Word: A bed of roses
Meaning: a phrase used to reference a situation that is easy or comfortable
Example: The poor orphan’s life hasn’t been a bed of roses or easy by any means.

Word: A Priori
Meaning: something that is believed to be true without actual reinforcement with facts or statistics
Example: Religious people have the a priori belief that God exists without any physical proof.

Word: Aardvark
Meaning: a large; long-eared nocturnal animal that uses its long tongue to eat ants and termites
Example: The long-eared aardvark slept all day and ate insects all night.

Word: Aback 
Meaning: in amazement; shocked
Example: I was taken aback by the server’s rude comment about my hair.

Word: Abaft
Meaning: toward the stern; behind
Example: The wind was abaft which made the ship glide faster towards our destination.

Word: Abandon
Meaning: to stop caring and leave or to desert
Example: Since the young girl was unable to care for the newborn; she decided to abandon the child at a fire station.

Word: Abase
Meaning: to lower so as to hurt feelings
Example: My stepmother is an evil woman who likes to abase little children because she had a miserable childhood herself.

Word: Abaser
Meaning: someone who degrades or lowers someone
Example: After the abaser would make fun of her daughter-in-law’s cooking; she would then continue to talk bad about the young woman’s appearance as well.

Word: Abash
Meaning: to humiliate someone and make them feel embarrassed or ashamed
Example: The officer tried to abash the inmates; humiliating them and treating them like dogs.

Word: Abate
Meaning: to reduce in degree or intensity
Example: I hope this medicine will abate the pain in my leg.

Word: Abatement
Meaning: reduction or weakening or something
Example: Natalie longed for the abatement of the screaming rock music from her brother’s band so she could focus on her homework.

Word: Abattoir
Meaning: a place where animals are taken to slaughter
Example: Although many farmers own cattle; they don't slaughter the animals on site but send them to an abattoir.

Word: Abbess
Meaning: the female superior of a community of nuns
Example: An Abbess is the female leader of a small community of nuns.

Word: Abbreviate
Meaning: to shorten a word or phrase
Example: Learning to abbreviate long words will help the court reporter type more quickly.

Word: Abdicate
Meaning: to stop accepting a particular responsibility or obligation that you have
Example: The young prince became king after his older brother decided to abdicate the throne.

Word: Abdominal
Meaning: related to the abdomen/stomach; or the part between the thorax and the pelvis
Example: My severe abdominal pains sent me to the hospital where I learned that it was nothing more than trapped gas.

Word: Abduct
Meaning: to grab an individual by trickery or force
Example: The kidnappers planned to abduct the millionaire’s daughter.

Word: Abecedarian
Meaning: alphabetical
Example: We decided to organize the files in an abecedarian manner so we could find what we were looking for by name more easily.

Word: Aberrant
Meaning: straying from the normal or right way
Example: John’s aberrant behavior is going to get him in a lot of trouble one of these days.

Word: Aberration
Meaning: deviating from what is normal or desirable; not typical
Example: Shelley’s angry retort was an aberration from her normally quiet demeanor.

Word: Abet
Meaning: to encourage or support a behavior or action
Example: The photo editing software is sure to abet my odds of winning the photo competition.

Word: Abeyance
Meaning: a state of temporary disuse or suspension
Example: Immediately following the terrorist attack; pilots had to observe a period of abeyance where they could not depart from the airport.

Word: Abhor
Meaning: to reject something very strongly; hate
Example: I abhor liars.

Word: Abhorrence
Meaning: a strong feeling of hate paired with a feeling of loathing
Example: My abhorrence of racism makes me avoid people with racist attitudes.

Word: Abhorrent
Meaning: causing or deserving strong dislike or hatred
Example: As I looked around the filthy apartment; I had to wonder who could live in such abhorrent conditions.

Word: Abide 
Meaning: tolerate an unpleasant thing or person; endure
Example: I find it difficult to abide the narrow-minded attitude of a prejudiced person.

Word: Ability
Meaning: the skill or capability to do something
Example: The Flash has the ability to run faster than the speed of light.

Word: Abiotic
Meaning: abiotic means something that is sterile; not from living organisms
Example: Unlike alive biotic organisms; abiotic factors are nonliving.

Word: Abject
Meaning: cast down in spirit or hope
Example: After his wife died; he was an abject man.

Word: Abjure
Meaning: to give up a belief or an activity
Example: After the tyrant took over the country; the citizens had to abjure their political beliefs.

Word: Ablaze
Meaning: burning fiercely; in a blaze; on fire
Example: The cops threw Jack to the ground and arrested him after he set the American flag ablaze.

Word: Able-bodied
Meaning: physically strong and healthy
Example: If you are not injured or sick; you can generally be considered an able-bodied individual capable of physical exertion.

Word: Able
Meaning: having the capability of doing something
Example: Being a healthy young man; I am perfectly able to engage in manual labor; no matter what kind of physical stress that includes.

Word: Ablution
Meaning: the act of washing or cleansing
Example: Sylvia has a rare condition that makes her break out in a rash if she gets water on her skin; so her morning ablution consists of using cleansing cream and tissue.

Word: Abnegation
Meaning: the act of rejecting or refusing something 
Example: Her abnegation of ice cream and cookies is due to her Olympic team training.

Word: Abnormal
Meaning: out of the ordinary; unusual
Example: William worried that his abnormal bleeding was a symptom of cancer.

Word: Abnormality
Meaning: a feature that is not normal or average
Example: Albinism is an abnormality in the pigmentation of one’s body; making them so pale as to appear white.

Word: Aboard
Meaning: on board; into or within a ship or boat
Example: The stewardess welcomed everyone aboard and asked us to pay attention to what she had to say.

Word: Abode 
Meaning: the place where one resides or lives
Example: The fraternity’s abode was the messiest house on campus.

Meaning: to put an end to
Example: The Supreme Court believed it was time to abolish the outdated amendment.

Word: Abolition
Meaning: the action of putting an end to something
Example: The abolition of smoking in restaurants is a blessing to people like myself who suffer from allergies and asthma.

Word: Abolitionist
Meaning: one who supports the elimination of practices or laws that are viewed as dangerous
Example: The abolitionist is recruiting like-minded people who share her opposition to the pro-abortion laws.

Word: Abominable
Meaning: horrible; terrible
Example: Last year’s record final record was abominable and we finished the season with no wings.

Word: Abominate
Meaning: to despise intensely
Example: Since I abominate liver; I will starve to death before I eat it.

Word: Abomination
Meaning: something that is hated
Example: The marketing team thought the new ad to be an abomination and worked hard to come up with one they didn’t hate.

Word: Aboriginal
Meaning: associated with being part of the original population; native
Example: The Indian tribe’s aboriginal dialect has been replaced by the English language.

Word: Abort
Meaning: to stop something from happening any longer; to discontinue
Example: The law allows women to abort an early-stage pregnancy.

Word: Abortive 
Meaning: an unproductive attempt
Example: When the rebels’ plan to take over the castle proved abortive; they were caught and executed.

Word: Abound
Meaning: available in large quantity or number
Example: At the beginning of the school year; computer deals abound on the Internet.

Word: Above
Meaning: overhead or directly over the head
Example: As the children heard the airplane; they looked above to see the big Boeing 747 flying within inches of the treetops.

Word: Above
Meaning: at a higher layer or level than something else
Example: If you look above you while outside; you will almost certainly spot clouds; the sun; or the moon; though in some cases you might not see them at all.

Word: Abraded
Meaning: to produce damage or irritation by scraping; rubbing; or crushing
Example: The wool blanket abraded my legs and gave me a rash.

Word: Abrasion
Meaning: a spot or area that has been scraped or harshly rubbed
Example: When the little boy fell off his bike; his only injury was a small abrasion on his right leg.

Meaning: unlikeable; nasty
Example: Because of Kurt’s abrasive personality; most people try to avoid him at work.

Meaning: remaining up to date on a topic

Meaning: to make shorter
Example: His agent told him that he needed to abridge some of the content of his novel so that it would be under 400 pages.

Word: Abroad
Meaning: in foreign countries
Example: His plan is to get a degree in economics and then work abroad for a year.

Word: Abrogate
Meaning: to abolish; to do away with
Example: You cannot abrogate anyone's right to free speech!

Word: Abrupt
Meaning: without notice; sudden
Example: The bus came to an abrupt halt outside the school.

Word: Abruption
Meaning: a sudden breaking away
Example: During Tara’s pregnancy; placental abruption occurred when the placenta pulled away from the uterine wall.

Word: Abruptly 
Meaning: suddenly; without notice
Example: Without warning; my boss abruptly fired me.

Word: Abscess
Meaning: cavity filled with pus
Example: A tame rabbit was brought in with a large abscess about the size of an egg on its cheek.

Example: Abscission of leaves occurs during autumn; before winter sets in.

Example: Do you think he has plans to abscond with the stolen money?

Example: She felt his absence like a gaping hole in her chest that was too painful to ignore.

Word: Absent-minded
Meaning: describes a person who is forgetful or constantly distracted
Example: The absent-minded professor was always forgetting an ingredient or two in his experiments.

Word: Absent
Meaning: not present; not in a place one is expected to be
Example: The absent father never came to his kids’ school events or picked them up for a weekend visit.

Word: Absenteeism
Meaning: the practice of missing school or work without good reason
Example: The student’s absenteeism has caused him to miss a lot of work.

Word: Absolute
Meaning: complete or total; undisputable
Example: The fact that two plus two equals four is absolute in mathematics; and cannot ever be disputed with any logical argument.

Word: Absolutely
Meaning: with no limitation; restriction; or caveat
Example: My cousin is absolutely convinced that there are aliens out there; even though we have no concrete evidence to back up such a notion.

Word: Absolution
Meaning: setting free from guilt; sin or penalty; forgiveness of an offense
Example: The killer got on his knees and begged for absolution at his execution.

Meaning: to take in or soak up a substance

Example: The paper towels are thick; and as such; have a heavy absorption rate.

Word: Acuity

Word: Acupuncture

Word: Acute

Word: Acuteness
Meaning: sharpness; insight
Example: The boy’s acuteness made him an excellent chess player.

Word: Ad hoc
Meaning: made for a particular reason
Example: Some of the men in our neighborhood have formed an ad hoc safety patrol to deter crime.

Word: Ad hominem
Meaning: a statement made during an argument or debate that is a personal attack or insult against the other person and not their opinion/stance
Example: During the debate; the politician’s ad hominem attack went after his opponent’s hair and makeup instead of her policies.

Word: Ad nauseam
Meaning: refer to something has been done or repeated so often that it has become annoying
Example: The woman’s ultimatums were ad nauseam; her constant threats to divorce eventually pushing her husband away.

Word: Adage
Meaning: old saying that has come to be accepted as truth over time
Example: He gets tired of all the same old sayings; so he is always trying to come up with a new adage.

Word: Adamant
Meaning: refusing to be persuaded; cannot change one's mind
Example: Robert; a first year physics student; is adamant in his decision to peruse a career in engineering.

Word: Adamantine
Meaning: unyielding; firm and unbreakable
Example: The hero was adamantine and stuck to his values no matter what problem he faced.

Word: Adapt
Meaning: get used to something new or change to fit
Example: When James relocates to a different side of the country; he will have to adapt to a new weather pattern.

Word: Adaptable
Meaning: able to change
Example: When dogs live in the wild; their bodies must be adaptable to the environment or they will suffer.

Word: Adaptation
Meaning: an alteration that makes an animal or thing more suitable for a certain environment
Example: This adaptation of the novel was written so the story could be performed as a play.

Word: Addend
Meaning: a number added to another number
Example: I asked our math teacher to help me with the addend in my math problem.

Word: Addendum
Meaning: something to be added; especially text added as an appendix or supplement to a document
Example: Maria’s article was written in 1965; but it was updated with an addendum in recent years.

Word: Addict
Meaning: someone that is obsessed with something to an extent where they suffer withdrawal without it
Example: My baby brother is a sugar addict; unable to go even two hours without consuming some sort of sweet to sate his obsession.

Word: Addictive
Meaning: something that is easy to be addicted to; easy to develop a reliance on
Example: This game is extremely addictive; having roped me into playing it for over six hours even though I only planned to play for one.

Word: Additional
Meaning: added or extra
Example: Additional charges will be added if you do not pay the bill on time.

Word: Additionally
Meaning: used in the place of ‘also’ or to introduce extra facts
Example: We started out with just one floor; but additionally; another was added.

Word: Addle
Meaning: to cause a person’s thoughts to become jumbled or confused
Example: Is it true smoking marijuana can addle your brain and make it difficult for you to concentrate?

Word: Addled
Meaning: incapable of thinking in a clear manner
Example: Because my grandmother is in her mid-nineties; she is a bit addled at times and requires the aid of a personal caregiver.

Word: Address
Meaning: a description of the location of a property
Example: The pizza delivery man had no problem finding my address to deliver my order.

Word: Adduce
Meaning: to produce as support during a discussion or argument
Example: During the trial the defense attorney will adduce evidence to show the defendant’s innocence.

Word: Adduction
Meaning: the act of bringing a body part usually an arm or leg inward to the middle part of the body
Example: When the patient’s adduction of her knee up to her waist caused agonizing pain; the doctor recommended that she return to standing straight on her two feet.

Word: Adept
Meaning: very good at doing something that is not easy
Example: Mark is an adept juggler who can easily manager four balls in the air without dropping one.

Word: Adequacy
Meaning: being satisfactory or acceptable
Example: The adequacy of the program is being questioned since few seem to graduate after starting.

Word: Adequacy
Meaning: the quality of being sufficient; adequate or able to meet the needs
Example: It’s important to review the adequacy of your medical insurance coverage each year.

Word: Adequate
Meaning: enough; good enough
Example: Adequate water intake is necessary for your body to function properly.

Word: Adhere
Meaning: conform to or follow rules exactly
Example: When I tell you to sit down; adhere to my order!

Word: Adherence
Meaning: faithful support for a cause 
Example: The teacher demanded the students adherence to the rules while in her classroom.

Word: Adherent
Meaning: a material that sticks to other things or a person who supports a particular party; person; or set of ideas
Example: The adherent properties of Super Glue are so strong that some people have had to go to the ER to get un-stuck from something.

Word: Adhesion
Meaning: a substance’s ability to attach to another substance
Example: For sturdier adhesion; apply hot glue to the sequins prior to attaching them to the leotard.

Word: Adhesive
Meaning: sticky
Example: Mom does not like to use Elmer’s glue because she claims that our project requires a stronger adhesive.

Word: Adieu
Meaning: a farewell; a goodbye; especially a fond farewell; or a lasting or permanent farewell
Example: We bid each other adieu after the movies by giving one another a hug.

Word: Adjacent
Meaning: lying next to; close; or contiguous; neighboring
Example: When the opposing attorneys asked for a sidebar with the judge; the jury was sent to wait in an adjacent area.

Word: Adjoining
Meaning: next to or joined with something else
Example: The travelers requested adjoining rooms so that they would be beside each other.

Word: Adjourn 
Meaning: to suspend or conclude an event
Example: After church services adjourn at one o’clock; we will have our monthly picnic.

Word: Adjudge
Meaning: to view or determine something in a particular manner
Example: Because of your drug problem; the court will probably adjudge you to be an unfit mother.

Word: Adjudicate 
Meaning: to make a decision on an issue
Example: The administrative board will adjudicate on the terms of the doctor’s suspension for misconduct.

Word: Adjunct
Meaning: something that is joined or added to another thing; but not part of the whole
Example: My math teacher was adjunct faculty and did not work for the school full time.

Word: Adjure
Meaning: request or urge someone to do something
Example: I had to adjure myself to stay awake; despite having not slept in two days.

Word: Adjust
Meaning: to change something a little so that it fits or works better
Example: The distraught teacher preferred her students to adjust their attitude before she initiated her next plan of referring those students to the office.

Word: Adjustment
Meaning: a small change that improves something or makes it work better
Example: The academic advisor made an adjustment to the college student’s classes so that it would fit better with her work schedule.

Word: Adjutant
Meaning: A military officer that is an administrative assistant to a senior officer

Word: Administer
Meaning: to supply or give out something
Example: The nurse will administer pain medicine every four hours.

Meaning: to give; handout; or dispense
Example: A nurse came into the patient’s hospital room to change his sheets and administer his nightly medication.

Word: Administration

Word: Admirable
Meaning: worthy of respect and admiration
Example: The colonel is an admirable man who has won numerous medals of valor.

Word: Admiration

Example: When the teacher retired; she was given a gold watch in admiration of her fifty years of service to the county.

Meaning: to hold a thing or person in high esteem
Example: As a former soldier; I admire all the men and women who are currently serving in the military.

Word: Admissible
Meaning: something that is allowed or considered appropriate
Example: Judge Taylor declared the evidence against the defendant admissible in court which became detrimental to the defense’s case.

Word: Admit

Example: It took the woman a long time to admit she has a drinking problem.

Word: Admittedly
Meaning: certainly; definitely
Example: The joke was admittedly risky but the crowd didn’t seem to mind much.

Example: Do not admonish him for being gay!

Word: Ado

Word: Ahem

Word: Ailing

Word: Anecdote
Meaning: an interesting or amusing short story
Example: My favorite anecdote tells the story of an adventurous dog making his way through the city.

Word: Anemia
Meaning: a medical condition in which your blood does not transport enough oxygen to the rest of your body; either because of too few red blood cells; or because of too little hemoglobin
Example: When Frank was diagnosed with a red blood cell condition called anemia; we understood why he had been feeling so weary lately.

Word: Anemic
Meaning: exhausted; weak
Example: Although the woman was anemic; she made one final push in order to deliver her baby.

Word: Anesthetize
Meaning: to give a person or animal medication that will put them in an unconscious or comatose state 
Example: The doctor will anesthetize the patient using Propofol so that he feels no pain during surgery.

Word: Aneurysm
Meaning: an abnormal blood-filled bulge of a blood vessel and especially an artery resulting from weakening as from disease of the vessel wall 
Example: During a brain aneurysm; an artery fills with blood and blows up like a balloon before leaking blood into the brain.

Word: Anew
Meaning: to take place once more
Example: After divorcing her husband last year; she married anew to a man she only knew for about three months.

Word: Anfractuous
Meaning: having many winding twists and turns
Example: The couple struggled to get through the anfractuous maze; constantly getting lost in the twists and turns.

Word: Angelic
Meaning: pure and innocent like an angel
Example: The woman’s pure voice sounded both angelic and beautiful.

Word: Anger
Meaning: a strong feeling of being annoyed; irritated; or hostile
Example: Pounding his fists in anger; the upset toddler demanded that his mother feed him lunch.

Word: Angrily
Meaning: with rage
Example: The woman yelled angrily at her cheating spouse.

Word: Angry
Meaning: having a strong feeling of being upset or annoyed
Example: Even if I am angry at my husband; I try not to go to bed still upset.

Word: Angst
Meaning: a mood associated with intense worry and unhappiness
Example: A day before the fight; the inexperienced boxer was plagued with angst about losing his first match.

Word: Anguish
Meaning: extreme suffering or grief
Example: When my husband died; the anguish I felt was nearly unbearable.

Word: Angular
Meaning: so thin or skinny that one’s bones can be seen 
Example: The angular boy was so thin you could see his rib cage.

Word: Anhedonia
Meaning: the physical and mental inability to get feelings of pleasure from typically enjoyable activities
Example: Depressed individuals suffer from anhedonia because what used to bring them joy only fills them with sadness.

Word: Anhydrous
Meaning: describes a substance that has no water
Example: The anhydrous mineral is unique because it lacks water in its makeup.

Word: Animadversion
Meaning: a judgmental remark or criticism
Example: The judge warned the hostile lawyer to not make another animadversion to the witness.

Word: Animal
Meaning: a living; breathing organism
Example: Amber’s favorite animal is a lion as she likes the way he roars when he’s mad.

Word: Animate
Meaning: to become enlivened and stimulated
Example: Once the upbeat music began; it seemed to animate the toddlers into jumping and dancing all around the room.

Word: Animated
Meaning: active and energetic
Example: In order to get the attention of her students; the animated teacher would throw her hands wildly around and move quickly around the room to explain a concept.

Word: Animation
Meaning: the technique causing images to appear to move 
Example: Due to the computer animation; it is now possible to make cartoon films more quickly.

Word: Animism
Meaning: a belief that natural objects have spirits
Example: The philosopher argued that he does not support animism because of how rocks seem to clearly lack any kind of vitality.

Word: Animosity
Meaning: a strong feeling of disliking someone or something
Example: Why do you have such animosity towards me when I have done nothing to you?

Word: Animus
Meaning: an intense feeling of loathing or disgust; hatred
Example: My animus towards my roommate stems from the fact he is constantly stealing my food.

Word: Annals
Meaning: a record of historical events (in chronological order)
Example: The annals of the museum held many interesting artifacts.

Word: Anneal
Meaning: to heat and slow cool metal or glass in order to toughen it
Example: The welder was able to anneal the metal; heating it to make it stronger.

Word: Annex 
Meaning: a new part of a building or dwelling
Example: Once the annex is built; we will move the Asian artifacts to that section of the building.

Word: Annexation
Meaning: the official action of securing something by taking it over; often relating to land
Example: To obtain lower property taxes; the citizens of the standalone area voted to approve their district’s annexation into a nearby town.

Word: Annihilate
Meaning: to destroy; to eradicate
Example: During the war; our soldiers will annihilate the enemy and secure our land.

Word: Anniversary
Meaning: the date on which an even took place the year before
Example: Celebrating their anniversary with a candlelit dinner; the couple was happy to be married for another year.

Word: Annotate
Meaning: to add notes to a text or diagram in order to provide additional insight and understanding about something
Example: The student is free to annotate the textbook with notes; as well as to highlight any text that they choose.

Word: Annotation
Meaning: a note or comment added to a document or book
Example: Surprisingly; my critical professor returned the rough draft of my essay without a single annotation.

Word: Announce
Meaning: to give out news in a public way
Example: The salon will announce the winner of the free hair cut on their Facebook page at noon.

Word: Announcement
Meaning: a public statement or report that gives information to those listening or viewing
Example: During the family get together; the happy couple made the announcement that they were having a baby.

Word: Annoy
Meaning: to irritate or bother someone to the point of aggravation
Example: The buzzy fly continued to annoy the house guests until someone finally stood up and swatted the pest.

Word: Annoyance
Meaning: irritation; nuisance
Example: Bernie’s state of annoyance was aggravated by the non-stop pestering of his crazy neighbor.

Word: Annual
Meaning: happening once a year
Example: We worried that our state would impose water rationing because of how little annual rainfall we had received this year.

Word: Annuity
Meaning: an allotment of money paid from an insurance company either in a full payment or in installments usually for retirement purposes
Example: Due to a small pension from her job; Matilda considered buying an annuity at the Lawton Insurance Company so she could live freely during her retirement.

Word: Annul
Meaning: to officially make something invalid 
Example: After the actress tied the knot with a stranger in Mexico; she was persuaded by her manager to annul the marriage.

Word: Anodyne 
Meaning: something used to comfort or relieve pain
Example: The doctor promised to give me a strong anodyne to relieve the throbbing in my neck.

Word: Anomalous
Meaning: unordinary; unusual; or distinctly different from the norm
Example: The scientists at the weather station were extremely worried about the anomalous readings they were getting from their instruments; as they were far beyond the norm.

Word: Anomaly
Meaning: something unusual or unexpected
Example: In order to find the anomaly; scientists had to repeat the experiment over a hundred times.

Word: Anomie
Meaning: social instability caused by erosion of standards and values 
Example: Carl claims that the children of gangsters are prone to anomie because they were never raised with a sense of right and wrong.

Word: Anon
Meaning: in a short time; soon
Example: The game will begin anon so hurry up and get here!

Word: Anonymity
Meaning: the condition of having one’s identity unknown
Example: For anonymity; the famous actress wore dark glasses and a baseball cap while walking in the park.

Meaning: not named
Example: The donor requested to remain anonymous so that others wouldn’t bother him for money.

Meaning: to give a response
Example: The student raised his hand to answer the question; but the teacher called on someone else.

Meaning: showing or feeling aggression or hostility towards something

Meaning: to trigger hostility or anger
Example: If you antagonize the dog; he will bite you.

Word: Ante
Meaning: to make an investment in money before knowing one’s chances 
Example: Every player is required to place an ante of the chosen amount into the center of table when playing poker.

Meaning: during the time before the American Civil War

Meaning: something that came before something else and may have influenced or caused it

Meaning: to occur before something else
Example:  In general; sex will normally antedate a pregnancy.

Meaning: greatly out of date
Example: My daughter often tells me I wear antediluvian clothes that are way out of style.

Word: Antemeridian
Meaning: in the morning or before noon
Example: The antemeridian brunch was held before noon so that more people could attend.

Word: Anterior
Meaning: nearer the front
Example: Marc’s anterior teeth are yellow; although his molars are pearly white.

Word: Anteroom
Meaning: a small waiting area that leads into a bigger room
Example: The principal makes the students wait in his anteroom before he calls them into his office.

Word: Anthem

Meaning: a collection of writings
Example: The band’s anthology was set to release in a few days.

Word: Anthropoid
Meaning: having characteristics of a human being; usually in terms of shape or appearance
Example: While visiting the zoo; we watched a monkey peal a banana in such an anthropoid way.

Meaning: an individual who studies the development of human beings
Example: As an anthropologist; Sara spends her days examining the evolution of human beings.

Meaning: the study of the origin of mankind

Word: Anthropomorphic
Meaning: having attributes of humans
Example: The boy’s favorite cartoon stars an anthropomorphic cat who talks and walks like a person.

Word: Anthropomorphism
Meaning: giving human traits to objects and living creatures that are not human
Example: The author uses anthropomorphism to give human personalities to her animal characters.

Word: Anti-Semitism 
Meaning: hostility towards Jewish people because of their religion and/or ethnicity
Example: When Jewish families began to move into the exclusive neighborhood; some of them were met with anti-semitism from racist neighbors.

Word: Anti
Meaning: opposed to or against
Example: The world is almost entirely anti-imperialism these days; condemning any country that would try to expand its own borders through conquest.

Word: Antibiotic
Meaning: any substance that can destroy or inhibit the growth of bacteria and similar microorganisms
Example: Her doctor said that she should take an antibiotic because it will help her fight the bacterial infection that is causing her strep throat.

Word: Antibody
Meaning: a blood protein your body creates to fight disease
Example: Finding the right antibody to fight the contagion is critical and can determine between life and death.

Word: Anticipate 
Meaning: ready for something to occur 
Example: Since we anticipate each person will eat at least two hot dogs at the barbecue; we have purchased fifty hot dogs for our twenty-five guests.

Meaning: the condition of being excited about something that is going to occur
Example: In anticipation of the baby’s arrival; we have prepared the nursery.

Word: Anticipatory
Meaning: happening or performed in anticipation of something
Example: The soldiers took anticipatory defensive positions; preparing for the wave of attackers that would no doubt assault their position within the hour.

Word: Anticlimactic
Meaning: lacking climax; disappointing or ironically insignificant following of impressive foreshadowing
Example: Although the child anticipated that the gift would bring him endless enjoyment; it quickly turned into an anticlimactic experience.

Word: Anticlimax
Meaning: a shift from an exciting event to a disappointing event

Meaning: silly or outrageous conduct
Example: The students’ disruptive antics caused the speaker to stop talking.

Word: Aquatic

Word: Arabesque

Word: Arbiter
Meaning: one who can settle a disagreement between parties
Example: An arbiter will help the divorcing couple come to terms on a settlement.

Word: Arbitrage
Meaning: a method of buying something for one price and then immediately selling it for another price somewhere else
Example: The broker decided to use arbitrage techniques to buy foreign stocks at a discount and quickly unload them in the US.

Word: Arbitrary
Meaning: not done for any particular reason; chosen or done at random
Example: In spite of the cold weather; we made an arbitrary trip to the beach.

Word: Arbitrate
Meaning: to settle an argument between two people or groups after hearing the opinions and ideas of both
Example: Often; I am called upon to arbitrate disagreements between my two best friends.

Word: Arboreal 
Meaning: associated with trees
Example: It is easy for the deer to hide in the fallen leaves of its arboreal habitat.

Word: Arcane
Meaning: understood by only a few; obscure
Example: Because it is no longer taught in schools; people are concerned that cursive writing will become arcane.

Word: Arch
Meaning: "a semi-circle shape; like an inverted ""U"""
Example: Write the letter U upside down to best visualize an arch.

Word: Archaeologist 
Meaning: one who studies ancient civilizations by examining artifacts
Example: An archaeologist studies artifacts to learn about past societies.

Word: Archaeology
Meaning: the study of the past by excavation and analysis of its material remains
Example: Thanks to the efforts of archaeology; excavators were able to discovered a new species of dinosaur.

Word: Archaic
Meaning: old and no longer useful
Example: Because my archaic computer is no longer useful to me; I am giving it away for free.

Word: Archenemy
Meaning: a main enemy that is extremely opposed to someone or something
Example: Glaring at this archenemy; the runner was determined to beat him in the race.

Word: Archetype
Meaning: an ideal example that people often attempt to duplicate
Example: The film that won the best picture award should be considered the archetype of all future movies.

Word: Archipelago
Meaning: a group of islands
Example: After island-hopping in the Aegean Sea; the tourists slept for a couple days due to previous excessive boating and walking to the different islands on the archipelago.

Meaning: the science of designing and constructing
Example: The architecture of the boat was supposed to make the vessel unsinkable.

Example: The archive was full of photographs; letters; and historical documents from WWI.

Word: Archly
Meaning: cunningly or slyly
Example: The thief archly planned the robbery.

Word: Ardent
Meaning: feeling great passion; or felt very passionately
Example: When the rock star checks his mail; he almost always finds one or two bizarre gifts from some of his ardent fans.

Meaning: great warmth of feeling; passion
Example: While Jane enjoyed spending time with John; she did not return the ardor he felt for her.

Word: Arduous
Meaning: demanding great effort or labor; difficult

Meaning: a particular geographic region
Example: The Everglades are an area of swamp in southern Florida.

Word: Argot
Meaning: a unique language used by certain groups or people with a particular occupation
Example: The old woman could not understand the argot her granddaughter used to communicate with her friends.

Word: Arguably
Meaning: possibly or probably
Example: Ms. Ray believed that her chocolate cake would arguably win the top prize at Florida’s Cake Contest.

Word: Argue
Meaning: to give reasons for your support or condemnation of certain ideals; typically in an aggressive manner
Example: If you wish to argue for an ideal that you believe in; you are better off relying on logic than emotion.

Word: Argument
Meaning: a discussion where both sides explain their contrasting viewpoints usually with an angry tone
Example: Everyone in the apartment complex could hear the argument between the couple due to their loud voices and the thin walls.

Word: Argumentative
Meaning: predisposed to debating; disagreeing; or expressing controversial opinions or beliefs
Example: An argumentative student will often disagree with the teacher just for the sake of doing so rather than having a good reason.

Word: Argyle
Meaning: a pattern that features a series of diamonds and a solid colored background that was originally modeled from Scottish tartan
Example: The doting grandfather made a habit of wearing argyle vests because his granddaughter loved to trace the diamond patterns and nuzzle into the wool.

Word: Arid
Meaning: incredibly dry; lacking water 
Example: The crops will not grow in the arid ground because the soil is too dry.

Word: Aridity
Meaning: long term lack of rainfall or moisture
Example: The aridity of the soil was not ideal for planting.

Meaning: to get up from a seated or laying position
Example: Once the small children saw the sun peak through their windows; they would arise and go downstairs on Christmas day.

Example: The armament technician’s job is to make sure that all of the troop’s weapons are in working order.

Meaning: illegally setting something on fire

Word: Attribution

Word: Attrition 
Meaning: a decrease in the number of staff or personnel as a result of replacements not been hired when employees leave

Word: Attune
Meaning: to customize or modify something to be more receptive or capable
Example: The radio transmitter wasn’t picking up what we needed; so I had to attune it to the right frequency.

Word: Atypical
Meaning: not normal
Example: Eating meat would be completely atypical for a vegetarian.

Word: Au courant
Meaning: fully informed; up-to-date
Example: The model’s au courant clothing is right off of the New York runway.

Word: Au fait
Meaning: being an expert or having detailed knowledge of a thing
Example: The skillful checker player was much more au fait with this game than he was with chess.

Word: Au gratin
Meaning: cooking technique in which a dish topped with cheese and/or breadcrumbs and then browned
Example: Mary made her famous potatoes au gratin with large sprinkling of freshly shredded gouda.

Word: Auction
Meaning: public sales event
Example: A vintage 1929 Mercedes Benz was sold at auction last week to an anonymous buyer.

Word: Audacious
Meaning: recklessly bold; daring
Example: Cooper was an audacious soldier who never ran from a battle.

Word: Audacity
Meaning: a confident and daring quality that is often seen as shocking or rude
Example: To everyone’s surprise; Jackie had the audacity to invite herself to her rival’s wedding.

Word: Audible
Meaning: capable of being perceived
Example: To block out audible sounds; Jack uses earplugs when flying.

Word: Audience
Meaning: a group of viewers or spectators
Example: Bowing gracefully in front of the audience; the ballerina beamed ear to ear as the attendees shouted for an encore.

Word: Audit
Meaning: to conduct an independent review and examination of certain data 
Example: Before baking brownies; make an audit of the ingredients available to see whether there is enough flour; eggs; and sugar.

Word: Audition
Meaning: to present talents in front of a judge or judges in order to achieve a desired position or role
Example: Diana flew to New York to audition for the leading role of Eliza in Hamilton.

Word: Auditorium
Meaning: a large room or building where people gather to watch a performance or hear a speech
Example: The packed auditorium held almost a thousand concert-goers who were eagerly awaiting the arrival of their idol.

Word: Auditory
Meaning: of or pertaining to hearing
Example: Many people are auditory learners who learn best through hearing.

Word: Aught
Meaning: anything or for all
Example: My psychiatrist says I worry too much; but for aught I know; a stranger could be watching all of my actions.

Word: Augment
Meaning: to increase the size or amount of something
Example: Because I want to augment my income; I am thinking about getting a second job.

Word: Augur
Meaning: to predict what is yet to come 
Example: Even the film’s initial reviews augur the movie’s A-list cast will be front and center on Oscar night.

Word: Augury
Meaning: a prediction or omen
Example: There are those who view the virus as an augury of the world coming to an end.

Word: August
Meaning: much-admired and respected
Example: Everyone wanted the chance to dine with the august president.

Word: Aura 
Meaning: a unique sensation or feeling that stems from an object; person; or place
Example: The angel’s aura made me feel calm and hopeful.

Word: Aural
Meaning: pertaining to the ear or the sense of hearing
Example: Instead of using his eyes to read the book; the truck driver used his aural sense to listen to the contents of the novel.

Word: Auricular
Meaning: of or relating to the ear or the sense of hearing
Example: After getting hearing aids; Grandpa Taylor realized he had fixed his auricular deficiency.

Word: Auriferous
Meaning: describes rocks or minerals that contain gold
Example: Placing his hands on the auriferous treasure; the pirate lusted for the golden trinkets.

Word: Auspices
Meaning: guidance and support
Example: Under the auspices of their commander-in-chief; the troops crossed the border into the war zone.

Word: Auspicious
Meaning: being a sign of future success; indicating a promising future
Example: His brilliant acceptance speech was an auspicious start to his political career.

Word: Austere
Meaning: without any decoration; strict and serious in manner
Example: Even though she appeared austere; my teacher was a very kind woman.

Word: Authentic
Meaning: genuine; real; unfaked
Example: We went to an authentic Mexican restaurant for my birthday where they served cuisine like you would find in Mexico.

Word: Authenticate
Meaning: to prove that something is true or genuine
Example: We will need to authenticate your orders to make sure that they did indeed come from high command before we can let you past this point.

Word: Author
Meaning: someone who writes books for a living
Example: Theodor Seuss Geisel was a famous author who published over sixty children’s books bearing the name Dr. Seuss.

Word: Authoritarian
Meaning: preferring or enforcing strict obedience to authority as opposed to individual freedom
Example: Our teacher is very authoritarian in her management and doesn’t allow us any wiggle room on the rules.

Word: Authoritative
Meaning: having an attribute that encourages people to obey you
Example: The principal has such an authoritative presence that even rebellious students behave around him.

Word: Authority
Meaning: the power to enforce rules or give orders
Example: Because I am the manager; I have the authority to change the policy at my job.

Word: Authorize
Meaning: to give official permission
Example: A manager must authorize the transaction before we can give the customer the money.

Word: Authorship
Meaning: the job of written composition 
Example: In the Bible; the authorship of Revelations is believed to be drafted by John the Apostle because there is evidence that he wrote it.

Word: Autobiography
Meaning: the story of an individual’s life written by that individual
Example: To learn about the deceased celebrity; you should read the autobiography he wrote about his life.

Word: Autochthonous
Meaning: original inhabitants of a place without any migration or intermingling of other groups
Example: Many autochthonous tribes in remote corners of Siberia have never been approached by colonists or married outside of their group.

Word: Autocracy
Meaning: a government type in which one person has boundless power
Example: The country is an autocracy that is controlled solely by a member of the royal family.

Word: Autocrat
Meaning: an individual who rules without considering others
Example: The corrupt autocrat views the brutal dictator as a role model.

Word: Autocratic
Meaning: not concerned about the wishes or opinions of others; heavy-handed
Example: The autocratic dictator ordered the deaths of people who opposed him.

Word: Autodidact
Meaning: self-taught person
Example: After moving to the rural village of the Congo; the autodidact learned math and science due to the only school being over one hundred miles away.

Word: Autograph
Meaning: a person’s own handwriting; especially the signature of a famous or admired person
Example: In order for the check to be valid; Greg needed to include his autograph.

Word: Automated
Meaning: controlled by a machine rather than a person
Example: If you call the hotline; you will talk to an automated system instead of a real person.

Word: Automatic
Meaning: something that is automated; or acts of its own accord without conscious effort or input
Example: A car with an automatic transmission will shift gears appropriately while driving; without any input from the driver themselves.

Word: Automatically
Meaning: spontaneously and involuntarily
Example: As I inhaled dust when I shook the dirty rug; I automatically sneezed without any warning.

Word: Automation
Meaning: the process of making a machine or system work without having to be controlled by a person
Example: Automation of the cotton picking process through the creation of the cotton gen changed the south forever.

Word: Automotive
Meaning: pertaining to a car or other powered automobile
Example: After wrecking my car at the intersection; I took my damaged Honda Accord to the automotive center for repairs.

Word: Autonomy
Meaning: the quality or state of being self-governing
Example: Teenagers should have the autonomy to make their own decisions in preparation for their lives as adults.

Word: Autopsy
Meaning: dissection of a body after death that is conducted to determine how the person died
Example: An autopsy of the deceased was performed against the family’s wishes since neglect was suspected.

Word: Autumn
Meaning: the season between summer and winter; fall
Example: Even though autumn is such a beautiful season; raking all of those leaves becomes such a daily chore for me.

Word: Auxiliary
Meaning: a group or team that provides assistance
Example: When my grandmother retired; she joined the hospital auxiliary team that visited lonely patients.

Word: Avail
Meaning: to be of advantage or use
Example: Stranded in the desert; Jake tried to restart his car but to no avail.

Word: Availability
Meaning: having the time or means supplies to do something
Example: The secretary informed the caller of her boss’s availability to meet that week.

Word: Available
Meaning: accessible and obtainable
Example: When my dream house was put on the market and appraised in my price range; I knew the house would be available for me to purchase it.

Word: Avalanche
Meaning: an unexpected accumulation
Example: During the power outage; our office faced an avalanche of distress calls.

Word: Avant-garde
Meaning: cutting-edge; trendy
Example: The elderly poet was confused by the youth’s avant-garde style of writing.

Word: Avarice
Meaning: A strong desire and greed for money/material things
Example: Mr. Krab’s avarice for money caused him to work his employees to the bone for little pay.

Word: Avaricious
Meaning: desirous of wealth or advancement
Example: Since Tiffany was an avaricious reader; her reading level was at 12th grade level even though she was still in 4th grade.

Word: Avatar
Meaning: in technology; an icon or figure representing a particular person
Example: In the hybrid chat room; an avatar is used in place of the person’s real picture.

Word: Avenge 
Meaning: to retaliate against a group or person who has harmed you in some way
Example: The police officer was determined to avenge his partner by bringing his killer to justice.

Word: Avenue
Meaning: a method or means by which something may be accomplished 
Example: Admittedly; anger is an all too human response to frustration; but it's still no avenue to solid achievement.

Word: Aver
Meaning: to assert something in a convincing way 
Example: Even though the country is in an economic crisis; its leader will aver the nation is doing well during his monthly address.

Word: Average
Meaning: ordinary; not very special
Example: Although others thought the woman to be very beautiful; she was insecure and only saw herself as average.

Word: Averse
Meaning: actively not liking something
Example: For those who are averse to spaghetti; you also have the meal choice of baked chicken with roasted potatoes.

Word: Aversion
Meaning: a feeling of disgust toward something with a desire to avoid it
Example: Older people who are unfamiliar with computer technology often have an aversion to it.

Word: Avert
Meaning: to stop an incident from occurring
Example: I always avert my eyes to avoid seeing the bloody movie scenes.

Word: Avian
Meaning: relating to birds
Example: The avian part of the animal kingdom includes every type of bird there is; from the flightless penguin to the majestic eagle.

Meaning: relating to birds
