Word: Aviary
Meaning: confinement for keeping birds; a birdhouse
Example: The cockatiel breeder used a suspended aviary to breed new birds.

Word: Aviation
Meaning: the activity of designing; producing; or flying an aircraft
Example: The top-notch aviation school only allows students with the highest potential to join its pilot program.

Word: Aviator
Meaning: a pilot
Example: The aviator prepared for his first flight across the Pacific by checking his engine and fueling his aircraft.

Word: Avid
Meaning: enthusiastic; passionate
Example: James is an avid supporter of any organization that is trying to improve the environment.

Word: Avidity
Meaning: a strong eagerness or desire
Example: The journalist’s avidity to learn everything there is to know about the case drove her to work long hours.

Word: Avidly
Meaning: in an excited or enthusiastic manner
Example: Airport police became suspicious of a passenger after one of the drug dogs avidly sniffed his carry-on bag.

Word: Avocation
Meaning: an activity one enjoys when he or she is not working
Example: Recently; Sherman discovered woodworking is the type of avocation he enjoys in his spare time.

Word: Avoid
Meaning: to keep away from; dodge or evade
Example: The dieter tries to avoid foods that are high in fat or sugar.

Word: Avoidable
Meaning: able to be stopped or prevented
Example: Diabetes can be avoidable if you reduce your sugar intake and exercise regularly.

Word: Avoidance
Meaning: the act of staying away from someone or something
Example: The procrastinator’s therapist tried to explain that avoidance of a task doesn’t make it disappear.

Word: Avoirdupois
Meaning: a system in the United States for measuring a pound equaling to sixteen ounces
Example: To calculate the weight of the gold using avoirdupois; it was determined that the gold weighed over a pound.

Word: Avouch
Meaning: to declare freely and openly; to assert
Example: Standing at the witness stand; I stated that I could avouch for the sterling reputation of Jennifer.

Word: Avow
Meaning: to admit or confess something publicly
Example: Because the man would not avow himself as a follower of the king in front of the villagers; he was sentenced to death.

Word: Avowal
Meaning: a public testimony or statement
Example: Since the jury members found the defendant guilty; they obviously didn’t believe his avowal of innocence.

Word: Avuncular
Meaning: kind or friendly; like an uncle
Example: My father’s best friend Joe treats me in an avuncular manner and even calls me his niece.

Word: Await
Meaning: to wait for
Example: The troops await their orders for the next deployment.

Word: Aware
Meaning: informed; understanding a situation
Example: Because they weren’t aware that the storm was coming; the family didn’t leave the area when everyone else did.

Word: Awareness
Meaning: the condition of being informed 
Example: In order to bring awareness to the emotional and financial needs of veterans; the singer has planned a benefit concert.

Word: Awe 
Meaning: the sensation one gets from being astounded
Example: An inexperienced teacher; I watched in awe as my mentor silenced the rowdy class.

Word: Awestruck
Meaning: filled with the sentiments of wonder and awe
Example: The little boy was awestruck by the holiday fireworks display.

Word: Awful
Meaning: horrible; terrible
Example: An awful plague took over the city and thousands of people died from the sickness.

Word: Awkward
Meaning: to act in a strange way
Example: Meeting the in-laws for the first time created an awkward situation for me since nobody knew what to say.

Word: Awning
Meaning: an overhang usually attached to a building that is used to block inclement weather conditions like snow; rain; or excessive sunlight
Example: They dashed under an awning to escape the sudden downpour.

Word: Awoke
Meaning: past tense having awakened or risen from sleep
Example: I awoke just before sunrise and hurried out of my bed to see if Santa had arrived while I slept.

Word: AWOL
Meaning: away from military duties without permission
Example: The military base put out an alert for the AWOL soldier who was away without permission.

Word: Awry
Meaning: away from the appropriate; planned; or expected course
Example: After we hit the deer; our road trip seemed to go awry and off course.

Word: Axiom
Meaning: a rule or principal that many people accept as true
Example: Although you keep using that axiom as the basis for your paper; the concept itself is not true.

Word: Axiomatic
Meaning: evident without proof or argument
Example: There was a time when it was regarded as axiomatic that the sun revolves around the earth.

Word: Axis
Meaning: an imaginary line about which a body rotates
Example: Tilting on its axis; the Earth is constantly rotating.

Word: Axle
Meaning: a rod or spindle (either fixed or rotating) passing through the center of a wheel or group of wheels
Example: The axle of a car holds the wheels together on both ends of the car; and if it is broken you will be unable to drive.

Word: Axon
Meaning: the part of a nerve cell that transmits signals away
Example: An electrical charge traveled down the axon as a nerve signal.

Word: Aye
Meaning: a synonym for yes that is used to express agreement or approval
Example: The senator signaled his aye vote by raising his hand.

Word: Azure
Meaning: a vibrant blue hue
Example: On the cruise; I spent hours appreciating the ocean’s azure waves.

Word: Babble
Meaning: to chatter about something in a typically foolish or excitable way
Example: The first time her crush talked to her; she was so excited that she was at a loss for words and began to babble about the weather.

Word: Babel
Meaning: a confused mixture of sounds and voices
Example: The children filled the classroom with babel; leaving the teacher overwhelmed at the sound of so many voices at once.

Word: Babelicious
Meaning: very physically attractive or sexy
Example: The men continued to catcall the babelicious woman as she walked down the street in her short skirt.

Word: Baccalaureate
Meaning: a typical four-year degree from a college or university
Example: In order for the college student to receive her baccalaureate; she must pass another math class.

Word: Bacchanal 
Meaning: a wild incident involving a drunken celebration
Example: The hotel ended the bachelor party after it turned into a noisy bacchanal.

Word: Bacchanalian
Meaning: relating to or given to reveling and drunkenness
Example: By the time the bacchanalian party ended; everyone was vomiting up their alcohol.

Word: Bachelor
Meaning: a typically young; single man actively in search of a romantic relationship
Example: Many single men like to think of themselves as a bachelor; but if they aren’t trying to find a partner they’re just single men.

Word: Back-and-forth
Meaning: moving first in one direction and then in another
Example: The back-and-forth movement of the ship caused those onboard to become seasick.

Word: Backache
Meaning: a pain or ache in the area around one’s spine
Example: After bending over for several hours at work; the baggage claim worker began to suffer from a terrible backache.

Word: Backbite
Meaning: to speak negatively or maliciously about someone who is not present to defend themselves
Example: The teenage girls tend to backbite each other and talk mess when they’re with their other friends.

Word: Backbite
Meaning: to talk or gossip about someone in a way that is spiteful or mean
Example: Grace makes an effort not to backbite or discuss others negatively while at school.

Word: Backbone
Meaning: the foundation or sturdiest part of something
Example: Because he was the backbone of the company; operations stopped after Jim died.

Word: Backdoor
Meaning: refers to an indirect or dishonest way of doing or achieving something
Example: The failing company’s backdoor bailout allowed them to get rid of their debt but left their shocked employees without jobs.

Word: Backdoor
Meaning: an indirect and dishonest way of doing something
Example: Because of a shady backdoor deal; the politician lost support from someone he thought was a loyal backer.

Word: Backdrop
Meaning: a painted piece of cloth that is used as the background for a performance picture
Example: The photographer used an airbrushed backdrop to make it look the photos were actually being taken in a field.

Word: Backer
Meaning: a supporter or follower of someone or something
Example: The anonymous backer is supporting the project by fully funding the activities for the students.

Word: Backfire
Meaning: of a plan or scheme to have the opposite outcome of what was expected
Example: The celebrity thinks her racy Twitter comments help her gain fans; but I believe writing these kinds of statements might backfire.

Word: Background 
Meaning: the area or scenery behind the main object of focus
Example: Although the current stage backdrop is beautiful; the director wants a background with more muted colors.

Word: Backhand
Meaning: to strike someone with the upside of the hand
Example: In a fit of anger; the woman raised her hand to backhand the child but caught herself before she made contact.

Word: Backhoe
Meaning: a mechanical tractor with a bucket on an extending arm that is used to dig things up
Example: The farmer will use a backhoe to dig up some of the stubborn dirt in several field rows.

Word: Backlash
Meaning: a strong feeling among a group of people in reaction to a change or recent event
Example: The president received backlash from thousands of people who disagreed with his Twitter statements.

Word: Backlog
Meaning: work that has piled up 
Example: The secretary had a backlog of a hundred documents that needed to be filed before the end of the day.

Word: Backpedal
Meaning: to change one’s previously expressed opinions or statements
Example: After people became angry about the celebrity’s Twitter remarks; she began to backpedal on what she said.

Word: Backrest
Meaning: a support used to brace the area around one’s spine
Example: After having surgery on his spine; the patient used a backrest for added support.

Word: Backstab
Meaning: to betray one’s friendship by acting in a deceitful way or speaking against someone when they’re not around
Example: Erin was upset that her very best friend would backstab her by having an affair with her husband.

Word: Backup
Meaning: a person or thing that assists or supports someone/something else
Example: The working mother is looking for a backup babysitter to watch her daughter on days her nanny cannot care for the child.

Word: Backward
Meaning: pertaining to the direction towards the back 
Example: Timmy accidentally dropped the soccer ball; and it rolled backward all the way down the hill.

Word: Bacteria
Meaning: microscopic living organisms; some of which are dangerous and can cause illness
Example: The teacher taught her students the importance of washing their hands to kill off bad bacteria.

Word: Bacterium
Meaning: once-celled microscopic living organisms that can cause infection
Example: The dirty slide was placed under the microscope so that the students could see all of the bacterium growing in the microbe-infested goop.

Word: Bade
Meaning: the past tense of bid; bade is used to express greetings and goodbyes
Example: As the cruise ship exited the harbor; the people bade farewell from the ship.

Word: Badge
Meaning: a small piece of metal or plastic worn to show that you are a part of some specific group or organization
Example: The officer’s shiny; star-shaped badge let the people know that he was part of the police force.

Word: Badger
Meaning: to bother or pester
Example: My daughter will badger me until I explain to her how to tie her shoes.

Word: Badinage 
Meaning: good-humored banter
Example: The humorous badinage between the coworkers made the long workday go faster.

Word: Badly
Meaning: severely or seriously
Example: With his head bashed in from hitting the windshield; the car crash victim was considered badly hurt.

Word: Baffled 
Meaning: totally confused or puzzled
Example: The complex puzzle baffled me for several hours before I could connect all the pieces.

Word: Bafflement
Meaning: a state of confusion or disarray
Example: The man was left in bafflement when he witnessed something he couldn’t explain occur on the side of the road.

Word: Bail
Meaning: an amount of money that a person who has been accused of a crime pays to a law court so that they can leave jail temporarily
Example: Bail money was requested before the arrested could be released to his family.

Word: Bailiff
Meaning: a legal officer who maintains order in a courtroom during a trial
Example: As the defendant’s witness stood in the witness box; the bailiff held the Bible out to swear her in.

Word: Bailiwick
Meaning: the district within which a bailie or bailiff has jurisdiction
Example: The bailiwick was quiet as the bailiff patrolled.

Word: Bait-And-Switch
Meaning: the action of advertising a product with the intent of selling inferior goods
Example: It does not happen much in America; but in less regulated countries many customers fall victim to the bait-and-switch tactic; buying something shoddy that was advertised as being superior.

Word: Balance
Meaning: remainder
Example: We put a deposit down on our vacation; with the remaining balance being due by June.

Word: Balderdash
Meaning: ridiculous thoughts or words
Example: Every word that came out of the drunk man’s mouth was balderdash.

Word: Bale
Meaning: a bundle of something (paper; hay; etc.) tightly bound together
Example: The first little pig needed another compressed bale of straw to finish building his house.

Word: Baleful 
Meaning: hinting at possible harm or danger
Example: With a baleful stare; the gang member pointed his gun at the unarmed police officer.

Word: Balk
Meaning: refuse to comply
Example: While my dog loves to go for walks in good weather; he will always balk if he gets the slightest whiff of rain in the air.

Word: Balkanization
Meaning: typically as the result of or end of a war; when large land areas are broken down into smaller states
Example: The balkanization of Yugoslavia happened after civil wars broke out on the country and several areas broke away to form their own states.

Word: Ballad
Meaning: a slow tune that usually focuses on love
Example: My husband and I ended date night by dancing to a romantic ballad.

Word: Ballistic
Meaning: suddenly angry; sad; or otherwise overcome with emotion
Example: After failing the test; the ballistic student began to scream and bang her head against the classroom wall.

Word: Ballistics
Meaning: the scientific study of the motion of objects that are thrown or shot through the air
Example: Using the science of ballistics; I created a Frisbee that spins back toward the thrower.

Word: Ballot
Meaning: a piece of paper or sheet on which a voter marks his or her choice
Example: Because the election fell on his 18th birthday; Aiden was finally able to cast a ballot for president of the United States.

Word: Ballyhoo
Meaning: a fuss or excessive publicity
Example: A ballyhoo was made over the silly video.

Word: Balm
Meaning: similar to a lotion that is used to soothe dry skin
Example: Since I was going to a place with a cold dry climate; I decided to get some balm to prevent my hands from getting dry.

Word: Balmy
Meaning: enjoyable and gentle
Example: The balmy climate immediately improved my spirits.

Word: Baloney
Meaning: nonsense
Example: I saw you take the money with my own eyes; that’s baloney.

Word: Balustrade
Meaning: an attachment to the side of a wall near a set of stairs or a waist-level wall used to prevent people from falling down or over something
Example: Anna firmly held on to the balustrade as she climbed the hundreds of steps to the top of the Eiffel Tower.

Word: Bamboozle
Meaning: to cheat or deceive another person
Example: The waiter tried to bamboozle me into giving him extra money by saying the tip had not been included in the check.

Word: Ban
Meaning: a ban means to exclude something or someone from a place
Example: There is a ban on cell phone use during the standardized test administered at the university.

Word: Banal
Meaning: boring because it contains nothing new and lacks originality
Example: Because the movie’s plot was banal; we knew exactly how the film would end.

Word: Banausic
Meaning: relating to jobs or workers that require/have technical skills rather than higher education
Example: Mike prefers a banausic job where he can use his hands and get dirty.

Word: Bandwagon
Meaning: a cause or thing that has become trendy or fashionable
Example: Many city residents jumped on the football bandwagon after our local professional team won the national championship.

Word: Bandy 
Meaning: to exchange words back and forth
Example: The political candidates will bandy during the debate tonight.

Word: Bane
Meaning: something causing misery or death
Example: Distraction is the bane of productivity when I’m trying to get anything done.

Word: Baneful
Meaning: destructive or harmful
Example: If not cooked properly; the fish can be baneful to humans.

Word: Banish 
Meaning: to cast out or away
Example: The ghost hunters tried to banish the ghosts from the house.

Word: Banished
Meaning: sent one away or forced one to leave a place
Example: Since they didn’t support the regime; the family was banished from their country and forced to leave.

Word: Bankrupt
Meaning: declared in law unable to pay debts owed; financially ruined
Example: Even though the woman was bankrupt; she still shopped as if she had plenty of money.

Word: Banquet
Meaning: a large celebratory meal; a feast
Example: At the end of the football season; the Mavericks held a banquet to recognize the players on the team.

Word: Bantam
Meaning: petite-sized chickens; a short and aggressive individual
Example: As the small-statured bantam was quick to grow angry at the site of his flock of bantam roaming outside of his farm; he quickly shooed them into their small pen clucking the whole way.

Word: Banter
Meaning: good humored conversation
Example: We need to help shy Sarah perfect her banter with the opposite sex.

Word: Barb
Meaning: a sharp pointy wire that projects out from a longer wire or hook
Example: When my shirt got snagged on the barb of the wire; it ripped a hole in it as I pulled away from the fence.

Word: Barbarian
Meaning: refers to a person who is considered uncivilized or with no manners
Example: Slopping up his soup and grunting while he ate; the barbarian finished his meal in minutes.

Word: Barbaric
Meaning: uncivilized; rude
Example: Because the barbaric moviegoer shouted and threw popcorn at other guests; he was asked to leave.

Word: Barbarous
Meaning: cruel; brutal
Example: The killer’s barbarous acts disgusted the jury and landed him a lengthy prison sentence.

Word: Barbed
Meaning: having sharp pointy wires stick out from a longer wire or hooks
Example: In order to keep the prisoners from escaping; a dangerous barbed wire fence was installed so that the prisoner’s skin would get ripped if an escape attempt was made.

Word: Bare
Meaning: naked; uncovered
Example: Jason made a bare handed catch deep in the outfield; which made him cry out in pain.

Word: Barefoot
Meaning: without socks or shoes
Example: While on the beach; the couple took off their shoes and went barefoot.

Word: Barely
Meaning: hardly ever; rarely
Example: Although they barely see each other anymore; Bert and Ernie still consider each other best friends.

Word: Bargain
Meaning: good deal; surprisingly cheap
Example: I will only shop at the mall when I believe that I can find a bargain deal.

Word: Barge
Meaning: to move in a rough or forceful way
Example: The cops waited in ambush outside Kevin’s door; ready to barge into his home as soon as they received the signal.

Word: Barker
Meaning: a person who calls out to passersby to attract customers to a theater or sideshow
Example: The barker stood outside of the carnival entrance; calling out to passersby and inviting them inside.

Word: Barometer
Meaning: something used as an indicator
Example: The unemployment rate has long been considered a barometer of a country’s economic status.

Word: Baron
Meaning: a male member of the lowest rank of English nobility 
Example: Most of the barons and lords that went up against Arthur; and lost; ended up as his knights and governing heads.

Word: Baroque 
Meaning: having a great deal of decorative embellishment; also referring to a time period in which heavy ornamentation was used in design; music; and art
Example: The elaborate architecture of the baroque dwelling seemed out of place in the neighborhood of simply-designed homes.

Word: Barracks
Meaning: lodging quarters in a structure for military troops
Example: After the mission; the soldiers went back to their barracks to get some rest in their bunks and put away their gear.

Word: Barrage
Meaning: a large volume of something; or a large quantity of things happening all at once
Example: Even though Mrs. Anderson knew that her students would probably barrage her with whines and complaints; she assigned fifty pages of reading to be done over the holidays.

Word: Barren
Meaning: (of land) a place with little or no vegetation
Example: Looking out the window of the airplane; I realized that some deserts are actually more barren than others.

Word: Barren
Meaning: unable to reproduce or grow something
Example: The barren woman could never get over the fact that she couldn’t have children.

Word: Barrette
Meaning: a typically bar-shaped clip or ornament for the hair
Example: She popped open the barrette and tried to clip it around her hair; but it was too thick.

Word: Barricade
Meaning: a barrier used to close or block a road 
Example: The police set up a barricade to keep the public from entering a crime scene.

Word: Barrier
Meaning: an obstacle that blocks access
Example: Not having transportation was a barrier to the girl enrolling in college courses.

Word: Barring
Meaning: excluding a person or something
Example: Barring an injury; the star quarterback will be able to play in Sunday’s big game.

Word: Barrister
Meaning: a British lawyer who is allowed to argue cases in the higher law courts
Example: While presenting his case in front of a judge; the barrister explained his client’s position.

Word: Barter
Meaning: to make an exchange using something other than a from of currency
Example: Since I do not have any money; I’m hoping I can barter my maid services in exchange for much-needed lawn care.

Word: Base
Meaning: the bottom section that sustains a bigger item or thing
Example: Below the Statue of Liberty on its base is an inscription welcoming and calling for any immigrants who want to make the United States their home.

Word: Baseline
Meaning: a minimum starting point
Example: The children will take a baseline test to determine which skills they have and which are missing.

Word: Baseness
Meaning: a shortage of positive qualities
Example: The political candidate’s election hopes were dashed when a book was published that detailed the baseness of his college days.

Word: Bash
Meaning: to strike someone or something with extreme force 
Example: I wear protective face gear so that the baseball does not bash me in the face.

Word: Bashful
Meaning: shy or easily embarrassed
Example: The bashful student turned red with embarrassment.

Word: Basic
Meaning: simple and not complicated
Example: We choose a basic phone package; but may need to upgrade to a better plan.

Word: Basin
Meaning: a kitchen sink
Example: My grandparents told us to wash up in the basin before suppertime.

Word: Basis
Meaning: foundation; base
Example: The research study had a scientific basis; but also included religious topics.

Word: Bask 
Meaning: to obtain joy from receiving praise or attention
Example: After a performance; the singer remains onstage for five minutes to bask in the audience’s adoration.

Word: Bass
Meaning: low in pitch; such as a male voice or an instrument
Example: The blues singer let out a low; deep tone with his bass guitar.

Word: Bastion
Meaning: an individual or object dedicated to a belief or idea
Example: In the film; the princess believed the wise old man was her last bastion of hope.

Word: Batch
Meaning: collection; group; or quantity of something made at one time
Example: The homemaker baked a batch of homemade chocolate chip cookies for her family.

Word: Bate
Meaning: the action of a hawk beating its wings to attempt a takeoff from its perch
Example: A baby hawk will have to bate furiously to lift its tiny body out of its nest and into the air for the first time.

Word: Bathe
Meaning: to clean oneself immersion in water or using water
Example: Bathe with soap and water to wash off dirt and dead skin cells.

Word: Bathos
Meaning: a sudden change in a style of writing or speech that involves going from a complex or elaborate form to a trivial one; either in topic or wording
Example: With a great deal of bathos; Lenny went from proclaiming his innocence to confessing he'd eaten the last slice of pumpkin pie.

Word: Battalion
Meaning: a military unit that is usually 300 to 800 soldiers; comprised of several companies
Example: A battalion of troops is comprised of many smaller companies; so that they can be divided and deployed around the battlefield as needed.

Word: Battle
Meaning: a fight or confrontation in which two sides face off
Example: Losing their final battle; the Indians agreed to give up their land and move west.

Word: Battlement
Meaning: a wall around the top of a fortress with spaces in it through which the people inside the castle shoot weapons
Example: Behind the castle battlement; the king’s men prepared to fire their arrows at the intruders down below.

Word: Batty
Meaning: crazy and out of one’s mind
Example: The batty woman walked the streets yelling “ca-caw” and flapping her arms as if she were a bird.

Word: Bauble
Meaning: a cheap showy ornament or piece of jewelry
Example: At first I thought that the trinkets sold on the island had value; but I then realized that they were nothing other than worthless bauble.

Word: Bawdy 
Meaning: indecent; obscene
Example:  The church is certainly not the place for your bawdy remarks.

Word: Bawl
Meaning: to cry extremely loudly
Example: Even as the spoiled rich girl put on her diamond bracelets; she would bawl about how her parents didn’t love her.

Word: Bay
Meaning: an inlet by the sea where the land curves inward
Example: Otis Redding was sitting on the dock of the bay; watching the tide roll away.

Word: Bayonet
Meaning: a long knife attached to the end of a rifle
Example: He removed his bayonet from his rifle; and was using it as a combat knife now; since a rifle would be too cumbersome.

Word: Bayou
Meaning: slow-moving creek or swamp
Example: My cousin wanted to swim in the bayou until I mentioned that there were alligators in the water.

Word: Bazaar
Meaning: a market (frequently seen in the Middle East) that offers an assortment of items for purchase
Example: While shopping at the bazaar; I found a number of international foods.

Word: Beacon
Meaning: a thing or person that provides guidance to people
Example: The lighthouse is a beacon for ships lost in the night.

Word: Beadle
Meaning: a British term used to refer to a leader of a church who assists the minister or priest in his duties
Example: When Mr. Peterson worked as the church’s beadle; he ran most of the fundraising events for the minister.

Word: Beak
Meaning: the hard; pointed part of a bird’s mouth
Example: Tapping the bark with his hard beak; the woodpecker tried to use his bill to break through.

Word: Beam
Meaning: to smile very happily
Example: Once the baby was born; the mother would beam with pride while gazing at the newest member of her family.

Word: Beamed
Meaning: shined brightly
Example: During the hottest part of the day; the sun beamed down on the garden and scorched the plants with its bright light.

Word: Bear
Meaning: to tolerate or accept something
Example: Michelle couldn’t bear to see her ex-husband with someone else; even years after their divorce.

Word: Bearable
Meaning: capable of being endured
Example: The window in my cell made my time in prison bearable.

Word: Bearing
Meaning: carrying; having; withstanding
Example: Bearing a dark secret; the young girl finally confided in a guidance counselor about the abuse she suffered from her family.

Word: Beast
Meaning: a large; dangerous animal
Example: The giant beast appeared from behind the cliff and growled a fearsome snarl at the children looking for berries.

Word: Beatific
Meaning: heavenly or blessed
Example: The bride looked angelic and wore a beatific expression as she walked down the aisle.

Word: Beatitude
Meaning: utmost bliss and happiness
Example: Her beatitude was sparked when her boyfriend proposed.

Word: Beau
Meaning: a wealthy gentlemen
Example: The dapper beau always dressed in his fine silk shirt; high-quality suit and a red carnation stuck in his lapel before walking outside.

Word: Beaucoup
Meaning: many; a great number
Example: The successful salesman made beaucoup money hawking thousands of cheap vehicles to unsuspecting customers.

Word: Beauteous
Meaning: beautiful
Example: My beauteous bride glimmered in her stunning white gown; as she stood under our wedding canopy.

Word: Beautify
Meaning: to make beautiful; or to increase the beauty of
Example: To beautify the earth; citizens need to keep the grounds clean.

Word: Beauty
Meaning: the quality of being pleasing to look at because of shape; color; sound or other sensory aspects
Example: Impressed by her beauty; the man knew that he had to marry the gorgeous woman at first sight.

Word: Beck
Meaning: a stream that moves from a mountain
Example: Water flowed swiftly over the stony bed of the beck and emptied into a larger stream at the mountain’s edge.

Word: Beckon
Meaning: to motion for an individual to come closer
Example: Because I was hungry; the restaurant seemed to beckon to me.

Word: Bedfellow
Meaning: an ally or associate connected to a person through a particular activity
Example: Anthony became a bedfellow of Jared when they both joined the same fraternity.

Word: Bedizen
Meaning: to be adorned in tawdry or loud clothing
Example: Due to the girl wanting attention; she decided to be bedizen herself with her brightly colored rhinestone jacket.

Word: Bedlam
Meaning: a condition of chaos
Example: Bedlam appeared to reign in the overcrowded school cafeteria.

Word: Bedraggled
Meaning: messy and filthy
Example: The neglected puppy was bedraggled and near-death.

Word: Bedrock
Meaning: solid rock that is under the soil
Example: In areas where soil is scarce; solid bedrock lies right under the surface.

Word: Befall
Meaning: to occur or happen to a person
Example: If anything bad should befall me; I leave all my possessions to my loving husband.

Word: Befitting 
Meaning: suitable
Example: Many people do not believe short dresses are befitting for women over the age of forty.

Word: Beforehand
Meaning: earlier or previously
Example: Without looking down the road beforehand; the young boy quickly darted out into the street getting hit by a car.

Word: Befriend
Meaning: to become a person’s pal or friend
Example: In an effort to befriend me; my rival offered to treat me to lunch.

Word: Befuddled
Meaning: puzzled; baffled
Example: Even with my professor’s help; I was still befuddled by the complicated chemistry formula.

Word: Beget
Meaning: to cause (something) to happen or exist
Example: In my dysfunctional family; fighting never failed to beget more fighting.

Word: Beggar
Meaning: a person who begs for money or food due to extreme poverty 
Example: The homeless beggar stands outside of stores in hopes of receiving money from patrons.

Word: Beginner
Meaning: a person just learning a skill or activity
Example: The beginner bowler only knocked a couple of pins down during his first few games.

Word: Begrudge
Meaning: to be envious of what one feels another does not deserve
Example: It is impossible for me to not begrudge my neighbor of the ten million dollars he won in the lottery.

Word: Beguile
Meaning: to attract or interest someone
Example: The car salesman tried to beguile the customer with an offer of free gas for a year.

Word: Begun
Meaning: started
Example: Right after the baby begun to cry; her mother came running into her room.

Word: Behalf
Meaning: representative of
Example: The director accepted the award on behalf of the entire cast.

Word: Behavior
Meaning: conduct
Example: Explaining that his behavior was unacceptable; the teacher corrected the misbehaving student and placed him in time out.

Word: Behemoth
Meaning: gigantic and very powerful
Example: The monster truck rally showcased a behemoth whose tires were twice as tall as I am.

Word: Behest 
Meaning: a request of great importance
Example: At the president’s behest; the prisoner will be pardoned for his crimes.

Word: Behold
Meaning: to see; or to look at
Example: Watching the fight at the arena was a sight to behold.

Word: Beholden
Meaning: owing something in return for service or help
Example:  Stan refused to accept a college loan because he didn’t want to feel beholden to anyone.

Word: Behoof
Meaning: benefit or advantage
Example: A parent forces their child to eat the vegetables they don’t like to behoof them; so they can grow up strong and healthy.

Word: Behoove
Meaning: in an individual’s interest
Example: If you seriously want to get your driving permit; it would behoove you to start studying for the computer test.

Word: Belabor
Meaning: to emphasize an idea or suggestion too much in a way that becomes boring or annoying; to go on and on about something
Example: If you’re just going to continue to belabor the point; I’m going home.

Word: Belated
Meaning: occurring past the regular time period
Example: Since I forgot about Jim’s birthday last week; I will send him a belated greeting today.

Word: Belay
Meaning: tying a rope to an object to to keep it steady or down. occassionally used to reference climbers who tie ropes to rocks to belay down the mountainside
Example: The teenagers belay their surfboards to the top of the car with bungee cords before heading to the beach.

Word: Beleaguer
Meaning: to cause constant or repeated trouble for
Example: On Halloween; I know the little trick-or-treaters are going to beleaguer me all night long.

Word: Belfry
Meaning: a bell tower attached to the top of a church or other building
Example: The Hunchback of Notre Dame lived at the top of the belfry; preferring to be with bats and bells.

Word: Belie
Meaning: to give a false impression of 
Example: Jason tried to belie the fact he was a lousy worker by showing up early at the office.

Word: Belief
Meaning: the feeling of being certain that something exists or is true
Example: It was the police officer’s belief that a serial killer was in the area; mainly because the murders kept happening.

Word: Believe
Meaning: to consider something to be true; to have confidence or trust in something
Example: The boy doesn’t believe in monsters; but his little brother thinks that they are real.

Word: Belittle
Meaning: to speak of something or someone in unflattering terms
Example: Even though John’s project was awful; I did not want to belittle his efforts so I went out of my way to pay him a compliment on his work.

Word: Bell curve
Meaning: a graph that represents the distribution of probabilities of a set of data in a bell-shaped pattern
Example: The student plugged all of the data into a bell curve and used the graph to display his findings.

Word: Bellhop
Meaning: a hotel worker who performs tasks like carrying luggage for guests
Example: The bellhop stood at the entrance of the hotel and opened the door for all incoming guests.

Word: Bellicose
Meaning: demonstrating aggression and willingness to fight; eager for war
Example: Don't cop that bellicose attitude with your mother!

Word: Belligerent
Meaning: hostile; ready to fight
Example: My brother was always belligerent and ready to fight.

Word: Bellow
Meaning: a low and roaring sound 
Example: Since the medic did not have anesthesia; he expected to hear a loud bellow as he removed the bullet from the soldier.

Word: Bellwether
Meaning: something or someone that points out upcoming trends
Example: At his brokerage firm; Ted is known as the bellwether because he always knows which stocks will become profitable.

Word: Belong
Meaning: be the property of
Example: The dogs wear tags that show what families they belong to.

Word: Beloved
Meaning: describing someone who is much loved
Example: When the beloved actor died; his passing was mourned by millions of people.

Word: Below
Meaning: underneath; on a lower level
Example: The descending ship began to sink below the surface after running into the side of the shore.

Word: Bemoan 
Meaning: to express displeasure 
Example: As a military wife; I bemoan our country’s involvement in yet another war.

Word: Bemused
Meaning: preoccupied or lost in thought
Example: After listening to the confusing lecture; the college girl was bemused.

Word: Bench
Meaning: to take a player out of a game
Example: Kevin knew that his basketball coach would bench him after the physical altercation with the rival’s top player.

Word: Benchmark
Meaning: a standard or target
Example: Setting a testing benchmark for all students; administration insisted that teachers push their children towards this target.

Word: Benedict
Meaning: a man who was a bachelor for an extended period of time; but has recently married
Example: After living years as a single man; the benedict has now settled into married life with his new bride.

Word: Benediction
Meaning: a brief prayer asking for a blessing or help
Example: In the hospital chapel; we said a benediction asking God to heal our mother.

Word: Benefaction
Meaning: a distributed donation
Example: The billionaire’s generous donation will allow us to build a new homeless shelter.

Word: Benefactor
Meaning: someone who helps another person; group; etc.; by giving money
Example: The anonymous benefactor did not want his church donation made public.

Word: Beneficent
Meaning: prone to doing kind and generous things
Example: My beneficent neighbor gives out meals to the poor every Sunday.

Word: Beneficial
Meaning: helpful or good to something or someone
Example: The vitamins he took were beneficial to his health.

Word: Beneficiary
Meaning: a group or individual that gains something
Example: As the billionaire’s only beneficiary; Cheryl will receive the entire estate.

Word: Benefit
Meaning: a payment; advantage; or gift
Example: Since I get sick a lot; my health insurance is one work-related benefit I really appreciate.

Word: Benevolence
Meaning: kindness; generous giving
Example: Because of the benevolence of their neighbors; the poor family was able to eat a homecooked meal every night.

Word: Benevolent
Meaning: willing to help; do good; and be generous towards people
Example: Holding the door open for Marie was very benevolent of you.

Word: Benighted
Meaning: lacking knowledge
Example: Plantation owners viewed slaves as benighted animals who had to be told what to do at every moment.

Word: Benign
Meaning: having no significant effect; harmless
Example: When the doctor said my tumor was benign; I was so happy.

Word: Benignant
Meaning: kind and goodhearted
Example: The benignant teacher volunteered her time; spreading kindness to everyone she met.

Word: Benignity
Meaning: the trait of being gentle and nice
Example: Jared’s benignity makes him too nice and allows him to be an easy target for con artists.

Word: Benison
Meaning: a blessing
Example: Karen asked her friend to say a benison while standing over the Thanksgiving dinner with her large family.

Word: Bent
Meaning: the state of being curved; crooked; or inclined from a straight line 
Example: Molly was bent over; drinking from the water fountain.

Word: Bequeath
Meaning: to give or leave by will 
Example: Since my father and I had often worked together on his classic car; I was not surprised to learn his will included his desire to bequeath me the vehicle.

Word: Bequest
Meaning: property or money gifted after an individual’s death
Example: With the bequest from the deceased billionaire; the school was able to build a new dormitory.

Word: Berate
Meaning: to yell at; to criticize or scold someone in a loud and angry way
Example: Shamefaced; the students sat quietly as Mrs. Garcia continued to berate them for the way they had treated the substitute.

Word: Bereave
Meaning: to take away something
Example: My grandfather’s death is sure to bereave my grandmother of her happiness.

Word: Bereaved
Meaning: depressed as a result of a loved one’s death 
Example: The bereaved mother did not leave her home for several months.

Word: Bereavement
Meaning: the mental state which occurs after someone has suffered a loss; usually a death
Example: When the principal died suddenly; the school district hired a bereavement counselor to help the students deal with their emotions.

Word: Bereft
Meaning: deprived
Example: When my husband died; I felt bereft of love and hope.

Word: Beret
Meaning: a type of round brimless cap; headgear 
Example: The green beret is a symbol of commitment and sacrifice to the brave men who challenged themselves to be the best of the best in the U.S. Army Special Forces.

Word: Berry
Meaning: a small succulent fruit; of any one of many varieties 
Example: Every summer we'd pluck berries from a berry tree and make jam.

Word: Berserk
Meaning: out of control with high emotions; wild
Example: Jimmy went totally berserk when Sandra told him that she was breaking off their engagement.

Word: Beseech
Meaning: to ask someone for something in an urgent and sincere way
Example: As soon as I reach the driving age; I will beseech my parents to buy me a car.

Word: Beset
Meaning: to surround or attack from all sides
Example: The expectant mother was beset with a new set of anxieties every time she heard some of her friends’ stories about childbirth.

Word: Besiege
Meaning: to approach with an excessive number of requests or questions
Example: The journalists will besiege the police chief with questions about the prisoner’s escape.

Word: Besmirch
Meaning: to smear an individual’s reputation or character
Example: The woman’s adultery accusation is sure to besmirch the married politician’s reputation.

Word: Besot
Meaning: to cause someone look silly or foolish; especially by drinking
Example: The huge glass of liquor besot the drunkard; causing him to dance on the bar and make stupid jokes.

Word: Besotted
Meaning: strongly infatuated or obsessed
Example: The besotted mother treated her child like a princess; despite the fact that she risked spoiling her.

Word: Bespeak
Meaning: suggest; indicate
Example: Thousands of homeless old-timers in the city might bespeak a larger scale problem with our national veteran services.

Word: Bespoke
Meaning: individually or custom made
Example: Jack is a master tailor who creates bespoke suits.

Word: Bestial
Meaning: like a wild animal or beast; exceptionally violent and cruel
Example: At the movie’s conclusion; there was a bestial scene that ended with the beheading of the bad guy.

Word: Bestow
Meaning: to give as a tribute or gift
Example: During the ceremony; the prime minister will bestow medals of honor to the brave soldiers who rescued their comrades.

Word: Bestowal
Meaning: to freely give something as a gift
Example: Mr. Markham’s bestowal of such high dowries to his 10 daughters was a surprise to everyone because for years they believed him penniless.

Word: Bestowed
Meaning: presented with
Example: The queen bestowed a title upon the man who saved her life.

Word: Bestride
Meaning: to sit with legs on both sides of something
Example: After mounting; the children over six years old would bestride the horse.

Word: Bet
Meaning: to risk something against another person on the outcome of a future event
Example: I am going to bet fifty dollars against my friend that it is going to snow today; while he is betting fifty that it will not.

Word:  Betide 
Meaning: to occur or happen to; befall
Example: Because Kurt and I love each other we know our marriage will last; whatever may betide while he is stationed overseas in the military.

Word: Betoken
Meaning: indicate or specify 
Example: In college; a sock wrapped around the door knob serves to betoken a roommate has a guest and does not wish to be disturbed.

Word: Betray
Meaning: expose (one's country; a group; or a person) to danger by treacherously giving information to an enemy
Example: Harry decided to betray his country and spy for the enemy; despite all that America had done for him.

Word: Betrothed 
Meaning: the person to whom one is engaged
Example: I must remain faithful to my betrothed and ignore the flirtations of the handsome man at the bar.

Word: Betterment
Meaning: the process of improving something and making it better
Example: The teacher put in long hours of after school tutoring for the betterment of her students.

Word: Between
Meaning: at; into; or across the space separating two objects or regions
Example: She hid her love letters between the pages of her favorite book.

Word: Betwixt
Meaning: between; specifically between two objects
Example: Steven shaved off the hair betwixt his nose and upper lip; otherwise known as the mustache.

Word: Bevel
Meaning: to create a sloping surface or edge
Example: The carpenter will bevel the roof so that it slopes down slightly on both sides.

Word: Bevy
Meaning: a sizable group of things or individuals
Example: In hopes of receiving a bevy of presents; Hank invited a lot of people to his birthday party.

Word: Bewail
Meaning: expressing extreme sorrow by crying or complaining 
Example: During lunch Matt took the opportunity to bewail the incompetence of his office mates.

Word: Beware
Meaning: to use caution; pay attention to 
Example: Beware of falling rocks from the top of the mountain.

Word: Bewildered
Meaning: puzzled or confused 
Example: Jason was bewildered by the strange noises coming from his neighbor’s house.

Word: Bewilderment
Meaning: the circumstance of being in a puzzled state
Example: I stared in bewilderment at the cat and dog dancing together.

Word: Bewitched
Meaning: to cast a magical spell on someone
Example: Evil witches bewitched the children and ate them for lunch once they were under their spell.

Word: Beyond
Meaning: past a specified point
Example: The prisoners couldn't see beyond the barbed wire fence that surrounded their compound.

Word: Bias
Meaning: prejudice favoring a person; thing or group; most often in a way thought to be unfair 
Example: After a long court battle; the firm was found guilty of showing bias against females in its promotion practices.

Word: Bib
Meaning: a piece of cloth or plastic fitted around the neck of a person to prevent food from getting on their clothes while they eat; typically used for babies
Example: Because babies are such messy eaters; we often tie a bib around their neck to catch any of the food they drop form their mouths or hands.

Word: Bibliography
Meaning: a list of the works referred to in a scholarly piece; usually at the end in the form of an appendix
Example: Most English teachers require you to have a bibliography with your research paper; giving proof of where you got all of your information.

Word: Bibliophile 
Meaning: an individual with a huge passion for books
Example: Jason is a bibliophile who reads at least four books every day.

Word:  Bibulous 
Meaning: related to alcohol consumption
Example: After a bibulous night of barhopping; Gail wasn’t in a condition to drive home.

Word: Bicameral
Meaning: having two distinct compartments or chambers
Example: The legislative portion of the United Sates government is bicameral and consists of two bodies of lawmakers; senators and representatives.

Word: Bicentennial
Meaning: taking place every two hundred years 
Example: The bicentennial of the war marks two hundred years since the conflict.

Word: Bicker
Meaning: to argue about inconsequential or unimportant things
Example: Young children are more likely to bicker about things that really don’t matter; such as who gets to play with a certain toy or who gets to ride in the front seat of the car.

Word: Bid
Meaning: to put in an offer to buy something; especially at an auction
Example: At the auction; the dealer bid on several different vehicles that were for sale.

Word: Bidet
Meaning: a low oval basin used for washing one's genital
Example: The restroom had a toilet as well as a bidet that was used to clean oneself after using the bathroom.

Word: Biennial 
Meaning: taking place in two year intervals
Example: The biennial picnic is scheduled to be held in two years.

Word: Bier
Meaning: a frame on which a dead body or a coffin is carried before a funeral
Example: The funeral director placed the corpse on the bier and had the burial frame moved to the cemetery.

Word: Bifurcate
Meaning: divided or forked into two
Example: If citizens are worried about a government having too much power; a bifurcate government would allow one branch to check the other branch

Word: Big
Meaning: of considerable size; extent; or intensity
Example: Sometimes the world felt so big and she was just a tiny speck on the surface of the planet.

Word: Bigamy 
Meaning: the practice of having two spouses at the same time
Example: Alan was charged with bigamy after the police discovered he was married to two women.

Word: Bigly
Meaning: with great force; strongly
Example: Attacking bigly; David was able to defeat Goliath with a single shot.

Word: Bigot
Meaning: a person who is obstinately or intolerantly devoted to his or her own opinions and prejudices
Example: The bigot was a lonely old man who thought everyone was inferior to him.

Word: Bilateral 
Meaning: relating to both sides 
Example: When Angie learned about her family history of breast cancer; she decided to have both her breasts removed in a bilateral mastectomy.

Word: Bilingual
Meaning: having the ability to speak two languages
Example: Because Debra is a bilingual; she is often chosen to translate between English and Spanish speakers.

Word: Bilious
Meaning: annoyed; bad-tempered
Example: Our bilious neighbor is known for his bad attitude.

Word: Bilk
Meaning: defraud; cheat
Example: Because he has always been so anti-government; he constantly accuses the President and Congress of trying to bilk tax-payers out of their hard-earned cash.

Word: Bill of Rights
Meaning: the first ten amendments of the Constitution that guarantee the rights of the people of the United States
Example: The Bill of Rights was added to the U.S. Constitution to insure certain freedoms and rights to the citizens of America.

Word: Billet
Meaning: a private nonmilitary house where soldiers were assigned to lodge
Example: During the Second World War the building became a billet for soldiers.

Word: Billfold
Meaning: a wallet typically made of leather that is thin enough to fold on itself several times
Example: I prefer a billfold for my wallet; since it folds the bills inside of it for easy distribution when I have to pay someone in cash.

Word: Billingsgate
Meaning: harshly offensive and rude talking
Example: Due to the billingsgate coming from the mouth of the disrespectful student to his teacher; the boy was suspended for a few days.

Word: Billowing
Meaning: swelling out or bulging
Example: As soon as the window was opened; the billowing curtains announced a cool breeze that was much needed on a hot day.

Word: Bin
Meaning: a container that is used to store things
Example: The teacher stored glue; scissors; and other school supplies in a small bin.

Word: Binary
Meaning: associated with two elements or items
Example: In a game of chess; the results are binary; one winner and one loser.

Word: Bind
Meaning: to tie or fasten
Example: Family are the ties that bind us to our history and remind us where we come from.

Word: Binge watch
Meaning: to watch multiple episodes of a television show back to back
Example: The lonely woman stays up all night and will binge watch episodes of the interesting series to pass the time.

Word: Binge
Meaning: a short period of excessive consumption
Example: If I continue to binge on junk food I will become obese.

Word: Biodegradable
Meaning: having the ability to decompose organically without leaving an imprint on its surroundings
Example: We avoid using foam plates because they aren’t biodegradable and as such will remain at the dump for hundreds of years.

Word: Biodiversity
Meaning: refers to the level of variety in living creatures and plants within a particular area
Example: The biodiversity of this lake is extremely high; with several dozen species of fish and birds living in or near it.

Word: Biography
Meaning: a person’s life story as told by another person
Example: It took me years to shape the president’s life story into an engaging biography.

Word: Biology
Meaning: study of living matter
Example: In biology class; we studied the human body and how it works.

Word: Biomass
Meaning: plant life used as a source of energy or fuel
Example: The biomass that fuels the bus comes from processed vegetation.

Word: Biome
Meaning: a large naturally occurring community of flora and fauna occupying a major habitat; e.g.; forest or tundra
Example: The tundra biome consists of icy landscapes; heavily furred woodland animals; and cool to freezing temperatures.

Word: Biopsy
Meaning: the act of removing and examining cells; fluids; or tissue to identify medical conditions
Example: The doctor is going to perform a tissue biopsy to see if cancer is present in my lungs.

Word: Biosphere
Meaning: the combined regions of a planet that make it habitable and sustainable for living organisms
Example: Earth’s biosphere is made up of all living things; from the oceans to plants to the very atmosphere.

Word: Biotic
Meaning: associated with living creatures
Example: Any living part of an environment is a biotic element.

Word: Bipartisan
Meaning: relating to supporters of two unlike groups
Example: It will take a bipartisan effort to turn the bill into a law.

Word: Biped
Meaning: an animal that walks on two feet
Example: Because my cat has four feet and not two; it is definitely not a biped.

Word: Bipolar
Meaning: a mental health disorder causing severe mood swings 
Example: Bipolar moods may shift from depressed to manic and back to depressed again.

Word: Birch
Meaning: a slender and smooth tree that has a wood covering that is usually white
Example: The woman picked a bundle of thin switches from the birch tree to create a broom.

Word: Birdbath
Meaning: a small basin filled with water that birds can bathe in
Example: Inside the garden; a rainwater-filled basin served as a birdbath for the bluebirds.

Word: Birther
Meaning: a person who believes former President Barack Obama was not born in the United States and should have been disqualified from being president
Example: The birther is adamant that President Obama was born in Kenya and not the United States.

Word: Bisect 
Meaning: to separate into two even or nearly even sections
Example: With the skill of a surgeon; the chef will use a knife to bisect the pie into two equal slices.

Word: Bitten
Meaning: having been wounded when a person or animal’s teeth were pushed down into the skin
Example: After being bitten by a poisonous snake; the injured hiker was rushed to the hospital.

Word: Bitter end
Meaning: the end or conclusion of a very difficult situation
Example: As the battle came to the bitter end; people on both sides were upset by all of the destruction.

Word: Bitter
Meaning: agitated; disgruntled; or angry about something
Example: My wife was bitter towards me after she found out that I had been hanging around an old girlfriend from school; even though we didn’t do anything.

Word: Bittersweet
Meaning: something that offers both joy and pain or the tastes of sweet and bitter together
Example: Saying goodbye to my husband was such a bittersweet experience for me.

Word: Bivouac
Meaning: a makeshift shelter that is generally used only for a night
Example: When the storm started; the soldier built a bivouac for shelter.

Word: Biweekly
Meaning: once every two weeks
Example: Being paid biweekly means that I have to manage my paycheck wisely for two weeks.

Word: Bizarre 
Meaning: highly unusual
Example: Everyone stared at the student who wore the bizarre outfit to school.

Word: Black

Word: Blacklist

Word: Blackmail

Word: Blameless

Word: Blanch
Meaning: to grow fairer or paler as a result of fright or amazement
Example: The snake’s presence made the normally dark Gail blanch in fear.

Word: Bland
Meaning: wanting in quality; taste; or seasonings 
Example: The bland salad will taste better if you add salt and pepper to it.

Word: Blandish
Meaning: to persuade or influence someone by using flattery
Example: Because he wanted to go to the game so badly; Joe tried to blandish his mother by complimenting her hair.

Word: Blandishment
Meaning: the use of flattery (sweet-talk) and enticements to persuade somebody gently to do something
Example: Even though the salesman produced every blandishment he could think of from his bag of tricks; his prospect wouldn’t be budged by his flattery.

Word: Blaring
Meaning: to make or cause sound to play loudly
Example: With siren blaring; the fire truck raced off noisily into the night

Word: Blase
Meaning: indifferent because of frequent exposure
Example: After going on eight cruises; I am blasé about the whole cruising experience.

Word: Blasphemy

Word: Blather
Meaning: to ramble on for a long period of time

Word: Blatherskite

Word: Blaze
Meaning: a fire that is burning intensely
Example: Last night firefighters worked tirelessly to control the blaze that consumed the old train station.

Word: Blazon

Word: Bleak

Word: Bleary

Word: Blemish

Word: Blend

Example: I plan on breaking up with my girlfriend because our views on important issues do not blend well together.

Word: Blight

Word: Blimp

Word: Blind

Word: Blindly

Word: Blip

Example: People who suffer from severe depression rarely experience days of bliss.

Word: Blister

Meaning: cheerful and lighthearted

Word: Blitz
Meaning: a sudden or intensive effort; often referring to a military attack
Example: The blitz bombing caught their adversaries by surprise; allowing them to win the war.

Word: Blitzkrieg
Meaning: a ruthless attack designed to quickly defeat or stun another
Example: Although the Japanese might have planned dropping bombs on Pearl Harbor as a blitzkrieg attack; the United States did not surrender.

Word: Blizzard
Meaning: a severe snowstorm with strong winds and reduced visibility
Example: The weather forecaster upgraded the simple snow showers to a blizzard due to expectant high 40 mph winds and at least 12 feet of snow.

Word: Bloat

Word: Blob

Word: Bloc

Word: Bore

Word: Bored

Word: Boredom

Word: Borked

Word: Borne

Word: Bossy

Word: Botanical
Meaning: related to plants

Word: Botany

Word: Botch
Meaning: to mess up or ruin
Example: You will botch the recipe if you leave the chicken in the marinade for too long.

Word: Bothersome
Meaning: causing bother or irritability
Example: Living close to the airport; the constant aircraft noise is particularly bothersome when I'm trying to sleep.

Word: Bottleneck
Meaning: a point where something large is forced into a narrower space
Example: In a bottle of water; there is a literal bottleneck at the top where the large space of the bottle narrows to fit someone’s mouth.

Word: Bottomless
Meaning: limitless; having an unlimited supply
Example: The waitress brought a bottomless supply of chips and salsa to our table all night long.

Word: Bough
Meaning: a large tree branch
Example: Mulberries sprouted in each direction off of the main bough of the tree.

Word: Bought
Meaning: purchased
Example: The customer bought several different beauty products from the department store; but the concealer was by far her favorite purchase.

Word: Boulder
Meaning: a large rock typically made smooth by erosion
Example: A large boulder fell from the cliffs above during the storm; blocking the road with its smooth surface.

Word: Bounce
Meaning: to move quickly up and down 
Example: My children aren’t allowed to bounce on the bed when they play in their room.

Word: Bound
Meaning: tied up
Example: As the robber bound his hands together; the store clerk prayed that he would only be tied up and not killed.

Word: Boundary
Meaning: a line that marks the limits of an area 
Example: The boundary between North and South Korea is marked by a barrier that functions as a demilitarized zone.

Word: Boundless
Meaning: unlimited; endless
Example: Technological advances seem boundless as we continue to invent new; high-tech devices every day.

Word: Bounteous
Meaning: ample; lavish
Example: The bounteous buffet could probably feed thousands of people.

Word: Bountiful
Meaning: having a generous amount 
Example: Since we had a bountiful harvest this year; we were able to donate a good portion of our crops to a local soup kitchen.

Word: Bounty
Meaning: an abundance
Example: A bounty of sheep filled the field; causing the entire area to look white like snow.

Word: Bouquet
Meaning: a creative arrangement of flowers 
Example: Our local florist created a lovely bridal bouquet of red and white flowers for my daughter’s wedding.

Word: Bourgeois
Meaning: characteristic of the social middle class or relating to one who likes to put on airs 
Example: After surviving the plane crash; Eric gave up his bourgeois life and joined the priesthood.

Word: Bout
Meaning: a period of something; usually painful or unpleasant
Example: After missing four days of school due to a bout of flu; Emily struggled to make up her missing work.

Word: Boutique
Meaning: a small store that sells fashionable items
Example: The boutique specializes in plus size clothing and caters to women with curvier figures.

Word: Bovine 
Meaning: uninteresting and sluggish 
Example: When my daughter does not want to do something; she always completes the task in a bovine manner.

Word: Bow
Meaning: a looped knot that is tied into something
Example: The small girl was taught how to make a two-looped bow out of her shoestring.

Word: Bowdlerize
Meaning: to delete or change the parts of a text that are viewed as offensive
Example: If you do not want to offend your teacher with that profane language; you should bowdlerize the story before handing it in for a grade.

Word: Boycott
Meaning: 
Example: A group of Hispanic men are holding a boycott by refusing to work in establishments that will not pay them legal wages.

Word: Boyhood
Meaning: the state or period of being a boy
Example: The man was going to buy his boyhood home so he could recapture his childhood memories.

Word: Bracken
Meaning: any of several coarse ferns
Example: The leaves of the western bracken fern are normally 1 to 10 feet long.

Word: Bracket
Meaning: a category or group that people or things are placed in
Example: Only teams were left in the lower bracket and had to face off for the division championship.

Word: Brackish
Meaning: unappealing in taste
Example: Since the water on the island tasted brackish; I decided not to drink it.

Word: Brackish
Meaning: slightly salty
Example: The diner complained that his meal was too brackish to consume.

Word: Brag
Meaning: boastful talk 
Example: Kevin would often brag about his many girlfriends when he was in the company of friends.

Word: Braggadocio 
Meaning: the boasting or bragging about something that is not true
Example: The bully’s braggadocio allowed him to hide his low self-esteem.

Word: Braggart 
Meaning: an individual who brags a great deal
Example: My rich uncle is a braggart who constantly boasts about his possessions.

Word: Braille
Meaning: a writing system consisting of raised dots used to help people who are blind read material
Example: Running her fingers along the raised dots; the blind woman read the book written in braille.

Word: Brainstorm
Meaning: the pondering of ideas by one or more individuals as a way to come up with a plan or solution to a problem
Example: Writers often brainstorm ideas for their stories before actually beginning to draft their books.

Word: Brandish
Meaning: to gesture while holding a weapon or other item as a threat
Example: When the crazed man decided to brandish a gun in the airport; he was immediately shot by a security guard.

Word: Brash
Meaning: assertive in an aggressive way that often comes across as unpleasant
Example: Because Anna is so brash at work; she often offends people with her aggressive personality.

Meaning: bold assertiveness
Example: The aggressive racecar driver is known for his brashness when zooming down the track.

Meaning: looking like brass
Example: The brassy jewelry shined with a golden twinkle in the sunlight.

Meaning: a sudden discovery or overcoming of an obstacle
Example: A medical breakthrough suddenly allowed doctors to cure a disease that once killed thousands of people.

Meaning: the air that you take in or send out of your lungs
Example: After a ten mile trek; the exhausted hiker was panting and out of breath.

Meaning: the intake and release of air
Example: Because we cannot breathe under water; swimmers can only stay under for a short amount of time.

Meaning: panting or gasping for breath
Example: On the other end of the phone; Phyllis heard a breathless voice gasping as it spoke.

Meaning: a class of animals within a species that have similar physical characteristics
Example: My dog is part of a very small breed that originated in Spain.

Meaning: fill or be full to the point of overflowing
Example: Her eyes were brimming with so many tears that they threatened to overflow.

Word: Brink
Meaning: the very edge or border
Example: A few years ago; the economy was on the brink of collapse due to inflation and several other factors.

Meaning: the habit of following a path to the point of danger before turning back or stopping; normally seen in political affairs

Meaning: very active and quick

Word: Cacology

Word: Cacophony

Word: Cadre

Word: Caducity
Meaning: frail old age; senile

Word: Cagey
Meaning: uncommunicative; unwilling or hesitant to give information

Word: Cahoots
Meaning: secretly working together to commit crime or dishonest activity

Word: Cajole
Meaning: persuade someone to do something; convince with gentle pleading; sweet-talk
Example: Why did I ever let my friends cajole me into eating sushi?

Word: Cajolery
Meaning: flattery and gentle pleading done on purpose to persuade someone to do something

Word: Calamitous
Meaning: involving catastrophe
Example: A calamitous accident destroyed the driver’s chance of winning a major race.

Word: Calamity
Meaning: a situation that results in extreme suffering
Example: The approaching hurricane is sure to be a calamity that will affect the lives of millions.

Word: Calculated
Meaning: referring to an action committed with full awareness of its consequences
Example: When you weigh the pros and cons of an action before doing it; you are taking a calculated risk; with full understanding of the implications of your decision.

Word: Caldera
Meaning: a large; volcanic crater that is created after part of a volcano collapses
Example: The circular caldera is located at the summit of the volcano and is sunken in from the collapse.

Word: Caliber
Meaning: the worth of an individual’s character or his level of ability
Example: Only dancers of the highest caliber will be invited to perform for the president.

Word: Calibrate
Meaning: to quantify in a careful and detailed manner 
Example: The hospital pharmacist knows how important it is to calibrate the IV medications correctly.

Word: Caliphate
