Word: Certify
Meaning: to guarantee that something is true in an official way
Example: A piece of paper was issued to certify the diamond was real.

Word: Certitude
Meaning: the condition of being certain or sure about something
Example: Unfortunately; the witness could not describe her attacker’s face with certitude.

Word: Cessation
Meaning: the termination of something
Example: The arrival of several police cruisers brought a quick cessation to the gang fight.

Word: Cesspool
Meaning: a circumstance or place that is corrupt and/or filthy
Example: Because the bar is filled with drug addicts and killers; it’s a real cesspool.

Word: Chafe
Meaning: to worry or fret
Example: My protective father tends to chafe whenever I go on a date.

Word: Chaff
Meaning: of very little value
Example: The pawn store owner refused to buy the thief’s chaff because it was worthless.

Word: Chagrin
Meaning: a feeling of being frustrated or annoyed because of failure or disappointment 
Example: To her chagrin; Jill placed second in the beauty pageant.

Word: Chair
Meaning: a seat that a person sits in that usually has a back and four legs
Example: Plopping down in the chair; the man prepared to relax and watch TV from his recliner.

Word: Chalice
Meaning: a large cup or goblet that is used to drink wine
Example: Raising his jeweled chalice and tapping the cup with his knife; the king made a toast to the success of his kingdom.

Word: Challenge
Meaning: a demand to battle in a match or brawl
Example: As the two men challenge the obnoxious younger man to a fight; he agreed and all three of them headed out of the establishment into the street.

Word: Chamber
Meaning: a compartment or space
Example: Calling the attorney’s into his chamber; the judge used his private room to counsel both sides.

Word: Champion
Meaning: a person who has defeated all rivals in a competition
Example: Standing on top of the platform; the Olympic champion received a gold medal for his win.

Word: Chance
Meaning: a possibility or likelihood
Example: There is always a chance that the baker will run out of donuts; but the likelihood is much higher on Mondays.

Word: Changeable
Meaning: easy to be changed or replaced
Example: The traveler bought a changeable ticket that could be swapped for a different date if needed.

Word: Changed
Meaning: altered; made different
Example: Although she changed her original classes to a few different courses; the student still wasn’t happy with her altered schedule.

Word: Changeling
Meaning: a boy or girl who is replaced with another child either on purpose as part of a scheme or by accident
Example: In order to make the mother believe her daughter had been found; a changeling was sent in as a substitute who closely resembled her daughter.

Word: Channel
Meaning: a passage that water or other liquids flow through
Example: A channel was created between the two rivers so that goods could be transported across the waterway.

Word: Chant
Meaning: rhythmic speaking or singing of words or sounds
Example: """USA! USA! USA!"" is a chant you hear from Americans at some political rallies or sports events."

Word: Chaos 
Meaning: a state of confusion 
Example: The chaos in the cafeteria began when one student threw his lunch at another student.

Word: Chap
Meaning: of the skin become cracked; rough; or sore; typically through exposure to cold weather; a cracked or sore patch on the skin
Example: She always carried extra lip balm in her purse during cold weather because the frigid air made her lips chap.

Word: Chaperone
Meaning: to watch and ensure the safety of another individual
Example: Parents chaperone the children at the school dance.

Word: Characteristic
Meaning: trait
Example: The only characteristic the man got from his father was his dark eyes.

Word: Characterize
Meaning: to describe
Example: The company is refusing to characterize the event as a PR nightmare; but their stocks have dropped significantly.

Word: Charade
Meaning: a sham or farce
Example: Keeping up the charade; my family continued to pretend that they weren’t going to throw my little sister a surprise party.

Word: Charisma
Meaning: charm; attractiveness
Example: The politician earned a lot of female votes because of his winning smile and charisma.

Word: Charismatic
Meaning: having a convincing charm that inspires others to believe what you say
Example: The charismatic cult leader convinced his followers he was the only path to heaven.

Word: Charitable
Meaning: generous in giving to those in need
Example: Charitable donations were made to help those who lost their homes during the flood.

Word: Charity
Meaning: the voluntary giving of money or assistance to those in need
Example: A charity run is being held to raise funds for the city’s homeless population.

Word: Charlatan
Meaning: a person who falsely pretends to know or be something in order to deceive people
Example: The charlatan pretended to be a doctor so he could go into the hospital and steal prescription drugs.

Word: Charm
Meaning: the ability to persuade; delight or arouse admiration 
Example: Rose soon learned from her new boss that her charm is why she was chosen for the hostess job.

Word: Chart
Meaning: to record information
Example: The nurse used pen and paper to chart all of the patient’s vital signs for the night.

Word: Charter
Meaning: a government-issued document that provides a group or individual with certain rights 
Example: The king’s charter gave the colonists the right to set up residence in the new world.

Word: Chary
Meaning: apprehensive about doing something
Example: Because Vera was chary about going in the old house; I agreed to go in with her.

Word: Chase
Meaning: to run after or pursue someone or something
Example: The dog tried to chase the cat up the tree; but the kitty got away.

Word: Chasm 
Meaning: a major difference in opinion between individuals or groups
Example: Jack and I ended our relationship because of the religious chasm that divided us.

Word: Chaste
Meaning: wholesome; pure in thought
Example: Because I am very religious; I told my boyfriend we could do nothing more than exchange chaste kisses.

Word: Chasten
Meaning: to punish or reprimand in order to correct 
Example: As a parent; I don’t feel spanking is a good way to chasten your kids.

Word: Chastise
Meaning: to criticize someone harshly for doing something wrong
Example: If you bully someone in Mrs. Marshall’s class; she will chastise you and keep you after school.

Word: Chastity
Meaning: the condition of remaining pure and chaste
Example: The nun took a vow of chastity as part of her commitment to remain pure.

Word: Chateau
Meaning: a huge house or manor that is most often seen in France
Example: My chateau in France is a huge manor.

Word: Chatoyant
Meaning: describes a gemstone that has a reflective streak or cat's eye effect in the center
Example: Each of the chatoyant minerals had a luminous band in the center.

Word: Chattel
Meaning: personal property that can be relocated
Example: A slave was once considered to be an owner’s chattel.

Word: Chatter
Meaning: trivial talk or chit chat
Example: Full of gossip; my nosy neighbors’ chatter could be heard on my front porch.

Word: Chauffeur
Meaning: one who drives a car as an occupation
Example: I’ll have the chauffeur drive me to the store tomorrow.

Word: Chauvinism
Meaning: a narrow-minded confidence in the supremacy of one’s own group or gender
Example: Despite the chauvinism of the male racers; Danica went on to become a successful racecar driver.

Word: Chauvinist
Meaning: someone who displays extreme or aggressive support for something
Example: Some people consider my sister to be a chauvinist when it comes to feminism; as she gets both angry and irritated when someone opposes her point of view.

Word: Cheap
Meaning: low in price; not expensive
Example: Cheap products can be purchased at the Dollar Tree since everything there costs a dollar or less.

Word: Cheapen
Meaning: to reduce the price or quality of something
Example: If the movie theater decides to cheapen the price of tickets; more people will be able to afford tickets.

Word: Checks and balances
Meaning: a controlled system in the three government branches where each branch has some rights to change or stop the actions of another branch
Example: Even though the president of the United States is the actual leader of the military; he can’t declare war on another country due to the system of checks and balances.

Word: Cheeky
Meaning: impudent or unapologetic but in a generally charming way
Example: The third grader was extremely cheeky; rarely referring to the teacher as ‘Mr. Walters’ rather than ‘gramps;’ but it was somewhat endearing.

Word: Cheerful
Meaning: displaying or feeling happiness
Example: Jan was in a cheerful mood on her wedding day.

Word: Chemical
Meaning: any basic substance that is used in or produced by a reaction involving changes to atoms
Example: The chemical is used to clean the kitchen; but care must be taken since the substance is so strong.

Word: Chemistry
Meaning: emotional or mental attraction/interaction between two people
Example: Instant chemistry between the couple led them to an engagement and wedding within six months of meeting.

Word: Cherish
Meaning: to treasure or deeply care for something
Example: I will forever cherish the teddy bear my late grandfather had given to me.

Word: Cherub 
Meaning: a child who looks innocent or beautiful
Example: Everyone referred to the adorable baby as a cherub.

Word: Chew
Meaning: to bite off something and grind it up using teeth
Example: It is hard to chew up an apple if you have two missing front teeth.

Word: Chiaroscuro
Meaning: an artistic image emphasizing the brightness and darkness while de-emphasizing color
Example: Art critics at the art gallery admired the chiaroscuro of the black and white photograph since the shade covered everything but the bright eyes of the woman.

Word: Chic
Meaning: tastefully stylish
Example: The chic heels will go perfectly with my stylish dress.

Word: Chicanery
Meaning: the use of trickery to achieve a political; financial; or legal purpose
Example: You can smell the chicanery from a dishonest politician.

Word: Chide
Meaning: tell somebody off; scold
Example: I don’t want the boss to chide me for being late again; so I’m setting the alarm for a half hour earlier.

Word: Chiffon
Meaning: light and silky fabric
Example: Before I put on my new chiffon skirt; I checked the temperature to make sure it was not going to be too cold outside.

Word: Child
Meaning: a young human being
Example: At 10; the child still liked to play with dolls and ride her bike.

Word: Childhood
Meaning: the time during which one is a child; from between infancy and puberty
Example: My stepmother is a mean woman who likes to insult little kids because she had a miserable childhood herself.

Word: Childlike
Meaning: being innocent or naïve in a manner befitting of a child
Example: Even as a young adult; Avan has an almost childlike innocence to him that many people find endearing; even though others think it foolish.

Word: Chime
Meaning: ringing or tone making component of a device 
Example: I enabled the chime mode on my watch so it will sound a long beep each hour.

Word: Chimera
Meaning: a creation of a person’s mind; something that is not real
Example: Ron’s mental disorder caused him to believe there was a dangerous chimera out to get him.

Word: Chimerical
Meaning: an invention of an individual’s imagination
Example: The company was fined when the government discovered it had used chimerical data to get approval for its new drug.

Word: Chipper
Meaning: happy and cheerful
Example: After having a great day at work; Martha was in a happy and chipper mood.

Word: Chirp
Meaning: a short; high-pitched sound
Example: Nothing irritates me more than a bird that wants to constantly chirp outside of my window in the morning; ruining my sleep.

Word: Chisel
Meaning: a long-bladed hand tool that is struck with a hammer to cut or shape hard materials
Example: Ancient sculptors used a hammer and a chisel to shape the blocks of stones that they wished to turn into statues.

Word: Chit-chat
Meaning: to engage in small talk; to discuss unimportant matters.
Example: Sitting close to the teacher will make it harder for you to chit-chat with classmates as the teacher will likely remind you to quiet down.

Word: Chlorophyll

Word: Choice

Example: Now that I’ve graduated High School; I have a choice to make whether I go to College.

Word: Choleric
Meaning: easily irritated; grumpy

Word: Chore

Example: Several artists used the same chromatic colors in their portraits at the display.

Word: Chromatin
Meaning: genetic material composed of DNA and proteins that condenses to form chromosomes
Example: Found in the inside of the cell; chromatin is made up mostly of DNA and proteins.

Word: Chromosome
Meaning: that portion of the cell that holds the genes which determine the identity and development of a plant or animal
Example: A chromosome is the cell organelle that contains the genes that define an organism’s traits.

Word: Chronic
Meaning: appearing for a lengthy period of time
Example: For three months; I have had a chronic headache.

Example: When the detective read the chronicle of the attack; he knew how and when the victim died.

Word: Chronological
Meaning: organized in the order of occurrence
Example: The easiest way to comprehend history is in chronological order; learning of events in the order that they happened in time.

Word: Chronology
Meaning: the time pattern in which something happens
Example: The detectives sought to create the chronology leading up to the victim’s disappearance.

Word: Chronometer
Meaning: an instrument designed to keep time with great accuracy; especially when at sea
Example: The chronometer was designed to help sailors more accurately determine longitude.

Word: Cilia
Meaning: the feather-like; thin hairs connected to the eyelid known as an eyelash

Word: Circa
Meaning: around or about a certain date
Example: The historian is not certain of the exact date; but he believes the war took place circa 300;000 years ago.

Word: Circle
Meaning: a group of people that share interests; professions; or acquaintances

Word: Circuitous
Meaning: not said or done simply or clearly 
Example: Because the spy did not want to give away the location of his headquarters; he always took a long and circuitous route to his office.

Word: Circular
Meaning: shaped like a circle; round
Example: The circular tower was much taller than the ones built in a square shape instead of a rounded one.

Word: Circulate
Meaning: to spread or move around freely; to move in circles
Example: The new company was planning to circulate fliers about their up and coming business.

Word: Circulation
Meaning: the continuous movement of something in a closed section
Example: While on the plane; the woman’s blood circulation was reduced and her legs began to cramp.

Word: Circumference
Meaning: the distance around something round or rounded; like the distance around the edge of a circle
Example: The nurse measured the circumference of the newborn babies’ head.

Word: Circumlocution
Meaning: the use of too many words to say something; especially in order to avoid saying something clearly
Example: The con man tried to use circumlocution to avoid explaining his real intentions to the wealthy couple.

Word: Circumnavigate
Meaning: to travel entirely around something
Example: In order to get into the police station; we must first circumnavigate the crowd of protestors.

Word: Circumscribe
Meaning: to limit the range or scope of something to a particular degree
Example: When my husband drinks too much; I hide his car keys to circumscribe his capacity to drive.

Word: Circumspect
Meaning: to think carefully before doing or saying anything; in order to avoid risks or consequences; cautious
Example: In this day and age; you need to be circumspect about giving out too much personal information on the internet.

Word: Circumstance
Meaning: a particular incident that influences another event
Example: Under no circumstance will I allow my daughter to go to a party that is not supervised by an adult.

Word: Circumstantial
Meaning: something that seems to be true but is not proven
Example: The evidence against the suspect was purely circumstantial and was not enough to convict.

Word: Circumvent
Meaning: to get around something
Example: If we do not find a way to circumvent this problem; we will not be able to finish the project.

Word: Cistern
Meaning: a reservoir or tank for holding water; especially for catching and holding rainwater for later use
Example: Due to living in the rural areas of Montana; the farmer kept a cistern filled with water.

Word: Cite

Word: Citizen

Word: Civic
Meaning: related to a city or citizen

Word: Civil Law
Meaning: system of law concerned with private affairs between citizens rather than criminal affairs
Example: A dispute between two neighbors that is taken to court would be considered within the realm of civil law rather than criminal justice.

Meaning: the rights of citizens to political and social freedom and equality

Meaning: polite and cultured

Word: Clandestine

Word: Clang

Word: Classification

Meaning: the process of classifying or labeling things based on shared traits
Example: Scientists use classification to divide the animal kingdom and make them easier to study and understand based on their similarities.

Word: Classify
Meaning: to group things or people together in categories based on things they have in common

Word: Classy
Meaning: elegant and refined in look in style

Word: Clause

Word: Claustrophobia
Meaning: the fear of closed; tight places

Word: Cleavage
Meaning: a separation between two groups or things

Word: Cleave
Meaning: to split with a tool
Example: You can use the axe to cleave the tree.

Word: Cleft

Example: Neil and Mary’s baby girl had a cleft lip repair at age six months.

Word: Clemency
Meaning: a decision not to punish someone severely

Word: Clement
Meaning: mild or merciful

Word: Clerical

Word: Cliche

Word: Client
Meaning: a person who pays someone else for their services
Example: The attorney required the client to pay a 500 dollar fee before he would begin working on her case.

Word: Clientele
Meaning: the individuals who frequent a certain business
Example: The strip club’s clientele includes a number of politicians and wealthy business owners.

Word: Climate
Meaning: the temperature and weather associated with an environment or area
Example: Skiing resorts typically are located in a colder climate so that snow will fall naturally during the season.

Word: Climatic
Meaning: associated with climate 
Example: The climatic change could cause us to cancel our cookout.

Word: Climax
Meaning: the most extreme part of a story; play; song; or situation
Example: In the film the climax occurs when the heiress gives up her fortune and walks out of the family mansion.

Word: Climb
Meaning: to move upward towards the top of something
Example: I get out of breath when I climb the stairs; even if it’s just a few steps.

Word: Clinch
Meaning: to make certain; to finalize
Example: The Senate must work quickly and together in order to clinch the budget deal to avoid a government shutdown.

Word: Cling
Meaning: hold tightly
Example: Eric does not like to swim while wearing an undershirt because wet clothes cling to his body.

Word: Clingy
Meaning: used to describe something that sticks onto someone or something tightly
Example: The clingy shirt stuck to the girl’s skin after she got out of the swimming pool.

Word: Clingy
Meaning: something or someone that is likely to stick; catch; or otherwise be stuck to something
Example: My dog is extremely clingy; refusing to leave my side no matter where I go; including the bathroom.

Word: Cloister

Word: Clone
Meaning: an organism or cell; or group of organisms or cells; produced asexually from one ancestor or stock; to which they are genetically identical
Example: The stranger resembled her so closely that she thought she was her clone.

Word: Close-minded

Word: Close

Word: Closeness

Word: Communicable

Word: Communication

Word: Communism

Example: One of the benefits of communism is free healthcare for everyone.

Word: Commute

Word: Commute

Word: Commuter

Word: Compact

Word: Compaction

Word: Company
Meaning: a person or group of people seen as pleasant or enjoyable to be around
Example: My brother has always been exceptionally good company; since we are around the same age and grew up spending time together.

Word: Comparable
Meaning: having features in common with something else
Example: Finding a hotel with comparable amenities at half the price proved difficult for the travelers.

Word: Comparative advantage
Meaning: the ability of an individual or group to carry out a particular economic activity such as making a specific product more efficiently than another activity
Example: It is a comparative advantage for countries like Iceland who have a large supply of fish to export seafood.

Word: Comparative
Meaning: relative; in comparison to something else
Example: Because they are the three major monotheistic religions; Islam; Christianity; and Judaism are comparative faiths.

Word: Comparatively
Meaning: to a moderate degree when compared to something else
Example: Mistreating others because you have a comparatively higher income is morally wrong.

Word: Compare
Meaning: to note similarities between things
Example: Auditors will compare the two files to see if they equal up.

Word: Comparison
Meaning: the act of telling what two or more things have in common
Example: A comparison of the two books showed that the main characters had a lot in common.

Word: Compartment
Meaning: a separate division or section; often of a room; chamber; or container
Example: The pyramid contained a secret compartment where the body of the pharaoh and all his possessions were stored.

Word: Compartmentalize
Meaning: to separate and isolate things into compartments or categories
Example: We are taught to compartmentalize our work and personal lives; but sometimes it is hard to separate the two.

Word: Compass
Meaning: a round; arrowed device that always points north and is used to find direction
Example: Explorers used the compass to find their way to the island.

Word: Compassion
Meaning: awareness of an individual’s suffering
Example: The woman’s compassion for others led her to become a nun.

Word: Compassionate
Meaning: displaying concern and/or understanding towards other people
Example: The compassionate man donated half of his yearly salary to local charities.

Word: Compatible
Meaning: able to occur together or exist without conflict
Example: While Fido is compatible with dogs; he does not get along with cats.

Word: Compatriot
Meaning: somebody from one's own country
Example: It put Juan at ease to be sitting next to a fellow compatriot on the plane trip from Spain to the United States.

Word: Compel
Meaning: to press or force to have something done 
Example: Sometimes I have to compel my daughter into doing her chores by threatening to keep her allowance.

Word: Compelling
Meaning: captivating; enthralling
Example: The music was so compelling the snake stopped watching its prey and began to sway.

Word: Compendious
Meaning: something that has been explained in a concise or brief way
Example: The small book included a short and compendious overview of the history of Feudal Japan.

Word: Compendium
Meaning: an assortment of items displayed as a set
Example: The book is nothing more than a compendium of the author’s rants against the government.

Word: Compensate 
Meaning: to give a form of payment for a good or service or as a means of making up for a misdeed 
Example: Since I paid over three hundred dollars for my dress; you cannot compensate me for its loss with a fifty dollar check.

Word: Compensation
Meaning: that which is given as payment for a service or as reimbursement for a loss or expense 
Example: If the compensation doesn't allow me to pay my bills; then I'm not interested in the job.

Word: Compete
Meaning: To try to win something such as a prize or award
Example: On Friday; our team will compete in a race against a neighboring school.

Word: Competent 
Meaning: having adequate ability or skill in a certain area
Example: Although the surgery is a difficult one; a competent surgeon will have no problem performing the operation.

Word: Competition
Meaning: a challenge for an award or prize
Example: When the spelling competition concludes; a prize will be given to the best speller.

Word: Competitive
Meaning: having a strong desire to win or be the best at something
Example: Because she’s so competitive; the tennis player can’t stand for someone else to win a match.

Word: Competitor
Meaning: one who takes part in a contest or competition
Example: Manuel was the only competitor that had ever been a part of the race before.

Word: Compilation
Meaning: a collection
Example: A compilation of family photos was on display all across the living room wall.

Word: Compile
Meaning: to bring together items and put them in one set or collection
Example: The librarian will compile popular books by African American authors and put them in a special area for Black History Month.

Word: Complacency
Meaning: a feeling of self-satisfaction that makes one unaware of one’s environment
Example: Because of the complacency of the guards; enemy spies were able to sneak into the castle.

Word: Complacent
Meaning: pleased; overly content
Example: I am rightfully not complacent with low quality service.

Word: Complain
Meaning: to make negative remarks about someone or something often
Example: The students complain about all the extra homework their math teacher gave them over winter break.

Word: Complaint
Meaning: a grievance; problem; difficulty or concern; the act of complaining
Example: I intend to make a formal complaint against my manager to Human Resources.

Word: Complaisant
Meaning: marked by an inclination to please or oblige
Example: Marsha’s complaisant character made her the perfect servant.

Word: Complement 
Meaning: a part that makes something perfect or complete
Example: Ketchup is a must-have complement for French fries.

Word: Complete
Meaning: to finish; to conclude; to reach the end 
Example: The investigation into the store robbery is complete once the criminal confessed.

Word: Complex
Meaning: difficult and complicated
Example: A complex problem surfaced during the faculty meeting when there were not enough staff members to serve food that day to the hundreds of customers who showed up.

Word: Complexion
Meaning: the tone and look of the skin of someone’s face
Example: Her smooth complexion made the model irresistible to every cosmetic company who saw her face.

Word: Complexity
Meaning: the state of being difficult or complicated
Example: Joshua became quite nervous when he noticed the complexity of the math problems on his final exam.

Word: Compliance 
Meaning: the act of obeying rules
Example: Because the prisoner had a long history of compliance; the warden gave him extra outside privileges.

Word: Compliant
Meaning: observing the requirements and rules
Example: The teacher was shocked when her normally rebellious class became compliant.

Word: Complicate
Meaning: make something more difficult or confusing by causing it to be more complex
Example: On shows like Chopped and Cupcake Wars; judges like to complicate the challenge by adding an exotic ingredient that many chefs haven’t used before.

Word: Complicated
Meaning: difficult and involving many different parts
Example: The first cake recipe was too complicated; so I decided to choose a simpler one.

Word: Complication
Meaning: a difficulty or problem
Example: The surgery was completed with only one complication and that difficulty was quickly overcome.

Word: Complicity
Meaning: the condition of being involved in an act of wrongdoing
Example: Your complicity in the crime is probably going to earn you five years in prison.

Word: Compliment
Meaning: a few words of praise: saying that someone or something is good in some way
Example: I just wanted to compliment you for the wonderful speech you gave tonight.

Word: Comply
Meaning: to obey or be in agreement with a policy or rule
Example: The man was arrested because he refused to comply with the airline’s no smoking policy.

Word: Component
Meaning: a small section of a bigger part of a whole thing
Example: The only component of the sandwich that I do not like is the tomato; but the turkey; lettuce and mayonnaise are fine.

Word: Comport
Meaning: to fit with or act in a certain fashion
Example: Because the children do not comport well in a formal dining atmosphere; we have placed them at a kids’ table in the kitchen.

Word: Comportment
Meaning: conduct; manners
Example: Because my brother lacks good comportment; he’s probably going to offend someone during the wedding banquet.

Word: Compose
Meaning: to put something together; like a letter; song; poem; speech; etc.
Example: Mozart would compose many famous musical pieces in his lifetime.

Word: Composed
Meaning: calm and showing no signs of nervousness
Example: Trying to remain composed as she approached the judges; the beauty contestant took a deep breath and gave a sweet smile.

Word: Composite
Meaning: comprised of various elements 
Example: The composite test score is the sum of the math and vocabulary scores.

Word:  Composition 
Meaning: the overall structure of something
Example: The chemical composition of water is two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.

Word: Compost
Meaning: decayed material (i.e.; leaves; food peelings) that is used as a fertilizer
Example: Al created a compost pile in his garden and used the decaying leaves and grass to help his trees grow.

Word: Composure 
Meaning: peace of mind
Example: When Jane’s wedding dress ripped; she kept her composure and walked down the aisle with her head held high.

Word: Compound
Meaning: a property that has multiple buildings in one area
Example: The entire compound was secured by fences and security systems that served to protect all of those inside.

Word: Compound
Meaning: a thing that is composed of two or more separate parts
Example: The compound sentence was made of two different phrases.

Word: Comprehend
Meaning: to mentally grasp the meaning or reason behind something
Example: Since the text was written in a foreign language; I could not comprehend its meaning.

Word: Comprehension
Meaning: understanding; grasp of knowledge
Example: Comprehension of the passage required the student to read the text several times.

Word: Comprehensive
Meaning: comprising a wide range of things
Example: Because I want the car completely repainted; I have purchased the comprehensive auto package.

Word: Compress
Meaning: to flatten something by pressure
Example: Wearing a girdle to compress the pudge on her stomach; the vain woman was much happier with a tummy that appeared flat.

Word: Compression
Meaning: the action of squeezing something into a smaller form or space
Example: Compression occurs when you squeeze something large into something small; like a pillow.

Word: Comprise
Meaning: to be made up of 
Example: Women and children comprise seventy percent of the hospital’s patients.

Word: Comprised
Meaning: to be formed or made from
Example: Rick’s sculptures are comprised of copper and aluminum.

Word: Compromise
Meaning: an arrangement reached when two parties agree to make allowances
Example: In a monetary compromise; the debtor agreed to pay the bill in full if the lender gave him a payment plan.

Word: Comptroller
Meaning: a person in charge of supervising the quality of the accounting and financial reporting of a corporation or public body
Example: The comptroller released an audit that outlined all of the discrepancies he found in the mayor’s office’s financial records.

Word: Compulsion 
Meaning: an illogical need to perform an action
Example: Along with my obsessive compulsive disorder comes the compulsion to repeatedly check doors to ensure they are locked.

Word: Compulsive
Meaning: uncontrolled or reactive and irresistible behavior
Example: My wife is a compulsive shopper spending more than what we can afford.

Word: Compulsory
Meaning: not having an option; required
Example: Because education is not compulsory in all countries; there are many children who do not attend school.

Word: Compunction
Meaning: anxiety arising from awareness of guilt
Example: The serial killer showed no compunction when his guilty verdict was announced.

Word: Computation
Meaning: the act of mathematically calculating something
Example: Computation of the math problem was too difficult to take on without a calculator.

Word: Compute
Meaning: to calculate or work out
Example: In order to compute the correct numbers; Leanna needed a calculator.

Word: Comrade
Meaning: one who shares an experience or duty
Example: Police officers came from across the country to gather at the funeral of their comrade.

Word: Con
Meaning: to trick or mislead someone
Example: The traveling salesman made good on his promise to con every housewife in the neighborhood.

Word: Concatenation
Meaning: taking two separately located things and placing them side by side so that they become two things
Example: The student’s concatenation of the words ‘air’ and ‘plane’ formed the word airplane.

Word: Concave
Meaning: shaped in an inward manner like a bowl’s interior
Example: While a convex lens turns outward; a concave lens bends inwardly.

Word: Conceal
Meaning: to put out of sight or hide from scrutiny
Example: Danielle tried to conceal her bruises with skin-colored foundation.

Word: Concede
Meaning: to admit something is true or to admit defeat in a contest
Example: Since he was trailing behind; the politician decided to concede the election to his opponent.

Word: Conceit
Meaning: arrogant pride in oneself
Example: There was so much conceit in his voice I couldn’t help but wonder if he swooned over his own image in the mirror every morning.

Word: Conceited
Meaning: holding an overblown view of one’s assets
Example: The conceited man would not stop talking about himself.

Word: Conceivable
Meaning: capable of being conceived or imagined; possible; credible; thinkable.
Example: It is quite conceivable that in 100 years from now; the world will be an unrecognizable place; due to the rapid advancements in technology.

Word: Conceive 
Meaning: to come up with a plan or idea
Example: Our team leader is counting on us to conceive a fix for the server error before our client deadline.

Word: Conceived
Meaning: imagined; visualized
Example: The idea for the voice app was conceived while the inventor’s father was in the hospital.

Word: Concentrate
Meaning: to focus all of your attention or mental effort to the thing you are doing
Example: With his sister’s music blaring in the background; it was impossible for Dante to concentrate on his piano lesson.

Word: Concentration
Meaning: the act of focusing one’s attention on something
Example: My concentration was disturbed by the sound of a lawnmower outside my office window.

Word: Concentric
Meaning: sharing an axis or center
Example: The two circles are concentric because they share a center location.

Word: Concept 
Meaning: an idea or notion 
Example: Fortunately; the client loves our new advertising concept.

Word: Conception
Meaning: the birth of an idea or plan
Example: It was obvious from the conception of the fundraiser the event would not be profitable.

Word: Conceptual
Meaning: of; or relating to concepts or ideas; existing in the imagination
Example: A good writer uses conceptual thinking to produce his work.

Word: Conceptualize
Meaning: to come up with the idea or vision for something
Example: During the meeting; we were asked to conceptualize a marketing plan for our client.

Word: Concern
Meaning: a specific worry or distress
Example: One concern of the mother is that her child seems not to be gaining much weight.

Word: Concert
Meaning: a musical performance put on by one or more musicians/singers
Example: I lost out concert tickets; so we won’t be able to go to the musical we’ve been dying to see.

Word: Concerted
Meaning: in group agreement; working as a team
Example: A concerted effort from community residents led to the formation of an effective neighborhood watch.

Word: Concession
Meaning: an item or privilege that is given
Example: Since the developer could not give the landowner his desired concession; he was not able to buy the land for the new subdivision.

Word: Conciliate
Meaning: make calm and content; placate 
Example: Before mediating between the two parties; the judge attempted to conciliate the plaintiff to prevent unnecessary litigation.

Word: Conciliatory
Meaning: To regain (friendship or goodwill) by pleasant behavior; to reconcile
Example: The mediator made a conciliatory statement which helped the two parties find common ground.

Word: Concise
Meaning: short; not lengthy
Example: The concise exam was greatly appreciated by the exhausted students who had studied all night for the test.

Word: Conclave
Meaning: a private meeting in which the discussions are kept secret
Example: The conclave of politicians was held on a Friday; giving the attendees the weekend to mull over the sordid details of their discussions.

Word: Conclude
Meaning: to come to a decision or judgment
Example: The teacher will probably conclude I am not listening to her lecture because I have my eyes closed.

Word: Conclusion
Meaning: the end; finish; or finale of an event
Example: The conclusion of our meeting came at seven o’clock; an hour after we had started and a full thirty minutes longer than we had planned.

Word: Conclusive 
Meaning: offering a conclusion
Example: According to the detectives; there is no conclusive evidence that links the suspect to the crime.

Word: Concoct
Meaning: to make something using cleverness or ability
Example: My mother is a talented chef who can concoct a gourmet meal out of sandwich meats.

Word: Concoction
Meaning: something created from scratch
Example: I could not wait for the bartender to finish my delicious concoction.

Word: Concomitant
Meaning: happening at the same time as something else
Example: Because the contractor and decorator agreed to concomitant work schedules in the final stages of construction; the house was ready to show well ahead of time.

Word: Concord 
Meaning: a state of accord or agreement
Example: After days of deliberation; the jury finally reached concord and was able to give the judge a verdict.

Word: Concordance
Meaning: agreement; accord
Example: The newest scientific data was in concordance with the last test and also the one before that.

Word: Concourse
Meaning: a large open space inside or in front of a public building where people can gather such as a train station or airport
Example: Once travelers pass through the airport security screenings; they’re allowed to enter the concourse.

Word: Concrete
Meaning: solid; real; or tangible; something physical that can be touched
Example: While thought may not be tangible; the human brain is a very concrete thing that can be touched and felt.

Word: Concubine
Meaning: a woman who lives with a man as a mistress but has a lower status than his wife/wives
Example: Though he loved his concubine the most; the king decided long ago just to have one wife.

Word: Concupiscence
Meaning: an intense desire; often describing a sexual craving
Example: Jared shouldn't get married until he can rein in his concupiscence and control his sexual cravings.

Word: Concur
Meaning: to agree with something
Example: With no other facts on hand; I can only concur with your statement.

Word: Concurrence
Meaning: when things are happening at the same time
Example: During the sentencing; the judge ruled that the guilty party’s two sentences would run in concurrence and be served at the same time.

Word: Concurrent powers
Meaning: governing powers that are shared by both two different divisions
Example: The agencies have concurrent powers and share spending responsibilities 50/50.

Word: Concurrent
Meaning: occurring at the same point in time
Example: Since my anniversary and my mother-in-law’s birthday are both on August 12; the two events are concurrent.

Word: Concussion
Meaning: the result of a really hard hit to the head; causing a temperary loss of function
Example: Falling onto the hiker’s head; the boulder caused a concussion.

Word: Condemn 
Meaning: reprimand harshly 
Example: According to the scripture; God will condemn and punish the wicked.

Word: Condense
Meaning: to decrease size or volume
Example: John managed to condense his education and previous job skills to one page on his resume.

Word: Condescending
Meaning: showing that you are more important than others
Example: "Rick said this condescending remark at work today: ""I'm better than all of you!"""

Word: Condign
Meaning: fair; fitting; and deserved
Example: The judge’s job was to make sure that the sentence was condign for each crime.

Word: Condiment
Meaning: a sauce such as mustard or ketchup that adds flavor to food
Example: Condiment packets were handed out to every person who wanted ketchup on their hotdog.

Word: Condition
Meaning: a disorder or illness
Example: Although she tried to hide her skin condition under make-up; the girl’s eczema caused her to be picked on in class.

Word: Conditional 
Meaning: restricted by a stipulation
Example: The first sale is conditional and will be cancelled if the seller cannot produce a thousand units within a week’s time.

Word: Condolence 
Meaning: a show of sympathy or comfort
Example: I offered my neighbor my condolence when I heard of his mother’s death.

Word: Condone
Meaning: to accept and allow
Example: We will not condone disorderly conduct at church.

Word: Conducive
Meaning: to cause or produce something
Example: The declining number of available positions are conducive for the highest unemployment rate in decades.

Word: Conduct
Meaning: the way one acts or carries themselves
Example: Because we are going to be visiting a nursing home; we hope all of you students will conduct yourselves in a kind and polite manner.

Word: Conduction
Meaning: the process by which sound waves travel through another material
Example: The conduction of sound through the air is what allows us to hear all of the noise around us; since we wouldn’t hear anything if the sound didn’t travel to our ears from its source.

Word: Conductive
Meaning: associated with a material that carries heat or electricity
Example: The conductive wiring may feel warm to the touch because of the electricity it’s carrying.

Word: Conductor
Meaning: a person who is in charge of a group of performers or ticket collection on a train
Example: During the performance; pay attention to the conductor to ensure you’re playing in tune with other orchestra members.

Word: Conduit
Meaning: a means of getting something to another place or person
Example: For many slaves; the underground railroad was a conduit of freedom.

Word: Confabulate
Meaning: to chat or talk to someone in an informal way
Example: Chatty Cathy will confabulate with anyone willing to hold a conversation with her.

Word: Confederacy
Meaning: a group that has formed to participate in an activity or to work towards a common cause; term generally used in the United States to refer to the Southern states during the Civil War period 
Example: To unite against union forces; the Southern states formed a confederacy.

Word: Confer
Meaning: to discuss
Example: Since the doctors are unfamiliar with my symptoms; they will confer on a diagnosis.

Word: Conference
Meaning: a formal meeting in which people gather to talk about specific ideas or problems
Example: A conference was held last weekend to teach struggling writers how to improve their skills.

Word: Confess
Meaning: to admit that you are at fault or have committed some wrongdoing
Example: Many people go to a priest to confess the things that are wracking them with guilt; and by doing so alleviate themselves from that guilt.

Word: Confession
Meaning: an admission of something one has done that was wrong or illegal
Example: The kid’s killer confession shocked the small town who never thought him capable of such a crime.

Word: Confidant 
Meaning: a person with whom you can share your secrets
Example: Because my husband is my confidant; I feel as though I can tell him anything without the information becoming public.

Word: Confide
Meaning: to share information in secret
Example: I often confide my secrets to my best friend because I know she will not tell them to anyone.

Word: Confidence
Meaning: a belief that you can trust something or someone fully
Example: The wife’s confidence in her husband was shattered after she discovered his affair.

Word: Confidentiality
Meaning: rules regarding the keeping of something secret or private
Example: Even with confidentiality rules in place; company workers still shared private information.

Word: Confinement
Meaning: being locked inside or forcibly kept inside somewhere and not allowed to leave
Example: By consenting to confinement in an institution; the patient hoped that she would finally get the medical treatment she so desperately needed.

Word: Confines
Meaning: boundaries or limits of a space
Example: It did not take the dog long to escape the confines of the backyard.

Word: Confirm
Meaning: verify truth or accuracy
Example: Bank tellers tried to confirm the man’s deposit but showed no record of the transaction.

Word: Confirmation
Meaning: confirmation is the action of confirming something
Example: A confirmation code was sent by email verifying the online furniture purchase.

Word: Confirmed
Meaning: describing someone who is firmly established in a set of ways or practice
Example: The young man is a confirmed bachelor; having been single for almost three years now and not looking to marry anytime soon.

Word: Confiscate 
Meaning: to take for a specific reason
Example: The bar owner will confiscate your keys if you are too drunk to drive.

Word: Conflagration
Meaning: conflict or war
Example: It seems as though the conflagration in the Middle East has been going on for centuries.

Word: Conflate
Meaning: to blend two or more things into one whole
Example: Every time she gets a cold; Sandy seems to conflate it with some other illness.

Word: Conflict 
Meaning: a disagreement that may be mental; verbal; physical; or associated with scheduling or the accuracy of information
Example: As a teenager; Danielle’s greatest internal conflict is which pair of shoes to wear with which outfit.

Word: Conflicting
Meaning: contradictory; inconsistent
Example: Laughing while she cried; the woman had conflicting emotions about her daughter leaving for college.

Word: Confluence 
Meaning: a circumstance where two things merge or occur simultaneously
Example: The confluence of warm and cold temperatures is going to create a powerful storm.

Word: Conform
Meaning: to fit in with standard practices or behaviors
Example: Because of Janet’s low self-esteem; she tried to conform alongside the cool kids by imitating their fashion styles.

Word: Conformist
Meaning: an individual who follows accepted practices
Example: As someone who refuses to be a conformist; I go out of my way to take the path less frequently chosen.

Word: Conformity 
Meaning: the condition of being like everything or everyone else
Example: Jared did not fit in well in the private school because he rebelled against the conformity of having to dress like everyone else.

Word: Confound
Meaning: to mix up or confuse
Example: If the nurse does not read the labels; she will confound the medications and possibly harm patients.

Word: Confounded 
Meaning: mystified; perplexed
Example: The detectives were confounded by the puzzling riddles left behind by the kidnapper.

Word: Confrere
Meaning: a fellow profession or fraternity member
Example: The student quarreled with his confrere about who would be president of the fraternity.

Word: Confront
Meaning: to face or stand up to
Example: After arriving home to a broken window; the woman decided to confront the babysitter about what happened.

Word: Confrontation
Meaning: the act of confronting or challenging another especially face to face
Example: She had a heated confrontation with her parents over homework.

Word: Confucianism
Meaning: an ancient philosophy of respect and kindness based on the teachings of Confucius
Example: Confucianism promotes the idea that people should be both virtuous and honest.

Word: Confuse
Meaning: to mix up; to puzzle; to bewilder
Example: I always confuse my neighbor’s twin girls as they look and dress alike.

Word: Confusion
Meaning: the state of uncertainty and not understanding what is going on
Example: As a way to avoid confusion while traveling; Johnny made sure to write down clear directions.

Word: Confute
Meaning: to prove something wrong
Example: Certain that she could find evidence; the young lawyer set out to confute the witness’s story against her client.

Word: Congeal
Meaning: to change from a liquid to solid state
Example: They refrigerated the liquid gelatin so it would congeal before they ate it.

Word: Congenial
Meaning: pleasant and enjoyable
Example: Mark is a congenial host who always makes everyone feel welcome.

Word: Congenital
Meaning: existing since birth
Example: Due to a congenital heart condition that ran in their family; the parents were worried about their unborn child.

Word: Congeries
Meaning: a jumbled collection of things
Example: The woman’s spare room was littered with a congeries of boxes and bags.

Word: Congested
Meaning: crowded and blocked
Example: Moving through the congested city; the cars honked their horns loudly as pedestrians darted across the roadway.

Word: Congestion
Meaning: accumulation; buildup
Example: My doctor gave me antibiotics after my nasal congestion turn into a sinus infection.

Word: Conglomerate
Meaning: a big corporation composed of several small firms that operate as a single business
Example: The billionaire’s conglomerate includes restaurants; convenience stores; and a chain of hotels.

Word: Congregate
Meaning: to gather as a unit or group
Example: During the summer teenagers often congregate at the beach.

Word: Congregation 
Meaning: a group of people who worship together in a certain place
Example: The congregation was shocked when its pastor was arrested for selling drugs.

Word: Congressional
Meaning: relating to congress
Example: A congressional convention was held to discuss federal policies.

Word: Congruent 
Meaning: matching in type or makeup
Example: Eating five chocolate bars is not congruent with your plan for losing weight.

Word: Congruity
Meaning: harmony or agreement
Example: Having worked together for years; the congruity of the team made them a shoe-in for the state competition.

Word: Congruous
Meaning: in agreement
Example: Expecting her mother to be congruous with her plans to move out; the young woman was shocked when she disapproved

Word: Coniferous
Meaning: a tree or bush bearing cones and green leaves that do not fall in the winter
Example: Even though the tree was classified as coniferous; it had a peculiar color that was far from evergreen.

Word: Conjectural
Meaning: based on thoughts and ideas not backed by evidence; hypothetical
Example: The prosecutor knew the jury would have doubts about his conjectural theory of the crime.

Word: Conjecture
Meaning: an opinion or idea formed without proof or sufficient evidence
Example: The jury rejected the attorney’s conjecture about the defendant’s motive because of a lack of evidence.

Word: Conjoin
Meaning: unite; combine
Example: With only one set of handcuffs; the officer had to conjoin the two suspects.

Word: Conjointly
Meaning: together
Example: As the octopus began seize its prey; all eight tentacles worked conjointly to finish the job.

Word: Conjugal
Meaning: of or relating to marriage; or the relationship of spouses
Example: The inmate received weekly conjugal visits from his wife.

Word: Conjugate
Meaning: to combine or fuse two things together; typically referring to words such as ‘can’t.’
Example: In the English language; we conjugate many different words for convenience; such as ‘won’t’ for ‘will not.’

Word: Conjugation
Meaning: the process of changing a verb’s form to show person; tense; number; etc
Example: In this form of conjugation; the word ‘help’ changes to ‘helped’ to show the past tense.

Word: Conjunction
Meaning: the act of joining two or more occasions together
Example: In April a city in Georgia will sponsor a city clean- up to embrace a more environmentally-conscious perspective called Living Green in conjunction with Earth Day.

Word: Conjuncture
Meaning: a combination of events that create a crisis
Example: A conjuncture of highly unlikely weather events leads to a devastating spring snowstorm.

Word: Conjuration
Meaning: a magic spell
Example: The witch’s conjuration led to many demons being released on Halloween.

Word: Conjure
Meaning: to bring into existence; sometimes by magic
Example: The magician was able to conjure a rabbit out of his empty top hat.

Word: Conjured
Meaning: summoned unexpectedly as if by magic 
Example: The woman conjured the evil spirits to get revenge upon the men who killed her daughter.

Word: Conjurer
Meaning: a person who practices magic
Example: The conjurer was able to turn the man into a monkey with a wave of her wand.

Word: Connate
Meaning: inherit beliefs or ideas existing in a person since birth
Example: The boy had a connate love for music since he was born.

Word: Connection
Meaning: one that links things together
Example: A connection from the computer to the wall allowed the secretary to access the internet.

Word: Conniption
Meaning: a fit; fuss; or tantrum
Example: My father had a conniption when he realized that I had not made all A’s for this semester of school.

Word: Connivance
Meaning: the act of allowing an illegal action to take place
Example: The clerk’s connivance allowed her to watch idly by as her supervisor stole thousands of dollars from the bank.

Word: Connive
Meaning: to conspire or plan
Example: The billionaire did not believe his greedy children would connive to murder him.

Word: Conniving
Meaning: discreetly working to complete a dishonest task
Example: Alan’s wife is a conniving woman who only married him for his money.

Word: Connoisseur
Meaning: an expert on a particular subject
Example: Because the psychologist talks to many individuals; she considers herself to be a connoisseur of people and their relationships.

Word: Connotation
Meaning: suggested or implied meaning
Example: Even though skinny technically means the same thing as slender; it has a connotation that is less favorable.

Word: Connote
Meaning: to imply something in addition to what is apparent 
Example: To an atheist; the image of a cross does not connote anything other than a perpendicular design.

Word: Connotes 
Meaning: conveying more than a literal meaning
Example: To me; the word “spouse” connotes the image of a loving partner.

Word: Connubial 
Meaning: marriage-related
Example: Watching his new bride pace back and forth in irritation; the husband hoped that their connubial argument would end soon.

Word: Conquer
Meaning: to overcome and take control of something
Example: Members of the group decided to rebel after seeing that no one was listening to their ideas.

Word: Conqueror

Example: Alexander the Great was a conqueror who dominated Greece; Egypt; and Persia.

Word: Conquest
Meaning: victory gained through combat
Example: The diner’s conquest was to eat the entire 64 ounce steak in one sitting.

Word: Conquistador 
Meaning: an individual who overpowers others
Example: Jack is going to the historical costume party as the conquistador who conquered the island in the 17th century.

Word: Consanguinity
Meaning: a familial relationship or close connection
Example: The results of the blood test showed there was no consanguinity between Ed and the man he had always referred to as his papa.

Word: Conscience 
Meaning: the feeling that lets you know if you have done something wrong
Example: The serial killer’s lack of a conscience made it very easy for him to kill people.

Word: Conscientious
Meaning: working hard and careful to do things well
Example: Carrie is a conscientious worker who completes every task.

Meaning: aware
Example: I became conscious of the crisis when the photographs of the terrorist attack were displayed on the news.

Word: Consciousness
Meaning: cognition; awareness of the mind of its own existence in the world

Word: Conscription
Meaning: the system of forcing individuals to serve in the military

Word: Consecrate
Meaning: to announce something is sacred or devoted to a specific purpose

Word: Consensus
Meaning: general agreement about something

Word: Consent
Meaning: permission for something to happen
Example: Fraud charges were filed after the woman used a friend’s credit card without her consent.

Word: Consequence
Meaning: something that occurs as a result of an action
Example: My daughter’s consequence for breaking curfew was a loss of her mobile phone privileges for two weeks.

Word: Consequent
Meaning: happening as a result of something
Example: Because it was last minute; our reservations were consequent on restaurant availability.

Word: Consequential
Meaning: significant; important
Example: The partial footprint was consequential in solving the case.

Word: Consequently
Meaning: occurring as a result of an action
Example: At the hotel; we take safety very seriously; and consequently; we have security officers on duty twenty-four hours a day.

Meaning: the smart consumption of organic resources
Example: Since we only have so much water on this planet; it is important we devise conservation methods now.

Word: Conservatory
Meaning: a school that focuses on music and other arts

Word: Considerable

Word: Considerate

Example: The considerate man held his umbrella over the elderly woman’s head.

Word: Consideration
Meaning: careful thought or deliberation
Example: You must take the price into consideration before buying a car from the dealership.

Word: Consign

Word: Consignment

Example: We purchased a vintage sofa on consignment.

Word: Consist

Example: After jaw surgery; the consistency of the patient’s food could not be solid.

Word: Consistent

Example: He was consistent; always arriving at the diner at exactly 9:15 every morning.

Word: Consolation
Meaning: comfort or reward given to someone who has lost something or someone

Word: Consolidate
Meaning: to put together

Word: Consort

Word: Consortium

Word: Conspicuous

Word: Conspiracy

Word: Conspire

Word: Constant

Word: Constitute

Word: Consume

Word: Contiguous

Word: Continual

Word: Contorted

Word: Contradictory

Word: Contradistinction

Word: Contrarian

Word: Contrarily

Word: Contrary

Word: Contrary

Example: Contrary to my political rival’s statement; the data reveals crime has not increased in this country.

Word: Contrast
Meaning: to differ greatly 
Example: Even though Kurt is going to love his new job; his salary will contrast negatively with the large income associated with his former position.

Word: Contrastingly
Meaning: at odds with something or the polar opposite of it

Word: Contravene
Meaning: to act against a rule or law
Example: Because your actions contravene school policy; you're being suspended for ten days.

Word: Contretemps

Word: Contribute

Word: Contrite

Word: Contrition

Word: Contrivance

Word: Contrived
Meaning: unnatural or fabricated 
Example: Jim made the contrived confession after the police threatened him.

Word: Control group
Meaning: the group of people in a study or experimentation that do not take the treatment or action

Word: Controversial

Word: Contumacious

Word: Conundrum

Word: Convalescence

Word: Convenience

Example: The elevator is a pleasant convenience that helps me avoid stairs.

Word: Convenient
Meaning: to make something simpler for ease or relief

Word: Conveniently

Word: Convent

Word: Convention

Example: A convention was called so that the delegates could vote on the laws.

Word: Conventional

Example: In many cultures; a handshake is a conventional greeting exchanged between people meeting for the first time.

Word: Converge

Word: Convergence

Word: Conversant

Word: Conversational

Example: The blog article had a conversational tone that made it easy to read and understand.

Word: Converse

Word: Conversely
Meaning: on the other side or hand
Example: The trip wasn’t all good; and conversely; it wasn’t all bad.

Word: Convert
Meaning: to change in form

Word: Convex

Word: Convey

Word: Conveyance

Word: Convict
Meaning: to find someone guilty of a crime
Example: The jury will probably convict the man of murder since he was found with the victim’s blood on his hands.

Word: Conviction
Meaning: a firmly held belief or opinion
Example: He had such a lack of conviction of his suitability for the job that he skipped the interview entirely.

Word: Convince

Example: Even though his drinking was a problem; no one could convince the alcoholic to get help.

Word: Convivial
Meaning: friendly and making you feel welcome
Example: Carl was a convivial party host who made everyone feel at home.

Word: Convocation
Meaning: a sizable gathering of people 
Example: The convocation of Baptist ministers is so large it’s being held in the city’s largest auditorium.

Word: Convoke
Meaning: to call together or summon a meeting
Example: The chairman decided to convoke a meeting to discuss the company’s budget issue.

Word: Convoluted
Meaning: extremely complex and difficult to follow

Word: Convoy
Meaning: a group of vehicles that move as a unit for safety reasons

Word: Convulse
Meaning: to shake violently
Example: During the seizure; the man’s muscles tightened; and his body began to convulse back and forth.

Word: Convulsion
Meaning: a sudden and uncontrollable movement of the body

Word: Coolly
Meaning: done calmly and in a way that does not show excitement

Word: Cooperation

Example: It took the cooperation of the entire team to meet the fundraising goal.

Word: Cooperative
Meaning: ready to work with another person or in a team
Example: The first team was very responsive and cooperative in updating data.

Word: Coordinate
Meaning: each of a group of numbers that can be used to find the location of something
Example: Because one coordinate is wrong; the address won’t help us find it to our location.

Word: Coordination
Meaning: a procedure or system of arranging people or things so that they function successfully
Example: Due to my coordination of the project at work with my department; my boss gave me a raise since the project was done in a timely and efficient manner.

Word: Cop-out
Meaning: an instance of avoiding commitment or responsibility; generally with an excuse
Example: Even though taking out the trash is supposed to be my little brother’s job; he managed to cop-out of it by pretending that the dog needed to be walked.

Word: Copacetic 
Meaning: going well; satisfactory
Example: Despite the poor economy; business at our restaurant has been copacetic enough to allow us to earn a small profit.

Word: Cope
Meaning: how well or effectively a person can deal with a difficult or tragic situation
Example: The farmers were unable to cope with the harsh dry weather and many of their crops died.

Word: Copious
Meaning: large in number or quantity
Example: To avoid having a hangover; do not drink a copious amount of alcohol.

Word: Copra
Meaning: dried coconut kernels or meat that produces coconut oil
Example: Because coconut oil is found inside the copra; the meat of the coconut isn’t discarded after use.

Word: Copse
Meaning: a group of small trees or shrubs
Example: Six oak trees made up a little copse to the right of the farmer’s house.

Word: Copy
Meaning: the result of copying; an identical duplicate of an original 
Example: My doctor was able to give me a copy of my test results.

Word: Copycat
Meaning: one who copies the ideas or behavior of someone else
Example: He called me a copycat for wearing the same shirt as him.

Word: Copyright
Meaning: exclusive legal ownership that is given to someone for something they create
Example: If you write a book; you will have it under copyright; and no one can reproduce it without your permission.

Word: Coquetry
Meaning: behavior that is flirty in nature
Example: It was hard for Rick to ignore his wife’s shameless coquetry with other men.

Word: Coquette
Meaning: a flirty lady with the male population to seek their appreciation
Example: When the young man saw the coquette playfully teasing other men at the party; he was heartbroken.

Word: Coquettish
Meaning: playful in a flirtatious manner
Example: My sister is a coquettish woman who enjoys flirting with men.

Word: Cord
Meaning: unit of measurement for firewood 
Example: Dominick entered the kitchen with a heavy cord of wood; his thick arms bulging under the load.

Word: Cordial
Meaning: warm and sincere
Example: The bellman’s cordial greeting made me instantly fall in love with the hotel.

Word: Cordillera
Meaning: a series of mountain ranges that run parallel and serve as the main mountain range of a continent
Example: In North America; the Rocky Mountains and the Sierra Nevada range make up a cordillera that stretches through the west.

Word: Cordon
Meaning: to create a barrier around or from something
Example: Since children could get injured on playgrounds; it is essential to cordon off a playground so they don’t have access to it through the fence.

Word: Corduroy
Meaning: heavy fabric with vertical ribs
Example: I like rubbing my fingers across the ribs of my corduroy pants.

Word: Core
Meaning: a center and usually main part of something compared to its surroundings
Example: Once the teacher was able to get to the core of the problem; the other information regarding the problem was really irrelevant.

Word: Cornerstone
Meaning: a key part of something
Example: Keith’s belief in Christ is the cornerstone of all his successful relationships.

Word: Cornucopia
Meaning: a large amount of something
Example: The gigantic farmer’s market has a cornucopia of fresh foods.

Word: Corollary
Meaning: a natural consequence; or a result that naturally follows
Example: While the expected corollary of staying up all night was to ace the final exam; Cynthia found that she actually fell asleep halfway through and didn’t finish.

Word: Coroner
Meaning: an official who investigates violent; sudden; or suspicious deaths
Example: The coroner examined the body for foul play.

Word: Corporal 
Meaning: relating to the physical or human form
Example: The board of education does not support corporal punishment because of the physical harm that can be inflicted upon students.

Word: Corporation
Meaning: a large business that under the law has the rights and duties of an individual
Example: Corporation tax cuts meant that the business could save money on levies and put it back into the company.

Word: Corporeal
Meaning: tangible; of a physical nature
Example: As Jack reached for the ghost; he realized it was not corporeal when his hands went straight through the shape.

Word: Corps
Meaning: a band of people operating together
Example: As the corps of volunteers worked on the house; they were able to provide a poor family with the opportunity to own their own home.

Word: Corpse
Meaning: a dead body
Example: Police found the corpse of the missing woman outside of her friend’s apartment building.

Word: Corpulent
Meaning: having a large bulky body
Example: After overeating for months; the skinny girl became somewhat corpulent.

Word: Corpus
Meaning: a large collection of writing
Example: The corpus contained many different articles written by the author shortly before his death.

Word: Corral
Meaning: a small fenced-in area for animals; usually farm animals
Example: Trainers will typically take their horses inside the corral so that they can teach them certain talents without worrying about the horses escaping.

Word: Correct
Meaning: free from error; true; the state of having an affirmed truth 
Example: You are correct that a sedentary lifestyle is generally bad for your health.

Word: Correlate
Meaning: having a shared connection in which one factor influences another 
Example: Studies show intelligence is unique to each person and does not correlate to a specific race or gender.

Word: Correlation 
Meaning: a relationship between two items that are connected in some way
Example: Since the detective could not find any correlation between the suspect and the victim; he had to release the accused man.

Word: Correlative
Meaning: mutually related
Example: The child's right to education is a correlative of the parent's duty to send the child to school.

Word: Correspond 
Meaning: to have an obvious link to something
Example: The colors on the legend correspond to the similarly colored areas on the map.

Meaning: messages exchanged between people
Example: In times of war; my mother often sends correspondence to active duty servicemen.

Example: A correspondent for Reuters news agency says he saw a number of demonstrators being beaten.

Meaning: a hallway that leads into rooms or other divided areas

Word: Corrigible 
Meaning: able to be fixed or corrected
Example: The judge believed there was hope for the corrigible criminal.

Word: Corroborate
Meaning: to strengthen or support with other evidence; make more certain
Example: I prayed my friend would corroborate the lie I told my parents!

Word: Corrosive 
Meaning: having the ability to wear down or destroy

Meaning: to retaliate or react to a typically hostile action
Example: The politician had to counter the accusations being made against him; but he did not have a suitable defense to do so.

Word: Counteract
Meaning: act against or in opposition to something
Example: To counteract the violence in the community; the police increased the number of footmen on patrol.

Word: Counterbalance
Meaning: to oppose or balance something with another thing of equal weight or force
Example: A pulley system was used by the movers to counterbalance the weight of the furniture during delivery.

Word: Counterclaim
Meaning: a claim or suit filed in response to a claim made against a group or individual
Example: Filing a counterclaim will allow us to replace the funds we spent defending ourselves in this silly lawsuit.

Word: Counterexample
Meaning: an example that contradicts a theory or opinion
Example: The math teacher provided a counterexample to prove to the student that her solution was incorrect.

Word: Counterfeit
Meaning: a fake version of an original item
Example: The man was arrested for making counterfeit money.

Word: Counterintuitive
Meaning: the opposite of what makes sense
Example: While this idea may sound counterintuitive to what you are trying to do; it really can help increase your sales.

Word: Countermand
Meaning: to change or retract a command
Example: Since the bank robbers have hostages; the police chief decided to countermand the order to storm the building.

Word: Counterproductive
Meaning: resulting in the opposite of the looked-for effect
Example: The measures are counterproductive and have only increased crime in our community.

Word: Countervail
Meaning: to counter something with equal force to offset its effect
Example: To countervail the customers’ concerns about poor service; the company sent out a letter offering to make things right.

Meaning: too many to be counted

Meaning: a wreath or band for the head; especially one given as reward of victory or mark of honor
Example: The previous winner of Miss America will hand off her crown to the next winner.

Word: Crucial 
Meaning: of vital importance
Example: Eating right is a crucial part of controlling diabetes.

Word: Crucially
Meaning: with extreme importance
Example: The amount of funds allocated depends crucially on how many foster children are being serviced.

Word: Crucible
Meaning: a tough trial or test
Example: After the hazing crucible; Matt became a full member of the fraternity.

Word: Crucifixion
Meaning: an execution by being nailed or tied to an upright cross and left to hang there until dead
Example: The most famous crucifixion in Christianity included Jesus on a cross with a criminal on either side of him.

Meaning: rudimentary; undefined or undeveloped
Example: I was not proud of my science project which was a crude representation of a planet.

Word: Cruel
Meaning: inflicting pain and suffering
Example: Cruel winter weather plagued the struggling city for months.

Word: Cruelty
Meaning: behavior that inflicts pain and suffering
Example: Severe cruelty was demonstrated through the treatment of slaves.

Word: Cruise
Meaning: to travel smoothly at a continuous speed
Example: Since we were on the highway; my mom decided to let the car cruise at a comfortable seventy miles an hour.

Word: Crumble
Meaning: to cause something to fall apart and break into many small pieces
Example: When his mother died; the man felt as if his world would crumble under his feet.

Word: Crumbly
Meaning: fragile; easily breakable

Word: Crush

Word: Crust
Meaning: the hardened; outer layer of an object

Word: Crustacean
Meaning: a large group of mostly water animals (as crabs; lobsters; and shrimps)

Example: The crux of the debate is each candidate’s position on the budget issue.

Word: Cry

Word: Debatable

Word: Debilitate
Meaning: to weaken

Word: Debility

Word: Debunk

Word: Debut
Meaning: the first public showing or appearance
Example: The piano prodigy made his musical debut when he was only three years old.

Word: Debutante
Meaning: a young upper-class woman who makes her first formal appearance in society
Example: The debutante teenager spent an enormous amount of money on a dress that she planned to wear only at her first appearance.

Word: Decade
Meaning: a span of ten years
Example: Robert taught at a University in Colorado for a decade before leaving to teach elsewhere.

Word: Decadence
Meaning: state of moral or artistic decline or deterioration
Example: The gold trimmings in the celebrity’s bathroom are nothing but sheer decadence.

Word: Decant
Meaning: to move one fluid or liquid from one container to another
Example: After asking the waiter for him to refill my glass; he took the large pitcher of iced tea to decant it from his pitcher into my glass.

Word: Decathlon
Meaning: an athletic contest consisting of ten events
Example: I practice sprinting; running and jumping so that I can compete in the decathlon.

Word: Decay
Meaning: to rot or break down
Example: Frank loves to impress everyone with his knowledge of the rise and decay of the Roman Empire.

Word: Deceased
Meaning: no longer alive
Example: Pretending to be deceased; Anthony laid silently in a pool of blood not daring to make a sound.

Word: Deceitful

Word: Deceive

Example: The married man tried to deceive the women at the bar by taking off his wedding band.

Meaning: to slow down or reduce the speed of something
Example: As the speedometer reached 100 miles per hour; the frightened passenger begged the driver to decelerate.

Example: My neighbor has no sense of decency and often walks around naked in his backyard.

Example: The deceptive woman led me to believe that she was divorced when in fact she was married with children.

Word: Decibel
Meaning: a common measure of sound intensity

Word: Derive

Word: Desert

Word: Desertification

Word: Deserve

Word: Deserve
Meaning: to have earned something because of actions or qualities
Example: The criminal might deserve to go to jail; but the judge had mercy on him.

Word: Desiccated
Meaning: dried out; lifeless
Example: The professional soccer player became desiccated after being in a car accident that left him in a coma.

Word: Desideratum
Meaning: a wished-for or desired thing
Example: A desideratum when car shopping is price.

Example: We will hire an architect to design our new kitchen to include more cabinet space and a larger pantry.

Meaning: wanting something very much
Example: After years of vocal lessons; Crystal was desirous to be a famous singer.

Meaning: 
Example: Helpless and alone; the prisoner of war fell victim to a deep despair.

Word: Dissimulation
