Word: Dissipate
Meaning: to drive away
Example: According to meteorologists; the storm will dissipate after a few hours and make way for the sunshine.

Word: Dissociate
Meaning: to distance or detach someone or something from a group
Example: When Beverly’s friends started to get into trouble with drugs and alcohol; she decided to dissociate from them and find nicer friends.

Word: Dissolute
Meaning: given to immoral behavior 
Example: My cousin is a dissolute woman who likes to irritate her religious parents by performing immoral deeds.

Word: Dissolve
Meaning: to liquefy; melt into a fluid
Example: Sugar will dissolve quickly in a hot cup of coffee.

Word: Dissonance
Meaning: a lack of agreement; generally between what one believes and how one acts
Example: His cruel abuse showed a dissonance with his loving words.

Word: Dissuade
Meaning: to convince an individual to not try or complete something
Example: Jealous people will always try to dissuade you from trying to be successful.

Word: Distal
Meaning: something that is distant from something else
Example: The paramedics were concerned with their patient’s distal pulse because there was a lot of time between beats.

Word: Distance
Meaning: an amount of physical space between two things
Example: The distance between Earth and the Moon is considerable for us to consider; even though it is almost nothing compared to the true vastness of space.

Word: Distant
Meaning: far enough away to be out of immediate reach
Example: I wanted to change the channel; but the remote was just distant enough that I would have to get up to grab it; and I didn’t want to move.

Word: Distant
Meaning: far away from each other physically or in time
Example: The most distant celestial body from the Sun in our solar system is Pluto; a dwarf planet at the farthest reaches of our immediate space.

Word: Distaste
Meaning: dislike or mild disdain for something
Example: I have a mild distaste for anything bitter; but I would certainly eat those foods if I were hungry enough.

Word: Distasteful
Meaning: unpleasant or offensive; causing dislike
Example: Donning a distasteful outfit; the protester’s offensive garb made many people upset.

Word: Distemper
Meaning: an infectious viral disease found in animals; especially dogs
Example: The puppy was vaccinated for distemper and several other viral respiratory diseases.

Word: Distend
Meaning: to become larger from internal pressure
Example: The hernia caused his stomach to distend from organ misplacement.

Word: Distill
Meaning: to extract out the essential meaning or most important pieces of something
Example: Though he didn’t know some of the words; the reader was able to distill most of what the author was saying.

Word: Distinct 
Meaning: different in an obvious way
Example: Everyone’s DNA is distinct and unique.

Word: Distinction
Meaning: a clear difference or contrast between similar people or things
Example: Although they are identical twins; there is a noticeable distinction between the colors of their hair.

Word: Distinctive
Meaning: specifying as unique; special or characteristic
Example: The only distinctive quality of this job candidate was his ability to speak to clients calmly because his clerical skills were a mess.

Word: Distinctness
Meaning: being easily distinguishable from other things due to particular attributes
Example: People have distinctness about them; possessing traits in both appearance and personality that set them apart from one another.

Word: Distinguish 
Meaning: to recognize something or someone as being unique
Example: A police detective often finds himself in the position of having to distinguish between a lie and a truth.

Word: Distinguishable
Meaning: being able to clearly see or hear something from within a whole and recognize it as different
Example: The fuzzy words on the page were only distinguishable after Mike put on his glasses.

Word: Distinguished
Meaning: describing something that is noteworthy or otherwise significant for some reason
Example: The General is a distinguished officer; having performed admirably in two wars and being directly responsible for victory in three major battles.

Word: Distort
Meaning: to bring something out of shape or to misrepresent
Example: My friend had an app on her phone that would distort our faces in amusing ways.

Word: Distortion
Meaning: an irregularity or abnormality in the shape or perception of something
Example: After getting hit by a flashbang; the victim suffers severe distortion in their ability to both hear and see.

Word: Distract
Meaning: to misdirect attention from one focus to another usually as an act of deception
Example: During the Trojan War; a great wooden horse was sent to distract the soldiers and allow the enemy Greeks to enter Troy and win the war.

Word: Distraught
Meaning: so upset that one cannot behave normally
Example: When my father died; I was so distraught I dropped out of school.

Word: Distress
Meaning: physical or mental anguish
Example: The anxiety attack left me in a bit of distress.

Word: Distribute
Meaning: to divide into portions and dispense
Example: Churches often distribute pamphlets to invite people to attend their Sunday service.

Word: Distribution
Meaning: the provision of goods and materials to multiple recipients
Example: Multiple people won the contest held by the state; but they would have to wait for the prize distribution to take place a month later.

Word: Distributive
Meaning: related to the act of giving or spreading out
Example: The distributive center is in charge of getting all of the products made at the factory out and into the stores.

Word: District
Meaning: an area of a country or a city
Example: Moving to a new district; it was difficult for the student to adjust to his new school.

Word: Distrust
Meaning: doubt in the ability to trust someone or something
Example: I have always had a strong distrust for politicians; as they never seem to follow through on the promises they make to the public.

Word: Disturb
Meaning: to bother or concern someone
Example: The sight of all the violence that was taking place during the riots served to disturb my mother; who was always a bit on the naïve side.

Word: Ditch
Meaning: to get rid of something
Example: Michael was willing to ditch his baseball cap and jeans for a wedding day suit.

Word: Dither
Meaning: to hesitate or be indecisive
Example: Terry tends to dither when someone asks him where to have lunch; as he is never able to decide on a restaurant.

Word: Ditto
Meaning: that which was stated before; the aforesaid; the above; the same; likewise
Example: When I took notes for class; I used ditto marks to show repetition.

Word: Ditto
Meaning: a word or mark used to agree with something said or to avoid repeating something
Example: “Ditto;” said Alex when agreeing with his friend that strawberry pie is the best kind.

Word: Diurnal
Meaning: energetic during the daylight hours
Example: Because bats are not active during the day; they are not diurnal creatures.

Word: Diverge
Meaning: to separate into different directions
Example: The interstate began to diverge into two exit ramps.

Word: Divergence
Meaning: the process or state of separating
Example: The married couple is currently in a state of divergence; going through the divorce process so they can legally separate.

Word: Divergent
Meaning: different from each other or growing further apart
Example: There were also divergent attitudes towards industrialization in China and Japan.

Word: Diverse
Meaning: composed of different people or features
Example: The restaurant has a diverse menu that includes entrees from all over the world.

Word: Diversify
Meaning: to make something less uniform by adding different things to it
Example: Many producers attempt to diversify their films by casting actors of many different nationalities in them.

Word: Diversion
Meaning: a distraction or turning from another activity
Example: Soldiers often use a diversion tactic; like a small attack away from their target; to sneak up on the enemy.

Word: Diversity
Meaning: an assortment of different types
Example: As a teacher; Bridgett has to deal with a large amount of diversity in her inner city classroom.

Word: Divert
Meaning: to shift from one thing or another or to distract someone
Example: I decided to divert the conversation away from the topic of politics.

Word: Divest
Meaning: to deprive of or strip away
Example: Divest yourself from the company of evil men or you will learn to mimic their ways.

Word: Divide
Meaning: to split or separate something into two or more parts or groups
Example: I am in love with books and have to divide my day into house chores; time to write and time to read.

Word: Dowdy
Meaning: unstylish; especially in reference to apparel
Example: The clothes I was wearing were apparently too dowdy for the popular kids to acknowledge them; but I really didn’t care for their sense of style.

Word: Downcast
Meaning: feeling sad; depressed; or despondent
Example: My daughter was extremely downcast when she couldn’t get ice cream; but I promised her we would go to the park later.

Word: Downfall
Meaning: a loss of power or prestige
Example: The downfall of the Soviet Union was likely due to the unhappiness that they brewed in the hearts of their own people.

Word: Downgrade
Meaning: to reduce in rank or importance
Example: After many years alone; the aging single was forced to downgrade her expectations.

Word: Downgrading
Meaning: reducing something to a lower rank; level; or grade
Example: Since he no longer needs the program for school; the student is thinking of downgrading his account to the free version.

Word: Downhill
Meaning: toward the bottom of something
Example: The ball rolled downhill from the top of the slope to the bottom of the mound.

Word: Downpour
Meaning: sudden; heavy rainfall
Example: Because her windshield wipers were broken; Beth had to pull over until the downpour stopped.

Word: Downright
Meaning: complete or total
Example: There has been so much downright terrible things happening in the world lately that some people are afraid to even leave their homes.

Word: Downsize
Meaning: to make something smaller or lessen
Example: When we downsize into a smaller house this fall; we will have to get rid of a lot of our extra furniture.

Word: Downtrodden
Meaning: oppressed; exploited.
Example: Hanging his head low; the downtrodden slave felt as if his life was without meaning.

Word: Downturn
Meaning: a decline in business or the economy
Example: A downturn in the real estate market made it really difficult for realtors to sell houses.

Word: Dowry
Meaning: property or payment given at time of marriage
Example: Part of her dowry included land that her father would give her husband.

Word: Doxology
Meaning: a Christian hymn or verse
Example: The doxology at the end of the Catholic prayer was chanted by the patrons.

Word: Doyen
Meaning: a man who serves as an expert as the senior member of a group
Example: The doyen of the group joined the Boy Scouts of America before any of the other members.

Word: Doze
Meaning: to nap lightly
Example: The wife always joked that her deep-sleeping husband could doze in the middle of a hurricane.

Word: Dozen
Meaning: a quantity of twelve
Example: A dozen donuts were served to the twelve breakfast guests.

Word: Drab
Meaning: dull; lacking brightness or enthusiasm
Example: Somber and drab; the gloomy hospital room made the depressed patient even sadder.

Word: Draconian
Meaning: harsh and cruel
Example: Giving someone a life sentence for stealing a loaf of bread is a draconian consequence.

Word: Draft
Meaning: a first version of something written or drawn
Example: Before I submit my final article; I need to edit my draft.

Word: Drag
Meaning: to pull someone or something often roughly and through or across an area
Example: The soccer players drag the heavy duffle bags into the locker room.

Word: Dragnet
Meaning: a police set-up put in place to catch a criminal
Example: Concealing his badge; the officer prepared the dragnet for the citywide drug sting.

Word: Dragoon
Meaning: a British soldier mounted on horseback
Example: Training of the British dragoon included lessons in horse-riding as well as fighting while mounted.

Word: Drastic
Meaning: extreme or severe
Example: She was so brokenhearted after the breakup that she considered taking drastic measures to win him back.

Word: Drat
Meaning: an expression used when one wants to express irritation or annoyance
Example: “Oh; drat!” Harriet exclaimed when she realized she had left her wallet at home.

Word: Draught
Meaning: a current of air
Example: Since Billy didn’t shut the glass door completely; his mom could feel a small draught.

Word: Drawback
Meaning: a disadvantage or downside
Example: The cruise to the Bahamas offered many perks; but the overall price was still a drawback.

Word: Drawl
Meaning: a type of accent branded by slow and drawn out speaking that is usually related to the southern United States
Example: The old banjo player’s songs seemed to go on and on as he picked and sang along in a Southern drawl.

Word: Drawn
Meaning: showing wear from being overworked or not cared for
Example: The student’s once healthy face looked drawn after several late-night study sessions.

Word: Dread
Meaning: a feeling of intense fear and anxiety
Example: The extremely shy speaker was filled with dread as she stepped in front of the microphone.

Word: Dreadful
Meaning: extremely terrible or awful
Example: The dreadful heat beat down on the farmhands; making their day’s work even more grueling.

Word: Dreamt
Meaning: imagined or fantasized about something or someone
Example: The love-sick man dreamt about the day he would finally marry his true love.

Word: Dreary
Meaning: cheerless; bleak; and dull
Example: The rainy weather was putting me in a dreary mood.

Word: Dreck
Meaning: flimsy or cheaply made
Example: Bargain hunters are always looking for products that are low in price but not dreck or of low quality.

Word: Dredge
Meaning: a huge; power shovel used to remove dirt and other debris from a channel or riverbed
Example: The workers used the dredge to remove sediment from the shallow sea.

Word: Dregs
Meaning: the least wanted parts or persons
Example: People who think homeless people are the dregs of society do not realize they could be down-and-out too.

Word: Drench
Meaning: to cover abundantly
Example: Everyone gasped as my little sister used ketchup to drench every piece of food on her plate.

Word: Drift off
Meaning: to fall asleep slowly
Example: I had just started to drift off to sleep when I heard the doorbell.

Word: Dungeon
Meaning: an underground prison; usually of a castle
Example: The king’s dank and chilly dungeon kept the most notorious offenders in the city.

Word: Dunnage
Meaning: a person's belongings; especially those brought on board ship
Example: Loading the dunnage on the ship was a tough job since the passenger had packed for a three month stay.

Word: Duo
Meaning: a pair or couple; usually associated with one another
Example: Minnie and Mickey Mouse are the most famous duo in Disney history.

Word: Dupe
Meaning: to deliberately mislead someone or the person who is easily used or tricked
Example: My brother is a schemer who is always trying to dupe people out of their money.

Word: Duplex
Meaning: a house divided into two separate apartments
Example: Both sides of the duplex are currently being rented.

Word: Duplicate
Meaning: an exact copy of an original
Example: The man’s duplicate license replaced the original that he lost.

Word: Duplicity
Meaning: dishonest behavior that is intended to trick someone
Example: Most politicians use duplicity to deceive voters just long enough to get their votes.

Word: Durable
Meaning: able to stay in good condition; withstand wear and damage; strong
Example: The plate was made of durable plastic and didn’t break when accidentally dropped.

Word: Duration
Meaning: the time period in which something occurs
Example: The total duration of the film is 180 minutes.

Word: Duress
Meaning: force or threats meant to make someone do something
Example: The judge overturned the case because the defendant’s attorney proved that his client’s confession had been given under duress.

Word: Dusk
Meaning: the darkest part of the evening
Example: The boy’s mother warned him that he must be back inside before the streetlights came on at dusk.

Word: Dutiful
Meaning: responsible; devoted
Example: A dutiful daughter will care for her parents in times of difficulty.

Word: Dutifully
Meaning: performing responsibilities as expected
Example: The Navy Seaman dutifully painted the ship gray as required by the military.

Word: Duty
Meaning: a responsibility or obligation
Example: As an American; it is your duty to vote on Election Day.

Word: Dwarf
Meaning: a mythical creature that is short in stature
Example: Without a step stool; it was difficult for the dwarf to get anything done around the cabin.

Word: Dwell
Meaning: to live in a specific place
Example: The migrant worker did not intend to dwell in the rural town for very long.

Word: Dweller
Meaning: a person who lives in a particular place
Example: The apartment manager offered the dweller a month of rent free living in exchange of a new lease signing.

Word: Dwelling
Meaning: a place where people live
Example: An adobe dwelling was made from dirt and other organic materials.

Word: Edema
Meaning: an increase in the size of an area of a person’s body due to excess fluid
Example: Once the pain was too much to bear due to Kevin’s edema; he was admitted to the hospital to drain the water pooling under his skin.

Word: Edge
Meaning: the rim or border of a place or thing
Example: As the hikers reached the edge of the forest; they realized they would be walking across a large field next.

Word: Edgy
Meaning: jumpy and tense
Example: After the plane continued to shake uncontrollably; the passengers began to get edgy for fear of the plane crashing.

Word: Edible
Meaning: that can be eaten without harm; eatable
Example: Mom’s dinner was barely edible so I ordered takeout instead.

Word: Edict
Meaning: an order made by a person or body of authority
Example: The principal’s edict prohibits female students from wearing skirts and dresses that do not cover their knees.

Word: Edification
Meaning: moral; intellectual; or spiritual improvement; through encouragement and instruction
Example: Professor Tom likes to have his students fill out this questionnaire for his own edification as to whether he is omitting anything they’re interested in studying.

Word: Edifice 
Meaning: an imposing building that is rather large
Example: As I stared at the gigantic edifice; I knew I would get lost once I entered the largest mall in the country.

Word: Edify
Meaning: to teach in a way that improves the mind or character
Example: As good Christians; we must seek to edify our neighbors about God and Jesus Christ.

Word: Elegy
Meaning: a poem or song displaying grief or mourning
Example: Since I am not an animal lover; I could only sigh as Ann sang an elegy for her dead cat.

Word: Element
Meaning: a specific portion of something 
Example: The detective needed to find the final element of the puzzle in order to identify the killer.

Word: Elemental
Meaning: fundamental; essential
Example: An elemental requirement for the program is a 3.0 GPA.

Word: Elementary
Meaning: pertaining to the basic or fundamental part of a topic
Example: Once the child graduated from his elementary school; he would have to go through middle and high school.

Word: Elephantine
Meaning: resembling an elephant
Example: She adds elephantine memory; social charm; and striking vitality to the marketing business.

Word: Elevate
Meaning: to increase in distance 
Example: “Elevate your legs so the blood won’t flow as fast to your injured foot;” the coach yelled to his injured player.

Word: Elevation
Meaning: the altitude between two points
Example: Ms. Smith worried that the low elevation of the city would cause the forecasted rainstorms to flood the land.

Word: Elevator
Meaning: a device used for raising and lowering people in multi-floor buildings
Example: She rode the elevator to the second floor of the apartment building which is where she lives.

Word: Elfin
Meaning: waiflike or fragile
Example: Due to her elfin frame; many soccer players were afraid that their teammate would get injured easily if their opponent ran into her.

Word: Elicit
Meaning: to draw out or bring forth
Example: The comedian hoped his jokes would elicit a great deal of laughter from the audience.

Word: Elide
Meaning: to leave out or omit
Example: The teacher decided to elide the last test since most of the students failed.

Word: Eligible
Meaning: the ability or qualifications to meet or fulfill a stipulation
Example: Mary was eligible for rehire with the Thompson Paper Company because she was simply laid off from her secretarial position the year before.

Word: Eliminate
Meaning: to totally do away with something
Example: Diet pill advertisements claim that they can eliminate belly fat by taking just a few pills a day.

Word: Elimination
Meaning: the complete destruction or annihilation of something
Example: Because our enemy does not take prisoners; we will face total elimination if we even think of surrendering to them.

Word: Elision
Meaning: omitting sounds in order to make something to easier to pronounce
Example: Elision occurs in Latin poetry as a stylistic device where phrases are omitted.

Word: Elite
Meaning: individuals who are viewed as the finest in a group or society
Example: Because Anna is quite wealthy; she sends her children to the area’s most elite school.

Word: Elitism
Meaning: the belief that one's social group is superior to others
Example: Spreading their elitism across Germany; the Nazis pushed to prove they were superior to all other races.

Word: Elixir
Meaning: a substance or liquid which is believed to cure illness and give eternal life
Example: The salesman was selling an elixir that he said would protect us all from the plague.

Word: Elliptical
Meaning: oval or egg-shaped
Example: I painted the elliptical shaped Easter egg with pastel colors.

Word: Elocution
Meaning: the way in which an individual reads or speaks in front of others
Example: During the play; the actor’s elocution was so magnificent the audience grew bored whenever he was not on stage.

Word: Elongate
Meaning: to make something longer
Example: In an attempt to elongate her body; the dancer stood on her tiptoes and stretched her arms up to the sky.

Word: Elope
Meaning: to run away in order to get married
Example: The couple’s dream was to elope in a Vegas wedding with Elvis leading their ceremony.

Word: Eloquent
Meaning: having or showing the ability to use language clearly and effectively
Example: When you listen to the eloquent politician speak; you always understand his message.

Word: Elsewhere
Meaning: referring to some other place
Example: Since we couldn’t find any of the supplies at the grocery store; we decided to look elsewhere.

Word: Elucidate
Meaning: to make clear or easy to understand
Example: To make life easy for my math students; I go out of my way to elucidate the complex problems before each test.

Word: Elude
Meaning: to avoid something or someone
Example: The criminal was able to elude the police in the crowded mall.

Word: Elusive
Meaning: difficult to find; catch; or achieve
Example: The police are finding it difficult to catch the elusive bank robber.

Word: Elysian
Meaning: heavenly; divine
Example: Ancient Greeks prepared to leave their earthly home and rest in Elysian Fields during the afterlife.

Word: Emaciated
Meaning: abnormally thin or weak; especially because of illness or a lack of food
Example: Because some sick animals refuse to eat; many of them become emaciated.

Word: Emacity
Meaning: the compulsive love for and desire to obtain; purchase; or spend money on items
Example: For Claudia; her emacity was an addiction that forced her to buy hundreds of dollars worth of items she did not need.

Word: Emanate
Meaning: to come out from a source
Example: Hopefully; the fun memories of the weekend will emanate throughout the office and give all the employees a positive outlook this week.

Word: Emanating
Meaning: coming from
Example: The smoke emanating from the stove was a clear sign something was burning.

Word: Emanation
Meaning: a particular thing that is released from a certain source
Example: An emanation will rise through the opening once the humidifier has been running for a while.

Word: Emancipate
Meaning: to give freedom to someone

Word: Emancipation

Example: Many slaves became sharecroppers and never left the plantation after emancipation.

Word: Emasculate
Meaning: emasculate means to lessen a man’s identity
Example: He was worried his pink pants would emasculate him a bit; but he wore them anyway.

Word: Embalm
Meaning: to protect a dead body from rot by inserting it with a chemical compound
Example: In ancient Egypt; people would embalm the bodies of famous leaders by removing the organs and fluids before wrapping it in cloth.

Word: Embankment
Meaning: a wall made of dirt or stone that is used to prevent a river from flooding

Word: Embargo 
Meaning: a government ban on trade with a specific country

Word: Embark
Meaning: to begin anew
Example: Tomorrow Grant will start college and embark upon a new phase in his life.

Word: Embarrass

Meaning: the state of feeling shame or discomfort with one’s self

Word: Embedded
Meaning: an object deeply implanted; enclosed; or ingrained within something

Word: Embellish
Meaning: to make something sound or look better or more acceptable than it is in reality;to make more beautiful and attractive; to decorate

Word: Ember
Meaning: a glowing piece of coal or wood
Example: The fire was blamed on an ember from the camp fire that had not been fully extinguished.

Word: Embezzle

Word: Emblazon
Meaning: to decorate something with a noticeable design or symbol

Word: Emblematic
Meaning: serving as a symbol
Example: The American flag is emblematic of freedom.

Word: Embodiment
Meaning: an individual or thing that serves as a role model

Word: Embody
Meaning: to stand as a symbol for something
Example: The national flag is supposed to embody the spirit of our country.

Word: Embolden
Meaning: to motivate or inspire
Example: Do you believe alcohol commercials embolden teens to drink?

Word: Embossed

Word: Embrace

Word: Embrace

Word: Embroider

Word: Embroiled
Meaning: pulled into a situation
Example: I avoided my two best friends because I did not want to get embroiled in their dispute.

Word: Embryo
Meaning: an organism in the earlier stages of development before it emerges from the egg; or before metamorphosis
Example: Before I was a baby; I was an embryo.

Word: Embryonic
Meaning: referring to a system or idea that has potential for significant development

Word: Emendation
Meaning: the action of fixing written errors

Word: Emerge
Meaning: to come forward or appear
Example: Who will emerge victorious at the end of the boxing match?

Word: Emergency
Meaning: a situation which poses an immediate risk and requires urgent attention 
Example: The family gathered into the hospital’s waiting room when my grandfather needed an emergency surgery to remove a blood clot from his brain.

Word: Emergent
Meaning: in the process of emerging; of coming into being or prominence
Example: The emergent young singer may not be famous yet; but his great talent points to a future in show business.

Word: Emeritus
Meaning: retaining a title of honor after retirement
Example: Barack Obama is the emeritus President of the United States.

Word: Emesis
Meaning: throwing up; barfing
Example: Because some patients experience emesis after surgery there are always basins in the recovery area.

Word: Emigrant
Meaning: a person who leaves their home country to live permanently in a new country
Example: Marco is an emigrant from Cuba; which is immediately obvious from his accent.

Word: Emigrate
Meaning: to move from an individual’s home country to another country
Example: Many Mexicans illegally emigrate into the U.S. from Mexico.

Word: Emigration
Meaning: the act of relocating to another region or nation
Example: Because of the high rate of emigration; our country’s population is decreasing.

Word: Eminence
Meaning: having a superior or famed ability at a specific activity
Example: Taylor Swift’s eminence as a creative singer and style icon make her one of the most well known celebrities in the world.

Word: Eminent
Meaning: remarkable; great
Example: Everyone was looking forward to taking the class with such an eminent professor.

Word: Emissary
Meaning: an individual who acts on behalf of another person
Example: The celebrity sent his assistant as an emissary to pick up the movie contract.

Word: Emission
Meaning: the act of releasing or sending out something
Example: The mechanic is checking the engine to identify the source of the emission coming from my car.

Word: Emit 
Meaning: to give off or send forth
Example: Since the x-ray machines emit radiation; the technician will give you a protective cover to use during the diagnostic procedures.

Word: Emollient
Meaning: something which softens or lubricates the skin
Example: The lotion was a great emollient for her dry skin.

Word: Emolument
Meaning: compensation for work completed
Example: The emolument I earn from working is not enough to pay my bills.

Word: Emotion
Meaning: an instinctive or intuitive feeling; as opposed to logic and rationale
Example: Happiness is an emotion that we all wish to experience throughout our lifetime in spades; but unfortunately we must all endure tough times.

Word: Emotional
Meaning: of or relating to the emotions
Example: After more information unfolded; it appears the woman in question has severe emotional issues that should be dealt with.

Word: Emotional
Meaning: connected with or showing feelings
Example: The woman and man had an emotional connection and expressed their feelings for each other over the phone.

Word: Emotive
Meaning: emotional
Example: I didn’t expect such an emotive response from the parent when I said that her son was not a nice child.

Word: Empathize
Meaning: to feel empathy for another person
Example: His ability to empathize with people made him an excellent marriage counselor.

Word: Empathy
Meaning: to understand and share the feelings of another
Example: Because her parents immigrated to the United States to give her a better life; Maria has empathy for illegal aliens.

Word: Emperor
Meaning: the male supreme ruler of a kingdom or empire
Example: Looking down from his throne; the emperor ordered all of the thieves to be banished from his kingdom.

Word: Emphasis
Meaning: special importance or prominence on a particular thing
Example: The teacher put special emphasis on the fact that the assignment was not due tomorrow; but the day after it; to make sure we wouldn’t forget.

Word: Emphasize
Meaning: to highlight or focus on
Example: You should use the blue eye shadow to emphasize your beautiful eyes.

Word: Emphatically
Meaning: firmly
Example: When my husband and I married; we agreed emphatically to stay together forever.

Word: Empire 
Meaning: a state or area ruled by one individual who is normally referred to as an emperor
Example: The emperor governed his empire without asking anyone for advice.

Word: Empirical
Meaning: based on observation or evidence
Example: Our data is based on empirical evidence collected in numerous studies.

Word: Empiricism
Meaning: pursuit of knowledge purely through experience and experiments
Example: The expert’s sense of empiricism stemmed from years of personal experience.

Word: Employ
Meaning: to make use of something or hire somebody to work
Example: The boutique was looking to employ fashion designers.

Word: Employment
Meaning: the state of having a job or paid work
Example: I have applied for several different jobs; but am yet to find full-time employment.

Word: Empower 
Meaning: to grant authority or power to act in a certain way
Example: A good manager never fails to empower his employees with the ability to meet the needs of the customer.

Word: Empowered
Meaning: acting with confidence
Example: After being praised to the sky; Jack felt empowered and was ready to tackle the job.

Word: Empowerment
Meaning: power or authority given to someone
Example: The women’s empowerment movement was all about helping women take control of their own lives.

Word: Emptiness
Meaning: the state of containing nothing
Example: After all of her children left home; the mother felt a sense of emptiness in her lonely heart.

Word: Empty
Meaning: unable to satisfy; hollow; vain
Example: My neighbor’s apologies were empty gestures and nothing more.

Word: Emulate
Meaning: to imitate and copy; strive to equal or excel
Example: Aspiring to become a good cook; Kate will emulate the recipes and cooking techniques of chef Emeril.

Word: Emulation
Meaning: the desire to equal or excel someone else in qualities or actions
Example: Growing up; Rick was absorbed with sports emulation and he wanted to play for the Jets one day.

Word: Emulous
Meaning: full of jealousy that leads one to be eager to copy another
Example: The teen’s emulous personality led her to copy the other girl’s style instead of embracing her own sense of fashion.

Word: Enable
Meaning: to make something workable or possible
Example: Earning a college degree will enable Jake to get a job that pays a decent salary.

Word: Enact
Meaning: to authorize as a law or decree
Example: Congress hopes to enact a law that will increase the consequences of drunk driving.

Word: Enamor
Meaning: to trigger feelings of adoration
Example: My daughter hopes her makeover will enamor feelings from her secret crush.

Word: Enamored
Meaning: in love with a person or thing
Example: Because I was so enamored of my boyfriend; I had to see him constantly.

Word: Encampment
Meaning: temporary living quarters
Example: The Native American encampment was set up close to where the buffalo roamed; providing a temporary home for the hunters following the herd.

Word: Encapsulate
Meaning: to concisely express the main point of something 
Example: The students wished there was a way to encapsulate their teacher’s lecture so class would end quicker.

Word: Encase
Meaning: to cover something in a case or close-fitting surroundings
Example: The foil was used to completely encase the meat before it was put in a pan and placed in the oven.

Word: Enchant
Meaning: to charm or captivate
Example: When the magician finished his act; he did enchant the audience with his unbelievable magic tricks.

Word: Enchanted
Meaning: charmed; delighted; enraptured
Example: After the performance ended; we sat glued in our seats; enchanted by what we just saw.

Word: Encircle
Meaning: encase or enclose around
Example: Police can’t determine what is happening on the sidewalk since the people tightly encircle the pair of fighters in the center.

Word: Enclave
Meaning: a faction of individuals who differ from the people who live in neighboring areas
Example: The residents of the wealthy enclave don’t want the public bus system in their neighborhood.

Word: Enclose
Meaning: to completely cover or close something off from outside sources
Example: Ancient Egyptians liked to enclose their dead in elaborate tombs.

Word: Enclosure
Meaning: an area that is surrounded by a fence; wall; etc
Example: The enclosure was filled with cows grazing in the field.

Word: Encomium
Meaning: speech or piece of writing that warmly praises someone or something; tribute
Example: Mrs. Poundstone was surprised and delighted on the last day of school when the students in her most difficult class presented her with an encomium they had written; praising her work as a teacher.

Word: Encompass 
Meaning: to include or contain 
Example: The coding conference will encompass seminars on the most popular programming languages today.

Word: Encore
Meaning: a brief extra performance; done after the main performance is complete 
Example: After the first encore ; the crowd made it obviously clear they wanted more.

Word: Encounter
Meaning: to come across something or someone without warning
Example: I never dreamed I would encounter a rattlesnake in my backyard.

Word: Encourage
Meaning: to give support and hope to someone in an effort to build their confidence
Example: Trying to encourage his troops to press on; the leader gave a moving speech to the discouraged men.

Word: Encouragement
Meaning: words or actions that offer support or confidence to another person
Example: Offering encouragement to her son; Rhonda tried to convince Eli to try out for the basketball team once again.

Word: Encroach
Meaning: to slowly move into another person’s area
Example: My coworker is always leaning on my desk and trying to encroach upon my personal space.

Word: Encumber
Meaning: to restrict or burden in such a way that action is limited
Example: The chaperon’s rules did not encumber the female members of the swim team from sneaking out of their hotel at night.

Word: Encumbrance
Meaning: burden or hindrance
Example: If it weren’t for the encumbrance of procrastination; I would be a productivity machine!

Word: Endangered
Meaning: at serious risk of dying out/becoming extinct
Example: The Dodo bird is now extinct since no one was able to mate them when they were endangered.

Word: Endear
Meaning: to bring about love or fondness 
Example: Your rude behavior didn't endear you to the judges.

Word: Endearment 
Meaning: actions or words that convey affection
Example: When Matt told Jill he loved her; he hoped she would respond with some type of endearment.

Word: Endeavor
Meaning: 
Example: Although soliciting donations to help rebuild the orphanage took a lot of time and energy; in the end everyone agreed it had been a very worthwhile endeavor.

Word: Endemic
Meaning: native to a specific area or group of individuals
Example: The poisonous snake must have come from another country because it is not endemic to our nation.

Word: Endogenous
Meaning: growing or forming on the inside
Example: Because they are endogenous; the plants roots grow from deep within the plant tissue.

Word: Endorse
Meaning: to express one’s support or approval
Example: If the president chooses to endorse the politician; he will lose many supporters who oppose the legislator.

Word: Endothermic
Meaning: a reaction that causes warmth to be taken in
Example: Due to the endothermic process of cooking; an egg is cooked and becomes hot by the use of a stove.

Word: Endow
Meaning: to bestow something in a natural way or to give funds that are needed to support a project
Example: The billionaire will endow the school of nursing with a huge donation.

Word: Endowed
Meaning: supplied or furnished with 
Example: Since we’ve been heavily endowed by investors this year; we have greatly exceeded our fundraising goals.

Word: Endowment
Meaning: income or property that is given to someone
Example: In an effort to assist my son as he buys his first home; I provided him with a significant monetary endowment.

Word: Endurance
Meaning: the ability to do something difficult for a long time
Example: She admired her grandmother’s endurance throughout the grueling cancer treatments.

Word: Endure
Meaning: to put up with or go through
Example: A woman has to endure an extreme amount of pain during childbirth.

Word: Energetic
Meaning: active; having high levels of energy
Example: I stayed up late last night; so I had a hard time being active and energetic.

Word: Energy
Meaning: the power and ability to be physically and mentally active
Example: When people are under stress; they don't have as much energy for physical or mental activity.

Word: Enervate
Meaning: to deprive of force or strength; weaken
Example: The wrestler's plan was to deliver a crushing blow which would enervate his opponent.

Word: Enervated
Meaning: weakened; derived of strength
Example: Because he wasn’t in great physical shape; the runner felt enervated after a long-run.

Word: Enfeebled
Meaning: made physically or mentally weak or feeble
Example: After months in captivity; the enfeebled survivors were too weak to walk out of the camp.

Word: Enforce
Meaning: to compel or require
Example: Police officers will enforce the law by arresting people for committing crimes and handing out citations for breaking the rules.

Word: Enforcement
Meaning: the process of making sure that people follow a law/rule
Example: Enforcement of the park rules meant that people were not allowed in after dark.

Word: Enfranchise
Meaning: to extend privileges or rights
Example: One purpose of the immigration bill is to enfranchise citizenship to people who are willing to make a commitment to this country.

Word: Engage
Meaning: to become involved or participate in
Example: If you engage in criminal activity; you could end up in a jail cell.

Word: Engaging
Meaning: connecting; joining
Example: Engaging in a heated argument with her husband; the angry wife refused to back down.

Word: Engender
Meaning: to cause a feeling or attitude to exist
Example: The restaurant hoped the act of giving out free ice cream would engender customer loyalty.

Word: Engine
Meaning: something that is the force or impetus of a process
Example: The tank is our preferred engine of destruction when our country goes to war on the ground.

Word: Engross
Meaning: to completely capture attention or focus
Example: Hopefully the plastic keys will engross the crying baby for a while.

Word: Engulf
Meaning: to totally surround or cover
Example: The lava will begin to engulf the abandoned city in six hours.

Word: Engulf
Meaning: to sweep over something; surrounding it completely
Example: It only took seconds for the raging fire to fully engulf every room in the house.

Word: Enhance
Meaning: to bring out positive features
Example: The saleswoman told me the blue dress would enhance my lovely blue eyes.

Word: Enigma
Meaning: someone or something that is mysterious and difficult to understand
Example: To the new detective; the motive of the crime was an enigma.

Word: Enigmatic
Meaning: full of mystery and difficult to understand
Example: When I was growing up; I viewed my father as an enigmatic man who rarely spent time with me.

Word: Enjoin
Meaning: to prohibit someone from performing an action
Example: The angry man wanted the judge to grant an injunction to enjoin his ex-wife from selling their vacation home.

Word: Enjoyable
Meaning: entertaining; pleasurable
Example: Going to the beach is usually enjoyable; but today’s heat wave took away from the fun.

Word: Enjoyment
Meaning: a feeling of happiness or pleasure gained from an event or activity
Example: Enjoyment of an ice cream cone is one of my favorite summer activities.

Word: Enlarge
Meaning: to make something bigger than its original size
Example: The nearly blind woman needed someone to enlarge her text messages so that she could read them.

Word: Enlighten
Meaning: to give someone more knowledge or information about a situation
Example: The teacher’s job was to enlighten her students on the various theories of physical science.

Word: Enlightenment 
Meaning: the action of being informed
Example: My children often look to me for enlightenment when they have questions about important life decisions.

Word: Episode
Meaning: incident or action connected with a series of events
Example: One in three of us will experience a depressive episode at some time in our lives.

Word: Epistemic
Meaning: of or relating to knowledge or cognition; cognitive
Example: As human beings; it is very important to be aware of our epistemic limitations.

Word: Epistemology
Meaning: a division of philosophy that examines numerous aspects of human intelligence
Example: “What exactly is knowledge?” is a question you will ask when you study epistemology.

Word: Epistle
Meaning: a formal printed communication; a written note or letter
Example: The epistle from the court ordered me to appear as a possible juror.

Word: Epistolary
Meaning: associated with written correspondence
Example: Her epistolary collection of the secret romance contains all the letters the couple exchanged.

Word: Epitaph
Meaning: a brief literary piece written about the life of a dead person and often placed on that individual’s headstone
Example: The slave’s epitaph stated his name but made no mention of his date of birth or death.

Word: Epithet
Meaning: a word or phrase that describes a person or thing
Example: The epithet “Curly” is used to describe the big football player with the curly hair.

Word: Epitome
Meaning: an example that represents or expresses something very well
Example: Because our mayor is the epitome of a good citizen; he has been in office for over ten years.

Word: Epitomized
Meaning: used as a model of something
Example: Before his career-ending injury; Dwayne epitomized the world’s idea of the best basketball player on the planet.

Word: Epoch
Meaning: a significant period in time
Example: Many people consider the development of the first antibiotic to be the epoch of man’s therapeutic advances.

Word: Epochal
Meaning: of great significance
Example: The president returned the country to prosperity during his epochal terms in office.

Word: Eponym
Meaning: a term derived from an individual or thing related to it or to the person who created a specific thing
Example: The word “sandwich” is an eponym linked to the first person said to have requested the item; the Earl of Sandwich.

Word: Eponymous
Meaning: a title or name that is derived from another name
Example: The singer’s first album was eponymous and carried her name as the record title.

Word: Equable
Meaning: even-tempered; calm
Example: Because she is so equable; my even-tempered mother rarely gets upset.

Word: Equal
Meaning: being the same in size; amount; or degree
Example: You should add an equal amount of water and paint to the bowl get the right mixture.

Word: Equality
Meaning: the quality of having the same value or worth
Example: The civil rights activist fought for racially equality so all people would be viewed as equals.

Word: Equanimity
Meaning: to stay calm; especially under stress; to maintain composure
Example: His equanimity allowed him to keep a clear head and escape the burning building.

Word: Equate
Meaning: to view as being equal in value 
Example: I was angry when I learned the insurance check wouldn’t equate to the painting’s purchase price.

Word: Equation
Meaning: a mathematical problem that says that two things are equal
Example: Although he knew how to divide; the confused student could not figure out the numbers to plug into the equation.

Word: Equator
Meaning: an imaginary circle around the Earth; dividing earth's surface into the northern and southern hemisphere
Example: Even though it is invisible; I am well aware of the equator due to its high suffocating temperatures.

Word: Equestrian
Meaning: associated with horse riding
Example: During the equestrian auction; you’ll have the opportunity to bid on some of the finest horses in the country.

Word: Equidistant
Meaning: located the same distance from two or more areas 
Example: My hotel room is located equidistant from both elevators so neither elevator is more convenient than the other.

Word: Equilateral
Meaning: referring to a polygon all of whose sides are of equal length
Example: The equilateral picture frame allowed for a four by four inched photograph.

Word: Equilibrium
Meaning: the condition at which competing influences are balanced
Example: Equilibrium is the point at which supply and demand are in balance with enough of a good being produced to meet the requests for it.

Word: Equine
Meaning: similar in appearance to or associated with a horse
Example: In high school; people used to bully Gail by calling her “Horsey” because of her equine face.

Word: Equinox
Meaning: the two days of March and September in which the hours of the day and night are nearly the same length 
Example: In the United States; we are always eager for the March equinox to cast out the winter weather.

Word: Equip
Meaning: to supply someone or something with the necessary items for a specific purpose
Example: If you plan on rock climbing; you should probably equip yourself with a harness and the other safety gear needed to stay safe.

Word: Equipoise
Meaning: a state of balance; equilibrium
Example: As she stacked the cans into a pyramid; the stocker was precise in order to ensure equipoise and stop the cans from crashing down.

Word: Equipped
Meaning: coming with additional items that allow ultimate functionability
Example: The campsite came equipped with a stone fire pit; charcoal grill; and water fountain.

Word: Equitable
Meaning: characterized by equity or fairness; just and right; fair
Example: Both sides agreed to try to find an equitable compromise that would please everyone.

Word:  Equity 
Meaning: the calculated worth of a property after the money owed has been deducted
Example: We do not have enough equity in our home to use it as collateral for a loan.

Word: Equivalent
Meaning: on par or equal to
Example: Carl is a cocky home cook who swears his hamburger is equivalent to a steak at a fine restaurant.

Word: Equivocal
Meaning: not clear or certain
Example: Since the defendant’s alibi is equivocal; the jury will disregard it almost instantly.

Word: Equivocate
Meaning: to use unclear language especially to deceive or mislead someone
Example: When things are not going Margie’s way; she will often twist the truth and equivocate to put things in her favor.

Word: Era
Meaning: a period of time of which particular events or stages in history
Example: The fall of the Berlin wall marked the end of an era.

Word: Eradicate
Meaning: to completely destroy; to put an end to
Example: The murderer conceived a sinister plot to systematically eradicate the any witnesses to his foul deed.

Word: Ere
Meaning: previously or earlier usually meaning with time
Example: The southern belle hoped Jeff would ask for her hand in marriage ere nightfall so that she could go to bed early that night.

Word: Ergo
Meaning: consequently or therefore
Example: I am allergic to shellfish; ergo; I will not be trying Pam’s shrimp pasta dish.

Word: Eristic
Meaning: describing a person likely to debate or argue with others
Example: My Dad is a very eristic person; always turning any conversation we have into a full blown debate for no reason.

Word: Erode
Meaning: to destroy something at a leisurely pace
Example: People predicted the Internet would erode the future of newspapers; and for the most part; they were correct.

Word: Erosion
Meaning: the slow demolition of something 
Example: The overconsumption of soft drinks can produce dental erosion.

Word: Err
Meaning: to make an error or mistake
Example: When I err; I try to learn from my mistakes.

Word: Errant
Meaning: not following the appropriate course
Example: The errant student was given a warning for not going directly to class.

Word: Erratic
Meaning: unpredictable
Example: The medicine causes the normally predictable Jacob to behave in an erratic way.

Word: Erratum
Meaning: an error in text that is later corrected 
Example: An erratum at the bottom of the article contains a correction for a spelling error.

Word: Erroneous
Meaning: wrong; incorrect
Example: After he had spent every waking moment of the past few days researching the subject; he was understandably frustrated when he discovered that several of his sources contained erroneous information.

Word: Error
Meaning: a mistake or blunder
Example: When the mother accused her son of stealing her money; it was an error on the mother’s part because the daughter actually stole the money.

Word: Ersatz
Meaning: replicated from something else yet lacking the original qualities
Example: Do you believe the ersatz beach created by the city will appeal to those who love the natural features of the seashore?

Word: Erstwhile
Meaning: in the past
Example: Before she began using a pseudonym; the author was erstwhile known by another name.

Word: Erudite
Meaning: having or showing profound knowledge
Example: The room was full of erudite scholars who made the discussion on astronomy fun and interesting.

Word: Erudition
Meaning: extensive knowledge learned from studying and research
Example: Ken Jennings is a man of great erudition; having won first place on Jeopardy 75 consecutive times.

Word: Erupt
Meaning: to violently eject
Example: Fearing that the volcano would erupt momentarily; the local authorities issued an immediate evacuation notice.

Word: Erupted
Meaning: simple past tense and past participle of erupt; to violently eject or explode
Example: After he said the words “not guilty;” the audience erupted.

Word: Eruption
Meaning: the bursting out of material suddenly and violently
Example: The volcano’s sudden eruption left the city in ruins; covered in lava and ash.

Word: Escalade
Meaning: the act of climbing or scaling defensive walls with the aid of ladders
Example: Even the strongest men were unable to escalade the tower of the north castle.

Word: Escalate 
Meaning: to make stronger or intensify
Example: Gas prices usually escalate during the summer because of the high demand for fuel.

Word: Escapade
Meaning: a risk-taking act that goes against normal behavior
Example: The boys’ escapade might end with their arrest.

Word: Escapism
Meaning: avoidance of the real world and finding comfort in daydreams and fantasy
Example: Escapism was his favorite pastime; preferring to immerse himself in video games over homework.

Word: Escarpment
Meaning: long; steep cliff
Example: Sledding down the steep escarpment proved to be a hair-raising event.

Word: Eschew
Meaning: to avoid something which you do not think is right or proper
Example: Since my husband believes chores are a woman’s work; he tries to eschew them around the house.

Word: Escort
Meaning: to go with someone or something as a companion or guard
Example: No women in the city are allowed to shop or be in public without a male family member to escort them.

Word: Escrow
Meaning: money or something of value held in trust by a third party for two other parties in a contract
Example: When my parents died; I inherited money that will be in escrow until I turn twenty-one years old.

Word: Esculent
Meaning: edible; good enough to eat
Example: Compared to the other mouthwatering apples; the one with the worm’s head poking out of it was not esculent.

Word: Escutcheon
Meaning: a shield displaying a coat of arms
Example: Shining brightly; the warrior’s shield-like escutcheon had protected him in many battles.

Word: Esophagus
Meaning: tube that carries food; liquids and saliva from your mouth to the stomach
Example: Forcing the sashimi down her esophagus; the finicky woman tried not to think about the fact that it was raw.

Word: Esoteric
Meaning: known about or understood by very few people
Example: The medical research was so esoteric that only a few physicians could actually understand the results.

Word: Especial
Meaning: exceptional
Example: With especial grades; the student knew she would get into the college of her choice.

Word: Espionage
Meaning: the obtaining of information considered secret or confidential without the permission of the holder of the information
Example: Digging through someone’s trash to get information is one of the oldest acts of espionage in the spy business.

Word: Espouse
Meaning: to support an idea; belief; or principle
Example: People who espouse the Paleo diet claim that they feel better and it’s much easier to control their weight.

Word: Espresso
Meaning: dark coffee brewed by forcing water through finely ground; roasted coffee beans
Example: A cup of expresso was just what the coffee junkie needed to get her day started.

Word: Esprit
Meaning: the quality of being lively and spirited
Example: Several of the esprit cheerleaders were able to liven the crowd even though the team was losing.

Word: Espy 
Meaning: to discover; to catch sight of
Example: Those who wanted to espy the incoming soldiers came out in droves.

Word: Essay
Meaning: a written composition of moderate length; exploring a particular issue or subject
Example: For a homework assignment; our teacher Mr. Jones wants the class to write an essay on endangered species.

Word: Essence
Meaning: the key element of something
Example: At the essence of the non-profit is the desire to improve the lives of homeless people.

Word: Essential
Meaning: absolutely necessary; extremely important 
Example: Air and water are essential for human life.

Word: Essentially
Meaning: basically; mostly
Example: Since the game is essentially over; we should go ahead and walk back to our cars.

Word: Establish
Meaning: to create or form
Example: The teacher must establish rules for the students to follow while they are in school.

Word: Established
Meaning: referring to something that has existed for a long time and is therefore recognized
Example: Italy has long been established as a country of good food; probably thanks to their donation of pizza and pasta to the world cuisine.

Word: Establishment
Meaning: the people with the most power within a government
Example: Because the establishment had all of the power; it was hard for a peasant to rise above servitude.

Word: Estate
Meaning: all of the property owned by a person; typically at the time of their death
Example: My estate includes my house; my car; my dog; and all of my money; which will all go to my wife if I die.

Word: Esteem
Meaning: respect and admiration
Example: Having set the world record for fastest mile time; the man received the esteem of his fellow runners.

Word: Esteemed
Meaning: having the admiration of others
Example: We are honored to present this award to our esteemed colleague for his hard work and dedication.

Word: Estimable
Meaning: worthy of respect and praise
Example: Our estimable professor is constantly being recognized for his cancer research.

Word: Estimate
Meaning: to roughly calculate or give a guessed amount
Example: I always estimate the cost of my groceries while shopping so that I’m not surprised at the total amount.

Word: Exceeding
Meaning: more or greater than average
Example: Having exceeding expectations; the teacher required high quality work with no errors from all of his students.

Word: Exceedingly
Meaning: extremely; to a great extent
Example: As my debt rose and income increased; it seemed exceedingly difficult to survive month to month.

Word: Excel
Meaning: to do something extremely well
Example: I tend to excel in subjects that are heavy in mathematics; but struggle with courses that require a great deal of writing.

Word: Excellence
Meaning: the state of being extremely good
Example: Committed to excellence; our basketball team refused to give up when we were behind in the first round.

Word: Excellent
Meaning: wonderful and superb
Example: After studying a few hours for his math test; the boy was proud for making an excellent grade of an A+ on his test.

Word: Exception
Meaning: a case where a rule does not apply
Example: The only exception that will be made for students who come late to classes is if they had been sick the day before.

Word: Exceptionable
Meaning: objectionable or not acceptable
Example: The nursing home worker’s exceptionable treatment of the patient led to complaints and termination.

Word: Exceptional
Meaning: excellent or brilliant
Example: Tiffany had exceptional grades with straight A’s and they were all at one hundred percent.

Word: Excerpt
Meaning: a short piece or clip from a larger piece of media 
Example: Since we had only a few minutes left in class; our teacher could only read an excerpt of the short story to us.

Word: Excess
Meaning: surplus; extra
Example: Excess annual funds should be designated to the building fund so that we can make the needed roof repairs.

Word: Excessive
Meaning: more than needed
Example: Excessive spending by the state government drained our funds and left us with a huge deficit.

Word: Excessively
Meaning: something that is done in an extra amount or extent than what is expected
Example: Since the young child was always silenced at home; she talked excessively at school about anything she could think about.

Word: Exchange
Meaning: to trade or swap
Example: After the small fender bender; the two parties decided to exchange phone numbers and sort the issue out at a later date.

Word: Excise
Meaning: to get rid of something by cutting
Example: It will take several hours for the surgeon to excise the massive tumor.

Word: Excitable
Meaning: easily excited; emotional or temperamental
Example: It didn’t take much to get the excitable puppy riled up and a bark fest to being.

Word: Excite
Meaning: to stimulate and thrill
Example: Several half-court three point shots were able to excite the crowd and send them into a frenzy.

Word: Excitedly
Meaning: to be thrilled or interested
Example: The 16-year old boy said excitedly; “I can’t believe you got me a brand new car for my birthday!”

Word: Excitement
Meaning: full of delight
Example: Excitement on a child’s face when she comes downstairs on Christmas morning to see all her presents is priceless.

Word: Exciting
Meaning: thrilling and interesting
Example: When my wife announced we were having a baby; the exciting news made me go buy a house full of baby toys.

Word: Exclaim
Meaning: to speak spontaneously and with strong feeling
Example: If you listen on Christmas Day; you'll hear millions of small children exclaim in joy.

Word: Exclaimed
Meaning: expressed with strong feeling
Example: It was obvious from the way the children exclaimed delight that they liked their Christmas presents.

Word: Exclamation
Meaning: a sudden cry usually brought on by surprise; anger; or pain
Example: I let out an exclamation of anger when I realized my best friend had accidentally spilled paint on my drawing in art class.

Word: Exclude
Meaning: to eliminate or reject
Example: If an African American citizen tried to vote in the 1950s; the workers would exclude him based on his race.

Word: Exclusion
Meaning: the condition of denying access to something
Example: Due to his exclusion from the military; Darrel didn’t know what he was going to do in the future.

Word: Exclusive
Meaning: private; restricted
Example: Although the pool was exclusive to paid members; we usually were allowed to swim after hours.

Word: Excogitate
Meaning: to study something intently and carefully
Example: The attorney took several days to excogitate the case documents so that he would be prepared for court.

Word: Excommunicate
Meaning: to be banished from a church
Example: In history; officials have decided to excommunicate prominent religious leaders because of their wrongdoings.

Word: Excommunication
Meaning: officially excluding someone from participation in religious acts of the Christian Church
Example: The penalty for joining a secret group like the Freemasons was exile and excommunication from the church.

Word: Excoriate
Meaning: to severely condemn
Example: In his speech; the president will excoriate the dictator’s actions and state his plans for military intervention.

Word: Excrement
Meaning: feces expelled through the body after digestion
Example: Cleaning up the patient’s excrement out of the bedpan was not the highlight of the nurse’s day.

Word: Excrescence
Meaning: a protrusion or growth usually in the form of a lump that is the result of sickness
Example: After discovering a large excrescence that resembled a bubble on his leg; Miles went to the doctor to have it looked it.

Word: Excretion
Meaning: the process of expelling waste from the body
Example: Taking part in the excretion process; several organs are responsible for removing waste for the body.

Word: Excruciating
Meaning: extremely uncomfortable or painful
Example: After watching the excruciating film; I thought about asking for a refund of my money.

Word: Exculpate
Meaning: to clear of or free from guilt; exonerate
Example: Diane’s teenage son is constantly getting into some kind of mischief; but he knows how to charm his mother and exculpate himself.

Word: Exculpatory
Meaning: describes something that shows or declares that (someone) is not guilty of wrongdoing
Example: Despite its exculpatory tone; those conducting the investigation know in their hearts that the president is guilty of perjury.

Word: Excursion
Meaning: a fun outing or visit
Example: On our excursion to see our grandparents in Colorado; we ran into a snowstorm which delayed our trip.

Word: Excuse
Meaning: the justification for an error; mistake or absence
Example: Her only excuse for stealing the bread was that her young brothers would starve to death if they weren’t fed.

Word: Execrable
Meaning: extremely bad or unpleasant
Example: When Matt accidentally found himself on a racist website; he was outraged by all the execrable comments that had been posted on it.

Word: Execrate
Meaning: to strongly condemn an individual or thing
Example: After being injured in the war; my uncle came to execrate gun violence.

Word: Execute
Meaning: to put a plan or order into effect
Example: We were unable to execute our beach plans since the weather wasn’t in agreement.

Word: Execution
Meaning: the act of performing a task or command to its completion
Example: The superintendent of the school system knew that the successful execution of the standardized test would require a thoroughly planned system.

Word: Executioner
Meaning: the person who discharges the death of a death penalty criminal 
Example: The protocol for the hanging included draping a dark cloth over the criminal’s head before the executioner released the trap door.

Word: Executive
Meaning: a high-ranking employee in a company or business
Example: Once the strict executive of the Zanda Office Supply Company realized some employees were stealing pens and paper; he fired every one of them.

Word: Executor
Meaning: a person who is authorized to make sure the conditions in a will are fulfilled
Example: When the executor read the will; all the family members listened intently.

Word: Exegesis
Meaning: detailed explanation of a written passage
Example: The student’s exegesis of the novel was one of the best summaries the professor had ever read.

Word: Exemplar
Meaning: a person or thing that serves as a model or ideal
Example: The school valedictorian is an exemplar of the perfect student.

Word: Exemplary
Meaning: something so good that it is an example for others to follow
Example: When my father retired from his company after fifty years of employment; he received a gold watch for his exemplary service.

Word: Exemplification
Meaning: the act of providing a sample; illustration or instance
Example: Lieutenant Sanders was an exemplification for the younger soldiers because he had rescued twenty troops during an attack.

Word: Exemplify
Meaning: to show or illustrate by example
Example: The citizenship trophies are presented to exemplify the best examples of good citizenship among the student body.

Word: Exempt
Meaning: free from a responsibility or obligation that is placed on others
Example: Because I made a perfect score on my last exam; I am exempt from the study guide that all of the other students are required to complete.

Word: Exemption
Meaning: the act of being excluded or immune to a task or obligation
Example: When I explained that I was working a very important job that only I could do; the judge gave me an exemption from jury duty.

Word: Exercise
Meaning: to put something to use such as rights or powers
Example: States must take effective measures to ensure that all persons entitled to vote are able to exercise that right.

Word: Exert 
Meaning: to apply bodily or intellectual effort
Example: The dictator will use military force to exert control over his people.

Word:  Exertion 
Meaning: the effort needed to complete a task
Example: After the surgery; I was told to avoid tasks that required a large amount of physical exertion.

Word: Exeunt
Meaning: a printed direction for actors and actresses to leave the stage of a play
Example: In the Broadway musical; the command was written in the script for the main characters to exeunt stage left because their part was over.

Word: Exfoliate
Meaning: to remove dead skin and cells from the face or body using a gritty scrub
Example: Many women choose to exfoliate their skin in order to expose the new skin underneath for a smoother appearance.

Word: Exhalation
Meaning: the process of releasing air from your lungs
Example: After puffing on a cigarette; the inconsiderate man’s exhalation of the second-hand smoke created a hazard for anyone standing near him.

Word: Exhale
Meaning: to release air from your lungs
Example: Synchronized swimmers wait as long as possible to exhale so that they can hold their breath for a long time.

Word: Exhaust
Meaning: to wear out or use up one's resources or materials
Example: The marathon runner began to exhaust at mile 23.

Word: Exhausted
Meaning: to be very tired having little to no energy
Example: After the colicky baby arrived; the new parents became exhausted from lack of sleep.

Word: Exhaustive
Meaning: leaving nothing out; thorough
Example: Despite an exhaustive search of the apartment; I could not find my car keys.

Word: Exhibit
Meaning: to purposefully show or reveal something
Example: Since the students want to impress their teacher; they exhibit perfect behavior in their class.

Word: Exhibition
Meaning: an event at which objects such as paintings are shown to the public
Example: The art exhibition featured pieces from famous painters around the globe.

Word: Exhibitionist
Meaning: an individual who uses his or her behavior to catch peoples’ attention
Example: The female rapper is an exhibitionist who attracts attention by wearing revealing clothing.

Word: Exhilarate
Meaning: to make an individual extremely happy
Example: Achieving my weight loss goal is sure to exhilarate me.

Word: Exhilarating
Meaning: producing intense feelings of joy or excitement
Example: When I won ten million dollars in the lottery; it was the most exhilarating moment in my life.

Word: Exhort
Meaning: to strongly urge someone to do something
Example: While I cannot force you to drive the speed limit; I exhort you to do so or else you might end up in jail.

Word: Exhume
Meaning: to bring something forth; often a body from the ground
Example: When new evidence was introduced; the detective chose to exhume the elderly woman’s body.

Word: Exigency
Meaning: something that is necessary in a particular situation
Example: Rules are an exigency inside of a prison or else chaos will reign.

Word: Exigent
Meaning: urgent; needing immediate action
Example: The police should always obtain a search warrant unless there is an emergency or exigent circumstances.

Word: Exiguous
Meaning: a tiny quantity of something or a tiny height
Example: Due to my exiguous knowledge of history; I was bound to lose quickly at the history trivia game.

Word: Exile
Meaning: the state of being expelled from one's country or home
Example: The military leader was forced into exile and spent his final days on a small island.

Word: Eximious
Meaning: exceptional; distinguished
Example: Not willing to settle on the venue; the bride looked for an eximious location that would top any other she had seen.

Word: Existence
Meaning: something determined to be real 
Example: Skeptics finally believed in the existence of ghosts once the paranormal activities were detected in their house.

Word: Existent
Meaning: to be living
Example: Questions are always posed about whether the dinosaurs were existent after the Mesozoic Era.

Word: Existential
Meaning: something relating or dealing with existence
Example: Perhaps the most existential question is “what is the meaning of life?”

Word: Exit
Meaning: to go away or leave a place
Example: Once the movie is over; the patrons will exit the theater and get in their cars to go home.

Word: Exodus
Meaning: a situation in which a lot of people leave a place or activity at the same time
Example: One would think that the repeated occurrence of tornadoes in an area would prompt an exodus of the residents to a location with a more stable climate.

Word: Exogamy
Meaning: marrying someone from a different communal group
Example: In order to avoid marrying a relative; the tribe practiced exogamy which involved mostly the surrounding tribes.

Word: Exogenous
Meaning: caused by outside factors
Example: The doctor determined that the woman’s depression was exogenous and stemmed from weather changes and other outside factors.

Word: Exonerate
Meaning: to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime or responsible for a problem; bad situation; etc.
Example: The job of the defense attorney is to exonerate his clients and keep them out of jail.

Word: Exonerated
Meaning: to declare someone not guilty of criminal charges
Example: After being exonerated; the death row inmate was freed from his jail cell.

Word: Exorbitant
Meaning: unreasonably high amount of something; too much
Example: The luxury hotel charges an exorbitant rate of $25 for a single cheeseburger.

Word: Exorcise
Meaning: to drive out an evil spirit from a person; place or thing; especially by an incantation or prayer
Example: Many people turn to religion to exorcise themselves from sin.

Word: Exorcism
Meaning: the act of driving out a demon from a person or place
Example: During the Second World War; some believed Adolf Hitler was possessed by a demon and tried to remove it through a long-distance exorcism.

Word: Exordium
Meaning: the introductory part of a speech
Example: The exordium of the speech explained the reasons why the speaker had selected nursing as a career.

Word: Exoskeleton
Meaning: a hard outer body that covers and protects certain animals; particularly insects
Example: Bats love to eat a certain type of insect; but cannot digest its hard exoskeleton.

Word: Exothermic
Meaning: releasing heat
Example: Because it generated heat; the chemical was considered exothermic.

Word: Exotic 
Meaning: not native; foreign
Example: The customs officer knew the exotic animal had to be put in solitary before it could enter the country.

Word: Expand
Meaning: to increase in size or enlarge
Example: In order to expand the master bedroom; the owner tore through a wall to combine the bedroom and a bonus room.

Word: Expanse
Meaning: an open area that is large in size
Example: The city park is a beautiful expanse of green in the center of town.

Word: Expansion
Meaning: growing larger or more extensive
Example: Expansion into the western part of the United States increased after a huge land deal was struck with the French.

Word: Expansive
Meaning: covering a wide area; extensive
Example: Covering an expansive area; the search team looked high and low for the missing child.

Word: Expansively
Meaning: having a wide range or extent of effect or influence
Example: The company has an expansively built network of cell phone towers to help them provide their service to as many people as possible.

Word: Expatiate
Meaning: to write or talk about something using many details
Example: During his book signing; Clark will expatiate on his military adventures.

Word: Expatriate
Meaning: an individual who does not reside in his native nation or birthplace
Example: My uncle is an expatriate who left the country of his birth to live in France.

Word: Expect
Meaning: to guess or suppose
Example: When everything was going wrong with the flight; we were told to expect the worst with a crash landing.

Word: Expectancy
Meaning: in a state of hoping or expecting something to happen
Example: Right before the storm; the stores restocked their shelves with expectancy of hurried shoppers.

Word: Expectant
Meaning: waiting eagerly for something to happen
Example: Impatiently waiting for her newborn’s arrival; the expectant mother counted down the days until her due date.

Word: Expectation
Meaning: a belief that something is going to happen in the near future
Example: The expectation that a landslide victory would occur was confirmed during the election with seventy percent of the vote going to the incumbent.

Word: Expectorate
Meaning: to expel from the mouth
Example: If Jack wants to feel better; he needs to expectorate the mucus from his lungs.

Word: Expedient
Meaning: suitable to the circumstances; appropriate
Example: Given the fact the police will be looking for us soon; it is expedient we leave this apartment quickly!

Word: Expedite
Meaning: to cause something to happen faster
Example: If you would like to expedite the shipping of your order; please pay the express shipping fee.

Word: Expedition
Meaning: a trip taken for a specific reason
Example: In the television series; the spaceship set off on a ten-year expedition to explore new planets and meet new life forms.

Word: Expeditious
Meaning: performed quickly and efficiently
Example: When I order fast food; I expect to receive it in an expeditious timeframe.

Word: Expel
Meaning: to force something out such as liquid and air; eliminate
Example: When Susan was sick with bronchitis; the doctor told her to cough up the mucus and immediately expel it.

Word: Expend
Meaning: to use up
Example: Our long; midday hike always causes me to expend all of my energy and leaves me exhausted by dinner.

Word: Expendable 
Meaning: not necessary 
Example: The pawn is expendable in a game of chess.

Word: Expenditure 
Meaning: the total needed or spent 
Example: My travel expenditure left my bank account depleted.

Word: Expense
Meaning: a cost or price
Example: Although the dealership agreed to repair the motor for free; the owner had to purchase a battery at an added expense.

Word: Experience
Meaning: knowledge or skill gained by doing
Example: The woman’s previous management experience made her a shoe-in for the leadership position at a local factory.

Word: Experiential
Meaning: knowledge gained from experience and observation
Example: Taking an experiential approach; the company hoped to train employees through hands-on training modules.

Word: Experiment
Meaning: an examination usually in a scientific nature that tests a proposed explanation
Example: The scientists conducted an experiment on rats to determine if the new medication is safe for people.

Word: Experimental
Meaning: something new that is still in the trial stages
Example: Experimental trials provided encouraging results related to new chemotherapy options for cancer patients.

Word: Expert
Meaning: an expert is someone specialized in a given area
Example: As an expert in natural healing; the naturalist provides nutritional advice to cure diseases.

Word: Expertise
Meaning: the knowledge held by one who is an expert in something
Example: Kurt’s computer expertise earned him a high-paying job.

Word: Expiate
Meaning: to make up for something
Example: To expiate for breaking his neighbor’s window; John shoveled snow for three months.

Word: Expire
Meaning: for something; most often a period of time; to end
Example: My contract with the client I work for is set to expire in six months; after which I’ll need to find a new source of work.

Word: Explanation
Meaning: a description of something or someone in order to clarify it
Example: When the new employee was going through her job orientation; the boss provided an explanation of the tasks she would need to perform.

Word: Explanatory
Meaning: the act of describing something
