Example: Mr. Doug’s secretary emailed her department an explanatory memo about what should be in the quarterly reports.

Word: Expletive 
Meaning: a term used when swearing; a cuss word
Example: After hearing the comic say one expletive after another; the religious woman left the theater.

Word: Explicable
Meaning: capable of being justified or recognized as true
Example: The only explicable solution to the water shortage problem was to simply conserve as much water as possible.

Word: Explicate 
Meaning: to describe something in a lot of detail
Example: It took the chemist a long time to explicate the chemical process to the group of financial investors.

Word: Explicit
Meaning: specific about rules or what is required
Example: The difficult woman left the maid explicit details about how she wanted her house cleaned.

Word: Explode
Meaning: to blow up something using a violent and noisy tactic
Example: The Los Angeles Bomb Squad detonated the mysterious device before it would explode and damage everything in sight.

Word: Exploit
Meaning: to gain an advantage by doing something unethical 
Example: For hefty paychecks; the paparazzi were willing to exploit the grieving widow at her husband’s funeral.

Word: Exploited
Meaning: utilize someone or something for their own personal gain
Example: “Jane exploited the situation;” Karen responded; “since she only came to our party to eat dinner.”

Word: Exploration
Meaning: adventuring into an unknown place in order to become educated about it
Example: Several kids decided to conduct an exploration of the cave due to their curiosity of science.

Word: Exploratory
Meaning: associated with searching and examining something
Example: For my technical writing class; I decided to conduct exploratory research to narrow down my topic for my next paper.

Word: Explore
Meaning: travel to or examine
Example: Setting out to explore the island was the most adventurous thing the man had ever done.

Word: Explorer
Meaning: an adventurer that explores unfamiliar areas or uncharted territories
Example: Looking for the West Indies; the explorer must have been surprised when he ended up on a completely different continent than what he set sail for.

Word: Explosion
Meaning: a violent blowing apart or bursting caused by a chemical change
Example: The dynamite detonated; causing an earth shattering explosion across the city.

Word: Explosive
Meaning: something that explodes or blows up when ignited
Example: Fearing her husband’s explosive personality; the wife tried to speak softly and avoid any topics that would infuriate him.

Word: Exponent
Meaning: an individual who champions a certain principle or cause; an advocate
Example: Once homeless Janice is now a successful businesswoman and exponent for ending homelessness.

Word: Exponentially
Meaning: increasing rapidly in a sizable quantity
Example: Because of the poor economy; crime has increased exponentially in our state.

Word: Export
Meaning: to send to another nation for retail purposes
Example: If the country did not have oil to export; it would be a very poor nation.

Word: Expose
Meaning: to reveal or uncover something
Example: The blackmailer threatened to expose the politician’s love child.

Word: Exposition
Meaning: the action of putting something out to public view; for example; in a display or show
Example: We attended a Business to Business exposition; where exhibitors displayed their products and services to attract other companies.

Word: Expository 
Meaning: designed to define or explain
Example: The play begins with an expository monologue explaining where the story takes place.

Word: Expostulate
Meaning: to express strong disagreement
Example: My mother never missed the opportunity to expostulate her opinion anytime my father did something which displeased her.

Word: Exposure
Meaning: unprotected or visible to others
Example: Exposure to ultra-violet rays from the sun can lead to skin cancer; so it is necessary to cover yourself with sunscreen.

Word: Expound
Meaning: to clarify by providing details
Example: During his graduation speech; Thad will expound his hopes and prayers for his graduating class.

Word: Express
Meaning: communicate; articulate
Example: Meteorologists began to express their concern about a storm moving into the area.

Word: Expression
Meaning: the look on one’s face that shows what he or she is feeling
Example: Looking at the excited expression on her daughter’s face; Donna was happy that she could make her little girl’s dreams come true.

Word: Expressive
Meaning: animated; dramatic
Example: The expressive dance routine was added to the boring show to give an animated touch.

Word: Expressly
Meaning: specifically; clearly
Example: The regulations for entry are expressly and clearly stated in the rulebook.

Word: Expropriate
Meaning: to take away property without payment to the owner
Example: The pirate’s made their living by being able to expropriate the property of others they happened upon.

Word: Expulsion
Meaning: a circumstance in which an individual or thing is ejected from a position; place; or group
Example: Since Henry hated school; the threat of expulsion did not make him behave.

Word: Expunge
Meaning: to remove completely
Example: I would like to expunge my ex-husband from my memory.

Word: Expurgate
Meaning: to edit out rude; incorrect; offensive; useless; or otherwise undesirable information; to purge
Example: The rapper was told that if he did not expurgate the offensive lyrics from his new song; it would never be played on the radio.

Word: Exquisite
Meaning: especially fine or pleasing; exceptional
Example: She wore an exquisite dress; which left all the guests staring in surprise.

Word: Extant
Meaning: still around; not extinct
Example: The extant writings of the ancient philosopher are still quite popular with philosophy students.

Word: Extemporaneous
Meaning: completed without any type of advance preparation
Example: Instead of giving his prepared speech; the minister delivered an extemporaneous statement about the recent terrorist attacks.

Word: Extempore
Meaning: impromptu; done without preparation
Example: An extempore meeting was called without notice to terminate employees who hadn’t lived up to performance standards.

Word: Extemporize
Meaning: to improvise; especially while giving a speech or performing music
Example: The pianist was able to extemporize and play a piece without music or preparation.

Word: Extend
Meaning: to move outward
Example: The procrastinating students requested for the professor to extend the deadline for the essay.

Word: Extension
Meaning: the act of moving something outward
Example: Since the plug was across the room; Toby needed an extension so the cord could reach his computer.

Word: Extensive
Meaning: having a large scale
Example: It will take several months for the city to clean up the extensive damage caused by the hurricane.

Word: Extensively
Meaning: to a large degree
Example: Having toured the area extensively; the man felt that he had a lot of background knowledge on what was needed in Amsterdam.

Word: Extent
Meaning: the distance or magnitude something spreads or covers
Example: No one knew the extent of her son’s injury since the school only gave minute details of what happened on the playground.

Word: Extenuate
Meaning: to cause a wrong act to be judged less harshly because of circumstances
Example: The woman’s troubled childhood wasn’t enough to extenuate or excuse her of killing her husband.

Word: Extenuating
Meaning: to lessen the seriousness of a wrong act
Example: The court reduced the criminal’s sentence because of extenuating circumstances.

Word: Exterior
Meaning: pertaining to the outside of something
Example: When I noticed the chipped paint on the exterior of my house; I hired a professional to paint the outer part of my house.

Word: Exterminate
Meaning: to destroy completely
Example: Needing help to exterminate the bugs; the pest control worker ordered specialized repellant.

Word: External
Meaning: the exterior or outside of something
Example: When the two children continued to physically fight; this external conflict would cause their parents to get tired of hearing the bickering.

Word: Extinct
Meaning: no longer active or in existence
Example: Even though dinosaurs are extinct; people can learn more about them by visiting a museum.

Word: Extinction
Meaning: the process of a species completely dying out
Example: Extinction of the species happened after poachers killed many of the animals.

Word: Extinguish
Meaning: to snuff out or eliminate something
Example: She learned that the only way to extinguish a grease fire is to eliminate the oxygen by covering it with another pan or pouring baking soda on top.

Word: Extirpate
Meaning: to totally eliminate
Example: Hopefully the pesticides will extirpate the insects from my garden.

Word: Extol
Meaning: to praise
Example: Because Helen and Gina were jealous of their sister’s good fortune; they did not extol her when she won the academic scholarship.

Word: Extort
Meaning: to take from an unwilling person
Example: When Larry was fired; he attempted to extort cash from his former boss by threatening to expose the man’s drug addiction.

Word: Extortion
Meaning: the practice of obtaining money from someone through force; threats; or abuse of power
Example: The criminal committed extortion when he threatened to hurt the victim’s family if she didn’t give him money.

Word: Extract
Meaning: to pull an object from something in order to remove it; usually with force
Example: When the dentist noticed the infected tissue around his patient's gums; he knew he would have to extract the tooth.

Word: Extraction
Meaning: the process of removing something or taking it out
Example: The man paid for the extraction of just one tooth but ended up having another one removed as well.

Word: Extradite
Meaning: to send an individual accused of a crime back to the area in which the crime took place
Example: The state will soon extradite Cal to the island nation where he is wanted for assaulting a young girl.

Word: Extraneous
Meaning:  not essential or coming from the outside
Example: Because of so many extraneous details in the instructions; Dad wasn’t able to put the toy together in time for Christmas morning.

Word: Extraordinaire
Meaning: someone or something that is outstanding or remarkable
Example: That man is an extraordinaire; being someone that goes on remarkable adventures with his ludicrous amounts of cash.

Word: Extraordinary
Meaning: amazingly good
Example: Henry is an extraordinary pianist who has played for three presidents and several royal families.

Word: Extravagant
Meaning: excessive; exceeding normal bounds
Example: Rick spent nearly a year’s salary on the extravagant engagement ring.

Word: Extravaganza
Meaning: excessive and lavish celebration or performance
Example: Carnival in Venice; Italy; is an annual extravaganza of elaborate masks; dancing; music; and feasting before Lent.

Word: Extreme
Meaning: to a very large degree or amount
Example: Laura always takes arguments to the extreme and quickly turns things physical.

Word: Extremist
Meaning: a person who holds radical views that are viewed as extreme or fanatical
Example: Because they are an extremist group; ISIS has some very fanatical religious views.

Word: Extremity
Meaning: a risky measure
Example: Who would have ever thought Patrick would go to the extremity of jumping out of an airplane to propose to Michelle?

Word: Extricate
Meaning: to free or remove something or someone 
Example: If the magician does not extricate himself from the water tank in the next forty-five seconds; he will die.

Word: Extrinsic
Meaning: not belonging to; outside of
Example: We did not expect there to be any issues with our wedding date; however the weather turned into an extrinsic factor that forced us to change the date.

Word: Extrovert
Meaning: an individual who is sociable and enjoys conversing with others
Example: Because Pat is an extrovert who enjoys chatting with others; she is the ideal talk show host.

Word: Extrude
Meaning: to force out
Example: The volcano began to extrude lava; shooting the hot liquid up and over its sides.

Word: Extrusive
Meaning: describes rock material that was made when magma was pushed out through holes in the earth's surface
Example: After the lava cooled extrusive slabs of rock were scattered around the outer edge of the volcano.

Word: Exuberance
Meaning: the quality of being exuberant; cheerful or vigorous enthusiasm; liveliness
Example: Even though the children’s choir had trouble getting the words of the songs right; their exuberance in singing more than made up for it.

Word: Exuberant
Meaning: filled with energy and enthusiasm
Example: Even though Johnny was not a very good basketball player; he had such an exuberant attitude that he came across as one of the stars of the team.

Word: Exudation
Meaning: a condition of something quickly flowing out or forward
Example: As the young man came dressed in a suit and presented himself professionally; the exudation of class was apparent to anyone who was in the same room with him.

Word: Exude
Meaning: to openly display an emotion or quality
Example: After accomplishing so much; he could not help but exude confidence in himself.

Word: Exult
Meaning: to rejoice; be very happy
Example: Christians are taught to exult Christ above all else.

Word: Exultation
Meaning: a feeling of triumphant elation or jubilation
Example: Harry’s feelings of exultation intensified as he neared the end of his prison term.

Word: Eye candy
Meaning: something visually appealing that brings pleasure without stimulating the brain
Example: Many think of Channing Tatum as nothing more than eye candy; but he’s actually a talented dancer and photographer as well as an actor.

Word: Eyesore
Meaning: an unpleasant or ugly sight that is in a public place (i.e. building; statue).
Example: The casino was an eyesore to the community members who hated looking at the neon lights.

Word: Fable
Meaning: a fictional tale; often with talking animals; meant to present a moral value
Example: In the fable ‘The Tortoise and the Hare;’ we see that sometimes it is better to take things slow and steady if we really want to have success.

Word: Fabricate
Meaning: to make up for the purpose of deception
Example: The journalist got fired when his editor learned of his plan to fabricate a story about the president.

Word: Fabulist
Meaning: a story-writer who composes or rewrites fables
Example: The fabulist wrote tales about talking animals living long ago.

Word: Fabulous
Meaning: amazing or wonderful
Example: The amount of money we made during the fundraiser was absolutely fabulous; covering the cost of not only our current project; but the repaving of the school parking lot as well.

Word: Facade
Meaning: deceptive outward appearance
Example: I often find myself putting up a facade when I’m around my troubled brother.

Word: Face
Meaning: the surface of (especially the front) of a thing
Example: The face of the table had a scratch that ran all the way across the top.

Word: Facet
Meaning: a side or aspect of something
Example: “Beyond a reasonable doubt” means that you must explore every facet of the case.

Word: Facetious
Meaning: joking often inappropriately; not serious
Example: Do you always have to be so facetious?

Word: Facial
Meaning: of or affecting the face
Example: The actor read his lines and practiced his facial expressions in the mirror.

Word: Facile
Meaning: easily performed
Example: While the adults found the video game complicated; the teenagers thought it was facile and easily played.

Word: Facilitate
Meaning: to make something occur or less difficult
Example: The translator will facilitate the conversation between the immigrant and the attorney.

Word: Facilitation
Meaning: the process of something becoming easier or simpler
Example: Due to the teacher’s facilitation of the skills in her class; my grade jumped from making low D’s to A’s and B’s.

Word: Facility
Meaning: space or equipment necessary to accomplish a task
Example: There is no facility available to produce our cupcakes; so we will have to continue working from home.

Word: Facsimile
Meaning: a copy or reproduction
Example: He offered a facsimile of the original painting for a much discounted price.

Word: Fact
Meaning: a truthful statement
Example: My mother hid the fact that my dad was not my real father for more than forty years.

Word: Faction
Meaning: a group within a larger group that has different ideas and opinions than the rest of the group
Example: In the novel; the heroine was born into a faction of the population that dedicated their lives to helping each other.

Word: Factious 
Meaning: given to disagreements that lead to the development of conflict and problems within a group
Example: When my factious son gets mad with one of his pals; he tries to separate the person from the group by starting an argument.

Word: Factor
Meaning: an element that contributes to a circumstance or situation
Example: The high fuel consumption is the main factor that deters me from buying the vehicle.

Word: Factory
Meaning: a building were products are made
Example: Factory employees work Monday through Friday making the rubber stoppers that go in bathtubs.

Word: Factotum
Meaning: person having many responsibilities
Example: After accomplishing every task on the woman’s list from installing a new sink to babysitting the children; the factotum proved his worth and earned his pay for the day.

Word: Factual
Meaning: having the quality or characteristic of being true or grounded in reality
Example: That two plus two equals four is a completely factual statement; and no one can ever claim it to be false.

Word: Faculty
Meaning: the teaching staff of an educational organization; such as a school or university
Example: My favorite member of the faculty here at school is Mr. Earhart; because he teaches my favorite class.

Word: Faculty
Meaning: the teachers who work at a school or university
Example: Faculty pictures were included with the students in the school yearbook.

Word: Fade
Meaning: a gradual decrease; dim movie clip or diminish sound
Example: I don’t care for the speed sensitive volume control feature on my car because the music will fade when I come to a complete stop.

Word: Fahrenheit
Meaning: a temperature scale in which 32 degrees is the standard for freezing and 212 degrees is the boiling point
Example: If you crank the heat up to 212 degrees Fahrenheit; the water in the pot will begin to boil.

Word: Failure
Meaning: a disaster or flop
Example: The fashion show was a failure after the models fell off the runway; the lighting did not work and very few people showed up to watch the event.

Word: Fain
Meaning: pleased or inclined to do something
Example: Although I was on a diet; I was fain to eat a large slice of cake.

Word: Faint
Meaning: weak and dizzy
Example: Because she felt faint; the exhausted woman went to lie down for a while.

Word: Fair
Meaning: just in decisions; right or ethical
Example: The fair judge always made decisions that were in the reasonable and just.

Word: Fairness
Meaning: the condition of being reasonable; impartial; and just
Example: Many students loved their English teacher due to her fairness by treating each student equal to the other students.

Word: Fairway
Meaning: an open path or space; particularly for playing golf
Example: The golfer hit a tee shot over the water past the green fairway.

Word: Fait accompli 
Meaning: already completed and unchangeable
Example: The low grade on my project was a fait accompli the teacher saw no reason to alter.

Word: Faithful
Meaning: to be loyal to someone or something
Example: After being caught in a small lie; the citizens remained faithful to the mayor since he had done so much good for their town and they could forgive a small lie.

Word: Fakir
Meaning: a Muslim or Hindi holy man with magical powers who makes a living by begging
Example: An Indian fakir roamed the city begging for alms from those who help the poor.

Word: Fallacy
Meaning: an idea or belief that is false but many people think is true
Example: Having money makes you happy is a fallacy because happiness has nothing to do with wealth.

Word: Fallen
Meaning: having dropped by the force of gravity
Example: I spent countless hours before winter begins raking leaves that have fallen from trees.

Word: Fallible
Meaning: capable of making mistakes or being wrong
Example: Even though we are all fallible to some degree; the most successful people have learned how to rise above their weaknesses.

Word: Fallow
Meaning: not being used
Example: At the end of summer; the once crowded beaches become fallow as the young people return to school.

Word: FALSE
Meaning: untrue; fake
Example: False news filled the internet; tricking people into believing lies.

Word: Falsehood
Meaning: something that is an outright lie or fib
Example: Despite the fact that Henry VIII told an obvious falsehood about his wife’s infidelity; the people of England were too scared to question the king and she was beheaded.

Word: Falsetto
Meaning: an unnaturally high and feminine voice particularly sung by a male
Example: The young man sang in a high; clear falsetto that rivaled the most talented female singers.

Word: Falsify 
Meaning: to dishonestly change something in order to trick people
Example: Knowing it was wrong to falsify the truth; the girl admitted to losing her assignment.

Word: Falsity
Meaning: something that is false; an outright lie; or simply incorrect
Example: A common historical falsity is that only Jews suffered under Hitler’s reign; but other marginalized groups were persecuted as well.

Word: Falter
Meaning: to hesitate; stumble; or waver
Example: When the bank teller noticed that the masked man began to falter slightly; she discreetly pressed the silent alarm.

Word: Familial 
Meaning: family-related
Example: Children of the same familial background are likely to follow similar career paths.

Word: Familiar
Meaning: to have knowledge of
Example: Mia wasn't familiar with the astrophysics but after reading a few textbooks on the subject she learned quickly.

Word: Familiarize
Meaning: to make; or become familiar with something or someone
Example: Having just moved in; I walked around to familiarize myself with the neighborhood.

Word: Family
Meaning: a group of people related to one another
Example: All of the family members look alike because of their red hair and freckled faces.

Word: Famine
Meaning: a severe food shortage or period when food is in short supply
Example: Many people have starved to death because of the famine.

Word: Famish
Meaning: to make someone extremely hungry
Example: Three days without anything to eat was enough to famish the lost campers.

Word: Famished
Meaning: extremely hungry
Example: The man had not eaten for days; so when I asked if he was hungry he responded by saying “I’m famished.”

Word: Famous
Meaning: well-known; famed
Example: The chef became so famous for her meals that she was given her own cooking show.

Word: Fanatic
Meaning: one who is extremely passionate about something; often a religion or cause 
Example: My husband is an exercise fanatic who runs six miles every day.

Word: Fanatical
Meaning: having an extreme; irrational zeal or enthusiasm for a specific cause
Example: Richard is fanatical about his beliefs; preaching to anyone that will listen.

Word: Fanaticism 
Meaning: a state of irrational enthusiasm or admiration
Example: The followers of the cult displayed their fanaticism by drinking their leader’s blood.

Word: Fancied
Meaning: liked or felt a desire for
Example: The couple fancied a night out on the town; so they got dressed and called a cab.

Word: Fanciful
Meaning: imaginative or unreal
Example: Because she had a wild imagination; she loved to create fanciful stories in her spare time.

Word: Fanciful
Meaning: coming from the imagination; dreamlike
Example: The storyteller told fanciful tales about talking mermaids and fearless princesses.

Word: Fancy schmancy
Meaning: extraordinarily impressive and expensive
Example: I know you're fashionable; but dressing up in a fancy schmancy suit and tie to eat at McDonald's is excessive.

Word: Fancy
Meaning: to want to do something
Example: We fancy a trip to the islands; but our budget won’t allow it.

Word: Fanfare
Meaning: the attention of the public or prestigious ceremony
Example: The President received a great deal of fanfare when he announced his plans on immigration; so the news spread word of it quickly.

Word: Fantastic
Meaning: extraordinarily good; incredibly wonderful
Example: The strong winds make for a fantastic day of kite flying.

Word: Fantastical
Meaning: odd and remarkable; as if it came from the imagination
Example: The woman’s real-life success story sounded like some fantastical movie plot.

Word: Fantasy
Meaning: a pleasant thought of an unlikely enjoyable situation
Example: When she was young; I often found my daughter Kendra in her room withdrawn into her own fantasy world.

Word: Farce
Meaning: a ridiculous situation or event
Example: Many argue that the government today is a mere farce of what it started out as.

Word: Farcical
Meaning: bizarre or outlandish
Example: Critics described the farcical play as an absurd piece of writing that could have only been created by an intoxicated playwright.

Word: Fare
Meaning: the fee an individual is charged in order to be transported somewhere 
Example: The airline fare will set me back by eight hundred dollars.

Word: Farewell
Meaning: goodbye to one who is departing
Example: Tearful onlookers waved farewell to the departing soldiers heading to Afghanistan.

Word: Farfetched
Meaning: unlikely; unbelievable
Example: The idea that the losing team could come back and win was farfetched; but we held out hope.

Word: Farouche
Meaning: wildly fierce while remaining unapproachable by others
Example: The farouche canine growled and snarled as he backed away from those trying to capture it.

Word: Farrago
Meaning: a collection containing a confused variety of miscellaneous things
Example: The present gun law is a farrago of nonsense as most of it is unenforceable.

Word: Farther
Meaning: referring to a larger physical distance
Example: We have to walk farther than usual today because there was construction work on our usual route to school.

Word: Fascinate
Meaning: to capture and hold someone’s attention or interest
Example: The idea of a president that would strengthen the middle class seemed to fascinate those listening to the speech.

Word: Fascination
Meaning: intense intrigue or interest in something
Example: My fascination with the stars as a child led me to become an astronomer later in life; as I just love studying those stars and learning more about them.

Word: Fascism
Meaning: a government that is ruled by a powerful dictator having control of everyone/everything
Example: When the mayor discussed the possibility of a local curfew; the citizens immediately accused him of fascism.

Word: Fascist
Meaning: related to a government system led by a dictator with complete power
Example: The fascist regime has taken over the area and is ruling the city with an iron fist.

Word: Fashionable
Meaning: popular; stylish
Example: It took much persuading to convince my aunt that her bell-bottom jeans and platform shoes are no longer fashionable.

Word: Fast
Meaning: moving at high speed or capable of high speed
Example: People who love to go fast could experience no greater thrill than the supersonic flight of a fighter jet.

Word: Fasten
Meaning: to make something secure or attached
Example: Stuffing himself at the dinner table left the man unable to fasten his belt when he got up.

Word: Fastidious
Meaning: concerned about accuracy and detail; hard to please
Example: My mother was a fastidious woman who always had a complaint on her lips.

Word: Fat cat
Meaning: a rich and influential person who is in business or politics
Example: People are easily angered when they read that another fat cat Pharmaceutical CEO receives a bonus while the public is paying higher drug prices.

Word: Fatal
Meaning: causes death or leads to a disaster
Example: Dropping a fatal dose of poison into the goblet; the evil queen smiled down at her deathly elixir.

Meaning: one who maintains that all events have been predetermined; and that one cannot prevent things from happening

Word: Fatality
Meaning: death resulting from an accident or disaster
Example: Fatality rates for motorcycle crashes is over 27 times that of automobiles.

Meaning: decided in advance; destined
Example: Keith believes he is fated to have an alcohol addiction because his mother was an alcoholic.

Meaning: too great to be measured

Meaning: weariness brought on by exertion

Meaning: tiring; exhausting

Meaning: lacking intelligence; stupid

Meaning: defective and not functioning properly

Meaning: not accurate in meaning; as a form of speech
Example: If you use figurative language; you are not speaking literally but rather in a manner meant to produce a reaction.

Word: Figuratively
Meaning: not literally
Example: Jim told the judge that when he spoke of chopping off Scott’s head; he meant it figuratively and not physically.

Word: Figure of speech
Meaning: an expressive phrase that has a meaning other than the literal one
Example: She is as pretty as a picture is a figure of speech that describes the beauty of the lady.

Word: Figure of speech
Meaning: a word or phrase that means something different than the literal meaning and is used for emphasis or effect
Example: When Freda wants to eat; she uses the figure of speech “I’m as hungry a horse.”

Word: Filch
Meaning: to take illegally
Example: The pickpocket was able to filch three wallets while on the subway.

Example: Frank has a filial affection for the uncle who raised him.

Meaning: a short article or ad in a newspaper or magazine
Example: Reader’s Digest magazine uses unique jokes for a filler and will often pay their readers for the use of them.

Word: Filthy
Meaning: extremely dirty
Example: Because she never cleans her filthy home; the lazy housewife’s house is caked in dirt.

Word: Finagle
Meaning: to acquire something by deception or scam

Word: Finite
Meaning: having limits

Meaning: solid; refusing to bend

Meaning: to happen prior to anything else

Word: Flashy
Meaning: showy and wanting to show off one’s wealth/skills in an obnoxious way

Word: Fleeting

Word: Flexibility
Meaning: the ability to bend or twist the body without injury

Word: Flexible

Word: Flexion
Meaning: bending a limb

Word: Flexuous
Meaning: having bends or curves

Word: Flibbertigibbet
Meaning: a flighty individual who talks a great deal about nothing
Example: It was my misfortune to be stuck next to a chatty flibbertigibbet during the bus ride home.

Word: Flibbertigibbet
Meaning: a person seen as a silly chatterbox that talks too much
Example: Nicknamed Chatty Cathy; Catherine was a flibbertigibbet who blabbed to anyone she met.

Word: Flick
Meaning: to move or hit something with a quick movement
Example: As soon as he began to flick the spicy food with his tongue; the chef realized he had added entirely too much jalapeno.

Word: Flicker
Meaning: a tiny; almost imperceptible movement
Example: There was a flicker of light from the candle on the windowsill due to the small gust of wind that moved through the house.

Word: Flier
Meaning: one that travels in the air
Example: Each flier on the plane was required to listen to a speech on safety procedures.

Word: Flight
Meaning: a group of people or creatures that fly through the air together
Example: A charter flight carrying the opposing soccer team arrived at the airport earlier today.

Word: Flimsy
Meaning: likely to bend or break under pressure; weak; shaky; flexible; or fragile
Example: Don’t give me the flimsy excuse that you were too deep asleep to hear the phone ringing.

Word: Flinch
Meaning: to cringe or jump slightly unintentionally
Example: The young boy would flinch when the bee buzzed right next to his ear causing his head to turn suddenly away from the bee.

Word: Fling
Meaning: to toss or throw something quickly
Example: His attempt to fling the fishing line across the pond ended with a hook in the bushes.

Word: Flint
Meaning: a solid rigid rock that is usually used in order to make a flame
Example: A leader from the Boy Scouts Troop 997 quickly showed the boys how to use flint in starting a fire in the wilderness.

Word: Flinty
Meaning: resembling the hardness of flint
Example: The man continued to grind his feet against the flinty ground in an attempt to get the mud off of his shoes.

Word: Flip
Meaning: to turnover or cause something to turnover suddenly
Example: Waiting on her stylist; the woman began to flip through a book in search of the perfect cut.

Word: Flippancy
Meaning: a manner that lacks respect or seriousness
Example: The unserious worker’s flippancy caused him to be fired from his job.

Word: Flippant
Meaning: lacking proper respect or seriousness
Example: The student’s flippant actions towards the teacher got him suspended from school.

Word: Float
Meaning: to stay atop of water in a resting or moving way
Example: Once the sink was filled with water; the soap would float across from one side to the other.

Word: Floccinaucinihilipilification
Meaning: approximating something as of having no value or rubbish
Example: Since there was very little education derived from comics; teachers rarely used them as reading material due to this floccinaucinihilipilification.

Word: Flocculent
Meaning: fluffy; wool-like appearance
Example: The Pomeranian was so flocculent that is resembled a fluffy cotton ball.

Word: Flock
Meaning: a group of one type of birds
Example: The flock of seagulls flew over the ocean looking for any fish it could grab for food.

Word: Flog
Meaning: to beat with a stick or whip

Word: Flood
Meaning: a larger amount of water than can fit into the container which causes it to spill over the sides

Word: Flop
Meaning: to drop down in a hefty and wobbly way
Example: After a long day at work; the girls flop down on the sofa and won’t move for an hour.

Word: Floppy
Meaning: limp or loose
Example: The rabbit’s floppy ears bounced around as it hopped through the tall grass.

Word: Flora
Meaning: all of the plants located in a particular habitat
Example: Flora in the eastern region includes over 7000 types of plants.

Word: Florid
Meaning: to have a red or rosy complexion
Example: The police officer was florid after being held up by a six-year old boy with a water pistol.

Word: Flotilla
Meaning: a group of ships or boats

Word: Flotsam

Example: According to the old saying; one man’s flotsam is another man’s treasure.

Word: Flounce
Meaning: to storm or stomp around in an agitated way
Example: Feeling misunderstood; the girl decided to flounce off in a huff.

Word: Flounder
Meaning: to act clumsily or confused
Example: The new swimmer had to flounder in the deep end until the lifeguard dragged him to safety.

Word: Flourish
Meaning: to develop well 
Example: The fertile ground and ample water supply will allow the crops to flourish.

Word: Flout
Meaning: to intentionally disobey (a law; rule; convention)
Example: People find themselves in trouble because they think they’re clever enough to flout the law without getting caught.

Word: Flow 
Meaning: a constant movement of something
Example: After nicking my finger with a knife while slicing vegetables; the flow of blood took a while before stopping.

Word: Flower
Meaning: the part of a plant that develops into a seed or fruit
Example: Snails like to munch on plant parts such as orchid flower spikes and buds.

Word: Flown
Meaning: travelled by air; a verb tense of fly
Example: During the riots; we were flown out of the city by helicopter.

Word: Flu
Meaning: shortened form of influenza-a highly contagious upper respiratory virus
Example: Although there are vaccines to defend against the virus; flu strains vary and can’t fully be protected against.

Word: Flubdub
Meaning: empty talk that is considered nonsense
Example: The students got in trouble for their flubdub; especially since their talk wasn’t about school work.

Meaning: to shift back and forth uncertainly
Example: Each day; the price of gold will fluctuate on the market.

Word: Fluffy

Word: Gainsay

Word: Gait

Word: Galactic
Meaning: relating to a system of millions or billions of stars in the solar system
Example: Our galaxy is the Milky Way and our closest galactic neighbor is the star system Andromeda.

Word: Galaxy
Meaning: a group of many stars; along with gas; dust; and dark matter
Example: Our galaxy; the Milky Way; is made up of the sun; planets; asteroids; millions of stars; and other space junk.

Word: Gale
Meaning: a very strong wind
Example: My favorite hat was blown off my head by the gale as I ran from into the house from my car.

Word: Gall
Meaning: daring conduct
Example: After Paul made the mistake; he had the gall to blame me for his error.

Word: Gallant
Meaning: fearless and daring
Example: Despite being outnumbered the gallant soldiers were eager for battle.

Word: Gallery
Meaning: a room or a building used for showing works of art for sale
Example: There is no lack of people who attracted to what may be considered unusual art shown in a gallery.

Word: Gallimaufry
Meaning: a confused mess of things
Example: The excuses of the young children was a gallimaufry of nonsense; each of them saying something different that made no sense.

Word: Galling
Meaning: triggering annoyance or anger
Example: The fraud allegation was galling and really upset the honest minister.

Word: Gallivanting
Meaning: to roam from place to place for pleasure or excitement
Example: The mischievous wanderer was gallivanting around town in search of something to entertain himself; paying no heed to those around him.

Word: Gallon
Meaning: a fluid measurement that equates to sixteen pints
Example: The mother knew she would need to buy a gallon of milk in order for her family of four to have enough milk for the week.

Word: Gallop
Meaning: when a horse runs at full speed
Example: The startled horse broke into a swift gallop and darted through the trees.

Word: Gallows
Meaning: a construction frame on which people are hanged for their crimes 
Example: The gallows is a structure that was once used to put people to death by hanging.

Word: Galore
Meaning: in a huge amount
Example: Because there is food galore at the party; I know I will not go hungry.

Word: Galvanize
Meaning: to inspire people to work towards change
Example: Do you think the child’s death will galvanize town residents to the point they will stand up to drug dealers?

Word: Gambit
Meaning: something done or said in order to gain a benefit or advantage
Example: The general’s gambit did not pay off; and soon we were surrounded by enemy soldiers.

Word: Gamble
Meaning: to play a game against odds for a chance at winning money
Example: At the casino; players gamble by placing coins into slot machines for the chance of winning a jackpot prize.

Word: Gamble
Meaning: a bet or wager on an event
Example: Some people like to gamble on the lottery even though the odds are against them.

Word: Gambol
Meaning: jump or run in a playful manner
Example: Because of the rain; students are unable to gambol on the playground during recess.

Word: Game-Changer
Meaning: an event or idea that dramatically changes the course or process of something
Example: The invention of the tank was a major game-changer for the face of war; which had relied on cavalry before troops were mechanized.

Word: Gamete
Meaning: a developed sex cell that has only one set of unpaired chromosomes
Example: During sexual procreation a gamete merges with another gamete to produce a fertilized egg.

Word: Gamut
Meaning: an entire range
Example: The company has a gamut of products ranging from infant toys to electrical wall outlets.

Word: Gangrene
Meaning: the rot and decay of an area of the body that suffered from infection or a wound that usually needed to be amputated
Example: The injured soldier’s wound became infected until gangrene set in; and the doctor’s were forced to cut off the dead tissue.

Word: Gap
Meaning: a space in between two things
Example: The gap between the seat and the center console was just wide enough for the keys to fall down in.

Word: Gape
Meaning: to stare at someone with your mouth wide open
Example: The men are sure to gape when they see Teresa in her tiny shorts.

Word: Garage
Meaning: a building attached to a house where cars are kept
Example: The homeowners added on a two-car garage that was just big enough to hold both of their vehicles.

Word: Garble
Meaning: to alter the sound or meaning of something
Example: The drunk man will often garble his words to the point that they are not understandable.

Word: Garden
Meaning: a piece of ground; often near a house; used for growing flowers; fruit; or vegetables
Example: The chef had a large herb garden in his backyard so that he always had fresh spices available.

Word: Gargantuan
Meaning: of tremendous size
Example: It took five men to move the gargantuan bedframe into the house.

Word: Gargoyle
Meaning: an unusual and unpleasant-looking animal or human shape that protrudes from a building’s roof
Example: Many children are frightened by the stone gargoyle that sits on top of the roof of the building.

Word: Garish
Meaning: something that is elaborate; showy; striking and in bad taste
Example: Because she likes showing off her money; my wealthy aunt is known for wearing garish jewelry to casual events.

Word: Garment
Meaning: single item of clothing
Example: The saleswoman are very knowledgeable while helping me find the right garment to wear at my cousin’s wedding.

Word: Garner 
Meaning: to collect or accumulate
Example: The teacher allowed us to put up posters to garner interest in our club fundraiser.

Word: Garnish
Meaning: to enhance or improve; especially food in a decorative way
Example: Grated cheese and fancy pieces of tomato were used to garnish the salad bowl.

Word: Garrison
Meaning: a base or camp used by armed forces
Example: Once the troops make it to the garrison they will rest for the night.

Word: Garrulous
Meaning: overly talkative and chatty; mostly about unimportant things
Example: "Desperate for peace and quiet; Amanda told the garrulous man sitting next to her to ""Shut up!"""

Word: Gas
Meaning: a fluid substance that is air like and that can expand to fill any space
Example: The balloons were filled with gas so that they could float in the party hall.

Word: Gasconade
Meaning: to make particularly showy gestures to brag about an accomplishment
Example: The football player jumped on the cafeteria table and started to gasconade about his speed and ability to catch impossible throws.

Word: Gaseous
Meaning: related to or existing as gas
Example: The broken machine is leaking fuel; letting off a gaseous odor into the air.

Word: Gash
Meaning: a deep cut
Example: My brother Tim needed to have an operation to close a large gash on his arm.

Word: Gaslight
Meaning: to use psychological manipulation to sow seeds of doubt in a person’s mind and make them question their own sanity
Example: The psychopath will gaslight and tell blatant lies in an attempt to throw you off balance.

Word: Gasp
Meaning: a short; sudden intake of breath
Example: Seeing her father standing at the arrival gate; the soldier’s daughter let out a deep gasp.

Word: Gatekeeper
Meaning: a person or thing that controls access to something
Example: Motioning for the gatekeeper to let him in; the funeral director prepared to take the casket to the cemetery.

Word: Gauche
Meaning: lacking class or manners; awkward; tactless
Example: His gauche table manners make me cringe; especially when he tries to talk with his mouth full.

Word: Gaudy
Meaning: so showy that it is unattractive
Example: When Crystal returned from the nail salon; she showed me her gaudy nails that were painted bright orange.

Word: Gauge
Meaning: to measure a specific thing
Example: The poll is used to gauge the public’s opinion on the president.

Word: Gaunt
Meaning: extremely skinny; typically because of illness or starvation
Example: After being held in a dark basement for three months; the prisoner was gaunt and weak.

Word: Gauntlet 
Meaning: a sequence of demanding events	
Example: During boot camp; soldiers were challenged by a five-mile gauntlet.

Word: Gauze
Meaning: a thin and transparent fabric used for clothing; curtains; as well as medical purposes
Example: With no bandage available; the hiker had to use some old gauze from a first-aid kit to cover his wound.

Word: Gawk
Meaning: to stare stupidly
Example: People always gawk at us because we have seven children in our family.

Word: Gawky
Meaning: lacking grace in movement or posture
Example: He's intelligent; but gawky and socially inept; unable to communicate with anyone other than his family.

Word: Gay
Meaning: content and joyful
Example: Playing in the field on their day off of school; the young gay children giggled as they were cartwheeling and jumping around.

Word: Gaze
Meaning: to stare off; fixing your eyes on something
Example: Natalie stood on her hotel balcony; feeling thankful that she could gaze out at the sunset from such an amazing view.

Word: Gear
Meaning: apparel or equipment used for a certain purpose
Example: The news reported how heavy the police officers gear is and how it may slow them down when chasing suspects.

Word: Gee
Meaning: an expression used to show surprise or excitement
Example: “Oh; gee!” shouted Leah as she walked into the extremely messy house.

Word: Gelatinous
Meaning: having a consistency that is like jiggly like jelly
Example: A large heap of gelatinous noodles jiggled on the girl’s plate as she walked back to her table.

Word: Gelid
Meaning: extremely cold or icy
Example: The swimmer immediately regretted wading into the gelid waters; as the coldness of the lake was almost unbearable.

Word: Gem
Meaning: something that is prized because of its worth
Example: The building is a gem and is expected to get city landmark designation.

Word: Gene
Meaning: genes determine physical traits (how we look); such as hair type; hair and eye color; freckles; height; etc. genes are part of the cell - you inherent genes from your parents. 
Example: No one wants to inherit the balding gene; but it is a normal part of aging.

Word: Genealogy
Meaning: the history that explains how family members are related
Example: When Glen studied his family’s genealogy; he learned his ancestors came from Germany.

Word: General
Meaning: concerning a very broad array of things; or referring to something in a vague sense
Example: The general public includes everyone in your society; from the lowest tier to the absolute wealthiest.

Word: Generality
Meaning: an offhand comment not backed up by facts
Example: The presidential candidate made a generality about the growing dangers of global warming without offering any statistics.

Word: Generalize
Meaning: to make a broad statement based on limited facts
Example: I told Debra not to generalize by stating that all Chinese businesses are corrupt just because she had a bad experience with one of them.

Word: Generally speaking
Meaning: usually true; correct in most cases but not all
Example: Generally speaking; we don’t celebrate holidays; but we may go trick-or-treating this year.

Word: Generally
Meaning: usually; In most cases
Example: Generally; we do not accept checks; but we will make an exception.

Word: Generate
Meaning: to create or produce something
Example: The mayor promised to generate new jobs in the area; but none have been created as of yet.

Word: Generation
Meaning: a generation is all the people in a group or country who are of a similar age
Example: This generation of students doesn’t seem to care about school as much as their parents.

Word: Generation
Meaning: the average amount of time needed for children to grow up and have children of their own
Example: It’s not uncommon to learn that some diseases and health conditions can carry from one generation to the next.

Word: Generic
Meaning: describing something that is plain; uniform; or ordinary and typically forgettable
Example: The guards at the gate were rather generic today; being so plain that I can’t even remember what they looked like.

Word: Generosity
Meaning: the characteristic of being charitable and kind
Example: Because of your generosity; a deserving student can go to college.

Word: Generous
Meaning: displaying a willingness to give more than is expected
Example: The generous old woman decided to donate twenty five dollars to our organization even though we only asked for ten.

Word: Genesis

Example: Genesis is the first chapter of the Bible’s Old Testament.

Word: Genetics
Meaning: the area of biology that focuses on the passing of genetic traits
Example: When Tammy studied genetics in class; she learned her eye color differed from her parents because of recessive genes.

Word: Genial
Meaning: warm and welcoming 
Example: Santa Claus is such a genial man that children love to approach him.

Word: Genie
Meaning: a magic person that lives in a lamp and grants wishes to the person who calls on it
Example: The genie was trapped in the magic lamp for thousands of years before anyone rubbed the side.

Word: Genocide
Meaning: the purposeful murder of individuals of a particular people
Example: Armed troops are being sent to end the dictator’s genocide that has resulted in the deaths of over twenty thousand people.

Word: Genome
Meaning: the complete set of genetic material within an organism
Example: Each species on Earth has a different genome; with different DNA and genetic material to set them apart from other species.

Word: Genotype
Meaning: the genetic makeup of a particular organism or group of organisms
Example: If both of your parents have dark hair; you likely won’t have the genotype to be a blonde.

Word: Genre
Meaning: a particular type of music; writing; film; or art
Example: Though he did not normally enjoy movies in the horror genre; he found the trailer quite compelling.

Meaning: polite and well-mannered
Example: At the formal dinner; you are expected to behave in a genteel manner.

Meaning: softly or with light action

Word: Gentry
Meaning: a term used mainly in the past to refer to members of society’s upper class
Example: The gentry travelled in carriages while the poor people walked or rode on rickety wagons.

Word: Genuflect 
Meaning: to show great respect or devotion
Example: Faithful Catholics genuflect to the pope.

Word: Genuine
Meaning: real; authentic; and exactly as it appears
Example: When the bride took her engagement ring to be reset she was shocked to discover that her diamond was not genuine but cubic zirconia.

Word: Genus
Meaning: a genus is a class or group of something; usually used in biology to classify similar animals of different species
Example: Because it represents the group; the genus is the first part of an animal’s scientific name.

Word: Geocaching
Meaning: an outdoor game in which people hunt for hidden items and locate them using GPS

Word: Geocentric
Meaning: describes something that considers the earth its center
Example: For years; people believed in a geocentric model in which the earth is at the center of the universe.

Word: Geography
Meaning: the nature and relative arrangement of places and physical features 
Example: Jessica’s knowledge of geography was so terrible that she thought China was next to Mexico.

Word: Geology
Meaning: that portion of science associated with rocks and their relevance in the history of an area or planet
Example: In the study of geology; rocks are placed into distinct categories according to certain characteristics.

Word: Geothermal
Meaning: relating to the internal heat of the earth
Example: Geothermal energy is created deep down in the earth and can provide heating and cooling for your home.

Word: Germ
Meaning: the onset of an idea that can turn into something big and important
Example: Most successful movies and novels start with a germ of an idea to become hits with the audience.

Word: Germane
Meaning: relating to a subject in an appropriate way
Example: Since we were running out of time; our professor asked us to limit our questions to those germane to today’s lecture.

Word: Germinate
Meaning: to mature or develop
Example: Without sunlight; the seeds will not germinate.

Word: Gerrymander
Meaning: to separate an entity like a region or state into political divisions so that one party has an unjust advantage
Example: The politician hoped to gerrymander the western states so his party could control electoral regions.

Word: Gestalt 
Meaning: an entity viewed as more than a collection of its parts
Example: In the field of psychology; gestalt is seen as a combined entity or whole.

Word: Gestapo

Example: In 1933; Adolf Hitler became chancellor of Germany and the Gestapo were established as a secret police force.

Example: When Jason got angry; he started to gesticulate his feelings with his hands.

Word: Gesture

Example: I was offended by the gesture the man made with his middle finger.

Word: Getup

Word: Gewgaw

Word: Gong

Word: Gooey

Meaning: a silly or goofy person

Word: Hamartia
Meaning: a fatal flaw that leads to the demise of a hero or protagonist
Example: Most tragic heroes have some sort of personal weakness; or a hamartia; that leads to their downfall in the story.

Word: Hamlet
Meaning: a small rural settlement without a church
Example: The hamlet was situated on the outskirts of a larger village.

Word: Hammer
Meaning: to drive something by force
Example: The camp director tried unsuccessfully to hammer the tent stakes into the frozen ground.

Word: Hammock
Meaning: a swinging bed; usually made of netting or canvas that is hung up by each end; often from trees
Example: Swaying on her back in the hammock; the resting woman took an afternoon siesta.

Word: Hammy
Meaning: overly dramatic and theatrical
Example: The actress’s hammy performance wasn’t terrible; but it was a tad bit over-the-top.

Word: Hamper
Meaning: to delay progress
Example: This awful traffic is definitely going to hamper our trip to the beach.

Word: Hand over
Meaning: to pass off responsibility or a task to someone else
Example: Diana has agreed to hand over the art project to her sister since she doesn’t enjoy painting anymore.

Word: Handdog
Meaning: shamefaced; ashamed
Example: With a handdog face; the boy hung his head low and admitted that he had stolen the money from his father’s wallet.

Word: Handful
Meaning: a small amount
Example: A handful of parents showed up to the midday meeting while the rest chose to come at night.

Word: Handicraft
Meaning: an activity or craft that requires with the hands
Example: Shoemaking was once a handicraft; respected in the days when shoemakers formed boots by hand.

Word: Handily
Meaning: done in a skillful or practical way
Example: The runner handily tossed the baton to his teammate who took off toward the finish line.

Word: Handiwork
Meaning: work that is done skillfully with one’s hands
Example: The completed masterpiece was the handiwork of a world-class painter who loved to work with watercolors.

Word: Handkerchief
Meaning: a square piece of material carried in one’s pocket to be used to wipe their nose or face
Example: The widow cried many tears into her soft handkerchief at her husband’s funeral.

Word: Handle
Meaning: to control or manage
Example: Fifty students on a field trip is too many for even a seasoned teacher to handle.

Word: Hands down
Meaning: easily; without question
Example: We thought our team would win the game hands down; but it was much harder than expected.

Word: Hands-on
Meaning: experience earned from activity that uses the body instead of just book learning
Example: The teacher allows the children to take part in hands-on science experiments in which they get to dig around in the dirt.

Word: Handsome
Meaning: attractive with masculine features
Example: The handsome prince attracted fair maidens from every nearby kingdom.

Word: Handsomely
Meaning: generously; substantially
Example: After calling a tip in to the crime hotline; the informant was rewarded handsomely for his information.

Word: Handy
Meaning: useful; practical
Example: The woman’s husband was not a good cook; but was handy around the house when things needed to be fixed.

Word: Hangar 
Meaning: a place where aircraft are kept when not in use
Example: Because the hangar was damaged during the storm; we had to place the airplane in a local barn.

Word: Hanger
Meaning: a shaped piece of metal; wood; or plastic that is used to suspend things like clothing
Example: The woman went into a rage when a wire hanger was used to hang up a dress in the closet.

Word: Hangover
Meaning: a severe headache caused by drinking too much alcohol
Example: Some drinkers never get a hangover while others heads hurt after one drink.

Word: Hanker
Meaning: to yearn or pine to do something
Example: After years of an unhappy marriage; the man begin to hanker to have an affair.

Word: Hankering
Meaning: to have an endless craving for or to do something
Example: I hope my husband has a hankering for fried chicken since that’s what we’re having for dinner.

Word: Haphazard
Meaning: random; chaotic; incomplete
Example: Compared to her mother’s organized system; Jen’s approach to housekeeping was haphazard; at best.

Word: Hapless
Meaning: having no luck; unfortunate
Example: When Jason lost his wife and job on the same day; he knew he was a hapless soul.

Word: Haploid
Meaning: having a single set of unpaired chromosomes
Example: Haploid drones have 16 chromosomes and not 32 like the diploid queen.

Meaning: to occur
Example: The king wanted to take on a second wife; but the queen would never allow that to happen.

Meaning: take place; occur
Example: Accidents happen during potty training; so make sure to keep extra clothes on hand.

Meaning: a chance situation or coincidence
Example: The coffeeshop conversation was happenstance; a coincidental meeting that lead to a whirlwind romance.

Word: Happier
Meaning: having more joy
Example: Money might not buy happiness; but I would be much happier driving a Porsche than a Pinto.

Meaning: in a happy way
Example: The playful dog barked happily when her owner returned from work.

Word: Happiness
Meaning: pleasure; joy
Example: Happiness exuded from the new bride’s face as she enjoyed her wedding day festivities.

Word: Happy hour
Meaning: the time each day when a bar or restaurant sells drinks at a reduced price
Example: Happy hour drinks at Sonic are always half price between two and four.

Word: Happy
Meaning: feeling or showing pleasure; joy; or contentment
Example: At their beautiful wedding; the happy couple smiled from ear to ear.

Word: Haptic
Meaning: related to the sense of touch
Example: Being haptic; the robot was able to sense if an object came close enough to touch.

Example: The firefighters showed their bravery and heroism when they were able to retrieve the family members from the burning house right before it crashed to the ground.

Word: Heron
