Word: Hyperbolic
Meaning: related to language that is extremely exaggerated
Example: While Jim fought only one attacker during the mugging attempt; he changed his story into a hyperbolic tale by adding a few other attackers.

Word: Hypercritical
Meaning: overcritical; always finding fault
Example: The girl’s father is hypercritical; always finding fault in everything she does.

Word: Hypertonic
Meaning: a solution that contains more dissolved salt or electrolytes than is found in normal cells and blood
Example: The hypertonic solution was so salty that it could be safely ingested.

Word: Hyperventilate
Meaning: to breathe at a very rapid rate
Example: Erratic breathing while exercising can lead you to hyperventilate.

Word: Hyphenate
Meaning: to divide by a small line or dash
Example: Some people wrongfully hyphenate words like “un-covered” and “jelly-fish” because it doesn’t need a hyphen in them.

Word: Hypnosis
Meaning: a trancelike state of altered consciousness in which a person is more susceptible to suggestions
Example: Placing the patient into a state of hypnosis; the doctor was able to offer suggestions that would help him quit smoking.

Word: Hypnotic
Meaning: tending to induce sleep
Example: If I take too high a dosage of the medication; its hypnotic affect will cause me to drift into a deep sleep.

Word: Hypnotic
Meaning: mesmerizing; spell-binding
Example: After being placed in a trance; the sound of a spoon clicking against the teacup sent the victims into a hypnotic state.

Word: Hypnotize
Meaning: to fascinate in a way that captures one’s full attention
Example: The sway in the woman’s hips seemed to hypnotize the men who drooled as they stared.

Word: Hypochondriac
Meaning: one who believes he or she is always ill
Example: Because my uncle is a hypochondriac; he is quick to diagnose himself with a life-threatening illness.

Word: Hypocorism
Meaning: is a pet name or nickname
Example: Although his name was Barry; his hypocorism was the Flash.

Word: Hypocrisy
Meaning: the practice of professing standards; beliefs; etc; opposite to one's real character or actual behavior
Example: Students protested that the rule about cell phones was just a bunch of hypocrisy because teachers were always using their cell phones.

Word: Hypocritical
Meaning: describes behavior that goes against what one claims to believe
Example: The hypocritical protesters shouted threats to the abortion clinic workers but refused to financially support the mothers who give birth to the unwanted infants.

Word: Hypodermic
Meaning: associated with the area under the skin
Example: The drug addict stole hypodermic needles from the pharmacy.

Word: Hypotenuse
Meaning: the longest side of a right triangle
Example: Using the Pythagorean Theorem; the mathematician was able to find the triangle’s hypotenuse as well as its shorter sides.

Word: Hypothalamus
Meaning: a small part of the brain that controls the autonomic nervous system and the secretion of hormones
Example: After an injury to the hypothalamus region of his brain; the patient had trouble with his appetite and metabolism.

Word: Hypothecate
Meaning: to pledge property as security for a debt
Example: To get their son out of jail; the family had to hypothecate their property in lieu of a cash bond.

Word: Hypothermia
Meaning: a dangerous drop in body temperature brought on by cold temperature
Example: Most victims of the sinking of died not from drowning; but from hypothermia brought on by the icy water.

Word: Hypothesis
Meaning: a proposed explanation or theory that is studied through scientific testing
Example: The scientist’s hypothesis did not stand up; since research data was inconsistent with his guess.

Word: Hypothesize
Meaning: to come up with an educated guess based on prior knowledge or statistics
Example: Scientists hypothesize that the Big Bang Theory was not actually caused by a giant meteor but ozone depletion.

Word: Hypothetical 
Meaning: founded on a theory or idea that has not been verified as true
Example: For an assignment; each student had to write a response to a hypothetical scenario as though it had actually occurred.

Word: Hypothetically
Meaning: being considered as a possibility but not yet reality
Example: Hypothetically going through a black hole could lead us to an alternate universe; but we have no way of confirming that theory.

Word: Hypothyroidism
Meaning: a condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain important hormones
Example: A diagnosis of hypothyroidism was given to the patient when bloodwork showed her thyroid gland was not producing adequate amounts of hormones.

Word: Hypotrophy
Meaning: gradual degeneration of an organ or tissue caused by a loss of cells
Example: Although hypotrophy involves the degeneration of tissue; it is a key part of building body muscle.

Word: Hypoxia
Meaning: a medical or scientific condition in which there are low levels of oxygen concertation in the body or water
Example: Sea life is all but suffocated when hypoxia causes oxygen depletion in the water.

Word: Hysteria
Meaning: a situation of unrestrained enthusiasm or intense fear
Example: The hostages were in a state of hysteria when they were rescued by the police.

Word: Hysterical
Meaning: affected by uncontrolled emotions
Example: The hysterical play kept the audience cackling the entire show.

Word: Hysterically
Meaning: done with uncontrolled or extreme emotions
Example: Out of the blue; the insane woman began to cackle hysterically.

Word: Hysterics
Meaning: an uncontainable crying or laughing spell
Example: The widow was in a state of hysterics at her husband’s funeral.

Word: Ibidem
Meaning: denotes a footnote citation that was already referenced in a prior footnote
Example: Because I had already written the footnote once; when it came up on another page later I simply marked it as Ibidem.

Word: Icicle
Meaning: a hanging piece of ice that is formed when dripping water freezes
Example: In order for an icicle to grow; a constant flowing stream of water must be moving over the ice.

Word: Icon
Meaning: a person who is very famous or popular
Example: Michael Jackson was a global icon; known around the world for his music and performing abilities.

Word: Iconic
Meaning: very famous or popular
Example: Iconic venues in the city draw in site-seers from all over the globe.

Word: Iconoclast
Meaning: someone who attacks the beliefs; customs; and opinions that most people in a society accept
Example: Because Jared was an iconoclast and dared to question the company’s mission; he was fired from his job.

Word: Idea
Meaning: a thought or opinion
Example: Each idea the intern offered was initially turned down by management; but later used without credit being given.

Word: Ideal
Meaning: perfect; model
Example: The ideal environment for the polar bear is somewhere with cold temperatures and plentiful amounts of ice.

Word: Idealism
Meaning: believing in or pursuing some perfect vision or belief that is unrealistic
Example: Steeped in idealism; most of the middle-aged woman’s financial goals were either impractical unrealistic.

Word: Idealist
Meaning: someone who pursues a certain idea or goal; even when it is unrealistic
Example: An idealist at heart; the woman agreed to the loan terms even though she knew the payments were too expensive for her budget.

Word: Idealize
Meaning: regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality 
Example: Jay Gatsby like to idealize his past relationship with Daisy as a fairy tale; when in reality they were constantly fighting.

Word: Ideation
Meaning: the forming of ideas
Example: Positive ideation can keep your mind centered and focused on the path ahead.

Word: Identical
Meaning: an exact copy
Example: The set of identical twins always confuse their teachers and sometimes their parents!

Word: Identification
Meaning: something that identifies a person; animal; or thing
Example: Showing identification to the clerk; the passenger was able to board the bus with no problem.

Word: Identify
Meaning: to select something based on noticeable characteristics
Example: Eyewitnesses were able to identify the suspect by the unusual tattoo he had in the middle of his forehead.

Word: Identity
Meaning: who someone is
Example: With a blonde wig and dark trench coat; the celebrity’s identity was unrecognizable.

Word: Ideogram
Meaning: a written symbol that represents an idea or object
Example: An ideogram with a cigarette and an X over it was placed on the door; warning patrons that no smoking was allowed in the building.

Word: Ideology
Meaning: principles or beliefs associated with a group or person
Example: When Jeff’s governmental ideology changed; he decided to start his own political party.

Word: Idiocy
Meaning: stupidity
Example: The intellectual community is appalled by the idiocy of those who do not acknowledge scientific research.

Word: Idiom
Meaning: a phrase or sentence that contains a meaning that is different than its individual words
Example: Even though the Japanese student knew every vocabulary word in the idiom; he failed to know what the expression meant.

Word: Idiomatic
Meaning: a phrase that is specific to a particular language or time period
Example: My grandmother loves idiomatic phrases like the pot calling the kettle black.

Word: Idiopathic
Meaning: relating to a disease that manifests spontaneously or that has no known cause
Example: Josh’s idiopathic arthritis arrived out of the blue when he was just 25 years old.

Word: Idiosyncrasy
Meaning: an odd habit or peculiar behavior; behavior or way of thought specific to an individual
Example: Her worst idiosyncrasy involved repeating back every word that was said to her.

Word: Idiosyncratic
Meaning: quirky or peculiar behavior or traits of an individual
Example: The strange bird let out a high-pitched sound that is idiosyncratic to its species.

Word: Idiot
Meaning: a stupid person
Example: The senseless idiot was able to solve the math problem one plus one.

Word: Idle
Meaning: not in use; inactive
Example: Since the taxi driver has not had any fares in a while; his car has been idle.

Word: Idleness
Meaning: inactivity; laziness
Example: The lazy sheep herder’s idleness caused him to fall asleep in the field while a wolf lurked nearby.

Word: Idly
Meaning: inactively; lazily
Example: The lazy boy stood idly by as the rest of his siblings helped unload the groceries from the car.

Word: Idol
Meaning: hero
Example: Ruby Bridges is an idol for young school girls around the world who admire her courage and bravery.

Word: Idolatry 
Meaning: extreme devotion to something or someone who is not a god
Example: It is sad how many people exhibit idolatry towards celebrities.

Word: Idolize
Meaning: to adore; admire; or love greatly
Example: The teen had begun to idolize the pop singer and had posters of them plastering her bedroom walls.

Word: Idyllic
Meaning: happy; peaceful; picturescue
Example: The tiny town by the sea is an idyllic place for the young couple to raise their twin daughters.

Word: Iffy
Meaning: uncertain or unsettled
Example: I am iffy on taking the job offer since the hours are long and the pay is a little low.

Word: Igneous
Meaning: solidified from lava or magma
Example: After the volcano erupted and lava covered the ground; many igneous rocks were created.

Word: Ignite
Meaning: to arouse or give energy to a situation
Example: The march in Selma was just what Dr. Martin Luther King needed to ignite others around the nation.

Word: Ignition
Meaning: the action of setting something on fire
Example: Firefighters suspected arson but could not located an ignition source.

Word: Ignoble
Meaning: not deserving respect; not honorable
Example: Because Frank has a habit of not showing up on time; he has an ignoble reputation as someone who is not very responsible.

Word: Ignominious
Meaning: very embarrassing; shameful or disgraceful
Example: When the boxer got knocked out in the first round; everyone knew it was the beginning of an ignominious defeat for him.

Word: Ignominy
Meaning: public shame or disgrace
Example: After being confronted about the theft; the official left the room in ignominy.

Word: Ignoramus
Meaning: someone who is completely uninformed
Example: The reporter proved he was an ignoramus when he gave out false information during the broadcast.

Word: Ignorance
Meaning: lack of knowledge; unawareness
Example: The woman’s ignorance regarding Hispanic culture led her to assume that everyone who speaks Spanish is Mexican.

Word: Ignorant
Meaning: lacking knowledge; uninformed
Example: My little sister was ignorant of the rules of the playground and pushed and shoved all of the other children.

Word: Ignore
Meaning: refusing to acknowledge someone or something
Example: My husband’s ability to ignore the television while sleeping is amazing to a light sleeper like myself.

Word: Ilk
Meaning: a type of individual who is similar to others in a certain category
Example: Only famous entertainers; athletes; and people of this ilk are allowed inside the VIP club area.

Word: Ill will
Meaning: wishing someone harm
Example: Despite the fact that William cheated on her; Briana wished him no ill will.

Word: Ill-Advised
Meaning: inadvisable; foolish; or unwise
Example: I think you would be ill-advised to go sky diving without a parachute; but if you don’t believe me I won’t have a chance to say I told you so.

Word: Ill-fated
Meaning: destined to fail; cursed with bad luck
Example: Romeo and Juliet’s ill-fated relationship was doomed from the day they laid eyes on one another.

Word: Illegality
Meaning: an act that is prohibited by law
Example: One illegality that we are all familiar with is murder; but some people seem to forget that littering and loitering are crimes as well.

Word: Illegible
Meaning: not clear enough to be read or understood
Example: The cashier refused to cash my check because she could not understand the check writer’s illegible signature.

Word: Illegitimate
Meaning: not authentic; genuine; official; or recognized as the real deal
Example: Deckson is considered an illegitimate son because he was born out of wedlock and not from the same father as the man his mother is married to.

Word: Illicit
Meaning: going against what is considered to be normal
Example: I dumped my boyfriend because of his illicit drug habit.

Word: Illiterate
Meaning: incapable of writing and reading
Example: The illiterate man could not complete the job application.

Word: Illness
Meaning: a disease or sickness of the body
Example: After coming down with a strange illness; the sick girl could no longer walk or talk.

Word: Illogical
Meaning: lacking sense or sound reasoning; contrary to logic
Example: An argument cannot be won with illogical reasoning.

Word: Illogical
Meaning: lacking sense or clear reasoning
Example: It is illogical to believe that someone could tell your future since there is little scientific proof that psychics are real.

Word: Illuminate
Meaning: to bring attention to or shine light upon
Example: Hopefully the justice department’s investigation will illuminate the police corruption in the small town.

Word: Illusion
Meaning: something that appears to look like something; but it actually is not
Example: The mirrored walls in the fun house created an optical illusion which made it difficult to walk afterwards.

Word: Illusive
Meaning: based on an illusion or something that isn’t real
Example: The pond the hiker saw in the distance was only an illusive mirage and not a real source of water.

Word: Illusory
Meaning: founded on something that is not genuine 
Example: Linda started an illusory friendship with her rival as part of her plan to destroy the girl’s reputation.

Word: Illustrate
Meaning: provide with pictures
Example: Once the preschool book was written; the artist was hired to carefully illustrate the book with a picture on every page.

Word: Illustrious
Meaning: respectable because of one’s accomplishments
Example: The leader of the country will recognize the illustrious scientist in a private ceremony.

Word: Image
Meaning: a visual representation of a person or object
Example: The camera was used to take a still-shot image of the fruit sitting on the table.

Word: Imagery 
Meaning: images of objects or people or words that convey these visuals in creative works
Example: The church refused the donated portrait because of the satanic imagery it contained.

Word: Imaginable
Meaning: feasible; possible; or able to be conceivably thought
Example: In the past; such a thing as spaceflight would not have been imaginable; but yet here we are; having visited the Moon.

Word: Imaginary
Meaning: existing only in the imagination; make-believe
Example: My family makes fun of me since I always had an imaginary friend when I was younger instead of befriending my classmates.

Word: Imagination
Meaning: the creative ability to form images; ideas; and sensations in the mind
Example: The creative writing teacher expected her students to use their imagination when writing their poems so that it would showcase their artistic talent.

Word: Imaginative
Meaning: containing original and interesting ideas
Example: Every applicant knew that the new job of instructional designer would require an imaginative mind in order to create such motivating lessons for middle schoolers.

Word: Imagine
Meaning: to visualize or see a picture of something in one’s mind
Example: When I’m sad; I close my eyes and imagine happier times to lift my spirits.

Word: Imbalance
Meaning: lack of balance or being out of proportion
Example: An imbalance of the number of men and women in Alaska makes it extremely difficult for a man to find a wife.

Word: Imbalance
Meaning: something that is out of proportion or off center
Example: An extreme vitamin imbalance gave the runner such high iron that her liver shut down.

Word: Imbecile
Meaning: a word used to describe a person who behaves in a stupid or foolish manner
Example: The teacher was reprimanded for referring to one of her students as an imbecile because he constantly asked silly questions.

Word: Imbibe
Meaning: to drink (used frequently of alcoholic beverages)
Example: Best practice dictates that anyone who intends to imbibe alcoholic beverages should make sure to have dependable transportation to get home.

Word: Imbroglio
Meaning: a confusing situation
Example: Will the treaty end this imbroglio that has kept the two countries at war for over sixty years?

Word: Imbue
Meaning: to cause to be strongly influenced by a quality or emotion
Example: After the terrorist bombings; the government placed several of the country’s flags at the site of the ruins to imbue patriotism.

Word: Imitate
Meaning: to copy or simulate the function of something else
Example: Young children will often attempt to imitate their parents; which is why you shouldn’t do anything you wouldn’t want your child to do while they’re watching.

Word: Imitation
Meaning: a copy or fake version of a genuine article or object
Example: Even though it’s an imitation; the copy of the painting sold for almost as much as the original.

Word: Immaculate
Meaning: without any blemish or imperfection
Example: Since I am having guests over for dinner; my house must be cleaned until it is immaculate.

Word: Immaterial 
Meaning: not relevant
Example: The judge told the jury to disregard the testimony because it was immaterial to the trial.

Word: Immature
Meaning: not fully developed to adulthood
Example: A human is immature for many years; having to go through nearly two decades of development before becoming an adult.

Word: Immediacy
Meaning: being immediate or urgent
Example: The manic man talks with immediacy as if his words are being driven by a motor.

Word: Immediate
Meaning: without delay; instant
Example: When code blue was announced on the intercom of the hospital; everyone noticed the immediate attention of every nurse was revealed as they ran for the door.

Word: Immense
Meaning: of a gigantic size
Example: The museum was so immense it took us two days to make our way through it.

Word: Immensity
Meaning: great size
Example: While hiking on a month-long mountainous trip; Davy felt the immensity of the wilderness.

Word: Immerse
Meaning: to become deeply involved in something
Example: To keep her mind off her divorce; Jill will immerse herself in work.

Word: Immersive
Meaning: surrounding a person in a way that makes them feel completely involved in the moment or process
Example: Many English programs adopt an immersive approach that requires the learner to be completely surrounded with people speaking the new language.

Word: Immigrant
Meaning: a person who comes to a country from another country in order to permanently settle there
Example: Since my grandfather was an immigrant from Sweden; he brought his Swedish culture and traditions to the United States with him.

Word: Immigrate
Meaning: to leave one country to permanently stay in another country
Example: Sari would like to immigrate to the United States and find a better life than the one she has in Syria.

Word: Immigration
Meaning: the act of permanently relocating to a different country
Example: During the immigration process; the Chinese citizen was permitted to move to France.

Word: Imminent
Meaning: likely to occur at any moment
Example: When the Secret Service arrived; everyone knew the president’s arrival was imminent.

Word: Immobile
Meaning: not moving; motionless
Example: After falling off of his porch; the elderly man became immobile and couldn’t move his leg.

Word: Immoderate
Meaning: excessive
Example: An immoderate amount of compliments was dished out towards the employer so that it seemed like the employee was simply trying to get a raise instead of speaking honestly.

Word: Immodest
Meaning: lacking modesty and decency
Example: Her immodest nature of thinking everyone was beneath her created an unfriendly atmosphere for her.

Word: Immolation
Meaning: the act of killing or sacrificing somebody
Example: Eating nothing but candy is a sure path towards immolation of your health.

Word: Immoral
Meaning: morally wrong
Example: Today it is considered immoral to murder someone; but during the ancient times murder was common.

Word: Immorality
Meaning: state or quality of being immoral or evil
Example: Several students at the school were suspended due to the immorality of their conduct when they pushed and made fun of a special needs student.

Word: Immortal
Meaning: one who is not susceptible to death
Example: Angels are immortal beings; incapable of death.

Word: Immovable
Meaning: unable to be moved
Example: The bumbling robbers became quickly aware that the ATM machine was securely fixed to an immovable wall so that it could not be taken.

Word: Immune
Meaning: exempt or protected from something unpleasant
Example: Since I have been a teacher; I have not been sick one day due to being immune from most childhood sicknesses after countless exposure.

Word: Immunity
Meaning: freedom from punishment or prosecution
Example: Since the accomplice lied on the stand; he is not eligible for immunity and may serve time in jail.

Word: Immunization
Meaning: the process of protecting a person against an illness; typically by vaccine
Example: After receiving my shots; I knew my immunization records would be up-to-date which would allow me to register for school.

Word: Immunize
Meaning: to make something immune or invulnerable to something else
Example: We use vaccination to immunize the human body; making it highly resistant to certain contagions like the flu.

Word: Immunoglobulin
Meaning: any of the glycoproteins in blood serum that respond to invasion by foreign antigens and that protect the host by removing pathogens
Example: An immunoglobulin was detected in the man’s body that seemed to fight off his disease before it spread.

Word: Immure
Meaning: to lock up behind walls
Example: Caught robbing a bank; Jason knew the police would immure him in a jail cell for an extended period of time.

Word: Immutable
Meaning: unable to be changed
Example: Although I tried to get the bank president to change his mind about giving me the loan; I finally realized his decision was immutable.

Word: Imp
Meaning: a badly behaved child
Example: As the new teacher walked into the classroom; she realized the boy in front would be an imp not just the class clown.

Word: Impact
Meaning: have a strong effect on someone or something
Example: Rising pollution and increased burning of fossil fuels has had a huge impact on global warming.

Word: Impair
Meaning: damage or weaken something
Example: Alcohol can greatly impair your judgement.

Word: Impairment
Meaning: an injury or damage
Example: Following his car accident; the man suffered an impairment in which he could only walk with the help of a crutch.

Word: Impale
Meaning: to pierce with something sharp
Example: During the horror movie; the knife would impale the girl through the heart killing her instantly.

Word: Impalpable
Meaning: not capable of being physically touched
Example: While you can view the signs of love; you can’t touch love because it’s impalpable.

Word: Impart
Meaning: to distribute a portion of something
Example: A teacher’s job is to impart knowledge to her students.

Word: Impartial
Meaning: to not offer influence to any side 
Example: Since the judge is related to the defendant; it is not possible for him to be impartial during the trial.

Word: Impassable
Meaning: impossible to travel along
Example: Without having shoulders on the highway; the stalled car made it impassable for any traffic to go through to the next town.

Word: Impasse
Meaning: a situation that prevents advancement
Example: Yesterday; the two parties did not make any progress on the contract terms because they had reached an impasse.

Word: Impassioned
Meaning: overflowing with strong emotion
Example: The widow’s impassioned speech brought the members of congress to their feet.

Word: Impassive
Meaning: having; or revealing; no emotion; expressionless
Example: Even though it was very exciting; Jon delivered the news in an impassive voice in the hope that everyone would stay calm.

Word: Impatient
Meaning: restless or irritated under delay or opposition
Example: After waiting for half an hour in line; the impatient customer stormed out of the store and called the manager to complain.

Word: Impavid
Meaning: extreme courage or bravery
Example: Mongols were impavid warriors who rode into dangerous battles without a thought of death.

Word: Impeach
Meaning: to charge a public official with a crime
Example: Without sufficient evidence; you cannot hope to impeach a public official.

Word: Impeccable
Meaning: perfect in every way
Example: With your impeccable English skills; writing essays should be a cinch.

Word: Impecunious
Meaning: lacking money; penniless
Example: Since Janice grew up in an impecunious household; she knew a great deal about surviving on very little.

Word: Impede
Meaning: to interfere with or slow the progress of
Example: If you do not eat while you are sick; the lack of nutrients will impede your recovery.

Word: Impediment
Meaning: something that interferes with a person’s ability to complete a task
Example: My broken wrist is the impediment preventing me from finishing my new novel.

Word: Impedimenta
Meaning: oversized gear that makes it awkward to carry

Word: Impel
Meaning: to drive an individual to perform in a certain way
Example: The manufacturer hopes its commercial will impel us to purchase its new product.

Word: Impending
Meaning: going to occur; coming
Example: When I refused to pay the fake fortuneteller; she warned me of impending doom in my future.

Word: Impenetrable
Meaning: not capable of being entered
Example: If the castle is truly impenetrable; our enemies will never gain access to the king.

Word: Impenitent
Meaning: unapologetic; remorseless
Example: Even after being sentenced to life in prison; the impenitent man was not sorry for his crimes.

Word: Imperative
Meaning: essential
Example: If you’re serious about getting healthy; it’s imperative that you follow a healthy lifestyle; make the right food choices; and exercise regularly.

Word: Imperceptible
Meaning: not perceptible by a sense or by the mind
Example: When I had my headphones over my ears; the noise outside was imperceptible.

Word: Imperfect
Meaning: not perfect
Example: After misrepresenting herself on her resume; it was obvious to the company that she was really an imperfect candidate for the job.

Word: Imperfection
Meaning: a defect or flaw
Example: An imperfection in the painting surprisingly made it more valuable to collectors.

Word: Imperial
Meaning: relating to an empire; emperor; or the concept of imperialism
Example: If a member from an imperial family approaches you; then your response should be to bow before them.

Word: Imperialism
Meaning: a course of action that involves vigorously expanding a nation’s power over other countries by any means necessary
Example: The country’s inability to embrace imperialism is responsible for its lack of geographical expansion over the years.

Word: Imperil
Meaning: to be in danger of something or someone
Example: Although most people do see the threat; littering in the ocean can imperil many different marine life like dolphins due to their ingestion of plastic litter.

Word: Imperious
Meaning: domineering; expecting ones' orders to be followed
Example: The principal is an imperious woman who expects to be obeyed.

Word: Imperishable
Meaning: to last forever or at least for a long time
Example: To survive the Apocalypse; the worried man stockpiled his cellar with an array of imperishable products like dried beans and powdered milk.

Word: Impermanence
Meaning: the state of being temporary
Example: The impermanence of the new the car’s smell caused the woman to buy air fresheners.

Word: Impermeable
Meaning: not allowing substances to pass through
Example: The impermeable rain coat kept water from ruining the woman’s cashmere sweater.

Word: Impermissible
Meaning: not allowed
Example: The student knew having her cell phone at school was impermissible but brought it anyway.

Word: Impersonal
Meaning: having no interest in other people and lacking warmth or emotion; cold
Example: Breaking up with me over text was a very impersonal way to end our relationship.

Word: Impersonally
Meaning: remaining neutral and not showing feelings or personality
Example: Cookout invitations were sent out impersonally through a group text.

Word: Impersonate
Meaning: to deliberately act or appear like someone else
Example: Most people try to impersonate Elvis Presley by wearing a sparkling jumpsuit; dark sunglasses; and jet black hair; in addition to singing one of his songs.

Word: Impertinent
Meaning: behaving without proper respect; rude
Example: Although she thought she was just being funny; her teacher didn’t agree and sent her to the principal’s office for being impertinent.

Word: Imperturbable
Meaning: not disturbed or excited easily
Example: The imperturbable actress carried on with her performance even when her costar forgot his lines.

Word: Impervious
Meaning: not allowing something to enter or pass through
Example: Let us hope these thin walls are impervious to the freezing cold tonight!

Word: Impetuous
Meaning: acting without thinking—done impulsively; sudden decision
Example: His impetuous behavior landed him in prison.

Word: Impetus
Meaning: a force that causes something to be done or to become more active
Example: The high crime rate was the impetus for the hiring of one hundred new police officers in our city.

Word: Impiety
Meaning: lack of respect for God
Example: Speaking with impiety of holy things was a crime in the city-state; but few were ever prosecuted.

Word: Impinge
Meaning: to produce an effect; usually an unwanted one
Example: Hopefully the bad weather will move in a different direction and not impinge upon our plans for an outdoor reception.

Word: Impious
Meaning: lacking reverence or respect; especially towards a god
Example: His lack of protocol in the church caused him to gain a reputation for being impious.

Word: Impish
Meaning: acting in a childish way like a rascal
Example: As the strict businessman walked down Main Street; he took notice of the group of impish teenagers ahead of him yelling at the passersby.

Word: Implacable
Meaning: not capable of being appeased
Example: The little boy was implacable when his parents left him alone with the babysitter.

Word: Implant
Meaning: to embed or establish something in a fixed position
Example: When the stubborn child would get upset with his mother for not getting his wish; he would implant his foot firmly on the rug with a scowl on his face.

Word: Implausible
Meaning: unlikely or questionable
Example: The drug manufacturer was fined for making implausible claims about its weight loss products.

Word: Implement
Meaning: to put into effect
Example: The computer programmer estimates it will take twenty hours to implement the code changes in the software.

Word: Implementation
Meaning: the process of executing or putting a plan into motion
Example: Many people are calling for a nationwide gun registry; but implementation of such a program would be difficult.

Word: Implicate 
Meaning: to hint a person or object is responsible for something; often an illegal deed
Example: If the evidence is found; it will implicate the person behind the brutal act.

Word: Implication
Meaning: an idea or belief that is suggested from something else
Example: Cheryl’s hiding of her report card gave me the implication she had failed at least one of her classes.

Word: Implicit
Meaning: understood though not clearly or directly stated
Example: Although you never stated I could use your car; your permission was implicit when you handed me your car keys.

Word: Implode
Meaning: to explode inward
Example: Everyone was shocked to see the loving couple’s relationship implode and end in divorce.

Word: Implored
Meaning: sincerely begged 
Example: The little boy implored his kidnapper to let him go.

Word: Imply
Meaning: to hint at something without directly stating or presenting
Example: When I said I would never wear a blue dress; I was not trying to imply blue was not a good color choice for you.

Word: Impolite
Meaning: being rude
Example: Her impolite ways of constantly interrupting me every time I spoke made me want to avoid her at any cost.

Word: Impolitely
Meaning: doing something rudely or without manners
Example: Lucas impolitely burped at the table during dinner and failed to excuse himself.

Word: Impolitic
Meaning: foolish
Example: I realized it was an impolitic idea to talk on my cell phone and walk through a curvy path in the woods since I am aware of my clumsiness and no sense of direction.

Word: Imponderable
Meaning: difficult or impossible to comprehend or evaluate
Example: She wanted to enter the contest but guessing the amount of jelly beans in the barrel was imponderable.

Word: Import
Meaning: to bring in from a foreign country
Example: Due to the high tariffs placed on goods; the company decided to buy the raw materials in the United States instead of deciding to import them.

Word: Importance
Meaning: the value or substance of something
Example: The doctor always stresses to his patients the importance of a healthy diet and lots of exercise.

Word: Importance
Meaning: being of great value or worth
Example: The doctor explained the importance of eating healthy meals and getting rest to the sick patient.

Word: Importunate
Meaning: demanding in an annoying way
Example: My mother left her husband because he was an importunate man who treated her like an unpaid servant.

Word: Importune
Meaning: to request (someone) pressingly and persistently for or to do something
Example: Even after I had politely declined and shut the door; I could hear the salesman continuing to importune me to let him demonstrate the expensive vacuum cleaner.

Word: Impose
Meaning: to apply controls or rules
Example: To maintain order; the prison warden will impose as many rules as necessary to keep the inmates in line.

Word: Imposition
Meaning: an unreasonable and burdening demand or request
Example: Mary’s nature of imposition by always asking her co-workers to do her work caused her to lose her job.

Word: Impossibility
Meaning: the condition of something not being able to be done
Example: Elizabeth’s boss was classified as a scrooge by his employees; and Elizabeth saw the impossibility to make the job worthwhile.

Word: Impossible
Meaning: not possible; not able to be done or happen
Example: The employees grew angry with their boss for assigning such an impossible task of creating the monthly reports overnight.

Word: Impossibly
Meaning: in a way that is unnecessary or ridiculously extreme
Example: Because the line to get into the restaurant was impossibly long; the couple decided to eat at a different café.

Word: Imposter
Meaning: a person who pretends to be someone else in order to trick and deceive people
Example: The imposter mimicked our dad’s voice to perfection.

Word: Imposture 
Meaning: the act of deceiving while using a fake identity 
Example: The scam artist’s imposture involved convincing elderly people he could increase their retirement incomes for a small fee.

Word: Impotent
Meaning: lacking in power; as to act effectively; helpless
Example: When my husband was diagnosed with cancer; I felt impotent because I could not help him with his pain.

Word: Impound
Meaning: to remove and keep property by law
Example: After stopping payments on their new car; the bank would impound their car in a secured lot until the couple would pay the overdue amount.

Word: Impoverished
Meaning: wiped out financially; poor
Example: The impoverished girl knew she did not have enough money to attend college.

Word: Impractical
Meaning: not reasonable because it is unlikely to happen 
Example: Even though his son was very smart; it was impractical for the father to believe his son could learn quantum physics while in kindergarten.

Word: Incidentally
Meaning: by the way
Example: Incidentally; Joan is no longer returning my phone calls since she borrowed money from me.

Word: Incinerate
Meaning: destroy by burning
Example: If an atom bomb was dropped over Manhattan; the whole city would incinerate in a flash.

Word: Incipient
Meaning: just beginning to appear or develop
Example: Because the incipient plan has no backup measure; there is no chance it will succeed.

Word: Incised
Meaning: cut carefully with a sharp tool
Example: Using a scalpel; the surgeon incised the woman’s stomach and removed the tumor from her body.

Word: Incisive
Meaning: clear and direct; sharp
Example: The teacher’s incisive tone made it clear that she was done playing games.

Word: Incite
Meaning: to stir up or excite
Example: The racist man tried to incite hatred in his children by telling them falsehoods about minority groups.

Word: Inclement
Meaning: unpleasant weather in being stormy; rainy; or snowy
Example: Inclement weather is causing us to postpone our picnic.

Word: Inclination
Meaning: the tendency to act or feel a certain way about something or someone
Example: A coward’s natural inclination is to walk away from a fight.

Word: Incline
Meaning: a surface or area that tends to go upward
Example: Because of my knee injury; it is difficult for me to walk up the incline.

Word: Include
Meaning: to make something part of a greater whole
Example: We wanted to include the new transfer student; so we invited him to sit with us at lunch on his first day.

Word: Inclusion
Meaning: the act of adding a person or thing to a situation or agreement
Example: The inclusion of the harp in the orchestra will enhance future performances.

Word: Inclusive
Meaning: covering every person and every aspect of a situation
Example: The comprehensive insurance plan is inclusive of both medical and emergency cancellation policies.

Word: Incognito
Meaning: without revealing one's identity; in disguise
Example: Even stars who go out incognito are often recognized by the public and hounded by the paparazzi.

Word: Incoherent
Meaning: not logical or easily understood
Example: After drinking too much at the party; Larry became incoherent and made very little sense.

Word: Income
Meaning: money that is earned/brought in monthly
Example: After losing his job; Mr. Davis had to find a new way to get income flowing in every month.

Word: Incommodious
Meaning: not comfortable; unpleasant
Example: I sat on the floor because the lumpy couch was incommodious.

Word: Incommunicado
Meaning: not in a position where one can communicate with other individuals
Example: During our honeymoon; my husband and I will be incommunicado.

Word: Incomparable
Meaning: without equal
Example: To me my favorite chocolate is incomparable.

Word: Incompatible
Meaning: not able to peacefully exist in the same area
Example: Because my husband and I were incompatible; our marriage ended after two weeks.

Word: Incompetent
Meaning: unskilled; not capable
Example: The robber was so incompetent he locked himself in the bank vault.

Word: Incomprehensible
Meaning: impossible or difficult to understand
Example: After hearing to the incomprehensible rap; listeners were left wondering what the musician meant.

Word: Inconceivable
Meaning: impossible to believe
Example: It is inconceivable that the young boy walked twenty miles without shoes in freezing weather.

Word: Inconclusive
Meaning: not conclusive; not leading to a conclusion
Example: The blood test was inconclusive for any diseases; so they wanted to redraw blood.

Word: Incongruent 
Meaning: mismatched; unsuited
Example: Because the two ingredients are incongruent; they will not create a tasty dressing.

Word: Incongruous
Meaning: out of place; inconsistent or incompatible
Example: How incongruous of a fat doctor telling me to lose weight!

Word: Inconsequential
Meaning: not important or significant
Example: When you walk with your head down and eyes lowered; you come across as being inconsequential.

Word: Inconsiderable
Meaning: minor; small or unimportant
Example: With such an inconsiderable injury; the athlete simply continued to play the game since he knew the scratch in his leg wouldn’t cause him any problems.

Word: Inconsiderate
Meaning: not considerate of others; thoughtless
Example: It is inconsiderate to leave a mess for someone else to clean up.

Word: Inconsistent 
Meaning: not occurring in a specific pattern
Example: The weather pattern is too inconsistent to be predictable.

Word: Inconsolable
Meaning: not capable of being consoled
Example: The old man was inconsolable at his wife’s funeral.

Word: Inconspicuous
Meaning: not easily observed
Example: The celebrity hoped she looked inconspicuous so her fans would not approach her in the grocery store.

Word: Inconstancy
Meaning: infidelity; unfaithfulness
Example: Known for his inconstancy; the married man had children with women all over town.

Word: Incontinent
Meaning: inability to control ones actions or hold back from something desired
Example: Someone who has Tourette syndrome is considered incontinent because they have little to no control over repeated words or sudden movements.

Word: Incontrovertible
Meaning: cannot deny or disprove; unable to change form
Example: How can you deny the incontrovertible proof staring you in the face?

Word: Inconvenience
Meaning: a disruption; bother; or annoyance
Example: Because I hate the cold; having to sit under the air conditioning vent at work is an inconvenience.

Word: Inconvenient
Meaning: causing difficulties or troubles
Example: The car accident was an inconvenient start to my holiday weekend.

Word: Incorporate
Meaning: to include or mix
Example: In order to provide a complete report; Henry and his staff incorporate the graphs and charts into the written text.

Word: Incorporated
Meaning: included; combined
Example: The bride was insistent that the wedding planner make sure that red; white; and blue were incorporated in her big day.

Word: Incorporeal
Meaning: lacking form or substance
Example: Most believe the soul to be incorporeal; as it can exist without a physical shell.

Word: Incorrect
Meaning: not accurate
Example: Each incorrect answer caused the team to lose fifty points from the score board.

Word: Incorrigible
Meaning: not capable of being reformed
Example: Because my daughter’s behavior is incorrigible; she might be grounded for at least a year.

Word: Incorruptible
Meaning: having integrity that cannot be corrupted
Example: The incorruptible jury member refused to be pressured into voting not guilty by the defendant’s family members.

Word: Increase
Meaning: made greater in size or amount
Example: An increase in the amount of the loan made it possible for the car shoppers to purchase the vehicle they really wanted.

Word: Increasingly
Meaning: progressively
Example: As the city continues to grow; it is increasingly harder to find a parking spot down town.

Word: Incredible
Meaning: so extraordinary that is seems impossible
Example: An incredible act of kindness; a stranger off the street offered to donate a kidney for the ill teenager.

Word: Incredibly
Meaning: to a great extent
Example: The woman was incredibly sorry that she took the job offer once she realized the company was going out of business in a few months.

Word: Incredibly
Meaning: very; extremely
Example: The puny teenager found it incredibly difficult to pick up the heavy barbell from the floor.

Word: Incredulity
Meaning: a feeling of not being able to believe something or of not wanting to believe it
Example: When the UFO appeared above my house; I was speechless with incredulity.

Word: Incredulous
Meaning: unbelievable; cannot accept as true
Example: The lottery winner was incredulous and could not believe his good fortune.

Word: Incredulously
Meaning: in a way that shows disbelief or skepticism
Example: All of the audience shook their heads incredulously as the unattractive contestant was crowned beauty queen.

Word: Increment 
Meaning: a degree by which something is increased or enlarged
Example: In prison; one phone increment is ten minutes.

Word: Incriminate
Meaning: to suggest an individual has done something inappropriate or illegal
Example: The man refused to talk because he did not want to incriminate himself in court.

Word: Incubate
Meaning: to keep eggs safe and warm so they can grow and hatch
Example: Like some other snakes; pythons incubate their eggs by coiling their bodies over them.

Word: Incubation
Meaning: the process of warming eggs so that they will hatch
Example: Farmers often take on the incubation process themselves since modern day hens are not always attentive to their eggs.

Word: Incubator
Meaning: a specialized crib that is used to care for infants or eggs; in which the temperature and oxygen content of the air can be controlled
Example: The eggs in the incubator must be kept at a temperature of 99.5 for proper growth and development.

Word: Incubus
Meaning: a demon or evil spirit supposed to descend upon sleeping women in order to have sex with them
Example: In the myth; the incubus surprised sleeping women with sexual advances.

Word: Inculcate
Meaning: to frequently instill an idea or belief firmly in someone's mind

Word: Inculpate
Meaning: to incriminate or accuse someone of doing something
Example: Evidence was used to inculpate the suspects and lead to their eventual conviction.

Word: Incumbent
Meaning: the person or group that currently has the title or position
Example: After twenty years in office; the incumbent politician is finally retiring from politics.

Word: Incur
Meaning: acquire
Example: It was impossible to incur any debt after a year of being unemployed.

Word: Incurable
Meaning: not having the ability to be remedied or healed
Example: When Sally found out she had an incurable and terminal disease; her family decided to help her do everything on her bucket list before she died.

Word: Incurious
Meaning: uninterested; unconcerned
Example: I was surprised that my parents were so incurious in this semesters grades since they usually pester me about my scores.

Word: Incurred
Meaning: having gained something; usually something unpleasant; because of one’s own actions
Example: Because I made too many long distance calls while out of the country; I incurred many different charges on my phone bill.

Word: Incurring
Meaning: acquiring or causing yourself to come into
Example: The company was careful with its firing practices because management feared incurring costly law suits.

Word: Incursion
Meaning: an entry into an area that does not belong to the entrants
Example: When the troops made an incursion across the border; they ruined any chance for peace between the two countries.

Word: Indebted
Meaning: obligated or committed to paying someone back for something
Example: The businessman makes his money by giving indebted people large loans to pay back their debts to others.

Word: Indecent
Meaning: offensive; crude
Example: The crazy old cook was charged with indecent exposure after pulling his pants down and peeing on a stop sign.

Word: Indecipherable

Word: Indecision
Meaning: unable to decide between choices

Word: Indecisive
Meaning: hesitant; wavering
Example: An indecisive shopper; the customer could not choose between the two dresses she liked.

Word: Indecorous
Meaning: not proper; inappropriate
Example: Everyone was shocked when Gail wore the indecorous outfit to the church party.

Word: Indicate 
Meaning: to highlight or show
Example: The green light will indicate the strength of the batteries.

Word: Indication
Meaning: sign; signal
Example: There was no indication that a break-in had occurred other than the broken window at the back of the house.

Example: The child’s anger problems were likely indicative of a deeper issue.

Word: Indictment
Meaning: accusation
Example: There are some people who truly believe that the recent natural disasters are an indictment against Man’s lack of respect for the planet.

Word: Indifferent
Meaning: not interested in or concerned about something
Example: As political aides; we are going door-to-door in hopes of getting indifferent voters to come out to the polls.

Word: Indigence
Meaning: a state of extreme poverty and lack
Example: High medical costs are a significant cause of indigence for many of the elderly who are living in poverty.

Word: Indigene

Example: While sitting around the campfire; the Australian indigene told his grandchildren the stories of his native ancestors.

Word: Indigenous
Meaning: produced; living; or existing naturally 
Example:  The class of students enjoyed learning about unusual animals that are indigenous and found naturally in the wild in North America.

Word: Indigent
Meaning: extremely poor
Example: The indigent man could not afford food or clothing.

Word: Indigestion
Meaning: pain in the stomach area that is associated with digesting food
Example: Chewing your food more before swallowing can help prevent the pain of indigestion during digestion.

Word: Indignant
Meaning: angry because of an unfair situation or someone's unfair behavior
Example: If I’m indignant; it’s because you threw that book at me!

Word: Indignity
Meaning: a situation or event that makes an individual feel embarrassment
Example: I felt as though I suffered a huge indignity when my ex husband brought his young girlfriend to my birthday party.

Word: Indigo
Meaning: dark blue
Example: Using the plant to dye her clothing indigo; the young woman admired her dark blue gown.

Word: Indirect
Meaning: secondary; unintentional
Example: Indirect exposure to cigarette smoke can still lead to lung cancer.

Word: Indiscernible
Meaning: difficult or impossible to see; notice; or hear
Example: Due to the foggy weather conditions; the camp pictures were so indiscernible.

Word: Indiscreet
Meaning: having a penchant for revealing secrets or acting without subtlety
Example: My indiscreet friend has a habit of blurting out pretty much everything; including all of the secrets she is not supposed to tell.

Word: Indiscrete
Meaning: not divisible or able to be separated into distinct parts
Example: The rock was indiscrete; breaking into small pieces when the lab tech tried to divide it.

Word: Indiscretion
Meaning: lack of good judgment or foolish behavior
Example: After spilling his wife’s secret; he was punished for his indiscretion.

Word: Indiscriminate
Meaning: done without consideration
Example: Becca regretted her indiscriminate choice in men when her boyfriend cleared out her bank account.

Word: Indispensable
Meaning: vital; essential 
Example: Cara does so much work in the office that she is indispensable to the productive running of the business.

Word: Indisposed
Meaning: not feeling well
Example: Because Maggie is indisposed with a high fever; she will not be attending the banquet.

Word: Indisputable
Meaning: not subject to doubt
Example: It is an indisputable fact smoking cigarettes can increase the risk of lung cancer.

Word: Indissoluble
Meaning: indestructible; not possible to dissolve; disintegrate or break-up
Example: The bond between the sisters was indissoluble as they were rarely apart.

Word: Indistinguishable
Meaning: difficult to tell apart
Example: Fred was indistinguishable to his classmates since his twin brother was standing next to him.

Word: Individual
Meaning: separate; single
Example: Each individual egg was filled with candy and other treats for the children.

Word: Individualism
Meaning: uniqueness; distinctiveness
Example: The bride’s need for individualism led her to seek out a dress that was exotic.

Word: Individuality
Meaning: the qualities that make a person or thing unique
Example: Because he chose an original monologue; his individuality set him apart from the other actors during the audition.

Word: Indivisible
Meaning: united; inseparable
Example: Though some try to forget it; topic of slavery is indivisible from the story of our country’s history.

Word: Indoctrinate
Meaning: to convince people to believe a certain idea or concept
Example: The cult leader will indoctrinate his followers with his beliefs.

Word: Indoctrination
Meaning: the process of teaching or brainwashing a person into believing something without question
Example: A few men in the city resisted communist indoctrination efforts; but most were programmed to side with the government.

Word: Indolent
Meaning: wanting to avoid activity or exertion; lazy
Example: Jackson lost his job because he was an indolent employee who did nothing but sleep at his desk all day.

Word: Indomitable
Meaning: not capable of being defeated
Example: Even when my father was stricken with cancer; he remained an indomitable force who never stopped fighting to live a normal life.

Word: Indubitable
Meaning: without doubt; undisputable
Example: Since Woods has over ninety percent of the votes; it is an indubitable fact he is our new legislator.

Word: Indubitably 
Meaning: in a manner that leaves no possibility of doubt; unquestionably
Example: The young prodigy is indubitably talented; but he doesn’t have the stage presence to go with his talent.

Word: Induce
Meaning: to bring about or lead by persuasion
Example: Sharon read somewhere that one can induce childbirth by smoking a cigarette; but her doctor strongly urged her against attempting something so foolhardy.

Word: Inducement
Meaning: something that persuades someone to do something

Word: Induction
Meaning: a formal ceremony in which a person is appointed to an office or into military service
Example: The Girl Scout Induction Ceremony was taking place at the local meeting hall.

Word: Indulge
Meaning: to give in to one’s desires or wants 
Example: If Al does not indulge in his coffee every morning; he finds it hard to concentrate at work.

Word: Indulgent
Meaning: A person who gives others permission and gifts regardless of the consequences
Example: My indulgent parents give me everything I want.

Word: Industrial Revolution
Meaning: the rapid development of industry that occurred in the late 18th and 19th centuries; brought about by the introduction of machinery
Example: During the Industrial Revolution; a majority of the population shifted from rural farming areas to industrialized cities.

Word: Industrial
Meaning: having highly developed factories; mechanical production; or consumer output
Example: First world countries are almost always industrial; having complex factories capable of mass producing almost anything that they desire.

Word: Industrialization
Meaning: the steps a nation takes to modernize itself while developing industries
Example: While industrialization increased processing times; it also reduced the labor force and left many people without much-needed employment.

Word: Industrious
Meaning: diligent; hardworking
Example: The industrious young man finished his four-year degree in two years.

Word: Industry
Meaning: hard work or effort
Example: The kitchen was transformed into a place of industry as we had to work very hard to make enough food for all of our guests.

Word: Inebriated
Meaning: behaving as though affected by alcohol; drunk
Example: After leaving the restaurant; the police officer cornered the patron to see if he was inebriated.

Word: Inedible
Meaning: unable to be eaten
Example: Many people have become sick by eating the poisonous and inedible berries growing near the blueberries.

Word: Ineffable
Meaning: incapable of being expressed in words
Example: The model’s beauty is ineffable and has everyone tongue-tied.

Word: Ineffective
Meaning: not performing as expected
Example: The housekeeper returned the ineffective vacuum cleaner and purchased one that worked much better.

Word: Ineffectual
Meaning: incapable of generating the sought after effects
Example: Once I realized the medicine was ineffectual; I stopped taking it.

Word: Inefficacious
Meaning: not producing the desired effect
Example: Liam thought that if he bought Julie flowers and expensive gifts she would reciprocate his love but his tactic was inefficacious.

Word: Inefficient
Meaning: not performing to ability or productivity
Example: The inefficient bridge needed extensive work before it would be cleared for travel.

Word: Ineluctable 
Meaning: impossible to alter
Example: Perhaps there is no hope for Jerry because even after a year in rehab his drug addiction seems ineluctable.

Word: Inept
Meaning: having or showing no skill
Example: The teenager was an inept driver who could not back out of his driveway without hitting something.

Word: Ineptitude
Meaning: the quality of being unfit or inept
Example: Because of Bill’s ineptitude; he lost his job.

Word: Inequality
Meaning: an unfair; not equal; state
Example: Inequality in the ingredients was likely the cause of the bitter tasting recipe the chef copied from his mentor.

Word: Ineradicable
Meaning: not capable of being removed completely
Example: Though black-market drugs are probably ineradicable; the government is still fighting to remove them from our society.

Word: Inert
Meaning: without power to act or move 
Example: Since my wounded dog is inert; I have to lift him up and put him in the car.

Word: Inertia
Meaning: the tendency to continue being motionless or inactive
Example: The legislators’ inertia has allowed the budget extension to expire before a solution can be put in place.

Word: Inestimable
Meaning: to such an extent the worth can’t be properly valued
Example: It’s impossible to define the inestimable role police officers play in keeping society safe.

Word: Inevitable
Meaning: incapable of being avoided or evaded
Example: Since Mary never wears shoes; it was inevitable that she would get a piece of glass in her foot.

Word: Inevitably
Meaning: going to happen; unavoidable
Example: Although my dog runs away sometimes; he inevitably returns home after a few hours.

Word: Inexcusable
Meaning: too bad to be justified or tolerated
Example: When her best friend started dating her ex boyfriend; she knew their friendship was over because that kind of betrayal was inexcusable.

Word: Inexhaustible
Meaning: endless; limitless
Example: The inexhaustible buckets of peanuts are continuously refilled as guests eat from them.

Word: Inexorable
Meaning: not able to be persuaded or stopped by any means; stubborn
Example: Of course; the public is enraged by the inexorable rise in gas prices.

Word: Inexpedient
Meaning: impractical or unwise
Example: It would be inexpedient to go walking through the desert without several bottles of water to keep you hydrated.

Word: Inexplicable
Meaning: incapable of being explained or interpreted
Example: Because the weather was clear and sunny a few moments ago; the sudden thunderstorm is inexplicable.

Word: Inextricably
Meaning: in a manner that is impossible to be unlinked
Example: The site where the black men were lynched has been inextricably linked with sorrow and hate.

Word: Infallible
Meaning: not capable of being wrong or of failing
Example: While you may think you are infallible; you make mistakes just like everyone else!

Word: Infamous 
Meaning: notorious; having a negative reputation
Example: The singer is infamous for her indecent costumes.

Word: Infamy
Meaning: the condition of being known for something unpleasant or bad
Example: In hopes of gaining infamy; the troubled youth brought a gun to school.

Word: Infancy
Meaning: the beginning stage of growth
Example: The hurricane seemed like a minor problem in its infancy but quickly grew into a devastating storm.

Word: Infant
Meaning: a young child; typically a baby that is not yet considered a toddler
Example: A human baby is considered an infant until it is about one year old; when it typically starts learning to walk and speak to some extent.

Word: Infantile
Meaning: pertaining to infants
Example: Two adults began to squabble in a most infantile way; displaying behavior that was very inappropriate for their age.

Word: Infantry
Meaning: a group of soldiers that march and fight on foot
Example: The infantry marched into battle with their rifles on their back and a mission in their hearts.

Word: Infatuated 
Meaning: to have a strong liking for someone or something
Example: Even as a young boy; the singer was infatuated with music.

Word: Infection
Meaning: a disease or virus that makes one sick
Example: Because she didn’t wash the cut on her hand regularly; Tessa ended up with a nasty infection inside the scratch.

Word: Infelicitous
Meaning: not well-timed or suitable
Example: Given the host’s spouse had recently died; my comment about wanting to die was infelicitous.

Word: Infer
Meaning: to make a guess based on evidence and reasoning
Example: Based on satellite images; we can infer with a degree of certainty that Japan is about to launch an attack.

Word: Inference
Meaning: a conclusion or opinion that is formed because of known facts or evidence
Example: From the data collected; scientists were able to make the inference that the water was polluted to the extent it was unsafe to drink.

Word: Inferential
Meaning: relating to or involving inference
Example: If you use inferential thought; you imply things based on the facts you already know to be true.

Word: Inferior
Meaning: of lower value or quality
Example: Slaves are viewed as inferior to their owners.

Word: Inferiority
Meaning: the fact of being around people who are more capable than you
Example: I had a feeling of inferiority when everyone around me could answer the questions easily except for me.

Word: Infernal
Meaning: horrible
Example: The infernal noise from my neighbor’s party kept me awake all night.

Word: Inferno
Meaning: an increasingly dangerous fire 
Example: The firefighters can’t stop the inferno in the woods until the wind stops blowing heavily.

Word: Infidel
Meaning: an individual who does not believe in a specific religion
Example: The old woman called me an infidel because I refused to attend her church.

Word: Infidelity
Meaning: the act of being unfaithful to your intimate partner
Example: My husband’s infidelity with another woman led me to file for divorce.

Word: Infiltrate
Meaning: to secretly penetrate; enter or gain access
Example: After the air conditioning unit malfunctioned; a large amount of debris would infiltrate the air and cause sickness to the household.

Word: Infinite
Meaning: an amount that is so endless it’s impossible to calculate
Example: Because there are an infinite amount of stars in the sky; it would be impossible to count each one.

Word: Infinitesimal
Meaning: very small
Example: In the grand scheme of things; so many of our problems are actually quite infinitesimal; and you shouldn’t waste the energy worrying about them.

Word: Infinity
Meaning: endlessness; unlimitedness; an eternity
Example: Humans do not live to infinity; but we do have a life expectancy of roughly 75 to 80 years.

Word: Infirm
Meaning: feeble and weak in health; usually because of illness or old age
Example: The infirm patients were sent to live out the rest of their days in the nursing home.

Word: Infirmity
Meaning: physical/mental weakness or disability
Example: He felt sorry for his uncle; feeling the alcoholism was a serious infirmity.

Word: Inflame
Meaning: to cause someone to become very angry or a situation to become extremely tense
Example: When calling each other names and pushing; the couple seemed to inflame the fight that landed them both in jail.

Word: Inflammable
Meaning: capable of burning; easily set on fire
Example: Once drenched in lighter fluid; the inflammable charcoal bricks ignited in fire when the match touched the first brick.

Word: Inflammatory
Meaning: having or relating to the irritation or swelling on or in the body 
Example: The elderly Mr. Thompson’s inflammatory arthritis could be detected by others due to his slow; painful walk and bloated knees.

Word: Inflatable
Meaning: capable of being filled with air
Example: A small hole in the inflatable raft caused the air to seep out and the swimmer to sink.

Word: Inflate
Meaning: to fill something up with air or gas
Example: Before Julie could ride her bike to the beach; she had to inflate her flattened tire with air.

Word: Inflation
Meaning: a steady rise in the prices of services and goods
Example: Inflation occurs as the value of currency decreases.

Word: Inflection
Meaning: an alteration in tone or pitch
Example: When Jan’s inflection kept changing during her speech; we knew she was nervous.

Word: Inflexible
Meaning: not flexible; not capable of bending or being bent
Example: Being extremely hard and capable of cutting through other stones and glass; diamonds are one of the most inflexible substances on Earth.

Word: Inflict
Meaning: to force something unpleasant upon a person or thing
Example: Our troops will inflict hefty casualties on their foes.

Word: Influence
Meaning: power to change; affect; control or manipulate someone or something
Example: Since they would influence my decisions; my mother told me to choose my friends wisely.

Word: Influential
Meaning: having or exerting influence or power
Example: Because she is very successful; my sister is an influential person in my life.

Word: Influenza
Meaning: a contagious viral infection that attacks your lungs (also called the flu)
Example: After being diagnosed with influenza; the patient was put on anti-biotics; and her breathing was monitored.

Word: Influx 
Meaning: the arrival of a large flow of people; things; or emotions
Example: I was unprepared for the influx of joy I felt when my boyfriend proposed.

Word: Inform
Meaning: to give someone information or facts
Example: It is a teacher’s job to inform their students about everything they need to know to generally live an educated life; from languages to science.

Word: Informal
Meaning: casual and relaxed
Example: The informal dinner only required that you wear casual clothing and not fancy attire.

Word: Informant
Meaning: a person who gives information to someone else
Example: The police claim that a secret informant called and told them who committed the crime.

Word: Infraction
Meaning: a violation of the rules

Word: Infrastructure
Meaning: basic foundation or underlying framework (as of a system or organization)

Word: Infringe
Meaning: to trespass upon something 
Example: Having that much work to do at home will only infringe upon my time with my family.

Word: Infuriated
Meaning: extremely angry

Word: Infuse
Meaning: to fill with a certain quality
Example: Cook the rice until you thoroughly infuse it with the taste of the herbs and spices you added.

Word: Infusion
Meaning: the act of adding one thing to something else in order to make it stronger or more successful

Word: Ingenuity
Meaning: the capacity to find solutions for tough problems

Word: Ingenuous
Meaning: innocent; naive

Word: Ingest
Meaning: to eat or drink something by swallowing or by taking it through the skin
Example: Trained assassins and military personnel used to hide cyanide pills on their back teeth so that in the event of capture; they could bite down and ingest the poison quick enough to die.

Word: Inglorious

Word: Ingrained
Meaning: established; firmly fixed
Example: Being right-handed was ingrained in me so that it was very difficult to write with my left hand.

Word: Ingrate
Meaning: an ungrateful person
Example: When you do not appreciate your gifts; you are being an ingrate.

Word: Ingratiate
Meaning: to try to get someone's approval by doing or saying things that will please them

Word: Ingratitude
Meaning: a lack or absence of gratitude; thanklessness

Word: Ingress
Meaning: a means of entry or the action of going into an area
Example: The glass doors on the hotel’s second floor provide ingress into the mall.

Word: Inhabit

Example: While we renovated our home; we would need to inhabit our summer cabin.

Word: Inhale

Word: Inherent

Word: Inheritance

Word: Inhibition
Meaning: a personal feeling of fear or embarrassment that stops one from behaving naturally

Word: Inhospitable
Meaning: not welcoming or friendly

Word: Inhuman

Word: Instigator

Word:  Instinct

Word: Insult

Word: Inter alia
Meaning: a phrase meaning among other things

Word: Inter
Meaning: to put a deceased person to rest
Example: We decided to inter my son’s dead bird near the apple tree.

Word: Inter
Meaning: to place a dead body or object into a grave or tomb

Word: Interact
Meaning: act in such a way as to have an effect on another; act reciprocally

Word: Interaction
Meaning: shared or collaborative communication

Word: Interactive
Meaning: acting with each other

Word: Intercede
Meaning: to try to help settle an argument or disagreement between two or more people or groups
Example: Even though a mother-in-law may have good intentions; I do not believe she should ever intercede in an argument between a husband and a wife.

Word: Intercept
Meaning: to stop; deflect or divert something in progress or motion
Example: I leaped into the air; attempting to intercept the football before it landed in Bernie’s hands.

Word: Interchange
Meaning: when two or more people trade information with each other

Word: Interchangeable 
Meaning: able to be substituted
Example: Because the British pound is worth more than the US dollar; the two currencies are not interchangeable.

Word: Intercity
Meaning: traveling or existing between cities
