Word: Intercom
Meaning: a system which allows a person speaking into a microphone to be heard on a speaker by people in a different room or area
Example: Babbling through the intercom; the baby let the parents know that they would have a long night ahead of them.

Word: Interconnect
Meaning: for more than one person or thing to connect with each other
Example: Many of the walking trails at the park interconnect and link at some point or another.

Word: Interconnection
Meaning: a mutual connection between two or more people or things
Example: A strong interconnection between the twins made it seem like they could read each other’s minds.

Word: Interdependence 
Meaning: a relationship in which individuals or groups are dependent upon each other
Example: In biology; we learn about types of interdependence in which two organisms feed off each other.

Word: Interdict
Meaning: to ban or prohibit in a firm manner
Example: The government’s new plan to interdict illegal drug sales will cost the country billions of dollars.

Word:  Interdiction 
Meaning: an official order stopping a person or group from doing a specific task
Example: For safety reasons; the city issued an interdiction which prohibits minors from being outside after 10 pm.

Word: Interdigitate
Meaning: for two things to become interlocked
Example: As the boat sank; the couple chose to digitate their hands; and their fingers remained interlocked as they sank into the water.

Word: Interest
Meaning: attention that is given to or received from someone or something
Example: The upcoming Royal wedding between Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will be of significant interest to the entire world.

Word: Interfere
Meaning: to take part in the affairs of others
Example: My neighbor’s rowdy parties interfere with my nightly slumbers.

Word: Interference
Meaning: a disruption between two or more things that most likely causes the action to stop
Example: I didn’t know if Ms. Smith would believe my excuse; but I really couldn’t access the internet since there was an interference with the connection.

Word: Interim
Meaning: meantime; short-term
Example: While my car is in the shop; I think I’ll borrow Dad’s Corvette for getting around during the interim.

Word: Interior
Meaning: having to do with the inner part of something
Example: A fire in the interior of a car spreads quickly to the trunk.

Word: Interject
Meaning: to cut in on another person’s statement by making a remark
Example: Every now and then the dog would bark to interject himself into my phone conversation.

Word: Interlock
Meaning: to link or connect two or more things together
Example: Because they were designed to interlock; the puzzle pieces snap together perfectly.

Word: Interlocutor
Meaning: an individual who is engaged in a dialogue with another person
Example: After Lynn listened to her friends’ conversation for a while; she became an interlocutor and expressed her opinion.

Word: Interloper
Meaning: someone who intrudes on the privacy or property of another without permission
Example: Since she has never been able to let her son go; my mother-in-law is an interloper in my marriage.

Word: Interlude
Meaning: a short period of time that comes in the middle of an event or situation
Example: We exited the theater during the short interlude to purchase something to eat.

Word: Intermediary 
Meaning: a person or thing that facilitates
Example: The intermediary is responsible for delivering the goods to the client and paying the seller.

Word: Intermediate
Meaning: being between two extremes; or in the middle of a range
Example: Due to my advanced knowledge of the subject matter; I was permitted to skip the beginners course and start at the intermediate level.

Word: Interment
Meaning: putting a dead body to rest; the act of burying someone
Example: The soldier who deserted his comrades in battle was not given interment in a military cemetery.

Word: Interminable
Meaning: seemingly without end; endless
Example: Being in the backseat of the car with her grandparents was an interminable experience for the teenage girl.

Word: Intermission
Meaning: a scheduled break of about 10 to 15 minutes in the middle of a play; movie or concert
Example: The woman quickly consumed the candy and drink during the play’s intermission because she could not take it back in the theater.

Word: Intermittent
Meaning: displaying in a random pattern; not consistent
Example: When the cops arrived; the loud intermittent noise had stopped.

Word: Intermittently
Meaning: not consistent; starting and stopping at random times 
Example: Unfortunately; my neighbor’s car alarm went on and off intermittently throughout the night.

Word: Intern
Meaning: a person that works somewhere not for pay but to gain training or experience
Example: The intern started her training in the mailroom and also learned about processing payments during her time at the company.

Word: Internal conflict
Meaning: a struggle within the mind that results from having two opposing desires
Example: Haley decided to quit her job and start her own business despite her internal conflict with the decision.

Word: Internal
Meaning: the interior or inside of something
Example: Since the emergency room physician suspected internal bleeding; the patient’s chest was opened up to see if the injury was bad.

Word: Internalize
Meaning: to make the ideas; standards; attitudes; values and opinions of others influence how you think and feel
Example: Sarah would internalize every harsh word said to her which resulted in her lashing out at people.

Word: International
Meaning: of or having to do with more than one nation
Example: The international chess competition was especially difficult because professional players from all over the world were in participation.

Word: Internecine
Meaning: causing destruction to both sides in the battle
Example: When the internecine war was over; both nations were left in ruins.

Word: Interpersonal
Meaning: communication and relationships between individuals
Example: Successful politicians have great interpersonal skills that enable them to relate to and communicate with people from all backgrounds.

Word: Interpolate
Meaning: to change something by adding material to it
Example: Since the author would often interpolate the stories of others by adding his own text; the critics did not view him as a real writer.

Word: Interpose
Meaning: to involve oneself or to insert
Example: It can be dangerous to interpose yourself between a cat fight.

Word: Interpret 
Meaning: to clarify something so it can be understood 
Example: The police officer could not interpret the deaf woman’s gestures.

Word: Interpretation
Meaning: a person’s view of something 
Example: My interpretation of the portrait is much different than the artist’s vision.

Word: Interpreter
Meaning: someone who translates from one language into another
Example: As I visited rural China; my interpreter explained in English what the local farmer was saying in Mandarin Chinese about his crops.

Word: Interrelate
Meaning: to relate or connect with one another
Example: At first; the two crimes didn’t seem to interrelate; but no police think they have a common killer.

Word: Interrelation
Meaning: the way in which each of two or more things is related to the other
Example: There is no interrelation between the two men; but they look as if they could be brothers.

Word: Interrelationship
Meaning: a close connection between two or more people or things
Example: A key concern of a number of recent U.S. studies has been the interrelationship between relations of politics; power; and racism.

Word: Interrogate
Meaning: to question someone in a commanding manner
Example: If Jill brings a boy home; she knows her father is going to interrogate him by asking hundreds of questions.

Word: Interrogative
Meaning: to be written in the form of a question
Example: Teenagers frequently despise when their parents confront them with interrogative statements and demanding answers.

Word: Interrupt
Meaning: stop the continuous progress of an activity or process
Example: Kayla’s brother always seemed to interrupt her in the middle of the movie.

Word: Intersection
Meaning: a place where two or more paths meet; typically in reference to roads
Example: Because two different roads meet at this intersection; they form a cross that provides four different directions for a driver to travel.

Word: Intersperse
Meaning: to spread things out at intervals
Example: The parents have decided to intersperse their son’s trust fund payments so that he will get money every 30 days.

Word: Interstate
Meaning: an American term related to events or roads that occur between states
Example: I-75 is a highway that runs through several states.

Word: Interstellar
Meaning: between or among the stars
Example: Interstellar is a film about mankind’s search for a new home among the stars.

Word: Interstice
Meaning: a small interfering gap
Example: Light peered through the interstice of the deck where the two boards did not completely meet together.

Word: Interstitial
Meaning: situated in interstices (small spaces)
Example: The patient was diagnosed with interstitial lung disease that stemmed from bacteria moving into small spaces in her lung cavity.

Word: Intertwined
Meaning: twisted together or closely connected
Example: Our lives became increasingly intertwined as we drew closer to each other.

Word: Interval
Meaning: the period of time that exists between happenings
Example: The interval between my wife’s contractions has decreased to twenty minutes.

Word: Intervene 
Meaning: to interfere in an incident for a specific purpose
Example: The teacher was injured when she tried to intervene in the fight between the two male students.

Word: Intervention 
Meaning: the process of becoming purposefully entangled in another’s affairs
Example: Our nation’s intervention in another country’s war could pull us into the crisis.

Word: Intimacy
Meaning: feeling of closeness and openness towards someone else
Example: Instead of controlling my children; I tried to create an intimacy with them.

Word: Intimate 
Meaning: not public; private 
Example: Because I am a private person; I do not like to share intimate details about my home life.

Word: Intimation
Meaning: a sign or suggestion that something is likely to happen
Example: Because they destroyed so many lives; the recent bombings are a brutal intimation of immortality.

Word: Intimidate
Meaning: to make afraid
Example: The mob tries to intimidate shop owners into paying protection fees.

Word: Intimidated
Meaning: to become timid or fearful of
Example: Jack was intimidated by the gangster; which is why he agreed to give him all of his money.

Word: Intimidation
Meaning: the act of making something feel threatened or afraid
Example: Intimidation and scare tactics were used to stop the players from kneeling during the anthem.

Word: Intolerable
Meaning: not able to be tolerated
Example: If I have to spend another second talking to that intolerable woman; I’m going to scream!

Word: Intolerant
Meaning: unable or indisposed to tolerate; endure or bear
Example: Matt is an intolerant person who hates listening to other people talk when their opinions are contrary to his own.

Word: Intonation
Meaning: the rise and fall in the pitch of a voice
Example: The rising intonation in the teenager's voice at the end of each sentence makes it seem as if she is asking a question.

Word: Intoned
Meaning: to speak with little voice inflection
Example: The boy intoned while he read the story with boring monotone speech.

Word: Intoxicated
Meaning: drunk
Example: Finishing off her last glass of wine; the intoxicated artist struggled to hold her paintbrush steady.

Word: Intracellular
Meaning: taking place inside of a cell
Example: Intracellular toxins affect the organelles and other substances inside of a cell.

Word: Intractable
Meaning: not easily managed or controlled
Example: Bringing up the sunken cruise ship is going to be an intractable task.

Word: Intramural
Meaning: taking place within an organization or group
Example: The intramural teams at our school only participate in games against each other.

Word: Intransigent
Meaning: uncompromising
Example: Even though the divorce proceedings should be over; they are still dragging on because of the intransigent parties involved.

Word: Intrastate
Meaning: an American term that describes something happening within a state or one area
Example: The intrastate highway will not take you over state lines.

Word: Intravenous
Meaning: by way of a vein
Example: Intravenous drug users often bruise their veins.

Word: Intrepid
Meaning: very brave
Example: To be an astronaut; you must be an intrepid person who craves adventure and is not afraid of heights.

Word: Intricacy
Meaning: the condition of being complex or extremely detailed
Example: The autistic boy found it easy to grasp the intricacy of the thousand-piece puzzle.

Word: Intricate
Meaning: highly involved or complex
Example: It took me months to put the intricate puzzle together.

Word: Intrigue 
Meaning: a complex scheme devised to gain something in a sneaky way
Example: The intrigue surrounding the latest political scandal has created some interesting tabloid articles.

Word: Intriguing 
Meaning: of interest; triggering a wish to know more
Example: The movie looks intriguing so I’m definitely going to see it.

Word: Intrinsic
Meaning: internally true and genuine; often referring to the worth of people and objects for their value
Example: A man with a generous heart can see the intrinsic value in something which looks worthless to others.

Word: Introduce
Meaning: to bring a measure; product; or process into use for the first time
Example: In an effort to modernize delivery; companies like Amazon have begun to introduce drones as a means of getting orders to doorsteps.

Word: Introduction
Meaning: a situation in which someone or something is brought in or used for the first time
Example: The introduction of the teen’s new boyfriend to her parents didn’t go very well.

Word: Introspection
Meaning: the process of examining one’s own thoughts and feelings 
Example: During a fierce battle; there is no time for a soldier to engage in introspection.

Word: Introspective
Meaning: tending to examine your own feelings; thoughts; or ideas
Example: If you are too introspective; you may talk yourself out of doing something wonderful.

Word: Introvert
Meaning: one who concentrates on his own life and shows little interest in socializing 
Example: Because I am an introvert; I rarely go to parties.

Word: Intrude
Meaning: to come or enter without invitation; permission; or welcome; to trespass
Example: Gaby opened my door saying that she did not mean to intrude; but that someone was waiting to speak to me for over an hour.

Word: Intruder
Meaning: someone in a place or situation who is not wanted
Example: Bonnie told me she feels like an intruder when at a family cookout at her in- laws house due to a personality clash.

Word: Intrusion
Meaning: an instance when a person goes into a place where they were not invited or wanted
Example: Apologizing for her intrusion; the main slowly backed out of the couple’s bedroom.

Word: Intuition
Meaning: an abilility to immediately understand something without reasoning or proof
Example: They say that when you feel something is wrong you should trust your intuition.

Word: Intuitive
Meaning: being able to sense or understand things with little or no information
Example: The intuitive police officer could tell the woman was trying to hide something from him.

Word: Inundate
Meaning: overwhelm with things or people
Example: My boss is the type of person who likes to inundate others with projects.

Word: Inure
Meaning: to become immune to unpleasant events or situations
Example: Raising three dramatic daughters will inure you to temper tantrums.

Word: Inured
Meaning: able to withstand hardship; to become accustomed to something unpleasant by prolonged exposure
Example: Ever since Melissa lost her mother when she was a child; she has been inured to hardship.

Word: Invade
Meaning: to attack or enter by force
Example: Police forces were cautioned to not use deadly force when they prepared to invade the home.

Word: Invalid
Meaning: not binding or acceptable
Example: The police officer gave me a ticket for driving with an invalid license.

Word: Invalidate
Meaning: to make something useless or to repeal it
Example: If your tickets are stolen; the distributor can invalidate them so they can’t be used.

Word: Invaluable
Meaning: crucial; particularly useful
Example: Without Amy’s invaluable help; we would not have met the project deadline.

Word: Invariable
Meaning: never changing; always the same
Example: The human condition is invariable; and no matter how much we progress humanity will always wage war and spread distrust among each other.

Word: Invariably
Meaning: always
Example: Max was a little too handy with the snooze button on his alarm clock; so he was invariably late for work every day.

Word: Invasion
Meaning: a occasion when a someone (usually a military) uses force to take over an area
Example: In an attempt to stop an invasion; the villagers built a tall fort to protect against the enemy’s force.

Word: Invective
Meaning: abusive language used to criticize
Example: The newspaper’s invective of the novel really made the author angry.

Word: Inveigh
Meaning: to criticize someone or something very strongly
Example: Because one politician chose to inveigh on the subject of immigration for an hour; the debate went on all afternoon.

Word: Inveigle
Meaning: to persuade someone to do something by means of deception or flattery 
Example: Speechless I stood by as June was able to inveigle her way into the private club by flirting with the security guard.

Word: Invention
Meaning: something that has been invented
Example: Jane appreciates the invention of the air conditioner on hot summer days.

Word: Inventive
Meaning: having the ability to create something
Example: The inventive father would always force his children to try out the toys he spent hours building.

Word: Inventory
Meaning: a complete list of goods or merchandise that is in a store or warehouse
Example: An inventory list was released that outlined each of the cars available for sale on the lot.

Word: Inverse
Meaning: contrasting in influence or direction
Example: When you read a palindrome in reverse; there is no inverse interpretation so the word will read the same.

Word: Inversion
Meaning: a situation in which something is changed so that it is the opposite of what it used to be
Example: Lower becoming cooler than upper air is called a temperature inversion.

Word: Invert
Meaning: to flip-flop direction in status; stance or associations
Example: The recipe called for the cook to bake the pineapple upside down cake in a pan and then to invert the cake face down onto a platter.

Word: Invertebrate
Meaning: animal without backbone
Example: The science teacher wanted us to study the snail; an invertebrate animal.

Word: Investigate
Meaning: to examine; look into; or scrutinize in order to discover something hidden or secret
Example: In order to find the murderer; the detective would have to investigate the dark building for evidence.

Word: Investment
Meaning: the use of money; time; or effort to make a profit or result
Example: The decline of sales made Jack feel nervous about his hefty investment in the store.

Word: Inveterate
Meaning: have a particular interest or habit that is unlikely to change
Example: Because Janet was an inveterate traveler; it seemed as though she lived at the airport.

Word: Invidious
Meaning: unpleasant and likely to cause bad feelings in other people
Example: The dictator’s invidious acts caused the people to rise up against him.

Word: Invigilate
Meaning: to watch people taking a test to ensure that they do not cheat
Example: In an effort to cut down on cheating; a proctor was hired to invigilate the test takers closely.

Word: Invigorate
Meaning: energize or give life
Example: Hopefully the energy drink will invigorate me so I can work all night on my paper.

Word: Invigorating
Meaning: giving strength; energy; or good health
Example: Some people say the warm springs are invigorating because of their healing powers.

Word: Invincible
Meaning: not possible to be defeated or harmed
Example: The teenager jumped off the building because he thought he was invincible and unable to get hurt.

Word: Inviolable
Meaning: never to be broken; infringed; ignored or dishonored
Example: Her parents made it clear that the rules of curfew were inviolable.

Word: Inviolate
Meaning: something to be respected and free or safe from harm
Example: Secured in a glass display case; the painting was kept inviolate.

Word: Invisible
Meaning: not visible to the eye
Example: Bree thought the scar from her surgery would be an ugly; red mark; but it was invisible.

Word: Invocation 
Meaning: a method of asking for assistance from a higher power
Example: During the invocation; the church leader asked for love; happiness; and good fortune for the newborn baby.

Word: Invoice
Meaning: an itemized statement of items or work done with their charges for these; bill
Example: Parents appreciated not having monthly tuition payments altered; and the invoice provided clear documentation of the expenses incurred throughout the year.

Word: Invoke
Meaning: to request aid; usually from a deity
Example: During the baptism; the priest will invoke a lifetime of blessings for the infant.

Word: Involuntary
Meaning: done without thought or without planning
Example: My involuntary response was to jump back from the snake.

Word: Involved
Meaning: included; a part of something
Example: Emily is involved in many school activities; including band and track.

Word: Invulnerable 
Meaning: not capable of being damaged or injured
Example: The police officer knew he could die any day because he was not invulnerable.

Word: Inward
Meaning: felt in your own mind but not revealed to other people
Example: After narrowly missing a dog crossing the street; Beth breathed an inward sigh of relief.

Word: Inward
Meaning: toward the inside
Example: The pastry chef rolled the two corners of the dough inward so that they could meet in the middle.

Word: Ion
Meaning: a cluster of atoms or a single atom carrying an electrical charge
Example: Since the atom has acquired an electric charge; it is now referred to as an ion.

Word: Iota 
Meaning: a tiny amount
Example: If there is even one iota of doubt; the jury should not find the defendant guilty.

Word: Ipso facto
Meaning: a statement meaning “by that very fact or act” or “it must be true because of”
Example: There are many more men in Alaska than there are women; ipso facto marriage comes easier for a lady.

Word: Irascible
Meaning: easily made angry
Example: It does not take much to aggravate my irascible neighbor who is annoyed by any little noise.

Word: Irate
Meaning: tremendously angry
Example: Jim was irate when he found his wife in bed with another woman.

Word: Ire
Meaning: hostility triggered by a grievance or insult
Example: My ire stems from the salesperson ignoring me while she talked on the telephone.

Word: Iridescent
Meaning: exhibiting a wide range of brilliant colors like a rainbow
Example: The singer’s iridescent necklace glowed brightly under the spotlight.

Word: Irk
Meaning: annoy; irritate
Example: Harry likes to irk us with his irrelevant questions.

Word: Irked
Meaning: annoyed; irritated
Example: The woman’s loud chewing irked the customers sitting nearby.

Word: Irksome
Meaning: irritatingly bothersome
Example: Hank's fellow employees try to avoid him because of his irksome behavior.

Word: Iron Curtain
Meaning: an unstoppable blockade
Example: As the government agency tried to penetrate the iron curtain of the foreign country; it refused to give the agency access to their information.

Word: Ironclad
Meaning: coated or wrapped in iron usually for protection
Example: During the American Civil War; two ironclad ships fought each other without causing much damage due to the strong metal shield of the ships’ outer material.

Word: Ironically
Meaning: referring to something being unexpected or ironic
Example: Ironically my boyfriend and I married at an early age despite our parents’ attempts to separate us.

Word: Irony
Meaning: a form of humor in which you use words to express the opposite of what the words really mean
Example: Because I could not detect any irony in Jason’s tone; I knew he was serious.

Word: Irrational
Meaning: devoid of reason
Example: Because my son has started to exhibit irrational behaviors; I am taking him to see a therapist.

Word: Irreconcilable
Meaning: incapable of being brought into harmony or adjustment.
Example: Feeling that their issues were irreconcilable; the couple decided to file for divorce.

Word: Irreducible
Meaning: not able to be reduced or lessened
Example: While the third-grader was working on her math test; she realized that the fraction on her test was irreducible because it was already in its lowest possible terms.

Word: Irrefragable
Meaning: not able to be disputed or contested
Example: During the trial; the bank teller’s irrefragable evidence couldn’t be contested by any other witnesses.

Word: Irrefragable
Meaning: not able to be disputed or disproved
Example: My college professor requires us to question all scientific evidence; even that which is considered fact or irrefragable.

Word: Irrefutable
Meaning: that which cannot be proven false
Example: The police arrested their suspect only after obtaining irrefutable proof he was the robber.

Word: Irregardless
Meaning: no matter what the circumstance or situation
Example: Though the sneakiy boy constantly found himself trouble; his mother loved him irregardless.

Word: Irregular
Meaning: unusual or odd
Example: We could not plan our day due to the irregular weather.

Word: Irrelevant
Meaning: not pertaining to or insignificant
Example: Why does Cathy spend so much time telling me irrelevant facts that have nothing to do with me?

Word: Irremediable
Meaning: unable to be remedied; cured; corrected or repaired
Example: Bursting into tears; the young mother was appalled when she heard her baby had an irremediable disease which would cause severe pain for the rest of her life.

Word: Irreparable
Meaning: not capable of being fixed
Example: Since the damage to my car is irreparable; I need to buy a new vehicle.

Word:  Irrepressible 
Meaning: not controllable
Example: Jason could not control his irrepressible temper.

Word: Irreproachable
Meaning: without fault
Example: The police captain is expected to have irreproachable behavior.

Word: Irresistible
Meaning: to attractive and tempting to be resisted
Example: The smell of the irresistible cake seemed to call my name as escaped out of the oven.

Word: Irresolute
Meaning: not certain about something
Example: As the troubled young girl faced her school principal; she was irresolute and did not know what to expect as a consequence for her behavior.

Word: Irrespective
Meaning: without regard for conditions; circumstances; or consequences; regardless of
Example: Our accountant explained that we would receive the tax credit irrespective of our income level.

Word: Irresponsible
Meaning: describes someone that does not show a sense of responsibility or obligation
Example: My irresponsible cousin has a ton of homework to do; but he has decided to sleep in late and play games instead of doing it.

Word: Irretrievable
Meaning: unable to recover or reverse back to what it was
Example: During a fight harsh words are irretrievable since they may be kept in the person’s mind forever.

Word: Irreverent
Meaning: displaying little respect to a person; thing; or idea 
Example: When the knight did not bow before his queen; he acted in an irreverent manner.

Word: Irreversible
Meaning: not able to be altered or undone; unchangeable
Example: Some acts are irreversible like having a child because you can’t return the baby.

Word: Irrevocable
Meaning: not able to be changed; reversed; or recovered; final
Example: Even though you are unhappy with your inheritance; the will is irrevocable and cannot be changed.

Word: Irrigate
Meaning: to provide water
Example: Before you bandage the wound; irrigate it to flush out foreign substances.

Word: Irrigation
Meaning: a process of providing water by artificial means
Example: With our new irrigation system; we will be able to make plants thrive even in dry terrains.

Word: Irritable
Meaning: getting annoyed or angry
Example: Mel is an irritable person; always getting on peoples nerves.

Word: Irritate
Meaning: to cause or induce displeasure or inflammation on any portion of body
Example: Becky was pleased to find a body wash that contains aloe which didn’t irritate her skin.

Word: Irritation
Meaning: feeling bother or annoyed by something that is time consuming or particularly frustrating
Example: Julia’s irritation with her best friend only grew because she kept making the same mistakes and completely ignoring Julia’s advice.

Word: Irrupt
Meaning: to enter or burst in suddenly
Example: Several non-native species were able to irrupt into the area and cause destruction after their sudden arrival.

Word: Isle
Meaning: island
Example: The deserted isle was in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean.

Word: Isolation
Meaning: the condition of being located away from others
Example: The worst prisoners are placed in isolation so they cannot hurt other inmates.

Word: Isolationism
Meaning: a rule of seclusion followed by a group or nation that chooses not to interact with other sects or countries
Example: Because of the rules of isolationism members of the sect were only allowed to interact with people of their community.

Word: Isotonic
Meaning: having equal tension
Example: The beverage is isotonic; with equal concentrations of sugar and salt.

Word: Isotope
Meaning: any of an element’s forms that differ because of the atom’s neutron count
Example: Just like an isotope; you are unlike your sibling because of the differences in your chemical makeups.

Word: Issue
Meaning: to deliver or give out
Example: No one was at the office to issue my driver’s license; so I will have to wait until tomorrow to pick it up.

Word: Isthmus
Meaning: a narrow strip of land; bordered on both sides by water; and connecting two larger landmasses
Example: They had to travel over the isthmus to the other end of the island.

Word: Itemize
Meaning: to break something down into the individual parts that comprise it
Example: An itemized bill is one that breaks down the listed cost into each part that makes up the bill; so you know what parts of it are the most expensive.

Word: Iterate
Meaning: said or done again and again; repeated
Example: I will iterate our policy over and over to be perfectly clear.

Word: Iterate
Meaning: to verbalize or say
Example: I had to iterate my answer for the mathematical problem a second time because my partner did not hear me the first time.

Word: Iteration
Meaning: the process of repeating a statement or sequence of some sort
Example: The only difference in the latest iteration of the videogame is the change of setting.

Word: Itinerant
Meaning: moving around from location to location
Example: The documentary follows the life of an itinerant homeless man who never sleeps in a location more than once.

Word: Itinerary
Meaning: a detailed schedule usually for a trip
Example: With his itinerary in hand; the tourist began his first day in Ireland by walking to each place on his list so he could see every attraction.

Word: Its
Meaning: related to something that was mentioned previously 
Example: After three days; the sick dog was allowed to leave its crate.

Word: Jabber
Meaning: to talk rapidly; indistinctly; or unintelligibly; to utter gibberish or nonsense
Example: I get nervous when my sister begins to jabber about all the nonsense that happens in her world.

Word: Jackanapes
Meaning: a conceited; sarcastic; and/or brutish individual
Example: Narcissus was such a conceited jackanapes that when he glimpsed himself in a mirror; he fell in love.

Word: Jaded
Meaning: depleted of excitement and enthusiasm; usually after having had too much of something
Example: After being on an airplane for nearly twenty-four hours; Henry is a bit jaded and never wants to travel again.

Word: Jagged
Meaning: sharp; pointed
Example: Jagged splinters sticking out of the wood stuck inside the barefoot boy’s foot when he stepped on top of the board.

Word: Jape
Meaning: a silly plan done on a person; practical joke
Example: My little sister Jessica thought it was funny to put a frog in my rain boot for a jape.

Word: Jape
Meaning: a practical joke or trick that you play on someone
Example: Hank’s mother didn’t find his April’s fool’s jape funny and punished him for the prank.

Word: Jargon
Meaning: communication that a person cannot comprehend
Example: If you include legal jargon in the article; only law students and lawyers will be able to understand your position.

Word: Jarring
Meaning: to be altered or changed usually in an irritating or unbearable way
Example: When the teenager’s jarring music was blasting in the car next to me; I became aware that I would enjoy the silence once he was gone.

Word: Jaundiced
Meaning: tending to dislike; criticize; or resent something
Example: Because she always received terrible customer service; my grandmother was jaundiced against the company.

Word: Jaunt
Meaning: a short journey or excursion for pleasure or refreshment
Example: The short jaunt that Janice took around the mountainside resulted in a lengthy search when she failed to return.

Word: Jauntily
Meaning: in an energetic way
Example: After receiving a promotion at work; Jill walked home jauntily.

Word: Jaunty
Meaning: expressing cheer and self-assurance
Example: Craig’s bright and jaunty tie put a smile on everyone’s face.

Word: Jawbone
Meaning: the skull area below the mouth
Example: During the fight; the young many broke his jawbone after the other man hit him on the lower side of his face.

Word: Jealous
Meaning: feeling resentment against someone because of that person's rivalry; success; or advantages
Example: Feeling jealous of her older sister’s small frame; the overweight teen refused to go prom dress shopping unless she could go alone.

Word: Jeer
Meaning: ridicule; taunt; scoff at
Example: When the basketball bounced off the rim for the second time; Nolan knew that the crowd would probably jeer at him.

Word: Jejune
Meaning: unsophisticated
Example: The billionaire couple refused to eat the jejune dish of chicken wings and tater tots.

Word: Jeopardize
Meaning: to put at risk
Example: Do not jeopardize your good grade by failing to turn in your assignment.

Word: Jeopardy
Meaning: at risk of loss or harm
Example: If you do not take your medicine; you will put your health in jeopardy.

Word: Jeremiad
Meaning: a long; sad list of complaints; sometimes produced as a literary work
Example: The elegantly written book was actually a jeremiad that laid out the author’s complaints against the current government.

Word: Jest
Meaning: words that are spoken as humor 
Example: When confronted by the teacher; the student said his words were in jest and not meant to be taken seriously.

Word: Jettison
Meaning: to eliminate something
Example: In order to conserve fuel; the pilot was forced to jettison some of his passengers’ suitcases.

Word: Jibe
Meaning: to agree; harmonize
Example: The findings of the court did not jibe with the testimony of the witness; angering the judge.

Word: Jingoism
Meaning: extreme patriotism for one’s country that often shows itself through aggression towards other nations
Example: The man’s jingoism led him to attempt to destroy a federal building as a show of loyalty for his own nation.

Word: Jinx
Meaning: a person or thing supposed to bring bad luck
Example: I lied on my resume and fear this big mistake could jinx my chances of snaring a great job.

Word: Jittery
Meaning: shaky and nervous
Example: The nervous puppy is always jittery when we go to see the vet.

Word: Jive
Meaning: to deceive; to be deceptive
Example: "Beth yelled at her husband; ""I know you went to see your mistress last night so don’t try to jive me!"""

Word: Jive
Meaning: slang talk that is meaningless and dishonest
Example: The conman tried to use his jive talk to trick people into giving him money.

Word: Jockey
Meaning: one who rides racehorses competitively
Example: Jockeys must be brave to ride horses at high speeds in such tight quarters.

Word: Jocose
Meaning: playful; humurous
Example: Robert is well known for his jocose disposition; always makes everyone around him laugh.

Word: Jocular
Meaning: characterized by joking; humorous or playful
Example: The jocular man is known for his funny punchlines.

Word: Jocund
Meaning: in high spirits; cheery 
Example: Because Patrick was feeling quite jocund after drinking a few beers; he could not stop smiling.

Word: Joie de Vivre
Meaning: ecstatic enjoyment of life
Example: Everyone should practice Joie de Vivre; enjoying life to the absolute fullest regardless of what bad things may happen along the way.

Word: Joint
Meaning: shared or made by two or more entities
Example: This is a joint project that my partner and I must work on to complete on time for chemistry class.

Word: Joist
Meaning: a wooden or metal beam that serves as a support for the ceiling or floor
Example: Chipotle has an industrial décor that enables guests to see the long metal joist that runs across the ceiling and supports the roof.

Word: Jolt
Meaning: to push or shake abruptly and roughly
Example: We hope that the new stores opening in the downtown will help jolt the economy back to life.

Word: Jostle
Meaning: to compete or struggle for something
Example: As soon as the coach makes the announcement; the football players will start to jostle for the position of team captain.

Word: Journey
Meaning: usually a long difficult period pertaining to personal change and growth
Example: Robin has hurt so many people on her long journey through addiction; she’s now focused on helping others.

Word: Jovial
Meaning: warm and friendly
Example: Stories describe Santa Claus as a jovial man who gives toys to children.

Word: Jowls
Meaning: the lower cheek attached to the jawbones or mandibles
Example: The strong-faced man had the same jowls as his grandfather and embraced his jawline as a coveted family trait.

Word: Joyful
Meaning: feeling happy and cheerful
Example: Making a joyful noise; the choir smiled as they sang their cheerful hymn.

Meaning: full of joy; happy
Example: A joyous celebration such as this requires cake; music; and elaborate decorations!

Word: Jubilant
Meaning: filled with joy
Example: I am jubilant to learn that my sister is finally having a baby.

Word: Judicial review
Meaning: a high courts review of a ruling by a lower court or actions of the legislative branch
Example: During the judicial review; the judge considered all of the evidence that had been presented to the lower court judge.

Word: Judicious
Meaning: showing intelligence and good judgment
Example: Because of the doctor’s experience; he was a judicious fellow who was well-respected by his colleagues.

Word: Juggernaut
Meaning: a large item that is seen as unstoppable and can destroy anything in its way
Example: With the reveal of its best-selling innovation; the software company has become a juggernaut in the tech industry.

Word: Jumble
Meaning: a typically messy pile of things
Example: Most teenage boys leave their things in a messy jumble; making their rooms look more like disaster areas than places of clean habitation.

Word: Jump
Meaning: to react suddenly often unexpected and quickly
Example: The loud boom heard was caused by an earthquake that made everyone jump out of their seats.

Word: Jumpstart
Meaning: to start something quickly by providing it with extra help
Example: To jumpstart his understanding of the math concepts; Felipe hired an algebra guru to tutor him before his classes start.

Word: Jumpy
Meaning: behaving in an anxious or nervous way
Example: Because he is afraid of the police; the jittery driver appeared jumpy when he was pulled over by the officer.

Word: Junction
Meaning: a location where roads or lines intersect or meet
Example: The city’s main interstates meet at the area known as Spaghetti Junction.

Word: Juncture
Meaning: an important point in a process or activity
Example: At this juncture; we are unable to continue with the project because of a lack of funding.

Word: Junta
Meaning: an armed group that comes into power by using force 
Example: Armed with the newest weapons; the junta faced little to no resistance as it drove out the government.

Word: Jurassic
Meaning: a geologic period that occurred over 150 million years ago and is marked by the presence of dinosaurs and the first appearance of birds
Example: During the Jurassic period; humans didn’t exist; and dinosaurs ruled the earth.

Word: Jurisdiction
Meaning: the valid power to make official decisions and rulings
Example: The probate court has jurisdiction over the validity of wills.

Word: Jurisprudence
Meaning: the part of philosophy that focuses on the origins of the law and the decisions made by the judicial systems
Example: Even in high school; Evan read a great deal on jurisprudence because he knew he wanted to become a lawyer.

Word: Jurist
Meaning: an individual with a deep awareness of the law
Example: Since I know my uncle has been a judge for fifteen years; I highly respect him as a jurist.

Word: Justice
Meaning: the outcome of using regulations to impartially judge and penalize a person or group accused of a criminal act
Example: Some people believe justice is blind to wealthy individuals because most of them don't receive harsh consequences.

Word: Justifiable
Meaning: well founded; rightful
Example: Even though a punch in the nose may not seem to be justifiable to many people; sometimes it just has to be done to get the point across to a bully.

Word: Justification
Meaning: an explanation of how something is reasonable or correct
Example: Phillip was fired when he was unable to offer justification for his repeated tardiness to work.

Word: Justify 
Meaning: to offer a reasonable explanation for a certain behavior or action
Example: Ted tried to justify his wife’s death with a claim of self-defense.

Word: Jut
Meaning: to stick out from something in a noticeable way
Example: The edge of the cliff seemed to jut out over the ocean and disappear into a blanket of clouds.

Word: Juvenile
Meaning: in a manner that is childish and unpleasant or referring to a young person

Word: Juxtaposition
Meaning: the fact of two things being seen or placed closed together with contrasting effect 
Example: The reality clearly shows a cultural juxtaposition between rich people and poor people.

Word: Kaleidoscope
Meaning: changing colors; shapes; and/or patterns in a general vicinity
Example: Clouds are a kaleidoscope of shapes; sizes; patterns; and colors.

Word: Kaput 
Meaning: completely done; not functioning or dead
Example: Because my car is kaput and not working; I need to buy a new vehicle.

Meaning: overturn; capsize
Example: Feeling like it might keel at any minute; the kayaker tried to steady himself with his oar.

Meaning: strong or highly developed
Example: His keen sense of observation allowed him to notice that his keys were not where he had left them.

Word: Keening
Meaning: wailing or crying with grief
Example: The keening mother could not believe that her child was gone; even though the officers that had found his body told her so through her tears.

Meaning: deeply or intensely
Example: Out of fear my daughter wasn't telling the truth; I stared keenly at her.

Meaning: the quality of being eager or excitedly enthusiastic
Example: Milo’s keenness for learning showed in his excellent work.

Word: Keratin

Example: A system update allowed the system to run faster and reduced any latency or wait time.

Word: Latent
Meaning: existing or present but concealed or inactive
Example: The detective asked the lab technician to search the room for latent fingerprints.

Word: Lateral
Meaning: of or pertaining to the side
Example: A beam runs along the top of the bridge; offering lateral support to the structure.

Meaning: looking or sounding sad and gloomy
Example: In his first novel; the mysterious postman is the perfect example of a lugubrious character.

Meaning: moderately warm; tepid
Example: Disappointed by his lukewarm chicken wings; the diner requested hot ones from the kitchen.
