Word: Matrimony
Meaning: the state of being married
Example: The man and woman are in a state of holy matrimony; being not just a man and woman but a husband and wife.

Word: Matrix
Meaning: an environment in which the development or formation of something occurs 
Example:  In the film; an alternate world had developed inside of the matrix.

Word: Matron
Meaning: an older; serious-minded married woman who usually has a high social position
Example: The matron was highly regarded for her philanthropic endeavors in her community.

Word: Matronly
Meaning: used to describe a middle-aged; married woman who is plump and dresses in a plain way
Example: The more matronly customers selected long skirts and flats rather than mini-skirts and tall boots.

Word: Matte
Meaning: describing a color that is dull and has no shine
Example: This brown color is extremely matte; dull and lifeless but supposedly a good color for this piece of furniture; according to my mother.

Word: Matter
Meaning: be of importance of have significance
Example: Clara insisted that the messiness of her room shouldn’t matter; but her mother thinks keeping a clean house is important.

Word: Matter
Meaning: a substance or object that occupies physical space
Example: The matter changed from a solid to a liquid form when it was placed in the sun to melt.

Word: Mature
Meaning: to gain experience or wisdom with age; full grown
Example: Emily said to her children; “Instead of calling each other names; can we discuss this in a mature manner?”

Word: Maturity
Meaning: of full development
Example: When the cherry tree reaches maturity; it will produce fruit.

Word: Maudlin
Meaning: showing or expressing too much emotion especially in a foolish or annoying way
Example: The girl’s performance was so maudlin that people started to boo her off the stage.

Word: Maul
Meaning: to wound someone by scratching or tearing them; often used in reference to animals
Example: I would never go near a bear even in captivity; for fear that it would maul me with its huge teeth and claws.

Word: Mauled
Meaning: attacked and mangled
Example: Because it seemed friendly; neighbors were surprise to hear the dog had mauled a pedestrian.

Word: Mausoleum
Meaning: a large elegant building that holds tombs
Example: The king wants to be entombed inside of a mausoleum.

Word: Maverick 
Meaning: tending to choose a different path from everyone else
Example: The maverick politician promised to leave behind the ways of the old guard and bring change to the government.

Word: Mawkish 
Meaning: being overly sentimental to the point it comes across as fake or silly
Example: The star’s mawkish poem at her mentor’s funeral was so insincere that most of the guests rolled their eyes.

Word: Maxim
Meaning: a phrase that is often used as a guiding rule
Example: My grandmother had a wise maxim to help me get through all of my teenage crises.

Word: Maximize
Meaning: to increase something in size; amount; or importance as much as possible
Example: If you increase your advertising in certain areas; you may also be able to maximize profits for your products.

Word: Maximum
Meaning: the highest amount possible
Example: After the opening of Pandora at Disney World; the park was forced to closed their doors because they had reached the maximum number of guests allowed in the park at one time.

Word: Maximum
Meaning: the total amount or limit
Example: We are looking for a house with a maximum of four bedrooms because any more than that would be too many.

Word: Mayhap
Meaning: perhaps or possibly
Example: Mayhap we should leave this cave before we encounter whichever creature calls it home?

Word: Mayhem
Meaning: chaos or disorder
Example: During the busy holiday season; most of the stores seem to be in a constant state of mayhem.

Word: Mea Culpa
Meaning: an acknowledgement of having done wrong (my bad)
Example: The magazine issued a mea culpa after they cited an incorrect statistic.

Word: Meager
Meaning: very small or too small in amount
Example: My daughter is quick to complain about what she considers to be a meager allowance.

Word: Mean
Meaning: characterized as cruel or antagonistic; but often in a petty manner
Example: A mean bully might try and take your lunch money from time to time; but such things are hardly unspeakably cruel.

Word: Meander
Meaning: to move slowly without any real purpose
Example: The confused old man will sometimes come into the store and meander for hours without making a purchase.

Word: Meaningful
Meaning: having a serious; important; or useful quality or purpose 
Example: Whenever she tried to have a meaningful conversation with her boyfriend; he always changed the subject to a new cat video or trending meme.

Word: Meant
Meaning: the past tense form of mean that is used to express what someone intended or had in mind
Example: I meant to send off the package; but left it sitting on the kitchen counter.

Word: Meanwhile
Meaning: at the same time but elsewhere
Example: “Victoria; dinner will be ready in ten minutes; meanwhile please set the table.”

Word: Measly
Meaning: an extremely; almost laughably small amount
Example: Briana hoped her mother would pay her well for babysitting her brothers but she only got a measly $5.

Word: Measure
Meaning: to gage or calculate an amount
Example: Using a cup to measure ¼ cup; the chef sifted just the right amount into the bowl.

Word: Measurement
Meaning: the size or length of something
Example: The seamstress guessed the measurement of the man’s shoulders and then confirmed with her tape.

Word: Mechanical Energy
Meaning: sum of all energy in an object used for work; such as the energy transferred in a swinging hammer
Example: The mechanical energy of a wheel is the sum of the energy produced while it is rotating; both in the wheel itself and the axle that turns it.

Word: Mechanical
Meaning: linked to machinery or tools
Example: A mechanical engineer was needed to fix the broken conveyer belt.

Word: Mechanism
Meaning: a piece of a machine that plays a specific role in its operation
Example: Visitors were stuck on the Ferris wheel for hours when the mechanism that controlled the rotation stopped working.

Word: Medallion
Meaning: a piece of jewelry crafted in the shape of a medal; often worn around the neck as a pendant
Example: The officer received a spectacular medallion from his commander in chief; a medal to wear around his neck for his service in the war.

Word: Meddle
Meaning: to interfere in something that is not your concern
Example: Because my mother-in-law is trying to meddle in my marriage; I want her out of my house immediately.

Word: Meddlesome
Meaning: tending to interfere in other people’s affairs
Example: Meddlesome men spent their morning drinking coffee and discussing their neighbors business.

Word: Medial
Meaning: situated in the middle of something
Example: With three people standing in a line; the person in the middle of the line has a medial position.

Word: Median
Meaning: the middle number of a set of ordered numbers
Example: The median household income for this major city is $56;000 with half of the lower incomes being below that amount and the higher incomes being above that amount.

Word: Mediate
Meaning: to help solve conflicts
Example: My husband is the one who usually has to mediate the disagreements between our sons.

Word: Mediator
Meaning: one that serves as a go-between during a dispute
Example: A mediator was needed to help the divorcing couple come to an agreement.

Word: Medicare
Meaning: a free health insurance program in the United States for older or disabled people
Example: Since my elderly mother has poor health; Medicare is her supplier of health care should she need medical attention.

Word: Medicinal
Meaning: used to cure pain and diseases
Example: Medicinal herbs were added to the tea to cure the woman’s stomachache.

Word: Medicine
Meaning: a substance used to treat disease
Example: Without medicine to ease his headache; the man had no choice but to go to bed early.

Word: Medieval
Meaning: relating to the Middle Ages
Example: Medieval feasts were thrown for royalty and nobles during the Middle Ages.

Word: Mediocre
Meaning: average; not great or extraordinary
Example: Because Janice does not apply herself in school; she is a mediocre student.

Word: Mediocre
Meaning: of ordinary or average quality
Example: The mediocre meal wasn’t the worst I’ve had; but it wasn’t the best either.

Word: Meditative 
Meaning: in deep contemplation
Example: The dog seemed to be in a meditative state as he stared at his empty food dish that hadn’t been filled in two days.

Word: Mediterranean
Meaning: representative of the Mediterranean Sea or culture of the people surrounding it
Example: Her olive skin and dark hair was typical of a Mediterranean woman.

Word: Medium
Meaning: in between small and large
Example: When trying on a swimsuit; Carrie chose a medium since the small was too tight but the large was sagging.

Word: Medley
Meaning: a mixture of things
Example: A medley of horrific shouts rose up out of the crowd when they realized the concert was canceled.

Word: Meed
Meaning: a much deserved reward or honor
Example: Even though she had six children; the loving mother was able to give each a meed of her time and attention.

Word: Meek
Meaning: restrained; unwilling to speak up
Example: Although the meek girl knew the answer to the teacher’s question; she was too nervous to raise her hand.

Word: Meekly
Meaning: doing something in a humble and modest way
Example: The shy girl hung her head as she meekly followed behind her older sisters.

Word: Meeting
Meaning: a gathering of people coming together
Example: Once managements gathers more information we will notify everyone for another meeting soon.

Word: Megabyte
Meaning: a unit equal to one million bytes that is used to measure how much information a computer can store
Example: The disk contained one megabyte of storage space.

Word: Megalith
Meaning: a large stone that was used as a building block in prehistoric structures
Example: A gigantic megalith was used to create a stone graveyard in 3000 B.C. Germany.

Word: Megalomania
Meaning: a mental disorder that leads individuals to think they are more influential and powerful than everyone else
Example: Helen’s megalomania allowed her to believe she could drive under the influence without putting her life in jeopardy.

Word: Megalopolis
Meaning:  a region comprised of several big cities
Example: As the cities in the area have grown; the population of the megalopolis has greatly expanded.

Word: Megaton
Meaning: an explosive force measurement that is used for nuclear weapons (equals one million tons of TNT)
Example: The megaton missile exploded with great force as it reached its target.

Word: Megawatt
Meaning: a unit for measuring electricity that is equal to one million watts of power
Example: The current national average of homes powered by a megawatt of solar power is 160.

Word: Meiosis
Meaning: a cellular process in which a single cell divides twice to produce four cells containing half the original amount of genetic information
Example: During meiosis; the parent cell duplicated and recombined to produce new cell.

Word: Melancholy
Meaning: a feeling of deep sadness
Example: The film’s tragic ending put us all in a melancholy mood.

Word: Meld
Meaning: to blend or merge things together
Example: Singing in harmony; the musicians were able to meld their voices.

Word: Melee
Meaning: a brawl; riot or fight
Example: I hate to go shopping during the holiday season because it feels like a melee with everyone pushing and shoving in the aisles.

Word: Meliorate
Meaning: to improve or make something better
Example: As a counselor; it was his job to try and meliorate the relationship between the two family members.

Word: Meliorism
Meaning: the idea that human effort is the key to making the world a better place
Example: As a believer in meliorism; the activist felt that every small effort he made had a positive effect on the world.

Word: Melliferous
Meaning: bearing or producing honey
Example: Melliferous flowers were collected to make honey.

Word: Mellifluous
Meaning: having a smooth; flowing sound
Example: The actor has a mellifluous voice that could lull anyone into a deep sleep.

Word: Mellow
Meaning: to become calm and easy-going due to being older or having more practice
Example: My mother became mellow once she became a grandmother because she would never let me eat unhealthy foods that she feeds to her grandchildren.

Word: Melodious
Meaning: having a pleasing sound
Example: His melodious voice carried over all of the other students in the Christmas program.

Word: Melodramatic
Meaning: overemotional
Example: For the practical viewer; the soap opera was way too melodramatic.

Word: Melody
Meaning: a simple tune that sounds harmoniously
Example: When the singer sang the song; her voice belted out the beautiful lyrics against the backdrop of the melody.

Word: Melt
Meaning: to dissolve something solid through heat
Example: The ice at North and South Poles is beginning to melt now that the temperature of our atmosphere is starting to rise.

Word: Melting pot
Meaning: where a set a diverse individuals coexist side by side
Example: Yugoslavia was a melting pot of citizens who spoke different languages and practiced diverse religions.

Word: Membership
Meaning: an individual becomes a member of a club; group; or organization
Example: Amanda was pleasantly surprised to receive a one year membership to a local fitness center for a birthday present paid for by her children.

Word: Memento
Meaning: a keepsake; an object kept as a reminder of a place or event
Example: The necklace I received from my late husband is a loving memento from my time spent with him.

Word: Memo
Meaning: a written message; especially in business
Example: The manager of the finance department sent a memo out to employees telling them when the next meeting would be held.

Word: Memoir 
Meaning: a description of a life or event written by a person with firsthand knowledge 
Example: The actress wrote a backdated memoir that began with the final days of her life.

Word: Memorabilia
Meaning: items treasured by people due to their past fascination in a remarkable person or occasion
Example: Due to the baseball memorabilia scattered across the garage sale table; the patrons realized that the homeowner brought home many souvenirs from the baseball games he attended.

Word: Memorable
Meaning: notable and unforgettable
Example: By marrying her soulmate on her perfect day; Beverly knew this would be the most memorable event of her life.

Word: Memorandum
Meaning: a short note about a specific situation serving as a reminder
Example: The Human Resources Department sent out a memorandum to all of the employees with the information pertaining to the upcoming holiday party.

Word: Memorial
Meaning: something serving as a remembrance of someone or event
Example: There was so many people today who attended the memorial of a young girl killed by her father.

Word: Menace
Meaning: an individual or situation that causes problems
Example: My neighbor’s dog is a menace who seems to enjoy going potty on my porch.

Word: Menagerie
Meaning: a diverse collection
Example: The president expected a menagerie of questions from the group of reporters.

Word: Mend
Meaning: to repair or fix something that is broken or damaged
Example: There’s no way to mend my broken shoe; so I’ll just need to buy a new pair.

Word: Mendacious
Meaning: lying; not telling the truth
Example: Chuck is mendacious about his vegetarianism because he eats chicken.

Word: Mendacity
Meaning: lack of honesty
Example: Since honesty is very important to me; I was deeply offended by my ex-husband’s mendacity.

Word: Mendicant
Meaning: an individual who begs for a living
Example: The mendicant hoped pedestrians would drop money in his bucket.

Word: Menial
Meaning: relating to tasks normally performed by a servant
Example: Everyone was surprised to see the company president doing menial labor he could easily pass on to one of his employees.

Word: Mental
Meaning: relating to the mind or to the health or state of one's mind
Example: The teacher’s mental strength was tested when the principal was observing her.

Word: Mentality
Meaning: a pattern of thought
Example: The stern preacher’s mentality was that any music other than Christian music had sinful overtones.

Word: Mention
Meaning: to make a short reference to something
Example: I will mention to your father when he calls me from work that he needs to take you to your baseball game tonight.

Word: Mentor
Meaning: someone who teaches or gives advice to someone less experienced
Example: Because she was a new teacher; Betsy needed a mentor to show her how to set up her classroom.

Word: Mephitic
Meaning: Bad-smelling; having a foul odor especially of gas or vapor
Example: The car’s mephitic fumes choked up the passengers in a nearby sedan.

Word: Mercantile
Meaning: concerned with the buying and selling of goods for money
Example: I joined our family’s mercantile business; buying and selling paper goods.

Word: Mercantilism
Meaning: an economic system in which a nation tries to become more affluent by exporting more goods than it brings into the country and by protecting its store of precious metals
Example: One of the reasons England developed the colonies under mercantilism was to increase its trading territory.

Word: Mercenary
Meaning: motivated by private gain; regardless of ethics or laws; greedy
Example: Following his employer’s instructions; the mercenary killed the woman and her baby without a second thought.

Word: Merch
Meaning: a shortened form of the word merchandise (products that people sell)
Example: We went to the clothing store for new merch but didn’t find any eye-catching pieces.

Word: Merchant
Meaning: one who trades in goods to earn a profit
Example: The greedy merchant raised the price of bread and milk during the blizzard.

Word: Merciful
Meaning: compassionate and generous
Example: After winning the lottery; the merciful winner donated every penny of her winnings to the homeless shelter.

Word: Merciless
Meaning: without mercy. ruthless and unforgiving
Example: The merciless sun of the desert will quickly drain all travelers of both water and will; ensuring a painful demise if one does not enter its sands prepared.

Word: Merciless
Meaning: cruel and without mercy or pity
Example: The merciless dictator killed everyone that went against his regime.

Word: Mercurial
Meaning: subject to sudden or unpredictable changes
Example: Because Mary is taking a new medication; her moods have become quite mercurial and change with the wind.

Word: Mercy
Meaning: tendency towards forgiveness; pity and kindness
Example: Beth’s strict parents showed mercy after she missed her curfew because she helped a stranded female motorist by jump starting her car battery.

Word: Mere
Meaning: in regards to an individual or thing that is viewed as unimportant or small
Example: Although Bailey was a mere boy; he knew he would become a world leader one day.

Word: Merely
Meaning: only; just; and nothing more
Example: The knight wondered how he; being merely a man; could hope to defeat the dragon.

Word: Meretricious
Meaning: tastelessly showy; attractive on the surface but having in reality no value or substance; falsely alluring
Example: Because of Christie’s meretricious style of dressing; she has often been mistaken for a prostitute and has received a number of indecent proposals.

Word: Merge
Meaning: to come together into one unit
Example: When the struggling nursery was about to go bankrupt; it decided to merge with the seed store since they both were in the same business.

Word: Merger
Meaning: the joining of two things into one
Example: The merger of the two companies happened in February when the smaller corporation joined the larger.

Word: Meridian
Meaning: an imaginary line that passes from the North Pole to the South Pole
Example: The equator and the prime meridian are imaginary lines used to find longitude and latitude on a map.

Word: Meringue
Meaning: a pie topping that is browned after being made from beaten egg whites and sugar
Example: Edith whipped up a meringue to be added to the list of sweet and light treats.

Word: Merit
Meaning: something that deserves to be recognized or praised
Example: Jill earned an award of merit for never missing a day of school in twelve years.

Word: Meritocracy
Meaning: a system in which the leaders are chose based on intellect; talent; or merit; not other factors such as race; popularity; or economic status
Example: Mr. Young longed to live in a meritocracy where the leaders of the free world were the ones who earned their places based on their accomplishments.

Word: Meritorious 
Meaning: deserving of rewards or praise
Example: Of all his achievements; winning the gold medal was definitely his most meritorious.

Word: Merriment
Meaning: laughter; happiness; and enjoyment
Example: The party was filled with the wonderful sounds of merriment.

Word: Mesh
Meaning: to connect or lock together
Example: The band can’t seem to mesh well together and continuously play off key.

Word: Mesmerized
Meaning: captivated by something or someone
Example: Because Jennifer was mesmerized by the author’s writing style; she purchased all of his books.

Word: Mesosphere
Meaning: an area between two layers in the Earth’s atmosphere where it gets colder as the elevation increases
Example: In the mesosphere the alien spaceship recorded the increasing temperatures every few minutes in this layer as it came closer to Earth.

Word: Message
Meaning: usually a brief form of communication sent to someone in form of written or spoken
Example: If I can’t answer my phone when you call; please leave me a message and I will call you back.

Word: Messenger
Meaning: a person who delivers someone a message; packages or documents
Example: The law firm sent a messenger to pick up the documents from their clients business office.

Word: Messiah
Meaning: one who is thought to be the savior of a certain group
Example: Many of the politician’s followers see him as a messiah who will fix all of their problems.

Word: Meta
Meaning: a prefix added to a word to explain that one thing is related to other things
Example: The meta-search sites found on the internet all link to the same information.

Word: Metabolism
Meaning: the chemical reactions which cause fat cells and/or calories to burn 
Example: Jan can eat anything without gaining weight because of her fast metabolism.

Word: Metabolize
Meaning: to break down food in the body so it can be used for energy
Example: His body didn’t metabolize iron normally; so he took an iron supplement daily.

Word: Metamorphosis
Meaning: an observable change
Example: When Chet started exercising on a regular basis; he experienced a huge physical metamorphosis.

Word: Metaphor
Meaning: the use of a word or phrase something that it is not; invoking a direct similarity between them and the thing described
Example: He uses the metaphor of fire to represent hatred.

Word: Metaphysical
Meaning: associated with what is believed to be present yet not visible
Example: In the book; the main character spoke to a metaphysical being he couldn’t see.

Word: Metastasize
Meaning: to spread or grow to other sites
Example: The idea of revolution began to metastasize and spread like wildfire from Moscow to the impoverished Russian countryside.

Word: Mete
Meaning: to give out or distribute
Example: After being caught stealing; the boy waited for his father to mete out his punishment.

Word: Meteor
Meaning: a piece of debris from space that enters Earth’s atmosphere and becomes luminescent due to friction; appearing as a streak of light
Example: The satellite from outer space become a meteor as it fell into the atmosphere; coming alight with flame.

Word: Meter
Meaning: the basic unit of length in the metric system
Example: A metric ruler was used to measure the shelf to the nearest meter.

Word: Method
Meaning: a procedure or technique used to accomplish as task
Example: My simple method to cake baking is different from most pastry baker’s techniques.

Word: Methodical
Meaning: in an ordered manner
Example: My husband is very organized and has a methodical approach for doing every task.

Word: Meticulous
Meaning: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
Example: Because Haley is a meticulous cleaner; every inch of her house is spotless.

Word: Metonymy
Meaning: a form of speech in which the title of a thing or person is used to replace a name associated with it 
Example: When you refer to the film industry as Hollywood; you’re using a metonymy by calling one subject a name that equates to it.

Word: Metropolis
Meaning: a large; heavily populated city
Example: Accustomed to country life; the farmer had a difficult time adjusting to his new home in a metropolis.

Word: Mettle
Meaning: strength of spirit; the ability to continue despite difficulties
Example: Of all the young men in the village; Caldor was the only one with enough mettle to face the dragon in its lair.

Word: Milieu
Meaning: the environment in which one experiences life
Example: Because my father grew up in a military milieu; he knew he wanted to join the armed forces when he graduated from high school.

Word: Militant
Meaning: prone to engage in conflict for a belief or cause
Example: Since the militant group believes the president is a brutal dictator; it is crafting a plan to remove him from office.

Word: Militarism
Meaning: an ideology which claims that the military is the foundation of a society's security; and thereby its most important aspect
Example: Because he was a veteran; many of his political ideals followed a form of militarism.

Word: Military
Meaning: the armed forces of a country
Example: Without a military; a country cannot wage war with another for lack of soldiers and weapons to wage it with.

Word: Militate
Meaning: to influence or have an effect upon 
Example: The rain will militate a change of venue for our picnic.

Word: Militia
Meaning: a military force of trained and organized civilians who may be called to duty
Example: The militia was assigned to assist the police until the National Guard troops arrived.

Word: Mill
Meaning: a manufacturing plant for paper; steel; textiles; etc.
Example: Our local paper mill mostly hire people through a temp agency for short-term contracts.

Word: Millennium
Meaning: a period that covers one thousand years
Example: The year 2000 saw the end of another millennium.

Word: Millipede
Meaning: bug whose skeleton is on the outside of its body and is known for having many legs
Example: As the millipede crossed the room; the children were mesmerized by all of his little appendages transporting his body across the floor.

Word: Milquetoast
Meaning: a fearful or shy individual
Example: As the milquetoast quietly shuffled down the street with his shoulders hunched; his eyes would dart around hoping no one would see him.

Word: Mime
Meaning: a performer that uses movements and gestures instead of words to express something or tell a story
Example: The face-painted mime used its hands to pretend that it was stuck in a box while performing for the children.

Word: Mimic
Meaning: to imitate
Example: Bert can mimic the barking of a dog to perfection; scaring thieves away from his property.

Word: Mimicry
Meaning: the act of mirroring an action or behavior
Example: During the talent show; the boy won the audience over when he performed a mimicry of his favorite rapper.

Word: Minatory
Meaning: expressing a threat
Example: The hate group left a minatory threat in the form of a burning cross on the couple’s lawn.

Word: Mince
Meaning: finely chopped
Example: When we cook we will mince the onions and peppers so they will enhance the flavor of the meat and not overpower the meats overall taste.

Word: Mincing
Meaning: dainty and refined; especially in the way that one walks
Example: The woman spoke to her precious pup in a sweet and mincing voice.

Word: Mindful
Meaning: thoughtful; considerate and dutiful
Example: Since the child was burned by a fire; the teacher told the other students to be mindful of their classmate’s feelings by refraining from talking about the blaze.

Word: Mindless
Meaning: to be done without explanation or care for the results of the actions
Example: The criminal committed mindless acts of violence where innocent people were hurt.

Word: Mindset
Meaning: an established set of attitudes and beliefs that someone holds
Example: A person’s mindset is often determined by how they have been raised and the experiences they have had; though the way they think can change over time.

Word: Mingle
Meaning: To mix or combine (people or objects) 
Example: The spies decided to mingle in with the crowd and see if they could find the killer.

Word: Miniature
Meaning: petite in size compared to a larger representation of the item
Example: A miniature model of the castle was created with modeling clay and made it easy to see what the whole castle looked like.

Word: Minimal
Meaning: likely the smallest amount 
Example: With minimal supervision; the employee was supposed to work by himself and pose only limited questions to the boss.

Word: Minimum
Meaning: the smallest or lowest of something
Example: Since the minimum age requirement to ride the amusement park’s roller coaster was 12; the 11-year old had to wait for her friends on the ground.

Word: Minion
Meaning: an individual who obeys the commands of another person
Example: At work; I’m a minion who does everything my boss says.

Word: Minister
Meaning: a person who is trained to perform religious worship
Example: The minister at our local church spoke a fresh and interesting sermon to their parishioners on Easter Sunday.

Word: Minor
Meaning: a legal term meaning child or one under the age of 18
Example: The clerk at the store got in trouble for selling cigarettes to a sixteen-year-old minor.

Word: Minority
Meaning: the smaller percentage of the whole
Example: As they looked around the room full of red-clad Republicans; the Democrats knew they were in the minority and their hopes of stopping the bill were destroyed.

Word: Minuscule
Meaning: quite small
Example: Many fast food workers are quitting their jobs because of minuscule salaries.

Word: Minute
Meaning: a unit that equals 60 seconds of time
Example: With the last test for the school year approaching; Carol is spending every spare minute studying.

Word: Minutiae
Meaning: tiny unimportant details 
Example: The students ignored their teacher as she told them minutiae about her boring life.

Word: Miraculous
Meaning: astounding in a way that suggests a miracle
Example: Her miraculous recovery surprised the hospital staff.

Word: Mirage 
Meaning: an illusion that appears real but does not exist 
Example: When I was stranded in the desert; I saw a lake that turned out to be nothing but a mirage.

Word: Mire
Meaning: a situation or circumstance from which it is difficult to escape
Example: Getting arrested was a mire of unfortunate circumstances the parolee had tried to avoid.

Word: Mirror Image
Meaning: a person or thing that closely looks like someone or something else
Example: Amber is a mirror image of her mother and looks just like her mom did when she was young.

Word: Mirrored
Meaning: having a surface that is reflective like a mirror
Example: The mirrored sunglasses reflect out and stop others from seeing through the lens.

Word: Mirth
Meaning: amusement and joy
Example: It was obvious from Jacob’s mirth he found the movie to be quite funny.

Word: Mirthful
Meaning: filled with joy
Example: The mirthful boy couldn't stop smiling after opening his holiday gifts.

Word: Misanthrope
Meaning: a person who hates or distrusts humankind
Example: The old man was a misanthrope who surrounded his entire yard with barbed wire to keep his neighbors at bay.

Word: Misapprehension
Meaning: a failure to understand something
Example: The Police Commissioner is under the misapprehension that he can do what he chooses without following the laws.

Word: Misbehave
Meaning: to act disobey or act in a way that is bad
Example: Because the child continued to misbehave; he was placed in the corner for a time out.

Word: Miscegenation
Meaning: the mixing or blending of race; interracial marriage
Example: Laws against miscegenation caused one to never see a married couple with a Caucasian husband with an African American wife.

Word: Miscellaneous
Meaning: consisting of many different kinds of things that might not go together
Example: As a collector; he would sometimes buy a miscellaneous assortment of pennies hoping to find one worthy money.

Word: Mischief
Meaning: playful wrongdoing or troublemaking
Example: The children would always get into mischief if they were left unattended.

Word: Mischievous
Meaning: badly behaved; naughty
Example: Garry’s dog is very mischievous so don’t be thrown off by its cute smile.

Word: Miscible
Meaning: capable of two fluid substances being completely mixed together
Example: Since the contents in the glass became cloudy; it was apparent to the girl that the miscible solution in her glass had more than one liquid in it.

Word: Misconceived
Meaning: to misunderstand
Example: I can’t believe there’s still people who often compare misconceived women to be weak in a leadership role.

Word: Misconception
Meaning: a belief that is incorrect
Example: The explorer set out to disprove the misconception about the Earth’s flatness.

Word: Misconduct
Meaning: unacceptable or inappropriate behavior
Example: Police misconduct within the sheriff’s department caused several officers to be fired.

Word: Misconstrued
Meaning: to interpret something the wrong way
Example: Carla had no idea that her intended compliment had been completely misconstrued by her aunt.

Word: Miscount
Meaning: to count something incorrectly
Example: Because there are hundreds of pills in the bottle; it is very easy to miscount the amount inside the container.

Word: Miscreant
Meaning: an individual who has misbehaved
Example: The principal took the miscreant out of my classroom and placed him in the in-school suspension room.

Word: Misdeal
Meaning: to make a mistake while dealing cards
Example: The casino worker was careful not to misdeal when shelling out cards to the poker player.

Word: Misdeed
Meaning: something that should not have been done
Example: Gina will have to serve some jail time for her misdeed.

Word: Misdemeanor
Meaning: a minor crime
Example: After driving her vehicle on a suspended license; the woman was slapped by the court with a misdemeanor requiring her to pay a fine and spend the night in jail.

Word: Misdirection
Meaning: the action or process of directing someone to the wrong place or wrong instruction
Example: Misdirection of the tourists caused them to be lost downtown for several hours.

Word: Mise-en-scene
Meaning: the process of setting up a stage for a play or performance
Example: The crowd seemed oblivious to the mise-en-scene; keeping their eyes on the actors even as the scenery was being changed.

Word: Miser 
Meaning: an individual who tries to spend as little money as possible
Example: To save money; the miser ate only one meal a day.

Word: Miserable
Meaning: extremely unhappy and depressed
Example: Though she pretended to be happy; the woman was really miserable and hated her life.

Word: Miserly 
Meaning: tight with money; stingy
Example: The miserly billionaire complained about paying two dollars for a cheeseburger.

Word: Misery
Meaning: a state of suffering
Example: Living in a state of misery; the refugees suffered greatly because of their country’s war.

Word: Misfire
Meaning: to fail to fire a gun or missile correctly
Example: A glitch in the release system caused the rocket to misfire and it quickly exploded in place.

Word: Misfit
Meaning: a person whose personality or behavior sets them apart from others
Example: Because she is such a social misfit; Gina has a hard time finding anyone at school wants to be her friend.

Word: Misfortune
Meaning: an unfortunate event
Example: A misfortune caused Bill to miss his own birthday party.

Word: Misgiving
Meaning: a feeling of doubt
Example: When I learned my daughter’s boyfriend had just been released from prison; my misgiving about him became stronger.

Word: Misgovern
Meaning: to run a country or organization unfairly or inefficiently
Example: Because they are being bribed; it’s not shock that the administration would misgovern the country.

Word: Mishap
Meaning: an unpredictable accident; mistake or problem
Example: At the yearly fourth of July fireworks tonight; there was a mishap due to computer software problems that shut down the show early.

Word: Mislead
Meaning: to make someone believe something that is untrue by giving them wrong or incomplete information
Example: She would mislead all of her boyfriends into believing she wanted something more serious.

Word: Misleading
Meaning: giving the wrong idea or information
Example: Misleading advertisements made it seem the phone was being offered for free when it was not.

Word: Mismanage
Meaning: to handle something badly or inappropriately
Example: The over spender tends to mismanage his money and waste it on frivolous things like candy and gambling.

Word: Mismanagement
Meaning: handling of something in a way that is wrong or inappropriate
Example: The student’s mismanagement of her time caused her to miss her class and fail her test.

Word: Mismatch
Meaning: to combine two things that are not supposed to go together
Example: If you decide to mismatch your socks you will look funny to everyone that sees them; especially if they are different colors.

Word: Misnomer
Meaning: a name or description that is incorrect or inappropriate
Example: Since Fred is very skinny; calling him Fat Fred is indeed a misnomer.

Word: Misogyny
Meaning: an intense dislike of females
Example: The boy’s misogyny hailed from the abuse he suffered from his mother.

Word: Misprint
Meaning: an error in a printed text
Example: There is a misprint in the very first page of this book; as it misspells at least three words on the first page.

Word: Misrepresent
Meaning: to represent falsely; to inaccurately portray something
Example: The video has been edited and doctored out of context to misrepresent the event as it actually occurred.

Word: Misshapen
Meaning: altered or damaged so that it no longer resembles its original form
Example: The shopper picked up the misshapen apple; noted it’s bruised skin and tossed it back in the basket.

Word: Missionary
Meaning: someone sent on a mission to help others and convince people to join a particular religion
Example: The missionary spent hours every day going door to door; handing out religious pamphlets and books.

Word: Missive
Meaning: a written note 
Example: While sitting in class; Greg asked his classmate to pass a love missive to his dream girl.

Word: Misspell
Meaning: to spell a word incorrectly
Example: Before the spelling bee started; the children were told if they misspell a word; the speller would be removed from the competition.

Word: Misstep
Meaning: to step badly or incorrectly
Example: One wrong misstep during a dance competition may end your chances of moving on to the finale.

Word: Mistake
Meaning: an error or slip-up
Example: The mom made a mistake when she bought cake instead of vanilla.

Word: Mistaken
Meaning: wrong or incorrect
Example: Paul thought he saw a ghost in the corner; but his parents assured him that he was mistaken.

Word: Mistaking
Meaning: confusing
Example: Mistaking the salt for sugar seemed to ruin my cookies which caused everyone to refuse them.

Word: Mistreat
Meaning: ill-treat someone or an animal physically or emotionally
Example: When people mistreat their pets; they should pay a hefty fine with some of the money going to the animal shelter.

Word: Mistrial
Meaning: a trial that ends through an error in the proceedings
Example: Bill Cosby’s rape hearing ended in a mistrial since the jurors were deadlocked and couldn’t come to a decision.

Word: Mistrust
Meaning: a feeling of doubt or suspicion
Example: After Kurt was severely bitten by a dog; he developed a mistrust of most animals.

Word: Misuse
Meaning: to mistreat or abuse
Example: Naughty children may misuse toys that don’t belong to them by breaking them or throwing them across the room.

Word: Mite
Meaning: a little or slightly
Example: The man was acting a mite suspicious; enough that the cops stopped him to find out what he was up to.

Word: Mitigate
Meaning: make less severe or painful
Example: The doctor gave me a prescription to mitigate the pain.

Word: Mitochondria
Meaning: an organelle found inside a cell that produces energy
Example: As the powerhouse of animal cells; mitochondria are responsible for making energy-packed proteins.

Word: Mitosis
Meaning: the course in which a cell divides and forms two distinct cells; each having the same amount of chromosomes as the original cell
Example: A worm that has been split apart can often regenerate through a type of cell division known as mitosis.

Word: Mixed economy
Meaning: a system that protects the property of private citizens and allows the use of capital but also allows for governments to interfere in the economy to accomplish social aims
Example: A mixed economy has both private companies and government owned entities.

Word: Mixture
Meaning: an item made by blending different substances together
Example: A mixture of vodka and orange juice is referred to as a screwdriver.

Word: Mnemonic
Meaning: anything (especially something in verbal form) used to help remember something
Example: Our math professor taught us a simple mnemonic for remembering how to complete the equation.

Word: Moat
Meaning: a thin stream of water that completely surrounds right outside a large house or fortress 
Example: Since the dragon could not swim; he dared not cross the moat to any window or door of the castle.

Word: Mob
Meaning: an unruly; generally violent crowd of people intent on destruction or harm
Example: The police had to bring out riot shields to hold back the unruly mob of people that were trying to push them back.

Word: Mobile
Meaning: capable of being moved; portable
Example: A mobile blood bank parked their bus in a busy shopping center to draw shoppers into stopping by to donate blood.

Word: Mobility
Meaning: the ability to shift from one place to another
Example: My broken leg limits my mobility.

Word: Mockery 
Meaning: ridicule that is directed at a person; group; or thing
Example: The judge’s fake praise was nothing more than a mockery of my performance.

Word: Modality
Meaning: the way in which something is executed
Example: John gets multiple assignments done by working in a productive modality that allows him to combine tasks.

Word: Mode
Meaning: the way in which something is done or happens
Example: Every parent’s preferred mode of communication was email because it was much easier to access than taking a telephone call.

Word: Model
Meaning: a smaller replica of an object
Example: Based on the World War II stealth bomber; Johnny built a model of the plane using a kit and some art supplies.

Word: Modeled
Meaning: displayed clothing by wearing it
Example: The designer’s assistant modeled a gray sheath dress from with a wool overcoat during the winter show.

Word: Moderate
Meaning: An average amount
Example: The girl’s mild to moderate asthma did not affect her in the way it does a person with severe breathing problems.

Word: Moderately
Meaning: fairly; reasonably
Example: A string of moderately priced homes hit the market at the same time; creating a positive buyer’s market.

Word: Moderation
Meaning: the act of restraining oneself from doing something excessively
Example: Eating fatty foods is acceptable as long as you do it in moderation without overdoing it.

Word: Modern
Meaning: taking place during the current times
Example: Using modern warfare; the number of casualties in war has decreased through the use of drones and other high tech equipment.

Meaning: a movement towards modifying traditional beliefs with modern ideas
Example: Residential modernism in the area moved homes away from country looks and towards clean lines.

Meaning: of moderate amount
Example: With our modest incomes; my wife and I can usually afford two vacations a year.

Word: Modular

Word: Module

Word: Modus operandi

Word: Mondegreen

Word: Monogram

Word: Monolingual

Word: Monologue

Word: Monomania
Meaning: a mental illness characterized by excessive obsessive or concentration on a single thing or idea

Word: Monomer
Meaning: becomes a polymer when two similar molecules are joined

Word: Monotonous

Word: Monsoon

Word: Mortar

Word: Mortification

Word: Mortify

Word: Mortuary

Word: Mosaic

Word: Mosque

Word: Mosquito

Word: Moss

Example: Scientists have proven that algae adapted to life on earth; growing into other plants including green moss.

Word: Most
Meaning: greatest in amount; degree or number; superlative of much or many
Example: After Dan retired from the Army; we decided to move back to our home state where most of our friends and family live.

Word: Mote
Meaning: a tiny piece of something

Word: Mother

Word: Motherhood
Meaning: the state of being a mother to a child

Meaning: the ability to move around in fluid

Word: Nebula
Meaning: a space cloud consisting of gas or dust
Example: I love to venture out into the open fields on a clear night and gawk at every galaxy and nebula that my naked eyes can detect.

Word: Nebulous
Meaning: Unclear; vague; not clearly defined
Example: It was not difficult to realize her answer to the question was nebulous.

Word: Necessarily
Meaning: automatically; certainly
Example: Putting down that you are a felon won’t necessarily stop you from getting the job; but it probably won’t help either.

Word: Necessary
Meaning: being required or vital
Example: For the chocolate cake; the necessary ingredients included flour; eggs; butter and cocoa.

Word: Necessitate
Meaning: to make essential as a result of something
Example: The heavy rain will necessitate the use of an umbrella.

Word: Necessities
Meaning: needs or essential supplies
Example: Even though the spoiled wife believed that a sports car and lots of money were the necessities of life; she could have lived with a regular sedan.

Word: Necessitous
Meaning: deprived and poverty-stricken
Example: The necessitous circumstances surrounding the flood victims became evidence when we saw all of the destruction.

Word: Necessity
Meaning: to be essential or vital
Example: Water is a necessity of life because failure to drink water in three days will cause death.

Word: Necrology
Meaning: a biographical description of a person who has recently died
Example: My grandmother’s necrology was posted online so that everyone could see what a wonderful person she was.

Word: Necromancy
Meaning: the act of communicating with spirits of deceased individuals
Example: When Maggie’s husband died; she visited a psychic who claimed she could use necromancy to talk to deceased persons.

Word: Necrosis
Meaning: the complete deterioration of a bodily organ
Example: Cancer first caused the necrosis of the liver which led to the liver failing to produce proteins used in coagulating the blood.

Word: Nectar
Meaning: the sweet liquid produced from certain plants and flowers that bees turn into honey
Example: Instead of acquiring the nectar from the plant; the farmers knew to wait until the bumblebees would convert it into honey.

Word: Nee
Meaning: born with this name usually before getting married
Example: Harriet Tubman; nee Araminta Ross; helped slaves escape to the North using the Underground Railroad.

Word: Needle
Meaning: a long thin sharp pointy device that holds thread and is used for stitching fabric
Example: When I tore my shirt; my friend grabbed a needle and thread in order to sew the material back together.

Word: Needless
Meaning: not essential or wanted
Example: Usually; the child spoke needless words simply because he was used to babbling all day about random things.

Word: Nefarious
Meaning: very evil and wicked
Example: How nefarious of you to fling dog crap on my car!

Word: Negate
Meaning: to cause something to be ineffective; to nullify
Example: Be careful when shopping because you do not want unnecessary purchases to negate the value of the coupons you are using.

Word: Negative
Meaning: a gloomy outlook on something
Example: Teenagers usually have negative attitudes toward adults because they think they know everything.

Word: Negative
Meaning: focused on what is bad; harmful; or lacking
Example: Negative effects of the medicine have stopped many patients from taking it.

Word: Neglect
Meaning: to abandon or ignore
Example: When you have children and work a full-time job; you may neglect your appearance because it is not important anymore.

Word: Negligence
Meaning: neglect; inattention
Example: The parent’s negligence resulted in their children being taken from their care and placed in a safer home.

Word: Negligent
Meaning: careless; irresponsible
Example: I felt negligent for leaving Jean’s toddler alone in the car.

Word: Negligible
Meaning: too small to be of importance
Example: Since the price difference between the generic item and the brand item is negligible; I will buy the brand product.

Word: Negotiable
Meaning: capable of being bargained or bartered with
Example: Even though the house was priced very low; the potential buyers still believe the price was negotiable.

Word: Negotiate
Meaning: to try to reach an agreement or come to terms
Example: We sat down to negotiate a deal that would satisfy everyone.

Word: Neigh
Meaning: the sound a horse makes
Example: Whenever anyone would get close to the fence; the horse would neigh to get the attention of its master.

Word: Neighbor
Meaning: a person who resides nearby
Example: While baking a cake; I needed to ask my neighbor for sugar since I had just run out.

Word: Neighborhood
Meaning: an area where people live close together
Example: The single woman became frightened when a prowler was spotted in her neighborhood looking in everyone’s houses.

Word: Nemesis
Meaning: an enemy who is constantly causing problems 
Example: Kara was not happy when her nemesis won the contest.

Word: Neoclassical
Meaning: in the manner of Ancient Greek or Romans
Example: Neoclassical artists model their paintings off of Ancient Greek and Roman masterpieces.

Word: Neolithic
Meaning: relating to a time known as the New Stone Age in which polished stone tools; pottery; weaving; stock rearing; and agriculture became prominent
Example: The village dwellings are adobe style and were crafted from clay and water.

Word: Neolithic
Meaning: the last part of the Stone Age in which agricultural and technological elements began to advance
Example: The village is home to a Neolithic dig site where late Stone Age pieces have been discovered.

Word: Neologism
Meaning: a new term or phrase recently added to a person or group’s vocabulary
Example: The neologism became so popular it was added to most dictionaries.

Word: Neonatal
Meaning: relating to a newborn baby
Example: Positive neonatal outcomes were much more positive for babies whose mothers did not smoke during pregnancy.

Word: Neophyte
Meaning: someone who is just learning to do something
Example: Because I have very little computer experience; I am a neophyte when it comes to working with most software programs.

Word: Nepenthe
Meaning: a fictional potion said to have been used by the ancient people to erase the memory of pain or sorrow
Example: To help her chase away all of her sorrow; Polydamna gave Helen a nepenthe potion.

Word: Nephew
Meaning: a son of one's brother or sister
Example: My sister enjoys keeping her nephew in the afternoons and it helps me get work done as well.

Word: Nepotism
Meaning: the act of giving opportunities to others simply because of a personal relationship 
Example: Since George is an idiot everyone knows his father hired him because of nepotism.

Word: Nerve
Meaning: courage; steadfastness
Example: Gathering the nerve to ask the young lady to dance; the shy wallflower ventured away from the corner and marched towards the center of the dance floor.

Word: Nerves
Meaning: a person’s mental state or perceived source of emotional control
Example: The anxious player’s nerves were on edge as he waited to see if he would be drafted in the first round.

Word: Nervous breakdown
Meaning: a period of mental illness that results from depression; stress; or anxiety
Example: After finding out that her husband was having an affair; the upset wife had a nervous breakdown and ended up in the mental hospital.

Word: Nervous wreck
Meaning: a person who is extremely anxious or worried about something
Example: Because she is so afraid of fish; Demi was a nervous wreck while swimming in the ocean.

Word: Nervous
Meaning: anxious; worried
Example: The bank teller could tell that the uneasy robber was nervous by the way his hand shook as he brandished his weapon.

Word: Nervously
Meaning: anxiously; apprehensively
Example: Smiling nervously; the interviewee tried not to let her anxiety show.

Word: Nervousness
Meaning: anxiety; edginess
Example: During dinner; the gentleman could sense his date’s nervousness as she anxiously tapped her fingers on the table.

Word: Nescience
Meaning: unawareness or ignorance
Example: Because of a nescience of allergic reactions; many people with allergies don’t carry the proper emergency medicines.

Word: Nestle
Meaning: to snuggle or cuddle something
Example: The bear cub’s mother began to nestle him closer as they drifted off to sleep.

Word: Net Force
Meaning: the total amount of force exerted on an object
Example: If you are pushing a cart and there is no resistance; the force you are exerting on that cart is the net force.

Word: Net
Meaning: a piece of mesh fabric used for as specific purpose (usually to catch animals or sports balls.)
Example: Positioning the net in the water; the fisherman prepared to catch a fish with one swift swoop.

Word: Nether
Meaning: rear; posterior
Example: An anatomy ultrasound scan of the fetus’s nether regions showed that he is definitely all boy.

Word: Nettle
Meaning: to cause someone to become annoyed or angry
Example: My brother will often nettle me by reading my diary.

Word: Nettlesome
Meaning: irritating; annoying
Example: Asking another nettlesome question; the child irritated her mother to no end.

Word: Network
Meaning: a system or association
Example: Our insurance will only pay for treatment if you use a doctor that is in their network of providers.

Word: Neural
Meaning: relating to the nervous system
Example: Nerves in the brain of mice brains were examined to determine what kind of neural response was released after food was given.

Word: Neuralgia
Meaning: pain in a nerve pathway
Example: Neuralgia is a form of chronic nerve pain that is hard for doctors to understand and diagnose.

Word: Neurasthenic
Meaning: a now obsolete psychiatric symptom that is more commonly known as chronic fatigue syndrome and is characterized by extreme mental and physical exhaustion
Example: Early 19th century insane asylums were filled with people showing neurasthenic symptoms; simply exhausted and in need of rest.

Word: Neurological
Meaning: related to the science of the nerves and nervous system
Example: Neurological problems related to the brain’s nerve endings were diagnosed by the patient’s physician.

Word: Neurologist
Meaning: a physician that deals with deals with the nervous system and the diseases that affect it
Example: Only one neurologist was available to talk to the patient’s family after he severely injured the nerves in his hand.

Word: Neurology
Meaning: the branch of medicine that deals with the nervous system and the diseases that affect it
Example: The physician decided to specialize in neurology since the study of the central nervous system piqued her interest.

Word: Neuromuscular
Meaning: relating to both the nerves and muscles
Example: Neuromuscular damage to the spinal cord nerves and surrounding muscles left the diver unable to move.

Word: Neuroscience
Meaning: the scientific study of the nervous system and the brain
Example: The field of neuroscience is fairly new; with the study of the brain and the body’s still being rather contemporary.

Word: Neurotic
Meaning: overly anxious; unstable
Example: Sally is a neurotic person who is often moody.

Word: Neutral
Meaning: unbiased; impartial
Example: Being neutral in the matter; I refused to take sides with either my brother or my sister.

Word: Neutrality
Meaning: the state or quality of being neutral; state of taking no part on either side
Example: Neutrality was impossible when choosing to write a persuasive speech.

Word: Neutralize
Meaning: to make unsuccessful or ineffective
Example: A glass of milk will help neutralize the spicy contents in my stomach.

Word: Neutron
Meaning: a particle in a nucleus; made of quarks; that lacks an electric charge and has a mass comparable to the mass of a proton
Example: Unlike a proton which has a positive charge; a neutron doesn’t have any charge.

Word: Nevertheless
Meaning: yet; however
Example: A wage assignment was issued; nevertheless; a payment has not been made.

Meaning: an employee who was recently hired for a job

Meaning: to cause minor but continuous irritation or anxiety

Word: Nebulous
Meaning: Unclear; vague; not clearly defined
Example: It was not difficult to realize her answer to the question was nebulous.

Word: Necessarily
Meaning: automatically; certainly
Example: Putting down that you are a felon won’t necessarily stop you from getting the job; but it probably won’t help either.

Word: Necessary
Meaning: being required or vital
Example: For the chocolate cake; the necessary ingredients included flour; eggs; butter and cocoa.

Word: Necessitate
Meaning: to make essential as a result of something
Example: The heavy rain will necessitate the use of an umbrella.

Word: Necessities
Meaning: needs or essential supplies
Example: Even though the spoiled wife believed that a sports car and lots of money were the necessities of life; she could have lived with a regular sedan.

Word: Necessitous
Meaning: deprived and poverty-stricken
Example: The necessitous circumstances surrounding the flood victims became evidence when we saw all of the destruction.

Word: Necessity
Meaning: to be essential or vital
Example: Water is a necessity of life because failure to drink water in three days will cause death.

Word: Necrology
Meaning: a biographical description of a person who has recently died
Example: My grandmother’s necrology was posted online so that everyone could see what a wonderful person she was.

Word: Necromancy
Meaning: the act of communicating with spirits of deceased individuals
Example: When Maggie’s husband died; she visited a psychic who claimed she could use necromancy to talk to deceased persons.

Word: Necrosis
Meaning: the complete deterioration of a bodily organ
Example: Cancer first caused the necrosis of the liver which led to the liver failing to produce proteins used in coagulating the blood.

Word: Nectar
Meaning: the sweet liquid produced from certain plants and flowers that bees turn into honey
Example: Instead of acquiring the nectar from the plant; the farmers knew to wait until the bumblebees would convert it into honey.

Word: Nee
Meaning: born with this name usually before getting married
Example: Harriet Tubman; nee Araminta Ross; helped slaves escape to the North using the Underground Railroad.

Word: Needle
Meaning: a long thin sharp pointy device that holds thread and is used for stitching fabric
Example: When I tore my shirt; my friend grabbed a needle and thread in order to sew the material back together.

Word: Needless
Meaning: not essential or wanted
Example: Usually; the child spoke needless words simply because he was used to babbling all day about random things.

Word: Nefarious
Meaning: very evil and wicked
Example: How nefarious of you to fling dog crap on my car!

Word: Negate
Meaning: to cause something to be ineffective; to nullify
Example: Be careful when shopping because you do not want unnecessary purchases to negate the value of the coupons you are using.

Word: Negative
Meaning: a gloomy outlook on something
Example: Teenagers usually have negative attitudes toward adults because they think they know everything.

Word: Negative
Meaning: focused on what is bad; harmful; or lacking
Example: Negative effects of the medicine have stopped many patients from taking it.

Word: Neglect
Meaning: to abandon or ignore
Example: When you have children and work a full-time job; you may neglect your appearance because it is not important anymore.

Word: Negligence
Meaning: neglect; inattention
Example: The parent’s negligence resulted in their children being taken from their care and placed in a safer home.

Word: Negligent
Meaning: careless; irresponsible
Example: I felt negligent for leaving Jean’s toddler alone in the car.

Word: Negligible
Meaning: too small to be of importance
Example: Since the price difference between the generic item and the brand item is negligible; I will buy the brand product.

Word: Negotiable
Meaning: capable of being bargained or bartered with
Example: Even though the house was priced very low; the potential buyers still believe the price was negotiable.

Word: Negotiate
Meaning: to try to reach an agreement or come to terms
Example: We sat down to negotiate a deal that would satisfy everyone.

Word: Neigh
Meaning: the sound a horse makes
Example: Whenever anyone would get close to the fence; the horse would neigh to get the attention of its master.

Word: Neighbor
Meaning: a person who resides nearby
Example: While baking a cake; I needed to ask my neighbor for sugar since I had just run out.

Word: Neighborhood
Meaning: an area where people live close together
Example: The single woman became frightened when a prowler was spotted in her neighborhood looking in everyone’s houses.

Word: Nemesis
Meaning: an enemy who is constantly causing problems
Example: Kara was not happy when her nemesis won the contest.

Word: Neoclassical
Meaning: in the manner of Ancient Greek or Romans
Example: Neoclassical artists model their paintings off of Ancient Greek and Roman masterpieces.

Word: Neolithic
Meaning: relating to a time known as the New Stone Age in which polished stone tools; pottery; weaving; stock rearing; and agriculture became prominent
Example: The village dwellings are adobe style and were crafted from clay and water.

Word: Neolithic
Meaning: the last part of the Stone Age in which agricultural and technological elements began to advance
Example: The village is home to a Neolithic dig site where late Stone Age pieces have been discovered.

Word: Neologism
Meaning: a new term or phrase recently added to a person or group’s vocabulary
Example: The neologism became so popular it was added to most dictionaries.

Word: Neonatal
Meaning: relating to a newborn baby
Example: Positive neonatal outcomes were much more positive for babies whose mothers did not smoke during pregnancy.

Word: Neophyte
Meaning: someone who is just learning to do something
Example: Because I have very little computer experience; I am a neophyte when it comes to working with most software programs.

Word: Nepenthe
Meaning: a fictional potion said to have been used by the ancient people to erase the memory of pain or sorrow
Example: To help her chase away all of her sorrow; Polydamna gave Helen a nepenthe potion.

Word: Nephew
Meaning: a son of one's brother or sister
Example: My sister enjoys keeping her nephew in the afternoons and it helps me get work done as well.

Word: Nepotism
Meaning: the act of giving opportunities to others simply because of a personal relationship
Example: Since George is an idiot everyone knows his father hired him because of nepotism.

Word: Nerve
Meaning: courage; steadfastness
Example: Gathering the nerve to ask the young lady to dance; the shy wallflower ventured away from the corner and marched towards the center of the dance floor.

Word: Nerves
Meaning: a person’s mental state or perceived source of emotional control
Example: The anxious player’s nerves were on edge as he waited to see if he would be drafted in the first round.

Word: Nervous breakdown
Meaning: a period of mental illness that results from depression; stress; or anxiety
Example: After finding out that her husband was having an affair; the upset wife had a nervous breakdown and ended up in the mental hospital.

Word: Nervous wreck
Meaning: a person who is extremely anxious or worried about something
Example: Because she is so afraid of fish; Demi was a nervous wreck while swimming in the ocean.

Word: Nervous
Meaning: anxious; worried
Example: The bank teller could tell that the uneasy robber was nervous by the way his hand shook as he brandished his weapon.

Word: Nervously
Meaning: anxiously; apprehensively
Example: Smiling nervously; the interviewee tried not to let her anxiety show.

Word: Nervousness
Meaning: anxiety; edginess
Example: During dinner; the gentleman could sense his date’s nervousness as she anxiously tapped her fingers on the table.

Word: Nescience
Meaning: unawareness or ignorance
Example: Because of a nescience of allergic reactions; many people with allergies don’t carry the proper emergency medicines.

Word: Nestle
Meaning: to snuggle or cuddle something
Example: The bear cub’s mother began to nestle him closer as they drifted off to sleep.

Word: Net Force
Meaning: the total amount of force exerted on an object
Example: If you are pushing a cart and there is no resistance; the force you are exerting on that cart is the net force.

Word: Net
Meaning: a piece of mesh fabric used for as specific purpose (usually to catch animals or sports balls.)
Example: Positioning the net in the water; the fisherman prepared to catch a fish with one swift swoop.

Word: Nether
Meaning: rear; posterior
Example: An anatomy ultrasound scan of the fetus’s nether regions showed that he is definitely all boy.

Word: Nettle
Meaning: to cause someone to become annoyed or angry
Example: My brother will often nettle me by reading my diary.

Word: Nettlesome
Meaning: irritating; annoying
Example: Asking another nettlesome question; the child irritated her mother to no end.

Word: Network
Meaning: a system or association
Example: Our insurance will only pay for treatment if you use a doctor that is in their network of providers.

Word: Neural
Meaning: relating to the nervous system
Example: Nerves in the brain of mice brains were examined to determine what kind of neural response was released after food was given.

Word: Neuralgia
Meaning: pain in a nerve pathway
Example: Neuralgia is a form of chronic nerve pain that is hard for doctors to understand and diagnose.

Word: Neurasthenic
Meaning: a now obsolete psychiatric symptom that is more commonly known as chronic fatigue syndrome and is characterized by extreme mental and physical exhaustion
Example: Early 19th century insane asylums were filled with people showing neurasthenic symptoms; simply exhausted and in need of rest.

Word: Neurological
Meaning: related to the science of the nerves and nervous system
Example: Neurological problems related to the brain’s nerve endings were diagnosed by the patient’s physician.

Word: Neurologist
Meaning: a physician that deals with deals with the nervous system and the diseases that affect it
Example: Only one neurologist was available to talk to the patient’s family after he severely injured the nerves in his hand.

Word: Neurology
Meaning: the branch of medicine that deals with the nervous system and the diseases that affect it
Example: The physician decided to specialize in neurology since the study of the central nervous system piqued her interest.

Word: Neuromuscular
Meaning: relating to both the nerves and muscles
Example: Neuromuscular damage to the spinal cord nerves and surrounding muscles left the diver unable to move.

Word: Neuroscience
Meaning: the scientific study of the nervous system and the brain
Example: The field of neuroscience is fairly new; with the study of the brain and the body’s still being rather contemporary.

Word: Neurotic
Meaning: overly anxious; unstable
Example: Sally is a neurotic person who is often moody.

Word: Neutral
Meaning: unbiased; impartial
Example: Being neutral in the matter; I refused to take sides with either my brother or my sister.

Word: Neutrality
Meaning: the state or quality of being neutral; state of taking no part on either side
Example: Neutrality was impossible when choosing to write a persuasive speech.

Word: Neutralize
Meaning: to make unsuccessful or ineffective
Example: A glass of milk will help neutralize the spicy contents in my stomach.

Word: Neutron
Meaning: a particle in a nucleus; made of quarks; that lacks an electric charge and has a mass comparable to the mass of a proton
Example: Unlike a proton which has a positive charge; a neutron doesn’t have any charge.

Word: Nevertheless
Meaning: yet; however
Example: A wage assignment was issued; nevertheless; a payment has not been made.

Word: New-hire
Meaning: an employee who was recently hired for a job
Example: The manager requested that the new-hire take a drug test before reporting to his newly assigned post.

Word: Newcomer
Meaning: a beginner at a place or in a group
Example: Since the middle school students grew up together in the tight-knit small town; it was evident when a newcomer entered the school.

Word: Newfangled
Meaning: contemporary; modern
Example: Newfangled cell phone cameras have all put replaced the handheld Polaroids of the past.

Word: Newness
Meaning: the quality of being new or original
Example: The shiny diamond’s newness quickly wore off; and the woman returned the impulsive purchase to the jeweler.

Word: Newscast
Meaning: a news broadcast
Example: Expressing their condolences beforehand; reporters on the ten o’clock newscast confirmed that remains of the missing scuba diver had been discovered.

Word: Newton
Meaning: the Standard International unit of force
Example: Force is a quantity that is measured by a metric unit known as a newton.

Word: Next
Meaning: following; subsequent
Example: The next day; the oracle’s prediction came true when a golden-haired warrior appeared to claim the throne.

Word: Nexus

Example: In our town; the nexus of the art world is the museum district.

Word: Nibble
Meaning: to take small bites
Example: As he continued to nibble on the small piece of cheese; the mouse did not see the sneaky cat coming up behind him.

Word: Nicely
Meaning: suitably; adequately
Example: The colors of the tenant’s new furniture blends in nicely with the apartments neutral walls.

Word: Nicety
Meaning: accuracy or precision
Example: The nicety of her spelling allowed her to win both the local and state spelling bees.

Word: Niche
Meaning: a unique field or market
Example: With so many cupcakes stores open; it is hard to find a competitive niche in that market.

Word: Nick
Meaning: a small chip or groove
Example: A small nick in the wood was the only flaw in the bedroom suite.

Word: Nickname
Meaning: an alias or alternate name that someone uses instead of their real name
Example: Because he has the same name as hid dad; Jerry goes by the nickname Junior.

Word: Niece
Meaning: the daughter of one’s sister or brother
Example: My brother and sister-in-law want to have a boy; but I am secretly hoping for a niece.

Word: Niggardly
Meaning: miserly; extremely stingy
Example: Even though the niggardly old man was worth millions; he still buried his wife in the cheapest casket available.

Word: Niggle
Meaning: to cause minor but continuous irritation or anxiety
Example: Something decided to niggle at me for the duration of the day; but even though it continued to bother me I couldn’t remember what it was.

Word: Nightmare
Meaning: a very terrifying or upsetting situation
Example: The bride’s dream wedding quickly turned into a nightmare after the groom ran away from the altar.

Word: Nihilism
Meaning: the idea that societal rules are worthless and should be eliminated
Example: The rebels urged the people to grab hold of nihilism and remove all government officials from office.

Word: Nil
Meaning: nothing; zero; nonexistent
Example: With only five of us and over a hundred of the enemy; our chances of emerging victorious in this battle are nil.

Word: Nimble
Meaning: quick in action or comprehension
Example: The overweight police officer could not catch the nimble suspect.

Word: Nimbus
Meaning: a dark grey rain cloud
Example: Looking up at the dark nimbus; Hector wondered how long it would be before it started to rain.

Word: Nimiety
Meaning: a quantity that is in excess of what’s appropriate

Word: Nincompoop
Meaning: a foolish person who is considered dumb
Example: Harold always behaves like a nincompoop; running around making faces at others trying to do their work.

Word: Nirvana

Example: The monk urged me to sit and meditate until I reached nirvana.

Word: Nitpick
Meaning: to correct minutiae or find fault in unimportant details
Example: Does anyone else notice how judges will nitpick about the littlest mistakes on competition shows? 

Word: Niveous
Meaning: snowy; white like snow
Example: After the snowstorm; the niveous landscape was as white as snow.

Word: Nix
Meaning: to cancel; end; or reject
Example: Over time; it became painfully clear that the smartest choice was to nix the partnership and dissolve the business.

Word: Nocturnal
Meaning: taking place at night
Example: Bats are nocturnal creatures because they tend to be more active during the night hours.

Word: Nocuous
Meaning: harmful; likely to cause injury
Example: Sitting inside the deadly car; the driver was unaware that he was breathing in nocuous gas.

Word: Nod

Example: At the diner; when the waitress asked if I was ready for more coffee; I gave her a silent nod because my mouth was full of food.

Meaning: loudly

Meaning: one who wanders

Word: Nominal
Meaning: incredibly small
Example: The court gave me a nominal award that did not cover the cost of my car repairs.

Word: Nominate
Meaning: to elect someone as a potential candidate for a position

Word: Non compos mentis
Meaning: unable to make decisions because of a mental issue; whether it be psychological; physical; or through a disease like dementia
Example: The court declared the defendant non compos mentis and mandated time served in a psychiatric facility.

Word: Non compos mentis
Meaning: not of sound mind; unable to handle one’s own affairs legally

Word: Non-negotiable
Meaning: not open to discussion or modification

Word: Non-sequitur
Meaning: a statement or conclusion that does not logically follow something said before
Example: The politician’s excuse for his lies was a non-sequitur that had nothing to do with the facts.

Word: Nonagon
Meaning: a nine sided polygon

Word: Nonchalant

Word: Noncommittal

Example: The nonconformist farmer loves to wear his overalls to important meetings.

Word: Nonplussed

Word: Notable

Word: Notation

Word: Notch

Word: Nuclear
Meaning: pertaining to an atomic binding that can be dangerous

Word: Nucleolus
Meaning: the center spherical part of the nucleus that has a connection with DNA and RNA
Example: Scientists study the nucleolus of each cell in order to determine the genetic make-up involving the person’s DNA.

Word: Nucleotide
Meaning: the fundamental components of RNA and DNA
Example: In order to fully understand a person’s genetic makeup; the scientist will have to first analyze the person’s nucleotide.

Word: Nucleus 
Meaning: the key element of a person; place; or thing upon which everything else is connected

Word: Nudge
Meaning: a slight shove or bump from someone or something

Word: Nugatory
Meaning: having no worth or value; useless

Word: Nuisance

Word: Null
Meaning: worthless or unfounded in the legal sense

Word: Nullification 
Meaning: the action of making something ineffective or null
Example: The referee’s nullification of the touchdown cost the home team the game.

Word: Nullify
Meaning: make of no use or value; cancel out
Example: Hopefully the coffee will nullify the drowsy effects of the medication and allow me to stay awake.

Word: Numb
Meaning: the decrease or absence of feeling in a body part
Example: Downing the frozen yogurt in under two minutes caused a numb sensation in his lips and a strong brain freeze.

Word: Numbly
Meaning: emotionlessly or without expression
Example: After hearing excuse after excuse; the teacher listened numbly to her student’s twentieth excuse for not having his homework.

Word: Numbness
Meaning: the decrease or absence of feeling
Example: Fearful of frostbite subsided for the trapped snow skier when the numbness started to go away and the man could feel the touch of his feet.

Word: Numeral
Meaning: something signifying a number
Example: Using Roman numeral five meant that I wrote a capital V on my outline.

Word: Numerator
Meaning: the top number of a fraction
Example: If you divide the numerator by the denominator; you will be able to determine the percentage of something.

Word: Numerical
Meaning: pertaining to numerals
Example: In order to decode the message; someone would have to determine the numerical representation for each letter.

Word: Numerous
Meaning: frequent; various or several
Example: After being given numerous warnings for disrupting class; Thomas was finally sent to the principal’s office.

Word: Numinous
Meaning: displaying a holy or sacred characteristics
Example: After months of digging at the ancient burial site; an archaeologist uncovered a numinous artifact from the civilization’s ceremonial chamber.

Word: Numismatist

Word: Nuncupative

Example: The royal nuptials are scheduled to take place on June 30 in St. Mark’s Cathedral.

Word: Opportunity cost
