Word: Opposable thump
Meaning: a thumb that allows the digits to grasp and handle objects and is characteristic of primates
Example: Using his opposable thumb; the monkey gripped the tree and hung high above the jungle floor.

Word: Oppose
Meaning: to go against something
Example: Due to Sheila’s religious belief that life is precious; she would oppose the death penalty for any crime.

Word: Opposite
Meaning: something that is contrary to something else
Example: When I realized that traveling north on the interstate was wrong; I quickly went in the opposite direction and headed south.

Word: Opposition
Meaning: a challenger or an opposing opinion
Example: The politician’s opposition claims he has a history of sexually harassing women.

Word: Oppress
Meaning: to hold down through use of force or fear
Example: The dictator uses fear to oppress his people.

Word: Oppressive
Meaning: overwhelming; restricting
Example: Because I am very sensitive to the oppressive heat; I tend to spend most of the summer indoors.

Word: Oppressor
Meaning: one who dominates someone by hard work or slavery
Example: Under the communist government; many citizens felt the suffering and persecution at the hands of the oppressor.

Word: Opprobrious
Meaning: conveying shame or contempt
Example: Elaine was offended by her friends’ opprobrious remarks about her drunken behavior.

Word: Opprobrium
Meaning: the disgrace incurred by conduct considered outrageously shameful
Example: Ben’s criminal opprobrium nearly cost him the election.

Word: Oppugn
Meaning: to doubt the authenticity of something
Example: During a presidential election; many politicians oppugn the ideas of the opposing party by providing proof of their wrongdoings.

Word: Opt
Meaning: to make a selection
Example: After receiving many worthless advertisements in her email; Cynthia decided to opt out of receiving any emails from unknown senders.

Word: Optic
Meaning: pertaining to the eye
Example: Incessant exposure to bright light created optic damage to the patient resulting in being visually impaired.

Word: Optical
Meaning: of; or relating to sight; visual
Example: Using optical aids such as telescopes or microscopes give a clear view at what you’re looking at. 

Word: Optimism
Meaning: hopefulness about things to come
Example: Gail’s optimism allows her to believe anything is possible.

Word: Optimist
Meaning: one who always has a positive outlook
Example: As an optimist; I always believe tomorrow will be better than today.

Word: Optimistic
Meaning: hopeful about the future or a specific outcome
Example: Though we haven’t won a game all year; our team is still optimistic that today we will win.

Word: Optimum
Meaning: the best condition
Example: For my financial circumstances; the optimum loan would need to have an interest rate below four percent.

Word: Optometrist
Meaning: a doctor whose medical practice revolves around detecting and correcting vision problems
Example: Visiting the optometrist to have his eyes checked was quite an achievement for the overly nervous patient.

Word: Opulent
Meaning: extravagant and rich
Example: Because the movie star made over ten million dollars a film; she was able to maintain an opulent lifestyle.

Word: Opus
Meaning: a significant work from an artist; writer; or other creative individual
Example: The songwriter worked day and night on the opus he prayed would make him famous.

Word: Opuscule
Meaning: an insignificant literary; art; or musical work
Example: Although Shakespeare had many famous plays; the opuscule one performed by the cast was a little-known.

Word: Oracle
Meaning: an individual with great intelligence or a person who speaks for a deity
Example: The computer genius is viewed as the oracle of technology who changed the world.

Word: Oracular
Meaning: prophetic; predictive
Example: Oracular predictions proved to be true as the medium knew that Donald Trump would be elected president.

Word: Oration
Meaning: a ceremonial speech that is formal

Word: Orator
Meaning: one who excels at speaking to an audience
Example: Thad is a much-liked orator who keeps people fully engaged while he is speaking.

Word: Orbit
Meaning: to move around something in a circular path
Example: The earth continues to orbit around the sun in a circular pattern.

Word: Orchard
Meaning: acreage where fruit trees are produced
Example: Apparently; the Apple Tree Restaurant acquired its apples for its dishes from the orchard that lined the road next to the restaurant.

Meaning: a group of people who play musical instruments together
Example: The trumpet could be heard over all of the other instruments in the orchestra.

Word: Orchestrate
Meaning: to organize or plan all of the details of an event
Example: Cautious FBI agents were able to orchestrate the sting without setting off any red flags.

Word: Ordain
Meaning: to deliver a decree or confirm a person into a religious ministry
Example: If the church decides to ordain the convicted rapist as a deacon; many people will leave the congregation.

Word: Ordeal 
Meaning: a tough experience
Example: The eighteen-hour plane trip was an ordeal for my hyperactive toddler.

Word: Order
Meaning: to request something be supplied; made; or served
Example: At the restaurant; I always order the pasta; and my mother requests a well-done steak.

Word: Order
Meaning: a request to supply goods to someone
Example: Sharon placed an order today online for clothes that are on clearance and was thrilled over the prices. 

Word: Orderly
Meaning: having a neat and organized system
Example: Orderly gardens surrounded by fences were lined in meticulous rows.

Word: Ordinance
Meaning: legislation or a decree
Example: The county ordinance prohibits smoking inside public establishments.

Word: Ordinarily
Meaning: usually; normally; or routinely
Example: Ordinarily I wouldn’t bother going outside before noon; but it’s snowing and I would like to play in it before it all melts.

Word: Ordinary
Meaning: normal; average
Example: Although it seemed extreme to others; working a 16 hour shift was part of the officer’s ordinary day.

Word: Ore
Meaning: element that naturally yields a metal
Example: After stumbling upon an abandoned mine; the experienced miner realized that ore could still be extracted here to produce iron.

Word: Organelle
Meaning: a specialized part of a cell
Example: An organelle is a structure inside of a living cell that has a specific role.

Meaning: originating from living material
Example: The bakery features Italian baked goods made from purely organic; sustainable ingredients.

Example: The fish is an organism that must remain in water in order to live.

Word: Organization

Meaning: to arrange in a structured order
Example: The maid’s job is to organize all of the clothes in the drawers neatly.

Word: Organize
Meaning: to arrange for
Example: The president of the PTA will organize a fundraiser and are in need of volunteers for this next event. 

Word: Orgastic
Meaning: having a great pleasure of emotion
Example: With orgastic shock; I realized that I had just won the lottery and started to jump up and down for joy.

Word: Orgulous
Meaning: proud and arrogant
Example: At the company party; the snobbish analyst and her orgulous husband constantly bragged about their wealth.

Word: Orient 
Meaning: to push in the direction of a goal
Example: During the staff meeting supervisors will orient team members to their monthly objectives.

Meaning: the process of becoming familiar or acquainted with people or things

Word: Orifice
Meaning: an opening or cavity through which things move
Example: Your mouth is an orifice through which food and beverages travel into your body.

Word: Origin
Meaning: the place or situation from which a person or thing came forth
Example: My last name is Scottish in origin because both of my parents are of Scottish descent.

Word: Original
Meaning: the first or earliest example of something
Example: The original Van Gogh fainting sold for several million dollars while a copy costs on a few bucks.

Word: Orphanage

Meaning: common; familiar
Example: The minister called me an upstart when I dared to question his orthodox views.

Word: Orthography
Meaning: the aspect of language that is associated with spelling

Word: Orthopedic

Meaning: to swing back and forth

Word: Osculate
Meaning: to caress with one's lips or kiss

Word: Osmosis
Meaning: the capability to comprehend things without exertion

Word: Ossify
Meaning: to become firm in a certain way
Example: My father’s opinion has started to ossify so I know he won’t change his mind.

Word: Ostensible
Meaning: appearing as such but not necessarily so
Example: Your ostensible prank has done a lot of damage; and now you must face the consequences of your actions.

Word: Ostensibly
Meaning: to all outward appearances

Word: Ostentatious

Word: Osteoporosis
Meaning: bone disease

Word: Ostracize

Word: Otherwise

Example: The otherwise well-behaved child threw a massive temper tantrum in the store.

Word: Otherwise
Meaning: apart from that; in other ways
Example: Hannah and her twin had different colored eyes but were otherwise identical.

Word: Otherwise
Meaning: differently; in another way
Example: “Please put the cake away otherwise I may eat it all.”

Word: Ouch

Word: Outright

Word: Outset

Word: Outshine

Word: Overcast

Word: Overcome

Word: Overcompensate

Word: Overdue

Word: Overemphasize

Word: Overjoyed

Word: Overlay
Meaning: to cover the surface of something with something else

Word: Overlook
Meaning: to supervise and direct

Word: Overpower

Word: Overprotective

Example: The overprotective mother rarely lets her teenage son out of her sight.

Word: Override
Meaning: To use one’s authority to cancel or overrule the action or decision of another

Word: Oversaturated

Word: Overstatement

Word: Overweening

Word: Owe

Word: Ownership

Word: Oxen
Meaning: typically male bovine trained as draft animals and beasts of burden

Word: Oxidation
Meaning: the result of a substance coming into contact with oxygen; generating a deficit of electrons
Example: During oxidation; the oxygen caused the paint to peel off the metal rod.

Word: Oxidize
Meaning: to merge with oxygen such as in the process of rusting or burning
Example: If you leave your bike in the rain; it will oxidize and begin to rust.

Word: Oxygen
Meaning: is a nonflammable gas with no smell or color
Example: Mountain climbers often carry oxygen bottles on high altitude climbs to prevent hypoxia; a rapid condition which weakens your body.

Word: Oxymoron
Meaning: an expression that contains words with opposite meanings
Example: Normally; an oxymoron consists of a noun and an adjective which clashes in opposition with that noun.

Word: Oy Vey
Meaning: a Yiddish phrase expressing dismay or exasperation

Word: Ozone
Meaning: the type of oxygen located in a high tier of the Earth’s atmosphere

Word: Pace
Meaning: speed or rate at which one is moving

Word: Pachyderm

Word: Pacific
Meaning: calm; peaceful

Word: Pad

Word: Paean

Word: Pagan
Meaning: an individual who doesn’t follow one of the world’s main religions

Word: Pageant
Meaning: a demonstration of contestants or incidents usually involving a common theme
Example: As the women donned their native country’s costume; they walked across the stage in the Miss Universe Pageant.

Word: Paging
Meaning: calling a person over a loudspeaker; usually in a public place
Example: The store manager began paging for the customer to come to the front several minutes ago.

Word: Paging
Meaning: calling out the name of a person over a loudspeaker
Example: While someone was paging for the lost boy to come to the front of the store; his parents were having a meltdown.

Word: Pagoda
Meaning: a pyramid-shaped religious building with curled up edges on each level that is usually found in Asia
Example: During my visit to Japan; I noticed the pagoda towering over the tourists on the ground.

Word: Pail
Meaning: a round container with a handle used for carrying things
Example: When the barn caught on fire; the only thing pioneers could use to put the fire out was a pail of water.

Word: Pain
Meaning: anguish and discomfort
Example: When the child accidentally placed her hand on the hot stove; the pain could be heard in her screams and cries.

Word: Painful
Meaning: experiencing or providing agony or discomfort
Example: The painful bee sting resulted in my arm reddening and swelling to twice its original size.

Word: Painless
Meaning: without pain or trouble
Example: Thanks to the anesthesia; the surgery was painless for Shirley.

Word: Painstaking
Meaning: performed with a great deal of attention
Example: Even though the rebuilding of the old farmhouse was going to be a painstaking job; I could not wait to begin work on my new home.

Word: Paint
Meaning: 
Example: The artist used different colored paint to make a colorful landscape of the sunset.

Word: Pair
Meaning: a couple of things that work jointly
Example: After putting on my clothes; I grabbed my pair of shoes and placed them on my feet before heading out the door.

Word: Palace
Meaning: an estate with a large exquisite house or structure
Example: Since the Tort Palace had a long history during the 1800s; it became a historical landmark that was visited by many tourists.

Word: Paladin
Meaning: a very brave knight that fought using a horse and a sword
Example: While fighting bravely for his country; Charlemagne’s paladin refused to bow down to any other knight.

Word: Palatable
Meaning: satisfactory; suitable
Example: Although the food is not the tastiest I have ever eaten; it is palatable and will fill my tummy.

Word: Palate
Meaning: person’s sense of taste or appetite
Example: Because she has a picky palate; the toddler refuses to eat anything other than chicken nuggets.

Word: Palatial
Meaning: on a large scale with elaborate furnishings
Example: The palatial diamond ring was so heavy it made Gina’s finger hurt.

Word: Palaver
Meaning: unnecessary talk that wastes time
Example: Although we were supposed to have a lecture; the teacher spent the entire period with palaver about his vacation.

Word: Pale
Meaning: light in color
Example: When I looked at my friend with the pale face and wide eyes; I realized she had also heard someone break into our house.

Word: Paleolithic
Meaning: a period of time during the Stone Age where many stone and bone artifacts have been discovered
Example: As the historian walked into the old cave; he took notice of the Paleolithic cave paintings depicting people and stones.

Word: Paleontology
Meaning: the area of science which focuses on the past through the review of plant and animal fossils
Example: Students with an interest in fossils should consider paleontology as a college major.

Word: Palette
Meaning: an artist’s flat paint panel which is used for mixing and holding paint
Example: Bob Ross usually used a dull knife to scrape the paint from his palette and smear it onto his canvas.

Word: Palimpsest
Meaning: a thing which displays evidence of the alteration it has experienced
Example: While the tradition has changed over time; it is still a palimpsest of our family’s history.

Word: Palindrome
Meaning: a term or group of words that contain the same letters no matter which way the word is read
Example: Since I knew my word during the Spelling Bee was a palindrome; I could easily spell it since I knew how to spell the first five letters of the word.

Word: Palisade
Meaning: posts usually made out of wood that form a fenced-in area
Example: As news of the Union troops marching closer to their town; the citizens built a palisade around their houses in order to defend themselves if troops attacked.

Word:  Pall 
Meaning: a thing or person that makes something depressing or dismal
Example: The car accident that killed five students cast a pall over the graduation ceremony.

Word: Palladium
Meaning: a platinum type metal that is a light silvery color and is flexible enough to be shaped
Example: Due to its mobility; the electrical engineer used palladium to form it into the necessary shape so that it could be used as part in the electronic device.

Word: Pallet
Meaning: a movable stand used for packing and transporting goods
Example: When the 18-wheeler truck stopped by the company’s loading dock; each shipping pallet was loaded onto the truck.

Word: Palliate
Meaning: to get rid of or alleviate
Example: After surgery; Greg received large does of medications to palliate his suffering.

Word: Palliative
Meaning: soothing remedy to relieve pain such as medicine
Example: My rash needs some palliative lotion if it is going to stop hurting and heal.

Word: Pallid
Meaning: pale skin or lacking in vitality or interest
Example: Although she is a redhead with very fair skin; Maureen has tried all sorts of ways to give her pallid complexion just a touch of color.

Word: Pallor
Meaning: an unhealthy pale appearance
Example: After working on the project for four months; Carl was anxious to take a cruise in the sun and work on getting rid of his office pallor.

Word: Palm 
Meaning: the inner part of the hand between the wrist and fingers
Example: David’s palm was dry and cracked from working in the garden with his bare hands.

Word: Palpable
Meaning: capable of being touched; felt; handled; or perceived
Example:  When she is angry at dinner; my mother kills the flavor of the meal with her palpable silence.

Word: Palpitate
Meaning: to thump or throb intensely
Example: When the music at the concert started to palpitate; it caused my head to hurt.

Word: Paltry
Meaning: small or meager
Example: My teenage son often complains about what he considers to be a paltry allowance.

Example: Unfortunately there is no panacea that will make cancer instantly vanish from your body.

Word: Pancreas

Word: Pandemic
Meaning: an illness or disease happening over a broad area
Example: I have no interest in watching a television show about a pathological pandemic that turns half the world’s population into zombies.

Word: Pandemonium
Meaning: chaos and utter craziness
Example: Even though the teacher had instructed the children to be on their best behavior; pandemonium broke loose the minute Santa Claus walked through the door.

Word: Pander 
Meaning: to spoil a person by giving him his desires; usually something immoral or illegal
Example: The woman on the corner did not realize she was attempting to pander her sexual services to an undercover cop.

Word: Pandiculation
Meaning: yawning and stretching

Word: Pane

Word: Panegyric

Word: Panel

Example: After piecing the panel together with the large headboard; the designer painted it and set it behind the bed.

Word: Pang
Meaning: an abrupt yet intense spasm of distress or pain
Example: When the bullet entered Rick’s stomach; it sent a pang of agony through his body.

Word: Pangaea
Meaning: the name of the ancient super-continent that incorporated all of the earth
Example: Pangaea existed when all of the Earth’s continents were one big continent.

Word: Panic
Meaning: a quick worry or dread that someone can’t stop
Example: Everyone could hear the panic in the child’s voice and see the strained look in his face as the boy searched for his mother.

Word: Panicky
Meaning: having the qualities of a quick worry or dread that someone can’t stop
Example: After unearthing a true scandalous story of her opponent; the panicky candidate began mumbling and fumbling around on stage.

Word: Panoply
Meaning: an impressive collection or exhibition
Example: The designer’s exciting panoply of dresses won over the fashion critics.

Word: Panoptic
Meaning: showing or seeing the whole at one view
Example: The panoptic view from the hot air balloon allowed us to see all of the city.

Word: Panorama
Meaning: a picture of a long scene or place
Example: Hot air balloon tours allow risk-takers to see a panorama of the city below while being thousands of feet up in the air.

Word: Panoramic
Meaning: having the qualities of a long scene or place in a picture
Example: As my friend showed me his panoramic photo of the mountain; I could point out the entire mountain system and all of the valleys.

Word: Pansophy
Meaning: knowing all information
Example: Studying theology allowed the students to ascertain that God’s pansophy enabled believers to put their faith in him.

Word: Pantheism
Meaning: belief that God is the universe and the universe is God

Word: Pantheon

Word: Pantomime

Word: Paper
Meaning: a thin flimsy item that is made from wood and mainly used for people to write on

Meaning: a small; heavy object that is used to keep loose papers in place
Example: Because he had no paperweight to hold down his files; the wind blew the attorney’s papers all around.

Meaning: a derogatory term that refers to a Roman Catholic who accepts the Pope as an authority of God

Meaning: a material similar to paper made from the papyrus plant

Example: The play is a parable that teaches the students a lesson about the importance of being kind.

Word: Parabola
Meaning: the kind of curve or arc that is created when an item is tossed upwards and lands in a different location

Word: Paradisiacal

Word: Paradox
Meaning: a person; thing; or situation that is strange because they have features or qualities that do not normally exist together
Example: In a strange paradox; the medicine made Heather sick before it made her better.

Word: Paradoxically
Meaning: in a manner that is contradictory
Example: Paradoxically; the economy is improving although many families complain about the poverty in which they live.

Word: Paragon
Meaning: a model of excellence or perfection
Example: As a paragon of purity; a nun would never dress inappropriately.

Word: Paragraph
Meaning: sentences written one after the other about one topic
Example: The English teacher assigned her 2nd grade students to write a paragraph about their summer vacation.

Word: Parallax
Meaning: the impression that the direction or location of an object appears to vary when observed from diverse viewpoints
Example: Because of the concept of parallax; locations look different when viewed at unique angles.

Word: Parallel
Meaning: stretching on in the same way or path
Example: Ms. Peterson realized that she was one street off from the doctor’s office; so she knew she could cut through to the next parallel street in order to reach her destination.

Word: Parallelogram
Meaning: a flat shape with two pairs of parallel sides
Example: The 10 by 20 rectangular cotton field formed a parallelogram.

Word: Paralysis
Meaning: the lack of mobility in a limb or part of the body
Example: Money from a grant issued wheelchairs to victims of the disaster who suffered from paralysis.

Word: Paralyze
Meaning: to cause a person or part of the body to lose the ability to feel and move
Example: A broken vertebra in her neck threatened to sever her spinal cord and paralyze her from moving.

Word: Paramedic
Meaning: a person trained to respond to medical emergencies

Example: If you meet the low-income parameter; you are eligible for financial aid.

Word: Paramount
Meaning: of the greatest concern

Word: Paramour

Word: Paranoia
Meaning: an illogical belief that others are against you

Word: Paranormal

Word: Parapet

Word: Paraplegic
Meaning: someone who is unable to move their legs and lower body

Word: Parasite
Meaning: a living organism which exists by taking from another living creature; usually while living inside or on the host
Example: The flea is a parasite that survives by extracting nourishment from other organisms.

Word: Parasitical
Meaning: of; pertaining to; or having the characteristics of a parasite; leechlike or freeloading
Example: Ticks feed off of human blood; making them parasitical and dangerous.

Word: Parasitism
Meaning: an unhealthy relationship in which a parasite lives off another organism; usually causing damage in the process
Example: Parasitism is a one-sided biological relationship in which an organism weakens a host while obtaining resources from it.

Word: Parasol
Meaning: a lightweight umbrella used to block the sun

Word: Park

Word: Parlance

Word: Parlay

Word: Parricide

Word: Participatory

Word: Participle
Meaning: a word formed from a verb that functions as an adjective

Word: Particle
Meaning: a small git or speck

Word: Particular
Meaning: certain or distinct
Example: The children paid particular attention when the teacher began explaining what would be on the next big exam.

Word: Particularly

Example: The veterinarian likes all animals; but she is particularly fond of rabbits.

Word: Particulate
Meaning: a very small piece or particle

Word: Partisan

Word: Partition

Word: Partner
Meaning: a couple or duo who worked together during an endeavor

Word: Parturient

Word: Party

Word: Parvenu
Meaning: an individual who moves from a lower economic and social class to a higher one while remaining an outsider

Word: Pasquinade
Meaning: a composition (cartoon; flyer or skit) that imitates; mocks or misrepresents somebody's style; typically in a humorous way
Example: The politician was unamused at the latest pasquinade published in the newspaper.

Word: Pass Away
Meaning: to die; generally of natural causes
Example: My son asked why his grandfather had to pass away; but all I could tell him was that it had been the ninety year old man’s time to go.

Word: Pass
Meaning: to go or move forward or through
Example: We waited a long time at the railroad tracks for a train to pass through.

Word: Passage
Meaning: a route for something to go through
Example: Christopher Columbus believed he found a passage to India but instead he found a new land.

Word: Passenger
Meaning: a person who is riding in a vehicle
Example: Only one passenger in the train was killed; but several others were injured when the train derailed.

Word: Passerby
Meaning: a person who happens to be walking by something

Word: Passerby
Meaning: one who passes by someone or something by chance
Example: The police officer stated that a passerby noticed a damaged empty vehicle in a ditch and reported it.

Word: Passion
Meaning: an intense liking and desire for something
Example: Even though most of the man’s friends called him cheap; he just had a strong passion to save as much money as he could.

Word: Passionate
Meaning: strong feelings toward something
Example: After suffering from two bouts of cancer; the family became passionate about donating every year to their local cancer organization.

Word: Passionately
Meaning: to be done with great feeling and reaction
Example: After acquiring her great singing gig; Annette sang passionately to the large audience in the Grand Theater.

Word: Passive
Meaning: undertaking no action
Example: The passive man never placed a hand on his abusive wife.

Word: Passivity
Meaning: the state of being passive; inactive; or lazy; a lack of initiative
Example: Her passivity in making a decision led to her termination from work.

Word: Passover
Meaning: a spring celebration in the Jewish faith due to their people gaining their freedom
Example: Typically taking place in March or April; Jewish people commemorate the Passover holiday with a feast.

Word: Past
Meaning: period of time that has already happened
Example: I notified the grocery store manager about the milk I needed to purchase was past the expiration date.

Word: Paste
Meaning: a substance that is thick but moist and is usually made by mixing dry ingredients with a liquid
Example: Mixing the flour with a bit of water; the chef created a thick paste to serve as the base of her recipe.

Word: Pasteurization
Meaning: a purification process which uses heat to kill bacteria and germs
Example: Milk is required to go through a pasteurization procedure so that it is fit to drink without getting sick.

Word: Pastiche
Meaning:  a mix of unique items
Example: The mix of country; pop; and soul music made the album a fascinating pastiche of sounds.

Word: Pastime
Meaning: a hobby done during someone’s free time
Example: After Mr. Frank retired from his office job; his pastime included golfing; reading and traveling.

Word: Pastoral
Meaning: pertaining to the country or to country folk
Example: The Smiths decided it would be better to raise their family in a pastoral area outside of the city.

Word: Pasture
Meaning: a grassy meadow of land used to grow grass or for livestock
Example: Farmer Fred rarely needed to mow his pasture due to his cows always grazing the grass and keeping it short.

Word: Pat
Meaning: to touch or tap something softly
Example: “Pat yourself on the back for a job well done on the difficult test;” the teacher said to her class.

Word: Patch
Meaning: to conceal and protect a little piece of cloth or other material over a gap
Example: Mothers usually have to patch their little boys’ pants because they frequently play so rough outside with their friends.

Word: Pate
Meaning: the uppermost part of a human being’s head
Example: After falling from the third floor; the victim lay dead on the sidewalk since he landed on his pate damaging his brain.

Word: Patent
Meaning: an official government document that allows the creator of a product to only create and sell this product for a period of time
Example: After the consultation with a lawyer regarding my invention of a self-cleaning placemat; the lawyer explained that the patent would take years to acquire for my product.

Word: Patented
Meaning: pertaining to a product; service or invention that has been issued a government document limiting others from reproducing it
Example: Their patented cordless vacuum cleaner made millions of dollar for the Sands family since their company made the only cordless type.

Word: Patently
Meaning: clearly so; without a doubt
Example: Although the information was patently false; the naïve woman believed the lies anyway.

Word: Paternal
Meaning: of or pertaining to one's father
Example: Abigail’s paternal grandfather was born in Johnstown; Pennsylvania.

Word: Paternalism
Meaning: a method of governance by which an authority advises individuals while not allowing them to make decisions
Example: The principal’s paternalism is necessary because it limits the actions of rebellious students.

Word: Paternity
Meaning: the condition of being a specific child’s father
Example: A paternity test will determine if Bill or his best friend is the child’s dad.

Word: Path
Meaning: a track or route
Example: Looking left; the victim ran down a path that led out of the park with the attackers close behind her.

Word: Pathetic 
Meaning: rousing compassion
Example: Jason looked like a pathetic dog as he tried to set up his tent in the drenching rain.

Word: Pathogen
Meaning: a tiny organism that brings about a disease
Example: The pathogen triggered an illness that made half the student body sick.

Word: Pathological
Meaning: in an unusual or unhealthy manner
Example: My sister is a pathological liar who never tells the truth about anything.

Word: Pathos
Meaning: a feeling of sympathy or pity
Example: The pathos of the movie caused me to leave the theater with tears in my eyes.

Word: Pathway
Meaning: a trail or passageway
Example: Nurse Johnson informed the cancer patient that the only pathway to recovery was through ten treatments of chemotherapy.

Word: Patience
Meaning: tolerating and enduring frustrating; time-consuming and problems with ease and composure
Example: Her patience was running thin as she was waiting four times longer than anybody else in the restaurant to be seated.

Word: Patient
Meaning: tolerating problems or irritation in an easygoing way
Example: When the truck seemed to be in an emergency; the patient driver of the car remained still for the truck to pass.

Word: Patiently
Meaning: in a tolerant and good natured way
Example: After spending three hours in the doctor’s waiting room; the woman still waited patiently for her appointment.

Word: Patina
Meaning: a layer of coating
Example: A shiny patina covers the statue; amplifying its historical value.

Word: Patio
Meaning: a paved outside space that is usually attached to the house
Example: During the garden party; the club members met on the patio to sip their lemonade and discuss the items on the meeting’s agenda.

Word: Patois
Meaning: the accent and way that the people of a certain area speak that is different than the rest of the place
Example: As the patois of the woman’s words were heard; many people couldn’t quite understand what she was saying.

Word: Patriarch
Meaning: the male who sits at the head of the tribe or family
Example: In my house; my father is the patriarch of the family.

Word: Patriarchal
Meaning: related to a system that is run or ruled by men
Example: Many ancient societies were patriarchal in nature; having predominantly male leaders in both the military and politics.

Word: Patriarchy
Meaning: a system of authority in which males are the power holders
Example: For over a hundred years the country has been ruled through the patriarchy of kings.

Word: Patrician
Meaning: relating to an individual born into a lofty position or an aristocratic family
Example: Marcus was born into a patrician family of great wealth.

Word: Patricide
Meaning: the action taken when an individual ends the life of his or her father
Example: Peter was arrested for patricide after killing his father.

Word: Patrilineal
Meaning: pertaining to the father’s lineage
Example: Since Patty was born to a single mother; she was unaware of her patrilineal health problems.

Word: Patrimony
Meaning: property or goods passed from one’s father or predecessors
Example: The antique is part of the patrimony I inherited from my daddy.

Word: Patriot
Meaning: a person who shows allegiance to his or her country by supporting and defending it
Example: When Great Britain raised the taxes; the patriot decided to fight the British and push for becoming our own nation.

Word: Patriotic
Meaning: pertaining to one’s allegiance and dependability to one’s country
Example: Every patriotic song in the tribute to the fallen soldiers was sung by a choir of professional singers.

Word: Patriotism
Meaning: allegiance and dependability to a country
Example: After 9/11 many U.S. citizens showed patriotism and supported the country by donating time and assistance to each other.

Word: Patrol
Meaning: a duty to guard or observe an area for security reasons

Word: Patron
Meaning: an individual who frequents a specific bar; eatery; or other company
Example: I have a regular patron who eats meatloaf at the same time every day.

Word: Patronage 
Meaning: support or sponsorship
Example: Your patronage of the arts program will allow our students to put on four plays this year.

Word: Patronize
Meaning: to give money or support to someone or something
Example: I patronize my favorite restaurant at least twice a week.

Word: Patronymic
Meaning: pertaining to the father’s or male relative’s name
Example: After many arguments; the expecting couple finally decided to use a patronymic name which made her husband happy.

Word: Pattern
Meaning: a decorative design or motif
Example: The seamstress sewed an interesting pattern on the back of the model’s dress.

Word: Paucity
Meaning: a small amount of something that is not enough
Example: Because of the paucity of our oil supply; we need to seek out other fuel resources.

Word: Pauper 
Meaning: a person who lives in poverty
Example: The pauper had no money and slept under a bridge.

Word: Pave

Word: Payroll

Word: Paystub

Word: Perigee

Word: Peripatetic

Word: Peripheral

Word: Periphery 
Meaning: the area that borders a thing or place
Example: If the tennis ball touches or goes pass the periphery of the white line; a point will be given to the recipient of the serve.

Word: Periscope
Meaning: a viewing instrument; in the shape of a tube comprised of mirrors and lenses; that allows a viewer to obtain a clear field of sight
Example: Although the soldier was positioned in a ditch; he was able to use a periscope to observe the enemy camp above ground.

Word: Perish
Meaning:  pass away; rot or decay
Example: Without enough lifejackets; someone might perish at sea.

Word: Peristalsis
Meaning: rhythmic; wave-like contraction of the digestive tract that forces food through it

Word: Perjury
Meaning: giving false testimony after swearing to state the truth

Word: Perk

Word: Perky
Meaning: lively or enthusiastic

Word: Permafrost
Meaning: a soil layer; typically found in extremely cold regions; that remains frozen for a very long time
Example: The cold temperature in the Arctic region keeps the permafrost frozen.

Word: Permanence
Meaning: the state of being fixed or stable
Example: The couple enjoy spending time together but know the relationship isn’t one of permanence.

Word: Permanent
Meaning: something that will last indefinitely; cannot be changed; or erased

Word: Permeable
Meaning: that absorbs or allows the passage of fluids or gases
Example: The permeable material allowed a large amount of water to seep through.

Word: Permeate
Meaning: to pass or spread through
Example: When the skunk’s spray began to permeate the car; my sister and I jumped out the vehicle and ran down the road.

Word: Permissible
Meaning: permitted
Example: Jack hired a lawyer to fight his speeding ticket because he claims that he was driving at a permissible speed.

Word: Permissive
Meaning: giving permission; or predisposed to give it; lenient
Example: Timmy's mother was too permissive; allowing him to do what he wanted when he wanted.

Word: Permit
Meaning: to give authorization to do something
Example: My mother; in all of her graciousness; has decided to permit me to go to the party with my friends; even though my dad does not think I should.

Word: Permutation
Meaning: one of the forms or conditions in which something occurs or can be positioned
Example: In time; the bacteria will undergo a permutation that will make it unaffected by antibiotics.

Word: Pernicious
Meaning: highly injurious or destructive
Example: The pernicious cycle of abuse within their family must be stopped.

Word: Peroration
Meaning: the conclusion of a speech designed to drive the message home
Example: The President’s peroration was extremely passionate and heartfelt; reinforcing the message that we all had to stick together as a nation.

Word: Perpendicular
Meaning: precisely upright or vertical at a ninety-degree angle
Example: The cross is made of two wooden boards with one of them placed in a perpendicular position over the other one.

Word: Perpetrate 
Meaning: to execute or carry out
Example: I can’t believe my best friend would perpetrate such an act of betrayal.

Word: Perpetrator 
Meaning: one who performs a crime or offence
Example: The perpetrator hid behind the trash can and hoped the police would not find him.

Word: Perpetual
Meaning: continuing forever; constant; never-ending
Example: The country is in a perpetual war; with no end in sight.

Word: Perpetuate
Meaning: to cause to continue
Example: If you yell at Jane after she yells at you; your actions will only perpetuate the argument.

Word: Perpetuity
Meaning: forevermore or permanently
Example: The greedy investor wanted to receive a royalty off the product in perpetuity.

Word: Perplex
Meaning: to puzzle or confuse
Example: According to the book reviewer; the author’s puzzling writing style will perplex many readers.

Word: Perplexity
Meaning: a confused mental state
Example: He was confused by her words so he stared at her in perplexity.

Word: Perquisite
Meaning: a privilege; gain; or a special benefit; perk
Example: Ronald considers his pension to be the most desirable perquisite of his profession.

Word: Persecute
Meaning: to afflict constantly so as to injure or distress
Example: The town tried to persecute a homeowner after they found out he was gay.

Word: Persecution 
Meaning: a campaign designed to harm someone because of a cultural; sexual; religious; or racial difference
Example: The national hate crime laws were initially enacted to prevent the persecution of minorities.

Word: Perseverance
Meaning: resolve that allows one to continue with a duty or task regardless of difficulty or previous attempts
Example: The disabled young man’s perseverance allowed him to complete the marathon.

Example: Since you used persiflage; I knew you were joking about my appearance.

Meaning: a tiny amount of something

Example: After I was given the manuscript for my first title role in the play; I began to pore over the script for hours.

Word: Pork barrel
Meaning: the use of government funds to appease voters and win votes
Example: Pork and barrel politics make it seem impossible to win an election without buying votes.

Word: Porous
Meaning: easy to move through because of the presence of small gaps
Example: Because the castle had porous security; the assassin found it quite simple to sneak inside and murder the king.

Word: Porridge
Meaning: a meal; typically cereal; that is boiled in water or milk
Example: Goldilocks ate all of the bear’s porridge; but she probably wished she hadn’t since it was just cereal and hot water.

Word: Porringer
Meaning: a small bowl; typically with a handle; used for soup; stew; or similar dishes
Example: This evening; we will have a porringer of tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwiches.

Word: Port
Meaning: a harbor where boats dock
Example: That is a popular port where merchandise can enter or leave.

Word: Portable
Meaning: able to be carried or easily moved
Example: We always pack a portable disposable grill before heading out on a trip because it’s the easiest way to cook on the road.

Word: Portage
Meaning: an act of carrying
Example: The portage across the canal required a hefty fee.

Word: Portcullis
Meaning: a sturdy sliding gateway door that moves vertically to open and close
Example: The pointy portcullis opened from the top to permit the passage of sightseeing tourists.

Word: Portend
Meaning: to indicate or give sign of a future occurrence
Example: By hovering nearby; the dark clouds portend a storm in our area.

Word: Portent
Meaning: a signal something is about to occur
Example: The thunder was a portent of an approaching storm.

Word: Portentous
Meaning: foreboding; ominous; or threatening
Example: Because Jack generally expects the worst; his language is normally portentous and filled with warnings.

Word: Porter
Meaning: a person employed to carry luggage
Example: A bellhop is considered a porter; because they carry luggage.

Word: Portfolio
Meaning: a collection of work
Example: The photographer has an impressive portfolio that holds an assortment of images he has taken in his career.

Word: Portion
Meaning: a part of a whole
Example: Since Teresa is trying to eat healthy; she will sample a very small portion of my home made brownies.

Word: Portly
Meaning: somewhat overweight
Example: Because the portly woman was unhappy with her weight; she joined a weight loss program.

Word: Portmanteau
Meaning: a large trunk or suitcase; typically made of stiff leather and opening into two equal parts
Example: She carried her possessions with her in an old portmanteau.

Word: Portrait
Meaning: a portrait is a painting; drawing; or photograph of a person
Example: When he had his portrait drawn; he couldn’t move for a few hours while the artist drew an image of him.

Word: Portray
Meaning: to depict an individual; situation; or specific event
Example: The media is going to portray the killer as a victim of society’s avoidance of mental health issues.

Word: Pose
Meaning: to present a question or raise a topic for discussion
Example: I would like to pose a question about testing nuclear weapons and the sanctions associated with it.

Word: Poseur

Word: Posh
Meaning: sophisticated and luxurious
Example: Her posh bag was expensive; but the style and fabric made the sophisticated purse worth it.

Word: Posit
Meaning: to offer as a suggestion
Example: Since no other venue is available; I will posit my condominium as a place for the company holiday party.

Word: Position
Meaning: the way in which someone or something is placed or arranged
Example: At Little League today; my son Jason was chosen to play the third base position.

Word: Positive
Meaning: absolutely certain of something
Example: Jeff was positive he scored an A on his test because he studied the material for eight hours.

Word: Posse
Meaning: a group of people who have a common characteristic or purpose
Example: My friend has a posse that he likes to hang out with because they are all so similar.

Word: Possess
Meaning: to have or own something
Example: Most families in America possess at least one car; but many have two.

Word: Possessive
Meaning: showing domination; control or influence over someone or something
Example: After being on a few dates with Bruce; Amy felt he was becoming jealous and possessive of her.

Word: Possibility
Meaning: something that has the potential to occur or is likely to happen
Example: There is a possibility that school will be cancelled if it snows hard enough.

Word: Possible
Meaning: able to be done or achieved
Example: It is possible for you to do a backflip if you practice long enough.

Word: Possibly
Meaning: indicative of doubt or uncertainty regarding a situation
Example: We could possibly be the only sentient race in the universe; but there’s no way to know for sure.

Word: Post-haste
Meaning: with a great deal of speed
Example: We must leave post-haste if we don’t want to miss the beginning of the film.

Word: Postbellum
Meaning: occurring or existing after a war
Example: While the term ‘postbellum’ can refer to a period of time after any war; it is usually used to refer to the events that occurred after the American Civil War.

Word: Postdate
Meaning: to assign a date to something later than was originally intended
Example: We had to postdate the party because a thunderstorm stopped the guests from coming on the original day.

Word: Posterior
Meaning: close to or at the rear of something
Example: In anatomy class; students learned the term “posterior” refers to the back of a body.

Word: Posterity
Meaning: all future generations
Example: We bury time capsules for ourselves and for posterity.

Word: Postgraduate
Meaning: referring to study undertaken after completing a first degree
Example: Any degree you study for after completing your first degree can be considered postgraduate; and it always looks good on your resume.

Word: Posthumous
Meaning: taking place after one's death
Example: The author received several impressive awards for her body of work; unfortunately; they were all posthumous.

Word: Postmark
Meaning: an official stamp that gives the time; place; and date of a package’s posting
Example: A postmark on a package will tell you where it was shipped from.

Word: Postmeridian
Meaning: of or pertaining to the afternoon
Example: Taking a postmeridian nap caused the boy to be awake all night long.

Word: Postmortem
Meaning: associated with happening after death
Example: The autopsy is performed on the victim postmortem.

Word: Postmortem
Meaning: something that happens after death
Example: When my great aunt passed away there was a postmortem examination to determine the actual cause of her death and to rule out foul play.

Word: Postnatal
Meaning: related to the period of time following childbirth
Example: A baby needs a lot of postnatal care to ensure that it is healthy before it can leave the hospital.

Word: Postoperative
Meaning: related to the period of time following a medical operation or procedure

Word: Postpartum
Meaning: after childbirth
Example: Most women experience postpartum joy when they get to hold their baby for the first time.

Word: Postpone
Meaning: decide to have something occur at a later date than originally intended
Example: I decided to postpone writing my essay until tomorrow because I was too tired to do it today.

Word: Postpone
Meaning: to reschedule for a later time
Example: Unfortunately Jamie had to postpone his wedding because of a severe illness.

Word: Postponement
Meaning: the action of delaying or putting off something until later
Example: The heavy snow last night resulted in a postponement for school.

Word: Postscript
Meaning: an extra remark or at the end of a letter or email signified by the initials P.S.
Example: Many people use a postscript in a letter when they forgot to write something in the body of the letter.

Word: Postulate
Meaning: to suggest something (such as an idea or theory) especially in order to start a discussion
Example: In an attempt to create controversy; some experts postulate alternatives to historical beliefs that have been accepted for years.

Word: Posture
Meaning: the position that someone holds their body in; generally while standing or sitting
Example: Mary’s bad posture when sitting at her school desk makes her back hurt later during the day.

Word: Postwar

Word: Potable

Example: There was a lack of potable water because of the drought.

Word: Potation
Meaning: the act of drinking a beverage; usually alcohol
Example: As a recovering alcoholic; Jim decided to refrain from potation.

Word: Potency
Meaning: strength; effectiveness; or power
Example: Because of its high potency; the herb can make people act in strange ways.

Word: Potent
Meaning: very strong in a chemical or medicinal way
Example: The potent poison killed him within seconds.

Word: Potentate
Meaning: someone with unlimited power; usually a leader of a country or territory
Example: Our president cannot become a potentate because he has to share his power with two other branches of government.

Word: Potential
Meaning: likely to happen or become
Example: Because the building has a gas leak that poses a potential risk to residents; it is being evacuated.

Word: Potentially
Meaning: with a possibility to occur or become reality in the future
Example: Because he did not study for the final test; Mark could potentially fail the class.

Word: Potentiate
Meaning: to increase the power or effect of something; especially medicine
Example: The two medicines prescribed by the doctor tend to potentiate each other and are stronger together than if taken separately.

Word: Potently
Meaning: having great influence or effect over or on something
Example: The poison of a Taipan snake is so potently lethal that it could kill twelve people.

Word: Pother
Meaning: a disturbance or commotion
Example: The police are often called to investigate a pother in rural neighborhoods.

Word: Potholes
Meaning: deep holes in a roads surface that are formed by weather or traffic

Word: Potion

Word: Potluck

Word: Potpourri

Word: Pouch
Meaning: a typically flexible small bag used for storage of equally small objects
Example: Ricky likes to keep his marbles in a small pouch so he doesn’t lose them.

Word: Poultice

Word: Pout

Word: Pout

Word: Poverty

Example: The practical solution is the easiest one that will fix the problem.

Word: Prattle

Word: Praxis
Meaning: traditional conduct or practices
Example: The praxis of our religious community sets the marriage age for young women.

Word: Preamble

Word: Prearrange

Word: Precarious
Meaning: unstable; dangerous or difficult
Example: Running around with a knife is very precarious.

Word: Precaution

Word: Precede
Meaning: to occur before something else
Example: Sometimes a tingling sensation in the arm will precede a heart attack.

Word: Precedent
Meaning: an earlier event or action that is regarded as an example
Example: The judges had no precedent to review before making their decision on the controversial case.

Word: Precept
Meaning: a rule that sets the pattern for one’s behavior
Example: The school’s honesty precept dictates we only turn in our own work.

Word: Precinct
Meaning: an area of town reserved for police or voting purposes

Word: Precious

Word: Precipitate

Word: Precipitation

Word: Precipitous

Word: Precise
Meaning: exact and correct
Example: The student tried to come up with the precise answer to the problem but was a few answers off.

Word: Precisely

Word: Precision

Word: Preclude
Meaning: to prevent it from happening
Example: Using home remedies should never preclude one from seeking help from medical personnel.

Word: Precocious

Word: Precognition

Word: Preconceived

Word: Precursor

Word: Predate
Meaning: to designate a date earlier than the actual one
Example: In a statement released today; Brown says; “While these issues of officers drinking while on duty predates my arrival of Sheriff in 2015; it has become my responsibility to handle this situation swiftly.”

Word: Predawn
Meaning: happening before the sun comes up (dawn)

Word: Predecessor

Word: Predestination

Word: Predicament

Word: Predicated
Meaning: founded upon a belief or argument
Example: My decision to move to Paris was predicated on the belief I had a job opportunity waiting for me.

Word: Predict
Meaning: to foretell what will happen next or in the future
Example: The psychic said she could predict my future and claimed I would be a great actress one day.

Word: Predictability
Meaning: the degree to which something can be guessed or forecasted
Example: Because of his predictability; Heath’s wife knew that she could find him fishing every Saturday afternoon no matter what.

Word: Prediction
Meaning: a forecast of what will most likely take place in the future
Example: A prediction could be made regarding the outcome of a random car accident on the dangerous road based on the number of deaths that occur on that road every year.

Word: Predilection
Meaning: a preference for something; a strong liking
Example: Gregory goes out to watch birds daily so I assume he has a predilection for the hobby.

Word: Predisposed
Meaning: to be inclined to act in a certain way or have a certain condition
Example: Because of my passion for athletics; I am predisposed to playing a variety of sports.

Word: Predisposition
Meaning: the circumstance of being vulnerable to a particular thing
Example: Because my mother suffered from depression; I have a genetic predisposition to the condition.

Word: Predominance
Meaning: the state of being greater in frequency; number; strength; or authority than something or someone else
Example: You will find a predominance of dog lovers at the park; but there are few cat lovers visit them as well.

Word: Predominant
Meaning: being the main thing or issue
Example: Flying continues to be the predominant means of travel despite increased airfares.

Word: Predominate 
Meaning: to be the main component of something
Example: Asian Americans tend to predominate the nail services industry in the United States.

Word: Preeminent
Meaning: better than others
Example: Dr. Michaels is always winning awards because he is the preeminent medical researcher in the country.

Word: Preempt
Meaning: to take steps to prevent something from happening
Example: The company decided to meet with its former employee as a way to preempt a lawsuit.

Word: Preemptive
Meaning: a step taken to prevent an undesirable action
Example: Spraying around the property for termites is a preemptive move a wise homeowner should make.

Word: Preen
Meaning: to groom or spruce up
Example: His pet bird would preen its feathers to keep it clean.

Word: Preface

Word: Prefect

Word: Preferable
Meaning: more suitable than other options
Example: Since nurses are constantly on their feet; they find flat shoes preferable to heels.

Word: Preference
Meaning: to like something much more than anything similar
Example: Getting her eyebrows threaded instead of waxed was a personal preference.

Word: Preferential
Meaning: receiving better treatment
Example: Many argue that celebrities receive preferential treatment in jail because they have spacious cells and better food than other prisoners.

Word: Preferred
Meaning: liked or favored over other choices
Example: The officer preferred working the day shift over patrolling at night.

Word: Prefix
Meaning: a partial word or number affixed to the beginning of a word or number to either complete the word or alter the meaning
Example: Often the prefix “un” is used to transform a word into its opposite meaning; like well and unwell.

Word: Pregnancy

Example: During her pregnancy; the expectant mother picked out baby names and decorated a nursery.

Word: Pregnant
Meaning: carrying a child inside your body

Word: Prehensile

Word: Prehistoric

Word: Prejudge
Meaning: to form a judgement beforehand without sufficient evidence
Example: I will not prejudge whether or not your answer is correct without first checking it up in the book.

Word: Prejudice
Meaning: hatred directed at a particular culture or group or at a specific individual
Example: Jane’s prejudice led her to dislike Mary simply because of the color of her skin.

Word: Prejudiced
Meaning: having a negative opinion about someone or a situation not based on reason or experience

Word: Prejudicial
Meaning: something that can cause a negative result; harm; or prevent success of a project or activity
Example: Poor reviews of a product on major sites are prejudicial to the overall sale of the item.

Word: Preliminary
Meaning: in preparation for the main matter
Example: Though he passed the preliminary exam; further testing proved he was not ready to begin.

Word: Prelude
Meaning: that which precedes another event
Example: Movie trailers are often used as a prelude to feature films.

Word: Premature
Meaning: early; untimely
Example: My husband thinks it is premature to call the cops; but I know for a fact that my ring was stolen.

Word: Premeditated
Meaning: planned in advance
Example: Since Mary planned her husband’s death in advance; she was charged with premeditated murder.

Word: Premier
Meaning: to be the leading or primary element of a group of something
Example: Of all the hotels in the world; this premier hotel was on the top of every hotel critic’s top ten list.

Word: Premise
Meaning: a statement that gives weight to a conclusion
Example: Since your premise cannot be confirmed; your entire theory is worthless.

Word: Premium
Meaning: an amount to be paid for an insurance policy
Example: The woman’s life insurance policy was cancelled after she forgot to pay her premium.

Word: Premonition
Meaning: an intense feeling something is about to occur; generally a negative event
Example: Before the accident; Sang mentioned he had a premonition something bad was going to happen on the road trip.

Word: Prenatal
Meaning: being or happening before birth
Example: Getting good prenatal care is the most important thing a mother can do for her unborn baby.

Word: Preoccupation
Meaning: distraction

Word: Preoccupied
Meaning: to become obsessed or completely concerned with something

Word: Preparation
Meaning: getting something ready or organized
Example: In preparation for the grand opening; the baker created several dozen special cupcakes.

Word: Preparatory
Meaning: designed to prepare for another task
Example: The preparatory school was created with the goal of getting students ready for college.

Word: Preponderance
Meaning: a larger figure or amount
Example: With such a preponderance of evidence; the jury will most likely find the defendant guilty.

Word: Preponderant
Meaning: blatantly influential and powerful
Example: The United States; Russia; and the China are preponderant military powers who have major influence over matters of diplomacy.

Word: Prepossessing
Meaning: being appealing to others
Example: The female fans went wild when the prepossessing actor walked into the theater.

Word: Preposterous
Meaning: contrary to nature; reason; or common sense
Example: His idea of selling dead bugs for big money is totally preposterous!

Word: Prerogative
Meaning: a special right; power; or privilege
Example: Since he was a senior member of the golf club; Allan had the prerogative to reject new member applications.

Word: Presage
Meaning: to give a warning something unpleasant may occur in the future
Example: If the unpopular president is reelected; his win will presage a countrywide protest.

Word: Prescience
Meaning: the capacity to know future events
Example: Because Janet was amazed by the psychic’s prescience; she visited her on a regular basis.

Word: Prescient
Meaning: having or showing knowledge of events before they take place
Example: The psychic's predictions were uncannily prescient and ended up proving true a few weeks later.

Word: Prescribe
Meaning: doctor to give someone medication or some other kind of treatment
Example: The patient couldn’t get her doctor to take her pain seriously or prescribe medication to ease it.

Word: Prescript
Meaning: a rule or regulation of conduct
Example: Because the prescript is in the Bible; followers of the faith refuse to break the law.

Word: Prescription
Meaning: an instruction written by a medical practitioner that allows a patient to be given a medicine or treatment
Example: When my daughter was sick with the flu; the doctor wrote her a prescription for special medication.

Word: Presence
Meaning: the state of being present; or of being within sight or call; or at hand
Example: Although he felt confident in his skills; his boss’s presence always left him on edge.

Word: Present-day
Meaning: of the current time period
Example: The area that was once called New Granada is present-day Columbia.

Word: Present
Meaning: here; in a particular place
Example: The student called out “present” to let his teacher know that he was in the classroom.

Word: Presentation
Meaning: a performance or demonstration usually involving factual or persuasive information
Example: Using power point; the business executive gave a presentation about workplace etiquette to his staff so that they would understand how to behave at the office.

Word: Presentiment
Meaning: the feeling something bad might occur
Example: The presentiment lingered after I saw a black cat twice in one day.

Word: Preservative
Meaning: a substance added to something else (such as food or wood) to slow down or stop it from decaying
Example: Sugar or salt is added to peanut butter as a preservative to keep it from going bad.

Word: Preserve
Meaning: to keep safe
Example: The automobile cover will preserve the car’s windows during the hailstorm.

Word: Preside
Meaning: to be in charge of something as the leader
Example: Judge Judy will preside over the case and make a final ruling on the matter.

Word: Presidency
Meaning: the position or length of time that someone serves as president of a country or organization
Example: During his presidency; the student council leader promised to lobby for better campus security and safer dormitories.

Word: Prestige
Meaning: how well something or someone is regarded
Example: The word most commonly associated with the luxury hotel chain is prestige.

Word: Prestigious
Meaning: highly regarded
Example: The prestigious doctor had a long waiting list of patients.

Word: Presumably
Meaning: by a sensible guess; probably
Example: Presumably; Heath will join his wife at the hospital for the birth of their daughter.

Word: Presume
Meaning: to suppose something to be true without proof
Example: The professor was quick to presume that the student did not do his homework since he hadn’t all year.

Word: Presumption
Meaning: a belief that something is true or false without having all of the facts
Example: Because they were fighting more often than not; the girl made a presumption that her parents were unhappily married.

Word: Presumptive
Meaning: relating to presumption; presumed without further information
Example: It is presumptive to jump to a conclusion without knowing all of the facts or aspects of the situation.

Word: Presumptuous
Meaning: making a judgment before knowing of all the facts - also means - extremely bold and forward in doing something;
Example: It was rather presumptuous of her to assume I would get her a birthday present.

Word: Presuppose
Meaning: to accept something as true without proof
Example: Before looking at evidence; the detective is usually the first to presuppose that a family member committed the crime.

Word: Presupposition 
Meaning: a background belief that is assumed beforehand
Example: The open-minded woman tried to provide new ways of thinking and prove her brother’s presupposition about other races as wrong.

Word: Pretence 
Meaning: behavior used to trick or deceive other people
Example: John’s pretence of wealth included renting a luxury sedan to convince his friends of his success.

Word: Pretend
Meaning: to speak and act as if something is happening when it’s really not
Example: The little girl likes to pretend to be a mermaid when she swims in the pool.

Word: Pretense
Meaning: a claim that is not real
Example: Under the pretense of being helpful; the sneaky insurance salesman sold the woman a policy that provided her with few benefits.

Word: Pretension
Meaning: asserting a certain quality or status
Example: To be the president of a country; Marcel is extremely down-to-earth and completely devoid of pretension.

Word: Pretentious
Meaning: acting as though more important; valuable; or special than is warranted
Example: The swindler was a pretentious man who claimed to be descended from royalty.

Word: Preternatural 
Meaning: so unusual that it does not seem natural or normal
Example: Seeing a penguin in the desert seemed very preternatural to the amazed onlookers.

Word: Preternatural
Meaning: unusual; uncommon in nature
Example: The superhero’s preternatural abilities help him perform amazing feats when people are in danger.

Word: Pretest
Meaning: a test given before instruction or evaluation
Example: Each new product must undergo a pretest to determine if it passes inspection and can be put on the shelves.

Word: Pretext
Meaning: a fake excuse or reason
Example: Under pretext of being a police officer; the gang member gained entry into the rival gang leader’s apartment.

Word: Pretty
Meaning: attractive in a dainty; graceful way 
Example: "The pretty dresses the twin girls wore on Easter Sunday had everyone talking.
