Word: Prevail
Meaning: to beat in a difficult contest or battle
Example: Even though our troops are tired and hungry; we will prevail against the enemy!

Word: Prevalent
Meaning: very common in a particular place or among a particular group
Example: You should not assume everyone is a drug user simply because drug use is prevalent.

Word: Prevaricate
Meaning: speak or act in an evasive way
Example: In order to get his bill passed; the politician went out of his way to prevaricate about the release of the environmental study.

Word: Prevention
Meaning: the action of stopping something from happening
Example: In the name of prevention; the insurance company gives wellness information to keep its customers from getting sick.

Word: Preventive
Meaning: designed to stop something unwanted from happening
Example: Studying can be considered a preventive measure; since it is an action you take to prevent yourself from failing.

Word: Preview
Meaning: a special show or performance that allows certain people to see a movie; play; product; etc.; before the public
Example: The movie preview showed the upcoming movie to a packed audience at the theater.

Word: Preview
Meaning: an advance showing of scenes to advertise an upcoming show or movie
Example: The preview of the soon to be released Black Panther movie reveals action pack scenes leaving a promising movie.

Word: Previous
Meaning: existing or coming before something/someone else
Example: Daniel’s previous business partner stole money; making it hard for him to trust anyone in the future.

Word: Prey
Meaning: something or someone that is susceptible to attack
Example: The rapist stalked his prey for days.

Word: Price
Meaning: the amount of money expected as payment for something
Example: The price of a new video game in the United States is almost always sixty dollars; though the cost will depreciate in time.

Word: Prickly
Meaning: sharp to the touch; usually pointed
Example: Porcupines are known for their prickly skin.

Word: Pride
Meaning: being filled with happiness or joy at an accomplishment
Example: She felt a deep sense of pride whenever she worked hard and got an A on her test.

Word: Prideful
Meaning: "proud; unfriendly; and showing an ""I'm better; smarter; and bigger than other people"" attitude"
Example: Turning her nose up at the homeless lady; the prideful woman would not allow herself to believe that the two had anything in common other than their gender.

Word: Priesthood
Meaning: the office or position of being a priest
Example: Before entering into the priesthood; the clergyman made a serious decision to dedicate himself to God and the church.

Word: Prig
Meaning: a deeply religious person who holds others to a high moral standard in a self-righteous and prudish way
Example: The pompous prig silently judged all of the other church members from his pew.

Word: Priggish
Meaning: a prim and pompous person who requires everything to be precise since she strongly requires it
Example: After working for a priggish boss who was never satisfied with my work; I decided to work somewhere else who was not so demanding.

Word: Prim
Meaning: formal and proper in a stiff and prudish way
Example: My prim coworker refused to dance; but the rest of my coworkers weren’t afraid to jump right in.

Word: Prima Facie
Meaning: accepted as true and correct until proven otherwise
Example: In court; the story of the plaintiff is Prima Facie; and they are innocent until they are actually proven guilty.

Word: Primacy
Meaning: the state or condition of being important or first
Example: The primacy of our mealtimes is that everyone eats together as a family.

Word: Primal
Meaning: basic; instinctive
Example: The dog’s primal instincts allow it to hunt out prey easily.

Word: Primary source
Meaning: is an artifact; a document; diary; manuscript; autobiography; a recording; or any other source of information that was created at the time under study
Example: The student struggled to find a primary source for his research paper because nearly everything from the region had been destroyed during the war.

Word: Primary
Meaning: principal and major
Example: A primary choice in the girl’s life was to get a college education so she could make a better life for herself and her children.

Word: Primate
Meaning: a member of the most developed and intelligent group of mammals (i.e.; humans; monkeys; and apes)
Example: The biology teacher explained to the students that both monkeys and humans fall into the primate category.

Word: Prime
Meaning: superior or best
Example: If a customer wants to order the prime cut of meat; he will have to pay top dollar for that dish.

Word: Primeval 
Meaning: extremely primitive or old
Example: The archaeologist found several primeval dinosaur bones in the canyon.

Word: Primitive
Meaning: something that is not refined or advanced
Example: In the primitive village; there is no source of electricity.

Word: Primly 
Meaning: done in an extremely proper manner
Example: The wealthy exchange student sat primly in her freshly starched uniform.

Word: Primogeniture 
Meaning: the state of being the firstborn child; an exclusive right of inheritance belonging to the eldest son
Example: Although they were twins; the system of primogeniture awarded the estate to the boy who was born first.

Word: Primordial
Meaning: in the beginning; in a basic way
Example: Sometimes I feel primordial when I eat food without silverware.

Word: Primp
Meaning: to spend time improving one's appearance (often in front of a mirror)
Example: Before Sarah’s date; she stood in the mirror to primp her hair.

Word: Principal
Meaning: person in the highest position in a group or organization
Example: The prima ballerina is the principal dancer in any ballet troupe.

Word: Principle
Meaning: the root of or foundation for a belief or state of being
Example: Democracy operates on the principle that everyone should be treated equally.

Word: Prior
Meaning: occurred previously
Example: On a prior episode of the television show; the main character was arrested for her husband’s murder.

Word: Prioritize
Meaning: to place in order of greatest to least important
Example: Surgeons prioritize which patients to schedule first based on the extent of their injuries.

Word: Priority
Meaning: of most importance
Example: Although I like to go out and have a good time; working and paying bills is a priority over everything else.

Word: Priority
Meaning: of utmost importance
Example: Because spending time with his wife is a priority; George rarely works on the weekends.

Word: Priority
Meaning: of most importance.
Example: Although I like to go out and have a good time; working and paying bills is a priority over everything else.

Word: Prism
Meaning: a transparent glass or plastic object that separates white light that passes through it
Example: The science teacher showed students how the glass prism reflects colors once light passes through it.

Word: Prison
Meaning: a place of confinement for convicted criminals
Example: A man was sentenced to prison for a long time after being convicted of trying to kill his wife with an ax.

Word: Pristine 
Meaning: still pure; unchanged
Example: Because there were few tourists on the island; the beaches were still pristine and beautiful.

Word: Privacy
Meaning: one’s right to control access to his or her personal information
Example: Valuing his privacy; Quan didn’t share anything about his personal life while at work.

Word: Private
Meaning: belonging to or being used by a select group and not the public
Example: Because it is top-secret; the private information inside the folder cannot be shared with anyone.

Word: Privation
Meaning: the state of being very poor; and lacking the basic necessities of life
Example: Written records of early explorers indicate that the native people faced a great deal of hard times and privation where they had to eat insects and other unspeakable items just to stay alive.

Word: Privilege 
Meaning: an advantage or benefit given to certain individuals
Example: As a senior account executive; I now have the privilege of access to the executive lounge.

Word: Privy
Meaning: allowed to share in confidential information
Example: The psychologist is privy to his patient’s thoughts and emotions.

Word: Prize
Meaning: a thing given as a reward to the winner of a competition or race or in recognition of another outstanding achievement
Example: The 500-pound pig won first prize at the county fair.

Word: Pro bono
Meaning: a free service to the public by a lawyer
Example: When the attorney wanted to give back to his community; he started doing pro bono work for the poor clients who found themselves in trouble with the law.

Word: Pro rata
Meaning: consistently corresponding to a precise amount
Example: “Since I left the apartment in the middle of the month;” the former tenant told his former landlord; “I should only have to pay a pro rata amount due to the length of time I was there.”

Word: Pro
Meaning: a professional or expert
Example: Because her mother is pro basketball player; most people are surprised that Maria doesn’t like sports.

Word: Proactive
Meaning: acting in advance
Example: Emergency procedures are proactive measures to ensure everyone’s safety.

Word: Probability
Meaning: The likelihood or chance that something will happen
Example: There is a strong probability that another earthquake will occur along the fault.

Word: Probable
Meaning: likely; most likely
Example: It was probable that the students cheated; given their scores on the practice test.

Word: Probate
Meaning: the legal process of proving the validity of a deceased person's will to a court
Example: Without a copy of the will; there was no way to prove through probate that the nephew was the sole heir.

Word: Probe
Meaning: to inquire or investigate
Example: An independent investigator will probe the allegations of racial bias in police hiring.

Word: Probity
Meaning: the quality of a person who is completely honest
Example: The criminal knew he could not buy the judge who was known for his probity.

Word: Problematic
Meaning: challenging; difficult
Example: Finding enough volunteers to work at the shelter can be problematic since it’s not a paying job.

Word: Proboscis
Meaning: an animal's long flexible nose; or an animal's long tube-like mouth
Example: Using its proboscis to snag a branch; the elephant proceeded to eat the attached fruit.

Word: Procedure
Meaning: a surgical or medical treatment
Example: Many anxious brides choose the weight loss procedure despite its surgical risks.

Word: Proceed
Meaning: to move forward
Example: The doctor agreed to proceed with the surgery; but only if the patient lost some weight.

Word: Proceeding
Meaning: the process of appearing before a court of law so a decision can be made
Example: During the legal proceeding; the jury found the man guilty of several serious crimes.

Word: Process
Meaning: a procedure or set of actions that is followed step-by-step
Example: The maid goes through a detailed process when cleaning up each section of the house.

Word: Procession 
Meaning: group of people or thing moving along in an orderly manner
Example: Behind the tank followed a long procession of the armored soldiers.

Word: Proclaim
Meaning: to announce or declare
Example: In order to win concert tickets; I needed to proclaim my love for the band.

Word: Proclamation 
Meaning: a public announcement about something important
Example: The angel’s proclamation warned the people that a seven year famine was coming.

Word: Proclivity
Meaning: a natural inclination or tendency to act a certain way
Example: As a young child; the award-winning singer had a proclivity for music.

Word: Procrastinate
Meaning: to put off until another time
Example: My project is late because I constantly procrastinate.

Word: Procrustean
Meaning: related to forcing everyone to be the same
Example: All inhabitants in the town were forced to dress and behave the same under procrustean rulers.

Word: Procure
Meaning: to get possession of something by action or effort
Example: In order to make sandwiches to feed the homeless; we will need to procure donations from local businesses.

Word: Prod
Meaning: to push something forward; can refer to a physical object or a situation
Example: The shepherd tried to prod the sheep back in the direction of the field; but they continued to scuttle the wrong way.

Word: Prodigal
Meaning: carelessly and foolishly spending money; time; etc.
Example: If you want to save money for college; you should stop your prodigal spending sprees.

Word: Prodigious
Meaning: very large in size; force; or extent; enormous
Example: Since Stan’s car accident; he has been taking prodigious amounts of pain pills.

Word: Prodigy
Meaning: extremely talented person; especially a child
Example: The high school boy was considered a prodigy when he won the national chess championship.

Word: Producer
Meaning: an individual or organization that creates goods and services
Example: Brazil is the world's largest producer of coffee.

Word: Product
Meaning: an object made or crafted for sale
Example: Each product made at the factory must be checked by quality control before it’s shipped.

Word: Production
Meaning: making or manufacturing of things using raw materials
Example: Workers in the factory stopped production of the tires due to a broken machine.

Word: Productive
Meaning: doing or achieving a lot
Example: As productive members of society; the couple were always trying to help others.

Word: Productivity
Meaning: a measure for how efficiently well something is working
Example: Because the machines keep malfunctioning; the company’s production productivity has gone way down.

Word: Profane
Meaning: vulgar and inappropriate
Example: Because the comic’s jokes were profane and offensive to our religion; we left the show early.

Word: Profess
Meaning: to make claims about yourself that other people do not believe
Example: Although Mitch wrote a ballad to profess his love for Cara; he knew his words would not be taken seriously.

Word: Profession
Meaning: a career or occupation
Example: Unable to decide on a possession; the man decided to take a job as a waiter while he figured it out.

Word: Professional
Meaning: a person that is considered a qualified expert in a particular field or skill
Example: A professional carpenter was hired to build the cabinets inside the new house.

Word: Proffer
Meaning: an offer made to another individual
Example:  Since I am hungry; I am happy to accept your proffer of a meal.

Word: Proficient 
Meaning: able to do something very well
Example: Because Kurt is a proficient programmer; he earns a high salary for his work.

Word: Profit
Meaning: the amount of money a business has left over after subtracting any expenses
Example: The football team sold candy bars at school and kept the profit to buy new helmets and uniforms.

Word: Profitable
Meaning: bringing in more money than it cost to make the good or provide the service
Example: The chef looked for ways to make his business more profitable so that he wouldn’t have to shut the doors for good.

Word: Profligate
Meaning: 1.) wildly extravagant or wasteful; 2.) shamelessly immoral
Example: After the millionaire saw evidence of his new wife's profligate spending; he quickly filed for a divorce.

Word: Profound
Meaning: extremely deep
Example: The speaker’s profound words made me think about my future.

Word: Profundity 
Meaning: words that express deep reflection or insight
Example: Even though Chuck thought he was making some deep statements; he was too drunk to express any profundity.

Word: Profuse
Meaning: in a large amount; abundant
Example: Jonathan has gained so much weight that even his doctor is concerned about his profuse growth.

Word: Profusion
Meaning: being in great abundance
Example: In the summer; my dog is always covered with a profusion of fleas.

Word: Progenitor
Meaning: any of a person's direct ancestors; an ancestral form of a species
Example: Sharing a common progenitor meant that the two best friends were also 3rd cousins.

Word: Progeny
Meaning: descendants or offspring
Example: Because the billionaire bachelor did not have a progeny; his entire estate went to charity when he died.

Word: Prognosis 
Meaning: the predicted outcome of a situation
Example: After being hit by a car; the small dog’s health prognosis was not good.

Word: Prognostic
Meaning: describes something that would help predict the likely outcome of a disease or illness
Example: Performing a prognostic biopsy will tell us the stage at which the cancer is currently.

Word: Prognosticate
Meaning: to forecast the future
Example: Using computer technology; meteorologists attempt to prognosticate the future.

Word: Program
Meaning: a group of events or exercises to accomplish a certain goal
Example: The annual piano program included twenty students playing their favorite musical pieces to be judged by a panel.

Word: Prohibit
Meaning: to forbid or make something illegal
Example: The U.S. tried to prohibit people from drinking alcohol; but that law failed miserably.

Word: Prohibition
Meaning: an act of forbidding or disallowing something
Example: The prohibition of alcohol was repealed.

Word: Prohibitive
Meaning: tending to prohibit; preclude; or disallow
Example: The park association was prohibitive of bringing glass on the beach.

Word: Project
Meaning: to estimate or forecast something
Example: The weatherman will try to project the weekend weather; but no guess can be 100% accurate.

Word: Projected
Meaning: predicted or anticipated
Example: Test scores are projected to decrease over time at the school due to the continuous lack of funding affecting the quality of the education.

Word: Projectile 
Meaning: something that will be or has been expelled from some object
Example: The projectile went from the prisoner’s mouth and onto the guard’s face.

Word: Prokaryote
Meaning: a single-celled organism (such as bacteria) that lacks a nucleus and cannot be seen with the naked-eye
Example: The scientist studied the prokaryote under the microscope to see if its single-cell would multiply in certain conditions.

Word: Proletariat 
Meaning: the class that is at the bottom of the social ladder
Example: The members of the proletariat are threatening to cease their farm work if their wages are not increased.

Word: Proliferate
Meaning: spread rapidly or increase in number
Example: With the popularity of the Zumba craze; health clubs that feature this exercise class have begun to proliferate in most cities.

Word: Proliferation
Meaning: rapid increase in the number or amount of something
Example: The doctor explained that proliferation of the cancer cells shows that the cancer is spreading more rapidly than expected.

Word: Proliferation
Meaning: a rapid multiplication of parts or the increase in the number of something
Example: The proliferation of the diner’s popularity has made it difficult to find a seat without an hour wait.

Word: Prolific
Meaning: producing abundant results or works
Example: Because the huge storm is expected to produce a prolific amount of snow; government offices and schools are being closed.

Word:  Prolix 
Meaning: prone to using large words that most people do not understand
Example: The prolix professor had a habit of using complex words that most people could not comprehend.

Word: Prolixity
Meaning: long and wordy; using too many words to express a thought or idea
Example: The paper was marked down for the writer’s use of prolixity to lengthen it.

Word: Prologue 
Meaning: an introduction that usually precedes a novel or play
Example: The play’s prologue provides the audience members with insight into what they are about to watch.

Word: Prolonged
Meaning: lengthened in time; extended; drawn out
Example: The meeting was prolonged because we were waiting for our boss to arrive.

Word: Promenade
Meaning: a walk taken for pleasure; display; or exercise; a stroll
Example: My date and I went for a promenade in the park.

Word: Prominent 
Meaning: showing distinction above others in a specific area
Example: There is a six-month waiting list to see the most prominent psychiatrist in the city.

Word: Promiscuous 
Meaning: having many different sexual partners
Example: His promiscuous behavior earned him the title of a lady’s man.

Word: Promise
Meaning: an assurance or vow that something will happen
Example: The husband and wife will promise to love each other for life when they say their vows on their wedding day.

Word: Promissory
Meaning: something that implies or guarantees a promise
Example: My friend often makes promissory statements; but he always fails to keep those ludicrous promises that he makes.

Word: Promontory
Meaning: a high point of rock or land that juts into a source of water
Example: If we take one more step off the mountain’s promontory; we will fall into the ocean.

Word: Promote
Meaning: advance someone to a higher rank or position
Example: Because he had served his country so well; the General decided to promote the Corporal to the rank of Sergeant.

Word: Promotion
Meaning: advancement; elevation to the next step
Example: Hoping for a work promotion; Jessica tried to pick up extra shifts and help out the manager as much as possible.

Word: Prompt
Meaning: in good time; punctual
Example: Because I take pride in being prompt; I always leave early for work.

Word: Promptly 
Meaning: in a quick manner
Example: Fortunately; the paramedics arrived promptly and were able to save my father.

Word: Promptness
Meaning: the quality of doing something quickly or without delay
Example: Promptness of payment is appreciated; especially when you pay a few days early.

Word: Promulgate
Meaning: to make something recognized or known
Example: The purpose of the documentary is to promulgate the importance of raising funds for additional cancer research.

Word: Prone
Meaning: inclined to act a certain way
Example: Jack is prone to be quite talkative after he has consumed several beers.

Word: Prong
Meaning: each of two or more pointed parts that each project out of certain objects (i.e.; a fork) parallelly
Example: Because the prong on the end of the television cord is bent; the metal piece won’t fit into the wall outlet.

Word: Pronounce
Meaning: make the sound of (a word or part of a word); typically in the correct or a particular way
Example: Whenever the young reader didn’t know how to pronounce a complicated name; she substituted an easier one.

Word: Pronouncement
Meaning: an announcement that is formal and usually given by someone of authority
Example: After a series of incidents occurred on campus; the president of the university made a pronouncement that any harassment would result in severe consequences.

Word: Pronto
Meaning: right away or as quickly as possible
Example: The lifeguard rushed into the ocean pronto when he noticed a young child struggling to stay above water.

Word: Proof
Meaning: physical evidence that proves an accusation or idea
Example: Forensic investigators perform autopsies to search for proof of foul play.

Word: Proofread
Meaning: to look over a work or text in order to edit or amend it
Example: After working for four days on her English essay; the high schooler decided to ask her mom to proofread it so that it would be free of mistakes.

Word: Propaganda
Meaning: exaggerated or untruthful claims used to help raise support for an effort
Example: During election season; politicians often try and beat their rivals by airing propaganda on television.

Word: Propagate
Meaning: to share broadly
Example: The political candidate hopes to propagate his vision to potential voters.

Word: Propel
Meaning: to cause to move in a certain direction
Example: The seat belt stopped him from being able to propel forward during the crash.

Word: Propellant
Meaning: thing or substance that causes something else to be driven forward
Example: The student used his teacher’s hurtful words as a propellant to drive him toward success.

Word: Propensity
Meaning: a natural inclination or tendency
Example: My mother has a propensity to drink when she gets anxious.

Word: Proper
Meaning: suitable or appropriate for the situation
Example: Grandmother didn’t think that Heidi’s dress bathing suit was proper attire for the dinner table.

Word: Property
Meaning: possessions owned by a person or a business
Example: Lockers are provided for all the swimmers to put their personal property in while at the waterpark.

Word: Prophase 
Meaning: the first stage of mitosis (cell division)
Example: During the prophase; the cell chromosomes became visible as paired chromatids.

Word: Prophecy
Meaning: a prediction or foretelling of what's to come
Example: As the Persians suffered one loss after another; Daniel’s prophecy from years before was proven to be true.

Word: Prophet
Meaning: a person who speaks for God; or someone who can predict what will happen in the future
Example: In the bible; Noah was a prophet who warned the people that God would bring a flood to wipe out humanity because of all of their thievery and deceit.

Word: Prophetic 
Meaning: announcing a future happening
Example: The prophetic message accurately predicted the terrorist bombings of 2001.

Word: Prophylactic
Meaning: something used to prevent a disease
Example: Although the medicine has proven to be prophylactic; it does not prevent infection in all cases.

Word: Prophylaxis
Meaning: preventive treatment of a disease
Example: A special medication was prescribed before overseas travel as a prophylaxis to prevent malaria.

Word: Propinquity
Meaning: nearness in place or time
Example: Since my school is huge and my classes are not in near propinquity to each other; I walk a great deal between the hours of 7 am and 3 pm.

Word: Propitiate
Meaning: to make things right by doing something that is requested
Example: Only an idiot believes he can propitiate his way into heaven by giving the church all of his money.

Word: Propitious
Meaning: full of promise; favorable
Example: The beautiful Hawaiian weather made it propitious for sun bathing yesterday.

Word: Proponent
Meaning: an individual who supports a cause
Example: Because April loves animals; she is a fierce proponent of the animal rights movement.

Word: Proportion
Meaning: an amount that is part of a whole
Example: When he discovered the love letter; he blew the situation out of proportion by accusing his partner of infidelity.

Word: Proportional
Meaning: related or balanced in size; amount; or degree when compared to something else
Example: Police officers could use proportional force against the violent protestors but could not go overboard.

Word: Proportionate
Meaning: balanced in size; amount; or degree when compared to something else
Example: All investors were convinced they would receive a proportionate return of their money; but only ended up with half.

Word: Proposal
Meaning: a plan or suggestion
Example: A proposal to increase property taxes has been strongly opposed by homeowners.

Word: Propose
Meaning: to suggest a plan of action for others to consider
Example: Each band member was asked to propose a way to increase ticket sales; but no one had a suggestion.

Word: Proposition
Meaning: a proposal or plan
Example: The school agreed that teachers in the district were spending too much on their classrooms out of pocket; but had no proposition for additional funding.

Word: Propound
Meaning: to bring forth for deliberation or consideration
Example: At the faculty meeting I will propound several ideas for improving faculty morale.

Word: Proprietary
Meaning: an object or concept that is used; created; or sold by an individual or company that holds the property rights
Example: The soft drink company uses it proprietary formula to exclusively make its best selling beverage.

Word: Proprietor 
Meaning: an individual who owns a business
Example: The proprietor of the restaurant decided to close his establishment after losing money for eight months.

Word: Propriety
Meaning: following what is socially acceptable in speech and conduct; correctness of behaviour
Example: After Harold wore a clown suit to his cousin’s funeral; we had to question his sense of propriety.

Word: Proprioception
Meaning: the body’s unconscious ability to sense the position and location and movement of the body and its parts
Example: Proprioception allows a person to know where their leg is positioned; even when their eyes are closed.

Word: Propulsion
Meaning: a force or energy that causes progress or movement
Example: The plane cannot leave the hangar until its propulsion system is fixed.

Word: Propulsive
Meaning: having the power to move forward
Example: When she got sick; the force of her stomach tensing was propulsive.

Word: Prorogue
Meaning: to defer or discontinue Parliament or other government business for a period of time
Example: The governor was advised to prorogue Parliament for now and call a meeting at a later date.

Word: Prosaic
Meaning: commonplace or dull; unimaginative
Example: Because the biggest thing in my hometown is the grocery store; the city really is a prosaic little place.

Word: Proscribe 
Meaning: to forbid something
Example: In our country; there are laws which proscribe discrimination based on race and gender.

Word: Prose 
Meaning: written language other than poetry
Example: I did not know my husband could write such elegant prose until he mailed me long letters while he was stationed overseas.

Word: Prosecute
Meaning: to hold trial against someone charged with a crime
Example: DNA evidence was used to prosecute the killer and lock him up for good.

Word: Prosecution
Meaning: the process of holding a trial against a person who is accused of a crime
Example: Prosecution of the defendant will be difficult since the evidence against him is all circumstantial.

Word: Prosecutor
Meaning: a government attorney who presents the state's case against the defendant during criminal prosecution
Example: A special prosecutor was called in to handle the murder trial of the governor’s son.

Word: Prosecutor
Meaning: a member of legal court; typically a lawyer; that argues against the defendant and tries to prove them guilty of pressed charges
Example: We hired a lawyer to be a prosecutor on our behalf; pressing our charges against the defendant for us.

Word: Proselyte 
Meaning: one who has converted to a religion or doctrine
Example: The Christian proselyte converted after twenty years as an atheist.

Word: Prosody
Meaning: rhyme and sound patterns used in poetry
Example: The main elements of linguistic prosody in poetry are intonation; rhyme; and stress.

Word: Prospect 
Meaning: an individual who is likely to be selected or targeted
Example: Jared improved his computer skills so he would be a good prospect for the job opening in the technology department.

Word: Prospective
Meaning: likely to happen
Example: Calculating his prospective earnings for the next six months was difficult since business tends to ebb and flow.

Word: Prospector
Meaning: an explorer in search of mineral deposits
Example: The gold prospector ventured to the area in 1867 looking to strike it rich.

Word: Prosper
Meaning: to be successful
Example: In order for the business to prosper; the company had to reduce the amount of miscellaneous spending.

Word: Prosperity 
Meaning: an abundance of resources
Example: When Jake reached his goal of prosperity; he realized he had neglected his family for his professional achievements.

Word: Prosperous
Meaning: successful; well off
Example: The prosperous man never had to worry about having enough money to pay his bills.

Word: Prosperously
Meaning: wealthily
Example: Living prosperously; the Jeffersons could now afford to move up to a deluxe apartment in the sky.

Word: Prosthesis
Meaning: artificial replacement for a body part
Example: Many young children and even some adults stared at the young veteran soldier as he limped down the aisle of the store wearing a prosthesis where his leg used to be.

Word: Prostrate
Meaning: in a flat position where a person’s face is turned downward
Example: When Jill discovered her husband had left her; she fell prostrate on the couch and buried her face against the cushions.

Word: Protagonist 
Meaning: the leading character in a literary composition
Example: The protagonist was willing to give his life for the woman he loved.

Word: Protean
Meaning: changing often; variable
Example: Because the woman’s affections are protean; she has ten ex-husbands.

Word: Protect
Meaning: to protect or guard against something
Example: Promising to protect and serve; the police officer’s main goal was to make the city a safer place for its residents.

Word: Protection
Meaning: something used to protect or guard
Example: A protection spell was cast by the good witch to shield all the people in the kingdom from evil.

Word: Protectorate
Meaning: a small country that is controlled and protected by a larger; stronger one
Example: The protectorate was grateful that they had a watchful eye over their state.

Word: Protein
Meaning: a needed nutrient found in certain foods (meat; milk; eggs; and beans) that is made up of many amino acids joined together
Example: Several protein shakes on the market claim to have enough nutrients to build muscle with little exercise.

Word: Protest
Meaning: an expression of disagreement or disapproval to something wrong or unfair
Example: The protest in Selma helped African Americans gain the freedom to exercise the right to vote.

Word: Protestant
Meaning: a member of the Western Christian Church whose faith is founded on the Reformation (movement away from the Catholic Church) and the acceptance in the Bible
Example: As a part of religious reform; the Bible-reading Protestant rejected the authority of the Pope and many other Catholic traditions and beliefs.

Word: Protocol 
Meaning: guidelines for conduct in specific environments as well as for diplomats and heads of state
Example: Harold broke protocol when he approached the queen without being summoned.

Word: Proton 
Meaning: a particle that is part of the nucleus of an atom and has a positive charge
Example: A hydrogen atom consists of just one very small positively charged proton.

Word: Protoplasm
Meaning: an outdated term for the clear; fluid like substance that forms the living content of all animal or plant cells
Example: Scientifically speaking; protoplasm is the living contents of a cell surrounded by a plasma membrane.

Word: Prototype
Meaning: the original model of something serving as a typical example
Example: The builders created a prototype for how the subdivision was to look.

Word: Protozoa
Meaning: any of a large group of single cellular animals that lives in water or as a parasite
Example: Using cilia to move around; the unicellular protozoa made its way through the marsh.

Word: Protract
Meaning: to prolong in time or space
Example: The committee voted to protract the discussions of an amendment to their mission statement.

Word: Protrude
Meaning: to push out
Example: The blow made the man’s teeth protrude from his mouth.

Word: Protrusion
Meaning: something that protrudes or sticks out from something else
Example: Within a few weeks of discovering the mass; the protrusion on the patient’s jaw had doubled in size.

Word: Protuberance
Meaning: something that protrudes or sticks out from something else
Example: A hairy protuberance from the woman’s nose stuck out just enough to make the neighborhood children think she was a witch.

Word: Protuberant
Meaning: protruding; bulging
Example: The eerie looking fish had a protuberant jaw that stuck out from the rest of his small body and was filled with bony teeth.

Word: Proud
Meaning: feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction for one’s accomplishments

Word: Prove
Meaning: to show or demonstrate
Example: The only way to prove that you did not use a calculator to answer the equation is to show your work on paper.

Word: Proven
Meaning: shown or demonstrated
Example: By showing up on time every day for a year; the worker had proven dependability.

Word: Provenance
Meaning: origin or the source of where something derived from
Example: Since the provenance of this dish came from Italy; many people wanted to go to Italy to taste the actual authentic dish.

Word: Proverb
Meaning: a sentence that people often quote to which gives advice or state a universal truth
Example: An old proverb says that an attorney who represents himself has a fool for a client.

Word: Proverbial
Meaning: used often to describe something
Example: Everyone in class knew the proverbial quote from the hit animated comedy.

Word: Provide
Meaning: to give or supply
Example: Militants refused to surrender or provide opposing forces with information about their mission.

Word: Providence
Meaning: good management of resources needed for the future
Example: Because of Jim’s providence; he and his wife have a nice retirement egg.

Word: Provident
Meaning: demonstrating great care and consideration for the future
Example: My financier told me that I needed to be more provident when it came to my spending.

Word: Providential
Meaning: fortunate
Example: It was providential that I moved out of the way before being struck by the oncoming vehicle.

Word: Province
Meaning: a region within a country
Example: Province leaders insist that the new energy plant will bring 3;000 jobs to the region within five years.

Word: Provincial
Meaning: 
Example: Even though James had travelled all over the world; he still wore clothing which was quite provincial and outdated.

Word: Provision 
Meaning: actions taken to meet a possible need
Example: The tax provision ensures lenders will not raise interest rates above a certain percentage.

Word: Provisional 
Meaning: temporary; but with the intention of eventually becoming permanent or being replaced by a permanent equivalent
Example: Provisional custody arrangements favored the mother; but the children were later ordered to live with their father.

Word: Proviso
Meaning: a conditional stipulation attached to an agreement
Example: A proviso was added to the bill to make sure that the likelihood of theft would be diminished.

Word: Provocation
Meaning: anything or anyone that incites a response
Example:  I walked away from a potential fight despite my enemy’s provocation.

Word: Provocative

Example: When the editor read the provocative article which urged people to destroy government buildings; he insisted the writer redo the entire piece.

Word: Provoke
Meaning: to trigger a reaction; often an angry one
Example: The pictures of the victim’s body are sure to provoke feelings of anger within the jury.

Word: Provost

Word: Prow
Meaning: the front part of a boat or ship

Word: Prowess

Word: Prowl
Meaning: to move around quietly in a place trying not to be heard or seen
Example: I called the police when I noticed a masked man prowl through the neighborhood.

Word: Proxemics
Meaning: the study of cultural; behavioral; and sociological effects of spatial distances between individuals
Example: Proxemics is the study of how people use and perceive the physical space around them.

Word: Proximal
Meaning: something that is nearby or close to something else
Example: Since the stab wound was proximal to the heart; the doctors feared that it might have penetrated the outer layer of the man’s heart.

Word: Proximity
Meaning: the nearness of one thing or person to another
Example: Because Mary left her sandwich in close proximity to her dog; she did not have anything for lunch.

Word: Proxy 
Meaning: one who has been given permission to act for another
Example: When my husband and I are out of the country; my sister is the proxy who signs legal documents for our children.

Word: Prude
Meaning: one who is easily offended or shocked by rude things
Example: I wouldn’t consider myself a prude; but I was offended at the comedian’s off-color jokes.

Word: Prudent
Meaning: marked by wisdom or sound judgment
Example: It is not prudent to go swimming during a hurricane.

Word: Prudish

Word: Pseudonym

Word: Pseudoscience 
Meaning: an idea. claim; or belief that looks like science; but is not
Example: Because no connection between the positions of stars and human behavior can be proven scientifically; astronomy is classified as pseudoscience.

Word: Pshaw

Example: Pshaw; you had better run if there really is a bear in your tent!

Word: Psyche

Word: Psychosis
Meaning: a severe mental disorder
Example: After three doctor visits; the man suffered from psychosis due to his mind-altering hallucinations and obscure delusions.

Word: Psychosomatic
Meaning: (of an illness) caused by mental problems; such as stress or anxiety; rather than physical problems
Example: Due to the constant worry of losing his job; Bob’s psychosomatic headaches would be cured when he stopped worrying.

Word: Pulsate

Word: Punctilio

Word: Punctilious

Word: Puncture

Word: Punitive 
Meaning: done as an act of punishment

Word: Purity

Word: Purloin

Word: Purportedly

Word: Purposeless

Word: Pursue

Word: Pyromania

Word: Pyrotechnic

Word: Pyrrhic

Word: Qua
Meaning: used to say “as” or “as a”

Word: Quackery

Word: Quadrant

Word: Quadrennial

Word: Quadriceps

Word: Quadruple

Word: Quadruplicate

Word: Quaff

Word: Quagmire

Word: Quail

Word: Quaint

Word: Quaker

Word: Qualification

Word: Qualifier

Word: Qualify

Word: Qualitative
Meaning: associated with type or quality
Example: The qualitative study will reveal the elements present in the compound.

Word: Qualities
Meaning: attributes or characteristics of a person; place; or thing

Word: Quality control
Meaning: a system for maintaining a desired level of quality in an existing product or service

Word: Qualm
Meaning:  a feeling of doubt or uncertainty about whether you are doing the right thing
Example: Under the influence of drugs; Matt had no qualm whatsoever about spending all of his money at the casino.

Word: Quandary
Meaning: a state of doubt about what to do in a certain situation; a difficult situation
Example: Mark is in a quandary about whether or not he should keep the money he found in the park.

Word: Quantifiable
Meaning: able to be measured
Example: Scientists used a calculator to average the quantifiable data gathered during the experiment.

Word: Quantify
Meaning: to assign a quantity to
Example: In my statistics class; we needed to quantify the probability of winning the lottery.

Word: Quantitative
Meaning: pertaining to the measureable amount of something
Example: After writing down everyone’s height in his 4th period class; the student analyzed the quantitative data to determine he was the tallest student in the class.

Word: Quantity
Meaning: the amount of something
Example: The store owner checked the quantity of tires and realized he needed to order more.

Word: Quantum
Meaning: The smallest amount of something; specifically energy
Example: Measuring the quantum amount of the object essentially destroyed it.

Word: Quarantine
Meaning: a place where individuals or animals who have contagious diseases are held
Example: Until it is determined whether or not the dog has rabies; it will be placed in quarantine.

Word: Quarrel 
Meaning: a verbal disagreement that is usually noisy
Example: The quarrel my husband and I had was so loud it woke our children.

Word: Quarrelsome
Meaning: argumentative; confrontational
Example: The younger brother’s quarrelsome nature resulted in constant arguments and the splitting of the family business.

Word: Quarry
Meaning: an area from which materials like stone are removed
Example: At night; the moonlight caused the stones in the quarry to shine.

Word: Quarter
Meaning: one of four equal parts
Example: With five minutes left on the clock; the defense performed much better than they did in the previous quarter.

Word: Quartet
Meaning: a musical group with four members
Example: The final performance had to be postponed since two of the four members were sick with the flu.

Word: Quasar
Meaning: an incredibly distant celestial object made of a vivid mass of light and energy
Example: A quasar is a cosmic entity that is filled with energy.

Word: Quash
Meaning: to put an end to something
Example: Refusing to give in to the toddler’s demands; the exasperated mother was hell-bent on coming up with a plan to quash the tantrums.

Word: Quasi 
Meaning: having features that are similar to another thing
Example: Since my father was in the military for twenty-five years; he treats our home like it is a quasi-base camp.

Word: Quaver
Meaning: a tremor in an individual’s voice usually caused by nervousness or anxiety
Example: You could hear a quaver in the nervous girl’s tone.

Word: Quavering
Meaning: shaking; trembling; or vibrating
Example: The little girl’s quavering body continued to shake as she looked for the monster under her bed.

Word: Quay
Meaning: a concrete loading dock situated on the edge of a body of water
Example: After years of loading and unloading freight on top of it; sections of the old concrete quay began to crumble into the sea.

Word: Queasy
Meaning: feeling sick and nauseated
Example: As the boat began to pick up speed; a few of the ship’s passengers began to feel queasy from the motion.

Word: Queen
Meaning: a woman ruler of a kingdom or country
Example: Presenting a feast fit for a queen; the peasants tried to make sure everything was in place for her majesty.

Word: Queer
Meaning: strange; odd
Example: Peering into the queer little house; Georgia couldn’t understand why all the unusually shaped furniture was painted pink and blue.

Word: Quell
Meaning: to calm or reduce
Example: Before Sarah gives a speech; she always drinks a shot of whiskey to quell her nerves.

Word: Quench
Meaning: to satisfy an actual or figurative thirst; or to put out a fire
Example: Aiming to quench her thirst; the runner guzzled down the water at full speed.

Word: Querulous
Meaning: full of complaints; complaining
Example: If there was an award for being querulous; my aunt would win because she is always complaining about something.

Word: Query
Meaning: an inquiry for information
Example: State officials have launched a query into allegations of judicial misconduct by Judge Petros.

Word: Quest
Meaning: a trip taken to find something or someone
Example: Jan’s quest for fame led her to do immoral things.

Word: Question
Meaning: to interrogate or cross-examine someone while looking for answers
Example: Police continued to question the suspect in an attempt to get him to confess to the crime.

Word: Questionable
Meaning: not certain; doubtful
Example: Attending the game is questionable since it will probably be rescheduled due to rain.

Word: Questionnaire
Meaning: a set of questions used to gain specific information from people responding to the survey
Example: Respondents to the second questionnaire provided follow up information about the types of cleaning products they use.

Word: Queue
Meaning: a waiting list or line in which people and/or problems are dealt with in order
Example: We stood in the queue for hours waiting to get tickets to the championship game.

Word: Quib
Meaning: a witty or clever remark that is said in a taunting way
Example: The barmaid continued to flirt with the man; throwing every quib and witty joke she could think of into the conversation.

Word: Quibble
Meaning: to quarrel about minor matters
Example: It is normal for married couples to quibble over small things like who controls the television remote.

Word: Quick
Meaning: moving fast or doing something in a short timeframe
Example: The rabbit was much too quick for my large dog to catch him; darting away and into a small crevice.

Word: Quickly
Meaning: at a rapid speed; fastly
Example: Speeding quickly down the highway; the distracted driver missed a curve and careened off of the mountainside.

Word: Quid pro quo
Meaning: a Latin term that refers to a deal in which something is given but only in exchange for something else; often use in legal cases
Example: Continuing quid pro quo; the bread maker always gave the butcher loaves in exchange for beef.

Word: Quiddity
Meaning: the qualities of something that makes it what it is; usually on purpose
Example: The quiddity of motherhood was reflected in Ms. Dowling because she was always baking cookies and tending to her child’s needs.

Word: Quidnunc
Meaning: a busybody who always wants to know other people’s business
Example: The town’s biggest quidnunc; Nancy loved to gossip about other people’s personal lives.

Word: Quiescent 
Meaning: not active; quiet
Example: For once; our hyperactive Great Dane is quiescent and resting on the rug.

Word: Quiet
Meaning: calm with little or no noise
Example: Moving into a quiet neighborhood; the couple was glad to be able to sleep peacefully at night.

Word: Quietude
Meaning: a state of quiet stillness and calmness
Example: In quietude and coolness; the couple enjoyed a picnic on a grassy knoll beside the calm stream.

Word: Quietus
Meaning: the termination of something; usually unpleasant in nature
Example: The police officer’s arrival brought a quietus to the argument between the two neighbors.

Word: Quill
Meaning: a pen made from the feather of a bird
Example: Placing the pointed black quill on the paper; the president prepared to write a letter to the general.

Word: Quilt
Meaning: a blanket made by sewing fabric squares or pieces together usually in a pattern
Example: When I unfolded my grandmother’s hand-sewn quilt; I could see different shapes coming together in a specific design.

Word: Quintessence
Meaning: most perfect example of its type
Example: Hillary has always been the quintessence of high fashion; so I was taken aback when I saw her wearing an old; saggy pair of jeans and a ragged T-shirt.

Word: Quintessential
Meaning: a model example of a specific quality
Example: The critics love the director’s latest film and consider it to be the quintessential horror movie.

Word: Quip
Meaning: a clever statement
Example: The president responded to the journalist’s question with a clever quip.

Word: Quirk
Meaning: an odd behavior or different way of acting
Example: Janice has this irritating quirk of rolling her eyes whenever she speaks.

Word: Quirky
Meaning: unusual; but in an attractive or interesting way
Example: The quirky yellow cottage is decorated in a strange yet attractive way.

Word: Quisling
Meaning: a traitor who helps an enemy that has taken control of his or her country
Example: The quisling was a traitor who helped the British when they came to try and take over his country.

Word: Quit
Meaning: to leave a place or stop doing a task
Example: The teacher wanted to quit her job; but she has to find another one first.

Word: Quitclaim
Meaning: a legal document that transfers ownership of a property from one person to another
Example: A quitclaim deed was issued to Jenny after her mother transferred the property into her name.

Word: Quite
Meaning: significantly; fairly
Example: Seasoned wings were quite tasty; but not as delicious as the corn on the cob.

Word: Quiver
Meaning: to shudder with a slight sound or motion; usually because of strong feelings
Example: I knew Jill was upset when her lips started to quiver.

Word: Quivering
Meaning: trembling and shaking
Example: Quivering when she came out of the chilly water; the swimmer decided that it was too cold to swim after all.

Word: Quixotic
Meaning: unrealistic and impractical
Example: Although Jack’s plan for killing the giant was quixotic; it was the village’s only hope.

Word: Quizzical
Meaning: suggesting confusion or disbelief
Example: Because I am a male; the doctor gave me a quizzical look when I told him I was pregnant.

Word: Quondam
Meaning: former; previous
Example: The quondam beauty queen was much more exotic than the one currently being crowned.

Word: Quorum
Meaning: the needed number of people to be present at a meeting in order to conduct business
Example: When Congress met to discuss the issue at hand; they realized that they would postpone the session until a quorum was met.

Word: Quota
Meaning: a goal or quantity that is assigned
Example: Each seamstress has a quota of fifty blankets that must be sewn each day.

Word: Quotidian
Meaning: everyday events that are normal and not that exciting
Example: As the days of celebration wore on; the formerly spectacular events began to seem more quotidian; and the king found himself yawning at the chariot races.

Word: Quotient
Meaning: the end of result of division
Example: The fun quotient reduced significantly when mom decided to tag along.

Word: Rabbi
Meaning: a religious scholar that teaches Jewish law
Example: As an assistant rabbi; the man was responsible for helping with the b’nai mitzvah program and teaching coming of age rituals to Jewish boys.

Word: Rabble
Meaning: a disorderly mob or crowd
Example: An angry rabble gathered outside of the courthouse and threw bottles at the mob on the other side of the street.

Word: Rabid 
Meaning: having excessive enthusiasm for something or someone
Example: The singer’s rabid fans have been known to dig through his trash.

Word: Racial
Meaning: related to race or ethnicity
Example: Racial jokes aimed at Hispanics offended the mostly Mexican audience.

Word: Racism
Meaning: prejudice and discriminatory actions towards others because of their ethnicity
Example: Racism during the Jim Crow era led to African Americans being banned from most public places.

Word: Racist
Meaning: someone who holds prejudiced beliefs or shows discriminatory behavior towards others of a certain race or ethnic background
Example: Racist protesters lined the city streets to protest the school integration of blacks and whites.

Word: Rack
Meaning: a stand or shelf used to hold or hang things
Example: A shoe rack and several small cubbies lined the walls of the classroom.

Word: Racket
Meaning: an unpleasantly loud and irritating noise
Example: Upstairs in the playroom; the loud children are making quite a racket.

Word: Racketeer
Meaning: a person who takes part in a fraudulent or dishonest business
Example: Implicated in at least 10 different fraudulent business deals; the racketeer is facing serious jail time.

Word: Racking
Meaning: tormenting; agonizing
Example: Making a racking noise up and down the halls of the haunted inn; the ghost continued to terrorize all who dared to stay the night.

Word: Raconteur
Meaning: one recognized as being a talented teller of stories
Example: The kindergarten teacher was an excellent raconteur who had no problem keeping her young charges engaged with her stories.

Word: Racy
Meaning: describes something exciting and slightly shocking because it is sexual
Example: Racy pictures of the celebrity showed up in the tabloid; embarrassing her husband and children.

Word: Radar
Meaning: a device that uses radio waves to locate something
Example: Bringing a radar along on his latest trip; the fisherman hoped that he would be able to use the device to find schools of catfish.

Word: Radiance
Meaning: glowing brightness
Example: Pure radiance shined through the water as the sun’s rays caused the waves to glisten.

Word: Radiant
Meaning: shining with happiness
Example: The bride looked radiant as she walked down the aisle.

Word: Radiate
Meaning: to give off
Example: Hopefully the small heater will radiate enough warmth to heat the room.

Word: Radiation 
Meaning: energy spread or radiated through waves; particles; or rays
Example: Although the explosion was contained inside of the plant; the chemical radiation can still spread within a thirty-mile radius.

Word: Radical
Meaning: an idea that is different from traditional views
Example: The conservative church leaders were not interested in hearing any radical religious ideas.

Word: Radius
Meaning: the circular area or distance limited by the sweep of a line
Example: Because I prefer working close to home; I only applied for positions within a ten mile radius of my apartment.

Word: Raffish
Meaning: unconventional and unacceptable yet intriguing
Example: The raffish woman drew everyone’s attention when she crashed the wedding.

Word: Raffle
Meaning: a lottery-style game where people buy tickets for a prize and one or more tickets is drawn at random
Example: During the Farmerville County Fair; people purchased tickets for a raffle to win a prize-winning chicken only if their ticket was drawn.

Word: Raft
Meaning: a flat floating structure for travelling across water that is often made from wood or logs tiled together
Example: The castaway used logs and vine to create a raft that he hoped would help him get off the island.

Word: Rafters
Meaning: internal beams extending from the eaves to the peak of a building’s roof
Example: The cluttered garage was packed all the way up to the rafters; with boxes sitting on some of the top beams.

Word: Rafters
Meaning: sloping wooden beams that support a roof
Example: The wooden rafters holding up the tilting roof up were the last bit of structure still standing after the tornado ripped the building apart.

Word: Rage
Meaning: an intense anger that is extremely difficult to manage
Example: Full of rage; the man slammed his fist through the car windshield.

Word: Ragged
Meaning: tattered and worn
Example: An old; ragged flag showed its tattered stripes as it ripped back and forth in the wind.

Word: Raging
Meaning: showing power and intensity
Example: A raging storm swooped into the area; destroying homes with its intensity.

Word: Raid
Meaning: To invade or search
Example: The successful raid into the nearby country was a military success for the army.

Word: Rail
Meaning: a bar or series of bars that serves as a fence or barrier
Example: A rail was placed on the outside of the cruise ship to keep passengers from going overboard.

Word: Raillery
Meaning: good-natured bantering
Example: While many people think the brothers are arguing; they’re usually just engaging in some fun raillery.

Word: Railroad
Meaning: a steel track along which trains carrying rail cars travel
Example: Moving down the railroad tracks; the train’s whistle let out a loud toot.

Word: Raiment 
Meaning: garments
Example: The shelter provides housing; food; and raiment for people in need.

Word: Rain
Meaning: water that condenses form water vapor and then falls from the sky in tiny droplets
Example: Damp rain splashing down onto the children’s faces was just what was needed on a hot day.

Word: Raincheck
Meaning: a promise that something that was supposed to occur now will be accepted later
Example: I know I promised you a dance; but something has come up so I’ll have to take a raincheck.

Word: Rainfall
Meaning: the amount of precipitation falling in an area during a specific time
Example: Rainfall across the region over the past 24 hours has ranged from 2 to 3 inches.

Word: Rainwater
Meaning: water that has fallen from the sky as rain
Example: Rainwater was collected in a bucket and used to water the flowers a day or so after a storm.

Word: Raise
Meaning: to lift something up
Example: The store agreed not to raise gas prices if other stores in the area kept them low as well.

Word: Rajah
Meaning: an Indian king or prince
Example: The film describes the life of an Indian rajah who gave up the throne for love.

Word: Rake
Meaning: to gather things together into a pile
Example: During the fall; we must rake all the leaves and acorns from the oak tree into big piles for disposal.

Word: Rakish
Meaning: filled with a nonchalant attitude that is often displayed in an unconventional manner
Example: Josh’s rakish personality leads him to believe it is okay to have six girlfriends at one time.

Word: Rally
Meaning: to come together in support
Example: Soldiers in the regime would rally around one another after every completed mission.

Word: Ram
Meaning: to butt or strike something
Example: The police began to ram the door with a piece of steel in order to force their way in.

Word: Ramadan
Meaning: the holy month when Muslims fast and try to perform good deeds
Example: Observing Ramadan from dawn until dusk; Muslims do not eat during this point of their holy month.

Word: Ramble
Meaning: to talk aimlessly
Example: Because my math professor tends to ramble on; I often fall asleep in class.

Word: Rambling
Meaning: speech or writing that is long-winded and confusing
Example: Theresa stopped reading the rambling letter from her jailhouse lover after several minutes of being confused.

Word: Rambunctious
Meaning: hyper and energetic
Example: The classroom looked like a war zone after the rambunctious kindergartners ran around knocking things onto the ground.

Word: Ramification
Meaning: a change that makes a situation more complicated
Example: Jason was shocked when he learned the ramification of his cheating was immediate expulsion from the university.

Word: Ramify
Meaning: intensify or complicate
Example: As the group’s questions began to ramify and thwart the event; the author began to think a Q and A session might better serve their interest.

Word: Ramose
Meaning: having many branches
Example: The ramose oak was covered in moss; with the thick peat covering the tree’s many branches.

Word: Rampage
Meaning: to rush through an area in a reckless or violent manner
Example: Shoppers went on a rampage through the mall; knocking over racks and pushing each other down.

Word: Rampant
Meaning: not restrained
Example: During the riots; crime was rampant in the streets.

Word: Rampart

Example: Soldiers formed a rampart around the city in order to protect Jericho from being overtaken.

Word: Ramping
Meaning: decreasing or increasing in volume; amount; or rate
Example: Since the demand for the product is now low; production efforts are ramping down.

Word: Ramrod
Meaning: a metal bar that is used to push explosive material down into the barrel of some old-fashioned guns
Example: A cleaning jag is added to the end of the ramrod to make cleansing of the gun barrel easier.

Word: Ramshackle 
Meaning: worn down; in disrepair
Example: I will be surprised if your ramshackle car can make it out of the driveway.

Word: Rancid
Meaning: being foul in taste or smell
Example: The oil went rancid because it was overly exposed to sunlight.

Word: Rancor
Meaning: a feeling of hate or anger
Example: Even though my mother despised her twin sister; she always spoke about her without rancor.

Word: Rancorous
Meaning: bitter or resentful
Example: Mr. Knightly is a rancorous old man who is always unhappy and seemingly angry at everyone; even if they are strangers.

Word: Random
Meaning: accidental; by chance
Example: Corrupt police officers conducted random stop-and-frisk stays throughout the city; targeting people unsystematically.

Word: Rang
Meaning: caused a device with a bell to ring by striking it
Example: The children rang the doorbell and then ran away as soon as someone answered the call.

Word: Range
Meaning: an assortment of things that are of the same general type
Example: A range of emotions filled the heart of the woman who had recently lost her husband and given birth to their child.

Word: Rangeland
Meaning: an open piece of land where animals graze
Example: The forage on the rangeland was dwindling; leaving little for the cattle to eat on during the winter.

Word: Ranging
Meaning: varying between
Example: The teacher has many students in each class; ranging from 25 to 30 per section.

Word: Rank
Meaning: foul smelling; pungent
Example: After a day of being left out to sour; the rank milk had curdled and begun to smell.

Word: Rankle
Meaning: to cause bitterness or irritation
Example: The fact the plane is leaving two hours late is certainly going to rankle the passengers.

Word: Ransack
Meaning: a frantic hunt for an item that leaves chaos and/or damage in its wake
Example: The thieves continued to ransack the house until they came across the shoebox stuffed with money.

Word: Ransacking
Meaning: to search through something hurriedly or carelessly
Example: Ransacking the place; the burglars threw everything around as they tried to steal all the valuables from the home.

Word: Ransom
Meaning: something that is paid to free an individual who is being held as a hostage
Example: In some cases you can pay the ransom and still not have your loved one returned.

Word: Rant
Meaning: an act complaining or speaking about something in a loud; lengthy; angry; emotional manner
Example: The woman’s irate Facebook rant was not representative of her character and was eventually taken down.

Word: Rap
Meaning: a sharp knock or blow made quickly
Example: A sharp rap at the door startled the nervous housewife who wasn’t expecting any visitors.

Word: Rapacious
Meaning: aggressively greedy
Example: Because of its rapacious appetite; the shark is often considered to be more of an eating machine than a living creature.

Word: Rapid-fire
Meaning: describes something coming quickly; one after the other
Example: Rapid-fire questioning during round three of the quiz bowl happened so quickly that most of the contestants became nervous.

Word: Rapid
Meaning: moving swiftly
Example: Thank you for your rapid response to my question.

Word: Rapidity
Meaning: quickness; swiftness
Example: Mashing the buttons with great rapidity; the toddler quickly locked his mother’s phone with his insistent pressing.

Word: Rapier
Meaning: a long slender blade that has two edges and a protective ornament for the hand
Example: In fencing; I often use a rapier because it has a long blade that makes it perfect for thrusting.

Word: Rapine
Meaning: the taking of another’s property by force
Example: To prevent rapine during the war; many people hid their most valuable possessions.

Word: Rapport
Meaning: a pleasant association or relationship
Example: The rapport I have with my therapist allows me to tell her my deepest thoughts.

Word: Rapprochement
Meaning: an agreement reached by opposing parties

Word: Rapscallion

Word: Rare
Meaning: uncommon
Example: The coin was a rare edition and was not found in many collections around the world.

Word: Rarefaction

Example: The rarefaction of air occurs as it rises higher in the atmosphere; where it loses much of its density.

Word: Rarefied
Meaning: relevant to only a select group
Example: The rarefied book was written in an ancient language that could only be read by a few linguists and historians.

Word: Rarefy
Meaning: to convert into something less thick
Example: The humidifier will rarefy the room by putting moisture in the air.

Word: Rarely
Meaning: not often; seldom
Example: I rarely use my home office but end up working from my couch instead.

Word: Rarity
Meaning: infrequency; uncommonness
Example: It is a rarity to see my grandmother at family functions since she prefers to stay in the house most of the time.

Word: Rascal
Meaning: a person who is always getting into trouble or mischief
Example: My grandpa often describes my little brother as a rascal who can’t be still.

Word: Rash
Meaning: acting without thinking
Example: The boy acted in a rash manner and didn’t consider the consequences of driving under the influence.

Word: Rasp
Meaning: an unpleasant sound; such as a rough surface being rubbed
Example: The nasal rasp of the woman’s voice irritated those listening to her speak.

Word: Raspy
Meaning: hoarse or harsh; usually in regards to a person’s voice
Example: My sore throat made my voice sound raspy to my friends; who knew I was sick the moment they heard my hoarse words.

Word: Rate
Meaning: charge or fee
Example: My attorney’s rate is much higher than other lawyers because of his excellent reputation and years of experience.

Word: Rather
Meaning: quite; to a slight degree
Example: It is rather cold outside; so I should wear a jacket when heading to work.

Word: Ratify

Example: Unfortunately; half of the legislators refuse to ratify a bill that would increase funding for public schools.

Word: Ratio

Word: Ratiocination

Word: Ration
Meaning: the portion that is distributed

Word: Rational

Word: Rationale

Word: Rationalism

Meaning: to justify negative behavior
Example: When he could not rationalize why he stayed out past curfew; the teen’s parents took his car for a month.

Word: Rattle

Word: Ravel

Word: Ravings

Word: Ravishing
Meaning: extremely beautiful

Word: Ray

Word: Razbliuto

Word: Raze
Meaning: to demolish
