Word: Reachable
Meaning: accessible or able to be achieved; reached
Example: Twenty thousand sales is a reachable target that we should be able to meet this month.

Word: React
Meaning: to respond or behave in a certain way
Example: We hope my brother will react in an excited way when we yell “surprise!”

Word: Reactant
Meaning: a substance that is there at the beginning of a chemical reaction
Example: Hydrogen is a reactant which when combined with oxygen can make water.

Word: Reactionary 
Meaning: against change
Example: My grandmother is described as reactionary because she refuses to use modern technologies like microwaves and mobile phones.

Word: Readily
Meaning: willingly and without doubt
Example: My empty stomach readily received the food I ate for lunch.

Word: Readiness
Meaning: the act of being prepared and equipped
Example: The future college student’s readiness to attend college could be seen since she had already paid all of the tuition and packed her bags.

Word: Readout
Meaning: the output of a computer in readable form
Example: The ATM spit out a readout that told the customer how much money she had in her account.

Word: Reaffirm
Meaning: to state something again
Example: By transferring to the Middletown Baptist Church; I had to reaffirm my faith in front of the congregation.

Word: Real
Meaning: genuine and authentic
Example: The woman in the market is selling real designer purses and not the knockoff versions.

Word: Realign
Meaning: to bring back into alignment; to restore to a new or correct position
Example: Doctors worked to relieve his shoulder pain and realign the joint.

Word: Realism
Meaning: a realistic approach of accepting things as they are and dealing with them accordingly
Example: The scientist always approached his work with a sense of realism and refused to let emotions lead him.

Word: Realist
Meaning: a person who accepts the true nature of a situation rather than an idealized version
Example: As a realist; the Prima prides herself on being a rational thinker that can solve any problem that arrives.

Word: Realistic
Meaning: based on what is real; sensible; or practical
Example: The actress gave such a realistic performance that it was hard to believe she wasn’t the actual character from the book.

Word: Reality
Meaning: the true situation exactly as it exists
Example: The reality of the family’s poverty meant they didn’t have much food or water.

Word: Realization
Meaning: the action of becoming informed or aware
Example: The realization shocked me into silence when I figured out my boyfriend was stumbling through a marriage proposal.

Word: Realize
Meaning: to understand or become aware of something
Example: The distracted driver didn’t realize the puppy was on the road and barely missed hitting him with her car.

Word: Realm
Meaning: a subject or area in which an individual has curiosity; experience; and/or knowledge
Example: In recent years; many technological innovations have deepened my interest in the realm of computer science.

Word: Reap
Meaning: to harvest by cutting
Example: With the invention of the thresher; farmers were able to reap their crops faster than before.

Word: Rear
Meaning: the back part of something
Example: Working out almost daily; the shapely woman tried to sweat off her rear end.

Word: Reason
Meaning: cause or basis
Example: There is no reason to clean the house because it is already spotless.

Word: Reason
Meaning: a cause or basis
Example: The student became very sick with the flu and had to miss school for that reason.

Word: Reasonable
Meaning: sensible and rational
Example: After so many silly answers; the teacher was happy that her top student gave a reasonable response to the question.

Word: Reasoning
Meaning: thinking; figuring
Example: When the couple fell in love; all logical reasoning flew out the window.

Word: Reassurance
Meaning: words spoken or actions taken to make a person feel better
Example: After I lost the contest; my husband spoke words of reassurance so I wouldn’t doubt my ability.

Word: Reassure
Meaning: to say or do something to remove fear or doubt
Example: The husband tried to reassure his wife that he loved her no matter what.

Word: Reassuring
Meaning: to make someone feel less afraid or doubtful through comfort and support
Example: In a reassuring tone; the doctor assured the patient that he would make it out of surgery.

Word: Reawakening
Meaning: the renewal of a feeling or interest in something
Example: Once he was treated for depression; the patient experienced an emotional reawakening and began to enjoy life again.

Word: Rebarbative
Meaning: unpleasant and unattractive
Example: The unpleasant waitress’s rebarbative stopped her from getting many tips at the café.

Word: Rebate
Meaning: an portion of money returned to you after the purchase of something
Example: The car dealership offered the potential buyer 6k back in the form of a rebate if he chose to buy the vehicle.

Word: Rebel
Meaning: to rise up in a revolt against something
Example: Members of the group decided to rebel after seeing that no one was listening to their ideas.

Word: Rebellion
Meaning: an attempt to replace one form of government with another or an organized act of defiance against authority
Example: The plantation owner killed the leader of the slave rebellion to deter other slaves from being disobedient.

Word: Rebellious
Meaning: unruly and wild with behavior and actions
Example: The rebellious teen refused to listen to his parents and did what he wanted to do.

Word: Rebirth
Meaning: to be born again or revival of something to take place again
Example: After suffering from the Civil War; the two sides came back together in a rebirth so the nation could function united as it once did.

Word: Rebound
Meaning: to bounce back off of something
Example: When the basketball players shoot the ball; they are hoping it will go in and not rebound off the backboard.

Word: Rebuff
Meaning: to turn down or refuse
Example: Since your offer does not benefit me; I will have to rebuff it and walk away empty-handed.

Word: Rebuke
Meaning: to criticize sharply or a sharp criticism
Example: Good parents praise their children more than they rebuke them.

Word: Rebut 
Meaning: to deny something by giving reasons it cannot be true
Example: The defense attorney tried hard to rebut the prosecutor’s accusation about the defendant.

Word: Rebuttal
Meaning: an account that is written or stated to contradict another idea
Example: Since the defense attorney did not have a rebuttal to the prosecutor’s statement; he was unable to make the jury believe his client’s alibi.

Word: Recalcitrant
Meaning: stubborn
Example: Despite being offered treats by his parents; the little boy was still recalcitrant about doing his homework.

Word: Recall
Meaning: to call up a memory
Example: Because the woman didn’t want her abusive husband arrested; she swore she couldn’t recall her attacker.

Word: Recant
Meaning: to retract a public statement
Example: After being convicted of perjury; the witness had to recant her remarks against the defendant.

Word: Recap
Meaning: a review of something
Example: The teacher gave us a recap of everything we had learned over the semester the day before the final exam.

Word: Recapitulate
Meaning: to review or repeat
Example: At the start of each class; the professor will recapitulate yesterday’s lecture.

Word: Recast
Meaning: to allocate the parts of a play to different actors than originally intended
Example: The actors in the play were recast once the director realized that they were not in the best roles possible.

Word: Recede
Meaning: to go back
Example: If you look closely at George’s hair; you can see where his hairline has started to recede.

Word: Receding
Meaning: to move back or further away
Example: Phil wears a hat whenever he is in public to hide his receding hairline.

Word: Recent
Meaning: new; latest
Example: Recent weather reports show that hurricane Sydney is still headed our way.

Word: Recently
Meaning: lately; not long ago
Example: Recently; several children have asked to join our book club.

Word: Receptacle
Meaning: an item used to hold something
Example: All trash should be placed in the garbage receptacle.

Word: Reception
Meaning: a party thrown for a special occasion
Example: The menu for the reception included finger foods; punch; and a two-tiered cake.

Word: Receptive
Meaning: ready to receive new ideas or concepts
Example: Every Friday night; Ben hits the club scene in hopes of finding a woman who will be receptive to his charm.

Word: Recess
Meaning: a short break
Example: After a short recess; the judge will return and decide on the case.

Word: Recession
Meaning: a time period in which economic movement is exceptionally slow
Example: During the recession; many individuals found it difficult to pay their bills.

Word: Recessive
Meaning: going in a backwards direction
Example: When my teenager becomes upset; she resorts to the recessive behavior of a small child and starts sucking her thumb.

Word: Recidivism
Meaning: the act of repeatedly committing crimes
Example: In the state; the rate of recidivism has decreased as noted by the fact fewer criminals are returning to prison.

Word: Recidivist
Meaning: one who falls back into prior habits; especially criminal habits; a repeat offender
Example: The recidivist drunk driver knew that the judge would throw the book at him.

Word: Recipe
Meaning: a set of instructions for preparing a dish
Example: Mixing up my grandmother’s famous chocolate cake for the fiftieth; I no longer needed to look at the recipe.

Word: Recipient
Meaning: one who receives; such as one who receives money or goods
Example: Michael is the recipient of a Nobel Peace prize because of the discovery he made in the field of medicine.

Word: Reciprocal
Meaning: shared; felt; or shown by both sides
Example: Unfortunately; I have to tell my best friend his romantic feelings towards me are not reciprocal.

Word: Reciprocate
Meaning: to pay back in return
Example: Because you helped me move; I will definitely reciprocate the favor when you relocate.

Word: Reciprocity 
Meaning: the state of having an agreement in which actions and feelings are mutually exchanged
Example: Because my best friend and I have mutual reciprocity; we always look out for each other.

Word: Recite
Meaning: to repeat something aloud; often before an audience
Example: Alex was expelled from public school when he publicly refused to recite the pledge of allegiance.

Word: Reckless
Meaning: unconcerned to danger or the consequences; careless
Example: The reckless driver did not stop at the red light.

Word: Reckon
Meaning: to anticipate a specific thing will occur
Example: From the loud cheers; it’s obvious the local fans reckon their team will win the game.

Word: Reclaim
Meaning: to retrieve or recover something that was once lost
Example: The invaders fought with the country’s soldiers to reclaim the land that belonged to them so long ago.

Word: Reclamation
Meaning: the act of recovering or retrieving something
Example: When the car owner defaulted on his loan; the bank hired a company to handle the reclamation of his vehicle.

Word: Recline
Meaning: to tilt back or lie down
Example: Cramped airline space made it difficult for the passenger to recline her seat back.

Word: Recliner
Meaning: a lounger or adjustable seat where the back of the chair can move forwards or backwards
Example: If someone got rid of my dad’s favorite recliner in the den; he would never be able to find a place to sit back and relax ever again.

Word: Recluse
Meaning: a person who lives alone and avoids other people; a hermit
Example: Despite her reputation as a recluse; Samantha held regular gatherings in her home to entertain close friends.

Word: Recognition
Meaning: acknowledgement; identification; awareness
Example: The biggest form of gratitude we can extend to the fallen soldiers is our recognition that they gave their lives so that others might live.

Word: Recognizance
Meaning: a bond entered before a court of record or judge
Example: After posting a $20;000 bond; the man was released by the judge on his own recognizance.

Word: Recognize
Meaning: to know and remember (someone or something) because of previous knowledge or experience
Example: Bold and daring; Harriet Tubman helped over 300 slaves escape to freedom through the Underground Railroad.

Word: Recoil 
Meaning: to quickly move back
Example: Seeing the snake made me recoil in fear.

Word: Recollect
Meaning: to remember
Example: Racing frantically throughout the house; the frazzled woman tried to recollect where she had placed her car keys.

Word: Recommence
Meaning: to continue or start again
Example: The construction will recommence after the hurricane leaves the area.

Word: Recommend
Meaning: to suggest or advise
Example: We do not recommend going to the restaurant if you are in a rush since the service is rather slow.

Word: Recommendation
Meaning: advice or suggestion
Example: The governor promised to make a recommendation on the issue within a week but we are still waiting to hear back.

Word: Recompense
Meaning: to reward or repay (someone) for something done or given
Example: There is no recompense I would accept in exchange for the life of my child who was recently killed in a hit-and-run accident.

Word: Reconcile
Meaning: to restore a friendly relationship
Example: After being separated for several months; the couple decided to attempt to reconcile for the emotional wellbeing of their distraught children.

Word: Reconciliation
Meaning: the restoration of good relations between individuals; groups; or territories who had become divided for some reason
Example: If the reconciliation between the two Indian tribes takes place; there will finally be peace in the area.

Word: Recondite
Meaning: not understood or known by many people
Example: Since I do not have a law degree; I find it hard to understand the recondite terms of the contract.

Word: Reconnaissance
Meaning: a survey or observation to gain information
Example: Because the reconnaissance team has discovered bombs up ahead; we will sleep here tonight and allow our explosives’ unit time to detonate the devices.

Meaning: to survey a place or situation for planning purposes
Example: Before the event; we will reconnoiter the venue so we can design the evening’s seating arrangements.

Example: The woman hoped her husband would reconsider his decision to divorce her after a nice weekend in Maine.

Meaning: return to a normal state

Word: Recreant

Example: The recreant police officer was brought up on charges of disobeying orders.

Word: Recreation

Word: Recrimination
Meaning: an accusation made against an accuser

Word: Recrudescence
Meaning: a return of something after a period of inactivity or abatement
Example: I thought my shingles outbreak subsided; but I experienced a recrudescence of the virus.

Example: My business is looking to recruit new personnel to join our team.

Word: Rectangle
Meaning: a quadrilateral made up of four straight lines and four right angles
Example: The pizza maker used dough to form another rectangle and stacked each crust in a quadrilateral pan.

Word: Rectify
Meaning: to correct an issue

Word: Rectilinear

Word: Rectitude
Meaning: behavior that is correct and moral

Word: Recumbent

Meaning: to happen or appear again

Meaning: happening or recurring time after time

Meaning: happening or occurring frequently; with repetition
Example: The woman was happy that her recurring cancer was in remission for a third time.

Word: Recursive
Meaning: pertaining to a rule or procedure that can be applied repeatedly

Word: Recuse

Word: Red herring
Meaning: a believable distraction designed to mislead; often used in mystery novels
Example: Sherlock Holmes warned that if a case was solved too easily; it was likely a red herring that distracted the detectives from the real criminal.

Word: Red Tape
Meaning: excessive adherence to rules and formalities; especially in a public processes

Word: Refraction
Meaning: the bending of a ray when it passes at an angle from one medium into another in which its speed is different
Example: When light rays hit the water in the cup; refraction occurred and made the straw look as if it was bent.

Word: Refractory
Meaning: not responsive or difficult to manage

Word: Regress

Word: Regroup
Meaning: to stop for a short period before continuing doing a difficult task
Example: After another devastating loss; the team decided to regroup and discuss strategies for the next meet.

Word: Regular
Meaning: usual; normal
Example: Unique bills such as the two-dollar bill are not seen as often as regular currency.

Word: Regularity
Meaning: predictability; constancy
Example: The king’s regularity made him an easy assassination target for cutthroats who could predict his whereabouts.

Word: Regularly
Meaning: frequently; often
Example: The movie buff regularly went to shows by herself; enjoying the weekly popcorn almost as much as the films.

Word: Regulate 
Meaning: to determine and oversee policies or rules
Example: Only licensed referees are allowed to regulate professional games.

Word: Regulation
Meaning: control; management
Example: Regulation of the industry has fallen into the inept hands of someone with no management experience.

Word: Regulatory 
Meaning: something that holds you to the rules
Example: Many citizens believe the regulatory laws of the country need changing

Word: Regurgitate
Meaning: to expel swallowed substances out of the mouth or to repeat information despite not understanding it
Example: While I didn’t understand the lecture; I was able to regurgitate the content well enough to create a decent essay.

Word: Rehabilitate
Meaning: to bring back to a healthy or useful state
Example: The image consultant believes she can rehabilitate the reputation of the disgraced politician.

Word: Rehash
Meaning: to go over something again
Example: Lawmakers have decided to rehash the idea of the healthcare bill to come up with a new version that could pass in the senate.

Word: Rehearsal
Meaning: a practice or trial of a play or similar public performance
Example: The actors had one last rehearsal the night before the big play; since they wanted to be absolutely sure that they were prepared for their big performance.

Word: Rehearse
Meaning: to practice or run through
Example: The only times the whole cast is available to rehearse for the finale is at 3:00 pm.

Word: Reify
Meaning: to make something real become more concrete
Example: The attorney tried to reify the statement so it would become more real for the jury.

Word: Reign
Meaning: the timespan during which an individual or government is in power
Example: A few years ago; the queen celebrated her fifty-year reign as the monarch of her country.

Word: Reimburse
Meaning: to give back what has been given; used; or damaged
Example: To make the trip more affordable; my company is going to reimburse me for all expenses.

Word: Reincarnation
Meaning: the act of being reborn in a new form or body
Example: If you accept the idea of reincarnation; you believe a person’s spirit will leave its deceased form and step into a living vessel.

Word: Reindeer
Meaning: a deer with long antlers that lives in the Arctic tundra of Europe; Asia; and North America
Example: The man traveled across the northeast; herding nomadic reindeer in the arctic.

Word: Reinforce
Meaning: to strengthen
Example: Because the students were inattentive; the teachers decided to reinforce the rules by creating harsher consequences for breaking them.

Word: Reinforcement
Meaning: strengthening or boosting of something
Example: Reinforcement of the existing drunk driving laws means tougher fines and sentences for those convicted.

Word: Reins
Meaning: ownership
Example: After I injured my foot; my husband had to take the reins over the household.

Word: Reinstate
Meaning: restore; bring back
Example: My insurance will reinstate my policy once I’m fully paid up.

Word: Reinvigorate
Meaning: to revive or refresh
Example: A free luncheon was held for staff to reinvigorate moral and refresh company unity.

Word: Reiterate
Meaning: to do or say something many times; repeat
Example: Do you have to reiterate everything you say?

Word: Reject 
Meaning: to not consider or accept something
Example: The nerdy boy was shocked when the homecoming queen didn’t reject his party invitation.

Word: Rejoice
Meaning: display or show feelings of great joy
Example: The children will rejoice after they open their holiday gifts.

Word: Rejoinder
Meaning: a clever or sharp response
Example: The boy was chastised when he responded to the teacher with a sarcastic rejoinder.

Word: Rejuvenate 
Meaning: to provide with energy and/or strength
Example: The football players consume sports drinks to rejuvenate themselves during the game.

Word: Relapse
Meaning: to fall backwards; usually in relation to a person’s health
Example: After the relapse; I had to return to my sickbed.

Word: Relatable
Meaning: relevant; applicable
Example: While on dates; women and men should focus on relatable subjects that are relevant to both sexes.

Word: Relate
Meaning: to feel sympathy for or identify with someone
Example: I could not relate to my friend’s misery in breaking up with his girlfriend; as I was still going steady with my first.

Word: Relation
Meaning: the way in which two or more people or things are connected
Example: The detectives were certain there was no relation between the two crimes; but the victims’ families thought they were connected.

Word: Relational
Meaning: relating to the connection between two things
Example: The relational database contained data that was connected to both of the businesses.

Word: Relationship
Meaning: the way in which two people or organizations are connected
Example: The mother and daughter have a very close relationship and can talk about almost anything.

Word: Relative
Meaning: a family member connected
Example: As a close relative of Elvis Presley; the man tried to sell off his cousin’s things for top dollar.

Word: Relatively
Meaning: to a certain degree or in comparison to another thing
Example: Since the building was built two years ago; it is still relatively new.

Word: Relatives
Meaning: one's family members
Example: We are expecting cousins from Florida; so we must clean the house before our relatives arrive.

Word: Relativism
Meaning: a theory that states there are no absolute truths and what is right or wrong is all relative to what you believe
Example: The priest tried to dissolve Paul’s relativism; but couldn’t convince him that there are solid set rules of what is morally okay.

Word: Relax
Meaning: to do things that lessen tension and anxiety and increase feelings of calmness or peace
Example: It is so difficult for the workaholic to relax as he is always in a hurry to snag the next contract.

Word: Relaxation
Meaning: the state of feeling calm or at peace while doing things that lessen tension and anxiety
Example: Sun-drenched relaxation on a secluded beach is the only thing that will take away my work-related stress.

Word: Relaxing
Meaning: doing things that lessen tension and anxiety and increase feelings of calmness or peace
Example: Laying peacefully in his bed with a good book is one of the most relaxing activities of the man’s week.

Word: Relay
Meaning: to pass on something that has been received
Example: Because their communication system was down; the lieutenant had no way to relay information to his officers.

Word: Release
Meaning: to set something free
Example: Although President Trump promised to release his tax returns upon taking office; he has yet to do so.

Word: Relegate
Meaning: to put (someone or something) in a lower or less important position; rank
Example: After the lead actors had been repeatedly late for rehearsal; the director decided to relegate them to the chorus and replace them with their understudies.

Word: Relent
Meaning: to unstiffen or give in
Example: Because my father is very angry; he won’t relent on my harsh punishment.

Word: Relentless
Meaning: persistent; unyielding
Example: The relentless marshal pursued the escaped prisoner for ten years.

Word: Relevance
Meaning: the condition of being related to or relevant
Example: My talkative professor is known for sharing stories that have no relevance to our lessons.

Word: Relevant
Meaning: having significance
Example: Because the job applicant’s experience was not relevant to the position; we did not make him an offer of employment.

Meaning: dependability; consistency
Example: Although it might come with a higher price tag than some other vehicles; the dependable Toyota is known for its reliability.

Meaning: able to be counted on
Example: We fired the babysitter because she wasn’t reliable and often cancelled at the last minute.

Meaning: dependence on help or support
Example: When she resigned; the company dissolved because of its reliance on her leadership.

Word: Reliant
Meaning: needing or depending on someone or something
Example: The ill patient was reliant on his wife for all his medical care.

Meaning: have a fondness for

Word: Relocate
Meaning: to transfer to a different place usually a different city or state
Example: When my best friend’s father was offered a better job on the other side of the country; I knew they would relocate there for his job.

Meaning: unwilling; not wanting to take some action
Example: Though he was reluctant to try the sushi; the man found it to be quite delicious.

Meaning: to depend upon
Example: We have learned not to rely on local weather reports since they are highly inaccurate.

Example: Priceless pieces of history remain buried with the Titanic at the bottom of the Atlantic.

Word: Remainder
Meaning: an amount that is extra
Example: After dividing 3 into 25; the remainder to the math problem is one because 3 goes into 25 eight times with 1 left over.

Word: Remake
Meaning: to create or construct something again
Example: A remake of the famous photograph was so authentic looking that it fooled a local historian into thinking it was the original.

Word: Require
Meaning: to specify something as mandatory

Example: The only thing that I require out of my children is that they do their chores and homework without being told.

Word: Requirement
Meaning: a thing that is deemed mandatory

Word: Requisite
Meaning: something that is considered or viewed as mandatory
Example: Before you can enter the official nursing program; you must complete the requisite coursework.

Word: Requisition
Meaning: a formal request for items needed to complete a task
Example: Because the teacher needed tablets; she completed an online requisition for a box of notebooks.

Word: Requite
Meaning: to give payment for something
Example: Ted chose to requite Carol for the lovely dinner by presenting her with a bouquet of flowers.

Word: Rescind
Meaning: to take back; cancel
Example: I cannot believe Janice’s boyfriend tried to rescind his marriage proposal!

Word: Rescript
Meaning: an official announcement or decree; especially one released by an emperor
Example: In the year 315; the emperor released a rescript encouraging all citizens to prepare for war.

Word: Rescue
Meaning: to save someone or something from a dangerous situation
Example: A swift moving river with flooding all around made it difficult for the search party to rescue the stranded dog.

Meaning: information gathered from a careful and diligent search
Example: Research gathered from the latest study suggests that radiation can actually increase a patient’s risk for cancer in remote areas of the body.

Word: Resemblance 
Meaning: the similarity to something else
Example: You cannot deny the resemblance between the twin brothers.

Word: Resemble 
Meaning: to be similar in appearance to something or someone
Example: Fraternal twins often do not resemble each other at all.

Word: Resembling
Meaning: having features or qualities that look like something else
Example: A plane resembling the one that Amelia Earhart flew is housed in the local aviation museum.

Meaning: to express displeasure for
Example: Rather than resent others for having what you desire; work hard to get what you want.

Word: Residual

Word:  Residue

Word: Risk
Meaning: a probability or chance of danger or hazard
Example: After smoking for 30 years; the risk that the man would acquire lung cancer was high since smoking had blackened his lungs.

Word: Risky
Meaning: full of danger or potential loss
Example: It is risky to go sky diving or bungee jumping because the possibility of death still exists if there were to be a malfunction with your equipment.

Word: Rite
Meaning: a religious practice
Example: The voodoo princess needed the blood of a chicken to perform the rite.

Word: Ritual
Meaning: a standard procedure for a rite or ceremony
Example: The team’s pregame ritual consists of a short prayer and a group hug.

Word: Rival
Meaning: a group or individual who is competing against another group or person
Example: Cathy is certain she will get the promotion because her rival is a new employee with no work experience.

Word: Rivalry
Meaning: competition
Example: The rivalry between the two teams was a longstanding conflict.

Word: Rivet
Meaning: to command the attention of
Example: Apple Inc. knows how to rivet the world’s attention by constantly releasing cutting edge technology.

Word: Riveted
Meaning: engrossed or completely fascinated by something or someone
Example: My eyes were riveted on my favorite actor as soon as he walked into the room.

Word: Rivulet 
Meaning: a tiny stream of water or another liquid
Example: As we walked through the desert; we were only able to get a rivulet of water from a cactus.

Word: Roadblock
Meaning: a barrier or obstacle that stops progress or makes moving forward difficult
Example: The hard worker’s lack of education is a roadblock that stops him from being able to get a job.

Word: Roadway
Meaning: the part of the street where cars drive
Example: The construction company is working on the roadway so that it will be safer for drivers.

Word: Roam
Meaning: to travel aimlessly and without a clear destination
Example: The wayward banished prince had no choice but to roam across the lands; searching for some means of redemption so he could finally return home.

Word: Roar
Meaning: a loud; deep sound; like that which comes from a lion
Example: Letting out a deep roar; the lion’s loud grumble scared away all of the animals in earshot.

Word: Rob
Meaning: to steal something form someone else
Example: The thieves tried to rob their neighbor; but his barking dog scared them away from his home.

Word: Robbery
Meaning: the act of stealing personal property that belongs to another person
Example: During the robbery; the thieves stole all of the sleeping homeowner’s jewelry and guns.

Word: Robot
Meaning: a computerized machine that performs specific functions
Example: The robot looked so much like a human that it was hard to believe that there was a mechanical system underneath its metal frame.

Word: Robust
Meaning: strong and healthy
Example: In order to be a fireman; one needs to be robust because fighting fires is a very difficult job.

Word: Rock
Meaning: to move back and forth
Example: The storm on the sea began to rock the cruise ship back and forth on the water.

Word: Rococo
Meaning: an ornate and fancy style of architecture and decoration that originated in France in the early 18th century
Example: 18th century rococo style was different from traditional English architecture in that it focused on both ornateness and symmetry.

Word: Rogue
Meaning: a person without principles; a dishonest individual
Example: Although the rogue was engaged to be married; he found it easy to flirt with other women.

Word: Roguish
Meaning: dishonest and deceitful; unprincipled and untrustworthy
Example: The roguish thief conned an old lady into giving him access to her life savings.

Word: Roguishly
Meaning: in the manner of a dishonest person or rogue
Example: The cheating husband stared roguishly at every woman in the bar.

Word: Roil
Meaning: to stir someone up; causing them to be angry or agitated
Example: The man’s hateful speech was just enough to roil up the already uneasy crowd.

Word: Roister
Meaning: to engage in noisy; drunken; or riotous behavior
Example: The man began to roister loudly after every touchdown.

Word: Role model
Meaning: a person who others look to as an example or inspiration
Example: Oprah is a role model to many young women who are wanting to be in the entertainment business.

Word: Role
Meaning: an actor or actress’s part in a play or movie
Example: The actress’s role in the horror film was that of a killer nurse who preyed on sick patients.

Word: Rollicking
Meaning: joyous and carefree
Example: Debra’s book is a rollicking good read that will take your mind on a joyride like none other.

Word: Romantic
Meaning: behavior or items that represent a sign of love and/or affection
Example: Sending a romantic letter to his crush was the guy’s latest effort to gain the woman’s heart.

Word: Romanticism
Meaning: a way of thinking or describing things makes them sound more exciting than they really are
Example: Because he is such a realistic person; George doesn’t understand his wife’s romanticism.

Word: Romp
Meaning: to play in an excited and energetic way
Example: Our playful pups romp and frolic around the yard every time we take them outside.

Word: Rookery
Meaning: a gathering or settlement of fowl or other animals
Example: Clustered together on a small island in the ocean barked a rookery of seals making so much noise as the beachgoers passed by on the shore.

Word: Rookie
Meaning: a beginner of a team or job
Example: All of the fans groaned when the rookie of the team came up to bat because they knew he did not have the experience to hit a homerun.

Word: Room for improvement
Meaning: the desire that something or someone will get better
Example: Even though the 8th grader was making a C in math; her mother explained that she could still work harder since there was room for improvement.

Word: Roomer
Meaning: a person who rents a room in another person’s home
Example: The roomer was evicted from her landlord’s house after she refused to pay her part of the utilities.

Word: Roommate
Meaning: a person who occupies the same house or apartment as someone else
Example: My roommate is looking for a new place to live since we constantly argue over the apartment we share.

Word: Roost
Meaning: where animals gather at night to sleep or rest; similar to nesting
Example: The bats roost in the dark corner of an abandoned barn.

Word: Root
Meaning: the basic cause or source of something
Example: The therapist helped her client get to the root of her emotional issues and heal once and for all.

Word: Rope
Meaning: a cord or cable made from natural fiber
Example: The mountain climber attached a rope to the side of the cliff and used the cable to lift himself up.

Word: Rose
Meaning: moved from a lower to a higher position
Example: The student rose from his seat and went to the board to solve the math equation.

Word: Roseate
Meaning: too optimistic; unrealistic
Example: The hopeful girl’s attitude towards life was too roseate for her realistic mother’s tastes.

Word: Roster
Meaning: a list of people's names; often with including the jobs they have been assigned
Example: A new student was added to the teacher’s roster; causing her to be short one desk.

Word: Rostrum
Meaning: a raised platform on which public speakers stand to address an audience; podium
Example: The set designers built a rostrum for the choir members to stand on.

Word: Rot
Meaning: to decay and deteriorate
Example: After several days in the fridge; the perishable products started to rot and smell.

Word: Rotary
Meaning: of motion revolving around a center or axis; rotational
Example: Before the invention of cordless phones; telephones were rotary and in order to make a call; individuals had to press the number; spin it around; to get to the next number.

Word: Rotate
Meaning: to spin around from the center
Example: The Earth does rotate on its axis near the sun so that each part of the Earth gets daylight and night.

Word: Rote
Meaning: without thought; by habit or routine
Example: By singing the alphabet song throughout the day; my daughter is learning her letters by rote.

Word: Rotogravure 
Meaning: a process used for printing in which the paper is rolled through a cylinder that has numerous indentions
Example: One of my grandmother’s most treasured possessions was a portrait of her parents that was printed in rotogravure through a rolling process.

Word: Rotten
Meaning: something that has decayed or deteriorated and is no longer fresh
Example: The rotten fruit sitting in the garden began to stink and attract flies.

Word: Rotund
Meaning: rounded in figure; plump; fat
Example: The jovial man’s rotund belly bounced wildly as he tried to jump rope with the kids.

Word: Rough
Meaning: Having a surface that is irregular not smooth
Example: Rough seas tossed the boat high in the area; causing it to sink.

Word: Roughly
Meaning: violently and forcefully
Example: The seizing plane shook roughly as it flew through an area of extreme turbulence.

Word: Roulette
Meaning: a gambling game in which players bet on which compartment of a revolving wheel that a small ball will land in
Example: As the ball spun around the roulette wheel; the gamblers bet on which number it would land in.

Word: Roundup
Meaning: to gather people or animals together
Example: When it was time to eat lunch; Mrs. Hall had to roundup all of the children and brought them into the school cafeteria.

Word: Rouse
Meaning: to make excited or enraged
Example: The presence of the minority police officers will rouse the racist group even further.

Word: Rout
Meaning: a defeat of an individual; army; group; or team
Example: After the dictator’s rout; the people finally had control of their country.

Word: Route
Meaning: a course or path to take to get somewhere
Example: After digging a 300-foot long trench; the water would travel down this route from the place where I first started digging and dumping it into the river.

Word: Routine
Meaning: activities performed at fixed times for intervals
Example: The teacher explained the classroom routine to students so they would know when it was time to go to lunch.

Word: Row
Meaning: a straight line of something
Example: Each row of corn was planted neatly in the field section by section.

Word: Rowdy
Meaning: wild in a loud or typically obnoxious manner
Example: The rowdy patrons at the bar were loud and especially irritating in their words; making the night less enjoyable for everyone present.

Word: Royalty
Meaning: the status or power of a king or queen or his or her family
Example: Because he is royalty; the queen is in charge of running the entire kingdom from her throne.

Word: RSVP
Meaning: to reply to a social request
Example: Since we had nothing to do next Friday night; we decided to RSVP to the party by calling our friends and letting them know we would be there.

Word: Rub
Meaning: to massage or kneed something by moving one’s hand or an object back and forth
Example: The massage tech moved her hands back and forth to rub out the tension in the man’s back.

Word: Rubbish
Meaning: garbage
Example: After trimming around the good part of the meat; the remainder of it was simply rubbish which I threw away.

Word: Rubble
Meaning: the pieces that remain after a structure is destroyed
Example: The hurricane turned several oceanfront homes into piles of rubble.

Word: Rube
Meaning: an uneducated or uncultured person that is from a rural area
Example: The city boy considers his country cousin an uncultured rube since he knows little about art or classical literature.

Word: Rubicon
Meaning: a boundary that is crossed without being able to return
Example: In my science fiction story; the young man crossed over the Rubicon into another dimension knowing that he will stay there forever.

Word: Rubicund
Meaning: bearing skin that is pink or red in color
Example: The sunburn made his face rubicund in appearance.

Word: Rubric
Meaning: a set of guidelines used to grade an assignment
Example: Sarah really needed a good grade in English in order to pass the course so she looked at the rubric before writing her next essay.

Word: Rucksack
Meaning: a sturdy bag with straps that is worn on the back; usually by hikers or campers
Example: After placing his rucksack on his back; the hiker prepared for his long march up the mountain.

Word: Ruckus
Meaning: a commotion or disturbance
Example: Due to the ruckus in the motel room next door; it woke my whole family up.

Word: Ruction
Meaning: a loud fight or disturbance
Example: The ruction in the cafeteria started when one student threw a lunch tray at another student.

Word: Rudder
Meaning: a part of a ship or vehicle found underneath that is used to turn the vehicle from side to side
Example: When the Titanic was raised into the air; the people in the lifeboats could see the rudder that was underneath the ship.

Word: Ruddy
Meaning: having a wholesome red skin color that generally comes from being outdoors a lot
Example: The pasty teenager got a ruddy tan after spending most of her summer on the soccer field.

Word: Rude
Meaning: to be impolite or disrespectful
Example: Since the child was spoiled throughout his life; his way of speaking to others always included his rude manners.

Word: Rudiment
Meaning: the start or beginning of a concept or plan
Example: My friend’s addiction to my chocolate cupcakes was the rudiment of my successful bakery.

Word: Rudimentary
Meaning: basic; minimal
Example: You need to have at least a rudimentary understanding of technology before you can upload a video on that website.

Word: Rudiments
Meaning: the simple skills or facts needed to begin or learn something
Example: In French 101; students will learn the rudiments of the language.

Word: Rue
Meaning: to experience regret or sorrow
Example: My husband will rue the day he ever cheated on me!

Word: Rueful
Meaning: displaying regret and/or sorrow for one’s actions
Example: The rueful dog looked pitiful after it chewed up its blanket.

Word: Ruefully
Meaning: in a way that expresses regret
Example: The little boys ruefully apologized for breaking the window.

Word: Ruffian
Meaning: a violent individual who more than likely engages in criminal activity
Example: The ruffian became violently angry when the cashier refused to sell him alcohol.

Word: Ruffle
Meaning: to annoy or upset someone or something
Example: “I didn’t mean to ruffle your feathers when I told you that your dress looked ugly;” the teenager told her classmate.

Word: Rug
Meaning: a small fabric mat used to cover part of the floor
Example: “Wipe your feet on the rug;” the mother told her muddy son as he entered the foyer of their house.

Word: Rugged
Meaning: describing a rough uneven area of land
Example: Since there are so many rocks on the island; the terrain is extremely rugged.

Word: Ruin
Meaning: to damage or wreck
Example: Her face reddened when I seemed to ruin the young girl’s dress after accidentally spilling wine on it.

Word: Ruinous
Meaning: causing ruin; destructive
Example: The ruinous policies of our principal caused many of the students to leave the school.

Word: Rule of law
Meaning: a legal principle that law should be the basis of governing a country and not the decisions of individual government officials
Example: Rule of law was established to take away some of the power of kings and make sure that all people were held accountable for their actions.

Word: Rule of thumb
Meaning: a general rule for a particular situation
Example: As a rule of thumb; the teacher doesn’t give extra credit assignments to any students.

Word: Rule
Meaning: a law or regulation that tells what actions should or shouldn’t be done
Example: Our state has put a law in place requiring everyone in a moving car to wear a seatbelt.

Word: Rumble
Meaning: to roar or thunder
Example: A rumble in the sky alerted the washerwoman that a storm was brewing.

Word: Ruminant
Meaning: a type of animal with a four-chambered stomach hat brings up food from its stomach and chews it again
Example: The water buffalo is a ruminant; which means it has a four-chambered stomach.

Word: Ruminate
Meaning: to think deeply about something
Example: Although I knew I cared deeply for Henry; I still had to ruminate on his marriage proposal for a while.

Word: Rumination
Meaning: persistent and repetitive thinking

Word: Rummage
Meaning: to look for something by searching through the contents in an area
Example: The dog will rummage through the garbage for food when it gets hungry.

Word: Rumor
Meaning: gossip or a story that is circulating but not confirmed as true
Example: Like junior high school girls; the gossiping women spread the malicious rumor all around the office tower.

Meaning: a circulating story or tale that is probably not true
Example: Allie was embarrassed by the nasty rumor and swore that she wasn’t dating two boys at the same time.

Word: Rumpus
Meaning: a commotion or noisy disturbance
Example: When the teacher began the class with a pop quiz over the difficult previous lesson; a rumpus among the students erupted throughout the room.

Word: Runaway
Meaning: a person or thing that has run away from a place or situation
Example: The runaway bride flew from the alter after becoming too afraid to marry her fiancé.

Word: Rung
Meaning: struck a bell or an object with a bell
Example: The schoolmaster rung the bell to let everyone know the class was ready to start.

Word: Runoff
Meaning: an extra election or contest used to decide a winner when the first event failed to result in a clear victor
Example: Since the vote was too close to count between two of the candidates; there will be a runoff next month.

Word: Runt
Meaning: the smallest animal of a litter
Example: The runt was the smallest; weakest; and cutest of the entire poodle puppy litter.

Word: Rupture
Meaning: a crack that interrupts peaceable relations
Example: The missile launch is sure to rupture the relationship between the two countries.

Word: Rural
Meaning: areas that are not in an urban environment
Example: My father and his friends often leave the city to go hunt game in rural areas.

Word: Ruse
Meaning: a plan or plot to mislead someone
Example: The security guard knew the girls were going to try and use a distractive ruse in order to shoplift.

Word: Rush hour
Meaning: the time each day when traffic is the heaviest

Word: Rush
Meaning: to move quickly usually due to being late or something urgent
Example: Brad had to rush around the house looking for his uniform when he woke up late for school.

Word: Rust
Meaning: corrosion or oxidation that occurs when certain types of metals get wet
Example: Because the child left his bike in the rain; orange rust covered his metal chain.

Word: Rustic
Meaning: having a country or simple style
Example: The rustic cabin was filled with hand carved furniture.

Word: Rusticate
Meaning: to suspend a student from a university as punishment
Example: Ruling to rusticate the student; the college’s board of directors sent him home for cheating.

Word: Rustle
Meaning: to move (something) with a soft crackling sound
Example: It was a lovely fall day watching the leaves change color and rustle in the wind.

Word: Rustling
Meaning: making light sounds because parts of something are touching each other
Example: Rustling his change together in his hand; the boy thought long and hard about how he wanted to spend his coins.

Word: Rusty 
Meaning: metal object covered in rust
Example: Because the work tools were never stored in a dry place; they became rusty; reddish-brown; and unusable.

Word: Rut
Meaning: a habit or pattern that is hard to change
Example: The prize-winning horse seemed to be a rut this year; having come in dead last during the past three races.

Word: Rutted
Meaning: having deep grooves from wheels driving over something consistently
Example: Rutted sections of the gravel track caused the bicyclist to flip his bike after hitting a dip in the road.

Meaning: a day set aside for religious observation including worship and rest
Example: Many stores in the U.S. are closed on Sunday as the Sabbath day is regarded as a time for rest.

Word: Sacrilege
Meaning: the corruption of something considered holy

Word: Sacrilegious
Meaning: acting in a disrespectful manner towards something or someone considered to be holy

Word: Sacrosanct
Meaning: too important or respected to be criticized or changed
Example: Woodland Hills Cemetery is sacrosanct and cannot be moved to another plot of land because of the large number of deceased soldiers who are buried there.

Word: Saddened
Meaning: very upset and depressed
Example: Saddened by the loss of his mother; the young boy could do nothing other than cry.

Word: Sadder
Meaning: filled with more sorrow or grief in comparison to someone; something else; or another time

Word: Saliva

Word: Salvo

Meaning: to make something holy

Word: Sanctity

Word: Sanctuary

Word: Sane

Word: Sangfroid

Word: Sanguinary

Word: Sanguine

Word: Sanitarium

Word: Sanitary
Meaning: to be clean and hygienic

Word: Sanitation
Meaning: the process of maintaining cleanliness
Example: Unfortunately; the sanitation crew wakes me up every Saturday from a sound sleep to take our trash from the driveway.

Word: Sanity
Meaning: the condition of being mentally sound
Example: Because the children were eager to get their inheritance; they challenged their elderly mother’s sanity in court.

Word: Sans
Meaning: without
Example: My plate was filled with steak and potatoes but sans shrimp since I am allergic to seafood.

Word: Sapid
Meaning: having a strong and savory taste
Example: The sapid steak was more appetizing than any other meat in the café.

Word: Sapience
Meaning: wisdom combined with discernment
Example: The difficult exam required both sapience and logical reasoning skills.

Word: Sapient
Meaning: displaying great knowledge or insight
Example: My sapient mother has helped me deal with a lot of relationship issues.

Word: Sapling
Meaning: a young; skinny tree
Example: A birch sapling grew in the middle of the forest as all the other trees had been chopped down.

Word: Saponaceous
Meaning: pertaining to bubbly and soapy
Example: After I drove into the school’s fundraiser car wash; two students poured a saponaceous substance covering my vehicle with white foam.

Word: Saporous
Meaning: full of flavor; good-tasting
Example: Stirring the saporous stew; the chef couldn’t wait to serve his flavor-packed simmer to his guests.

Word: Sappy
Meaning: Overly sentimental or sweet
Example: Viewers reviewed the overrated television drama as sappy and overly romantic.

Word: Sarcasm
Meaning: a biting remark spoken to convey the opposite meaning
Example: While Jason is amused by his sarcasm; no one else likes his smart remarks.

Word: Sarcastically
Meaning: saying the opposite of what one means in a mocking or joking way
Example: Joking sarcastically; the woman said; “Not all men are annoying; some are dead.”

Word: Sarcophagus
Meaning: a stone coffin from ancient time
Example: Peering into the sarcophagus; the archeologist’s eyes lit up when he saw the intact remains.

Word: Sardonic
Meaning: displaying disrespect in a scornful way
Example: Jim’s sardonic laugh made his parents angry enough to stop paying his cellphone bill.

Word: Sartorial
Meaning: relating to clothing; fashion or dressing
Example: Those with a developed sartorial sense can tell a cheap suit from an expensive one.

Word: Sashay
Meaning: to walk in a way that attracts attention
Example: Several high fashion models sashay down the runway by swinging their arms and their hips to the rhythm of the music.

Word: Sassy
Meaning: feisty and vivacious
Example: With a strong personality; the sassy girl would always answer the teacher’s questions in a funny and upbeat way.

Word: Satchel
Meaning: a bag; often with a strap
Example: Tossing his satchel over his shoulder; the mailman continued down his route.

Word: Sate
Meaning: to satisfy; fill up
Example: My family’s huge get-togethers are filled with so much food; they can sate the hungriest person.

Word: Sated
Meaning: satisfied to the fullest; had more than one could enjoy at one time
Example: Sated from the huge family feast; the stuffed couple retired to their bedroom for a midday nap.

Word: Satellite
Meaning: a man made device used to collect information while orbiting around the Earth; moon; or another planet
Example: A satellite recorded images of the house from way up in the sky and displayed them on the website.

Word: Satiate
Meaning: to satisfy fully
Example: Hopefully this feast I am preparing will satiate your hunger.

Word: Satiety
Meaning: the state of being satisfied or full after consuming food
Example: Sarah reached satiety and felt content after tasting every item on the buffet.

Word: Satire
Meaning: a literary work or device that makes fun of its subject
Example: The latest biography of the president is a satire designed to mock the leader.

Word: Satirical
Meaning: having the qualities of mockery; sarcasm and ridicule
Example: After reading the satirical piece of literature; I didn’t know whether to laugh at the sarcastic remarks or feel angry at it.

Word: Satirize
Meaning: cleverly make fun of something
Example: The poet looked for a way to satirize the boring poem and give it a more humorous appeal.

Word: Satisfaction
Meaning: gaining joy or happiness from an achievement
Example: Nothing brought her more satisfaction that pulling perfectly baked cupcakes from the oven.

Word: Satisfactorily
Meaning: in a way that is adequate and meets expectations
Example: Both students completed their tests satisfactorily and used their high scores to apply for top colleges.

Word: Satisfactory
Meaning: adequate; satisfactorily acceptable
Example: A satisfactory number of contestants must register for the contest in order for it to take place.

Word: Satisfactory
Meaning: acceptable or good enough; meeting all requirements
Example: Though her test scores were satisfactory; the test taker was sad she didn’t make a 100.

Word: Satisfied
Meaning: content and okay with the way things are
Example: The teacher was not satisfied with her student’s work; so she asked him to redo the inferior essay.

Word: Satisfy
Meaning: to be of acceptable standards
Example: In order to graduate from her high school; Lily had to take one more math class to satisfy the graduation requirements.

Word: Satrap
Meaning: a local governor in the ancient Persian Empire
Example: A satrap that served under King Darius were responsible for governing a Persian province.

Word: Saturate
Meaning: to fill something to the utmost capacity
Example: The company hopes to saturate the market with their products so consumers will think of its brand first.

Word: Saturation
Meaning: to fill something or a place so completely that no more can be added
Example: Because of market saturation; it would be silly to build another coffee shop in the area that has ten already.

Word: Saturnine
Meaning: sad and solemn
Example: The dog’s eyes became saturnine whenever he was left at home alone.

Word: Satyr

Word: Savanna
Meaning: a big area of grassy land that has few trees and is generally found in South America and Africa

Meaning: growing or living among rocks
Example: Lichen is a saxicolous organism that arises from algae and thrives on fresh rock.

Meaning: a tiny amount

Word: Scurvy

Word: Seat

Word: Secede

Example: The monks have made the decision to seclude themselves from society as a whole.

Word: Seclusion 
Meaning: the circumstance of being isolated from others
