Word: Second Nature
Meaning: something that is done so often by one person it is normal for them; though typically not normal for everyone
Example: It may be second nature for a soldier to be aware of his surroundings at all times; but many of us regular civilians ignore the environment.

Word: Secondary Source
Meaning: information about a subject or event that is not gained first hand; but later on
Example: The book about 1985 World War II is a secondary source written after the fact.

Word: Secondary
Meaning: coming after something else that is usually more important
Example: Instead of primary red; blue; and yellow; only secondary colors were used on the walls.

Word: Secondhand
Meaning: describes goods that have been passed down after being owned by one other person
Example: Tiff owns a secondhand store where people come to buy used items that are still in good condition.

Word: Secondment
Meaning: a temporary period of time in which an employee is transferred to a new position or organization
Example: The department head was required to find a couple of replacement workers since two permanent employees were on secondment in a different department.

Word: Secrecy
Meaning: the act of keeping something secretly hidden
Example: Judicial secrecy kept the final verdict under wraps until the official press conference.

Word: Secret
Meaning: something that is not to be known or seen by others
Example: Approaching the secret lair; the knight crept quietly as to not awaking the sleeping dragon.

Word: Secretary
Meaning: an office assistant; usually in charge of records
Example: Trying to impress the new secretary caused the office manager to spill coffee all over himself during the briefing.

Word: Secrete
Meaning: to produce and give off
Example: An octopus can secrete ink to ward off prey.

Word: Secretion
Meaning: the process of releasing a substance (from an animal’s body)
Example: When the woman reduced her sugar intake; her body’s insulin secretion lowered as well.

Word: Secretive
Meaning: describes someone who hides their intentions; thoughts; and actions from other people
Example: Secretive sorority sisters whispered in the hallway about new pledges and upcoming events.

Word: Sect
Meaning: a small religious or political group that separates from a larger group. Sects have many of the same beliefs and practices as the original group; but often have some different doctrines
Example: Our family are Mormons; which is a sect of Christianity.

Word: Sectarian
Meaning: adhering strongly to a certain doctrine or sect
Example: The sectarian preacher would not obey any laws that contrasted with his religious beliefs.

Word: Section
Meaning: part or segment of something larger
Example: Each section of the park has a map that shows you which segment of the square you are standing.

Word: Sectional
Meaning: pertaining to a specific section or segment of a larger group
Example: The U.S. Civil War was a sectional dispute; with the country being divided almost in half.

Word: Sectionalism
Meaning: the condition of being focused on a specific section or sphere
Example: It was Southern sectionalism that divided the nation and started the U.S. Civil War.

Word: Sector
Meaning: a specific part of the country; economy; or a company
Example: Our nonprofit sector is in need of a donation drive to boost funds.

Word: Secular 
Meaning: not driven by religious principles
Example: Since Bill was not a spiritual man; he went out of his way to attend a university with a secular focus.

Word: Secure
Meaning: to attach something soundly
Example: Forgetting to secure his bike with the chain; the boy was extremely disappointed to find that it was stolen overnight.

Word: Security
Meaning: a private police force that is put in charge of guarding a person or a place
Example: Armed security was hired to stop robbers from holding up the bank.

Word: Sedan
Meaning: a two or four door vehicle that is made to hold at least four people
Example: Purchasing a used four-door sedan was more reasonable than a buying a jeep since we live in a Seattle.

Word: Sedate
Meaning: to soothe or calm
Example: The shot should sedate the patient and allow him to sleep peacefully.

Word: Sedately
Meaning: calmly; without excessive emotion
Example: Because he was tired; everything he did was done sedately.

Word: Sedative
Meaning: an agent or drug that sedates; having a calming or soothing effect; or inducing sleep
Example: She was so upset at the loss of her husband; that the doctor gave her a sedative to calm her.

Word: Sedentary
Meaning: staying or living in one place
Example: Since the birth of my daughter; I have been enjoying a sedentary existence at home.

Word: Seder
Meaning: a Jewish ritual dinner that marks the beginning of the Jewish holiday of Passover
Example: A rabbi presided over the Seder; beginning with sanctification and a blessing being recited over wine.

Word: Sediment
Meaning: collection of small particles
Example: The apple cider had sediment in the bottom as part of the natural settling process.

Word: Sedition
Meaning: the act of encouraging opposition to authority
Example: The rebels were arrested for sedition when they protested outside of the dictator’s palace.

Word: Seduction
Meaning: the act of enticing or attracting someone
Example: The seduction of the now entranced audience was complete when the lead singer began her soulful crooning.

Word: Seductive
Meaning: tempting; alluring
Example: Seductive plates full of scrumptious shrimp and mouthwatering steak made the guests mouth water.

Word: Sedulous
Meaning: diligent; hard working and persistent
Example: Even though you completely destroy the ant bed time after time; those sedulous ants will continue to go right back to work rebuilding it.

Word: Seed
Meaning: reproductive grains of a plant that are used to grow another plant
Example: Covering the field with netting stopped the birds from eating the seed from the rows.

Word: Seek
Meaning: to look for something
Example: The police continue to seek the murder suspect and are setting up road blocks all over the city.

Word: Seemingly
Meaning: apparently; appearing to be
Example: The seemingly normal couple actually had many hidden secrets.

Word: Seemly
Meaning: appropriate or suitable
Example: The teacher quietly explained that throwing a temper tantrum is not seemly behavior for a fourth grade student.

Word: Seep
Meaning: to slowly flow through a small opening
Example: After hitting the bump in the road; oil began to seep out of my car’s radiator.

Word: Seer
Meaning: a person who claims to be able to see the future
Example: Being a seer; the man’s wife knew that destruction would befall their family the following week.

Word: Seethe 
Meaning: to be in an emotionally frantic condition; usually one rooted in rage or anger
Example: My mother will seethe for weeks if anyone touches her collectible dolls.

Word: Seething
Meaning: intensely hot; boiling with anger.
Example: The cook dashed some salt into the kettle of seething water.

Word: Segment
Meaning: one part of something that is divided into sections
Example: Smokers were the only segment of the society that were targeted by the tax increase.

Word: Segregate 
Meaning: to place apart because of real or perceived differences
Example: Airlines segregate passengers into economy and first class so they can charge higher ticket prices for premium seats.

Word: Segregation
Meaning: setting apart or separation
Example: Feminists complain about segregation between men and women in the workplace.

Word: Segue
Meaning: to fluidly change from one form or situation to another
Example: As the song was coming to an end; it would segue into the next tune without hesitating with silence.

Word: Seismic
Meaning: Caused by or related to an earthquake
Example: Seismic tests were conducted to determine the force of the earthquake.

Word: Seize
Meaning: to gain through forcible means
Example: If you do not watch the dog; he will try and seize the toddler’s lollipop.

Word: Seizure
Meaning: The capturing of something by force
Example: All of the stolen goods taken in the seizure are being stored in the police lock-up.

Word: Selcouth
Meaning: interestingly strange or uncommon
Example: The selcouth documentary was so unique that we couldn’t stop watching it.

Word: Seldom
Meaning: hardly ever
Example: Taking cocaine is seldom credited with improving a person’s intelligence.

Word: Select
Meaning: to choose something
Example: Taylor gets to select tonight’s movie since I chose the last one.

Word: Selection
Meaning: a choice or range of different options
Example: My sister and I had a hard time agreeing on a movie selection; so we ended up renting two different ones.

Word: Selective
Meaning: intentionally choosing some things and not others
Example: Being overly selective in love caused the prudish woman to end up an old maid.

Word: Self-assured
Meaning: showing confidence in one’s self and your own abilities/skills
Example: Confident and self-assured; there is nothing the man thought he couldn’t accomplish.

Word: Self-Concept
Meaning: the image one has of him or herself
Example: Many people have an inaccurate self-concept of themselves; thinking they are not worth as much as they really are.

Word: Self-conscious
Meaning: uncomfortably over-conscious of oneself; worried or nervous by what other people think of you
Example: During her speech; her body language portrayed her as self-conscious.

Word: Self-control
Meaning: the ability to manage one’s own desires and behavior
Example: Sheryl wanted to eat another donut but used self-control instead.

Word: Self-discipline
Meaning: the ability to control one’s emotions and overcome one’s weaknesses
Example: Lacking self-discipline; Kellyanne continued to overeat even though she knew she should stop.

Word: Self-evident
Meaning: obvious and clear; not needing any explanation
Example: The teacher’s instructions were self-evident; so no students asked any questions about the assignment.

Word: Self-explanatory
Meaning: completely understandable; plain and clear
Example: Once the science teacher distributed the worksheet with explicit steps and diagrams on it; the students felt comfortable with the self-explanatory lab.

Word: Self-preservation
Meaning: a natural instinct to protect oneself from harm or death
Example: The hero forgot about self-preservation and jumped into the fire to save the children.

Word: Self-righteous
Meaning: believing that you are better; superior; and more moral than other people
Example: With a self-righteous outlook; the snobby lady looked down on others from her moral high ground.

Word: Selfish
Meaning: to think of oneself
Example: Since he was known to be a selfish man; Darren never paid his child support even though he had plenty of money.

Word: Selfless
Meaning: thinking only of others and not of oneself
Example: A selfless individual often donates a fair sum of their money to charity even though they could use that money for themselves.

Word: Selflessness
Meaning: the act of thinking of others instead of yourself
Example: Her selflessness was displayed when Marta ran onto the tracks of an oncoming train to rescue the helpless toddler.

Word: Selves
Meaning: essential beings or personalities of people
Example: The two children seem to always to find their selves in trouble when they spend too much time together.

Word: Semantics
Meaning: the message or meaning behind a term; phrase; or sentence
Example: When you made a profanity-filled rant about me; the semantics were pretty clear.

Word: Semaphore
Meaning: a mechanical gadget with arm; lights; or flags that is used as a signal
Example: The railroad’s semaphore was broken; causing the car to miss the warning and come over the tracks.

Word: Semblance
Meaning: an outward appearance of something; an assumed appearance
Example: Once my divorce has been finalized; my life can return to a semblance of normality.

Word: Semi-final
Meaning: a game or round just before the final match
Example: The top two teams in each division will play off in a semi-final followed by a final to decide the winners.

Word: Semiannual
Meaning: Happening twice a year
Example: Semiannual fishing tournaments are held in both March and July.

Word: Semicircle
Meaning: a half circle shape
Example: Sitting in a semicircle of mismatched chairs; the arc of kindergarteners waited for their teacher to start the lesson.

Word: Semiconductor
Meaning: a substance that is in between a conductor and an insulator; making it a good medium for controlling electrical current
Example: Silicon is the best known semi-conductor and forms the basis for most integrated circuits.

Word: Seminal
Meaning: important and highly influential on later developments
Example: His award-winning performance was a seminal event for the college.

Word: Seminar
Meaning: a training session usually lasting a few hours
Example: Debbie and Lila only have enough time to attend the seminar on flipping houses instead of the detailed two-day workshop on the same topic.

Word: Seminary
Meaning: a theological school that prepares students to become priests and pastors
Example: The seminary’s academic courses range between traditional theology classes and practical internships.

Word: Semiotics
Meaning: the study of signs and symbols; especially as means of language or communication
Example: The semiotics of his body language revealed he was lying.

Word: Sempiternal
Meaning: everlasting; having no start or no end
Example: The girl’s parents tried to explain that images you put online are sempiternal and can last forever.

Word: Senate
Meaning: a body of government that represents a specific area and reports to the national governing body; usually the group that writes and passes laws
Example: The senate met to discuss implementing new laws against vandalism in the community.

Word: Senectitude
Meaning: old age; the last stage of life
Example: Although she is well into her senectitude; the eighty-year-old woman tries to combat her age with exercise.

Word: Senescence
Meaning: old age
Example: My grandfather said the best part of senescence is watching his grandchildren play.

Word: Senescent
Meaning: growing old; aging
Example: Our senescent dog is almost fifteen years old and is starting to suffer in his old age.

Word: Senile
Meaning: confused or memory loss as a result of old age
Example: I think my Grandma is going senile because she keeps forgetting her daughter's name.

Word: Senility
Meaning: the physical and mental decline connected to old age
Example: Dementia; also known as senility; is seen in elderly individuals whose mental states have started to decline.

Word: Seniority
Meaning: refers to having a high ranking in an organization due to having been there for a longer period of time than others
Example: Employees with seniority were given project preference over those who were new to the company.

Word: Sensation
Meaning: a feeling picked up by one of the five senses
Example: The burning sensation in the man’s eye only seemed to intensify as he flushed it with water.

Word: Sensational
Meaning: astonishing and unbelievable
Example: After working on the woman’s hair for over eight hours; her sensational hairstyle was admired and jealous by many women who saw it.

Word: Sensationalism
Meaning: the presentation of stories by a journalist in a way that excites people emotionally; often at the expense of the truth or honesty
Example: Feeding off the celebrity’s latest scandal; the article was full of sensationalism and exaggerations.

Word: Sense of humor
Meaning: having the skill to notice wit and funniness
Example: With John’s good sense of humor; he was able to make us laugh all night long with his hilarious stories and jokes.

Word: Sense
Meaning: the bodies ability to experience sight; sound; touch; taste; or smell
Example: When Beethoven started composing music his sense of hearing was poor and got worse until he was completely deaf.

Word: Sense
Meaning: to feel or know something
Example: Although she couldn’t see the man hiding in the shadows; June could sense that someone was there.

Word: Sense
Meaning: to detect or recognize
Example: After entering the spooky house; the medium could sense several spirits moving about the room.

Word: Senseless
Meaning: pointless; done for no clear reason
Example: The family is devastated by the senseless murder of their young son who was at the wrong place at the wrong time.

Word: Sensibility
Meaning: one’s ability to feel or be aware of something
Example: President Lincoln’s sensibility about the situation helped him make right decisions regarding the abolition of slavery.

Word: Sensible 
Meaning: having the ability to make sound decisions
Example: If you are sensible; you will not use your credit cards unnecessarily.

Word: Sensitive
Meaning: highly responsive or reactive
Example: The sensitive child demanded much attention from her parents as she was always getting upset over small and trivial things.

Word: Sensitivity
Meaning: the tendency to be easily upset; influenced; changed; or damaged by outside factors
Example: Because of her sensitivity to sunlight; the woman has to protect her fragile skin.

Word: Sensory
Meaning: associated with the senses
Example: The music at the concert was so loud it felt like a sensory attack.

Word: Sensual
Meaning: inducing pleasurable or erotic sensations
Example: The sensual couple’s massage was part of the honeymoon plans.

Word: Sensuous
Meaning: associated with the senses
Example: The hypnotist’s sensuous voice was very relaxing.

Word: Sententious
Meaning: using few words; often in a preachy manner
Example: Because the minister was in a hurry to get home to watch the football game; he gave a sententious sermon about the importance of valuing time.

Word: Sentience
Meaning: awareness and the capacity to sense and feel; particularly pleasure and pain
Example: His sentience failing him in the dark; the man was no longer able to see the corridor or decide which way to turn.

Word: Sentient
Meaning: being able to feel or sense things
Example: Humans are not the only sentient beings; elephants are very emotional and perceptive mammals as well.

Word: Sentiment
Meaning: a thought; view; or attitude; an opinion
Example: The sentiment in his love poem was so touching that it brought tears to her eyes.

Word: Sentimental 
Meaning: having excessive emotions about certain things or people
Example: Jan becomes sentimental whenever she thinks about her deceased parents.

Word: Sentinel 
Meaning: one whose job is to keep watch and protect
Example: The armed sentinel stood outside of the meeting room to make sure no one interrupted the two world leaders.

Word: Sentry
Meaning: a solider whose job is to stand watch and guard against intruders
Example: Standing at the gate; the Iraqi sentry guarded the entrance to the embassy.

Word: Separate
Meaning: to break something up or divide it into parts
Example: The teacher tried to separate the fighting students but couldn’t get the two boys apart.

Word: Separately
Meaning: occurring on an individual basis
Example: The manager interviewed each candidate separately in an effort to determine who would be the best fit for the position.

Word: Separation of Powers
Meaning: the political system in which the power of the government is split into different branches to avoid consolidation
Example: The separation of powers in the American government divides the power of between three different branches.

Word: Separation
Meaning: disconnection or detachment
Example: Separation of Church and State allows the government to run without a connection to a particular religion.

Word: Separatist
Meaning: of the belief in full separation of a group from a larger whole (usually based on race; religion; culture; or ethnicity.)
Example: Separatist forces in the state worked to keep Muslims and Christians in different areas.

Word: Sepsis
Meaning: a dangerous medical condition in which bacteria is present in the blood system
Example: Bacteria in wounds can move into the bloodstream and lead to sepsis if not treated quickly.

Word: Septic
Meaning: infected or contaminated with disease-causing organisms
Example: After the wound became septic; it started oozing pus and turned green.

Word: Septuagenarian
Meaning: a person who is in the seventy to seventy-nine age range
Example: As she approached eighty; the septuagenarian wished that she could stay 79 forever.

Word: Sepulcher
Meaning: a place where one is buried
Example: When my mother dies; she will be placed in the family sepulcher alongside my father.

Word: Sepulchral
Meaning: extremely gloomy
Example: The siren would use her voice to lure sailors to their sepulchral deaths.

Word: Sequacious
Meaning: tending to follow; missing original thoughts or independence
Example: Because the girl was sequacious; she usually went along with the other students and never voiced a conflicting opinion.

Word: Sequel
Meaning: a movie or book that continues a tale
Example: The movie’s sequel picks up where its predecessor ended.

Word: Sequelae
Meaning: aftereffects of a disease or injury
Example: Fully recovered; the man had no aftereffects or sequelae six months after his surgery.

Word: Sequence
Meaning: arrangement of events in a specific order
Example: Switching up the sequence of the recipe steps caused the usually delicious brownies to turn out inedible.

Word: Sequent
Meaning: consecutive or something that is next
Example: When the old woman finished her transaction with the bank teller; the sequent person in line was waved up to the next teller.

Word: Sequential
Meaning: going in order from first to last
Example: Factoring in algebra is sequential and must be completed in order to get the correct answer.

Word: Sequester
Meaning: to be put away for a specific reason
Example: The people with the virus were told to sequester themselves at home to avoid spreading the illness.

Word: Seraph
Meaning: the highest ranking angel in the Bible
Example: Crying “holy; holy; holy”; the angelic seraph flew around the throne of God.

Word: Seraphic
Meaning: angelic and stunning
Example: When the children put on their angel costumes; they looked seraphic.

Word: Sere
Meaning: dry and withered
Example: The sere leaves that covered the ground were once healthy; but are now dry and brittle.

Word: Serenade 
Meaning: to perform a song for a special person
Example: More than anything my mother wants my father to serenade her by singing her favorite song at their anniversary dinner.

Word: Serendipity
Meaning:  the fact of finding pleasant or useful things by chance
Example: The lottery is something one wins by serendipity not by design.

Word: Serene
Meaning: calm; peaceful
Example: The quiet beach made a serene setting for the midnight wedding.

Word: Serenity
Meaning: untroubled; calm; and peaceful
Example: For the outdoorsman; there is no way to experience serenity better than enjoying nature.

Word: Serf
Meaning: a medieval peasant who was forced to work on a manor
Example: The main duty of the serf was to work in the fields; but he was also required to serve at his lord’s house at least three days a week.

Word: Serfdom
Meaning: the state of being a medieval peasant who was forced to work on a manor
Example: Feudal serfdom was similar to later century slavery in that serfs were not allowed to leave the manor in which they lived and worked.

Word: Sergeant
Meaning: a noncommissioned military officer ranking
Example: Moving up in the Air Force; the sergeant was looked to for guidance and mentorship from lower ranking officers.

Word: Serial
Meaning: describing a person who commits an act repetitively
Example: Each of the serial killer’s latest victims were blondes who worked in the downtown district.

Word: Seriatim
Meaning: relating to a series
Example: A seriatim schedule is key to staying organized and completing tasks in an orderly manner.

Word: Series
Meaning: a sequence or chain of people; things; or event
Example: A series of tropical storms rose up in the ocean; causing destruction one after the other.

Word: Serious
Meaning: requiring careful thought and deep consideration
Example: I thought you were joking about how much weight you’ve lost; but now I can see that you were serious.

Word: Sermon
Meaning: a speech or talk on a religious or moral subject
Example: The sermon was about forgiveness.

Word: Serpent
Meaning: a snake
Example: The little girl screamed as the serpent slithered past her leg.

Word: Serpentine

Example: The serpentine lake twists through the region providing the entire area with water.

Word: Serrated
Meaning: having a row of sharp or tooth-like projections
Example: A serrated knife allowed the chef to saw the bread into slices.

Word: Serried
Meaning: rows of people or objects grouped together
Example: Grandfather’s garden is serried in five rows; but it is too overgrown to notice.

Word: Servant
Meaning: a person who performs working responsibilities for others
Example: As a house servant; the slave was responsible for indoor chores rather than field duties.

Word: Serve
Meaning: to work for or provide duties of service for someone else
Example: At the dinner party; the maître D’ appeared to serve the guest their food.

Word: Service
Meaning: work that is done for others as a business or an aid to others
Example: A much-needed service in the area; the teacher decided to pet-sit during the summer.

Word: Serviceable
Meaning: able to be serviced; examined; or repaired
Example: Thankfully; the car’s engine is serviceable and can be repaired instead of being replaced.

Word: Servile
Meaning: submissive; willing to serve others
Example: Some individuals are so servile that other people take advantage of their submissiveness.

Word: Servility
Meaning: eagerness to serve and please others
Example: The janitor’s servility caused her to go above and beyond to make her employer happy.

Word:  Servitude
Meaning: the situation in which one individual controls another person’s life
Example: After paying off his debts; the man was finally able to leave his life of servitude and work for himself.

Word: Sesquipedalian
Meaning: a very long word
Example: The word sesquipedalian defines itself by the amount of syllables it possesses.

Word: Sessile
Meaning: an organism that is immobile and cannot move
Example: The coma patient was sessile as she had not moved since she went into a coma a few years ago after the accident.

Word: Session
Meaning: a period of time designated for a specific purpose
Example: During the brief session; the committee members voted to increase funding for infrastructure.

Word: Set Forth
Meaning: to begin a trip or journey
Example: The heroes would set forth for the lands beyond their realm as soon as they had gathered the supplies they would need.

Word: Set out
Meaning: to begin a journey or start something
Example: The mountain climbers set out to reach the peak but were forced to turn around due to bad weather.

Word: Setback
Meaning: a reversal of progression
Example: The principal lost his job; creating a financial setback for a few months until he found another one.

Word: Settee
Meaning: a seat or bench with a back and armrests
Example: You might not want to purchase a white fabric settee if you have children because the furniture would get dirty and difficult to maintain.

Word: Setting
Meaning: the type of surroundings that something takes place in
Example: The setting of this book is the Industrial era; as the entire story takes place in that time frame and around that area.

Word: Settle
Meaning: to reach a decision or agreement
Example: The sisters couldn’t settle their argument; so their mother took the bike from both of them.

Word: Settlement
Meaning: a formal decision or agreement that settles a dispute
Example: Unable to reach a settlement through the use of a mediator; the separated couple hired new attorneys and prepared for court.

Word: Settler
Meaning: one who settles in a new location
Example: The traveling gypsy decided to become a settler by purchasing a home in Colorado.

Word: Sever
Meaning: to detach by cutting figuratively or literally
Example: National leaders may sever ties with other countries who do not properly negotiate trade with them.

Word: Several
Meaning: a number higher than two yet relatively low in number
Example: During her walk; the girl was able to pick up several lemons to make a gallon of fresh lemonade.

Word: Severance
Meaning: ending of employment
Example: Offering of the displaced workers severance packages is the least the company could do before shutting down operations.

Word: Severe
Meaning: very strong and intense
Example: The severe thunderstorm caused so much damage that recovery would take years.

Word: Severest
Meaning: the worst and harshest when compared to other severe events
Example: Devastating hurricanes pop up all the time; but the last storm was the severest this coast has ever seen.

Word: Severity
Meaning: the state of being strong and intense
Example: The severity of the bomb threat resulted in two students being expelled from school and placed in a juvenile detention center.

Word: Sew
Meaning: to create or repair by making stitches with a needle and thread
Example: The cut on her cheek was so deep that the doctor had to sew a few stitches to mend it together.

Word: Sexism
Meaning: gender discrimination and prejudice
Example: Unfortunately; sexism and other forms of discrimination towards women are still very common in the twenty first century.

Word: Sextet
Meaning: a musical piece written for six people to sing or six instruments to be played
Example:  With two altos; two sopranos and two bass; a sextet was written so everyone in the group could participate in the song.

Word: Sextuple
Meaning: to be or have six portions or people
Example: When the doctor scheduled the unhealthy man to a sextuple heart bypass surgery; the procedure would be dangerous since they would be fixing half a dozen arteries in the man’s chest.

Word: Shabbier

Example: My dress was worn and tattered; but my sister’s gown was even shabbier than mine.

Meaning: in poor condition because of age or wear
Example: The college student’s apartment wasn’t what I would call chic; but it wasn’t shabby either.

Word: Shack
Meaning: a small building that is not put together very well
Example: The one room shack didn’t seem like much; but it was better than sleeping on the streets.

Word: Shackle
Meaning: anything that hinders an individual from doing what he or she wants to do
Example: The comedian referred to his wife as the shackle that prevented him from being with his dream girl.

Word: Shade
Meaning: covering from the sun
Example: Cala lilies love the shade and do not grow well in direct sunlight.

Word: Shadow
Meaning: to follow someone
Example: Since I want to become an attorney like my uncle; I sometimes shadow him at his firm.

Word: Shady
Meaning: sly and suspicious
Example: Every member of the secret round table meeting was either a shady mobster or a crooked politician.

Word: Shaft
Meaning: the long handle of a weapon or tool
Example: The shaft of the club was so rough that it rubbed a blister on the golfer’s hand.

Word: Shake a leg
Meaning: a phrase used to tell someone to start or do something in a hurry
Example: Grandma told the boys to ‘shake a leg’ and encouraged them to get a jumpstart on their chores.

Word: Shake up
Meaning: to greatly startle; shock; or upset someone
Example: The thunderous bell was just what it took to shake up the exhausted student sleeping at his desk.

Word: Shake
Meaning: to tremble or quiver
Example: The woman’s warm natured body would shake every time she felt the cool Chicago air nip and her nose.

Word: Shake
Meaning: to tremble or vibrate
Example: During the earthquake; the ground began to shake and gyrate violently.

Word: Shaken
Meaning: upset and unable to remain calm
Example: After the terrible car wreck; the shaken driver scrambled from the car trembling and in tears.

Word: Shakily
Meaning: unsteadily; wobblingly
Example: Taking the stage and slowly speaking into the mic; the nervous valedictorian shakily addressed his classmates.

Word: Shall
Meaning: an alternative for the word ‘will’ that tells what someone will do
Example: We shall go to breakfast at 8:00; if our cab arrives in time.

Word: Shall
Meaning: will have to; must
Example: The student shall overcome her fear of public speaking and give a speech at her graduation.

Word: Shallow
Meaning: uninterested in things that are serious or deep; seeing only what is noticeable
Example: A beauty pageant is a shallow contest in which people are judged mainly on their looks.

Word: Sham
Meaning: a fake; an imitation that purports to be genuine
Example: When we found out that the engagement was just a sham; we were very upset.

Word: Shaman
Meaning: a tribal figure that serves as a go-between for the physical and spiritual worlds
Example: The shaman of the tribe recommended that the girl not be buried immediately; as he wanted her spirit to have time to leave her body.

Word: Shambled
Meaning: to move with a slow; shuffling; awkward gait
Example: Moving at a slow and steady pace; the man shambled up the stairs to the guest bedroom.

Word: Shambles
Meaning: a state of disorder or chaos
Example: After the fraternity party; the house was in shambles.

Word: Shambolic
Meaning: untidy or muddled

Word: Shame
Meaning: the hot; nauseating feeling that comes with making a bad decision or of fool of yourself
Example: The ballerina’s cheeks flushed with shame when she failed to land her jump during the dance recital.

Word: Shamefacedly
Meaning: in a way that shows a person is awkwardly embarrassed
Example: Once I had calmed down; I shamefacedly removed my ranting Facebook post from my timeline.

Word: Shameful
Meaning: causing disgrace or embarrassment
Example: Dumping 18 billion gallons of highly toxic chemicals into the Ecuadorean Amazon was one of the many shameful things that Chevron has done.

Word: Shameless
Meaning: unacceptable; unabashed
Example: I couldn’t stomach the author’s shameless self-promotion and quickly turned the channel.

Word: Shamrock
Meaning: a three-leaved green plant (clover) that is used as a symbol for Ireland
Example: If you are able to find a shamrock with four leaves instead of three; you will have the luck of the Irish.

Word: Shanghai
Meaning: to abduct or kidnap someone
Example: Pirates were able to shanghai several of our crewman by waiting for them just up shore from the dock.

Word: Shank
Meaning: the leg of a person or animal
Example: The dinner party was a success; with the biggest hit being the exotic bistro-style lamb shank that was served to the guests.

Word: Shanty
Meaning: a shack or hut that is built shabbily
Example: The river’s edge was covered with shanty after shanty; build by gypsies who decided to stick around for a while.

Word: Shard
Meaning: a sharp piece of a broken material such as ceramic; glass; or metal
Example: Grimacing as each shard of glass was pulled from his heel; the boy vowed never to walk barefooted again.

Word: Share
Meaning: a portion or part of something larger that has been divided out amongst people
Example: I became upset after finding out that my brother ate not only his piece of cake but also my share.

Word: Sharecropper
Meaning: a farmer paying rent with crops to the landowner
Example: The sharecropper was planting a field of soybeans.

Word: Shareholder
Meaning: a person who owns a portion of a company
Example: Each shareholder had an equal say in the company’s decision making process.

Word: Shark
Meaning: a person who takes advantage of the misfortune of others for personal gain
Example: The loan shark took advantage of the indebted couple and charged them an outrageous interest rate.

Word: Sharp-tongued
Meaning: harsh or critical in speech
Example: Curt and sharp-tongued; the director was vocally critical of all of the film’s performers.

Word: Sharp
Meaning: having a pointed edge that cuts something easily
Example: The sharp spindle pierced Aurora’s finger causing a drop of blood to seep out of the wound.

Word: Sharp
Meaning: having an edge or point that can cut something
Example: The doctor used the sharp blade of the scalpel to make a deep cut into the patient’s skin.

Word: Sharply
Meaning: intensely; suddenly
Example: Breathing in sharply; the man prepared to ask his girlfriend for her hand in marriage.

Word: Shatter
Meaning: to break something into multiple pieces
Example: The wayward baseball soared towards the window; serving to shatter it when it crashed into the glass.

Word: Skiff
Meaning: a boat small enough for sailing or rowing by one person
Example: The fisherman hoped that the small skiff would be able to hold all of the fish he caught.

Word: Skill
Meaning: a particular ability or expertise
Example: The woman’s writing skill helped her stand out amongst all the other writers in the field.

Word: Skilled
Meaning: having the ability or skill to do something well
Example: Drawing back his bow; the skilled archer prepared to hit his target as he usually did.

Word: Skillful
Meaning: being good at doing a certain task
Example: A skillful painter; the artist was able to capture any image on canvas.

Word: Skim
Meaning: to go over something quickly
Example: Not having enough time to read all of the assigned chapters; I decided to skim through the pages and home for the best.

Word: Skinflint
Meaning: a person who spends as little money as possible
Example: The skinflint refused to spend money; even on things that are necessary.

Word: Skinny
Meaning: extremely thin
Example: Sauntering down the runway; the skinny model appeared rail thin.

Word: Skip
Meaning: to move past one thing in order to do the next
Example: Since I was tired; I decided to skip morning church service and attend the afternoon mass instead.

Word: Skipper
Meaning: the captain of a ship or boat
Example: The skipper of the boat guided the vessel through the storm and made it safely into the port.

Word: Skirmish
Meaning: a skirmish is a brief argument
Example: Several players got into a skirmish following the first play of the game.

Word: Skirt
Meaning: skirt is to go around something instead of directly through it
Example: Do not skirt around the truth about this issue; tell me exactly what happened and when.

Word: Skirting
Meaning: skirting is going around something instead of straight through it
Example: The daughter tried skirting around the truth about how she wrecked her car.

Word: Skittered
Meaning: glided or skipped lightly over the surface of something
Example: As the rain beat down on the highway; a car skittered across the slick road and careened down the hill.

Word: Skittering
Meaning: to glide or skip lightly over the surface of something
Example: After skittering across the surface of the lake; the pebble Gretchen tossed finally sank down to the bottom.

Word: Skittish 
Meaning: scared by even the smallest of things
Example: The skittish horse stood on his hind legs when the rabbit rushed by him.

Word: Skulduggery
Meaning: behavior characterized by tricking someone into something or cheating them through lies or misinformation
Example: The insurance company was investigated by the FBI after claims of skulduggery and cheating customers was reported.

Word: Skulk 
Meaning: to move about in a sneaky way
Example: When the criminal surveyed the jewelry store; he tried to skulk around the neighborhood without being noticed.

Word: Skyrocket
Meaning: to rise very quickly
Example: After one hit movie; the actress’s career seemed to skyrocket to success.

Word: Skyrocket
Meaning: to increase very steeply and quickly
Example: Gas prices usually skyrocket in the summer when lots of people are traveling and fuel is in great demand.

Word: Skyscraper
Meaning: a skyscraper is a tall building with many stories
Example: The contractor is building a new eighty-story residential skyscraper in downtown Houston.

Word: Slab
Meaning: a slab is a large; thick piece of wood; concrete; or stone
Example: The newlyweds went to the home improvement store to narrow down their favorite stone slab for their new home.

Word: Slack
Meaning: slack means loose; not tight
Example: I took my new dress to the seamstress because it needed slack added to the waist.

Word: Slacken
Meaning: slacken means to loosen or lessen
Example: You really need to slacken the seatbelt before you choke yourself.

Word: Slain
Meaning: slain means to kill in a violent manner
Example: Their son; slain in the shooting; began his career as a prison deputy at a local jail.

Word: Slake
Meaning: slake means to quench or satisfy one’s thirst
Example: This electrolyte water should help slake the runners’ thirst during the marathon.

Word: Slam-dunk
Meaning: an expression that means to achieve or accomplish something easily
Example: Although he thought the exam might be hard; the pleasantly surprised student considered it a slam-dunk.

Word: Slam
Meaning: to shut something loudly and with great force
Example: When he is angry; grant likes to slam his bedroom door so hard that the walls shake.

Word: Slammer
Meaning: a slang word for prison or jail
Example: Having spent ten years in the slammer; the ex-con wasn’t afraid of doing hard time for his crimes.

Word: Slander
Meaning: to make a statement that cannot be proven in order to injure someone’s reputation
Example: To win the election for homecoming queen; Jill resorted to slander to ruin her competitors’ reputations.

Word: Slang
Meaning: a form of informal language
Example: The children used slang as a secret language; not realizing their parents had cracked their codes long ago.

Word: Slant
Meaning: a slant is a lean; bend; or slope
Example: The slant of the mountain side made a much easier track for the mountain climbers than the strictly vertical path.

Word: Slapdash
Meaning: done quickly without consideration for accuracy
Example: Because I gave my mother very little notice; she had to plan a slapdash wedding ceremony for me.

Word: Slash
Meaning: a slash is a cut
Example: There was a slash through the doorway that allowed the thief to break into the enormous mansion.

Word: Slate
Meaning: a thin piece of rock that is often used a writing surface
Example: Writing the letter A on the smooth slate; the teacher demonstrated correct form for her students.

Word: Slaughter
Meaning: the killing of a large number of animals or people
Example: Mass slaughter of the Jewish people is one of history’s most senseless tragedies.

Word: Slave
Meaning: a person who is legally owned by another
Example: Slave labor was used in the southern colonies where large amounts of workers were needed to produce crops.

Word: Slavery
Meaning: the practice of owning people as property and requiring them to serve and work for free
Example: Escaping slavery herself; Harriett Tubman helped other slaves make it to freedom in the north.

Word: Slay
Meaning: to kill something in a violent way
Example: Determined to slay the dragon; the knight raised his sword to deliver a strike.

Word: Sleazy
Meaning: shabby; dishonest; immoral
Example: The sleazy salesman would make up anything to sell his product.

Word: Sleet
Meaning: rain and snow mixed
Example: The combination of snow and rain in the form of sleet rained down on the driver’s windshield.

Word: Sleigh
Meaning: a sled drawn by horses; especially reindeer
Example: Reindeer guide Santa Claus’s sleigh as he travels down the snowy mountains to deliver gifts to all the children.

Word: Sleight
Meaning: the manipulation of cunning or skill; particularly as a means of deception
Example: The card cheat used a sleight of hand trick to ensure he won the biggest pot of the night.

Word: Slender
Meaning: slim; lean
Example: Tall and slender; the model’s thin legs were one of her best assets.

Word: Sleuth
Meaning: a detective or investigator who solves mysteries
Example: Making a name for himself as a hard-hitting detective; the sleuth prides himself on being able to solve cold cases.

Word: Slew
Meaning: to have killed something/someone
Example: Zeus slew many of his enemies by literally striking them down with bolts of lightning.

Word: Slice
Meaning: to cut something
Example: Using a butcher knife; the deli worker continued to slice the meat into think pieces.

Word: Slick
Meaning: smooth and glossy (usually of a surface)
Example: Rain caused the road to become wet and many cars to skid across the slick surface.

Word: Slide
Meaning: to scoot or move across something without lifting from the item
Example: The gambler watched the dealer slide the cards across the table and prayed for a good hand.

Word: Slight
Meaning: small or minimal in degree
Example: Although she had a slight fever; the woman still felt well enough to go to work.

Word: Slightly
Meaning: a tiny bit
Example: Jamie loved that her best friend was only slightly bigger in size so that they could share each other’s clothes.

Word: Slim
Meaning: slight or unlikely; slender or thin
Example: After the terrible car accident; the driver only had a slim chance with about a 10% survival rate since he incurred extensive brain damage.

Word: Slimy
Meaning: covered in or having a moist; soft; and slippery surface that is usually considered gross or repulsive
Example: The slimy frog felt cool and moist to the touch when being held by the curious children.

Word: Slip
Meaning: to slide or fall after losing one’s balance or footing
Example: Water pooled on the grocery store floor caused a customer to slip and fall into the puddle.

Word: Slippery Slope
Meaning: a series of events in which one bad decision leads to a cascading number of negative consequences
Example: Taking drugs is a slippery slope; and if you start you may find yourself addicted; which will lead to a life of dependency and pain.

Word: Slipshod 
Meaning: performed too rapidly
Example: Because the roofer performed a slipshod repair job; we had a leak in the kitchen within hours.

Word: Slit
Meaning: a long; narrow cut or opening
Example: The long slit in the woman’s evening gown went from her ankle all the way up to her thigh.

Word: Slog
Meaning: to work extremely hard over a period of time
Example: The road workers were forced to slog it out and continue the construction even through the holidays.

Word: Slogan
Meaning: a short noticeable motto for marketing a product or service
Example: Once people started to remember the catchy slogan of the company’s popular frozen foods; this product’s sales increased.

Word: Slope
Meaning: a surface that has one end that is higher than the other
Example: The children slid their sled from the top of the hill to the bottom; laughing as they zoomed down the slope.

Word: Sloppily
Meaning: messy; dirty; disheveled
Example: He showed up to the interview so sloppily dressed that they turned him away at the door.

Word: Slosh
Meaning: the sound of splashing
Example: The distant slosh of the waves on the sandy beach was a relaxing sound as I attempted to take a nap.

Word: Slothful
Meaning: lazy and idle; wanting to do nothing
Example: Because he was so slothful; the lazy husband laid in bed every day while his wife worked.

Word: Slouch
Meaning: to stand or sit in a stooped; slumped; or drooping way
Example: Too tired of sitting up straight; the exhausted student began to slouch down in his chair.

Word: Slough
Meaning: to cause to shed or purge
Example: The product is designed to slough off dead skin cells.

Word: Slovenly
Meaning: having a dirty appearance
Example: The man’s slovenly dress was a result of him being homeless for a month.

Word: Slug
Meaning: a slimy mollusk that lacks a shell and secretes mucous as it drags its body along the ground
Example: The slug took over the man’s garden; dragging its slimy body over the plants as it munched.

Word: Sluggard
Meaning: a generally lazy and unproductive person
Example: Jonas was your typical sluggard who loved nothing more than laying in his bed and playing video games all day.

Word: Sluggish
Meaning: slow-moving and lacking in energy
Example: After staying up all night; the tired teenager was sluggish when morning arrived.

Word: Slum
Meaning: a poor area of a city where the living conditions are really bad; and the houses are falling apart
Example: Deep in the slum; the people were living in terrible poverty in shacks that were barely standing.

Word: Slumber
Meaning: sleep; rest
Example: The bear awoke from his slumber; stretching and yawning after a month long nap.

Word: Slumgullion
Meaning: a cheap stew that is made of meat and vegetables but is thin like water
Example: The poof family could only afford to make slumgullion and slurped the thin stew at every meal.

Word: Slump
Meaning: to fall suddenly of prices; values; and sales
Example: After a successful mowing season; winter caused service calls to slump.

Word: Slunk
Meaning: crept or snuck
Example: After noticing the light on in the living room; the teenage girl slunk back into the house after her curfew by crawling up the tree and into her bedroom window.

Word: Slur
Meaning: to speak and mumble in a way that the words run into each other and can’t be understood
Example: The drunk patron started to slur and mumbled his words as he stumbled around the bar.

Word: Slush
Meaning: ice or snow that is partially melted
Example: As the snow began to melt; it left behind a thin layer of watery slush.

Word: Sly
Meaning: having or showing cleverness in a cunning or deceitful manner
Example: Instead of a ‘yes’ or ‘no’ answer; he gave a sly smile as a response.

Word: Smack
Meaning: to hit something or someone quickly with an object or the palm
Example: The angry woman tried to smack her husband in the face; but he dodged the blow.

Word: Smackdown
Meaning: the result of a humbling confrontation or defeat
Example: After laying the smackdown on his opponent; the wrestler celebrated his victory by bragging to everyone in the arena.

Word: Small
Meaning: of lesser size than normal
Example: The skinny girl ordered a very small dress to wear to the dance.

Word: Smarting
Meaning: the sensation of feeling a sharp pain or hurt
Example: The football team is still smarting over their loss to their rival but must prepare for the next game.

Word: Smash
Meaning: to break something into several pieces through brute force
Example: If my large dog sees a squirrel outside the window; he may accidentally smash the glass trying to get to it.

Word: Smear
Meaning: to spread a substance messily
Example: The baby used her fingers to smear paint all across the paper.

Word: Smell
Meaning: to detect the odor or scent of something using your nose
Example: Amy stopped to smell the flowers in the garden because she loved the sweet scent.

Word: Smelt
Meaning: to extract metal from ore through a heating process
Example: In order to get useable metal out of iron ore; you must smelt it with extreme heat to get rid of the useless impurities.

Word: Smile
Meaning: to turn the corners of one’s mouth up as a way of showing happiness or kindness
Example: Tim was able to make his baby smile and giggle by tickling him under his chin.

Word: Smirk
Meaning: a confident and often gloating smile
Example: The smirk on his face told her that he was being sneaky.

Word: Smirk
Meaning: a kind of smile that one gives when acting in a smug or conceited way
Example: Because she knew the answer to the difficult math problem; the smug student shot a smirk toward her confused classmates.

Word: Smite
Meaning: to strike something with a firm blow
Example: Bringing his sword down swiftly; the knight tried to smite the enemy before he could get away.

Word: Smithereens
Meaning: very tiny pieces
Example: As the bomb exploded; it blew all of the paper close to it into tiny smithereens.

Word: Smitten
Meaning: in love
Example: The boy was completely smitten with his new babysitter; smiling whenever she was near.

Word: Smog
Meaning: fog or haze that is polluted with smoke
Example: Thick smog filled the air outside of the huge factory; polluting the sky all around the plant.

Word: Smolder
Meaning: to burn with no flame and little smoke; to have strong restrained feelings
Example: After we extinguished the bonfire; it continued to smolder for a long time.

Word: Smooth
Meaning: having a surface texture that is flat and level with no bumps or uneven spots
Example: The smooth highway pavement was very different from the bumpy dirt roads we are used to traveling.

Word: Smoothly
Meaning: in an easy; flowing way
Example: Everything was going smoothly during his driver’s test until he forgot to use his signal to turn and drove through a stop sign.

Word: Smorgasbord
Meaning: a collection containing a variety of things
Example: Fitness experts recommend trying a smorgasbord of cardiovascular activities to discover new hobbies.

Word: Smote
Meaning: to knock down or kill with great force
Example: With one touch; the war god can smote you into ashes.

Word: Smother
Meaning: to restrict or stifle the airflow of someone or something requiring air or oxygen
Example: When the camp leader decided he needed to smother the fire before going to bed; he took his booted foot and stomped it out.

Word: Smudge
Meaning: a smeared mark on the surface of something
Example: Wiping her eyes while crying; the bride tried hard not to leave a smudge from her makeup.

Word: Smug 
Meaning: extremely satisfied with oneself
Example: Gregory was smug after he easily eliminated his rival during the kickboxing competition.

Word: Smuggle
Meaning: to bring something into or out of a place by concealing it
Example: Police were there to arrest the woman trying to smuggle drugs into the airport.

Word: Snag
Meaning: to tear or rip something after catching it on a sharp projection of some kind
Example: I tried not to snag my dress on the rosebush but got it caught anyhow.

Word: Snaggletooth
Meaning: a smile with a tooth or teeth that are crooked and project out past others
Example: Many of the first graders have snaggletooth smiles; so they rarely ever tease each other about their crooked teeth.

Word: Snap
Meaning: to break
Example: Feeling the tree branch snap beneath my weight; I prepared to hit the ground below.

Word: Snapshot

Example: While looking through an old photo album; Chelsea found a snapshot of her grandmother when she was very young.

Word: Snare
Meaning: a trap

Word: Snarky
Meaning: sarcastic or caustic in nature

Word: Snarl
Meaning: growl
Example: Cowering in fear; Pete and Jerry heard the snarl of an unknown animal while walking in the haunted forest.

Word: Snatch
Meaning: to grab something quickly
Example: I tried to snatch up my most precious belongings before I ran to safety; but the smoke from the fire proved too much for my lungs.

Word: Sneak peak
Meaning: an opportunity to see something before it is officially accessible
Example: Our local movie theater will be giving a sneak peak of the new thriller that won’t be officially released until next week.

Word: Sneak
Meaning: to move about in a sly and secretive manner

Meaning: behaving in a sly or secretive manner
Example: The sneaky teenager quietly snuck out her bedroom window while her parents slept.

Word: Sneer
Meaning: to speak or smile in an unkind way
Example: Mark gave Ted a condescending sneer when he walked into the meeting.

Word: Sneeze
Meaning: suddenly and involuntarily blowing air from the nose
Example: As the boy slept; his sneaky sibling tickled his nose with feathers that caused a terrible sneeze!

Word: Snicker
Meaning: to let out a half-suppressed laugh in a disrespectful way
Example: The judges tried not to snicker at the beauty queen’s misguided rant about how world hunger affects Americans the most.

Word: Snide
Meaning: indirectly unkind or insulting
Example: Tina always made snide and cutting remarks when trying to hurt her younger sister’s feelings.

Word: Sniff
Meaning: bringing in air through the nose in order to smell something
Example: Having the carsick woman sniff and taste ginger helped her to feel a little better.

Word: Sniffle
Meaning: to sniff over and over again; usually when sick or crying
Example: Sniffle attacks plagued the ailing twins and caused their noses to run constantly.

Word: Snip
Meaning: to cut something with a small; quick stroke
Example: If you snip the suckers off of the bush too quickly; the blossoms will never appear.

Word: Snipe
Meaning: to shoot at someone from a hiding place
Example: The soldier used his long-range rifle to snipe his targets off of the building.

Word: Sniper
Meaning: one that shoots at someone from a hiding place
Example: The sniper hid with his rifle behind the bushes and laid in wait for his first victim.

Word: Snippet
Meaning: a small piece of something
Example: A snippet of the code was placed on the screen for viewers to copy down.

Word: Snippy
Meaning: used to describe rude behavior or communication that is brief or curt
Example: My lab partner comes off as a bit snippy; but I think it is simply his nature to be brief when working on a project.

Word: Snitch
Meaning: a person who reports the wrongdoing of others to someone in an authority position
Example: Fearing that he would be labeled a snitch; the man made sure that no one at the company knew he was filing a complaint.

Word: Sniveling
Meaning: whining while in tears
Example: The little boy was sniveling as he begged his mother not to punish him.

Word: Snob
Meaning: a person who is condescending and thinks they are better than those around them
Example: The clothing snob constantly bragged about how she never wore the same outfit twice.

Word: Snobbery
Meaning: the attitude or behavior of a person who is condescending and thinks they are better than those around them
Example: With a cold and distant attitude; the rich woman’s snobbery kept her alone and without an close friends.

Word: Snobbish
Meaning: describes a person who looks down on others based on superficial reasons (good looks; wealth)
Example: The snobbish woman is in desperate need for a job but still refuses to work in a fast food restaurant.

Word: Snoop
Meaning: to look around a place secretly; in an attempt to discover things or find out information
Example: Deciding to snoop through her husband’s pockets; the woman looked around to make sure the coast was clear.

Word: Snooty
Meaning: an attitude of disdain or contempt towards others
Example: The most popular girl in school is especially snooty; looking down on almost every other student and acting like they are beneath her.

Word: Snooty
Meaning: rude and arrogant; especially to those from a lower class
Example: The snooty heiress refused to associate with anyone in a lower class than her.

Word: Snore
Meaning: breathing with a grunting or snorting sound while sleeping
Example: Hearing a loud snore coming from the living room; the children ran down the stairs to find grandpa sleeping in the chair.

Word: Snout
Meaning: the mouth and nose of an animal that projects out
Example: Placing its snout up to the ground; the dog sniffed around in search of the suspect.

Word: Snow
Meaning: frozen water vapor that falls down in small flakes
Example: Glistening white snow fell lightly from the clear sky.

Word: Snub
Meaning: the ignoring or brushing off of someone
Example: The waitress insisted that her lack of attentiveness to the table wasn’t a snub; but an accidental oversight.

Word: Snuff
Meaning: to put out a flame
Example: Blowing out the flicker quickly; the boy was able to snuff out the candle and hop into bed before his mother walked into the room.

Word: Snug
Meaning: fitting tightly
Example: The baby’s car seat belt must be snug so that she will be protected in case of an accident.

Word: Snuggery
Meaning: a comfortable place or position
Example: The quaint cabin was a snuggery of privacy and reflection for the writer.

Word: Soar
Meaning: to rise high
Example: Gas prices always seem to soar in the summer when families are getting ready to travel.

Word: Sob
Meaning: to cry in a noisy fashion or a loud gasp made when a person cries
Example: Spoiled toddlers often sob when their parents leave home.

Word: Sober
Meaning: sober means solemn; serious; and sensitive
Example: The interviewee gave a blank sober stare into the camera lens prior to her meeting.

Word: Sober
Meaning: not affected by alcohol or illegal drugs
Example: While in his sober state; the man was much more irritable than when he was drinking.

Word: Sobriety
Meaning: the state of being not using alcohol or illegal drugs
Example: Sobriety tests showed that the driver was inebriated and not able to operate a vehicle.

Word: Sobriquet 
Meaning: a commonly used name for an individual that is usually shorter than the person’s real name
Example: Kitty is the sobriquet Catherine’s friends use when addressing her.

Word: Sociable
Meaning: friendly and willing to spend time and talk with other people
Example: Out of all the party guests; my sociable neighbor was the only one to make conversation with me.

Word: Social construct
Meaning: an ideal or system that exists only because humans have put it in place
Example: The notion that women were incapable of performing some of the same jobs as men was a social construct; with no real basis in reality.

Word: Social Contract
Meaning: the philosophical notion that people surrender their freedoms to a government in exchange for the security and stability they provide
Example: Many philosophers believe the idea of social contract; in which people sacrifice freedom for security in government.

Word: Socialism
Meaning: a system of rule in which the government controls the main industries
Example: Under a system of socialism; the government manages the country’s major businesses.

Word: Socialist
Meaning: an individual who supports the policies of socialism
Example: A socialist is a person who favors the principles of socialism in government.

Word: Socialite
Meaning: a trendsetting young woman who is frequently seen at society’s important events
Example: As a socialite; I normally attend two or three social events each week.

Word: Socialization
Meaning: the process of talking to or doing activities with others
Example: Socialization with humans was difficult for the rescue pup since he had been abused in the past.

Word: Socially
Meaning: relating to society or a social situation with others
Example: Being socially awkward around the opposite sex kept the science teacher from getting a date.

Word: Society
Meaning: an organized group of people
Example: Homeowners contested that the property tax was unfair since it singles out one segment in society.

Word: Socioeconomic
Meaning: socioeconomic is a term used to describe social and economic factors
Example: A student’s socioeconomic status is used to determine who receives free school lunch.

Word: Sociologist
Meaning: a sociologist is a person who studies patterns of social behavior
Example: The sociologist concentrates on patterns of behavior shared by members of a society.

Word: Sociology
Meaning: sociology is the scientific study of social behavior; patterns; and structure
Example: During this course; students will gain a precise understanding of sociology as the scientific study of social structure.

Word: Sociopath
Meaning: a sociopath is a person possessing a personality disorder that involves having very little regard or concern for others
Example: A sociopath does not practice understanding or compassion for others; as he is only concerned with self.

Word: Sockdolager
Meaning: a decisive and often unexpected blow
Example: President Trump’s win came as a surprising sockdolager to both Democrats and Republicans alike.

Word: Socrates
Meaning: a Greek philosopher who known for his thoughts on justice and virtue and is credited for laying the foundation of Western Philosophy
Example: Greek philosopher Socrates rejected the idea that how virtuous a person is depends on age or gender.

Word: Sod
Meaning: the grass covered surface of land
Example: Adding grass seed to a lawn can be a long process; but it is much less expensive than laying sod with grass attached.

Word: Sodden
Meaning: soaked in fluid
Example: My shoes were sodden after I walked a mile in the rain.

Word: Sodium
Meaning: an element that is found naturally in many things and when combined with chloride; results in table salt
Example: Sodium is an element found in the ocean; causing the water’s saltiness.

Word: Soften
Meaning: to make or become less harsh or hard
Example: Curtains soften the sun’s rays; stopping the bright light from shining through in the morning.

Word: Softly
Meaning: in a gentle and quiet way
Example: Rocking the baby softly; the new mother tried to keep from waking her slumbering newborn.

Word: Softness
Meaning: not hard or firm
Example: The pillow’s softness made the man feel as if he was sleeping on a cloud.

Word: Sog
Meaning: a piece of marshland that is soft and wet
Example: The farmer’s boots sank into the squishy mud as he stepped out onto the sog.

Word: Soggy
Meaning: something that is wet and soft
Example: The toddler spilled juice on her bread and refused to eat it because it was soggy.

Word: Soigne
Meaning: polished; well-groomed or dressed
Example: Looking soigne; the debonair gentleman stepped out of the limousine.

Word: Soiree
Meaning: an elegant party or event
Example: Attendees of the soiree are expected to dress in star-studded attire.

Word: Sojourn
Meaning: a brief stay
Example: As a teacher; I am looking forward to my sojourn at the beach during spring break.

Word: Sojourner
Meaning: a person who temporarily resides or stays in a place
Example: A servant and a sojourner stayed at the inn; but only for a short period.

Word: Solace
Meaning: comfort in grief
Example: After Maureen’s husband died; she sought solace in the church.

Word: Solar
Meaning: related to the sun
Example: Solar panels on buildings can reduce the amount of electricity used since they rely on energy from the sun.

Word: Solder
Meaning: a fusible metal (usually tin or lead) that is used to join other metals together
Example: Half of the world’s tin is used for solder; specifically to fuse other metals together.

Word: Soldier
Meaning: a person serving in the military
Example: A soldier serves in the military and bravely puts his life on the line to defend our many freedoms.

Word: Sole
Meaning: only
Example: As the sole heir to her parents’ fortune; the selfish woman felt lucky to be an only child.

Word: Solecism
Meaning: something that isn’t seen as normal or appropriate; a deviation from the norm
Example: According to the fashion critic; the actress committed a major solecism when she wore white after Labor Day.

Word: Solely
Meaning: not involving anyone or anything else; or performed by only one person
Example: Walking the dog is solely Gordon’s responsibility; and if the dog pees on the carpet we all know that he didn’t do his job.

Word: Solemn
Meaning: extremely somber or serious
Example: My mother’s solemn expression told me she was not in a playful mood.

Word: Solemnity
Meaning: the condition of being serious or formal
Example: In due solemnity; the minister pronounced us husband and wife.

Word: Solemnize
Meaning: to perform a marriage ceremony
Example: The reverend agreed to solemnize the marriage as long as the bride and groom agreed to counseling.

Word: Solicit
Meaning: to request or ask for something
Example: Many businesses put up signs to discourage others from going there to solicit.

Word: Solicitation
Meaning: actively seeking out others in order to obtain a favor or money for a specific cause or business
Example: The homeowner’s association called the police on the door to door salesmen because there was a strict policy of no solicitation in the community.

Word: Solicitor
Meaning: a solicitor is a person who tries to obtain business from others usually related to sales
Example: The insurance salesman acted like a solicitor; his demeanor resembling more of a peddler than a professional.

Word: solicitous
Meaning: full of anxiety and concern
Example: I am going to keep a solicitous eye out for criminals in this hard-hit neighborhood.

Word: Solicitude
Meaning: care or concern
Example: His solicitude was shown by the fact that he brought flowers to her every day.

Word: Solid
Meaning: firm; stable
Example: The murderer had a solid alibi that kept him from being charged with the crime.

Word: Solidify
Meaning: to reinforce or make something stronger
Example: The woman’s constant complaining only seemed to solidify her husband’s resolve to skip out on household chores.

Word: Soliloquize
Meaning: to talk to one’s self
Example: Alone on the island; the stir-crazy man had no choice but to soliloquize since there was no one else to talk to.

Word: Soliloquy
Meaning: a monologue that is spoken out loud by an actor or actress
Example: Speaking her internal thoughts as she moved about; the Broadway star gave a stellar soliloquy through her moving speech.

Word: Solipsism
Meaning: the idea that the only thing we can be truly certain of is our own existence

Meaning: deserted; unoccupied

Meaning: a piece of music for one performer

Word: Solstice
Meaning: the time when the sun is furthest north or south of Earth's equator

Word: Solute

Example: The struggling agency is looking for a solution to their low funds problem.

Word: Solvent

Word: Spoils System
Meaning: gaining favor or positions in a system for being well liked or making a monetary contribution
Example: Some argue that President Trump has a spoils system in place because all of the open political offices are given to his unqualified friends.

Word: Spoke
Meaning: uttered words
Example: The love-stricken maiden spoke to the pirate and asked him to take her with him on his next adventure.

Word: Sponsor
Meaning: a supporter or benefactor
Example: The bill’s sponsor traveled around the country asking voters to support the bill as she did.

Word: Spontaneity
Meaning: the act of being impulsive
Example: It was an act of spontaneity for my normally unromantic husband to bring me flowers.

Word: Spontaneous
Meaning: natural without planning or thought
Example: If you have to plan in order to be spontaneous; then you’re not acting naturally upon instinct.

Word: Spooky
Meaning: scary in a strange and frightening way
Example: Because the haunted house is spooky; the children are scared to enter the abandoned building alone.

Word: Spool
Meaning: a device with a cylinder shape that is used to hold tightly wrapped material such as thread or film
Example: Unravelling the fishing line wrapped tightly around the spool; the fisherman prepared to cast his pole.

Word: Spoonerism
Meaning: a phrase in which the speaker accidentally swiches the first sounds of two words
Example: A common spoonerism is saying one has “drain bramage” when meaning “brain damage”.

Word: Spoor
Meaning: the track; trail; droppings or scent of an animal
Example: If the police don’t find and start following the spoor of a child abductor within the first two hours; the chances of getting that child back alive start to diminish greatly.

Word: Sporadic
Meaning: occurring occasionally
Example: Since my father left my mother and me twenty years ago; he has made sporadic appearances in my life.

Word: Spore
Meaning: a one-celled reproductive unit capable of growing into a new lifeform without sexual combination
Example: A single fungus spore can grow into an entirely new mushroom.

Word: Sport
Meaning: to wear or display something distinctive
Example: Bob likes to sport a bright orange t-shirt whenever he goes into town.

Word: Sportive
Meaning: playful and lively
Example: Although the tried to focus on school work; their study sessions always seemed to take a sportive turn.

Word: Sportsmanship
Meaning: fair and good-mannered behavior while participating in a competition of some sort
Example: Exhibiting good sportsmanship and being nice to your fellow players is just as important as winning the game.

Word: Spot
Meaning: to notice or recognize something that wasn’t immediately obvious
Example: Laura managed to spot the airplane among the white of the sky’s clouds.

Word: Spotless
Meaning: completely clean or devoid of blemishes
Example: There’s no such thing as a spotless car because there will always be more dirt somewhere.

Word: Spotlight
Meaning: a lamp with a narrow high power beam for illuminating small areas
Example: A police helicopter is equipped with a spotlight to search for people in the dark.

Word: Spouse
Meaning: an individual who is wed to another person
Example: Once I marry Frank; he will become my spouse.

Word: Sprain
Meaning: to twist the ligaments of a joint badly enough to cause pain and swelling but not tear it
Example: You sprain your ankle if you twist it too far in a direction it’s not supposed to go.

Word: Sprang
Meaning: moved or jumped up suddenly
Example: After crouching behind a dumpster for several minutes; the robber suddenly sprang up and sprinted out of the alley.

Word: Sprawl
Meaning: to develop or spread without limitation
Example: If we don’t manage the bushes; they'll sprawl onto our neighbor’s property.

Word: Sprawled
Meaning: spread out over a wide area with little organization
Example: The ramshackle shanty town was comprised of wooden shacks sprawled about the valley.

Word: Spray
Meaning: to apply liquid in a shower of tiny drops
Example: My dad used the water hose to spray water on the brown grass of his yard.

Word: Spread
Meaning: to extend something’s surface area; height; or width
Example: The chef spread the raw pizza dough from its compact ball to a flat circle on the table.

Word: Spreadsheet
Meaning: a computer document that uses rows and columns to organize data
Example: Microsoft Excel is what most people use to create a spreadsheet on their computer.

Word: Spree
Meaning: a time period in which individual(s) engage in a great deal of something
Example: When the crime spree ended six people were dead.

Word: Sprig
Meaning: a small plant stem with leaves or flowers on it
Example: Please tear a sprig from that bunch of parsley to garnish that plate with before serving it.

Word: Sprightly
Meaning: full of vigor; active
Example: The sprightly old woman walks two miles every day.

Word: Spring
Meaning: to originate from
Example: The car was an idea that was likely to spring from the wagon.

Word: Springboard
Meaning: a sturdy yet flexible board that is jumped on to provide momentum
Example: The diver used a springboard to properly him through the air during the Olympics.

Word: Sprinkle
Meaning: to scatter or pour small amounts of a substance over a surface or object
Example: If your food is bland you should sprinkle some salt or pepper on it.

Word: Sprint
Meaning: to speed over a short area
Example: About fifty feet from the finish line; Gail will probably sprint and soar past the other runners.

Word: Sprite
Meaning: a computer graphic that can be moved on screen and manipulated
Example: The image of character you control in a video game is a sprite.

Word: Sprout 
Meaning: to develop or shoot forth
Example: The young students are eager gardeners ready to see their seeds sprout.

Word: Spruce
Meaning: to make something clean or neat or to be stylish or clean
Example: We are having guests so please spruce up before dinner.

Word: Sprung
Meaning: to have suddenly and rapidly moved or jumped
Example: The tiger sprung from its hiding place to ambush its prey in the jungle.

Word: Spry
Meaning: full of energy and get-up-and-go
Example: The spry old woman runs three miles every morning.

Word: Spume
Meaning: foam of sea water
Example: Beer foam and bubbly coffee froth look similar to ocean spume.

Word: Spun
Meaning: to have turned or twisted quickly
Example: The ballerina spun around on stage with flair and grace.

Example: Although she wasn’t the fastest runner; the jogger’s spunk helped her push towards the finish line.

Word: Spunky
Meaning: courageous and full of spirit
Example: Spunky and full of spirit; the little girl is known for always doing things that others are afraid to do.

Word: Spur of the moment
Meaning: happening impulsively and without planning
Example: Izzy loves spur of the moment vacations and prefers going on impulsive trips over planned ones.

Word: Spur
Meaning: to motivate an individual or group into action
Example: The chance to win a scholarship should spur my daughter into studying for the college admissions test.

Word: Spurious
Meaning: not real or genuine
Example: After receiving a low appraisal on my diamond ring; I realized the suspicious-looking jeweler had sold me a spurious jewel.

Word: Spurn
Meaning: to reject; turn down
Example: Mikey is such a picky eater that he will spurn everything except chicken nuggets and ice cream.

Word: Spurt 
Meaning: an unexpected short surge of activity; development or effort
Example: During a recent growth spurt; Ted grew three inches.

Word: Sputter
Meaning: to spit or speak in an explosive manner
Example: When oil started to sputter from the car; I knew I wasn’t going home anytime soon.

Word: Spy
Meaning: to secretly collect information on competition or adversaries for a particular organization

Example: The old couple was known to squabble about even the most trivial things.

Meaning: a unit of the military that consists of ships; aircraft; or fighters
Example: There are over six hundred soldiers in the army squadron on its way to the base.

Meaning: extremely dirty and unpleasant
Example: The homeless man had no choice but to sleep in squalid conditions.

Word: Squall
Meaning: to cry or wail loudly
Example: I left the house because the squall of our new born baby was grating on my nerves.

Example: Because the homeless man did not have running water; he was used to living in squalor.

Word: Square
Meaning: directly or head-on
Example: My arrow hit the target square in the center.

Example: If you aren’t careful; you will squash the banana and it will be smeared all over your new bag.

Word: Squaw
Meaning: a term for a Native American woman
Example: Since she isn’t a North American Indian woman; she isn’t a squaw.

Word: Squawk
Meaning: to protest or grumble noisily with passion
Example: My rebellious daughter started to squawk when I told her she couldn’t attend her friend’s sleepover.

Example: As the dog bit down on the plastic toy; it would squeak.

Word: Squeamish 
Meaning: easily made nauseous
Example: My husband has a weak stomach and becomes squeamish whenever he sees blood.

Meaning: to firmly press
Example: After adding the sugar; squeeze and crush the lemon in the pitcher for homemade lemonade.

Word: Squint

Example: Since the sun was shining bright into my eyes; I had to squint to see.

Word: Squirm

Word: Squirt

Word: Stale

Word: Stamina

Word: Stammer

Word: Stereotype

Word: Sterile

Word: Sterling

Word: Sternly
Meaning: in a harsh way
Example: After the last chapter’s horrible test grades; the teacher spoke sternly to her class about studying for the next test.

Word: Sternum

Word: Sternutation
Meaning: sneezing as an action; fact; noise

Word: Stertorous
Meaning: breathing in a noisy and heavy way

Word: Stethoscope
Meaning: a medical tool that allows a practitioner to listen to body sounds; usually noises from the lungs and heart
Example: The doctor used his stethoscope to listen to the sick child’s lungs.

Word: Stevedore
Meaning: someone employed to load/unload cargo; specifically for ships
