Word: Stew
Meaning: an assortment of meat; vegetables; and/or stock cooked for a period of time and occasionally placed over a starch
Example: Bouillabaisse is a traditional French stew made with fish; an assortment of seafood; and broth.

Word: Steward
Meaning: an individual who is tasked with protecting another person’s interests
Example: The steward will be along each month to collect the rent from the property owner’s tenants.

Word: Stewardship
Meaning: the management or supervision of something
Example: Under Coach Todd’s stewardship; the team won three national championships.

Word: Stick-in-the-mud
Meaning: a person who is too serious and refuses to take part in anything fun
Example: Quite the prude; Ladonna is a stick-in-the-mud who hates to see anyone having a good time.

Word: Stick
Meaning: a piece of wood; usually thin; that has been crafted for a specific purpose
Example: The eager campers searched high and low through the dense foliage to find the perfect stick to roast marshmallows on.

Word: Stickler
Meaning: an individual who insists a task should be completed in a certain manner
Example: Because the drill sergeant is a stickler for details; he makes us check everything four times.

Word: Stiff
Meaning: physically inflexible or hard
Example: By the time the criminal investigators uncovered the body it was already stiff with rigor mortis.

Word: Stiff
Meaning: rigid and unable to be easily bent or shaped
Example: When she sits down for a long period of time; the elderly woman’s bones become stiff and rigid.

Word: Stifling
Meaning: overpowering to the point of being suffocating or preventing progress
Example: The hot temperature is so stifling it is pulling all the energy out of my body.

Word: Stigma
Meaning: a sign of disgrace
Example: Once upon a time; the stigma of being an unwed mother led many young women to attempt suicide.

Word: Stigmata
Meaning: plural form of stigma; denoting multiple physical or symbolic forms of disgrace which mar an individual’s reputation
Example: In Nathaniel Hawthorne’s The Scarlet Letter; Hester Prynne is forced to wear red ‘A’’s on her clothes as stigmata.

Word: Stile
Meaning: steps or handholds built into something that enables a person to scale a wall or fence
Example: Before ladders were invented; many fortifications had a stile built into the wall that soldiers could climb up to scale the wall.

Word: Still
Meaning: devoid of motion; movement; or sound
Example: The meteorologist warned citizens to be leery of the still trees because the lack of movement was only a natural calm before the fiercest weather struck.

Word: Stilted
Meaning: unnatural; stiff in form or tone
Example: After the divorce; my parents' conversations were stilted and far from natural.

Word: Stimulant
Meaning: an object or person that triggers action or excitement
Example: Because caffeine is a stimulant; it often makes my heart race.

Word: Stimulate
Meaning: to incite interest in something or inspire action
Example: The goal of any great teacher is to craft exciting lessons that will stimulate their students to want to learn.

Word: Stimulus 
Meaning: anything that triggers a change
Example: Because the acid causes the mixture to burn; it is the stimulus in the experiment.

Word: Sting
Meaning: an irritation or pain caused by rubbing against a poisonous substance or receiving a piercing bite from a venomous creature
Example: The sting of the bumblebee felt like wildfire rapidly spreading across his skin.

Word: Stingy
Meaning: lacking generosity or the capacity to spend money
Example: Ebenezer Scrooge valued money more than friendship and because of his stingy habit of hording money and refusing to help those in need; he had no true friends.

Word: Stint
Meaning: a span of time in which a person is occupied with a particular job or in a particular place
Example: After a two-year stint as a Peace Corps volunteer; I returned home and became a teacher.

Word: Stipend
Meaning: a small sum of money that is given to an individual on a regular basis
Example: While serving in the Peace Corps; I was paid a monthly stipend which I used to buy toiletries and other essentials.

Word: Stipulate
Meaning: to insist upon something as a condition of an agreement
Example: The owners may stipulate a huge deposit as a condition of the purchase agreement.

Word: Stipulation
Meaning: a condition that is attached to an arrangement or deal
Example: So that the shoplifting charges would be dismissed; the teenager had to abide by one stipulation which was to refrain from getting in trouble again.

Word: Stir
Meaning: to disturb or provoke

Meaning: to blend elements together with a utensil
Example: On the Homemade Food Cooking Show; the chef stirred the gumbo with a large wooden spoon.

Word: Stitch
Meaning: to join something together by sewing

Word: Stochastic
Meaning: having a probability or random factor

Word: Stoic

Meaning: applied or situated under the skin

Word: Subjugate

Word: Sublimate

Word: Sublimation

Word: Sublime

Word: Subliminal 
Meaning: working beneath the level of awareness

Word: Sublingual
Meaning: pertaining to the bottom of the mouth beneath the tongue

Word: Sublunary

Word: Submarine
Meaning: a ship that travels and functions completely underwater

Word: Submerge
Meaning: to sink out of sight

Word: Submersible
Meaning: to be able to function completely underwater

Word: Submission

Example: After my submission of the monthly reports to my boss; I returned several phone calls.

Word: Submissive
Meaning: yielding; passive
Example: After months of training; our aggressive dog finally became submissive.

Word: Submit
Meaning: to bring forth an item before or to a group of people
Example: Candidates may submit their applications for employment at the Timmonsville Computer Company in order to be considered for any job vacancies.

Word: Submittal
Meaning: the act of someone or something being directed and shown to someone else for a conclusion
Example: When the employee was told to finish his request form; his boss would read his submittal for approval.

Word: Subordinate
Meaning: under the command of those with a greater position or rank
Example: Many women still believe they should be subordinate to their husbands and do everything they are told.

Word: Suborn
Meaning: successfully influence a person to commit a crime or do something wrong
Example: Through her charm and evil ways; a greedy woman might suborn an innocent stranger to kill her husband in order to get her husband’s life insurance money.

Word: Subpoena 
Meaning: a legal document requiring an individual to appear in court
Example: As soon as I received the subpoena; I knew I had to testify during the trial.

Word: Subscribe
Meaning: to pay for an item or amenity
Example: Once I subscribe to the cake of the month club; I will become aware that $200 is worth getting a delicious cake each month.

Word: Subscript
Meaning: a character that is lower than the line of standard text
Example: While scanning over the material in the science textbook; the student was quickly able to point out the name of a chemical compound due to the subscript written in it.

Word: Subscription
Meaning: a payment to acquire or take part in something
Example: For Mother’s Day; I decided to give my mother a magazine subscription for Southern Living since she likes to garden.

Word: Subsequent
Meaning: coming after something in time
Example: Subsequent editions of the book will be based on the early lives of the characters.

Word: Subservient
Meaning: submissive
Example: In the movie; you will play the role of a subservient son who never talks back to his father.

Word: Subset
Meaning: a smaller batch of something that is a part of a bigger batch

Word: Subsided
Meaning: to decrease to a less intense level
Example: After I took the medicine; the pain in my leg subsided.

Word: Subsidence
Meaning: the progression of the ground sinking lower

Meaning: a business owned by a larger company

Meaning: to sustain or live upon
Example: The prisoners of war were forced to subsist upon bread and water.

Word: Subsistence
Meaning: something (food; water; money; etc.) that is required to stay alive

Word: Subsoil
Meaning: the dirt that lies right beneath the top layer of dirt

Word: Substandard

Word: Substantial

Word: Substantive
Meaning: associated with issues of key importance; meaningful
Example: As a busy employee; Phil is tired of attending monthly meetings that are not substantive to his work.

Word: Substation
Meaning: a passthrough where electricity strength is changed before it goes to homes/businesses

Word: Substrate

Example: Planting the small saplings in the substrate of the ground allowed these plants to take in nutrients to grow bigger.

Word: Substructure

Word: Surreptitious
Meaning: kept secret and marked by quiet and caution
Example: The dog has his surreptitious ways of stealing table scraps behind my back.

Word: Surrogate
Meaning: a substitute (usually of a person; position or role)
Example: Because the couple was unable to conceive; they decided to have a surrogate carry their child.

Word: Surround
Meaning: to be completely around someone or something
Example: The troops had to surround the enemy from all sides to ensure that they didn’t escape.

Word: Surroundings
Meaning: the things and conditions around a person or thing
Example: As she walked to her car in the parking garage; the woman checked her surroundings for danger.

Word: Surveillance
Meaning: close observation of an individual or group; person or persons under suspicion
Example: The FBI surveillance van cruised through the neighborhood where several burglaries had taken place.

Word: Survey
Meaning: to carefully observe someone or something to appraise its worth
Example: The cartographer had to survey the new land to see if it was suitable for a settlement.

Word: Surveyor
Meaning: a person that analyzes a geographical area
Example: The surveyor was tasked with finding suitable land for a new settlement.

Word: Survival
Meaning: the state or act of continuing to live or exist despite difficult or dangerous circumstances
Example: The best way to achieve survival in the wilderness is to come prepared for danger and adversity.

Word: Survive
Meaning: to continue to live in the face of adversity or danger
Example: A cockroach can survive the radiation of a nuclear blast.

Word: Survivor
Meaning: a person that remains alive after an event that killed other people
Example: Corporal Jenkins was a survivor of the ambush that killed some of his unit.

Word: Susceptible
Meaning: vulnerable to an influence
Example: Since the dog lives outside; he is highly susceptible to parasites that strive in the outdoors.

Word: Suspect
Meaning: to believe something without having proof of its existence
Example: I suspect that my keys are in my car; but I haven’t checked so I don’t know.

Word: Suspend
Meaning: to temporarily stop or prevent from occurring
Example: The doctor had to suspend the treatment until he knew more about the injury.

Word: Suspend
Meaning: to hang something from somewhere
Example: It was difficult to suspend the heavy chandelier from the tall ceiling; but a ladder made it possible.

Word: Suspended
Meaning: hung in the air by something
Example: We suspended the box in the air by attaching a rope to it and pulling it over a branch.

Word: Suspense
Meaning: a feeling of anticipation or anxiety over what may happen
Example: Movies use cliffhangers to make sure their audience feels suspense over what is going to happen next.

Word: Suspension
Meaning: the act of forcing someone or something to remain in the same state
Example: The balloon was held in suspension at the top of the room because there was nowhere else for it to go.

Word: Suspicion
Meaning: a feeling that something that may be true or possible
Example: I have a suspicion that school will be cancelled if it snows tomorrow.

Word: Suspicious
Meaning: having a cautious distrust of someone or something
Example: The cop was suspicious of the man in the hood and the mask walking into the bank.

Word: Sustain
Meaning: to keep up or support
Example: In order to sustain food supplies throughout the harsh winter; the settlers had to reduce the size of food portions.

Word: Sustainability
Meaning: the ability to be maintained at a specific level or state
Example: Wind turbines have a high level of sustainability because wind is an endless resource.

Word: Sustenance
Meaning: that which gives nourishment or support
Example: As humans; we get our sustenance from the food we eat.

Word: Susurrant
Meaning: a soft or quiet sound
Example: The tiny mouse made a susurrant noise as it scampered across the floor.

Word: Susurration
Meaning: a whispering sound
Example: The audio recording file was ruined because of the susurration of the producer’s hushed voice in the background.

Word: Suture
Meaning: to stitch up an open wound
Example: We had to suture the large gash in my arm.

Word: Svelte
Meaning: slenderly graceful
Example: The svelte model made her way across the runway with a graceful flare.

Word: Svengali
Meaning: a svengali is a person who exercises a controlling influence on others
Example: The head of the company was a svengali; he controlled all of his employees.

Word: Swaddle
Meaning: to wrap something up tightly
Example: Nurses swaddle the newborn babies tightly in blankets to calm them down.

Word: Swagger
Meaning: a confident and usually arrogant attitude
Example: Someone who is full of themselves walks around with swagger.

Word: Swaggering
Meaning: acting with arrogant confidence in oneself
Example: The man was swaggering his way through the crowd; irritating everyone.

Word: Swallow
Meaning: to allow something to pass down the throat
Example: You must swallow your food to consume it.

Word: Swamp
Meaning: to overwhelm with something
Example: I wish the teacher wouldn’t swamp us with so much homework.

Word: Swank
Meaning: showy and posh
Example: She was showing off her new diamond engagement ring by flaunting it with arrogant swank.

Word: Swanky
Meaning: something that is stylishly expensive
Example: This car is really swanky; but even though it is pretty stylish I cannot afford it because of how luxurious it is.

Word: Swap
Meaning: to exchange one thing for another
Example: You swap money for products in a store.

Word: Swarm
Meaning: a large group of flying insects
Example: You should run if you encounter a swarm of mosquitos.

Word: Swarthy
Meaning: having a dark skin color or complexion
Example: After the man had been stranded on the deserted island for nearly a year; his skin had become quite swarthy as a result of the sun’s heat.

Word: Swath
Meaning: a wide area of something
Example: A forest is just one big swath of trees.

Word: Swathe
Meaning: a bandage; a band
Example: Wrapping the swathe around the wound; the good samaritan hoped that the bandage would hold until helped arrived.

Word: Sway
Meaning: control or dominion
Example: Africa was under Britain’s sway for several decades during colonial times.

Word: Swear
Meaning: to make a solemn promise to do something or confirming that something is true
Example: I swear that I will clean my room tomorrow.

Word: Sweat
Meaning: to excrete drops of a salty liquid from the skin; especially when hot or when working strenuously
Example: After working for hours in the noon-day sun; the farmer began to sweat huge puddles from his armpits.

Word: Sweatshop
Meaning: a factory in which manual laborers work for long hours in poor conditions for very low wages
Example: The workers in the sweatshop were paid less than minimum wage for their hard work.

Word: Sweep
Meaning: to clean an area by brushing away litter and dust
Example: I have to sweep the front porch because it is so dusty.

Word: Sweeping
Meaning: something that has a wide area of effect or range
Example: The missile blanketed the entire area in a sweeping blast of flame.

Word: Sweet Tooth
Meaning: used to refer to a great love for sweet food
Example: Someone with a sweet tooth tends to have an insatiable desire for sugar; honey; and all other manner of sweet things.

Word: Sweet
Meaning: generally pleasing or nice
Example: The little girl was very sweet to me; asking if I wanted one of her cookies.

Word: Sweeten
Meaning: to make something sweeter in taste
Example: The tea didn’t taste very good; so I used some sugar to sweeten it.

Word: Swell
Meaning: to become larger in size
Example: The size of the crowd began to swell as more people began to show up.

Word: Swelter
Meaning: to suffer terribly from intense heat
Example: The beachgoers began to swelter in the afternoon sun.

Word: Swept
Meaning: to have been brushed or carried away
Example: The dirt on the floor was swept away by my broom.

Word: Swerve
Meaning: to change direction very suddenly
Example: To avoid hitting the squirrel on the road; the car had to swerve to the left.

Word: Swift
Meaning: fast or rapid
Example: The roadrunner is a swift animal capable of running very fast.

Word: Swiftly
Meaning: quickly or promptly
Example: The car moved swiftly down the road at eighty miles an hour.

Word: Swiftness
Meaning: the quality or characteristic of speed
Example: A Cheetah has great swiftness for hunting its prey.

Word: Swill
Meaning: a large mouthful of drink
Example: The thirsty man filled his entire mouth with a swill of water and guzzled it down as quickly as he could.

Word: Swim
Meaning: to propel one’s body through water
Example: You use your arms and legs to swim in the pool.

Word: Swimmingly
Meaning: in a manner that is smooth and satisfying
Example: The track meet went swimmingly; as we won a gold medal.

Word: Swindle
Meaning: to deceive someone in order to take wealth from them
Example: The con man makes his money with scams that swindle people out of their money.

Word: Swindler
Meaning: a person who swindles; cheats or defrauds
Example: Considered a swindler for conning people out of their money; the man walked around town in shame.

Word: Swing
Meaning: to move by grasping a support from below and using it to jump
Example: You can use a monkey bar on the playground to swing around if you want to.

Word: Swirl
Meaning: to move about in a spiral pattern
Example: A tornado moves across the Earth in a swirl that is centered on the eye of the storm.

Word: Swish
Meaning: a hissing or rustling sound
Example: I could hear the swish of a paper bag as the wind blew it past me.

Word: Switch
Meaning: to change the direction or position of
Example: I had to switch the vase on the table out for a prettier one.

Word: Swivel
Meaning: to turn around on a point or axis
Example: Your head can swivel around on your neck.

Word: Swollen
Meaning: enlarged; puffed up
Example: Putting ice on her swollen ankle; the woman hoped the pack would help the swelling go down.

Word: Swoon
Meaning: to faint or lose consciousness from extreme emotion
Example: Aaron would not consider going to medical school; for fear that he would swoon at the sight of blood.

Word: Swoop
Meaning: to rapidly dive downwards in the air
Example: The falcon likes to swoop down on its prey from above to catch them off guard.

Word: Sword
Meaning: a weapon with a long metal blade protruding from a hilt and a handguard
Example: Knights in medieval times often carried a sword as both a sign of prestige and a weapon.

Word: Sybarite
Meaning: one who is self-indulgent and addicted to luxury
Example: The sybarite looked forward to their day at the spa.

Word: Sybaritic
Meaning: indulgent; luxurious
Example: The sybaritic prince spared no expense; always splurging on luxurious things like camels and jewels.

Word: Sycophant
Meaning: a person who tries to get what they want by excessively praising or complimenting someone in order to make them feel attractive or important
Example: Because she always kisses up to the teacher; Janice is considered the sycophant in first period.

Word: Sycophantic
Meaning: behaving in a flattering way that is insincere and meant just to gain advantage
Example: The sycophantic reporter tried flattering the speaker just so he could get the first dibs on the interview.

Word: Syllable
Meaning: a unit of pronunciation with one vowel sound forming a part of a word or the whole word
Example: If you don’t know how to say a word properly; try to say it syllable by syllable.

Word: Syllabus
Meaning: an outline of topics and important dates in an educational course
Example: The professor handed out a syllabus to the class so he wouldn’t have to explain all of the lessons for the year to them.

Word: Syllogism
Meaning: a line of reasoning in which a conclusion is drawn from two related premises
Example: One example of incorrect syllogism is the notion that all animals have four legs because dogs are animals and all dogs have four legs.

Word: Sylvan
Meaning: associated with a large number of trees or woods
Example: We enjoy visiting the park because it is filled with trees and is the most sylvan area in our crowded city.

Word: Symbiosis
Meaning: relationship of mutual benefit
Example:  The trade that peacefully occurs between the two warring tribes is viewed as an example of symbiosis.

Word: Symbiotic
Meaning: having a relationship where two organisms live in close association and benefit from one another
Example: A relationship where both people benefit from each other is a symbiotic one.

Word: Symbol
Meaning: a mark; character; or other notion used to represent something else
Example: On the periodic table; the letters Fe serve as a symbol for the element Iron.

Word: Symbolic
Meaning: an object whose meaning is often deeper or different than it appears
Example: The life cycle of the mythical phoenix is symbolic of rebirth and reincarnation.

Word: Symbolism
Meaning: the use of symbols to represent ideas
Example: Black objects are used as symbolism in many movies to represent evil or death.

Word: Symbolize
Meaning: an object used to represent a greater or hidden meaning
Example: Often in literature; colors are used to symbolize emotions.

Word: Symmetry
Meaning: balanced amounts of features to the main body or shape
Example: The perfect symmetry of the body parts increased the sculpture's realistic appearance.

Word: Sympathetic
Meaning: showing care and compassion toward others
Example: Teresa was sympathetic and kind to everyone she met along her journey.

Word: Sympathize
Meaning: to share in feeling with another person; usually in a positive light
Example: It’s difficult to sympathize with a negative people who will do nothing to help themselves.

Word: Sympathy
Meaning: shared feeling or kinship in feeling after an upsetting or particularly emotional event
Example: After her grandmother died; Abigail’s friends expressed their deepest sympathy for her loss in the form of flowers; cards; and comfort food.

Word: Symptom
Meaning: a sign of a virus; sickness or ailment
Example: Since Sally only had one symptom of coughing; her mother decided she probably was just under the weather and really not very sick.

Word: Symptom
Meaning: a physical or mental sign that disease or illness exists in the body
Example: Because it is a symptom of diabetes; the doctor is taking his patient’s high blood sugar very seriously.

Word: Symptomatic
Meaning: showing symptoms
Example: Although he managed a C; his slipping grades were symptomatic of a much bigger problem.

Word: Symptomatology
Meaning: the combined symptoms of a particular disease
Example: It is very easy to identify a cold by its symptomatology; which includes coughing and a sore throat.

Word: Synagogue
Meaning: a place where Jews meet for worship
Example: Not wanting to be late for prayer; the family rushed into the crowded synagogue.

Word: Synchronize
Meaning: to cause two or more events to happen at exactly the same time; at the same rate; or in a time-coordinated way
Example: The bungee jumpers decided to synchronize their descent; so that they would fall at the same time.

Word: Synchronous
Meaning: events occurring at the same time or pace
Example: The cyclists' wheels were in such perfect synchronous motion with each other that they crossed the finish line at the same time.

Word: Syncopate
Meaning: stressing beats that forms a contrast to the overall sound
Example: The horrible beatboxer hummed against his wrist to syncopate a bass drum; but failed to find a natural rhythm.

Word: Syncope
Meaning: loss of consciousness when blood flow is unable to reach the brain to faint
Example: The swimmer held her breath for too long and experienced syncope.

Word: Syndetic
Meaning: related to or using conjunctions
Example: Because we like to get our point across as quickly as possible; we often use syndetic words like ‘can’t’ to speak faster.

Word: Syndicate
Meaning: a group that comes together to buy; trade; invest; or negotiate; usually with large amounts of capital or goods on the line
Example: Members of the sports syndicate crafted an elaborate system to keep track of the millions of dollars placed in bets on major NFL games.

Word: Syndrome
Meaning: group of actions or behaviors that are typical to a particular illness or disease
Example: After being held captive for several months; the prisoner started to exhibit symptoms of Stockholm syndrome like developing positive emotions towards his captor and paranoia that rescuers are the enemy.

Word: Synecdoche
Meaning: a figure of speech in which a part is used for the whole or the whole for a part; the special for the general or the general for the special; as in ten sail for ten ships or a Croesus for a rich man
Example: A synecdoche is often used in classical literature as a form of symbolism that references a group by using a single noun.

Word: Synergism
Meaning: elements that when combined make them more potent or increase effectiveness
Example: Doctors employ the concept of synergism when prescribing new medications that they believe would be more effective when used in tandem.

Word: Synergistic
Meaning: helpful to others on the grounds that helping them will also help oneself; particularly with teammates
Example: I prefer to play a synergistic role in the teams I play on; offering assistance to my teammates but not necessarily taking the lead.

Word: Synergy
Meaning: The combining of different groups; processes; objects; or people to increase success.
Example: In therapy; I am working on organization so all aspects of my life will work in synergy together.

Word: Synesthesia
Meaning: gaining an additional sense during the act of another sense
Example: Ben had a particular form of synesthesia where whenever he heard a bell; he smelled strawberries.

Word: Synod
Meaning: a council
Example: The synod of scholars met to discuss important developments in academia.

Word: Synonym
Meaning: a word that means the same thing as a different word in the same language
Example: A word is a synonym for another word if it has the same meaning as that other word; or at least a very similar one.

Word: Synonymous 
Meaning: being alike in meaning
Example: In the old days; being a woman was synonymous with being a housewife because women were not expected to work outside of the home.

Word: Synopsis 
Meaning: a short summary of a longer work
Example: My teacher said my five-page digest of the book was entirely too long to be a synopsis.

Word: Syntax 
Meaning: the order in which phrases; words; or coding symbols and terms are placed to produce high quality sentences or commands
Example: Because I do not like the way my sentences read; I am going to ask my teacher to tutor me on syntax.

Word: Synthesis
Meaning: the creation of an object or entity by mixing simpler materials or substances
Example: Proteins are essential to the synthesis of muscles and body tissue.

Word: Synthetic
Meaning: not pure; counterfeit
Example: April bought a pair of synthetic leather pants that looked nothing like real leather.

Word: Syringe
Meaning: a device used to suck up or inject liquid
Example: A turkey baster is a form of syringe that families use on Thanksgiving to suck up the juice from the turkey and make homemade gravy.

Word: System
Meaning: a set of different small parts that work together to create a larger complex whole
Example: A country’s transportation system is made up of many small parts; including roads; ports; railways; and airports.

Word: Systematic
Meaning: carried out using a planned; ordered procedure
Example: Wilma teaches algebra in a systematic and thorough way.

Word: Systemic
Meaning: relating to parts that combine forming an entity affecting an entire group or entity
Example: Systemic violence in war-torn countries not only affects the region being targeted; but all of the outlying regions as well.

Word: Syzygy
Meaning: when celestial objects align
Example: Religious fanatics believe that the world will end when syzygy of the sun; moon; and Earth occurs in combination with a solar eclipse.

Word: Table
Meaning: a piece of furniture with a flat top and four legs that are used for eating; writing; or working
Example: The child placed his plate on the top of the table and sat down in a chair to eat his meal.

Word: Tableau
Meaning: a dramatic image; sometimes a reenactment of a historical scene
Example: The tableau of the troops crossing the river is one of the most famous paintings in the world.

Word: Taboo
Meaning: considered inappropriate because of societal beliefs or emotional dislikes
Example: In the old days; even the idea of a homosexual relationship was viewed as a taboo arrangement.

Word: Tachycardia
Meaning: a term used to describe abnormally fast heart rates
Example: The doctor told him he had Tachycardia because his heart was beating much faster than most do; and he would need to be careful about getting too excited.

Word: Tacit
Meaning: implied but not directly stated
Example: Although no words were spoken; our nods represented our tacit agreement to a cease fire.

Word: Taciturn
Meaning: reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little
Example: My shy brother is taciturn and rarely speaks in public.

Word: Tack
Meaning: a small; sharp nail that is used to pin things up
Example: Using a tack; the office worker was able to pin the memo to the message board hanging beside her desk.

Word: Tackle
Meaning: to determinedly attempt to handle a problem or obstacle
Example: My mother is the kind of person to tackle any problem with everything she has; regardless of how difficult or troublesome the problem is.

Word: Tact
Meaning: the ability to say or do things in such a way that doesn’t upset or offend anyone
Example: Because he lacks discretion and tact; most of the things my brother says comes off as offensive.

Word: Tactful
Meaning: concerned about distressing other individuals
Example: The doctor was tactful as he told the woman about her incurable illness.

Word: Tactic
Meaning: action to achieve some end
Example: In order to achieve the win; the coach showed his team the best tactic to perform.

Word: Tactical
Meaning: employing a series of skills or maneuvers to gain advantage over an enemy
Example: Soldiers spend months on tactical training where they learn the best skills and maneuvers to gain an advantage over the enemy in battle.

Word: Tactile
Meaning: in regards to the sense of touch
Example: The child’s tactile response was to move her hand away from the hot stove.

Word: Tactless
Meaning: without tact; not sensitive
Example: My tactless sister made a joke about running over a dog even though she knew my son’s pet had recently died.

Word: Taiga
Meaning: large region of North America; Eurasia; and parts of Russia with subarctic climate and expansive forests
Example: The great Russian taiga is known for its abundance of snow and hulking pine trees.

Word: Tail
Meaning: a typically flexible appendage that extends from hindmost part of an animal
Example: The skunk blended in so well with the pitch black night that the campers would have stepped on it if not for the bright; white stripe on its tail.

Word: Tailor
Meaning: an individual who is employed to make clothing alterations
Example: The tailor knelt by the bride’s feet and hemmed her dress to the perfect length.

Word: Tailpiece
Meaning: a part added to the end of something such as a piece of writing or a musical instrument
Example: A tailpiece was added to the mandolin as a way to anchor the string to the end of the instrument.

Word: Tailspin
Meaning: taking a decline or becoming uncontrollable
Example: Once someone got a fever hundreds of years ago; it could take a tailspin to death due to lack of medicine.

Word: Taint
Meaning: to contaminate or pollute something
Example: The spilled chemicals worked to taint the experiment; forcing the students to start over.

Word: Take for Granted
Meaning: to believe that a person or thing is permanently accessible to someone who acts unappreciative
Example: Occasionally; Tiffany will take for granted Sally because Tiffany asks favors from Sally without returning the favor.

Word: Take up
Meaning: to become interested in something
Example: Denise wanted to take up playing the piano; but she couldn’t find anyone to teach her how to play.

Word: Take
Meaning: to carry something or bring it with you
Example: The clerk used a huge buggy to take all of the boxes from the front of the store to the pack.

Word: Takeaway
Meaning: a key point or idea that is remembered
Example: The takeaway from the entire staff meeting is that you shouldn’t post things on social media that might make the company look bad.

Word: Taken aback
Meaning: surprised or shocked
Example: The customer was taken aback by the high price of the spa services.

Word: Talcum
Meaning: a mineral-rich substance often in the form of a powder that has many everyday uses
Example: The mineral-rich talcum powder is a soothing mosturizer for those who suffer from skin conditions like eczema.

Word: Tale
Meaning: a story that typically describes an important or notable incident
Example: Washington Irving’s The Legend of Sleepy Hollow is a tale of witchcraft; romance; and a headless horseman on a quest for revenge.

Word: Tale
Meaning: a story (usually fictional) told orally or written
Example: Grandpa is famous for telling his tale of wrestling a lion in the Savannah desert.

Word: Talent
Meaning: natural mastery of a specific skill
Example: She had a talent for writing that could put even Shakespeare to shame.

Word: Talented
Meaning: having above average or a surprising skill at an activity
Example: Even though Vincent van Gogh was an extremely talented artist; he only sold one painting during his lifetime.

Word: Talisman
Meaning: a charm worn or kept to bring good fortune and ward off evil; lucky charm
Example: Throughout my grandmother’s ninety-five years of life; she rarely went a day without her favorite talisman around her neck.

Word: Talk
Meaning: to speak words out loud
Example: Hillary went to talk to her husband Bill about why she hates polka dot dresses.

Word: Talk
Meaning: to say words out loud
Example: The baby is just learning to talk and can only say a few words.

Word: Talkative
Meaning: someone who likes to speak a great deal
Example: Jessica’s best friend was extremely talkative and rarely paused to catch her breath between sentences.

Word: Talking head
Meaning: someone directly talking on television and whose whole body isn’t shown; but only their head and shoulders
Example: While watching the news; Marty got tired of watching the same boring talking head giving his opinion and changed the channel.

Word: Tallow
Meaning: hard fat of animals often used to craft candles; soap; and other household materials
Example: Before electricity; people would collect bits of congealed fat called tallow and light them on fire as makeshift candles.

Word: Tally
Meaning: a count that usually represents a score; money; number of wins; etc
Example: The prisoner kept a running tally of his incarceration by marking his cell wall with a white line for each day he spent behind bars.

Word: Talmud
Meaning: a book that is sometimes used in correlation with the Torah that consists of accounts of rabbis through a number of centuries and detailed descriptions of commandments that lay the foundation of Jewish faith
Example: Rabbi’s often refer to the Talmud to reinforce their faith and become well versed in religious laws.

Word: Talon
Meaning: sharp; hooked claw
Example: The eagle’s talon held a helpless mouse in its grip.

Word: Tame
Meaning: domesticated; gentle; behavior exhibited after loss of savage ways
Example: After several weeks of training; the poorly behaved and hyperactive puppy was surprisingly tame.

Word: Tamper
Meaning: to interfere with something with the intent to damage it or make unauthorized changes to it
Example: The saboteur had a special mission to tamper with the enemy’s vehicles before their morning deployment; so they wouldn’t be operable.

Word: Tandem
Meaning: alongside; in front of; following one after another; in a line
Example: For their anniversary; the couple decided to go tandem skydiving because what could be more romantic than dropping thousands of feet from a plane wrapped in each other’s arms?

Word: Tangent
Meaning: a line of thought that is off topic
Example: When my uncle is drunk; he will talk about one subject for a moment and then go off on a tangent about a completely different topic.

Word: Tangential
Meaning: not directly related to something
Example: I hardly ever learn anything in my history class because my teacher always rambles off on a tangential topic that has nothing to do with history.

Word: Tangible
Meaning: capable of being touched
Example: The tension in the air was so thick it was almost tangible.

Word: Tangle
Meaning: to become mixed together or intertwined
Example: Tara’s mother yelled as Tara was getting out of the shower; “If you don’t comb your wet hair; it may tangle.”

Word: Tanker
Meaning: a vehicle used to transport gas or liquids in bulk
Example: The gas tanker held hundreds of gallons of fuel that supplied a substantial portion of South Florida.

Word: Tannery
Meaning: a place that makes leather from animal skins
Example: During colonial times; many hunters would sell their captures to a tannery so that the tanner could take them and turn them into coats and outerwear.

Word: Tantalize
Meaning: to tease someone with a promise and then not deliver upon it
Example: In an attempt to tantalize me; my personal trainer offered a piece of cake as an incentive for me to finish my three miles on the treadmill.

Word: Tantalizing
Meaning: displaying something that arouses desire or interest
Example: Since I am on a diet; I must ignore the tantalizing smells coming from the bakery.

Word: Tantamount
Meaning: equal to something
Example: Mooching off your mother at age 35 is tantamount to being a lazy bum.

Word: Tantivy
Meaning: at top speed
Example: As she sped tantivy through the streets; the driver hoped that he would be able to make his meeting on time.

Word: Tantrum
Meaning: a fit or outburst of extreme emotion that is often deemed childish
Example: The toddler threw a temper tantrum when his mother took away his favorite toy.

Word: Taoism
Meaning: chinese philosophy written by Lao Tzu focused on humility and piety
Example: Those that follow Taoism rarely brag about their achievements; instead choosing to simply accept praise with modesty.

Word: Tap
Meaning: to exploit or draw from a source
Example: The miners were looking to tap into a gold reserve in the mine and extract it all for personal gain.

Word: Taper off
Meaning: to become gradually weaker or smaller
Example: As Angie walked away from her father; his voice began to taper off in the night.

Word: Taper
Meaning: to make thinner or narrower at one end or to diminish gradually
Example: The more I sketched my drawing; the more my pencil began to taper.

Word: Tapestry
Meaning: used in reference to complex or complicated combinations of things
Example: America is a tapestry of races and cultures from all over the world; combining all of them into one whole.

Word: Taproot
Meaning: the main root system of a plant that grows down vertically
Example: The dandelion has a single; thick taproot that helps it draw in lots of nutrients.

Word: Tar
Meaning: a thick and flammable liquid distilled from wood and coal
Example: Tar is a black gooey substance used in paving roads; which is why most roads are black themselves.

Word: Tarantism
Meaning: a psychological illness that gives people an overwhelming impulse to dance; once believed to have been caused by the bite of a Tarantula
Example: Tarantism gave many people the hysterical urge to dance in 15th century Italy; something that confused those that were not afflicted by it.

Word: Tarantula
Meaning: a big furry spider that does sting but is usually not dangerous
Example: As the tarantula crawled across the floor; its eight hairy legs and giant body caused people to scream but were too scared to step on it.

Word: Tardiness
Meaning: the quality of being late
Example: Because most schools have a rule about students arriving on time; teachers do not tolerate tardiness.

Word: Tardy
Meaning: late to a specific event or delayed beyond the expected time
Example: Students who do not arrive to class on time are tardy; and they often receive some sort of penalty for it.

Word: Tare
Meaning: another name for vetch; a common name for a flowering plant of the legume family
Example: I accidentally stepped on a tare when I was walking through the forest; but thankfully the flowering plant didn’t have any thorns on it.

Word: Target
Meaning: something selected as the aim of an attack
Example: An Eagle will often choose small fish and rodents as the target of their hunt because they are carnivores.

Word: Tariff
Meaning: a tax or duty on imports or exports
Example: The president has proposed a 25% tariff on all imported automobiles; angering foreign car makers with his tax.

Word: Tarnish
Meaning: a dullness of color or luster
Example: The once shiny candlesticks now only had a tarnish about them; not being as pretty as they once were.

Word: Tarpaulin
Meaning: a heavy duty waterproof cloth
Example: The sails of a boat are usually tarpaulin in nature; so they can withstand the rains and waves of the ocean without getting damaged.

Word: Tarry
Meaning: to take your time or delay in doing something
Example: He decided to tarry during his trip to Georgia because he really didn’t want to go; but he was only able to stall for a short while.

Word: Tarry
Meaning: covered in tar or a tar like substance
Example: The tires of the vehicle were tarry from all the sticky mud it drove through; making it difficult to wash off even with a hose.

Word: Tart
Meaning: acid or sharp in taste
Example: The sour candy I eat is very tart and I love it; but my mom that hates sour food does not.

Word: Task
Meaning: work to be done or completed
Example: My task is to organize all of these papers before noon; but after that I can take a short break.

Word: Taste
Meaning: a person’s liking for a particular thing
Example: Orange walls aren’t really my personal taste; as I honestly prefer darker colors like gray or blue.

Word: Tatterdemalion
Meaning: someone dressed in ragged or torn clothing
Example: With the dirty and torn clothes he was wearing; the homeless man was a tatterdemalion compared to his nicer dressed counterparts.

Word: Tattered
Meaning: ragged and torn; in bad condition
Example: Tattered from the strong wind; there was little left of the boat’s sail.

Word: Tatters
Meaning: irregularly torn pieces of material
Example: The cloth was cut into tatters with a knife; leaving it in multiple pieces of different sizes.

Word: Taught
Meaning: instructed or trained someone on a subject or how to do something
Example: My mother taught me how to cook and clean the kitchen at an early age.

Word: Taunt
Meaning: using insults to try and trigger a response
Example: As the visiting team walked on the court; the hometown fans began to taunt the players.

Word: Taunting
Meaning: insulting or ridiculing in a way that makes others angry
Example: The playground bully continued taunting the shy boy and insulting him with name-calling.

Word: Taut
Meaning: stressed to the point of being nervous
Example: As I waited for the results of my lab tests; I was taut with anxiety.

Word: Tautology
Meaning: speech or text in which something is restated unnecessarily
Example: The politician’s advertisement was simply tautology he restated several times within a thirty second period.

Word: Tawdry
Meaning: cheap and poor in appearance or quality
Example: Everyone is always expecting a politician to have a tawdry affair.

Word: Tawny
Meaning: an orange-brown or yellowish-brown color
Example: Dirty water is often a very unpleasant tawny color that is reminiscent of a muddy orange.

Word: Tax
Meaning: to strain or burden someone or something
Example: That much homework will really tax all of my strength; but I have to do it all even if I’ll be tired afterwards.

Word: Taxation
Meaning: the process of levying taxes
Example: The Revolutionary War was waged for many reasons; but one of the causes that ignited the conflict included unfair taxation in which Americans had to pay money to the Crown without representation.

Word: Taxidermist
Meaning: a person who stuffs and mounts animal skins so that they have a life-like appearance
Example: The skilled taxidermist was able to stuff the giant bear; making him appear life-like again.

Word: Taxidermy
Meaning: the art of preparing and stuffing the skins of dead animals to appear lifelike
Example: The mounted deer heads you see in some homes are the results of taxidermy; and they used to belong to real animals.

Word: Taxing
Meaning: physically or mentally challenging/demanding
Example: Working all day and raising a family can be a taxing task on any single parent.

Word: Taxing
Meaning: requiring significant physical or mental effort
Example: For some people; high level mathematics is simple; but for others even algebra can be taxing and mentally exhausting.

Word: Taxon
Meaning: a group or rank in biology such as a species or family
Example: Giraffes are of a small biological taxon that only includes four distinct species.

Word: Taxonomy
Meaning: the methodology used to classify things or organisms
Example: In biology; the term taxonomy refers to the classification of organisms into groups based on their attributes.

Word: Tea
Meaning: a drink made by infusing the crushed leaves of a tea plant with boiling water
Example: Many people in the south U.S. add sugar to their tea to make sweet tea; but it’s not a common practice in Asia.

Word: Teach
Meaning: the act of passing on knowledge to another
Example: It’s Mr. Kim’s job to teach the students the complicated aspects of math; but most of the students have a hard time understanding it all.

Word: Team

Word: Teammate

Example: Every football player is a teammate to the other players on their team; and they work together towards a common goal.

Word: Teamwork
Meaning: a group of people who work together towards a mutual goal
Example: Group sports rely on teamwork to win the game.

Word: Tear
Meaning: to rip something apart with brute force
Example: I tear apart my test in frustration because I got a low grade on it; but unfortunately it doesn’t change anything.

Word: Tearful
Meaning: the act of being flooded by emotion and its physical manifestation in tears full of tears
Example: The heartbroken woman made a tearful plea to her beloved to forgive her.

Word: Tearjerker

Word: Teary-eyed
Meaning: having eyes that are wet with tears
Example: The teary-eyed bride wiped her cheeks and smiled up at her soon to be husband.

Word: Tease
Meaning: to insult another for their physical or mental condition; to irritate or provoke because it brings the antagonizer joy
Example: When he was younger; kids used to tease him about his frizzy hair and braces.

Word: Technic
Meaning: the way a skill or event is presented
Example: The expert fisherman explained the technic to catching a fish by using a desirable bait and lots of patience.

Word: Technicality
Meaning: an extremely specific piece of information that is typically used to win an argument or make a judgment
Example: The eager young job applicant didn't think that she would be refused the job for a simple technicality like forgetting to sign the bottom of her non-disclosure document; but she was wrong.

Word: Technically
Meaning: according to the strict and exact meaning of something
Example: People are told they can do anything they want; but technically they cannot because some things are impossible.

Word: Technician
Meaning: someone who has mastered the basic techniques necessary for a trade and employs them effectively
Example: The lab technician applied a variety of scientific techniques to analyze the specimen.

Word: Technique
Meaning: a procedure or method used to carry out a task
Example: Trying out a new technique for dying hair; the beautician was able to cut her client’s wait time in half.

Word: Technocracy
Meaning: a ruling power who governs with heavy reliance on technology
Example: In many science fiction novels; the world is ruled by a technocracy where scientists and technology reign supreme.

Word: Technological
Meaning: related to advanced machinery or techniques
Example: Apple is known for their quick technological advancements.

Word: Technology

Example: Replacing the office’s outdated computer systems with new technology would allow the workers to get a lot more done.

Word: Techy

Example: Techy gifts can be bought on a budget at the new; technology-based street shop.

Word: Tectonic 
Meaning: relating to the surface of the Earth’s crust and movement
Example: Movements along the coast were likely due to tectonic shifts in the Earth’s crust.

Word: Tedious
Meaning: boring; annoying because it is long or slow
Example: Watching paint dry seems tedious.

Word: Tedium

Example: To ease the tedium of looking at accounting forms all day; I listen to bubbly music while I work.

Word: Teem
Meaning: to be present or gather in a large number
Example: Honeycombs teem with worker bees who work tirelessly to produce honey for their queen.

Word: Teeming
Meaning: filled with an abundance of things
Example: The homeless dog’s fur was teeming with fleas.

Word: Teeter
Meaning: to be unsteady or to wobble
Example: The judges held their breaths as they watched the normally skilled gymnast teeter on the edge of the balance beam.

Word: Teetered

Example: The wobbly toddler teetered back and forth before finally toppling over on the floor.

Word: Teleconference

Example: Because the CEO’s were in different states; they had to have a teleconference over the phone for their meeting.

Word: Telegenic

Example: The telegenic news reporter looked even more beautiful on television than she did in person.

Word: Telegnosis
Meaning: knowledge of events acquired from supernatural sources and without the use of the senses
Example: The psychic must have used telegnosis to read the future; as she could not have learned that information any other way.

Word: Telegram
Meaning: a message or information sent by telegraph
Example: Before telephones; people’s messages had to be sent in the form of a telegram and printed out.

Word: Telegraph
Meaning: to convey intent through physical signs
Example: If you telegraph your attack to the enemy they will know it’s coming before you move; which is why you shouldn’t give yourself away before you’re ready.

Word: Telekinesis
Meaning: the ability to move objects with the power of one's mind
Example: Using telekinesis; the spiritual lady transferred the pencil to the desk.

Word: Telemeter
Meaning: an instrument used for measuring the distance of an object from an observer
Example: The hands of a telemeter can tell you how far away an approaching thunderstorm is at the moment.

Word: Telemetry
Meaning: the act of recording and transmitting data from an instrument
Example: We’ll use telemetry to send our research data to the other station; and they’ll be able to interpret what we saw on the radar.

Word: Teleological
Meaning: the philosophical attempt to describe every object in regards to its apparent use or purpose
Example: In teleological thinking; you would describe a fork by saying what it is used for; rather than what it looks like or is made of.

Word: Telepathy
Meaning: the ability to communicate with another person mentally without using any motions or words
Example: Many people believe twins have telepathy and can talk to each other without speaking.

Word: Telephonic
Meaning: relating to a telephone
Example: Telephonic life coaching is provided over the phone for those who need help losing weight.

Word: Telescope
Meaning: an optical instrument that uses curved lenses to magnify the visual image of far-off objects
Example: Because planets are too far away for us to see with the naked eye; we need to use a special instrument like a telescope to see them.

Word: Telescopic
Meaning: relating to a telescope or optical enlargement
Example: The telescopic nature of the lens made the image look larger to me; just like a telescope is supposed to do.

Word: Tell

Example: Hillary wants to tell her mom that she has a boyfriend; but she knows that her mother will be upset by the news.

Word: Telltale

Word: Temerarious

Example: Jason lost his temper and broke the bathroom mirror.

Word: Temperamental

Example: The temperamental toddler becomes upset easily and throws tantrums any time she doesn’t get her way.

Word: Temperance

Example: Determined to never become an alcoholic; Tim exercised temperance whenever he drank alcohol so he wouldn’t drink too much.

Word: Temperate

Word: Theology

Word: Theorem

Word: Theoretical
Meaning: pertaining to an idea based on conducted experiments or studies
Example: No one contested her theoretical idea since it was based on years of research and testing.

Word: Theorize
Meaning: to draw a conclusion based on conducted experiments or studies
Example: Hundreds of years ago; many scientists would state that the earth is flat until Galileo would theorize that the earth is round.

Word: Theory
Meaning: a conclusion based on conducted experiments or studies
Example: Many people disagree about the Big Bang Theory creating the universe due to the lack of evidence.

Word: Therapeutic
Meaning: associated with the healing of a sickness
Example: The therapeutic massage relieved the pain in my back.

Word: Therapy

Example: Therapy was required after a traumatic car accident in order to repair the victim’s broken bones.

Word: Therapy
