Example: The patient is going to physical therapy to gain control of her knee movement again.

Word: Thereafter
Meaning: afterward or subsequently
Example: Due to many times of trying to match the paint to the walls; the painter thereafter refused to go back to Home Depot.

Word: Thereby
Meaning: thus; in doing so
Example: The wife offered a heartfelt apology; thereby saving her marriage.

Word: Therefore
Meaning: so; consequently
Example: Elizabeth wants to lose weight and therefore refuses to eat anything made of carbs.

Word: Therefore
Meaning: so; for that reason
Example: Lindsey doesn’t like going to the theater; therefore; she turned down the invitation to the show.

Word: Therein
Meaning: in that place
Example: Racism is passed down generationally and therein lies the problem.

Word: Thereof
Meaning: of that; of the thing just mentioned
Example: Money; or a lack thereof; can influence people to do some really bad things.

Word: Thereon
Meaning: on or following from the thing just mentioned
Example: The chef brought a large platter to the kitchen and piled meat thereon.

Word: Thereunto
Meaning: to that place or thing
Example: Reba enjoyed worshipping at the temple and hastened thereunto ever chance she got.

Word: Thereupon
Meaning: immediately; shortly after
Example: The police chief thereupon ordered a blocking of the road so that more accidents did not occur.

Word: Therm
Meaning: a unit of heat that equals 100;000 British thermal units
Example: The wholesale price of gas per therm has gone up significantly the past few weeks.

Word: Thermal
Meaning: heat related
Example: Venturing out into the thermal pool; the swimmer let out a sigh of relief as the hot water eased her aching back.

Word: Thermodynamics
Meaning: the science of heat and temperature
Example: Our thermodynamics teacher had us design an experiment that showed the three most common ways heat is transferred.

Word: Thermograph
Meaning: a recording thermometer that registers the temperature it measures
Example: The self-registering thermograph printed a graph showing the daily temperatures for the month of May.

Word: Thermometer
Meaning: an instrument used to measure the temperature (how much heat is present)
Example: The doctor used the thermometer to see if the boy’s body temperature was too high.

Word: Thermonuclear
Meaning: relating to devices that use high temperatures from a nuclear reaction to cause powerful explosions
Example: France’s thermonuclear bombs were developed without the help of countries who already had high level explosives.

Word: Thermos
Meaning: a special container that keeps liquids hot or cold
Example: Carrying her joe in a thermos allowed the coffee junkie to have warm java throughout the day.

Word: Thermosphere
Meaning: the outermost layer of the earth’s atmosphere that is characterized by steadily increasing temperature with height
Example: As the outside layer of the earth’s surface; the temperature of thermosphere really depends on the position of the sun.

Word: Thermostat
Meaning: an automatic device for controlling temperature
Example: Even though he liked to leave the thermostat at 70 degrees; the man’s hot-natured wife would often turn it down to 63 during the night.

Word: Thesaurus
Meaning: a book in which words that have the same or similar meanings (synonyms) are grouped together
Example: Words listed with the word ‘sad’ in the thesaurus include unhappy; blue; and gloomy.

Word: Thesis
Meaning: a statement that is discussed and debated
Example: The student’s experiments helped her formulate a thesis to share with her professor and classmates.

Word: Thespian
Meaning: relating to drama or the theater
Example: Making his thespian debut; the newbie took the stage and gave the theatrical performance of a lifetime.

Word: Thick
Meaning: broad; wide
Example: The football player’s thick shoulders were much wider than the rest of his narrow body.

Word: Thicket
Meaning: a very dense group of trees or bushes
Example: Moving through the dense thicket; the explorers could barely see through the trees.

Word: Thickness
Meaning: depth; wideness
Example: The thickness of the river made it difficult for the pioneers to wade across.

Word: Thief
Meaning: one who steals things from others
Example: A thief crept up to the house and stole several items while the owners slept.

Word: Thin
Meaning: skinny; slender
Example: The skinny ballerina’s bones seemed to poke through her thin skin.

Word: Thine
Meaning: a form of the word thy or the word your that is used before a vowel
Example: To thine own self you should always be true.

Word: Thing
Meaning: an object
Example: The only thing that should be placed in the cabinet are cans.

Word: Thingamajig
Meaning: an object that one can’t recall the name of
Example: I can’t remember the use of that thingamajig or the name of the product either.

Word: Think
Meaning: to reason or consider
Example: The judge needed time to think before making a decision in court.

Word: Think
Meaning: to have an opinion about someone or something
Example: I think that we should get up for school an hour earlier; but my sister feels we should sleep later.

Word: Third-rate 
Meaning: of poor or low-grade quality
Example: Because all of the first-class flight seats were sold out; I had to settle for a third-rate ticket.

Word: Thirdhand
Meaning: describes goods that have been passed down to a third person after having been owned by two others
Example: The thirdhand vehicle had two previous owners; but it was still in great condition.

Word: Thirst
Meaning: to desire or crave
Example: Lots of water was needed to quench the dying man’s thirst for water.

Word: Thirsty
Meaning: to be slightly dehydrated or dry
Example: After running a few miles in the hot sun; the runner became thirsty and grabbed a cup of water from a volunteer during the marathon.

Word: Thither
Meaning: toward that place
Example: We followed the foot prints leading towards the woods in search of the cabin; but they did not lead us thither.

Word: Thorax
Meaning: the chest; or part of the anatomy that is located between the neck and the abdomen
Example: Lying between the neck and abdomen; the man’s thorax was the main place cancer had evaded.

Word: Thorn
Meaning: a sharp prickle that extends from a plant
Example: Piercing the gardener’s finger; the rose’s thorn drew blood to the surface.

Word: Thorough
Meaning: detailed and careful
Example: A thorough investigation of the crime brought out lots of details but no motive.

Word: Thoroughbred
Meaning: used to refer to animals of a pure breed; though it is typically used for horses
Example: A thoroughbred horse is born of two parents of the same breed; and has no blood from any other breed at all.

Word: Thoroughfare
Meaning: a main road in a town
Example: If you want to go straight through town you should use the thoroughfare; which is the biggest road in the center of town.

Word: Thoroughness
Meaning: great care or attention to detail when doing something
Example: Because the job is delicate; I had to complete it with great thoroughness to ensure that I did it correctly.

Word: Thou
Meaning: an ancient way of saying ‘you'
Example: Thou are a most vile; disgusting individual; and I am lesser for knowing your face.

Word: Thought
Meaning: an idea or opinion that is created in the mind
Example: The thought of working out crossed Darren’s mind; but he decided to skip the gym today.

Word: Thoughtful
Meaning: to be kind and considerate
Example: After her mother passed away; the young woman received many thoughtful cards expressing sympathy for her loss.

Word: Thoughtless
Meaning: to be unkind and inconsiderate
Example: The thoughtless acts of evil were viewed from the children as the older boy threw rocks at the injured puppy.

Word: Thousand
Meaning: a number equal to ten hundreds
Example: Since the jacket cost a thousand dollars; I had to take really good care of it due to its expensive price.

Word: Thrall
Meaning: the state of being under the control of another person
Example: During historical times; a citizen would become aware quickly of the evil thrall of a dictator’s control.

Word: Thrash
Meaning: to hit or strike continuously
Example: When the pit bull dog began to bite the child’s leg; the father began to thrash the dog with a stick to get it to release its grip.

Word: Thread
Meaning: a strand of string or fiber used in sewing
Example: With my needle and thread; I began to mend the hole in my pants which had ripped at the seam.

Word: Threadbare
Meaning: pertaining to something that is worn out or ragged
Example: After living in the woods for a week without supplies; my threadbare clothing was not protecting me from the elements.

Word: Threat
Meaning: the act of being in hazard or danger
Example: With the approaching tornado; there was a definite threat of impending harm on the citizens in the community.

Word: Threaten
Meaning: to put someone or something in hazard or danger
Example: If you threaten violence; you stand the chance of getting in trouble with the law.

Word: Threatening
Meaning: having a hostile or intimidating manner
Example: The threatening letter stated that a bomb would be placed in a random mailbox around the city once every day.

Word: Threateningly
Meaning: done in a hostile or intimidating manner
Example: The bully raised his fist at the boy threateningly and made him give up his lunch money.

Word: Threefold
Meaning: referring to something that is triple the amount
Example: With Harry; Tom and Sam from the same gang all in jail together; this threefold group presented a problem to the warden.

Word: Thresh
Meaning: to detach a seed or useless part of the crop from the rest of the flower or crop
Example: As soon as the farmers thresh their crops; they will usually replant the seeds on their new land.

Word: Threshold
Meaning: the level at which an individual is defenseless or helpless
Example: I knew I had reached my threshold of pain when I had to take a pill for comfort.

Word: Thrice
Meaning: three times the amount of something
Example: When the teacher thrice repeated the directions to her students; she was angry that they failed to listen the first couple of times.

Word: Thrift
Meaning: the act of being cautious with your money
Example: Nonprofit organizations use their thrift to buy needed items to make life better for those they are devoted to helping.

Word: Thrifty
Meaning: careful with money
Example: The thrifty family decided to have a garage sale to bring in extra income.

Word: Thrill
Meaning: excitement and joy
Example: The teenage girls were all smiles on their first road trip due to the thrill of the adventure.

Word: Thrilling
Meaning: exciting and inspiring
Example: The roller coaster ride was thrilling because every rider had a smile on their face and was screaming with delight.

Word: Thrive 
Meaning: to do better or increase in size or number
Example: In its new place on the windowsill; the plant is sure to thrive and bloom regularly.

Word: Throat
Meaning: the esophagus or the place on a living being where swallowing occurs
Example: Before speaking the first word of his speech; Artie cleared his throat completely and took a deep breath.

Word: Throb
Meaning: to pulse or pound
Example: Pain began to throb in my leg due to my clumsiness when I fell and landed on it.

Word: Throbbing
Meaning: pertaining to a pounding rhythm
Example: As the most popular boy walked down the hallway; Patricia’s heart began throbbing faster and faster.

Word: Throes
Meaning: intense struggle or agony
Example: We decided to have our dog put down because he was in the throes of incurable pain.

Word: Thrombosis
Meaning: the thickening or lump of blood preventing or blocking the flow of blood
Example: Emergency surgery was scheduled for the young woman whose thrombosis had become life-threatening from the blood clot.

Word: Throne
Meaning: seat or chair for a royal official
Example: As the king of the castle sat on his throne; the criminal came before the king to explain his case.

Word: Throng
Meaning: a large cluster of individuals
Example: When the game ended; a throng of fans carried some of the winning players off the field.

Word: Throttle
Meaning: to suffocate by cutting off someone’s air supply in order to kill or hurt him or her
Example: At the crime scene; investigators quickly realized that the assailant did throttle the victim due to the red marks around the victim’s neck.

Word: Throughout
Meaning: all over or the whole time
Example: Rain poured down in droves throughout the day without relinquishing causing all of school’s athletic events to be canceled.

Word: Throw
Meaning: to toss or heave
Example: Please throw the torn clothing in the trash and toss the stained things in there too.

Word: Throwaway
Meaning: a material or product that is disposable or non recyclable
Example: Throwaway razor blades and disposable cups are now common household products that don’t get reused.

Word: Throwback
Meaning: a prompting back to something or sometime in the past
Example: While the teenage boy was helping the teacher glue glitter onto the paper; he felt that it was a throwback to his kindergarten days.

Word: Thrown
Meaning: to have pitched something through the air
Example: Knowing the batter struggles with hitting curve balls; the pitcher should have thrown a curve ball in order to get him out.

Word: Thrust
Meaning: to force something in a certain direction
Example: Sometimes; the wind will be so strong that it will thrust open an unlocked door to a building or house.

Word: Thumb
Meaning: the short thick inside digit on a hand
Example: During my arrest; the officer took my fingerprints by first rolling my thumb over the screen.

Word: Thump
Meaning: to tap something hard
Example: Many shoppers will thump a watermelon to see if it is ripe while grocery shopping in the produce section of the store.

Word: Thunder
Meaning: the crackling or roaring sound in weather occurring sometimes with lightning
Example: During the storm; the thunder crashed while the lightning lit up the sky against a dark background.

Word: Thunderous
Meaning: extremely loud
Example: The thunderous storm made crashing sounds throughout the night; frightening the sleeping children out of bed.

Word: Thus
Meaning: as an effect of something else; then
Example: “We have sold 225 dollars worth of girl scout cookies thus far;” said the troop leader; “but we have a long way to go to reach our goal.”

Word: Thwart
Meaning: to hinder or stop something from happening
Example: Someone built this wall with broken bottles set in the top to thwart the intrusion of outsiders.

Word: Thy
Meaning: a word meaning “your” that was used in older times
Example: “If honesty runs in your family; then thy truth will be told today;” the prosecutor explained to the witness.

Word: Tickle
Meaning: to poke or slightly grab someone resulting in laughing
Example: While sitting on his lap; Uncle Paul would tickle his niece under her chin causing her to giggle.

Word: Tidal
Meaning: referring to ocean waves
Example: Islanders feared a tidal wave would come on shore since scientists had warned that the probability was great.

Word: Tidbit
Meaning: a tiny amount of something
Example: Any tidbit of food was needed by the lost hikers in the wilderness since they hadn’t eaten for days.

Word: Tide
Meaning: the various levels of water in the ocean
Example: “As we go later into our day;” the meteorologist stated; “the tide will turn and be more dangerous to anyone who goes out into the water.”

Word: Tidiness
Meaning: the act of being neat or something that is neat
Example: After noticing the tidiness of the children’s playroom; the family realized that their maid had worked today.

Word: Tidings
Meaning: reports or announcements of facts
Example: Tidings of happiness that World War II was finally over circulated around the world by radio broadcasts.

Word: Tidy
Meaning: to be orderly and organized
Example: Showing a tidy house to the potential buyers left a good impression with them as the house had been taken care of.

Word: Tie
Meaning: to clasp or join two strings; fabric or other material together
Example: My four-year old niece learned how to tie her shoes so she might stop tripping on her loose shoelaces.

Word: Tier
Meaning: a level; layer or step
Example: Due to the high dropout rate and low test scores; this high school ranked in the bottom tier of the list of good schools in the state.

Word: Tiff
Meaning: a small conflict usually between two people
Example: What started as a little tiff between the two sisters turned into a fight with hair-pulling and slapping.

Word: Tight-knit
Meaning: describes a group that is well-organized and closely united
Example: Our family is a tight-knit group; and we enjoy going on family vacations together several times a year.

Word: Tight-lipped
Meaning: reluctant to speak or give information
Example: Even during the trial; the uncooperative defendant remained tight-lipped about his part in the crime.

Word: Tight
Meaning: close together with no extra space in between
Example: Her pencil skirt was so tight that the young lady could only waddle down the street at a snail’s pace.

Word: Tile
Meaning: a shaped flattened piece of rock or clay used in floors or coverings
Example: After removing the linoleum; the home owner decided to tile the floor so that it looked like more modern.

Word: Till
Meaning: to tend to or work the soil
Example: Slaves were expected to till the soil for many hours a day on a large plantation in which many died from exhaustion.

Word: Tilt
Meaning: to slant or list to one side
Example: If you put a heavy object onto the table; it will tilt to the right since the top of it isn’t screwed in properly.

Word: Timber
Meaning: lumber primarily used for commercial or building use
Example: A timber was place around each side of the raised flowerbed giving it a natural look before filling the bed with mulch.

Word: Timbre 
Meaning: The quality of a sound aside from its volume and pitch.
Example: The opera star’s timbre was rich and filled with vibrato.

Word: Time
Meaning: the juncture or point at which an event takes place
Example: When the bell rang; it was time to say good-bye to my therapist since my half hour was up.

Word: Timeless
Meaning: classic; lasting through the ages
Example: The timeless movie was popular in past generations and with current moviegoers.

Word: Timeline
Meaning: an estimated plan of how long something will or should take
Example: To meet the timeline of completion; construction must start tomorrow.

Word: Timeliness
Meaning: the act of something happening at an appropriate period or instant
Example: Due to the timeliness of the child’s birth; the teacher was able to have her baby in the summer and not miss any work.

Word: Timely
Meaning: happening at a previous or correct time
Example: If the shoppers wanted the free gift; then they had to accept the timely offer and pay for the product before 8 p.m. that night.

Word: Timid
Meaning: lacking in courage or confidence
Example: The timid singer nervously approached the microphone.

Word: Timidity
Meaning: the act of shyness
Example: With his head down and barely speaking; the timidity of man shown when he was approached by the manager of the store.

Word: Timorous
Meaning: frightened
Example: The timorous kitten would not come out from under the bed.

Word: Tin
Meaning: a receptacle can made of a metallic element
Example: When the little boy put the pebbles in the tin for safe keeping; he could hear the clinking sound as they hit the bottom.

Word: Tincture
Meaning: a small hint of something
Example: While the student slightly stuttered during her speech in class; I sensed a tincture of nervousness in her voice.

Word: Tinder
Meaning: a very flammable substance adaptable for use as kindling
Example: Lighting the tinder and wood; the camper prepared for an overnight stay at the campground.

Word: Tinge
Meaning: a small but noticeable amount
Example: After kissing his wife; Jim had a tinge of lipstick on his lips.

Word: Tingle
Meaning: a feeling of sharp throbs
Example: After I got up from my nap; my arm began to tingle since I had slept directly on my right arm.

Word: Tinker
Meaning: to try to fix something
Example: Every now and then my father would go to the basement to tinker with a gadget; but he rarely got anything repaired.

Word: Tinkering
Meaning: attempting to fix something without the required knowledge or skill
Example: I spent hours tinkering with my car trying to find out what was wrong with it; but I failed to accomplish anything at all.

Word: Tinsel
Meaning: of superficial attractiveness
Example: The shallow woman cared only for the tinsel aspects of a prospective boyfriend; and not about his personality or character.

Word: Tintinnabulation
Meaning: a ringing or tinkling sound
Example: You are more likely to hear tintinnabulation around Christmas time; when there are more bells and chimes to be heard.

Word: Tiny
Meaning: extremely small
Example: Ants are tiny; but there are so many ants on Earth they outweigh us humans even though they are so small.

Word: Tipsy
Meaning: just slightly drunk
Example: Because my wife has a low tolerance for alcohol; she gets a little tipsy after just one glass of wine.

Word: Tiptoe
Meaning: to walk very quietly on the tips of one’s toes
Example: When sneaking into the house at night; the teen made sure to tiptoe quietly past her parent’s bedroom.

Word: Tiptop
Meaning: the very best something can be
Example: The quality of this beef is tiptop; I would recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Word: Tirade
Meaning: a long and angry speech
Example: Because Carrie is normally a laidback person; she shocked everyone with her tirade.

Word: Tire
Meaning: to grow bored of or exhaust the patience of
Example: The child was quick to tire of his toy and he moved on to something else to entertain himself with.

Word: Tireless
Meaning: determined and unrelenting
Example: While bouncing around; the tireless toddler seemed like he could continue to run around without stopping all day.

Word: Tiresome
Meaning: causing one to feel annoyed or bored
Example: Fed up with their tiresome interruptions; the professor warned his students they would all fail if they did not stop.

Word: Tiring
Meaning: causing someone to lose stamina or energy and require rest
Example: Taking care of a young child is often very tiring; draining people of energy all too quickly.

Word: Tissue
Meaning: The organic material from which living creatures are made; consisting of cells
Example: If you get a cut you are damaging your skin tissue; but it will heal itself over time.

Word: Titanic
Meaning: extremely large
Example: Godzilla is a monster of titanic proportions; dwarfing even buildings as he rampages throughout the city.

Word: Tithe
Meaning: ten percent of earnings typically given to the church as an offering
Example: The most devout churchgoers offer a ten percent monetary tithe to support their congregation.

Word: Titillate 
Meaning: to arouse
Example: The woman hoped her sexy dress would titillate her husband so much he would overlook her outrageous credit card bills.

Word: Title
Meaning: the name or heading of a book; a piece of writing; or artistic work
Example: The author couldn’t think of a title for her story right away; but she eventually came up with a name.

Word: Titter
Meaning: a brief and partially suppressed laugh
Example: The young girl held back a laugh and uttered a titter instead; unable to completely suppress her mirth.

Word: Titular
Meaning: having a completely arbitrary position that is of no real power or authority
Example: England has a Queen; but today her position is completely titular and she has no authority in the government whatsoever.

Word: To no avail
Meaning: fruitless; pointless often referring to making effort but not having success
Example: The football team tried to pull out a win even though they were forty points behind; but their efforts were to no avail.

Word: Toad
Meaning: a contemptible or otherwise hated individual
Example: The traitor Benedict Arnold was a toad through and through; and us true Americans really hate him.

Word: Toady
Meaning: an individual who compliments others for a reason
Example: In order to get a promotion; Amy has been acting like the manager’s toady by agreeing with everything he says.

Word: Toast
Meaning: to cook food by exposing it to radiant heat rather than a direct source
Example: You burn a marshmallow when you put in it the fire; but you toast it when you let the heat from the fire cook it for you.

Word: Tobacco
Meaning: the cured and fermented nicotine rich leaves of the North American Nightshade plant; used for smoking and chewing
Example: My Uncle likes to chew tobacco; but the nicotine in it isn’t very good for his teeth; and they are beginning to deteriorate.

Word: Tocsin
Meaning: an alarm
Example: Pulling the fire alarm at school will set off an ear grating tocsin that lets everyone know that they are supposed to vacate the building as quickly as possible.

Word: Today
Meaning: at the present time
Example: I have a doctor’s appointment at two-o’clock today and will take a cab to the clinic.

Word: Toddler
Meaning: used to refer to a young child that is just learning to walk
Example: My son is just a two year old toddler; having taken his first steps about a week ago.

Word: Toe
Meaning: any one of the five digits at the end of the human foot
Example: I was walking around my house barefooted and I accidentally rammed my little toe into the leg of my kitchen table.

Word: Togetherness
Meaning: the act of being together with or near others
Example: Because it is so cold where they live; penguins like to practice togetherness; huddling up in groups to conserve warmth and protect each other.

Word: Toggle
Meaning: pressing a key or button on a computer to go back and forth between something
Example: The little kids would toggle back and forth between music and you tube on their tablets.

Word: Toil
Meaning: to work for a long period of time
Example: You should hire Justin because he is a hard worker who will toil until the job is done.

Word: Toilsome
Meaning: something that involves a great deal of effort or hard work
Example: Plowing an entire field is quite toilsome; but even though it is hard work farmers have to do it all the time.

Word: Token
Meaning: an object that serves as a voucher for goods and services
Example: At a casino; the coins you win in slot machines serve as a token that you can exchange for prizes or money.

Word: Tolerable
Meaning: something that is alright or decent; but not terrible or great
Example: The average performance of the actors on stage was tolerable; and I certainly would not give them any special awards.

Word: Tolerance
Meaning: ability to withstand problems or discomfort
Example: Since none of the passengers on the plane complained about the constantly screaming baby; they had a high tolerance to the noise.

Word: Tolerant
Meaning: the attribute of being able to endure something in particular
Example: Most desert creatures are quite tolerant to the heat of the sun; so they can resist it better than non-native creatures.

Word: Tolerate
Meaning: to put up with or withstand
Example: Our English teacher could only tolerate students whispering because otherwise the level of noise was too loud for her.

Word: Toleration
Meaning: the process or act of tolerating something
Example: Religious toleration in America is one of its most admirable qualities; as you can practice any religion you want here without persecution.

Word: Toll
Meaning: the number of casualties caused by an event that took lives
Example: The death toll from the tsunami was catastrophically high; reaching well into the tens of thousands across the coastline.

Word: Tomb
Meaning: a large; typically underground chamber used to bury the dead
Example: Because we had so many fallen; we had to bury them in a tomb where there was enough room for them all.

Word: Tome
Meaning: a huge educational written work
Example: At the exhibit of the Templeton Historical Museum; it displayed a scene of a small room including a bed; chest and tome on the small desk.

Word: Tomfoolery
Meaning: foolish or overly silly behavior or actions
Example: My sister is far too serious to play pranks on any of our neighbors; so I had to engage in that tomfoolery by myself.

Word: Tomorrow
Meaning: the day after the present day
Example: We cannot go to the movie today; so we will have to go tomorrow when we have some free time.

Word: Tone
Meaning: the author’s attitude toward a subject in a work
Example: Using many descriptive words and serene scenes; the tone of the poem is calmness and relaxation.

Word: Tonearm
Meaning: the movable part of a record player that allows the needle to follow the record’s groove
Example: The tonearm on the record player was broken and couldn’t move or pick up.

Word: Tongue-in-cheek
Meaning: meant as amusing and not in a serious manner
Example: After waiting in line for over an hour; I did not appreciate the clerk’s tongue-in-cheek comment about annoying customers.

Word: Tongue
Meaning: the muscular organ in the mouth that is used for tasting; swallowing; and articulating speech in the case of humans
Example: If you want to know what a lollipop tastes like; you will have to lick it with your tongue to find out.

Word: Tonnage
Meaning: the actual amount in heaviness that is measured in tons
Example: With the extra tonnage of equipment on the ferry; it was in jeopardy of sinking due to the excess weight.

Word: Took
Meaning: to have removed something from a particular place
Example: The student took several pieces of paper from the classroom down to the office for his teacher.

Word: Tool
Meaning: a device or implement that is used to accomplish a task or function more easily
Example: While there are many ways you can put a nail into a piece of wood; it is far easier to do it with an appropriate tool like a hammer.

Word: Toothsome
Meaning: tasty and delicious
Example: The toothsome gumbo is the most delicious dish included on the café’s menu.

Word: Top-notch
Meaning: of the best quality possible
Example: Betty has decided to higher a top-notch lawyer with many years of experience to handle her divorce case.

Word: Top
Meaning: to exceed or perform better than
Example: I scored over ninety points on my test; and I bet my friend failed to top that since he didn’t study as hard.

Word: Topiary
Meaning: the art of clipping shrubs into ornamental shapes
Example: I like to engage in topiary from time to time; though my favorite shape to cut shrubs into is that of animals.

Word: Topic
Meaning: the subject or theme of a conversation; book; piece of art; etc
Example: Recipes are a usual topic of conversation between the friends since they both like to cook.

Word: Topical
Meaning: pertaining to putting something on a human’s body part usually for medical purposes
Example: After the girl’s foot muscles were aching; she rubbed a topical cream to soothe her throbbing and sore feet.

Word: Topical
Meaning: up to date and relevant to current events
Example: Police shootings of unarmed citizens is a topical issue that is relevant to communities around the country in 2018.

Word: Topography
Meaning: a detailed depiction of an area
Example: The three dimensional map provides a vivid image of the continent’s topography.

Word: Topple
Meaning: to tumble over
Example: Placing the bowling ball onto the flimsy table caused it to topple over onto the floor.

Word: Topsoil
Meaning: the upper level of dirt on the ground
Example: Since the topsoil is rich in nutrients; many plants will flourish since their roots are planted there.

Word: Topsy-turvy
Meaning: upside down or reversed from the way it should be
Example: The political climate is a state of topsy-turvy where every day the world seems more upside down.

Word: Torah
Meaning: the five books found in the beginning of the holy book of the Judaism religion
Example: Reading the Torah; the young Jewish boy became interested in his faith at such a young age.

Word: Torch
Meaning: to intentionally burn something with fire
Example: A rookie chef realized at the last minute that he needed to torch the crème brulee before serving it to the customer.

Word: Tore
Meaning: ripped or split
Example: The gardener tore here favorite dress after getting the hem caught on a rosebush.

Word: Torment
Meaning: to torture and cause pain
Example: Every day when he got on the bus; the bully began to torment the quiet child.

Word: Torn
Meaning: to have ripped or split something apart
Example: As I flipped through the ancient book; I noticed the pages were torn due to it being used so many times.

Word: Tornado
Meaning: a storm involving a revolving cone-shaped cloud with very damaging winds
Example: Kansas declared a state of emergency due to the excessive damage caused by the tornado that came through their state.

Word: Torpedo
Meaning: an underwater weapon that is in the shape of a long tube used as a bomb sent out to destroy other ships
Example: When the war submarine observed the enemy ship in the near distance; the submarine sent a torpedo in its direction.

Word: Torpid
Meaning: lazy or inactive
Example: My torpid brother rests on the couch all day.

Word: Torpor
Meaning: the state of being motionless or inactive
Example: After overeating on Christmas; I fell into a satisfied torpor.

Word: Torque
Meaning: the turning or spinning by force
Example: An automotive expert determined the amount of torque needed to ensure that the car would travel at its maximum speed.

Word: Torrent
Meaning: a huge and heavy cascade of water or other material
Example: With the torrent of rain; I grabbed my umbrella to go outside but really just wanted to remain inside.

Word: Torrential
Meaning: falling rapidly and in large quantities
Example: The flash flood sent a torrential stream of rain through the city streets.

Word: Torrential
Meaning: a large amount of continuously flowing water
Example: Monsoons occur in the Amazon rainforest and feature torrential rainfall that doesn't stop for several weeks.

Word: Torrid 
Meaning: extremely sweltering and dry
Example: During these torrid temperatures; it is best we stay indoors and consume lots of fluids.

Word: Torsion
Meaning: twisting one side or at one point with the other side or point remaining the same
Example: “Due to the torsion of the nerve;” the doctor stated to his patient; “you may feel pain near your neck but your back should feel fine.”

Word: Torso
Meaning: part of the body from the neck down excluding the limbs
Example: Since the man’s t-shirt and shorts covered his torso; he decided to get a tattoo so no one could see it through his clothes.

Word: Tort
Meaning: a wrongdoing; not including contract violations resulting in harm and compensation
Example: After the young man was caught stealing expensive electronics from Ms. Davis’s house; the homeowner sued the young man for tort to redeem the cost of the stolen items.

Word: Tortoise
Meaning: used to refer to anything that is particularly slow moving
Example: While it took me an hour to finish the race; it took my tortoise of a cousin three hours to finish.

Word: Tortuous
Meaning: containing coils; turns and curves
Example: When the tortuous snake moved across the Sahara Desert; his body made an S-shape in the sand.

Word: Torture
Meaning: to purposefully cause or do harm or hurt to someone
Example: Beneath the demented psychopath’s home; he had built a chamber to torture his victims after he kidnapped them.

Word: Toss
Meaning: to throw something lightly or casually
Example: I didn’t want to break my phone; so I decided to toss it on my bed rather than throw it.

Word: Totalitarian
Meaning: associated with a system of governance in which the government controls everything
Example: Some people feel the government is trying to take our civilian rights and turn our nation into a totalitarian state.

Word: Totality
Meaning: the whole or entirety of something
Example: The twenty six letters in the English language make up the totality of the English alphabet.

Word: Totally
Meaning: completely or absolutely
Example: Because the bomb left absolutely nothing left of the city it had been dropped on; the report said that the city had been totally destroyed.

Word: Tote
Meaning: to carry or wield something
Example: Help me tote this heavy box all the way to the other end of the driveway; because I can’t do it by myself.

Word: Totem
Meaning: a natural object or animal a society adopts as an emblem because they believe it has spiritual significance
Example: In Native American society; the Eagle is a very powerful totem; a symbol of great spiritual significance.

Word: Totter
Meaning: to move with an unsteady or unsure gait or walk
Example: Disoriented; I had no choice but to totter towards the edge of the skating rink to grab a hold of the wall before I fell again.

Word: Touch
Meaning: to make physical contact with an object
Example: If you want to touch another person; you will have to be close enough to lay your hand on them.

Word: Touchstone
Meaning: a standard by which something is judged
Example: I used the essay that I received a perfect score on as a touchstone for the other essays I had to write later; so I could get a high score on them as well.

Word: Tough
Meaning: pertaining to something sturdy and that can endure harshness
Example: With the tough weather of severe thunderstorms approaching; the little boat was in danger of capsizing.

Word: Toughness
Meaning: the act of being solid and effortless
Example: Toughness exuded from the young man since he could take any insult and punch without even flinching.

Word: Tour
Meaning: a fun trip with several detailed stops
Example: When the cruise ship passengers’ tour stopped by the local pub; winery and museum; many people were amazed at the sights.

Word: Tourism
Meaning: an industry pertaining to vacationers
Example: Myrtle Beach in South Carolina was created for tourism since it is so close to a warm beach.

Word: Tourist
Meaning: a person who journeys to a place for fun
Example: When the tourist needed information about the local attractions; he consulted the concierge at his hotel for suggestions.

Word: Tourniquet
Meaning: a medical apparatus that is tied around a limb to cut off the blood flow
Example: When the soldier’s leg was ripped off; a medic had to apply a tourniquet around the top part of his thigh so he would not bleed to death.

Word: Tousle 
Meaning: to put into disorder
Example: The blowing wind began to tousle the woman’s hair into a tangled mess.

Word: Tout
Meaning: to brag or flaunt
Example: Listening to the basketball player tout his skill becomes boring after a while.

Word: Tow
Meaning: to haul a vehicle out from somewhere or as an attachment
Example: In order to get the boat out of the water; we had to tow it up the ramp and onto the dock with our heavy duty truck.

Word: Tower
Meaning: a soaring but slender structure
Example: With the clock tower in the middle of the town square; everyone would have to look up the brick thin building to the sky to see the time.

Word: Tower
Meaning: to rise to a great height
Example: Because his wife was so short; 6 foot Ramirez seemed to tower over her.

Word: Town
Meaning: a little place similar to a city
Example: Leadership in the town had dwindled to just a few officials since the population had decreased in size since many people had moved to the big city.

Word: Toxic
Meaning: lethal or fatal
Example: After drinking the toxic substance; the man’s face ballooned to three sizes its normal size before he died.

Word: Toxicity
Meaning: the quality of being toxic or poisonous
Example: The drink showed no toxicity even though it was mixed with a strong poison.

Word: Toxicology
Meaning: the scientific study of fatal substances
Example: A few months after the autopsy; the toxicology report showed that the deceased woman had large amounts of cyanide in her system.

Word: Toxin
Meaning: a substance from plants that is dangerous to ingest sometimes causing sickness rather than death
Example: In order to rid the body of the toxin; many times the body’s initial reaction will cause diarrhea.

Word: Toy
Meaning: a kid’s item intended for fun
Example: At Christmas; my child always received her favorite toy to play with so that she would be happy and occupied for the rest of the day.

Word: Trace
Meaning: to reproduce a design or word by rewriting or re-sketching it onto the piece of paper or other surface
Example: Many children begin to learn how to write their letters by their teaching requiring them to trace over the dashed letters on a worksheet.

Word: Trachea
Meaning: the windpipe of the human body; that is used to transfer air to and from the lungs when your breath
Example: If you punch someone in the throat hard enough; you may crush their trachea and prevent them from breathing; which will kill them.

Word: Track
Meaning: to follow or trail a person or thing
Example: A GPS system was used to track the stolen vehicle and return it to its rightful owner.

Word: Tract
Meaning: a large area or region
Example: Each tract of land is being sold at the price of 1;000 dollars per acre.

Word: Tractable
Meaning: controlled or directed with ease
Example: The dog was more tractable when he wore the vibrating collar.

Word: Traction
Meaning: power or grip that causes a moving thing to stick against the surface
Example: The truck driver searched for a good set of tires that would get good traction on wet roads.

Word: Tractor
Meaning: a vehicle with a motor and large; heavy treaded tires that is used for pulling farm machinery
Example: Using a tractor; the gardener was able to till the tract of land for planting.

Word: Trade-off
Meaning: a compromise in which one thing is traded for something of equal value
Example: As part of the divorce trade-off; the husband has agreed to give his wife the vehicle in exchange for the boat.

Word: Trade
Meaning: to swap or exchange
Example: Before money was used to buy things; Native Americans would trade shells and other objects to get the things they needed.

Word: Trademark
Meaning: a symbol or logo
Example: The McDonald’s famous m-shaped arch is a trademark that is recognized all over the world.

Word: Tradition
Meaning: a cultural custom; ritual; or practice
Example: Members of the Dani tribe of Indonesia have a strange tradition of cutting off parts of their fingers when a loved one dies.

Word: Traditional
Meaning: keeping with long-standing traditions or customs
Example: The same traditional Passover foods are eaten by our family year after year.

Word: Traduce
Meaning: to harm someone’s reputation by speaking of them in a negative manner
Example: The crooked politician paid a newspaper editor to traduce his rivals.

Word: Traffic
Meaning: vehicles or people moving in an area
Example: Traffic creeped to a halt after a car wreck happened just past the bridge.

Word: Tragedy
Meaning: a disastrous event; especially one involving great loss of life or injury
Example: Having claimed the lives of all passengers; the car accident was a great tragedy.

Word: Tragic
Meaning: extremely sad; often involving death and suffering
Example: Emmett Till’s tragic murder was one of the saddest events in our country’s history.

Word: Trail
Meaning: a path; usually through a countryside or wooded area
Example: Trail guides led the visitors down the beaten path and to the entrance of the deep cave.

Word: Trailblazer
Meaning: the first person or thing to accomplish something groundbreaking or revolutionary
Example: The doctor’s goal is to be a medical trailblazer and discover a universal cure for cancer.

Word: Train
Meaning: to teach or coach
Example: Some workers have been asked to train the newcomers on how to use the machines.

Word: Train
Meaning: to teach a person or animal a particular skill
Example: The animal trainer used treats to train the dog to sit on command.

Word: Trainwreck
Meaning: a disastrous or devastating situation that ends in ruin
Example: This football season was an utter trainwreck and ended disastrously for the losing team.

Word: Traipse
Meaning: a leisurely and generally purposeless walk
Example: Every Sunday the voracious reader loved to traipse down several blocks to every independent bookstore without any intention of actually buying anything.

Word: Trait
Meaning: a critical characteristic of a person’s personality
Example: Honesty is a trait that most parents greatly value in their children; as nothing is more troublesome than someone who lies to their parents.

Word: Traitor
Meaning: someone who betrays trust; alliance; or duty
Example: Judas is a notorious Biblical traitor.

Word: Trajectory
Meaning: a course or route taken
Example: If the missile alters the trajectory of just one of the planets; the two bodies will not collide.

Word: Trammel
Meaning: to restrain or restrict one’s freedom
Example: The parents were careful not to trammel their son’s dreams of being a dancer even though he had no rhythm.

Word: Tramp
Meaning: a heavy-footed walk
Example: Angry children tramp noisily up the stairs; making sure to stomp out their irritation.

Word: Trample
Meaning: to crush; disfigure; maim; etc.; by walking or running over something
Example: The girl walked lightly through the garden; carefully watching her feet so that she didn’t trample the beautiful flowers.

Word: Trance
Meaning: a dazed state where one wanders without active knowledge that they are doing so
Example: The girl was in such a trance that she didn’t even flinch when her friend snapped his fingers in front of her face.

Word: Tranche
Meaning: a portion of something; especially money
Example: A tranche of the Wallstreet stocks was transferred from one stockholder to the other.

Word: Tranquil
Meaning: relaxed; peaceful
Example: Since we were the only ones on the beach; we enjoyed a tranquil day.

Word: Tranquilize
Meaning: the act of drugging or incapacitating in order to calm
Example: The doctors were forced to tranquilize the hysterical woman before she her herself.

Word: Transact
Meaning: the act of completing an action where one or more sides benefit; typically applies to sales
Example: Bank tellers transact withdrawals and deposits daily.

Word: Transaction
Meaning: the act of exchanging something for something else; whether it be an idea; goods; money; labor; or alliances
Example: The cashier asked the customer if she wanted a receipt for her transaction.

Word: Transatlantic
Meaning: something that crosses the Atlantic Ocean
Example: The exchange student was exhilarated as she took her first transatlantic flight from New York to Moscow.

Word: Transcend 
Meaning: to exceed the limits of something
Example: The athlete hoped the increased training would allow him to transcend Olympic records.

Word: Transcendent
Meaning: surpassing the ordinary; exceptional
Example: In order to completely identify with the plot of the science fiction movie; you must be able to consider the idea of transcendent experiences that allow people to enter the minds of others.

Word: Transcendental
Meaning: supernatural or beyond the human experience
Example: Jesus and Buddha are both transcendental heroes whose experiences go past a simply human one.

Word: Transcontinental
Meaning: extending or crossing a continent
Example: The first transcontinental telegraph connected an existing network in the east of the U.S. to a smaller network in California.

Word: Transcribe
Meaning: to change a form of communication into another form
Example: The medical transcriptionist will transcribe the doctor’s notes by typing them into the computer.

Word: Transcript
Meaning: a written or printed copy of material
Example: No one is allowed to view the trial transcript because the file is sealed.

Word: Transcription
Meaning: a written or printed representation of something
Example: You can listen to the audio version of the podcast or wait to read the transcription.

Word: Transect
Meaning: to cut or split crosswise
Example: My daughter will only eat her sandwich if I transect it and slice off the edges.

Word: Transfer
Meaning: to move or relocate something
Example: The banker agreed to transfer the client’s money to a different type of account since he was unhappy with the current fees.

Word: Transference
Meaning: a psychological phenomenon in which an individual redirects emotions and feelings from one person to another
Example: In a transference roleplay; the therapist pretended to be the client’s mother and let her act out her feelings of anger.

Word: Transfigure
Meaning: to fully change or transform into something different than the original form
Example: A group of wizards worked together to transfigure the fiery dragon into a meek mouse.

Word: Transfix
Meaning: to captivate or hypnotize something; making them motionless
Example: The spellbinding songstress was able to transfix the crowd with her captivating singing.

Word: Transfixed
Meaning: so interested; surprised; or afraid that you are unable to move / to pierce with a sharp pointed weapon
Example: As she walked down the aisle; the entire gathering sat transfixed on her.

Word: Transform
Meaning: to alter in form or appearance
Example: A new hairstyle will totally transform your appearance.

Word: Transfusion
Meaning: the process of adding an amount of blood to the body of a person or animal
Example: Although it used to happen when receiving blood; it is very rare to get HIV from a transfusion these days.

Word: Transgress
Meaning: to act in violation of some law
Example: People who transgress the boundaries of social etiquette will be politely turned away at the door.

Word: Transgression
Meaning: the violation of a duty; law; or moral principle
Example: The judge will decide the penalty for my transgression.

Word: Transgressor
Meaning: wrongdoer; offender
Example: Forgiveness of a transgressor who wrongs you is one of the important rules of the Christian faith.

Word: Transient
Meaning: lasting only for a short time; impermanent
Example: The snow is transient and will melt as soon as the sun appears.

Word: Transistor
Meaning: a small device that controls the flow of electricity in radios; computers; televisions; etc.
Example: Passing the electronic signal; the transistor functioned perfectly and helped the energy flow.

Word: Transit
Meaning: the carrying of people; goods; or materials from one place to another
Example: The transit agency works to find cheap transportation for people to take to work.

Word: Transition
Meaning: a change or conversion from one position or phase to a different position or phase
Example: When preschoolers transition into kindergarten; they must modify their learning to adhere to the rules as well as get used to stronger academic expectations.

Word: Transitional
Meaning: belonging or relating to a change
Example: Transitional housing is often needed for people who get out of prison but have no place to go.

Word: Transitory
Meaning: not permanent; temporary
Example: Unfortunately; the homeless people can only stay in the transitory shelter for a short period of time.

Word: Translation
Meaning: the act or product of changing a text; document; speech; etc.; from one language to another
Example: Advanced Russian students were required to perform an on the spot translation of Gogol’s The Overcoat in order to graduate.

Word: Translucent
Meaning: partially transparent
Example: Because Jenna is a proper young lady; she wore a sheath under her translucent wedding dress.

Word: Transmission
Meaning: a message sent through a transmitting device; such as a satellite or radio
Example: The radio transmission came through on our end loud and clear; allowing us to hear the President’s speech.

Word: Transmit
Meaning: to cause something to pass from one person or place to another
Example: We use telephones to transmit our voices from wherever we are to the location of the person we are talking to.

Word: Transmitter
Meaning: equipment that uses electromagnetic waves to carry signals over radio or television
Example: The transmitter is being used to send the XM signal to any nearby FM radio.

Word: Transmogrify
Meaning: to magically transform into a different shape or form
Example: High on pain medicine; the patient thought she saw a nurse transmogrify into a poodle.

Word: Transmundane
Meaning: existing outside the physical world that we can see
Example: Because he believes in transmundane beings; the writer pens stories about galaxies that are out of this world.

Word: Transmute
Meaning: to change or alter appearance or form
Example: After years of therapy; the woman was able to transmute her negative thoughts into positive ones.

Word: Transparency
Meaning: openness; clearness
Example: Media outlets are calling for the president to embrace transparency and be open with his financial documents.

Word: Transparent
Meaning: see-through; clear
Example: Bill could see Jan’s bra through her transparent blouse.

Word: Transpiration
Meaning: the process in which plants absorb water and then give off water vapor through pores in their leaves
Example: Plant roots absorb and release moisture from the ground during transpiration.

Word: Transpire
Meaning: to occur or take place
Example: The police sat in their cruiser and waited for a criminal act to transpire.

Word: Transplant
Meaning: to relocate or move something
Example: The couple decided to transplant themselves in a new city so that they could get a fresh start.

Word: Transpontine
Meaning: situated on the other side of a bridge or ocean
Example: The transpontine city is situated just on the other side of the Golden Gate Bridge.

Word: Transport
Meaning: to use a vehicle to take people or goods from one place or another
Example: We use large ships to transport large amounts of goods and supplies across the ocean; because it is more cost effective than using planes.

Word: Transpose
Meaning: means to reorder or cause (two or more things) to change places with each other
Example: For the student; the most difficult part of dealing with dyslexia was his tendency to transpose numbers that were side by side.

Word: Transubstantiation
Meaning: the process by which the bread and wine of the Eucharist is transformed into the body and blood of Jesus Christ
Example: Some churches do not believe in transubstantiation and argue that bread and wine of the Eucharist is not actually turned into the body or blood of Jesus.

Word: Transverse
Meaning: situated or lying across
Example: Transverse nerve cords run across the body like rungs on a ladder.

Word: Trap
Meaning: to catch or ensnare
Example: Using magic to trap people; the witch would not take the sleeping spell away.

Word: Trapeze
Meaning: a gymnastic or acrobatic apparatus made of a short bar hanging high up in the air from two ropes
Example: Swinging from the trapeze; the acrobat did crowd wowing tricks as she dangled on the bar.

Word: Trapezoid
Meaning: a flat; four-sided shape that has two sides that are parallel and two sides that are not parallel
Example: After kicking the soccer ball into the trapezoid shaped goal; the player and his teammates cheered for joy.

Word: Trappings
Meaning: the outward signs or objects related to a particular situation
Example: The horror movie had all the usual trappings including screaming and blood.

Word: Trauma
Meaning: a deeply distressing experience than can cause someone long term emotional pain
Example: The trauma of living in a concentration camp was a suffering that the survivors couldn’t get over easily.

Word: Traumatic
Meaning: extremely disturbing or upsetting
Example: Traumatic events caused the girl to be afraid of going to sleep without a light on.

Word: Traumatized
Meaning: to cause someone to become extremely upset in a way that causes serious emotional problems
Example: Being robbed at work traumatized the store clerk leaving her too afraid to leave her home.

Word: Travail
Meaning: to work hard or with a great deal of effort
Example: Since Scott was not a very good worker; nobody expected him to volunteer to travail to help the team meet the deadline.

Word: Travel
Meaning: to journey somewhere; though it is typically a great distance or abroad
Example: Because we want to see more of the world on vacation this year; we are going to travel to Europe from our suburban American neighborhood.

Word: Traveler
Meaning: someone who journeys from one place to another; typically over a great distance
Example: The old traveler has been all around the world; from the towering pyramids of Egypt to the great snow fields of Siberia.

Word: Travelogue
Meaning: a telling of the places visited and things experienced by a traveler
Example: The movie we saw was a documentary; a travelogue that showed us all the places the main character had visited throughout his life.

Word: Traverse 
Meaning: to travel a rough path
Example: To get to the highest mountain peak in the world; we will have to traverse a very rocky path.

Word: Travesty
Meaning: a false or distorted representation of something; usually of something serious
Example: It would be a travesty of justice to put an innocent man in jail.

Word: Trawler
Meaning: a ship that is used for trawling; which is fishing by dragging a net across the seabed
Example: The trawler towed a very large net through the water behind it; catching hundreds of fish from the sea floor.

Word: Tray
Meaning: a shallow and flat container with a rim typically used for carrying food
Example: Most school cafeteria’s hand out a tray for you to put your food on; though it is sometimes questionable if they are clean or not.

Word: Treacherous 
Meaning: unsafe
Example: Drivers are asked to stay home and avoid the treacherous icy roads.

Word: Treachery
Meaning: betrayal or deceptive action
Example: Benedict Arnold is infamous for the treachery that he displayed when he turned on the Revolutionary Army during the Revolutionary War.

Word: Treacle
Meaning: mushy or emotional sentimentality

Word: Tread
Meaning: to walk; step; or trample with your feet

Word: Treason
Meaning: the offense of betraying a nation
Example: When the soldier sold military secrets to a foreign government; he was arrested for the crime of treason.

Word: Treasure
Meaning: to greatly value something
Example: This gift means a lot to me; and I will make sure that I treasure it for as long as I live; no matter how long that may be.

Word: Treat
Meaning: to behave towards someone in a certain manner
Example: You should treat the elderly with care and respect; since they have a lot more wisdom and experience than you.

Word: Treatise
Meaning: a serious book or piece of writing about some subject
Example: I read Josh’s treatise on the Civil War and found it to be very informative.

Word: Treaty
Meaning: a formal agreement between countries
Example: The Treaty of Versailles officially ended World War I and was signed in France in 1919.

Word: Tree
Meaning: a woody perennial plant typically with a single trunk and lateral branches near the top that takes in carbon dioxide and produces oxygen
Example: The tree was struck by lightning; igniting it and starting a forest fire that spread to the other trees in the woods.

Word: Trek
Meaning: a long and usually difficult journey; typically carried out on foot
Example: In order to make it to Grandma’s house; we will have to trek over the mountains and through the woods.

Word: Trellis
Meaning: a framework of solid bars used as a support for unstable objects
Example: Because the sapling is too weak to stand up straight on its own; we planted a trellis made of wooden bars around it to help it stand.

Word: Tremble
Meaning: to shake uncontrollably; usually from fear or excitement
Example: Being terrified of snakes; I could not help but tremble at the sight of a boa constrictor; even behind the glass of the zoo exhibit.

Word: Tremendous
Meaning: massive; huge; or giant in scope
Example: The tsunami that crashed into the coastline was so tremendous that it destroyed half of the entire city; flooding it with water.

Word: Tremor
Meaning: a weak or very slight earthquake
Example: Because we live on a fault line; we feel a weak tremor that rattles the picture frames on our wall every once in a while.

Word: Tremulous
Meaning: shaking or quivering
Example: Her voice was weak and tremulous; but the audience clapped politely when she finished the aria.

Word: Trench
Meaning: a long; narrow hole in the ground; that is usually deep and has a purpose
Example: The car swerved off the road and into a deep trench full of rainwater.

Word: Trenchant
Meaning: sharp or cutting
Example: Marvin’s trenchant wit made him a popular speaker at conservative fundraisers.

Word: Trend
Meaning: something fashionable or popular for a finite period of time
Example: When Starbucks embraced the unicorn food trend with a new rainbow frappucino; they sold out in mere hours.

Word: Trepidation
Meaning: a nervous or fearful feeling
Example: Shaking with trepidation; the young man faced his fear of heights by skydiving.

Word: Trespass
Meaning: to enter someone else's property illegally
Example: Hoping no one would see him trespass; the hunter ignored the sign and headed in to the woods.

Word: Trestle
Meaning: a framework comprised of a horizontal beam and two sloping legs; often used to support a flat surface like a table or a bridge
Example: Most bridges need some sort of support to help them stand; and this bridge has a trestle made of steel in the corner holding it up.

Word: Triad
Meaning: a grouping of three
Example: Adam’s family forms a triad as he is an only child; with no brothers or sisters.

Word: Triage
Meaning: to sort by a particular attribute
Example: The purpose of the automated phone system is to triage calls so they can be routed to the proper customer service agent.

Word: Trial
Meaning: a court hearing held to decide if an accused person is guilty or innocent
Example: Students in the criminal justice course took part in a make believe trial in which some were attorneys and others jurors.

Word: Triangular
Meaning: shaped like a triangle with three sides and three corners
Example: The pizza’s triangular shape had two cheesy sides and one section of crust.

Word: Triathlon
Meaning: an athletic event that includes three separate events (usually running; cycling; and swimming)
Example: The third event of the triathlon was difficult for the athlete since she was already tired from cycling and running.

Word: Tribal
Meaning: relating to an ethnic group of people that live together as a nation (a tribe)
Example: The tribal council held a meeting to see who would be elected as the next chief of the tribe.

Word: Tribe
Meaning: a group of people; usually related to Native Americans
Example: Because few people still speak the dialect of the tribe; the population’s language is considered endangered.

Word: Tribulation 
Meaning: a challenging situation or experience
Example: When creating his multimillion dollar software company; Mark learned from each tribulation he faced.

Word: Tribunal
Meaning: an assembly including one or more judges to conduct judicial business
Example: To discuss the prospect building a park in the subdivision; the neighborhood tribunal met.

Word: Tributary
Meaning: a stream of water that enters into a larger body of water
Example: As it flowed into the river; the tributary provided fresh water for the village.

Word: Tribute
Meaning: a way to honor a person
Example: The concert is a tribute to the men and women of the military who protect our nation.

Word: Trick
Meaning: a cunning scheme intentionally designed to deceive someone
Example: My little sister has always been fond of tricks; constantly plotting schemes she can use to trap us in one of her silly pranks.

Word: Trickery
Meaning: the practice of being deceitful and dishonest
Example: The sly fox continued his trickery; sneaking into the hen house when the farmer wasn’t looking.

Word: Trickle
Meaning: a very thin flow
Example: There was a slow trickle of water from the faucet in the bathroom.

Word: Trickledown
Meaning: refers to situations in which something that starts in the high parts of a system spreads to the lower parts
Example: Because of the trickledown process; some car features that were once only found in high-end vehicles are now standard.

Word: Trifecta
Meaning: a set or combination of three things
Example: The three girls’ voices created a beautiful trifecta over the loudspeaker.

Word: Trifle
Meaning: to handle with disrespect or in a discourteous manner
Example: When the cat catches the mouse; it will trifle with it before ending its life.

Word: Trifling
Meaning: having little value or importance
Example: My time is too valuable to spend on trifling matters that have little worth.

Word: Trigger
Meaning: to initiate something
Example: Anxiety has been known to trigger asthma attacks.

Word: Trilateral
Meaning: involving three groups or countries
Example: The meeting was trilateral between three departments in the company.

Word: Trilogy
Meaning: a group of three things which are related
Example: The first book in the trilogy sets the course for the other two books in the series.

Word: Trim
Meaning: to make something neater by cutting away excess or irregular parts
Example: Rather than mow the lawn; I decided that I would trim unseemly bushes in my neighbor’s yard for a little extra cash.

Word: Trinket
Meaning: a small showy ornament or piece of jewelry
Example: Before returning from vacation; I purchased a cheap trinket for my daughter Robyn.

Word: Trio
Meaning: a group of three people or things
Example: Of the trio; Bruce was the one that rose to fame and eventually broke off from the other two.

Word: Tripod
Meaning: a stand with three legs that is used to support an object; usually a camera
Example: Placing the camera on the tripod; the photographer adjusted the stand to get the perfect shot.

Word: Trisect
Meaning: to divide something into three parts
Example: I decided to trisect the candy bar so that my two friends could share it with me.

Word: Trite
Meaning: unoriginal and lacking in importance
Example: I did not finish the novel because the story’s plot was trite and uninspiring.

Word: Triumph
Meaning: a final success or victory
Example: Surviving brain cancer is Mark’s biggest triumph in life.

Word: Triumphant
Meaning: experiencing a feeling of success
Example: The triumphant graduates could not wait to celebrate their achievements.

Word: Triumvirate
Meaning: a group of three
Example: Our company created a triumvirate structure where Ted; Mark and James are all CEOs.

Word: Trivia
Meaning: quiz game with little-known and unimportant facts
Example: I love to compete in trivia contests because I know so many random facts.

Word: Trivial
Meaning: of little significance or value
Example: Despite having lived what he considered to be a trivial life; George had actually had a tremendous impact on everyone he knew.

Word: Triviality
Meaning: the unimportance and insignificance of something irrelevant
Example: Because of the issue’s triviality; the businessman decided to work on more important matters.

Word: Trivialize
Meaning: to make something seem unimportant
Example: The abused woman tried to trivialize the horrible cruelty.

Word: Trodden
Meaning: heavily walked upon
Example: This road is heavily trodden; being walked by dozens of people every day and trampling the dirt into the ground.

Word: Troglodyte
Meaning: a reclusive individual that shuns society and actively enjoys solitude
Example: The famous writer was a well-known troglodyte who holed up in a cabin for months at a time without a single visitor.

Word: Troika
Meaning: three components that make up a whole; whether it be group; idea; alliance; etc
Example: The Three Musketeers are a famous literary troika.

Word: Trolley
Meaning: a vehicle; usually that resembles a rectangular bus that is powered by electricity and runs on a cable or track
Example: A red electrical trolley loops from downtown Moscow to the university.

Word: Troop
Meaning: a group of individuals that belongs to a larger organization
Example: A troop of UN Peacekeepers were dispatched to the war-torn and devastated areas of Syria.

Word: Trope
Meaning: commonly used technique or idea generally used so often that it becomes expected or a cliche
Example: Love at first sight is an overused romance trope.

Word: Trophic Level
Meaning: the living things that are on the same level in the food chain
Example: Since these two animals were located in the same trophic level; witnesses realized that they were both herbivores.

Word: Trophy
Meaning: an item that symbolizes and commemorates an event or triumph
Example: The Spelling Bee champion proudly displayed his trophy on the fireplace mantle where everyone could see it.

Word: Tropical
Meaning: has attributes of warm climate; greenery; and usually consists of beaches
Example: Snowbirds are seasonal travelers who move to tropical locations during the winter.

Word: Tropism
Meaning: natural talent for
Example: Leonardo da Vinci had a scientific tropism that allowed him to not only excel at drawing perfectly proportioned anatomy but to craft some of the greatest inventions known to man.

Word: Troposphere
Meaning: part of the atmosphere where visible weather changes occur
Example: Meteorologists analyze shifting weather patterns in the troposphere in order to predict the forecast.

Word: Trot out
Meaning: to show someone or something in public to get attention
Example: The attention-seeking cheerleading team will trot out on the field in glittery mini-skirts.

Word: Trot
Meaning: to take on a quick pace
Example: The horse picked up his pace until he moved at a quick trot.

Word: Troth
Meaning: to swear loyalty; fealty; or fidelity
Example: The knights of Camelot pledged their troth to King Arthur.

Word: Troubadour
Meaning: a traveling or local musician/poet that sings of folk legends and history
Example: In Medieval times; royalty often hired a court troubadour to sing their praises in the form of love ballads and bawdy drinking songs.

Word: Trouble
Meaning: difficulty or problem
Example: My grandmother always calls me when she is having trouble working her computer.

Word: Trouble
Meaning: an act or action that causes a disturbance or alteration to a typically calm or normal setting
Example: When people started rioting in the streets; the government knew that trouble was on the horizon.

Word: Troubled
Meaning: to be worried; concerned; or bothered with/by something
Example: The investor was troubled by the plummeting numbers in the stock market.

Meaning: a person who causes lots of problems and issues
Example: Jessica is an office troublemaker who always causes issues between coworkers at the firm.

Word: Troubleshoot
Meaning: to resolve common issues or problems
Example: The tech tried to troubleshoot the customer’s internet issue over the phone but couldn’t resolve the issue.

Word: Troublesome
Meaning: something that is irritating; difficult; or more hassle than you want to deal with
Example: The most troublesome thing in the world of driving is when everyone stops to look at an accident; slowing down traffic in your lane.

Word: Trough
Meaning: a long and narrow open container used to feed animals
Example: The trough has been filled with hay; so the horses can walk up and eat whenever they want.

Meaning: to severely defeat someone
Example: In the contest of strength; the full grown man managed to trounce his teenaged opponent with no effort whatsoever.

Meaning: another word for pants
Example: I need a new pair of trousers because I accidentally tore a hole in my old pair when I fell earlier.

Word: Trousseau
Meaning: the clothes collected by a bride for her marriage
Example: The bride brought an entire wardrobe to the marriage as her trousseau; practically filling the small closet of the man’s home.

Meaning: a freshwater fish related to the salmon that is often caught for food or sport (Merriam)
Example: The fisherman felt a tug on the line and in reeled in a 10 pound trout.

Meaning: a collection of things
Example: I hope to find a trove of Easter eggs on the hunt today.

Example: The truant hid in the park to avoid taking his midterm exams.

Word: Turncoat

Word: Typhus
Meaning: any of various bacterial diseases caused by rickettsial bacteria that is transmitted by lice or fleas and causes a rash; severe fever and headache; and confusion
Example: Scientists think the great plague in 430 B.C. Athens was a typhus outbreak since many who died suffered from severe rashes and headaches.

Word: Unchanged
