Word: Uncharacteristic
Meaning: unusual; abnormal
Example: Disappearing was uncharacteristic for the elderly man; so the police sent out a search party.

Word: Uncharted
Meaning: not surveyed; mapped; or investigated
Example: Ships should not sail in uncharted waters; because they might get lost.

Word: Uncomfortable
Meaning: not at ease or relaxed
Example: An uncomfortable feeling crept over the woman as she walked alone in the dark alley.

Word: Uncompromising
Meaning: steady and unshakable; adamant
Example: The ethical nurse was awarded an excellence honor for her uncompromising commitment to her patients during tough times.

Word: Unconditional
Meaning: having no controls or limits
Example: The mother’s love for her son was unconditional and she loved him no matter what mistakes he made.

Word: Unconducive
Meaning: not favorable or not encouraging
Example: Constant moving around can make a classroom unconducive for taking test.

Word: Unconformity
Meaning: a geological occurrence in which there is erosion of rock and then new sedimentary rock is deposited on top
Example: The geologist explained that an unconformity shows the time during which no sediments were well-kept in an area.

Word: Uncongenial
Meaning: not friendly or welcoming
Example: The woman’s uncongenial dining companions on the cruise ship were rude the entire dinner.

Word: Unconscionable
Meaning: not right or unreasonable
Example: Allowing blind people the right to drive is not only foolish; but it is unconscionable.

Word: Unconscious
Meaning: comatose and unaware of what is going on
Example: I was unconscious during the surgery and didn’t have any idea what had happened until I woke up.

Word: Unconstitutional
Meaning: illegal and unlawful according to America’s Constitution
Example: Stopping the media from publishing truthful articles is unconstitutional since Americans have the right to freedom of speech.

Word: Unconstrained
Meaning: free and not restricted or restrained
Example: Swimming in the pool under the stars; the relaxed woman felt free and unconstrained.

Word: Uncontrollable
Meaning: wild and unable to be tamed or controlled
Example: Lashing out at everyone he is close to; Alex was rarely able to reign in his uncontrollable temper.

Word: Unconventional
Meaning: unusual; eccentric
Example: The gay man and lesbian woman’s unconventional marriage seemed strange to those who didn’t know them personally.

Word: Uncouth
Meaning: having a lack of acceptable manners
Example: While George comes from a very wealthy family; he often behaves in an uncouth manner and acts as though he has no social skills at all.

Word: Uncover
Meaning: to disclose or unearth something that was once hidden
Example: The explorers set out to uncover the location of the Holy Grail; but never found the legendary object.

Word: Unction
Meaning: an anointing for a ceremonial or religious purpose
Example: I hope you can attend my daughter’s baptismal unction.

Word: Unctuous
Meaning: not expressing true feelings; pretending to display true feelings
Example: Find me a politician without an unctuous personality; and I’ll pay you a million bucks!

Word: Undaunted
Meaning: not intimidated or discouraged by a difficulty or danger
Example: Soldiers seemed undaunted by the mission and bravely marched into battle.

Word: Undecided
Meaning: unsure; In doubt
Example: The senior was undecided on his major and needed more time to think about what career path he would choose.

Word: Undefeated
Meaning: having never suffered a defeat or a loss
Example: Filipe’s team is undefeated and hasn’t lost a single football game all year.

Word: Undefined
Meaning: unclear; vague
Example: The rules were undefined; leaving many employees to break them without even knowing.

Word: Undeniable
Meaning: clearly true; a fact that can’t be denied
Example: The young artist has an undeniable talent for painting that is recognized by everyone at his school.

Word: Undeniably
Meaning: emphasizing that something is clearly true and can’t be denied
Example: Data shows that our school is undeniably the best in the district.

Word: Under the weather
Meaning: used to describe being sick or overall feeling less than optimal
Example: I was feeling a bit under the weather; so I didn’t bother eating dinner that night with my sour stomach taken into account.

Word: Underbelly
Meaning: the underpart of an animal or object
Example: Most of the toad’s body is rough and bumpy; but his underbelly is flat and smooth.

Word: Underbrush
Meaning: shrubs; bushes; or small trees growing beneath large trees
Example: The thick underbrush covered the old tombstone; leaving it barely visible beneath the shrubs.

Word: Undercurrent
Meaning: a current of water moving below the surface
Example: Although the river appears calm on top; a strong undercurrent under the water’s surface can drown even the most skilled swimmer.

Word: Underdog
Meaning: a competitor that is unlikely to win
Example: The underdog team’s 0-10 record makes them an unlikely winner of this week’s game.

Word: Underestimate
Meaning: to say that something is worth less than it really is
Example: The man made a mistake when he chose to underestimate the skill of the other player.

Word: Underfoot
Meaning: something positioned under one’s feet
Example: As the boys ran through the woods; the only thing you could hear was laughing and the crunching of the leaves underfoot.

Word: Undergird
Meaning: to support or strengthen something
Example: Tess looked to her best friend to undergird her decisions and offer moral support during hard times.

Word: Undergo
Meaning: to experience; go through
Example: She had to undergo anesthesia for her operation.

Word: Undergrowth
Meaning: plants; sprouts and bushes that develop beneath the primary taller foliage in a woodland
Example: While the trees hovered overhead; only the hikers walking on the floor of the Amazon Rainforest could observe the undergrowth growing close to the ground.

Word: Underlie
Meaning: to trigger; motivate
Example: I don’t understand all of the principles that underlie how a radio works; but I know a few things about sound waves.

Word: Underline
Meaning: to emphasize something written by marking a line underneath it
Example: Using a highlighter; the student was able to underline the study material she found most important.

Word: Underlying
Meaning: triggering or motivating
Example: The underlying cause for most lung cancer is smoking.

Word: Undermine
Meaning: to weaken; hinder; sabotage
Example: Chloe hoped that her allergies were not going to undermine her ability to perform in the recital.

Word: Underneath
Meaning: situated directly below
Example: The titanic was buried underneath the ocean’s surface for several decades.

Word: Underpaid
Meaning: not paid enough money for the amount or type of work that is done
Example: Cruise ship employees are extremely underpaid and have low salaries that would shock American workers.

Word: Underpinning
Meaning: a solid level of foundation laid below a building to support it
Example: The construction team added underpinning at the bottom of the trailer to shelter the mobile home’s pipes from cold weather.

Word: Underscore
Meaning: to highlight
Example: When the teacher reviewed the essay with her student; she went out of her way to underscore the paper’s best features.

Word: Understand
Meaning: to know the meaning of the information you are hearing or seeing
Example: Because she doesn’t speak English; the Chinese tourist didn’t understand what the cab driver was saying.

Word: Understandable
Meaning: something that is comprehensible; or able to be understood
Example: Because I am very good at math; the complicated nature of calculus is still understandable to me; even though it is not to my classmates.

Word: Understandably
Meaning: reasonably so; as expected
Example: The cancer patient is understandably weak after many weeks of treatment.

Word: Understanding
Meaning: the ability to comprehend and grasp something
Example: Mr. Dean’s deep understanding of marketing helped him turn his business into an overnight success.

Word: Understatement
Meaning: presenting something as being smaller or worse than it actually is
Example: Saying he had gained a little weight was an understatement since he had put on thirty just last month.

Word: Undertake
Meaning: to commit oneself to an obligation
Example: Choosing to undertake the obligation of raising foster children was not a decision the woman took lightly.

Word: Undertaking
Meaning: a task that is taken on
Example: Getting a PhD while working fulltime is a huge undertaking; even for the most dedicated student.

Word: Undertone
Meaning: a quality or feeling that is gentle or subdued
Example: When dying my hair; I have my stylist add a slight undertone of red to give it a different look.

Word: Undertow
Meaning: an underlying mood or feeling that is present just below the surface
Example: An undertow of grief swept over the widow as she laid her husband to rest.

Word: Undervalue
Meaning: to consider something to have little value or worth than it really has
Example: The group of workers tends to undervalue the intern’s contributions even though he adds a lot of value to the project.

Word: Underway
Meaning: something started and is ongoing
Example: With the construction of the road underway; it was only a matter of a few weeks before people could drive on it.

Word: Underwent
Meaning: experienced or went through
Example: After he underwent the risky surgery; the runner wasn’t able to exercise for a while.

Word: Undesirability
Meaning: the quality of being unwanted or desired
Example: The product’s undesirability caused it to sit on the shelf week after week.

Word: Undeterred
Meaning: continuing to do something even in the face of obstacles or setbacks
Example: Undeterred by the evidence stacked against his client; the attorney continued to look evidence pointing to the real killer.

Word: Undiminished
Meaning: not lessened; not made weaker
Example: Trees in front of the window need to be cut back so that the view of the lake is undiminished.

Word: Undisputed
Meaning: certain; definite
Example: The vote count was undisputed until several people came forward saying the machines had been rigged.

Word: Undisputed
Meaning: not challenged or disagreed upon
Example: The smart student was the undisputed winner of the spelling bee after putting everyone out in the first round.

Word: Undistinguished
Meaning: ordinary; unremarkable
Example: Sometimes the celebrity wished for an ordinary and undistinguished life where he wasn’t followed around constantly.

Word: Undo
Meaning: to reserve or cancel
Example: I tried to undo my typing mistake; but couldn’t get it to reverse.

Word: Undoing
Meaning: downfall; defeat
Example: It seems that complaining about her boss led to Megan’s undoing since she was fired a day after she made those negative comments.

Word: Undone
Meaning: ruined; destroyed
Example: The Clippers hope of a championship was undone by their latest loss.

Word: Undoubtedly
Meaning: without any doubt
Example: Undoubtedly; I have plans to attend my only daughter’s high school graduation.

Word: Undue
Meaning: at a level that is extreme; not needed
Example: The daredevil likes to take undue risks and keeps himself in trouble.

Word: Undulate
Meaning: move with a smooth wavelike motion
Example: The dancers’ movements were arranged so that they seemed to undulate like dolphins with the music.

Word: Unduly
Meaning: done excessively; overly or out of proportion
Example: The teenage girl is unduly dependent on her mother and can’t even go to the bathroom by herself.

Word: Unearth
Meaning: to uncover or discover
Example: At an estate sale; I was able to unearth some dresses from the 1920s that had been hidden in an old trunk.

Word: Unease
Meaning: a sense of anxiety or nervousness
Example: I had a sense of unease as I traveled through the dark forest; and every noise made wary of what could be lying I wait.

Word: Uneasy
Meaning: nervous; worried or overly anxious
Example: I always feel uneasy when I am in a dark building alone.

Word: Unemployment
Meaning: being without a job
Example: Unemployment rates have gone up ever since the Nike company took their factory jobs out of the area.

Word: Unencumbered
Meaning: free of to move forward or advance
Example: Because she had her official transcripts; the woman was unencumbered to move on to any college she wanted.

Word: Unequal
Meaning: imbalanced or uneven
Example: Unequal leg lengths on desks can cause them to wobble around.

Word: Unequivocal 
Meaning: unquestionably clear
Example: Since we raised over a million dollars for our charity; we considered the fundraiser to be an unequivocal success.

Word: Unerring
Meaning: correct; unmistaken
Example: The accountant had an unerring for spotting mistakes in bank statements.

Word: Unethical
Meaning: not having morals or honorable principles
Example: Unethical office practices caused the bad doctor to lose his job at the hospital.

Word: Uneven
Meaning: not balanced or symmetrical
Example: Because the table legs were uneven; it rocked back and forth anytime something was placed on it.

Word: Uneventful
Meaning: boring; ordinary
Example: My uneventful weekend was filled with nothing but yawns and the flipping of channels on the T.V.

Word: Unfair
Meaning: wrong; unjust
Example: The store was unfair with its pricing and raised the cost of water and bread during the flood.

Word: Unfasten
Meaning: to open; undo; or disconnect the tie of something
Example: The toddler was able to unfasten her seatbelt and climb out of her car seat when her mom wasn’t looking.

Word: Unfathomable
Meaning: impossible to comprehend or understand
Example: After five hours; we still could not figure out the unfathomable riddle.

Word: Unfavorable
Meaning: poor or bad
Example: The odds of us being able to go to the ballgame are unfavorable since the weatherman is calling for heavy rain.

Word: Unfazed
Meaning: not bothered or affected in any way
Example: Laidback Larry remained calm and seemed completely unfazed when the robbers entered his shop.

Word: Unfeasible
Meaning: impractical; not realistic
Example: Paying for their son’s college seemed unfeasible; so they looked for another way to get funding.

Word: Unfeigned
Meaning: real; not pretense
Example: Because the woman truly loved her husband; her sorrow was unfeigned during the funeral.

Word: Unfettered 
Meaning: not confined or restrained
Example: Once the bird was unfettered and out of the cage; it flew up into the sky.

Word: Unfit
Meaning: not qualified or suited for a specific purpose
Example: Because he was ruled unfit for the position; the police officer was relieved of his duties.

Word: Unflagging
Meaning: tireless and persistent
Example: The persistent reporter was unflagging and refused to give up on the story.

Word: Unflappable
Meaning: clear headed and serene during a catastrophe
Example: When a deadly tornado raced across town; many residents panicked but Miles remained unflappable and calmly lead his neighbors to shelter.

Word: Unfledged
Meaning: inexperienced; naïve
Example: The unfledged nurse had very little experience in hospice care.

Word: Unflinching
Meaning: unwavering even in difficult times
Example: The frightened dog’s unflinching gaze never left my face.

Word: Unfold
Meaning: to develop or progress
Example: Watching the disaster unfold on television; the onlookers couldn’t believe how quickly the storm had grown.

Word: Unforeseen
Meaning: unexpected; sudden
Example: An unforeseen storm approached and surprised the weathermen who had not called for rain.

Word: Unfortunate
Meaning: used to describe an unlucky or ill-time situation or person
Example: The unfortunate woman seemed jinxed as she happened to step in front of the window right when a car ploughed through it.

Word: Unfortunately
Meaning: used to expresses regret before giving bad news
Example: Unfortunately; there are no more tickets for the movie we want to see.

Word: Ungainly
Meaning: used to describe a person or movement that is clumsy or awkward
Example: Penguins are ungainly on land; always waddling around awkwardly on the ice.

Word: Ungrateful
Meaning: not grateful; not expressing gratitude
Example: The man left a single dollar to his ungrateful son in his will.

Word: Unguent
Meaning: a greasy salve that is used to heal wounds
Example: Rubbing the unguent across the patient’s wound; the nurse hoped the salve would speed up the healing.

Word: Unhallowed
Meaning: unholy
Example: Unhallowed talk is not allowed in the holy sanctuary.

Word: Unhappy
Meaning: displeased; upset
Example: The couple’s unhappy marriage led to heated arguments and a divorce.

Word: Unheeded
Meaning: ignored or not paid attention to
Example: The doctor’s unheeded warnings about the dangers of smoking seemed to go in one ear and out the other.

Word: Unhinged
Meaning: deranged; emotionally or mentally disturbed
Example: Ever since her son died; the distraught woman has been emotionally unhinged.

Word: Unhurt
Meaning: not hurt; injured; or damaged in any way
Example: Although the toddler was unhurt; the fall down the stairs scared his parents.

Word: Unicameral
Meaning: a government that has only one legislative house or chamber as opposed to two
Example: Nebraska is the only U.S. state with a unicameral legislature; meaning it doesn’t have a separate house and senate.

Word: Unicellular
Meaning: an organism (such as protozoa; some algae or spores) that are made of only one cell
Example: A simple creature that has only one cell with no nucleus is called unicellular.

Word: Unicorn
Meaning: a mythical creature that resembles a horse and has one horn in the center of its head
Example: The horse-like unicorn is said to be the holder of all truth that can pierce the heart of a liar with its horn.

Word: Unicycle
Meaning: a bicycle with only one wheel
Example: Riding on a unicycle; the circus clown did tricks on its one wheel.

Word: Unidirectional
Meaning: operating or moving in one direction
Example: With the unidirectional model; all the gears turn in the same direction.

Word: Unification
Meaning: merger or union of more than one thing
Example: Unification of the school system means that students on both sides of town will now go to the same school.

Word: Unified
Meaning: made into one
Example: The couple made a unified decision to buy the house they both liked the best.

Word: Unifoliate
Meaning: having only one; compound leaf
Example: Because the plant’s leaf was single; it is described as unifoliate.

Word: Uniform
Meaning: identical clothing worn by people of the same workplace; organization; or school
Example: The student wished she could ditch school uniform and show her unique clothing style.

Word: Uniformity
Meaning: the state of overall sameness or being identical in every way
Example: Uniformity between the twins’ clothes made it to where even their own parents couldn’t tell them apart.

Word: Unify
Meaning: to unite things or make pieces whole
Example: Giving a speech about how important it is for all races to work together; MLK was able to unify the groups.

Word: Unilateral
Meaning: performed only by one side
Example: Since the legislators were slow to act on the issue; the president used his executive powers to make a unilateral solution.

Word: Unimaginable
Meaning: something that is difficult to believe
Example: After the devastating storm left the area; people were left with unimaginable damage.

Word: Unimpeachable
Meaning: completely trustworthy and reliable
Example: Most of the voters saw the candidate as unimpeachable and completely trusted his every word.

Word: Unimpeded
Meaning: free of any restrictions or obstacles
Example: After getting a permit from the city; the unimpeded workers were free to build the home.

Word: Unimportant
Meaning: trivial and of no great concern
Example: The janitor’s job might seem unimportant; but the school could not function without this essential position.

Word: Uninhabitable
Meaning: not able to be lived in or on
Example: Because it is near a nuclear test site; the island is now uninhabitable by people.

Word: Uninhabited
Meaning: having no people living there
Example: Jaco Island is uninhabited because the locals think it is sacred land that no one should live on.

Word: Uninhibited
Meaning: outgoing; not reserved
Example: The camp counselor encouraged uninhibited participation and wanted the campers to be spontaneous.

Word: Uninitiated
Meaning: without specific knowledge or experience
Example: The uninitiated students had trouble understanding the advanced concepts of physics.

Word: Unintelligible
Meaning: making no sense; not understandable
Example: The babbling baby let out an unintelligible wail as she toddled down the hallway.

Word: Unintended
Meaning: accidental; not intentional
Example: Testifying in court caused an unintended consequence to the salesman’s reputation.

Word: Uninterested
Meaning: not concerned; indifferent
Example: Although she acts uninterested; the teenager really does enjoy spending time with her younger sister.

Word: Union
Meaning: a marriage
Example: The elderly couple’s union had lasted for over fifty years.

Word: Unique 
Meaning: without match; distinct
Example: Kate’s unique hairstyle captured everyone’s attention.

Word: Unison
Meaning: the condition of being in agreement or occurring at the same time
Example: Because the singers sung in unison; it sounded like only one person was performing.

Word: Unit
Meaning: one part of component
Example: The complex has over sixty apartments; but only one unit is available to rent this month.

Word: Unitary
Meaning: relating to one single unit
Example: Those unitary officers are the one allowed to stop drivers in this area.

Word: Unite
Meaning: to join more than one thing together
Example: If we are to win the war; our soldiers must unite and face the enemy.

Word: United
Meaning: connected together
Example: The United States are separate but connected by a single; federal government.

Word: Unity
Meaning: being in harmony or full agreement
Example: During the civil rights era; protestors called for unity and peace in which blacks and whites could live together.

Word: Universal
Meaning: relating to everyone in the world
Example: The universal remote is said to work for any kind of television set.

Word: Universe
Meaning: the world; earth.
Example: Many predicted the end of the universe in 1999; but the world kept on spinning.

Word: University
Meaning: a college or academic institution
Example: Professors at the university teach many different courses including biology and world geography.

Word: Unjust
Meaning: not fair; just or right
Example: He believed the sentence was unjust and planned to appeal.

Word: Unkempt
Meaning: not clean or tidy
Example: An unkempt appearance was the least of the homeless man’s worries.

Word: Unkind
Meaning: mean; cruel
Example: Girls on the playground often say cruel and unkind things to those they see as weak.

Word: Unknown
Meaning: something that is still a mystery or uncertain
Example: An unknown substance was found on the bottom of the scientist’s fossil discovery.

Word: Unleash
Meaning: to set free from a restraint
Example: After I went to unleash the dog who had been chained to his cage for years; the dog attacked the first person it saw and ran away.

Word: Unless
Meaning: used to show an exception
Example: Unless you turn in your homework; you will not pass this course.

Word: Unlike
Meaning: different from; dissimilar
Example: Unlike her glamorous mother; the tomboy preferred tennis shoes over heels.

Word: Unlikely
Meaning: not very likely to happen; questionable
Example: It is very unlikely that I will win the lotto; but I still like to play.

Word: Unload
Meaning: to unpack or drop off
Example: Movers helped me unload my furniture and even aided me in putting the beds back together.

Word: Unlucky
Meaning: having or bringing bad luck or fortune
Example: Friday the 13th is said to be an unlucky day that brings bad fortune.

Word: Unmarred
Meaning: free from blemishes or stains
Example: Babe Ruth’s ball was surprisingly unmarred; having almost no marks or blemishes.

Word: Unmentionable
Meaning: forbidden or taboo
Example: After my father left my mother; his name was unmentionable in our home.

Word: Unmistakable
Meaning: unique; easily recognizable
Example: The smell of rotting flesh is unmistakable and can even be recognized by those who have never been around a dead body before.

Word: Unmitigated
Meaning: in its entirety; complete
Example: Since we raised over a million dollars during the telethon; we considered the fundraiser to be an unmitigated success.

Word: Unmoved
Meaning: not affected by emotion or other influence
Example: The toddler threw a fit and cried for the toy; but his mother was unmoved by his tantrum.

Word: Unnatural
Meaning: abnormal; strange
Example: The peculiar woman’s bright orange hair looked so unnatural.

Word: Unnecessary
Meaning: something that is not needed
Example: Checking on her baby all through the night was unnecessary; but the woman felt better if she did it anyway.

Word: Unnerve
Meaning: to make someone lose confidence; to discourage
Example: In an effort to unnerve his foe; the politician brought up some of the less honorable things he had done in the past during their debate.

Word: Unnerving
Meaning: causing fear; anxiety; or loss of courage
Example: As her voice trembled and hands shook; the speaker realized just how unnerving it can be to talk to such a large crowd.

Word: Unnoticed
Meaning: ignored or unseen
Example: The hunter wore clothes that would help him blend into the woods and go unnoticed by the animals.

Word: Unobserved
Meaning: not seen; overlooked
Example: The robbers went unobserved through the forest; never being spotted by the frantic search party.

Word: Unobtrusive
Meaning: not obvious
Example: The reclusive man wanted to be buried in an unobtrusive area of the cemetery so people would not walk around his grave.

Word: Unofficial
Meaning: not for sure or officially confirmed by the organization in charge
Example: It’s still unofficial; but I am pretty sure the company chose me for the job.

Word: Unorthodox 
Meaning: nontraditional
Example: Not wearing the school uniform in the Christian school is viewed as unorthodox behavior.

Word: Unpalatable 
Meaning: unpleasant to the taste
Example: Forgetting the sugar caused the baker to create a fine-looking but unpalatable cake.

Word: Unparalleled 
Meaning: without comparison
Example: The hotel is the city's best because it offers unparalleled services not provided by other area hotels.

Word: Unperceived
Meaning: not noticed or recognized by the senses (sight; smell; taste; touch; hearing.)
Example: The smell of the fire blazing through their home went unperceived by the sleeping family.

Word: Unperturbed
Meaning: not concerned; worried; or disturbed
Example: The unperturbed husband did not seem to care about his cheating wife or her string of affairs.

Word: Unpleasant
Meaning: unsavory; distasteful; or disgusting
Example: The unpleasant smell of rotten eggs crept out of the trash and hit my nose like a ton of bricks.

Word: Unpopular
Meaning: disliked or not accepted by most people
Example: Unpopular at school; the shy and lonely girl; didn’t have any friends to sit with at lunch.

Word: Unprecedented
Meaning: previously never experienced or seen
Example: Before the storm; there was an unprecedented demand for food supplies that left many stores empty.

Word: Unpredictable
Meaning: describes something that is uncertain and not able to be predicted or foretold
Example: The unpredictable weather was sunny one day and rainy the next.

Word: Unprepossessing
Meaning: looking plain or ordinary
Example: The unprepossessing bookshelf looked like any other bookstand; giving no hint of what lay behind its novels.

Word: Unpretentious
Meaning: not attempting to impress others with intelligence; money; style; importance; etc; modest
Example: The girl next door portrayed herself in an unpretentious way so that she was beautiful without striving for attention.

Word: Unprincipled 
Meaning: lacking a moral code
Example: The unprincipled banker failed to handle the transactions ethically.

Word: Unprofessional
Meaning: not showing behavior that is expected or standard in a particular setting
Example: After continuing his inappropriate jokes and sexual harrassment; the store manager was fired for his unprofessional behavior.

Word: Unpromising
Meaning: lackluster and unlikely to gain success
Example: Her hopes of graduating were unpromising after she failed her final exams.

Word: Unpropitious
Meaning: not favorable of likely to produce a good result
Example: The candidate’s unpropitious speak is unlikely to win him any votes.

Word: Unproven
Meaning: not proved
Example: Your alien abduction claim is unproven and seems extremely unlikely.

Word: Unpunctual
Meaning: not happening or doing something on time
Example: Unpunctual guests were not allowed to enter after arriving at the event two hours late.

Word: Unquestionably
Meaning: certain; not able to be disputed
Example: The doctor will unquestionably perform the surgery; the only thing in question is the date.

Word: Unravel
Meaning: to cause something to separate or come apart
Example: The tassels on the end of the rug have started to unravel and will need to be replaced.

Word: Unreal
Meaning: unbelievable; incredible
Example: Winning the lottery is an unreal experience that most will only dream of.

Word: Unreasonable
Meaning: extreme or excessive
Example: The costs to rent a car in the city are unreasonable and make buying one seem cheaper.

Word: Unredressed
Meaning: refers to a wrong or injustice that has not been righted
Example: The girl’s unredressed murder still bothers her family since the killer has never been caught.

Word: Unrelenting
Meaning: refusing to yield or compromise
Example: The unrelenting storm continued to destroy the area and seemed as if it would never end.

Word: Unreliable
Meaning: not able to be trusted or depended on
Example: Since Ms. Watson proved she was unreliable to do her job; I would never call on her when I needed a substitute.

Word: Unremitting
Meaning: continuing without any type of interruption or decrease in intensity
Example: Jim and Edith could not agree upon a divorce settlement because of their unremitting anger towards each other.

Word: Unrepentant
Meaning: showing no regret for one has done wrong
Example: Even after being sentenced for his crimes; the smug kidnapper was unrepentant.

Word: Unrequited
Meaning: not given back
Example: I started to cry when I learned my love was unrequited.

Word: Unrest
Meaning: a state of uneasiness; restlessness; or agitation
Example: Unrest in the country began to grow after the leader began to censor what the newspapers could publish.

Word: Unruffled
Meaning: composed; self-controlled
Example: Even when the children won’t listen to her; the calm teacher remains composed and unruffled.

Word: Unruly
Meaning: disruptive behavior that is wild and out of control
Example: Police were sent to stop the unruly drunks from throwing bottles at cars passing by.

Word: Unsafe
Meaning: dangerous; risky
Example: Moving into the unsafe neighborhood required the renters to get both a gun and a security system.

Word: Unsatisfactory
Meaning: not satisfying or good enough
Example: An unsatisfactory number of people signed up for the play so it had to be cancelled.

Word: Unsatisfied
Meaning: not pleased or happy with something
Example: The editor was unsatisfied with the writer’s work and asked her to make several changes.

Word: Unsavory
Meaning: unpleasant to smell or taste
Example: Catching a whiff of the unsavory smell; Hannah quickly remembered that she had forgotten to take out the trash before leaving for vacation.

Word: Unscathed
Meaning: untouched or not damaged
Example: Despite the vase’s tumble from the shelf; it is unscathed.

Word: Unscrupulous
Meaning: unconcerned about doing what is right
Example: The unscrupulous teacher offered to raise her student’s grade if he gave her one hundred dollars.

Word: Unseemly 
Meaning: not in good taste
Example: William acted in an unseemly manner when he wore his pajamas to his mother’s funeral.

Word: Unseen
Meaning: hidden or out of sight
Example: Waldo remained unseen in the picture until one of the kids finally spotted him.

Word: Unselfish
Meaning: generous and willing to put other needs or wants before one’s own
Example: The kidney donor’s unselfish gift helped the sick man stay alive for several more years.

Word: Unsheathed
Meaning: pulled a knife or sword out from its covering
Example: The warrior unsheathed the blade; raised it above his head and plunged it towards the enemy.

Word: Unsightly
Meaning: ugly; hideous
Example: Cinderella’s unsightly stepsisters were so ugly that their own reflections scared them.

Word: Unsolicited
Meaning: not welcome or invited
Example: The new mother wished she could stop family members from giving unsolicited advice on how to care for her baby.

Word: Unsophisticated
Meaning: basic; not complicated or highly developed
Example: The unsophisticated factory version of the vehicle sells for a much lower price than one purchased with all the bells and whistles.

Word: Unspeakable
Meaning: to horrific or horrible to be expressed in words
Example: The murders suspect was arrested for his unspeakable crimes; and the jury will soon hear about the horrible things he did.

Word: Unstable
Meaning: not balanced or steady
Example: The unstable chair crashed to the floor when the heavy farmer leaned back in it.

Word: Unstable
Meaning: unsteady or wobbly
Example: After years of wear and tear; the rocky table finally collapsed onto the floor.

Word: Unstinting
Meaning: generously giving
Example: The man showed his unstinting support of the business by writing several checks during hard times.

Word: Unsubstantial
Meaning: lacking firmness or strength
Example: It wasn’t until he fell from the cliff that the rock climber realized his unsubstantial rope was too thin for the climb.

Word: Unsubstantiated
Meaning: not supported by evidence or proof
Example: His unsubstantiated claim of being related to royalty could not be taken seriously; as he had no proof to support it.

Word: Unsullied
Meaning: untainted; pure
Example: The groom was happy to discover his wife was an unsullied virgin on their wedding night.

Word: Unsung
Meaning: not praised or celebrated
Example: An unsung champion; the nameless soldier was never even honored for his heroic acts.

Word: Unsure
Meaning: not certain; having doubts about a situation
Example: Because she was unsure of the answer; the puzzled girl didn’t raise her hand in class.

Word: Unsurpassed
Meaning: unmatched or better than any other
Example: The chef’s culinary skill was unsurpassed by any of the mediocre cooks in the kitchen.

Word: Unsuspecting
Meaning: being naïve and unaware; especially of the presence of danger
Example: The unsuspecting driver never expected to be carjacked in the middle of a busy roadway.

Word: Unsustainable
Meaning: not able to be maintained for long periods of time
Example: Although Tremaine is able to work 16 hour days right now; this kind of work schedule is unsustainable for long-term.

Word: Unsympathetic
Meaning: uncaring and unwilling to show compassion to others
Example: Cold and unsympathetic; Carl was selfish and only cared about his own problems.

Word: Untenable
Meaning: not capable of being supported or maintained
Example: The losing debate team had an untenable argument.

Word: Untenanted
Meaning: describes a house or room that has no one living in it (vacant)
Example: Because the home is untenanted; the landlord has plenty of time to fix up the vacant property.

Word: Untidy
Meaning: messy and unorganized
Example: A maid is needed to help the clean the untidy home.

Word: Until
Meaning: before (a specified time)
Example: I cannot go home from the hospital until my doctor gives the okay.

Word: Untimely
Meaning: taking place at an unsuitable time
Example: The president's untimely death has thrown the country into chaos.

Word: Unto
Meaning: an old form of the word “to”
Example: Do unto others as you would like them to do unto you.

Word: Untoward 
Meaning: inappropriate
Example: Janice ignored the holiness of her environment and behaved in an untoward manner in church.

Word: Untrammeled
Meaning: free; not limited or restricted
Example: The captured lion longed for the days when he lived untrammeled in the wide-open grasslands.

Word: Untrue
Meaning: false; wrong
Example: The rumor was untrue; but a lot of people believed the lie.

Word: Unusable
Meaning: broken or unable to be used
Example: Because it is unusable; the chef decided to throw the broken mixer into the trash can.

Word: Unused
Meaning: something new that has not been used before
Example: Please place any unused towels back on the rack for the next customer.

Word: Unusual
Meaning: rare or uncommon
Example: It isn’t unusual for the employee to take off from work since she likes to stay home at least once a week.

Word: Unusually
Meaning: uncommonly; rarely happening
Example: Unusually hot weather meant that there was swimming but no snow in November.

Word: Unutterable
Meaning: to intense or horrible to be described with words
Example: The man lashed out in an unutterable rage that scared everyone in the parking lot.

Word: Unvanquished
Meaning: not beaten or defeated
Example: Athens agreed to leave the city unvanquished as long as Sparta agreed not to attack again.

Word: Unveil
Meaning: to reveal or show something
Example: Even when the children won’t listen to her; the calm teacher remains composed and unruffled.

Meaning: revealed or showed something
Example: Eli Whitney unveiled a special machine to the crowd that would change the way that cotton was processed.

Word: Unwarranted
Meaning: not deserved or justified
Example: Although the punishment seems unwarranted; the mother has the right to discipline her child as she sees fit.

Word: Unwary
Meaning: not cautious or aware of danger
Example: Although he should have been afraid of the wolf; the third pig seemed unwary.

Word: Unwavering
Meaning: never doubted; always steady and on course
Example: The runner was unwavering on his decision to run a marathon.

Word: Unwieldy
Meaning: hard to relocate because of its size
Example: The young boy found it difficult to hold the unwieldy ball because of its huge size.

Word: Unwind
Meaning: to relax and let go of stress
Example: After a long day at work; the waitress needed to put her feet up and unwind.

Word: Unwise
Meaning: foolish; not smart
Example: Even though she was book smart; the foolish girl continued to make unwise money decisions.

Word: Unwitting
Meaning: ignorant or unaware
Example: The unwitting buyer has no clue what her interest rate is or how long she will have to pay on the loan.

Word: Unwittingly
Meaning: ignorantly or in a way that shows one is unaware
Example: Not realizing she was sick; the passenger unwittingly spread her cold to the man sitting next to her.

Word: Unwonted
Meaning: something not seen often; not ordinary
Example: Since Bill rarely came to church; even the priest was shocked by his unwonted appearance at the service.

Word: Unworthy
Meaning: not fit or deserving
Example: The author is unworthy of the award because she copied her book from another writer’s ideas.

Word: Unwritten
Meaning: not recorded in writing
Example: Because the oral business agreement was unwritten; there was no paper to prove it existed.

Word: Unyielding
Meaning: not flexible; not easily moved or swayed
Example: My unyielding father refused to increase my allowance.

Meaning: modern; current
Example: My classroom has the most up to date computer systems out right now.

Meaning: awake
Example: The farmer’s wife was up with the sun; making sure to feed the chickens before six each morning.

Meaning: useful and not simply for appearance

Word: Utilitarianism
Meaning: an theory that says actions that are harmful to certain individuals are justified if they help the majority
Example: Because the focus is on the whole and not individual needs; societies practicing utilitarianism have laws like population control.

Meaning: useful and able to perform several different functions
Example: The utility vehicle was designed to carry loads more efficiently than other types of trucks.

Word: Vacillate

Word: Vacuity
Meaning: emptiness or blankness; often used to criticize someone or something because of lack
Example: The Scarecrow’s vacuity led most people to assume that he didn’t have a brain.

Word: Vacuole
Meaning: a small cavity within the cytoplasm of a cell that contains fluid
Example: A vacuole is a small cavity of fluid inside a cell that keeps that fluid stored until it is needed by the cell.

Word: Varlet

Word: Vary
Meaning: to differ; usually when making comparisons
Example: Temperatures vary from city to city; even in the same state.

Word: Vascular
Meaning: a system that transports fluids through a living creature
Example: The vascular system is more commonly known as the circulatory system.

Word: Vasoconstriction
Meaning: the shrinking of blood vessels that often inhibits proper circulation and increases blood pressure
Example: In blistering cold environments; vasoconstriction of the veins causes blood flow to move to the center of the body and reduces odds of freezing to death.

Word: Vassal
Meaning: a worker of a lord who is working off his debt in return for safety from the lord
Example: When the vassal took an oath from the lord of the manor; he knew that his employer would require him to tend to the fields until his obligation was met.

Word: Vast Majority
Meaning: almost all of a group
Example: A vast majority of the kid’s that go to my rural school live on a farm nearby.

Word: Vast 
Meaning: gigantic in size
Example: My daughter will not go near the rose bushes because of the vast number of bees surrounding the flowers.

Word: Vastly
Meaning: to a huge or immense extent
Example: Although humans and chimpanzees are related; they’re vastly different in appearance and mannerisms.

Word: Vat
Meaning: a massive container used to hold liquid
Example: They brewed the beer in a large vat and then transferred it into barrels to age.

Word: Vatic
Meaning: predicting or describing what will happen in the future
Example: The psychic’s predictions weren’t truly vatic but something that he tells to every customer.

Word: Vaudeville
Meaning: a type of theatre entertainment in the 19th and 20th centuries; consisting of short performances by dancers; singers; and comedians
Example: Singers; dancers; and jugglers stood by and prepared to perform their vaudeville acts.

Word: Vault
Meaning: a typically spacious room used as storage for valuables
Example: Archeologists stumbled upon an underground vault filled to the prim with ancient sculptures; gold; and other valuables.

Word: Vaunt
Meaning: brag; boast; or excessively praise
Example: China likes to vaunt its military strength; intimidating her neighbors.

Word: Vector
Meaning: a line that usually veers and can be the result of force
Example: Military aviators study the vector between their aircraft and the enemy in order to calculate how to intercept.

Word: Veer
Meaning: to swerve or change direction
Example: She helplessly watched the car in front of her veer into oncoming traffic and let out a breath when they quickly navigated back into the proper lane.

Word: Vegetarian
Meaning: someone who chooses to abstain from eating meat
Example: She became a vegetarian over the holiday when she gave up all meat for Lent.

Word: Vegetate
Meaning: to exist in a meaningless; unchallenging; and lazy state
Example: On the weekend; the tired student loved to vegetate in her room for hours just watching movies and eating popcorn until she fell asleep.

Word: Vegetation
Meaning: plant life that often covers the expanse of an area
Example: The rolling hills were filled with all sorts of vegetation.

Word: Vehemence
Meaning: intensity and forcefulness
Example: Because of his vehemence when talking about the topic; the Civil Rights leader was known for his intense speeches.

Word: Vehement
Meaning: deeply felt; passionate
Example: I was vehement about monitoring the actions of the police as they sought my husband’s killer.

Word: Vehemently
Meaning: to do something forcefully and often passionately
Example: The scorned young woman vehemently rejected her ex-boyfriend’s pleas to forgive him.

Word: Vehicle
Meaning: a mechanical vessel used to transport someone or something
Example: The little boy looked out the airport window at the vehicles lining the runway and gaped at the gargantuan metal wings on the airplanes.

Word: Veil
Meaning: a head covering that may or may not cover the whole face that is often associated with religious or cultural customs
Example: On her royal wedding day; Princess Diana wore a simple silk veil that perfectly complemented her elaborate gown.

Word: Vein
Meaning: vessels beneath skin that transport blood
Example: The phlebotomist tied a rubber band around her upper arm and scanned for a prominent vein to draw blood.

Word: Velleity
Meaning: to weakly wish or desire something without taking action to achieve it
Example: He had a velleity for a home cooked meal but he was too lazy to get off the couch and ordered take out instead.

Word: Velocity
Meaning: the rate of action or motion
Example: After the football played injured his knee; his velocity on the field decreased.

Word: Velvety
Meaning: having a smooth or soft texture
Example: She sunk into the velvety fur jacket and sighed at how the soft fabric caressed her skin.

Word: Venal
Meaning: willing to do dishonest things in return for money; willing to take bribes
Example: Because the mayor was a venal man; he had no problem accepting bribes from real estate developers.

Word: Vend
Meaning: to offer small items especially food for sale from a machine or small cart
Example: The kiosks are used to vend movies to people looking for an interesting flick to watch.

Word: Vendetta
Meaning: a series of actions taken to get back at or harm someone
Example: 1. The candidate’s vendetta against his challenger led him to question the man’s character.

Word: Vendible
Meaning: having the ability to be sold
Example: Several sites like Pinterest offer many vendible craft ideas that retirees and craftspeople can do to make money for their crafts.

Word: Vendor
Meaning: a person who sells something
Example: The beer vendor set up his stand outside of the concert and offered a variety of craft beer for sale.

Word: Veneer
Meaning: a pleasant appearance that hides the truth
Example: While the actress showed the photographers her warm veneer; she was actually fuming inside.

Word: Venerable
Meaning: worthy of respect because of age; position; or dignity
Example: The Pope is a venerable leader who is recognized for his commitment to helping others.

Word: Venerate
Meaning: to respect or worship someone or something
Example: The Bible says we should venerate our parents and our elders.

Word: Veneration
Meaning: great respect or awe for another
Example: The parishioner’s veneration for her priest came off as not only respect but also blind devotion.

Word: Vengeance
Meaning: revenge for a wrong
Example: When Jim did not get the justice he thought he deserved in court; he got his own vengeance by shooting his attacker.

Word: Vengeful
Meaning: someone who is consumed by or actively seeking revenge for a wrong doing
Example: The Count of Monte Cristo follows a vengeful Edmond Dantes on his quest to destroy the lives of those who had him falsely imprisoned.

Word: Venial
Meaning: capable of being excused
Example: Because the principal felt the boys had committed a venial offense; he only gave them a light punishment.

Word: Venison
Meaning: edible flesh of hunted game animal; typically deer
Example: Skilled hunters shoot several deer a season and freeze the venison to eat all year long.

Word: Venom
Meaning: a poisonous substance secreted by animals such as snakes; spiders; and scorpions and typically injected into prey or aggressors by biting or stinging
Example: The scorpion stores venom in its tail and releases the powerful poison when it stings.

Word: Venomous
Meaning: of animals; especially snakes; or their parts secreting venom; capable of injecting venom by means of a bite or sting
Example: The park ranger warned the campers to watch out for venomous snakes.

Word: Vent
Meaning: an opening that allows air; gas; or liquid to pass out of or into a confined space
Example: A vent at the top of the chimney allows smoky air to escape and fresh air to enter the home.

Word: Ventilate
Meaning: cause air to enter and circulate freely in (a room; building; etc.
Example: Maria opened the windows to ventilate the dusty; old basement.

Word: Ventilation
Meaning: the ability of a room/place to intake fresh air
Example: Because mines are so deep within the Earth; they have poor natural ventilation and fresh air rarely reaches far enough to clear the dust.

Word: Ventilator
Meaning: a machine that helps lungs function when the body is incapable
Example: Brielle was rushed to the hospital and put on a ventilator to help her breathe after her lung collapsed during a car accident.

Word: Ventral
Meaning: refers to the underside of a plant or animal; close to the abdomen
Example: From the cruise ship; we spotted the ventral side of a large migrating whale.

Word: Ventriloquist
Meaning: a person who can speak or utter sounds so that they seem to come from somewhere else; especially an entertainer who makes their voice appear to come from a dummy of a person or animal
Example: The children laughed as the ventriloquist made the doll speak without moving his lips.

Word: Venture 
Meaning: an undertaking that has some risk attached
Example: Although the venture is going to cost me a lot of money; I can easily recoup my funds in three months if the business is successful.

Word: Venturesome
Meaning: having the tendency to willingly take risks or dangerous adventures
Example: The venturesome couple climbed decided to climb Mount Everest for their honeymoon.

Word: Venue
Meaning: the place where something happens; especially an organized event such as a concert; conference; or sports event
Example: The bride was having trouble picking the perfect venue for the reception; but finally decided on a beautiful garden estate.

Meaning: honest; always truthful
Example: “Honest” Abraham Lincoln was known as a veracious president who stood for truth.

Word: Veracity
Meaning: the quality of being truthful
Example: Since the witness is a known enemy of the defendant; his testimony certainly needs to be evaluated for its veracity.

Word: Veranda
Meaning: a covered area outside a house; usually a large porch
Example: Old southern ladies sit in rocking chairs on the veranda outside their front door and drink sweet tea.

Word: Verbal irony
Meaning: use of words to say one thing but mean another
Example: The author used both verbal irony and sarcasm when writing one thing in her book but actually making a different point.

Word: Verbal
Meaning: spoken aloud
Example: Bree hated the verbal portion of her Spanish exam because while she knew how to write the words on paper; speaking the out loud was far more difficult.

Word: Verbatim
Meaning: repeating the exact words that were used
Example: Do you have to repeat everything I say verbatim?

Word: Verbiage
Meaning: speech or writing that uses too many words or excessively technical expressions
Example: In an attempt to confuse the jury; the attorney used a lot of legal verbiage.

Word: Verbose
Meaning: described as using an excessive amount of words
Example: The verbose man took thirty minutes to give me a simple answer.

Word: Verboten
Meaning: forbidden; prohibited
Example: Because of past arguments; political discusses are verboten at our dinner table.

Word: Verdancy
Meaning: becoming green with plants and vegetation
Example: The field’s verdancy showed through as mossy greens began to take over the pasture.

Meaning: green with grass or other rich vegetation
Example: After three years of drought conditions; the farmers welcomed the spring rains and hoped they would continue long enough to restore their crops to verdant abundance.

Meaning: a decision made after much consideration
Example: In accordance with the verdict of all five panelists; Sally was crowned the spelling bee champion.

Word: Verdure
Meaning: a thriving condition
Example: One week after a successful surgery; John was in verdure and eager to leave the hospital.

Word: Verge
Meaning: at the edge of; border of; or between two distinct sites
Example: She stood on the verge of the lake at the line where the water met the sand.

Word: Verifiable
Meaning: able to be checked or demonstrated to be true; accurate; or justified
Example: In order to write a proper research paper you must use facts to back up your argument or information that is easily verifiable.

Word: Verification
Meaning: the process of confirming the truth or validity of a claim/document
Example: The university waited for verification of the student’s SAT scores and final GPA before admitting her for fall semester.

Word: Verify
Meaning: to prove or confirm something
Example: The waitress asked to see my driver’s license so she could verify my age.

Word: Verily
Meaning: truly; certainly
Example: At over 7ft tall; the basketball player was verily one of the tallest people on record for the NBA.

Word: Verisimilar
Meaning: seemingly truthful or likely
Example: After talking to the witness; the police officer thought her story was verisimilar but would have to confirm it with hard evidence.

Word: Verisimilitude
Meaning: the appearance or semblance of truth
Example: When the man’s wife lied on the stand; she destroyed any chance the jury would believe she was capable of giving them even an ounce of verisimilitude.

Word: Veritable
Meaning: used to highlight the realness of a person; place; or thing
Example: As I watched my brother drink beer after beer; I realized he was a veritable sponge.

Word: Veritably
Meaning: extremely or greatly as compared to something else
Example: Lynette; veritably; is a much better driver than her crash dummy sister.

Word: Verity
Meaning: the condition of being real or true
Example: It was obvious from the jurors’ looks of disbelief they doubted the verity of the testimony given by the witness.

Example: After her father’s death; the verklempt woman cried herself to self every night.

Meaning: experienced or skilled in something

Example: It seems as though every political election in the United States comes down to Democrats versus Republicans.

Word: Vertebrate
Meaning: an animal of any species that has a backbone or spinal column

Word: Vertex
Meaning: the tapering point where two lines meet
Example: Wayne had the odd habit of eating his pizza from the vertex to the crust.

Meaning: ascending upwards and downwards in a straight line
Example: Disney’s Tower of Terror is a vertical drop from 199 ft. in the air; straight to the ground.

Meaning: suffering from dizziness
Example: After she hit her head; Molly became increasingly vertiginous; lightheaded; and lost her balance.

Meaning: the feeling of spinning and being lopsided; often as a result of an inner ear problem

Meaning: taking place or happening at night

Word: Vestige
Meaning: the last small part of something that existed before
Example: The shameless killer did not show a vestige of emotion when the judge sentenced him to death.

Word: Vestigial
Meaning: an organ or limb that is no longer in use due to evolution but may be used for other unintended purposes
Example: Penguins; unlike other birds; have vestigial wings that are too heavy for flight but are perfect for swimming.

Word: Vestment

Word: Vicennial

Word: Vicissitude
Meaning: a change of circumstances or fortune; typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant.
Example: The parental vicissitude I currently have is trying to pay child support for six children.

Word: Vicissitudes
Meaning: changes (usually negative) in circumstances or fortune

Meaning: a person who has suffered at the hands of someone else or a situation that is out of their control

Word: Virtual
Meaning: carried out or accessed over a computer
Example: Since I live so far from the company I want to work for; they agreed to do a virtual interview over the computer.

Word: Virtually
Meaning: nearly; almost
Example: Virtually no one went to the party other than a few freshmen who didn’t have anything else to do.

Word: Virtue
Meaning: a moral and praiseworthy trait
Example: Since Jason is such a mean man; I doubt if he has a single virtue.

Word: Virtues
Meaning: qualities or merits that make up one’s personality
Example: The company was founded on several virtues including honesty and the importance of embracing people from all walks of life.

Word: Virtuosity
Meaning: great skill in music or another artform
Example: Full of ambition and virtuosity; the young jazz musician plays as much as possible to increase her skills.

Word: Virtuoso
Meaning: a person (esp. a musician) who does something in a very skillful way
Example: We sat in amazement as the young prodigy delivered a piano performance that revealed his unstoppable future as a virtuoso.

Word: Virtuous
Meaning: having strong moral fiber
Example: Margaret was a virtuous woman who dedicated her life to helping others.

Word: Virulence
Meaning: the ability of a microorganism or bacteria to produce disease
Example: The virulence of the microbes seemed to increase with time; producing more disease with time.

Word: Virulent
Meaning: extremely dangerous and deadly and usually spreading very quickly
Example: Local law authorities investigated Mitchell after he was suspected of stealing a virulent disease that could kill millions of people.

Word: Virus
Meaning: tiny organisms that cause disease and must have a cell host to multiply
Example: The virus is said to spread with time; causing the infected person to become sicker as the years go on.

Word: Vis a vis
Meaning: face to face; in person
Example: I feel it is better to discuss personal issues vis-à-vis rather than over the phone.

Word: Visa
Meaning: an official mark or stamp on a passport that allows someone to enter or leave a country for a specific reason or amount of time
Example: The Nigerian’s visa was approved; allowing him to visit his family in America over the Christmas holiday.

Word: Visage
Meaning: the facial appearance of an individual or animal
Example: The model’s visage earned her many cover photos.

Word: Viscera
Meaning: internal organs; specifically the body’s intestines
Example: The viscera are where the body makes its last attempt to gain any nutrients from food before pushing the remainder out of the body.

Word: Visceral
Meaning: based on emotional reactions rather than on reason or thought
Example: His visceral reaction of punching the wall left him with a broken hand on top of his broken heart.

Word: Viscid
Meaning: sticky; gooey
Example: Creating a viscid cake with caramel; the chef enjoyed making the ooey-gooey treat.

Word: Viscosity
Meaning: the thickness of a liquid or its resistance to movement
Example: The syrup flows slowly from the bottle because of its viscosity.

Word: Viscount
Meaning: a lower-middle ranking english nobleman
Example: The viscount was appointed by the king to help the count run his portion of the English countryside.

Word: Viscous 
Meaning: having the characteristics of being sticky and/or thick and slow to move
Example: It seemed to take forever for the viscous cough medicine to come out of the bottle.

Word: Visibility
Meaning: the ability to see or be seen
Example: Because of visibility issues; the teen needs glasses before he can start to drive.

Word: Visible
Meaning: able to be seen
Example: The sun was barely visible because of the large clouds in the sky.

Word: Visibly
Meaning: clearly; noticeably
Example: Although her husband’s weight gain was visibly clear; the wife pretended not to notice.

Word: Vision
Meaning: the ability to see
Example: Glasses help my vision improve and allow me to see far away.

Word: Visionary 
Meaning: using foresight and imagination to plan for the time ahead
Example: Jim was a visionary leader who had the foresight to lead our company in a profitable direction for many years.

Word: Visit
Meaning: to go to see a person or place
Example: We plan to visit as many Disney parks as possible on our vacation.

Word: Visitant
Meaning: a visitor from the spirit world
Example: Although the visitant remained unseen; we could hear the ghost floating around in the attic.

Word: Visitation
Meaning: a set period of time in which people get to see and spend time with each other
Example: Family visitation for inmates lasts from two to four.

Word: Visitor
Meaning: a person who goes to see a person or place
Example: Each visitor needs their own ticket to enter into the building.

Word: Visits
Meaning: goes to see a person or place
Example: Each time my father visits; he complains about my messy house.

Word: Vista
Meaning: a distant view or scene
Example: The vacationers could see their favorite bay vista from the top of the tower.

Word: Visual
Meaning: relating to eyesight
Example: I learn best when information is put in visual images that I can see.

Word: Visualize
Meaning: to form a mental image of someone or something; imagine
Example: My art teacher told us; “Visualize the mountain and stream and then draw it.”

Word: Vital
Meaning: essential for something
Example: Peanut butter is a vital ingredient in the recipe for peanut butter cookies.

Word: Vitality
Meaning: energy; strength
Example: The doctor was proud to see his patient was full of vitality.

Word: Vitamin
Meaning: a natural substance that is needed for normal growth
Example: Because I am lacking the vitamin B-12; my body tends to be tired all the time.

Word: Vitiate
Meaning: to spoil; make faulty; to reduce the value; quality; or effectiveness of something
Example: When peers and bullies apply pressure; it can vitiate the moral character of young people and lead them down the wrong path.

Word: Vitiated
Meaning: having ruined something or made it faulty
Example: The company’s morals were vitiated by a greedy CEO who pushed workers to commit fraud.

Word: Vitriol
Meaning: mean-spirited and venomous criticism or talk
Example: During the town-meeting; angry citizens met the mayor spewing vitriol.

Word: Vitriolic
Meaning: harsh or corrosive in tone
Example: What was supposed to be a civil debate turned into a debate reaching vitriolic levels; ending with both participants screaming obscenities.

Word: Vituperate
Meaning: to insult or verbally attack someone using abusive language
Example: We are sure that the nail technicians vituperate us in their own language when they are irritated.

Word: Vituperative
Meaning: abusive and harsh
Example: We cannot be friends if you continue to attack me with vituperative words.

Word: Viva Voce
Meaning: By word of mouth (orally)
Example: Because he could speak the answer but couldn’t see the words on the exam; a viva voce test was given to the blind man.

Word: Vivacious
Meaning: to be bubbly and energetic
Example: When the vivacious child came through the school’s door on her first day of kindergarten; she spoke with every student and volunteered to do every activity.

Word: Vivaciously
Meaning: done is a lively or spirited way
Example: Dancing vivaciously across the stage; the energetic dancer attracted the attention of all of the crowd.

Word: Vivaciousness
Meaning: liveliness; energy
Example: Known for her vivaciousness; Andi is considered the life of the party in her hometown.

Word: Vivacity
Meaning: the state of being attractive because of one’s enthusiasm and liveliness
Example: Elicia’s vivacity helps her gain customers at work since being attractive and lively are need traits for a bartender.

Word: Vivid 
Meaning: colorful; bright
Example: The artist was known for his vivid paintings that were distinguished by their colorful hues.

Word: Vivify
Meaning: to arouse; stimulate or invigorate
Example: Exercise and eating healthy can really vivify someone into doing more activities in their day due to their increase in energy.

Word: Viviparous
Meaning: describes animals that produce live babies instead of reproducing through eggs
Example: Although a shark is a fish; it is viviparous and gives birth to live baby sharks.

Word: Vivisection
Meaning: purposely wounding or slitting open an animal in order to examine it for medical purposes
Example: When the photos of the vivisection were posted online; many people were upset at the brutal nature of killing the animals until they found it was done for scientific reasons.

Word: Vocal
Meaning: speaking loudly and freely about something
Example: The woman was very vocal about racial issues and wouldn’t backdown when questioned by the media.

Word: Vocation 
Meaning: the job a person holds or would like to hold
Example: At an early age; Frank knew his chosen vocation was to be a priest so he could minister to others.

Word: Vociferate
Meaning: to shout; argue; or otherwise speak loudly or aggressively
Example: The man decided to vociferate with his wife because the two of them were having an argument and only shouting could apparently get his point across.

Word: Vociferous
Meaning: making a loud outcry
Example: The protestors were vociferous as they screamed outside of the government building.

Word: Vogue
Meaning: a trend or largely admired fad
Example: When the most popular girl in school wore her hair differently; a new vogue took place the next day when everyone was wear that same hairstyle.

Word: Voice
Meaning: the sound produced in a person’s larynx that passes out of the throat/mouth
Example: After yelling at the children all day; the mother had lost her voice.

Word: Void 
Meaning: not legal
Example: Since the judge did not sign the final page of the documents; our divorce is void.

Word: Volant
Meaning: to spread wings outward as if to fly
Example: The prince knew he was in trouble when the volant dragon became twice his size and then fluttered about.

Word: Volar
Meaning: relating to the sole of the foot or palm of the hand
Example: The volar surface of the man’s palms was made rough by constant working with his hands over the years.

Word: Volatile
Meaning: tending to erupt in violence; easily aroused
Example: Because Mary and Frank have a volatile relationship; they often argue.

Word: Volcano
Meaning: a mountainlike opening in the earth’s crust through which molten lava; rocks; and gas spews out
Example: The active volcano in Hawaii continues to gush gaseous lava and ash through It’s funnel-like top.

Word: Volitant
Meaning: flying or moving about rapidly
Example: During the Jurassic period; volitant creatures flew rapidly around the earth.

Word: Volition
Meaning: the power to make your own decisions or choices
Example: Despite my parents' preference; I have decided to attend an out-of-state college on my own volition.

Word: Volley
Meaning: a strike or kick of the ball made before it touches the ground during a sporting event or game
Example: The volleyball player attempted to volley the ball past the net; but the other team blocked the strike.

Word: Voluble
Meaning: characterized by ready or rapid speech; fluent
Example: After my grandfather drinks a few beers; he becomes voluble and will not stop talking.

Word: Volume
Meaning: the power of sound; how loud something is
Example: Because headphones play music directly into your ears; you should lower the volume of the music to avoid damaging your ear drums and your hearing.

Word: Voluminous
Meaning: spacious; roomy
Example: The hospital is adding a more voluminous waiting room on to his building in order to hold more patients.

Word: Voluntary
Meaning: done or given without being forced to do so
Example: The generous donor gives voluntary donations to the charity without anyone have to ask him for money.

Word: Volunteer
Meaning: to donate time or energy to a cause usually charitable
Example: The students volunteer at the annual beach clean up.

Word: Voluptuous
Meaning: displaying luxury and giving pleasure to the senses
Example: Every once in a while I like to treat myself to the voluptuous indulgence of a spa weekend.

Word: Vomit
Meaning: to eject/throw up food and other matter from the stomach through the mouth
Example: Feeling sick to her stomach; the nauseous woman tried not to vomit all over the floor.

Word: Voracious
Meaning: having a large appetite; greedy
Example: The football player was a voracious eater who easily consumed two chickens during one meal.

Word: Voracity
Meaning: extreme hunger for food or an activity that is powerful and consuming
Example: Her voracity for reading was marked by her overflowing bookshelves; too much money spent at her favorite little bookshop; and the fact that she read at least one book a day.

Word: Vortex
Meaning: a movement or force; usually circular in shape; that pulls things into its stream or current
Example: In the movie; the vortex pulled in every spaceship that came near it.

Word: Votary
Meaning: A person; such as a monk or nun; who lives a religious life according to vows they have made
Example: The young man decided he wanted to devote his life to his religion and became a votary.

Word: Voter

Meaning: dedicated or given in fulfillment of a vow or pledge
Example: In honor of the holiday; votive candles were placed around the room.

Word: Voucher
Meaning: piece of paper that entitles the holder to a discount
Example: Although she was not doing well financially; Amber was able to buy lunch with a voucher.

Word: Vouchsafed
Meaning: granted as a favor or honor
Example: Since the parole committee vouchsafed the killer’s release from prison; the parents of his victims have been in an uproar.

Word: Vow
Meaning: an unwavering decision; usually of great importance to those involved
Example: On their wedding day; John made a vow to love his wife beyond death and into the next life.

Word: Vowel
Meaning: a speech sound (a; e; I; o; or u) you make with your mouth open and your tongue in the middle
Example: ‘E’ is the most frequently used vowel; being used to form words like ‘feel’ and ‘exercise.’

Word: Voyage
Meaning: an account of a trip especially one made in a boat
Example: During the seven-day voyage; the ship traveled to three different countries.

Word: Voyeuristic

Example: The first time a student uses vulgar language in class he is given an afterschool detention.

Word: Vying
Meaning: involved in a competition for something
Example: The two boys are both crazy about the head cheerleader and are constantly vying for her attention.

Word: Waddle
Meaning: to take small steps while walking in a stumbling way

Meaning: to walk or paddle through water or another liquid
Example: During the flood; the escaping residents had to wade through the rushing water to get to dry land.

Word: Waft 
Meaning: to advance gently through the air
Example: My children hurried to the kitchen when the scent of freshly baked cookies started to waft upstairs.

Word: Wag

Word: Wager
Meaning: to bet or gamble

Word: Waggish
Meaning: acting in a mischievous manner
Example: The waggish teenage boys kept tripping on the ground in hopes of attracting the attention of the pretty girls.

Word: Waif
Meaning: a very skinny and lanky girl or young woman

Word: Wail
Meaning: a loud; long; and often anger or pain-filled cry
Example: The toddler started to wail after he fell off his bike and scraped his knee.

Word: Waist
Meaning: the part of the human body above the hips and below the rib cage
Example: Your waist is what the band of your pants rest on; holding them up just above your hips.

Word: Waive
Meaning: to give up one’s rights or claims

Word: Wan
Meaning: weak or pale in quality or appearance
Example: Although the toddler was quite ill; he still managed to give his mother a wan smile.

Word: Well-being
