Word: Well
Meaning: satisfactory; good
Example: If I do well enough on my test; I won’t have to go to school tomorrow.

Word: Wellaway
Meaning: a word used as an expression of sorrow or distress
Example: “Wellaway!’ the sailor cried out in distress as he watched the boat sink.

Word: Wellness
Meaning: the state of being in good health
Example: Focusing on wellness and good health; the dieter was finally able to get herself in shape.

Word: Welt
Meaning: a swollen; red mark on the body made by a blow or chemical
Example: The tear gas caused a puffy red welt above the soldier’s eye.

Word: Weltanschauung
Meaning: a person’s philosophy of life or worldview
Example: Our weltanschauung is shaped by major events in our lives and how they affected our views.

Word: Welter
Meaning: wild disorder
Example: The classroom was in a welter when the teacher did not show up for class.

Word: Wend
Meaning: to follow a set direction or path
Example: Miles of trails wend their way through the trees and meadows.

Word: Wept
Meaning: to cry bitterly
Example: Having just learned that her son had been killed in the line of duty; the woman felt to her knees and wept; streaking her face with tears.

Word: Werewolf
Meaning: a person believed to change into a wolf some of the time; especially at night when there is a full moon
Example: Although Jacob appeared to be a normal teenager during the way; he morphed into a howling werewolf once the sun went down.

Word: West
Meaning: the direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun set
Example: If you turn left at the northern star; you will be traveling due west.

Word: Westernization
Meaning: adoption of western traditions or ideas; specifically the traditions of any culture that originally came from Europe
Example: Westernization traces its roots back to Ancient Greece; where the concepts of arts and democracy first took hold.

Word: Wet
Meaning: covered with a liquid; usually water
Example: The floor is still wet from where I spilled soda on it.

Word: Wetland
Meaning: land that has wet soil; such as a marsh or a swamp
Example: The animals living on the wetland were at risk of losing their habitat because of the oil spill.

Word: Whack
Meaning: to hit or strike something sharply
Example: The runner threatened to whack the growling dog with a stick when it came up to him on the trail.

Word: Whale
Meaning: an extremely large ocean mammal that breathes through an opening on the top of its head
Example: The blue whale is an ocean mammal and the largest animal that has ever lived on earth.

Word: Wham
Meaning: a strike of great force
Example: The angry wife slammed the door behind her with a satisfying wham.

Word: Whammy
Meaning: a situation where two unpleasant things happen at the same time
Example: The death of her father and mother within a few days was quite a whammy for Janice.

Word: Wharf
Meaning: a platform built on or along water where ships can load/unload goods or passengers
Example: A large wharf was built on the bay next to the shipbuilding facility.

Word: Whatchamacallit
Meaning: a word used when the actual name of the object in question will not come to mind
Example: My grandmother calls my brother whatchamacallit when she forgets his actual name.

Word: Whatever
Meaning: anything; any
Example: You can eat whatever you like; as long as it is not seafood.

Word: Whatnot
Meaning: a word used to indicate additional things of any kind that you don't feel like naming
Example: During our family vacation; we will eat; swim; and whatnot.

Word: Whatsoever
Meaning: in any way; at all
Example: There was no snow on the ground; whatsoever.

Word: Wheat
Meaning: a cereal grain that is ground to make flour for bread; pasta; pastry; etc
Example: Just one bushel of wheat can make up to forty-five boxes of flake cereal.

Word: Wheedle
Meaning: to try and persuade using flattery
Example: After Bill forgot his wedding anniversary; he attempted to wheedle his way back into his wife’s heart by surprising her with a romantic getaway.

Word: Wheel
Meaning: a circular object that revolves around a bar and axle and is usually used for movement of some kind
Example: To move the car towards the barn; the driver must turn the wheel towards the left.

Word: Wheelchair
Meaning: a chair on mounted wheels that is used for transportation by a person who can’t walk
Example: After injuring his leg in a terrible car accident; the man had to use a wheelchair to get around.

Word: Wheeze
Meaning: to breathe with a whistling or rattling sound in the chest
Example: Because of an infection in his lungs; the patient will wheeze anytime he breathes in air too deeply.

Word: Whelm
Meaning: to bury something by engulfing or submerging it
Example: During the devastating fire; the tall flames began to whelm every room in the house.

Word: Whelp
Meaning: a baby dog or wolf; a puppy
Example: The little whelp will cry anytime the momma dog is away from him too long.

Word: Whence
Meaning: from what place or source
Example: To end racism; you must start from whence the ideas originally came from.

Word: Whenever
Meaning: at whatever time
Example: Whenever you want to go to a party; call me and let me know.

Word: Whereabouts
Meaning: the place where something is located
Example: The police told me they would contact me if they got any information on my missing car’s whereabouts.

Word: Whereby
Meaning: by which or through which
Example: The voters walked into a voting precinct whereby they cast their votes for their favorite candidate.

Word: Wherein
Meaning: in which
Example: The shy girl is anxious in any situation wherein she is the center of attention.

Word: Whereof
Meaning: with or by which
Example: Because she was raised in the heart of the city; the author of the urban book knows whereof she speaks.

Word: Whereupon
Meaning: right after; closely following
Example: The couple got married; whereupon they went on an amazing honeymoon.

Word: Wherewithal
Meaning: money or funds needed for a purchase or project
Example: The couple really wants to buy the house; but they do not have the wherewithal to make the down payment.

Word: Whet
Meaning: to trigger or make desire
Example: The mobile phone company uses celebrity endorsements to make consumers whet their phones.

Word: Whether
Meaning: expressing a doubt or choice between two different things
Example: I’m not sure whether I should cook hamburgers or spaghetti for lunch.

Word: Whetstone
Meaning: a sharpening stone that is used to sharpen knives or other tools
Example: Using a whetstone to sharpen his sword; the knight prepared his weapon for battle.

Word: Whey
Meaning: the watery part of milk that remains after curds are formed
Example: When milk curdles; the whey is separated from the protein.

Word: Which
Meaning: used to show which particular object one is talking about
Example: The real and the fake paintings look so much alike that it’s even hard for collectors to know which was which.

Word: Whiff
Meaning: a smell or aroma
Example: The children came running as soon as they got a whiff of the fresh pizza.

Word: While
Meaning: a period of time
Example: We went to the park for a little while and afterwards ventured to the ice cream shop.

Word: Whilom
Meaning: former; past
Example: The whilom friends were once so close; but now they hate one another.

Word: Whilst
Meaning: while or during
Example: Whilst it is not unusual for my husband and I to fight; the constant arguing does concern me.

Word: Whim
Meaning: a sudden desire to do something unplanned
Example: The police officer acted on a whim; not thinking before he violently slammed the suspect to the ground.

Word: Whimper
Meaning: a low cry that is used to express pain or unhappiness
Example: The puppy let out a quiet whimper while licking its injured paw.

Word: Whimsical
Meaning: in an amusing or playful manner
Example: The whimsical music made me feel like a little kid again.

Word: Whimsy
Meaning: the quality of being amazing or fantastic
Example: There is a touch of whimsy to this metal sculpture; a certain magical and inspired aura to it that shows how passionate the artist was.

Word: Whine
Meaning: a long; high-pitched sound
Example: The toddler’s high-pitched whine annoyed everyone in her house.

Word: Whip
Meaning: to beat or thrash
Example: Every time the trainer would whip the horse; the mare hid from the beating.

Word: Whiplash
Meaning: an injury caused by a severe jerk to the head/neck
Example: During the car accident; the driver was rear-ended and his neck suffered whiplash from the jerking.

Word: Whipsaw
Meaning: to move or make something move quickly between two different directions
Example: The politician tried to whipsaw his followers by going back and forth on his stance.

Word: Whirl
Meaning: to twirl or spin
Example: The tornado continued to whirl around; kicking up dust along its path.

Word: Whirlwind
Meaning: something that involves many quickly changing events or emotions
Example: The couple’s whirlwind romance happened so quickly that by May; they were married.

Word: Whisk
Meaning: to take or move something away quickly
Example: The maiden was waiting for her knight in shining armor to whisk her off into the sunset.

Word: Whisper
Meaning: to speak very softly using one’s breath but not vocal cords
Example: Even though the teacher told us not to speak at all; my sneaky classmates and I continued to whisper.

Word: Whist
Meaning: a card game played by four people (two per team) in which each side tries to win more cards than the other
Example: While playing whist; the group of friends fought over who was going to win more cards during the game.

Word: Whistle
Meaning: to make a signal through a high pitch sound by forcing air through a small hole
Example: Use your mouth to whistle to the others so that they can know where we are.

Word: Whistleblower
Meaning: a person who informs a higher power that an organization is doing things that are illegal
Example: The whistleblower reported his employer to the state after he violated several overtime laws.

Word: White-collar crimes
Meaning: nonviolent; money motivated crimes that are committed by professionals or businesses
Example: The banker was arrested for stealing from his company and was charged with several white-collar crimes.

Word: White-collar job
Meaning: a position that requires the worker to perform professional duties in an office setting
Example: Alan has always worked outdoor gigs; but now he wants to transition to a white-collar job at the state office.

Word: White-collar worker
Meaning: an professional whose work is performed in an office or administrative setting
Example: The white-collar worker has made his career as an office manager and never worked any blue-collar factory jobs.

Word: Whitelist
Meaning: a list of items that are granted access to a certain system or protocol
Example: A whitelist on the programming allows only certain text messages to come to the phone.

Word: Whither
Meaning: to which place or position
Example: Whither one sibling goes; his needy baby brother will soon follow.

Word: Whittle
Meaning: to reduce or gradually eliminate something
Example: Her patience began to whittle when the students would not stop talking.

Word: Whiz
Meaning: a person that is naturally good or clever at something
Example: Even at the age of five; you can tell that the boy is a computer whiz.

Word: Whoever
Meaning: whichever person or people
Example: Whoever wants to come over to the birthday party is invited to attend as a guest.

Word: Whole
Meaning: the entire thing
Example: Walter was so hungry that he was able to devour a whole box of pizza without leaving one slice.

Word: Wholeheartedly
Meaning: fully; without reserve
Example: Although Hazel is halfhearted about our relationship; I am in it wholeheartedly; without any reservations.

Word: Wholesome
Meaning: considered ethical or of good moral standing
Example: Though he put on a wholesome persona; the mayor was really a gambler who stole money from the city.

Word: Wholly
Meaning: totally or completely
Example: According to the police; the intoxicated man was wholly at fault for the car accident.

Word: Whom
Meaning: "used instead of ""who"" as the object of a verb or preposition"
Example: The couple has three children; two of whom were adopted.

Word: Whoop-de-do
Meaning: a commotion or frenzy of activity or excitement
Example: The Christmas whoop-de-do is exciting for the children who love the holiday frenzy.

Word: Whoop-de-doo
Meaning: used sarcastically; indicating a lack of enthusiasm
Example: Well; whoop-de-doo; they're offering me a 0.1 percent pay raise!

Word: Whose
Meaning: belonging to or associated with which person
Example: Whose car is parked in the driveway; Tammy or Jackson?

Word: Wicked
Meaning: evil
Example: Whenever the young children would see the wicked witch in the movie; they would scream in fright because they thought she would harm them.

Word: Wicked
Meaning: morally wrong or evil
Example: The evil queen’s wicked ways gave her the reputation of a cruel ruler.

Word: Wickedness
Meaning: evilness that is morally wrong or harmful
Example: A sense of wickedness filled the witch’s castle; and her evilness could be felt throughout each room.

Word: Widen
Meaning: to become wide or wider
Example: Online marketing campaigns widen the chances for more people to see the brand.

Word: Widespread
Meaning: affecting a large area or number of people
Example: The widespread outages that our state experienced last month were due to the big tornado.

Word: Widow
Meaning: a wife whose husband has died and has yet to remarry
Example: Mrs. Carter became a widow when her husband was killed in the line of duty in Afghanistan.

Word: Wield
Meaning: To control an item with competence; in particularly a tool or weapon
Example: Do you wish you could wield a sword like a valiant knight?

Word: Wifely
Meaning: like or relating to a wife
Example: Rita always made sure to complete her wifely duties such as keeping the house clean and cooking for her husband.

Word: Wild
Meaning: untamed; living in a natural state
Example: A pack of wild dogs roamed the neighborhood picking fights with tamed pets.

Word: Wildcard
Meaning: someone or something that causes uncertainty because there is no way to determine their behavior or influence beforehand
Example: Considered a wildcard before the show; Juan surprised everyone with his outstanding school play performance.

Word: Wilderness
Meaning: An uncivilized expanse; often without human settlement of any kind
Example: At one time; much of America was an unexplored wilderness that was home to more animals than man.

Word: Wildlife
Meaning: animals and plants thriving in a natural environment
Example: The deer hunter creeped through the forest; carefully searching for wildlife to trap.

Word: Will
Meaning: a document that outlines who will get one’s personal property and control their estate after death
Example: Before his death; the millionaire drafted a will that outlined who would get his massive fortune.

Word: Willful
Meaning: declining to alter one’s behavior or opinions
Example: The willful boy refused to take his seat in class.

Word: Willingly
Meaning: of one's own free will
Example: The suspect did not go willingly and fought every second of his arrest.

Word: Willingness
Meaning: happily prepared and wanting to do something
Example: The young woman’s willingness to give an impromptu speech since their speaker didn’t show was very much appreciated by those who planned the event.

Word: Williwaw
Meaning: a suddenly violent; gust of cold wind blowing down from mountain coast towards the sea
Example: A strong williwaw blew in from the coast and shipwrecked a vessel trying to make its way around the Cape Horn.

Word: Wilt
Meaning: to droop or become limp and soft
Example: I placed an excessive amount of water into the vase on my breakfront because of how quickly the flowers tend to wilt.

Word: Wily
Meaning: sneaky and calculating
Example: The wily cartoon character was always thinking of ways to steal food.

Word: Wimpy
Meaning: weak and cowardly
Example: Wimpy and weak; the frail boy was too afraid to stand up to the playground bully.

Word: Wince
Meaning: to make a tensing movement as a result of distress or pain
Example: The electric shock made the dog wince.

Word: Wincing
Meaning: flinching or grimacing involuntarily as a result of pain or anguish
Example: As soon as the abused dog sees a belt; he begins wincing out of fear.

Word: Wind up
Meaning: to prepare for; typically in regards to a heavy blow or a lot of action
Example: The boxer threw a punch so powerful that he had to wind up for it before even launching it at his foe.

Word: Wind
Meaning: to turn something around and around in a coiling or twisting motion
Example: If you wind up the metal piece of the jewelry box; the little ballerina will spin around and around.

Word: Windfall
Meaning: an unanticipated benefit; usually monetary in nature
Example: With her lottery windfall; Gail eliminated all her financial debt.

Word: Winding
Meaning: a twisting or curving path with many turns
Example: We took a winding trail throughout the woods that got us where we wanted to be; but not without a lot of twists and turns.

Word: Winger
Meaning: an attacking player that is on the wing in certain sports
Example: The championship soccer winger stayed on the outside and attacked any incoming players.

Word: Winner
Meaning: the victor or champion that wins something
Example: The winner of the championship game was a new victor who had never played the sport before

Word: Winnow
Meaning: 
Example: The warm summer breeze slowly winnowed the sand across their beach towel.

Word: Winsome

Example: Greg’s winsome smile is incredibly boyish.

Meaning: the coldest season of the year
Example: During the winter months; the children wear thick coats and gloves to keep their hands warm.

Word: Wiry

Word: Wisdom

Example: Although the young woman was an A student; she wasn’t very wise when it came to dating decisions.

Word: Wishful thinking
Meaning: thoughts of an unlikely future event that you wish were possible but isn’t likely

Word: Wishy-washy
Meaning: uncertain and indecisive
Example: The wishy-washy woman couldn’t decide on an outfit and went back and forth between choices for several hours.

Word: Wisp
Meaning: a small and thin amount of something; generally capable of being carried by the wind
Example: With the fuel for the fire all but burnt away; there was nothing left but a wisp of smoke and scraps of ash floating on the breeze.

Word: Wispy
Meaning: describes objects that are thin and fine
Example: The soft-spoken woman’s wispy voice could barely be heard in the crowd.

Word: Wistful
Meaning: sad and reflective
Example: When I visit my mother’s grave; I feel wistful.

Example: As I think back to my childhood; I wistfully recall the fun summers on my grandfather’s farm.

Word: Wit 
Meaning: the skill of using words in a manner that is both amusing and clever
Example: While the doctor laughed at his humorous comment; I did not find his wit amusing.

Word: Witch
Meaning: a woman who claims to have magical powers and practices sorcery or witchcraft
Example: The warty witch mixed up toad parts and magic beans in her black cauldron.

Word: Withal 
Meaning: along with this; in addition to something else
Example: Jared is a successful actor and withal a philanthropist who generously donates to charity.

Word: Withdraw
Meaning: to remove or take away something from a specific place
Example: Because he no longer wants the job; the applicant decided to withdraw his application from the running.

Word: Withdrawn
Meaning: being detached from others and seeking solitude retreating from social interactions
Example: After her father passed away; Molly was withdrawn and antisocial.

Word: Wither
Meaning: dry up or shrivel
Example: The gardener’s plants began to wither in the heat of the sun.

Word: Withhold
Meaning: to keep something from someone
Example: If you withhold information from the judge; you could get thrown in jail for not telling all of the truth.

Word: Within
Meaning: inside of
Example: When the target is within striking distance; we will pull the trigger.

Word: Withstand
Meaning: to persist through or survive a difficult situation
Example: The houses close to the coast were built so sturdily that they are able to withstand the strongest storms.

Word: Withstood
Meaning: having resisted or stood firm against some force
Example: The trees withstood the hurricane even though the winds were very strong.

Word: Witness
Meaning: to see something
Example: I bore witness to the sunrise this morning; because I decided it would be nice to start the day on a good note this time.

Example: Wanting to impress her new friends; the girl showcased her witticism in order to make them laugh.

Word: Wizened

Word: Work ethic
Meaning: a belief in the moral benefit and importance of work

Word: Work ethic
Meaning: a moral belief in the importance of hard work
Example: Because she has such a strong work ethic; Heather goes to work consistently and never turns down extra shifts.

Word: Work out
Meaning: to do exercises to make your body stronger
Example: The bodybuilder makes sure to work out every day so that he can keep his humongous muscles bulging.

Word: Work
Meaning: to complete tasks; especially at one’s job or to earn money
Example: Because she likes to work from home; Janet prepares a lot of her cases on her personal computer.

Word: Workaholic
Meaning: someone who works to excess or the extreme
Example: A workaholic like his father; John worked in the fields from sun up to sun down.

Word: Workaround
Meaning: a way of dealing with a problem or person without actually solving the entire situation
Example: The instructor looked for a way to workaround the lack of internet so he could teach the online lesson he had planned.

Word: Workaround
Meaning: a method for overcoming a problem or situation
Example: The fast-food worker found a workaround that made it easier for her to get the difficult orders out on time.

Word: Workflow
Meaning: the flow or amount of work to and from an office or employee
Example: During the winter time; workflow seems to slow down; but the stream of tasks picks up in the summer.

Word: Workforce
Meaning: the group of people that work for a particular company or place
Example: Members of the workforce joined a union as a way to protect their rights and negotiate their contracts.

Word: Workload
Meaning: the amount of work that needs to be completed
Example: As the students’ workload increases; they will lose more of their free time.

Word: Workmanship
Meaning: the skill of making things
Example: Made in the U.S.A. used to mean the item you were buying was of the highest workmanship.

Word: World
Meaning: the earth; especially when referring to the place that people live
Example: Because many people refuse to recycle; they are hurting our world and the natural resources on the earth.

Word: Worldwide
Meaning: global; all over the world
Example: The company hopes to go worldwide and branch out over both Asia and Europe.

Word: Worried
Meaning: anxious and upset about something
Example: Allen is worried about not having enough money to pay his bills this month.

Word: Worrisome
Meaning: something that causes stress or fear
Example: The rising crime rate in her neighborhood was more than worrisome; it was alarming.

Word: Worry
Meaning: give way to anxiety or unease; allow one's mind to dwell on difficulty or troubles
Example: She tried not to worry about her test grade; but because it made up 60% of her grade she couldn’t help panicking.

Word: Worse
Meaning: a comparative term meaning more difficult or unpleasant than before
Example: Soda is much worse for your health than water or healthy juices.

Word: Worsen
Meaning: to make the condition of something worse
Example: The sick woman’s condition will worsen if she doesn’t get the medicine she needs.

Word: Worship
Meaning: to show respect and honor something and hold it as sacred
Example: The Clines goes to church every Sunday to worship with family and friends.

Word: Worship
Meaning: to express honor and respect for someone or something; especially a deity
Example: In that country; many people worship carved objects in the way that others show respect to a god.

Word: Worst
Meaning: the most bad or ill of a group of people or things
Example: The student said that the worst part of her already difficult school day was having to walk several miles to the bus stop.

Word: Worth
Meaning: having a particular value
Example: The jewelry isn’t worth much money; but it is a beautiful color.

Word: Worthiness
Meaning: having qualities that are desired to fit into a specific group or category
Example: The Royal family interviews all potential matches for worthiness before the prince is allowed to date.

Word: Worthless
Meaning: having no value or use
Example: The broken speaker was useless; so I threw it in the trash when cleaning out the garage.

Word: Worthwhile
Meaning: good and important enough to spend time; effort; or money on
Example: I get a feeling of satisfaction when I invest my energy in worthwhile causes that bring benefit to the world.

Word: Worthy
Meaning: deserving respect; praise; or attention
Example: All the talented artists were worthy of the prize; but only one received the award.

Word: Wound

Example: During a cat fight; Garfield received a deep wound to his hind leg.

Word: Wow
Meaning: to impress or excite someone
Example: The acrobat was able to wow the stunned audience with her amazing flips and turns.

Word: Wraith
Meaning: ghost of a known person who recently died

Word: Wrapper

Word: Wrath
Meaning: intense anger
Example: In mythology mortals generally feared the wrath of the powerful gods.

Word: Wrathful
Meaning: very angry and irate

Word: Wreak havoc
Meaning: to bring chaos and distraction
Example: The devastating storm was able to wreak havoc on the entire island; destroying life there in just a matter of seconds.

Word: Wreak
Meaning: cause a lot of damage or harm
Example: If the internet goes down; it will wreak havoc with our ability to communicate and continue doing any kind of business.

Word: Wreck
Meaning: to destroy or damage something
Example: My cousins tried to wreck my party by showing up and making an ugly scene.

Word: Wreckage
Meaning: debris and rubble left over after a disaster
Example: Weeks after the tornado swept through the town; homeowners were still trying to clean up the wreckage and rebuild.

Word: Wren
Meaning: a small brown bird
Example: The Wren is a small brown bird commonly found in the New World with a high pitched and endearing chirp.

Word: Wrench
Meaning: to pull or twist something away violently
Example: Tiff tried to wrench all of the water out of the rag by twisting it really tightly.

Word: Wrenching
Meaning: forcefully pulling away from something or someone
Example: 1. The football player tried wrenching the ball from the other team member’s hands; but his grip was too strong.

Word: Wrest
Meaning: to forcefully take something away
Example: My wife had to wrest the candy bar from my hands in order for me to stop eating it.

Word: Wrestle
Meaning: to struggle with a difficultly or problem
Example: The unhappy worker continues to wrestle with the decision to find a better job.

Word: Wretched
Meaning: incredibly miserable
Example: After a night of overindulging in rich foods and alcoholic drinks; I am wretched.

Word: Wriggle
Meaning: to move or twist in contorted motion
Example: The rabbit was able to wriggle its way out of the net and moved its body well enough to escape the trap.

Word: Wright
Meaning: one who builds or erects
Example: After the architect finished drawing his plans; it was time for the wright to follow through with the project.

Word: Wring
Meaning: to squeeze or twist in an effort to remove liquid from something
Example: After I stepped in the puddle; I had to wring water from my socks.

Word: Wrinkle
Meaning: a slight line or fold; especially in skin or fabric
Example: The maid used the steaming hot iron to smooth each wrinkle on her boss’s shirt.

Word: Wrinkled
Meaning: to make or cause folds or lines in something
Example: Because she balled the clothes up into a pile; the maid wrinkled the hotel guest’s once ironed shirts.

Word: Writ
Meaning: the power to enforce submission and compliance
Example: It is beyond the writ of adults to punish children that are not their own for misbehavior regardless of how bad it is.

Word: Write
Meaning: to mark words or symbols down; especially on paper
Example: Students were asked to write their full names on the piece of paper.

Word: Writer
Meaning: one who has authored or written something
Example: Kristen hired a talented writer to help her put her life story in book form.

Word: Writhe
Meaning: to twist as if from struggling or pain
Example: When the old man had a heart attack; he fell to the floor and began to writhe around on the carpet while holding his chest.

Word: Written
Meaning: having made marks that represent letters; shapes; or numbers; usually on paper with pen
Example: Written in ink; the words on the pages began to smear when they got wet.

Word: Wrong
Meaning: not correct or accurate
Example: The math student came up with the wrong answer; but his teacher helped him find the right solution.

Word: Wrongdoer
Meaning: a person who does something wrong or against the law
Example: The wrongdoer faced the judge and begged for a lesser sentence for his crimes.

Word: Wrongdoing
Meaning: an action that is morally or legally wrong
Example: If you are guilty of wrongdoing in our society; you must pay either through fines or jail time; depending on the severity of your crime.

Word: Wronged
Meaning: betrayed; hurt
Example: Though she felt wronged by her former employer; the woman felt it best to forgive and move forward.

Word: Wrought 
Meaning: prepared in some manner; usually by hammering or applying another type of pressure
Example: As we stared at the wrought iron gate; we could not help but wonder about the craftsman who had created the masterpiece.

Word: Wry
Meaning: describes something sarcastic or a bit humorous
Example: Bill's wry sense of humor made it difficult to be taken seriously at the office.

Word: Wryly
Meaning: in a witty yet mocking manner
Example: As a self-proclaimed chef; Kelly wryly writes about her experiences in the kitchen.

Word: Wunderkind
Meaning: a young prodigy or whiz kid who becomes victorious with his or her accomplishments
Example: When Mozart began composing popular classical music before the age of six; this wunderkind astonished everyone with his early achievements.

Word: Xanthosis
Meaning: an abnormal yellowish discoloration of the skin
Example: The doctor explained that cholesterol build-up in the skin cells could cause a yellowing of the skin known as xanthosis.

Word: Xenophile
Meaning: a xenophile is a person attracted to foreign people and customs
Example: The American professor is a xenophile particularly interested in Roman cathedrals.

Word: Xenophobia
Meaning: a dread or dislike of anything or anyone foreign; especially people from other cultures and races
Example: Shane’s xenophobia prevents him from going to social events where there are people he does not know.

Word: Xeric
Meaning: an area or climate that gets a very low volume of water and is often extremely dry
Example: The xeric environment of the desert makes it difficult for plants that require a substantial amount of water to grow.

Word: Xerox
Meaning: a photocopy or reproduction of something
Example: The xerox machine in the office is broken and can’t be used to make photocopies.

Word: Xylem
Meaning: plant tissue that carries water and minerals from the roots to the leaves
Example: Xylem carried water from the root of the plant to the very center of the leaf.

Word: Xylophone
Meaning: a musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars with a mallet
Example: The music teacher showed her students how to play a song by tapping each wooden bar on the xylophone.

Word: Yacht
Meaning: a sail-boat used for racing or pleasure rides
Example: The family boarded the yacht and prepared to set sail to a private island where they would spend the day.

Word: Yahoo
Meaning: a rude; coarse and wild person
Example: One day in her classroom; Ms. Howard determined that the yahoo in class needed to be punished for talking back to her in a rowdy way.

Word: Yammer
Meaning: to excessively complain about something
Example: Her grandfather liked to yammer on and on about how things were better back in the old days.

Word: Yammered
Meaning: made a loud; repetitive noise
Example: The mouthy woman yammered on and on; telling everyone she met about her relationship problems.

Word: Yank
Meaning: to pull something quickly
Example: 1. The robber tried to yank the man’s briefcase from his hand; but didn’t pull hard enough.

Word: Yard
Meaning: a grassy piece of land surrounding a house
Example: Because the grass in his yard has grown so tall; Ed will spend most of the day mowing it.

Word: Yarn
Meaning: to tell a long and unlikely story
Example: The old man loved to yarn on and on about the old days; where he was supposedly some sort of hero of great fame and renown.

Word: Yearly
Meaning: happening every year
Example: The family is planning their yearly reunion where they meet up each August and have a cookout.

Word: Yearn
Meaning: to have a deep desire for something or someone
Example: When my sister was pregnant; all she did was yearn for chocolate ice cream and French fries.

Word: Yeast
Meaning: a single-celled; microscopic fungi used in many food items; nutrition; and even bio-fuels
Example: It’s hard to believe that yeast; a common fungus; is used to make something as delicious as pizza dough.

Word: Yegg
Meaning: a thief who is skilled in breaking open safes
Example: Using his safe-cracking skills; the yegg was able to steal all of the money out of the man’s hiding spot.

Word: Yellow Journalism
Meaning: fake news that is not based on fact but exaggerations
Example: The paper published a piece of yellow journalism that was nothing but exaggerated facts.

Word: Yellow Journalism
Meaning: journalism that exaggerates distorts or exploits the news to attract readers
Example: In the 1800s; Spain and the US were pushed into war because of yellow journalism that exaggerated the facts.

Word: Yen
Meaning: the basic unit of money used in Japan
Example: The yen is the currency of Japan and is the most valued money unit after the dollar and the euro.

Word: Yeoman
Meaning: a farmer long-ago who owned a small amount of land
Example: The yeoman was plowing the field on his master’s land.

Word: Yes
Meaning: given as a positive or agreeing answer when asked a question
Example: Yes; I can sell you two new pairs of shoes for the rice of one.

Word: Yesteryear
Meaning: a point in the past; usually thought of in a nostalgic way
Example: Grandma frequently talked about the beauty of yesteryear when gas was less than a dollar and she could buy a handful of candy for a quarter.

Word: Yesteryear
Meaning: last year; or in past years
Example: A famous singer of yesteryear; the old-timer reminisced about all the stages he had performed on during his prime.

Word: Yet
Meaning: so far; up until now
Example: The company hasn’t hired anyone yet; but they should be making their selections this week.

Word: Yield
Meaning: to bow out
Example: Since I do not know a great deal about the subject; I will yield this question to my well-informed colleague.

Word: Yielding
Meaning: productive; providing a profit
Example: The farmland has been yielding more and more crops; allowing the farmers to gain even more money.

Word: Yoga
Meaning: an ancient art based on a harmonizing system of development for the body; mind; and spirit through breathing exercises and exercise
Example: Yoga is a combination of three things: various postures; breathing patterns and mindful meditation.

Word: Yoke
Meaning: an attachment for two animals side by side with a bar across the top of their necks and each loop around their heads
Example: Pioneers put their oxen’s heads through the rings of the yoke with the attached straps stretched up to the wagon.

Word: Yonder
Meaning: in a distant; indicated place; over there
Example: The creek is about a mile or so yonder.

Word: Yore
Meaning: a very long time ago
Example: In the days of yore; the Internet did not exist.

Word: Yourself
Meaning: a word used by a speaker or writer to refer to the person being addressed as the object of the verb
Example: The speaker that it is important to do most of the work yourself instead of hiring someone else.

Word: Youth
Meaning: young people (usually considered a group)
Example: Several teenagers started a church youth group where they can pray and study.

Word: Youthful
Meaning: young-looking; child-like
Example: Because of her youthful appearance and energetic spirit; it was hard for anyone to believe that Tina was sixty years old.

Word: Yowza
Meaning: a word used to express excitement or surprise
Example: “Yowza;” Bella exclaimed when she saw the table full of delicious cakes and pies.

Word: Yule
Meaning: an old term for the Christmas holiday
Example: The Yule holiday is when we set up trees in our homes and decorate them with ornaments and lights.

Word: Yuletide
Meaning: an old term for the Christmas season
Example: Yuletide is a time in which we celebrate Christmas; but for a lot of people that season is mostly just about presents and snow.

Word: Yuppify
Meaning: to change the way something looks in an effort to attract wealthy people
Example: The novelist made sure to yuppify his story so that well-to-do readers would be interested in reading his book.

Word: Zaftig
Meaning: having a full rounded figure
Example: Marilyn Monroe’s zaftig figure made her one of the most famous curvy actresses.

Word: Zany
Meaning: unique and amusing
Example: The comedian’s zany performances are hilarious and never fail to engage the audience.

Word: Zap
Meaning: to destroy or get rid of something quickly with force
Example: Using the electric bug killer; the homeowner was able to zap many of the pesky bugs in his backyard.

Word: Zeal
Meaning: a lot of energy; effort; and enthusiasm
Example: Jack’s zeal made him stand above all the other candidates during the interview process.

Word: Zeal
Meaning: eagerness and ardent interest in pursuit of something
Example: The athlete’s zeal gave him the energy to reach the top of the mountain.

Word: Zealot
Meaning: one who is uncompromising and fanatical in pursuit of his ideals
Example: The religious zealot was willing to break the law to follow his prophet’s orders.

Word: Zealous
Meaning: feeling or showing strong and energetic support for a person; cause; etc.
Example: Because my husband is a zealous supporter of the high school football team; he donates money to their organization every year.

Word: Zealousness
Meaning: enthusiastically full of eagerness and excitement
Example: The manager’s zealousness when it comes to work helped him quickly earn a reputation as one of the company’s most eager workers.

Word: Zeitgeist
Meaning: the spirit or identity of a specific time period
Example: The zeitgeist of the years preceding the war was a desire for isolation since no one wanted to get involved in an international crisis.

Word: Zen
Meaning: feeling extremely relaxed; peaceful; and free of worries
Example: She turned towards Zen to help her relieve the stress in her life.

Word: Zenith
Meaning: the strongest or most successful period of time
Example: Before her zenith ended; Meredith published six best-selling books.

Word: Zephyr
Meaning: a light or delicate wind
Example: By evening; the harsh wind following the storm had turned into a zephyr that did nothing more than move the leaves.

Word: Zeppelin
Meaning: a long; rigid; German airship that was used during World War I bombings and to transport passengers after the war
Example: As the German airship approached the target; the Zeppelin prepared to use its missile to bomb the area.

Word: Zero
Meaning: the figure that is written as 0 and represents none
Example: 1. The bank claimed that zero dollars were in the man’s account; but he thought he had some money.

Word: Zest
Meaning: a great amount of enthusiasm
Example: Kate's zest for running keeps her very active.

Word: Zestful
Meaning: full of energy and excitement
Example: The runners like to enter zestful competitions that will push their energy and make them work for the prize.

Word: Ziggurat
Meaning: a tower that is tiered and rectangular in shape and occasionally topped by a holy place
Example: The shape of the ziggurat is very similar to the shape of a pyramid.

Word: Zigzag
Meaning: a line of a “z” pattern in which it crisscrosses back and forth
Example: In order to escape the police; the fleeing car would zigzag in between cars going back and forth down the two lanes.

Word: Zilch
Meaning: zero or nothing
Example: She knew zilch about camping; so when she was asked to help put up the tent she fumbled with poles.

Word: Zinger
Meaning: a surprising or shocking piece of news
Example: The writer included a zinger to surprise the reader at the end of the novel.

Word: Zodiac
Meaning: a divided band in sky along which the sun; the moon; and most of the planets move that is connected to astrology and twelve signs
Example: Twelve cities in the state were named after astrological parts of the zodiac.

Word: Zone
Meaning: an area or division
Example: The zone only has houses and no stores or shops can be built there.

Word: Zoology
Meaning: that portion of science that deals with the analysis of animals and their behaviors
Example: Since Chamberlain had a fierce love for animals; choosing zoology as a college major was a natural choice for him.

Word: Zoom
Meaning: to move very quickly
Example: The cars began to zoom around the racetrack; moving faster and faster with each lap.

Word: Zygote
Meaning: the fertilized egg that results from the union of sex cells
Example: A zygote is formed when a sperm cell and an egg cell merge.
